IAST: abodhy agniḥ samidhā janānām prati dhenum ivāyatīm uṣāsam
Griffith: Agni is wakened by the people's fuel to meet the Dawn who cometh like a milch-cow.
Devanāgarī: अबोध्यग्निः समिधा जनानां प्रति धेनुमिवायतीमुषासम्
pada pāṭha: abodhi | agniḥ | sam-idhā | janānām | prati | dhenum-iva | ā-yatīm | uṣasam || yahvāḥ-iva | pra | vayām | ut-jihānāḥ | pra | bhānavaḥ | sisrate | nākam | accha ||5.1.1||

IAST: yahvā iva pra vayām ujjihānāḥ pra bhānavaḥ sisrate nākam accha
Griffith: Like young trees shooting up on high their branches, his flames are rising to the vault of heaven.
Devanāgarī: यह्वा इव प्र वयामुज्जिहानाः प्र भानवः सिस्रते नाकमच्छ
pada pāṭha: abodhi | agniḥ | sam-idhā | janānām | prati | dhenum-iva | ā-yatīm | uṣasam || yahvāḥ-iva | pra | vayām | ut-jihānāḥ | pra | bhānavaḥ | sisrate | nākam | accha ||5.1.1||

IAST: abodhi hotā yajathāya devān ūrdhvo agniḥ sumanāḥ prātar asthāt
Griffith: For worship of the Gods the Priest was wakened: at morning gracious Agni hath arisen.
Devanāgarī: अबोधि होता यजथाय देवानूर्ध्वो अग्निः सुमनाः प्रातरस्थात्
pada pāṭha: abodhi | hotā | yajathāya | devān | ūrdhvaḥ | agniḥ | su-manāḥ | prātaḥ | asthāt || sam-iddhasya | ruśat | adarśi | pājaḥ | mahān | devaḥ | tamasaḥ | niḥ | amoci ||5.1.2||

IAST: samiddhasya ruśad adarśi pājo mahān devas tamaso nir amoci
Griffith: Kindled, his radiant might is made apparent, and the great Deity set free from darkness.
Devanāgarī: समिद्धस्य रुशददर्शि पाजो महान्देवस्तमसो निरमोचि
pada pāṭha: abodhi | hotā | yajathāya | devān | ūrdhvaḥ | agniḥ | su-manāḥ | prātaḥ | asthāt || sam-iddhasya | ruśat | adarśi | pājaḥ | mahān | devaḥ | tamasaḥ | niḥ | amoci ||5.1.2||

IAST: yad īṁ gaṇasya raśanām ajīgaḥ śucir aṅkte śucibhir gobhir agniḥ
Griffith: When he hath stirred the line of his attendants, with the pure milk pure Agni is anointed.
Devanāgarī: यदीं गणस्य रशनामजीगः शुचिरङ्क्ते शुचिभिर्गोभिरग्निः
pada pāṭha: yat | īm | gaṇasya | raśanām | ajīgariti | śuciḥ | aṅkte | śuci-bhiḥ | gobhiḥ | agniḥ || āt | dakṣiṇā | yujyate | vāja-yantī | uttānām | ūrdhvaḥ | adhayat | juhūbhiḥ ||5.1.3||

IAST: ād dakṣiṇā yujyate vājayanty uttānām ūrdhvo adhayaj juhūbhiḥ
Griffith: The strength-bestowing gift is then made ready, which spread in front, with tongues, erect, he drinketh
Devanāgarī: आद्दक्षिणा युज्यते वाजयन्त्युत्तानामूर्ध्वो अधयज्जुहूभिः
pada pāṭha: yat | īm | gaṇasya | raśanām | ajīgariti | śuciḥ | aṅkte | śuci-bhiḥ | gobhiḥ | agniḥ || āt | dakṣiṇā | yujyate | vāja-yantī | uttānām | ūrdhvaḥ | adhayat | juhūbhiḥ ||5.1.3||

IAST: agnim acchā devayatām manāṁsi cakṣūṁṣīva sūrye saṁ caranti
Griffith: The spirits of the pious turn together to Agni, as the eyes of all to Surya.
Devanāgarī: अग्निमच्छा देवयतां मनांसि चक्षूंषीव सूर्ये सं चरन्ति
pada pāṭha: agnim | accha | deva-yatām | manāṁsi | cakṣūṁṣi-iva | sūrye | sam | caranti || yat | īm | suvāte iti | uṣasā | virūpe iti vi-rūpe | śvetaḥ | vājī | jāyate | agre | ahnām ||5.1.4||

IAST: yad īṁ suvāte uṣasā virūpe śveto vājī jāyate agre ahnām
Griffith: He, when both Dawns of different hues have borne him, springs up at daybreak as a strong white charger.
Devanāgarī: यदीं सुवाते उषसा विरूपे श्वेतो वाजी जायते अग्रे अह्नाम्
pada pāṭha: agnim | accha | deva-yatām | manāṁsi | cakṣūṁṣi-iva | sūrye | sam | caranti || yat | īm | suvāte iti | uṣasā | virūpe iti vi-rūpe | śvetaḥ | vājī | jāyate | agre | ahnām ||5.1.4||

IAST: janiṣṭa hi jenyo agre ahnāṁ hito hiteṣv aruṣo vaneṣu
Griffith: The noble One was born at days' beginning, laid red in colour mid the well-laid fuel.
Devanāgarī: जनिष्ट हि जेन्यो अग्रे अह्नां हितो हितेष्वरुषो वनेषु
pada pāṭha: janiṣṭa | hi | jenyaḥ | agre | ahnām | hitaḥ | hiteṣu | aruṣaḥ | vaneṣu || dame-dame | sapta | ratnā | dadhānaḥ | agniḥ | hotā | ni | sasāda | yajīyān ||5.1.5||

IAST: dame-dame sapta ratnā dadhāno 'gnir hotā ni ṣasādā yajīyān
Griffith: Yielding in every house his seven rich treasures, Agni is seated, Priest most skilled in worship.
Devanāgarī: दमेदमे सप्त रत्ना दधानोऽग्निर्होता नि षसादा यजीयान्
pada pāṭha: janiṣṭa | hi | jenyaḥ | agre | ahnām | hitaḥ | hiteṣu | aruṣaḥ | vaneṣu || dame-dame | sapta | ratnā | dadhānaḥ | agniḥ | hotā | ni | sasāda | yajīyān ||5.1.5||

IAST: agnir hotā ny asīdad yajīyān upasthe mātuḥ surabhā u loke
Griffith: Agni hath sat him down, a Priest most skilful, on a sweet-smelling place, his Mother's bosom.
Devanāgarī: अग्निर्होता न्यसीदद्यजीयानुपस्थे मातुः सुरभा उ लोके
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | hotā | ni | asīdat | yajīyān | upa-sthe | mātuḥ | surabhau | ūm̐ iti | loke || yuvā | kaviḥ | puruniḥ-sthaḥ | r̥ta-vā | dhartā | kr̥ṣṭīnām | uta | madhye | iddhaḥ ||5.1.6||

IAST: yuvā kaviḥ puruniṣṭha ṛtāvā dhartā kṛṣṭīnām uta madhya iddhaḥ
Griffith: Young, faithful, sage, preeminent o'er many, kindled among the folk whom he sustaineth.
Devanāgarī: युवा कविः पुरुनिष्ठ ऋतावा धर्ता कृष्टीनामुत मध्य इद्धः
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | hotā | ni | asīdat | yajīyān | upa-sthe | mātuḥ | surabhau | ūm̐ iti | loke || yuvā | kaviḥ | puruniḥ-sthaḥ | r̥ta-vā | dhartā | kr̥ṣṭīnām | uta | madhye | iddhaḥ ||5.1.6||

IAST: pra ṇu tyaṁ vipram adhvareṣu sādhum agniṁ hotāram īḻate namobhiḥ
Griffith: This Singer excellent at sacrifices, Agni the Priest, they glorify with homage.
Devanāgarī: प्र णु त्यं विप्रमध्वरेषु साधुमग्निं होतारमीळते नमोभिः
pada pāṭha: pra | nu | tyam | vipram | adhvareṣu | sādhum | agnim | hotāram | īḷate | namaḥ-bhiḥ || ā | yaḥ | tatāna | rodasī iti | r̥tena | nityam | mr̥janti | vājinam | ghr̥tena ||5.1.7||

IAST: ā yas tatāna rodasī ṛtena nityam mṛjanti vājinaṁ ghṛtena
Griffith: Him who spread out both worlds by Law Eternal they balm with oil, strong Steed who never faileth.
Devanāgarī: आ यस्ततान रोदसी ऋतेन नित्यं मृजन्ति वाजिनं घृतेन
pada pāṭha: pra | nu | tyam | vipram | adhvareṣu | sādhum | agnim | hotāram | īḷate | namaḥ-bhiḥ || ā | yaḥ | tatāna | rodasī iti | r̥tena | nityam | mr̥janti | vājinam | ghr̥tena ||5.1.7||

IAST: mārjālyo mṛjyate sve damūnāḥ kavipraśasto atithiḥ śivo naḥ
Griffith: He, worshipful House-Friend, in his home is worshipped, our own auspicious guest, lauded by sages.
Devanāgarī: मार्जाल्यो मृज्यते स्वे दमूनाः कविप्रशस्तो अतिथिः शिवो नः
pada pāṭha: mārjālyaḥ | mr̥jyate | sve | damūnāḥ | kavi-praśastaḥ | atithiḥ | śivaḥ | naḥ || sahasra-śr̥ṅgaḥ | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | tat-ojāḥ | viśvān | agne | sahasā | pra | asi | anyān ||5.1.8||

IAST: sahasraśṛṅgo vṛṣabhas tadojā viśvām̐ agne sahasā prāsy anyān
Griffith: That strength the Bull with thousand horns possesses. In might, O Agni, thou excellest others.
Devanāgarī: सहस्रशृङ्गो वृषभस्तदोजा विश्वाँ अग्ने सहसा प्रास्यन्यान्
pada pāṭha: mārjālyaḥ | mr̥jyate | sve | damūnāḥ | kavi-praśastaḥ | atithiḥ | śivaḥ | naḥ || sahasra-śr̥ṅgaḥ | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | tat-ojāḥ | viśvān | agne | sahasā | pra | asi | anyān ||5.1.8||

IAST: pra sadyo agne aty eṣy anyān āvir yasmai cārutamo babhūtha
Griffith: Thou quickly passest by all others, Agni, for him to whom thou hast appeared most lovely,
Devanāgarī: प्र सद्यो अग्ने अत्येष्यन्यानाविर्यस्मै चारुतमो बभूथ
pada pāṭha: pra | sadyaḥ | agne | ati | eṣi | anyān | āviḥ | yasmai | cāru-tamaḥ | babhūtha || īḷenyaḥ | vapuṣyaḥ | vibhā-vā | priyaḥ | viśām | atithiḥ | mānuṣīṇām ||5.1.9||

IAST: īḻenyo vapuṣyo vibhāvā priyo viśām atithir mānuṣīṇām
Griffith: Wondrously fair, adorable, effulgent, the guest of men, the darling of the people.
Devanāgarī: ईळेन्यो वपुष्यो विभावा प्रियो विशामतिथिर्मानुषीणाम्
pada pāṭha: pra | sadyaḥ | agne | ati | eṣi | anyān | āviḥ | yasmai | cāru-tamaḥ | babhūtha || īḷenyaḥ | vapuṣyaḥ | vibhā-vā | priyaḥ | viśām | atithiḥ | mānuṣīṇām ||5.1.9||

IAST: tubhyam bharanti kṣitayo yaviṣṭha balim agne antita ota dūrāt
Griffith: To thee, Most Youthful God! to thee, O Agni from near and far the people bring their tribute.
Devanāgarī: तुभ्यं भरन्ति क्षितयो यविष्ठ बलिमग्ने अन्तित ओत दूरात्
pada pāṭha: tubhyam | bharanti | kṣitayaḥ | yaviṣṭha | balim | agne | antitaḥ | ā | uta | dūrāt || ā | bhandiṣṭhasya | su-matim | cikiddhi | br̥hat | te | agne | mahi | śarma | bhadram ||5.1.10||

IAST: ā bhandiṣṭhasya sumatiṁ cikiddhi bṛhat te agne mahi śarma bhadram
Griffith: Mark well the prayer of him who best extols thee. Great, high, auspicious, Agni, is thy shelter.
Devanāgarī: आ भन्दिष्ठस्य सुमतिं चिकिद्धि बृहत्ते अग्ने महि शर्म भद्रम्
pada pāṭha: tubhyam | bharanti | kṣitayaḥ | yaviṣṭha | balim | agne | antitaḥ | ā | uta | dūrāt || ā | bhandiṣṭhasya | su-matim | cikiddhi | br̥hat | te | agne | mahi | śarma | bhadram ||5.1.10||

IAST: ādya ratham bhānumo bhānumantam agne tiṣṭha yajatebhiḥ samantam
Griffith: Ascend to-day thy splendid car, O Agni, in splendour, with the Holy Ones around it.
Devanāgarī: आद्य रथं भानुमो भानुमन्तमग्ने तिष्ठ यजतेभिः समन्तम्
pada pāṭha: ā | adya | ratham | bhānu-maḥ | bhānu-mantam | agne | tiṣṭha | yajatebhiḥ | sam-antam || vidvān | pathīnām | uru | antarikṣam | ā | iha | devān | haviḥ-adyāya | vakṣi ||5.1.11||

IAST: vidvān pathīnām urv antarikṣam eha devān haviradyāya vakṣi
Griffith: Knowing the paths by mid-air's spacious region bring hither Gods to feast on our oblation.
Devanāgarī: विद्वान्पथीनामुर्वन्तरिक्षमेह देवान्हविरद्याय वक्षि
pada pāṭha: ā | adya | ratham | bhānu-maḥ | bhānu-mantam | agne | tiṣṭha | yajatebhiḥ | sam-antam || vidvān | pathīnām | uru | antarikṣam | ā | iha | devān | haviḥ-adyāya | vakṣi ||5.1.11||

IAST: avocāma kavaye medhyāya vaco vandāru vṛṣabhāya vṛṣṇe
Griffith: To him adorable, sage, strong and mighty we have sung forth our song of praise and homage.
Devanāgarī: अवोचाम कवये मेध्याय वचो वन्दारु वृषभाय वृष्णे
pada pāṭha: avocāma | kavaye | medhyāya | vacaḥ | vandāru | vr̥ṣabhāya | vr̥ṣṇe || gaviṣṭhiraḥ | namasā | stomam | agnau | divi-iva | rukmam | uru-vyañcam | aśret ||5.1.12||

IAST: gaviṣṭhiro namasā stomam agnau divīva rukmam uruvyañcam aśret
Griffith: Gavisthira hath raised with prayer to Agni this laud far-reaching, like gold light to heaven.
Devanāgarī: गविष्ठिरो नमसा स्तोममग्नौ दिवीव रुक्ममुरुव्यञ्चमश्रेत्
pada pāṭha: avocāma | kavaye | medhyāya | vacaḥ | vandāru | vr̥ṣabhāya | vr̥ṣṇe || gaviṣṭhiraḥ | namasā | stomam | agnau | divi-iva | rukmam | uru-vyañcam | aśret ||5.1.12||

IAST: kumāram mātā yuvatiḥ samubdhaṁ guhā bibharti na dadāti pitre
Griffith: THE youthful Mother keeps the Boy in secret pressed to her close, nor yields him to the Father.
Devanāgarī: कुमारं माता युवतिः समुब्धं गुहा बिभर्ति न ददाति पित्रे
pada pāṭha: kumāram | mātā | yuvatiḥ | sam-ubdham | guhā | bibharti | na | dadāti | pitre || anīkam | asya | na | minat | janāsaḥ | puraḥ | paśyanti | ni-hitam | aratau ||5.2.1||

IAST: anīkam asya na minaj janāsaḥ puraḥ paśyanti nihitam aratau
Griffith: But, when he lies upon the arm, the people see his unfading countenance before them.
Devanāgarī: अनीकमस्य न मिनज्जनासः पुरः पश्यन्ति निहितमरतौ
pada pāṭha: kumāram | mātā | yuvatiḥ | sam-ubdham | guhā | bibharti | na | dadāti | pitre || anīkam | asya | na | minat | janāsaḥ | puraḥ | paśyanti | ni-hitam | aratau ||5.2.1||

IAST: kam etaṁ tvaṁ yuvate kumāram peṣī bibharṣi mahiṣī jajāna
Griffith: What child is this thou carriest as handmaid, O Youthful One? The Consort-Queen hath bome him.
Devanāgarī: कमेतं त्वं युवते कुमारं पेषी बिभर्षि महिषी जजान
pada pāṭha: kam | etam | tvam | yuvate | kumāram | peṣī | bibharṣi | mahiṣī | jajāna || pūrvīḥ | hi | garbhaḥ | śaradaḥ | vavardha | apaśyam | jātam | yat | asūta | mātā ||5.2.2||

IAST: pūrvīr hi garbhaḥ śarado vavardhāpaśyaṁ jātaṁ yad asūta mātā
Griffith: The Babe unborn increased through many autumns. I saw him born what time his Mother bare him.
Devanāgarī: पूर्वीर्हि गर्भः शरदो ववर्धापश्यं जातं यदसूत माता
pada pāṭha: kam | etam | tvam | yuvate | kumāram | peṣī | bibharṣi | mahiṣī | jajāna || pūrvīḥ | hi | garbhaḥ | śaradaḥ | vavardha | apaśyam | jātam | yat | asūta | mātā ||5.2.2||

IAST: hiraṇyadantaṁ śucivarṇam ārāt kṣetrād apaśyam āyudhā mimānam
Griffith: I saw him from afar gold-toothed, bright-coloured, hurling his weapons from his habitation,
Devanāgarī: हिरण्यदन्तं शुचिवर्णमारात्क्षेत्रादपश्यमायुधा मिमानम्
pada pāṭha: hiraṇya-dantam | śuci-varṇam | ārāt | kṣetrāt | apaśyam | āyudhā | mimānam || dadānaḥ | asmai | amr̥tam | vipr̥kvat | kim | mām | anindrāḥ | kr̥ṇavan | anukthāḥ ||5.2.3||

IAST: dadāno asmā amṛtaṁ vipṛkvat kim mām anindrāḥ kṛṇavann anukthāḥ
Griffith: What time I gave him Amrta free from mixture. How can the Indraless, the hymnless harm me?
Devanāgarī: ददानो अस्मा अमृतं विपृक्वत्किं मामनिन्द्राः कृणवन्ननुक्थाः
pada pāṭha: hiraṇya-dantam | śuci-varṇam | ārāt | kṣetrāt | apaśyam | āyudhā | mimānam || dadānaḥ | asmai | amr̥tam | vipr̥kvat | kim | mām | anindrāḥ | kr̥ṇavan | anukthāḥ ||5.2.3||

IAST: kṣetrād apaśyaṁ sanutaś carantaṁ sumad yūthaṁ na puru śobhamānam
Griffith: I saw him moving from the place he dwells in, even as with a herd, brilliantly shining.
Devanāgarī: क्षेत्रादपश्यं सनुतश्चरन्तं सुमद्यूथं न पुरु शोभमानम्
pada pāṭha: kṣetrāt | apaśyam | sanutariti | carantam | su-mat | yūtham | na | puru | śobhamānam || na | tāḥ | agr̥bhran | ajaniṣṭa | hi | saḥ | paliknīḥ | it | yuvatayaḥ | bhavanti ||5.2.4||

IAST: na tā agṛbhrann ajaniṣṭa hi ṣaḥ paliknīr id yuvatayo bhavanti
Griffith: These seized him not: he had been born already. They who were grey with age again grow youthful.
Devanāgarī: न ता अगृभ्रन्नजनिष्ट हि षः पलिक्नीरिद्युवतयो भवन्ति
pada pāṭha: kṣetrāt | apaśyam | sanutariti | carantam | su-mat | yūtham | na | puru | śobhamānam || na | tāḥ | agr̥bhran | ajaniṣṭa | hi | saḥ | paliknīḥ | it | yuvatayaḥ | bhavanti ||5.2.4||

IAST: ke me maryakaṁ vi yavanta gobhir na yeṣāṁ gopā araṇaś cid āsa
Griffith: Who separate my young bull from the cattle, they whose protector was in truth no stranger?
Devanāgarī: के मे मर्यकं वि यवन्त गोभिर्न येषां गोपा अरणश्चिदास
pada pāṭha: ke | me | maryakam | vi | yavanta | gobhiḥ | na | yeṣām | gopāḥ | araṇaḥ | cit | āsa || ye | īm | jagr̥bhuḥ | ava | te | sr̥jantu | ā | ajāti | paśvaḥ | upa | naḥ | cikitvān ||5.2.5||

IAST: ya īṁ jagṛbhur ava te sṛjantv ājāti paśva upa naś cikitvān
Griffith: Let those whose hands have seized upon them free them. May he, observant, drive the herd to us-ward.
Devanāgarī: य ईं जगृभुरव ते सृजन्त्वाजाति पश्व उप नश्चिकित्वान्
pada pāṭha: ke | me | maryakam | vi | yavanta | gobhiḥ | na | yeṣām | gopāḥ | araṇaḥ | cit | āsa || ye | īm | jagr̥bhuḥ | ava | te | sr̥jantu | ā | ajāti | paśvaḥ | upa | naḥ | cikitvān ||5.2.5||

IAST: vasāṁ rājānaṁ vasatiṁ janānām arātayo ni dadhur martyeṣu
Griffith: Mid mortal men godless have secreted the King of all who live, home of the people.
Devanāgarī: वसां राजानं वसतिं जनानामरातयो नि दधुर्मर्त्येषु
pada pāṭha: vasām | rājānam | vasatim | janānām | arātayaḥ | ni | dadhuḥ | martyeṣu || brahmāṇi | atreḥ | ava | tam | sr̥jantu | ninditāraḥ | nindyāsaḥ | bhavantu ||5.2.6||

IAST: brahmāṇy atrer ava taṁ sṛjantu ninditāro nindyāso bhavantu
Griffith: So may the prayers of Atri give him freedom. Reproached in turn be those who now reproach him.
Devanāgarī: ब्रह्माण्यत्रेरव तं सृजन्तु निन्दितारो निन्द्यासो भवन्तु
pada pāṭha: vasām | rājānam | vasatim | janānām | arātayaḥ | ni | dadhuḥ | martyeṣu || brahmāṇi | atreḥ | ava | tam | sr̥jantu | ninditāraḥ | nindyāsaḥ | bhavantu ||5.2.6||

IAST: śunaś cic chepaṁ niditaṁ sahasrād yūpād amuñco aśamiṣṭa hi ṣaḥ
Griffith: Thou from the stake didst loose e'en Sunahsepa bound for a thousand; for he prayed with fervour.
Devanāgarī: शुनश्चिच्छेपं निदितं सहस्राद्यूपादमुञ्चो अशमिष्ट हि षः
pada pāṭha: śunaḥ-śepam | cit | ni-ditam | sahasrāt | yūpāt | amuñcaḥ | aśamiṣṭa | hi | saḥ || eva | asmat | agne | vi | mumugdhi | pāsān | hotariti | cikitvaḥ | iha | tu | ni-sadya ||5.2.7||

IAST: evāsmad agne vi mumugdhi pāśān hotaś cikitva iha tū niṣadya
Griffith: So, Agni, loose from us the bonds that bind us, when thou art seated here, O Priest who knowest.
Devanāgarī: एवास्मदग्ने वि मुमुग्धि पाशान्होतश्चिकित्व इह तू निषद्य
pada pāṭha: śunaḥ-śepam | cit | ni-ditam | sahasrāt | yūpāt | amuñcaḥ | aśamiṣṭa | hi | saḥ || eva | asmat | agne | vi | mumugdhi | pāsān | hotariti | cikitvaḥ | iha | tu | ni-sadya ||5.2.7||

IAST: hṛṇīyamāno apa hi mad aiyeḥ pra me devānāṁ vratapā uvāca
Griffith: Thou hast sped from me, Agni, in thine anger: this the protector of Gods' Laws hath told me.
Devanāgarī: हृणीयमानो अप हि मदैयेः प्र मे देवानां व्रतपा उवाच
pada pāṭha: hr̥ṇīyamānaḥ | apa | hi | mat | aiyeḥ | pra | me | devānām | vrata-pāḥ | uvāca || indraḥ | vidvān | anu | hi | tvā | cacakṣa | tena | aham | agne | anu-śiṣṭaḥ | ā | agām ||5.2.8||

IAST: indro vidvām̐ anu hi tvā cacakṣa tenāham agne anuśiṣṭa āgām
Griffith: Indra who knoweth bent his eye upon thee: by him instructed am I come, O Agni.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रो विद्वाँ अनु हि त्वा चचक्ष तेनाहमग्ने अनुशिष्ट आगाम्
pada pāṭha: hr̥ṇīyamānaḥ | apa | hi | mat | aiyeḥ | pra | me | devānām | vrata-pāḥ | uvāca || indraḥ | vidvān | anu | hi | tvā | cacakṣa | tena | aham | agne | anu-śiṣṭaḥ | ā | agām ||5.2.8||

IAST: vi jyotiṣā bṛhatā bhāty agnir āvir viśvāni kṛṇute mahitvā
Griffith: Agni shines far and wide with lofty splendour, and by his greatness makes all things apparent.
Devanāgarī: वि ज्योतिषा बृहता भात्यग्निराविर्विश्वानि कृणुते महित्वा
pada pāṭha: vi | jyotiṣā | br̥hatā | bhāti | agniḥ | āviḥ | viśvāni | kr̥ṇute | mahi-tvā || pra | adevīḥ | māyāḥ | sahate | duḥ-evāḥ | śiśīte | śr̥ṅge iti | rakṣase | vi-nikṣe ||5.2.9||

IAST: prādevīr māyāḥ sahate durevāḥ śiśīte śṛṅge rakṣase vinikṣe
Griffith: He conquers godless and malign enchantments, and sharpens both his horns to gore the Raksas.
Devanāgarī: प्रादेवीर्मायाः सहते दुरेवाः शिशीते शृङ्गे रक्षसे विनिक्षे
pada pāṭha: vi | jyotiṣā | br̥hatā | bhāti | agniḥ | āviḥ | viśvāni | kr̥ṇute | mahi-tvā || pra | adevīḥ | māyāḥ | sahate | duḥ-evāḥ | śiśīte | śr̥ṅge iti | rakṣase | vi-nikṣe ||5.2.9||

IAST: uta svānāso divi ṣantv agnes tigmāyudhā rakṣase hantavā u
Griffith: Loud in the heaven above be Agni's roarings with keen-edged weapons to destroy the demons.
Devanāgarī: उत स्वानासो दिवि षन्त्वग्नेस्तिग्मायुधा रक्षसे हन्तवा उ
pada pāṭha: uta | svānāsaḥ | divi | santu | agneḥ | tigma-āyudhāḥ | rakṣase | hantavai | ūm̐ iti || made | cit | asya | pra | rujanti | bhāmāḥ | na | varante | pari-bādhaḥ | adevīḥ ||5.2.10||

IAST: made cid asya pra rujanti bhāmā na varante paribādho adevīḥ
Griffith: Forth burst his splendours in the Soma's rapture. The godless bands press round but cannot stayhim.
Devanāgarī: मदे चिदस्य प्र रुजन्ति भामा न वरन्ते परिबाधो अदेवीः
pada pāṭha: uta | svānāsaḥ | divi | santu | agneḥ | tigma-āyudhāḥ | rakṣase | hantavai | ūm̐ iti || made | cit | asya | pra | rujanti | bhāmāḥ | na | varante | pari-bādhaḥ | adevīḥ ||5.2.10||

IAST: etaṁ te stomaṁ tuvijāta vipro rathaṁ na dhīraḥ svapā atakṣam
Griffith: As a skilled craftsman makes a car, a singer I, Mighty One! this hymn for thee have fashioned.
Devanāgarī: एतं ते स्तोमं तुविजात विप्रो रथं न धीरः स्वपा अतक्षम्
pada pāṭha: etam | te | stomam | tuvi-jāta | vipraḥ | ratham | na | dhīraḥ | su-apāḥ | atakṣam || yadi | it | agne | prati | tvam | deva | haryāḥ | svaḥ-vatīḥ | apaḥ | ena | jayema ||5.2.11||

IAST: yadīd agne prati tvaṁ deva haryāḥ svarvatīr apa enā jayema
Griffith: If thou, O Agni, God, accept it gladly, may we obtain thereby the heavenly Waters.
Devanāgarī: यदीदग्ने प्रति त्वं देव हर्याः स्वर्वतीरप एना जयेम
pada pāṭha: etam | te | stomam | tuvi-jāta | vipraḥ | ratham | na | dhīraḥ | su-apāḥ | atakṣam || yadi | it | agne | prati | tvam | deva | haryāḥ | svaḥ-vatīḥ | apaḥ | ena | jayema ||5.2.11||

IAST: tuvigrīvo vṛṣabho vāvṛdhāno 'śatrv aryaḥ sam ajāti vedaḥ
Griffith: May he, the strong-necked Steer, waxing in vigour, gather the foeman's wealth with none to check him.
Devanāgarī: तुविग्रीवो वृषभो वावृधानोऽशत्र्वर्यः समजाति वेदः
pada pāṭha: tuvi-grīvaḥ | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | vavr̥dhānaḥ | aśatru | aryaḥ | sam | ajāti | vedaḥ || iti | imam | agnim | amr̥tāḥ | avocan | barhiṣmate | manave | śarma | yaṁsat | haviṣmate | manave | śarma | yaṁsat ||5.2.12||

IAST: itīmam agnim amṛtā avocan barhiṣmate manave śarma yaṁsad dhaviṣmate manave śarma yaṁsat
Griffith: Thus to this Agni have the Immortals spoken. To man who spreads the grass may he grant shelter, grant s
Devanāgarī: इतीममग्निममृता अवोचन्बर्हिष्मते मनवे शर्म यंसद्धविष्मते मनवे शर्म यंसत्
pada pāṭha: tuvi-grīvaḥ | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | vavr̥dhānaḥ | aśatru | aryaḥ | sam | ajāti | vedaḥ || iti | imam | agnim | amr̥tāḥ | avocan | barhiṣmate | manave | śarma | yaṁsat | haviṣmate | manave | śarma | yaṁsat ||5.2.12||

IAST: tvam agne varuṇo jāyase yat tvam mitro bhavasi yat samiddhaḥ
Griffith: THOU at thy birth art Varuna, O Agni; when thou art kindled thou becomest Mitra.
Devanāgarī: त्वमग्ने वरुणो जायसे यत्त्वं मित्रो भवसि यत्समिद्धः
pada pāṭha: tvam | agne | varuṇaḥ | jāyase | yat | tvam | mitraḥ | bhavasi | yat | sam-iddhaḥ || tve iti | viśve | sahasaḥ | putra | devāḥ | tvam | indraḥ | dāśuṣe | martyāya ||5.3.1||

IAST: tve viśve sahasas putra devās tvam indro dāśuṣe martyāya
Griffith: In thee, O Son of Strength, all Gods are centred. Indra art thou to man who brings oblation.
Devanāgarī: त्वे विश्वे सहसस्पुत्र देवास्त्वमिन्द्रो दाशुषे मर्त्याय
pada pāṭha: tvam | agne | varuṇaḥ | jāyase | yat | tvam | mitraḥ | bhavasi | yat | sam-iddhaḥ || tve iti | viśve | sahasaḥ | putra | devāḥ | tvam | indraḥ | dāśuṣe | martyāya ||5.3.1||

IAST: tvam aryamā bhavasi yat kanīnāṁ nāma svadhāvan guhyam bibharṣi
Griffith: Aryaman art thou as regardeth maidens mysterious, is thy name, O Self-sustainer.
Devanāgarī: त्वमर्यमा भवसि यत्कनीनां नाम स्वधावन्गुह्यं बिभर्षि
pada pāṭha: tvam | aryamā | bhavasi | yat | kanīnām | nāma | svadhā-van | guhyam | bibharṣi || añjanti | mitram | su-dhitam | na | gobhiḥ | yat | daṁpatī iti dam-patī | sa-manasā | kr̥ṇoṣi ||5.3.2||

IAST: añjanti mitraṁ sudhitaṁ na gobhir yad dampatī samanasā kṛṇoṣi
Griffith: As a kind friend with streams of milk they balm thee what time thou makcst wife and lord one-minded.
Devanāgarī: अञ्जन्ति मित्रं सुधितं न गोभिर्यद्दम्पती समनसा कृणोषि
pada pāṭha: tvam | aryamā | bhavasi | yat | kanīnām | nāma | svadhā-van | guhyam | bibharṣi || añjanti | mitram | su-dhitam | na | gobhiḥ | yat | daṁpatī iti dam-patī | sa-manasā | kr̥ṇoṣi ||5.3.2||

IAST: tava śriye maruto marjayanta rudra yat te janima cāru citram
Griffith: The Maruts deck their beauty for thy glory, yea, Rudra! for thy birth fair, brightly-coloured.
Devanāgarī: तव श्रिये मरुतो मर्जयन्त रुद्र यत्ते जनिम चारु चित्रम्
pada pāṭha: tava | śriye | marutaḥ | marjayanta | rudra | yat | te | janima | cāru | citram || padam | yat | viṣṇoḥ | upa-mam | ni-dhāyi | tena | pāsi | guhyam | nāma | gonām ||5.3.3||

IAST: padaṁ yad viṣṇor upamaṁ nidhāyi tena pāsi guhyaṁ nāma gonām
Griffith: That which was fixed as Visnu's loftiest station-therewith the secret of the Cows thou guardest.
Devanāgarī: पदं यद्विष्णोरुपमं निधायि तेन पासि गुह्यं नाम गोनाम्
pada pāṭha: tava | śriye | marutaḥ | marjayanta | rudra | yat | te | janima | cāru | citram || padam | yat | viṣṇoḥ | upa-mam | ni-dhāyi | tena | pāsi | guhyam | nāma | gonām ||5.3.3||

IAST: tava śriyā sudṛśo deva devāḥ purū dadhānā amṛtaṁ sapanta
Griffith: Gods through thy glory, God who art so lovely! granting abundant gifts gained life immortal.
Devanāgarī: तव श्रिया सुदृशो देव देवाः पुरू दधाना अमृतं सपन्त
pada pāṭha: tava | śriyā | su-dr̥śaḥ | deva | devāḥ | puru | dadhānāḥ | amr̥tam | sapanta || hotāram | agnim | manuṣaḥ | ni | seduḥ | daśasyantaḥ | uśijaḥ | śaṁsam | āyoḥ ||5.3.4||

IAST: hotāram agnim manuṣo ni ṣedur daśasyanta uśijaḥ śaṁsam āyoḥ
Griffith: As their own Priest have men established Agni; and serve him fain for praise from him who liveth.
Devanāgarī: होतारमग्निं मनुषो नि षेदुर्दशस्यन्त उशिजः शंसमायोः
pada pāṭha: tava | śriyā | su-dr̥śaḥ | deva | devāḥ | puru | dadhānāḥ | amr̥tam | sapanta || hotāram | agnim | manuṣaḥ | ni | seduḥ | daśasyantaḥ | uśijaḥ | śaṁsam | āyoḥ ||5.3.4||

IAST: na tvad dhotā pūrvo agne yajīyān na kāvyaiḥ paro asti svadhāvaḥ
Griffith: There is no priest more skilled than thou in worship; none Self-sustainer pass thee in wisdom.
Devanāgarī: न त्वद्धोता पूर्वो अग्ने यजीयान्न काव्यैः परो अस्ति स्वधावः
pada pāṭha: na | tvat | hotā | pūrvaḥ | agne | yajīyān | na | kāvyaiḥ | paraḥ | asti | svadhā-vaḥ || viśaḥ | ca | yasyāḥ | atithiḥ | bhavāsi | saḥ | yajñena | vanavat | deva | martān ||5.3.5||

IAST: viśaś ca yasyā atithir bhavāsi sa yajñena vanavad deva martān
Griffith: Ile man within whose house as guest thou dwellest, O God, by sacrifice shall conquer mortals.
Devanāgarī: विशश्च यस्या अतिथिर्भवासि स यज्ञेन वनवद्देव मर्तान्
pada pāṭha: na | tvat | hotā | pūrvaḥ | agne | yajīyān | na | kāvyaiḥ | paraḥ | asti | svadhā-vaḥ || viśaḥ | ca | yasyāḥ | atithiḥ | bhavāsi | saḥ | yajñena | vanavat | deva | martān ||5.3.5||

IAST: vayam agne vanuyāma tvotā vasūyavo haviṣā budhyamānāḥ
Griffith: Aided by thee, O Agni may we conquer through our oblation, fain for wealth, awakened:
Devanāgarī: वयमग्ने वनुयाम त्वोता वसूयवो हविषा बुध्यमानाः
pada pāṭha: vayam | agne | vanuyāma | tvā-ūtāḥ | vasu-yavaḥ | haviṣā | budhyamānāḥ || vayam | sa-marye | vidatheṣu | ahnām | vayam | rāyā | sahasaḥ | putra | martān ||5.3.6||

IAST: vayaṁ samarye vidatheṣv ahnāṁ vayaṁ rāyā sahasas putra martān
Griffith: May we in battle, in the days' assemblies,O Son of Strength, by riches conquer mortals.
Devanāgarī: वयं समर्ये विदथेष्वह्नां वयं राया सहसस्पुत्र मर्तान्
pada pāṭha: vayam | agne | vanuyāma | tvā-ūtāḥ | vasu-yavaḥ | haviṣā | budhyamānāḥ || vayam | sa-marye | vidatheṣu | ahnām | vayam | rāyā | sahasaḥ | putra | martān ||5.3.6||

IAST: yo na āgo abhy eno bharāty adhīd agham aghaśaṁse dadhāta
Griffith: He shall bring evil on the evil-plottcr whoever turns against us sin and outrage.
Devanāgarī: यो न आगो अभ्येनो भरात्यधीदघमघशंसे दधात
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | naḥ | āgaḥ | abhi | enaḥ | bharāti | adhi | it | agham | agha-śaṁse | dadhāta || jahi | cikitvaḥ | abhi-śastim | etām | agne | yaḥ | naḥ | marcayati | dvayena ||5.3.7||

IAST: jahī cikitvo abhiśastim etām agne yo no marcayati dvayena
Griffith: Destroy this calumny of him, O Agni, whoever injures us with double-dealing.
Devanāgarī: जही चिकित्वो अभिशस्तिमेतामग्ने यो नो मर्चयति द्वयेन
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | naḥ | āgaḥ | abhi | enaḥ | bharāti | adhi | it | agham | agha-śaṁse | dadhāta || jahi | cikitvaḥ | abhi-śastim | etām | agne | yaḥ | naḥ | marcayati | dvayena ||5.3.7||

IAST: tvām asyā vyuṣi deva pūrve dūtaṁ kṛṇvānā ayajanta havyaiḥ
Griffith: At this dawn's flushing, God! our ancient fathers served thee with offerings, making thee their envoy,
Devanāgarī: त्वामस्या व्युषि देव पूर्वे दूतं कृण्वाना अयजन्त हव्यैः
pada pāṭha: tvām | asyāḥ | vi-uṣi | deva | pūrve | dūtam | kr̥ṇvānāḥ | ayajanta | havyaiḥ || sam-sthe | yat | agne | īyase | rayīṇām | devaḥ | martaiḥ | vasu-bhiḥ | idhyamānaḥ ||5.3.8||

IAST: saṁsthe yad agna īyase rayīṇāṁ devo martair vasubhir idhyamānaḥ
Griffith: When, Agni, to the store of wealth thou goest, a God cnkindled with good things by mortals.
Devanāgarī: संस्थे यदग्न ईयसे रयीणां देवो मर्तैर्वसुभिरिध्यमानः
pada pāṭha: tvām | asyāḥ | vi-uṣi | deva | pūrve | dūtam | kr̥ṇvānāḥ | ayajanta | havyaiḥ || sam-sthe | yat | agne | īyase | rayīṇām | devaḥ | martaiḥ | vasu-bhiḥ | idhyamānaḥ ||5.3.8||

IAST: ava spṛdhi pitaraṁ yodhi vidvān putro yas te sahasaḥ sūna ūhe
Griffith: Save, thou who knowest, draw thy father near thee, who counts as thine own son, O Child of Power.
Devanāgarī: अव स्पृधि पितरं योधि विद्वान्पुत्रो यस्ते सहसः सून ऊहे
pada pāṭha: ava | spr̥dhi | pitaram | yodhi | vidvān | putraḥ | yaḥ | te | sahasaḥ | sūno iti | ūhe || kadā | cikitvaḥ | abhi | cakṣase | naḥ | agne | kadā | r̥ta-cit | yātayāse ||5.3.9||

IAST: kadā cikitvo abhi cakṣase no 'gne kadām̐ ṛtacid yātayāse
Griffith: O sapient Agni, when wilt thou regard us? When, skilled in holy Law, wilt thou direct us?
Devanāgarī: कदा चिकित्वो अभि चक्षसे नोऽग्ने कदाँ ऋतचिद्यातयासे
pada pāṭha: ava | spr̥dhi | pitaram | yodhi | vidvān | putraḥ | yaḥ | te | sahasaḥ | sūno iti | ūhe || kadā | cikitvaḥ | abhi | cakṣase | naḥ | agne | kadā | r̥ta-cit | yātayāse ||5.3.9||

IAST: bhūri nāma vandamāno dadhāti pitā vaso yadi taj joṣayāse
Griffith: Adoring thee he gives thee many a title, when thou, Good Lord! acceptest this as Father.
Devanāgarī: भूरि नाम वन्दमानो दधाति पिता वसो यदि तज्जोषयासे
pada pāṭha: bhūri | nāma | vandamānaḥ | dadhāti | pitā | vaso iti | yadi | tat | joṣayāse || kuvit | devasya | sahasā | cakānaḥ | sumnam | agniḥ | vanate | vavr̥dhānaḥ ||5.3.10||

IAST: kuvid devasya sahasā cakānaḥ sumnam agnir vanate vāvṛdhānaḥ
Griffith: And doth not Agni, glad in strength of Godhead, gain splendid bliss when he hath waxen mighty?
Devanāgarī: कुविद्देवस्य सहसा चकानः सुम्नमग्निर्वनते वावृधानः
pada pāṭha: bhūri | nāma | vandamānaḥ | dadhāti | pitā | vaso iti | yadi | tat | joṣayāse || kuvit | devasya | sahasā | cakānaḥ | sumnam | agniḥ | vanate | vavr̥dhānaḥ ||5.3.10||

IAST: tvam aṅga jaritāraṁ yaviṣṭha viśvāny agne duritāti parṣi
Griffith: Most Youthful Agni, verily thou bearest thy praiser safely over all his troubles.
Devanāgarī: त्वमङ्ग जरितारं यविष्ठ विश्वान्यग्ने दुरिताति पर्षि
pada pāṭha: tvam | aṅga | jaritāram | yaviṣṭha | viśvāni | agne | duḥ-itā | ati | parṣi || stenāḥ | adr̥śran | ripavaḥ | janāsaḥ | ajñāta-ketāḥ | vr̥jināḥ | abhūvan ||5.3.11||

IAST: stenā adṛśran ripavo janāso 'jñātaketā vṛjinā abhūvan
Griffith: Thieves have been seen by us and open foemen: unknown have been the plottings of the wicked.
Devanāgarī: स्तेना अदृश्रन्रिपवो जनासोऽज्ञातकेता वृजिना अभूवन्
pada pāṭha: tvam | aṅga | jaritāram | yaviṣṭha | viśvāni | agne | duḥ-itā | ati | parṣi || stenāḥ | adr̥śran | ripavaḥ | janāsaḥ | ajñāta-ketāḥ | vr̥jināḥ | abhūvan ||5.3.11||

IAST: ime yāmāsas tvadrig abhūvan vasave vā tad id āgo avāci
Griffith: To thee these eulogies have been directed: or to the Vasu hath this sin been spoken.
Devanāgarī: इमे यामासस्त्वद्रिगभूवन्वसवे वा तदिदागो अवाचि
pada pāṭha: ime | yāmāsaḥ | tvadrik | abhūvan | vasave | vā | tat | it | āgaḥ | avāci || na | aha | ayam | agniḥ | abhi-śastaye | naḥ | na | riṣate | vavr̥dhānaḥ | parā | dāt ||5.3.12||

IAST: nāhāyam agnir abhiśastaye no na rīṣate vāvṛdhānaḥ parā dāt
Griffith: But this our Agni, flaming high, shall never yield us to calumny, to him who wrongs us.
Devanāgarī: नाहायमग्निरभिशस्तये नो न रीषते वावृधानः परा दात्
pada pāṭha: ime | yāmāsaḥ | tvadrik | abhūvan | vasave | vā | tat | it | āgaḥ | avāci || na | aha | ayam | agniḥ | abhi-śastaye | naḥ | na | riṣate | vavr̥dhānaḥ | parā | dāt ||5.3.12||

IAST: tvām agne vasupatiṁ vasūnām abhi pra mande adhvareṣu rājan
Griffith: O AGNI, King and Lord of wealth and treasures, in thee is my delight at sacrifices.
Devanāgarī: त्वामग्ने वसुपतिं वसूनामभि प्र मन्दे अध्वरेषु राजन्
pada pāṭha: tvām | agne | vasu-patim | vasūnām | abhi | pra | mande | adhvareṣu | rājan || tvayā | vājam | vāja-yantaḥ | jayema | abhi | syāma | pr̥tsutīḥ | martyānām ||5.4.1||

IAST: tvayā vājaṁ vājayanto jayemābhi ṣyāma pṛtsutīr martyānām
Griffith: Through thee may we obtain the strength we long for, and overcome the fierce attacks of mortals.
Devanāgarī: त्वया वाजं वाजयन्तो जयेमाभि ष्याम पृत्सुतीर्मर्त्यानाम्
pada pāṭha: tvām | agne | vasu-patim | vasūnām | abhi | pra | mande | adhvareṣu | rājan || tvayā | vājam | vāja-yantaḥ | jayema | abhi | syāma | pr̥tsutīḥ | martyānām ||5.4.1||

IAST: havyavāḻ agnir ajaraḥ pitā no vibhur vibhāvā sudṛśīko asme
Griffith: Agni, Eternal Father, offering- bearer, fair to behold, far-reaching, far-refulgent,
Devanāgarī: हव्यवाळग्निरजरः पिता नो विभुर्विभावा सुदृशीको अस्मे
pada pāṭha: havya-vāṭ | agniḥ | ajaraḥ | pitā | naḥ | vi-bhuḥ | vibhā-vā | su-dr̥śīkaḥ | asme iti || su-gārhapatyāḥ | sam | iṣaḥ | didīhi | asmadryak | sam | mimīhi | śravāṁsi ||5.4.2||

IAST: sugārhapatyāḥ sam iṣo didīhy asmadryak sam mimīhi śravāṁsi
Griffith: From well-kept household fire beam food to feed us, and measure out to us abundant glory.
Devanāgarī: सुगार्हपत्याः समिषो दिदीह्यस्मद्र्यक्सं मिमीहि श्रवांसि
pada pāṭha: havya-vāṭ | agniḥ | ajaraḥ | pitā | naḥ | vi-bhuḥ | vibhā-vā | su-dr̥śīkaḥ | asme iti || su-gārhapatyāḥ | sam | iṣaḥ | didīhi | asmadryak | sam | mimīhi | śravāṁsi ||5.4.2||

IAST: viśāṁ kaviṁ viśpatim mānuṣīṇāṁ śucim pāvakaṁ ghṛtapṛṣṭham agnim
Griffith: The Sage of men, the Lord of human races, pure, purifying Agni, balmed with butter,
Devanāgarī: विशां कविं विश्पतिं मानुषीणां शुचिं पावकं घृतपृष्ठमग्निम्
pada pāṭha: viśām | kavim | viśpatim | mānuṣīṇām | śucim | pāvakam | ghr̥ta-pr̥ṣṭham | agnim || ni | hotāram | viśva-vidam | dadhidhve | saḥ | deveṣu | vanate | vāryāṇi ||5.4.3||

IAST: ni hotāraṁ viśvavidaṁ dadhidhve sa deveṣu vanate vāryāṇi
Griffith: Him the Omniscient as your Priest ye stablish: he wins among the Gods things worth the choosing.
Devanāgarī: नि होतारं विश्वविदं दधिध्वे स देवेषु वनते वार्याणि
pada pāṭha: viśām | kavim | viśpatim | mānuṣīṇām | śucim | pāvakam | ghr̥ta-pr̥ṣṭham | agnim || ni | hotāram | viśva-vidam | dadhidhve | saḥ | deveṣu | vanate | vāryāṇi ||5.4.3||

IAST: juṣasvāgna iḻayā sajoṣā yatamāno raśmibhiḥ sūryasya
Griffith: Agni, enjoy, of one accord with Ila, striving in rivalry with beams of Sarya,
Devanāgarī: जुषस्वाग्न इळया सजोषा यतमानो रश्मिभिः सूर्यस्य
pada pāṭha: juṣasva | agne | iḷayā | sa-joṣāḥ | yatamānaḥ | raśmi-bhiḥ | sūryasya || juṣasva | naḥ | sam-idham | jāta-vedaḥ | ā | ca | devān | haviḥ-adyāya | vakṣi ||5.4.4||

IAST: juṣasva naḥ samidhaṁ jātaveda ā ca devān haviradyāya vakṣi
Griffith: Enjoy, O Jatavedas, this our fuel, and bring the Gods to us to taste oblations.
Devanāgarī: जुषस्व नः समिधं जातवेद आ च देवान्हविरद्याय वक्षि
pada pāṭha: juṣasva | agne | iḷayā | sa-joṣāḥ | yatamānaḥ | raśmi-bhiḥ | sūryasya || juṣasva | naḥ | sam-idham | jāta-vedaḥ | ā | ca | devān | haviḥ-adyāya | vakṣi ||5.4.4||

IAST: juṣṭo damūnā atithir duroṇa imaṁ no yajñam upa yāhi vidvān
Griffith: As dear House-Friend, guest welcome in the dwelling, to this our sacrifice come thou who knowest.
Devanāgarī: जुष्टो दमूना अतिथिर्दुरोण इमं नो यज्ञमुप याहि विद्वान्
pada pāṭha: juṣṭaḥ | damūnāḥ | atithiḥ | duroṇe | imam | naḥ | yajñam | upa | yāhi | vidvān || viśvāḥ | agne | abhi-yujaḥ | vi-hatya | śatru-yatām | ā | bhara | bhojanāni ||5.4.5||

IAST: viśvā agne abhiyujo vihatyā śatrūyatām ā bharā bhojanāni
Griffith: And, Agni, having scattered all assailants, bring to us the possessions of our foemen.
Devanāgarī: विश्वा अग्ने अभियुजो विहत्या शत्रूयतामा भरा भोजनानि
pada pāṭha: juṣṭaḥ | damūnāḥ | atithiḥ | duroṇe | imam | naḥ | yajñam | upa | yāhi | vidvān || viśvāḥ | agne | abhi-yujaḥ | vi-hatya | śatru-yatām | ā | bhara | bhojanāni ||5.4.5||

IAST: vadhena dasyum pra hi cātayasva vayaḥ kṛṇvānas tanve svāyai
Griffith: Drive thou away the Dasyu with thy weapon. As, gaining vital power for thine own body,
Devanāgarī: वधेन दस्युं प्र हि चातयस्व वयः कृण्वानस्तन्वे स्वायै
pada pāṭha: vedhena | dasyum | pra | hi | cātayasva | vayaḥ | kr̥ṇvānaḥ | tanve | svāyai || piparṣi | yat | sahasaḥ | putra | devān | saḥ | agne | pāhi | nr̥-tama | vāje | asmān ||5.4.6||

IAST: piparṣi yat sahasas putra devānt so agne pāhi nṛtama vāje asmān
Griffith: O Son of Strength, the Gods thou satisfiest, so in fight save us, most heroic Agni.
Devanāgarī: पिपर्षि यत्सहसस्पुत्र देवान्त्सो अग्ने पाहि नृतम वाजे अस्मान्
pada pāṭha: vedhena | dasyum | pra | hi | cātayasva | vayaḥ | kr̥ṇvānaḥ | tanve | svāyai || piparṣi | yat | sahasaḥ | putra | devān | saḥ | agne | pāhi | nr̥-tama | vāje | asmān ||5.4.6||

IAST: vayaṁ te agna ukthair vidhema vayaṁ havyaiḥ pāvaka bhadraśoce
Griffith: May we, O Agni, with our lauds adore thee, and with our gifts, fair-beaming Purifier!
Devanāgarī: वयं ते अग्न उक्थैर्विधेम वयं हव्यैः पावक भद्रशोचे
pada pāṭha: vayam | te | agne | ukthaiḥ | vidhema | vayam | havyaiḥ | pāvaka | bhadra-śoce || asme iti | rayim | viśva-vāram | sam | inva | asme iti | viśvāni | draviṇāni | dhehi ||5.4.7||

IAST: asme rayiṁ viśvavāraṁ sam invāsme viśvāni draviṇāni dhehi
Griffith: Send to us wealth containing all things precious: bestow upon us every sort of riches.
Devanāgarī: अस्मे रयिं विश्ववारं समिन्वास्मे विश्वानि द्रविणानि धेहि
pada pāṭha: vayam | te | agne | ukthaiḥ | vidhema | vayam | havyaiḥ | pāvaka | bhadra-śoce || asme iti | rayim | viśva-vāram | sam | inva | asme iti | viśvāni | draviṇāni | dhehi ||5.4.7||

IAST: asmākam agne adhvaraṁ juṣasva sahasaḥ sūno triṣadhastha havyam
Griffith: Son of Strength, Agni, dweller in three regions, accept our sacrifice and our oblation.
Devanāgarī: अस्माकमग्ने अध्वरं जुषस्व सहसः सूनो त्रिषधस्थ हव्यम्
pada pāṭha: asmākam | agne | adhvaram | juṣasva | sahasaḥ | sūno iti | tri-sadhastha | havyam || vayam | deveṣu | su-kr̥taḥ | syāma | śarmaṇā | naḥ | tri-varūthena | pāhi ||5.4.8||

IAST: vayaṁ deveṣu sukṛtaḥ syāma śarmaṇā nas trivarūthena pāhi
Griffith: Among the Gods may we be counted pious: protect us with a triply-guarding shelter.
Devanāgarī: वयं देवेषु सुकृतः स्याम शर्मणा नस्त्रिवरूथेन पाहि
pada pāṭha: asmākam | agne | adhvaram | juṣasva | sahasaḥ | sūno iti | tri-sadhastha | havyam || vayam | deveṣu | su-kr̥taḥ | syāma | śarmaṇā | naḥ | tri-varūthena | pāhi ||5.4.8||

IAST: viśvāni no durgahā jātavedaḥ sindhuṁ na nāvā duritāti parṣi
Griffith: Over all woes and dangers, Jatavedas, bear us as in a boat across a river.
Devanāgarī: विश्वानि नो दुर्गहा जातवेदः सिन्धुं न नावा दुरिताति पर्षि
pada pāṭha: viśvāni | naḥ | duḥ-gahā | jāta-vedaḥ | sindhum | na | nāvā | duḥ-itā | ati | parṣi || agne | atri-vat | namasā | gr̥ṇānaḥ | asmākam | bodhi | avitā | tanūnām ||5.4.9||

IAST: agne atrivan namasā gṛṇāno 'smākam bodhy avitā tanūnām
Griffith: Praised with our homage even as Atri praised thee, O Agni, be the guardian of our bodies.
Devanāgarī: अग्ने अत्रिवन्नमसा गृणानोऽस्माकं बोध्यविता तनूनाम्
pada pāṭha: viśvāni | naḥ | duḥ-gahā | jāta-vedaḥ | sindhum | na | nāvā | duḥ-itā | ati | parṣi || agne | atri-vat | namasā | gr̥ṇānaḥ | asmākam | bodhi | avitā | tanūnām ||5.4.9||

IAST: yas tvā hṛdā kīriṇā manyamāno 'martyam martyo johavīmi
Griffith: As I, remembering thee with grateful spirit, a mortal, call with might on thee Immortal,
Devanāgarī: यस्त्वा हृदा कीरिणा मन्यमानोऽमर्त्यं मर्त्यो जोहवीमि
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | tvā | hr̥dā | kīriṇā | manyamānaḥ | amartyam | martyaḥ | johavīmi || jāta-vedaḥ | yaśaḥ | asmāsu | dhehi | pra-jābhiḥ | agne | amr̥ta-tvam | aśyām ||5.4.10||

IAST: jātavedo yaśo asmāsu dhehi prajābhir agne amṛtatvam aśyām
Griffith: Vouchsafe us high renown, O Jatavedas, and may I be immortal by my children.
Devanāgarī: जातवेदो यशो अस्मासु धेहि प्रजाभिरग्ने अमृतत्वमश्याम्
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | tvā | hr̥dā | kīriṇā | manyamānaḥ | amartyam | martyaḥ | johavīmi || jāta-vedaḥ | yaśaḥ | asmāsu | dhehi | pra-jābhiḥ | agne | amr̥ta-tvam | aśyām ||5.4.10||

IAST: yasmai tvaṁ sukṛte jātaveda u lokam agne kṛṇavaḥ syonam
Griffith: The pious man, O Jatavedas Agni, to whom thou grantest ample room and pleasure,
Devanāgarī: यस्मै त्वं सुकृते जातवेद उ लोकमग्ने कृणवः स्योनम्
pada pāṭha: yasmai | tvam | su-kr̥te | jāta-vedaḥ | ūm̐ iti | lokam | agne | kr̥ṇavaḥ | syonam || aśvinam | saḥ | putriṇam | vīra-vantam | go-mantam | rayim | naśate | svasti ||5.4.11||

IAST: aśvinaṁ sa putriṇaṁ vīravantaṁ gomantaṁ rayiṁ naśate svasti
Griffith: Gaineth abundant wealth with sons and horses, with heroes and with kine for his well-being.
Devanāgarī: अश्विनं स पुत्रिणं वीरवन्तं गोमन्तं रयिं नशते स्वस्ति
pada pāṭha: yasmai | tvam | su-kr̥te | jāta-vedaḥ | ūm̐ iti | lokam | agne | kr̥ṇavaḥ | syonam || aśvinam | saḥ | putriṇam | vīra-vantam | go-mantam | rayim | naśate | svasti ||5.4.11||

IAST: susamiddhāya śociṣe ghṛtaṁ tīvraṁ juhotana
Griffith: To Agni, Jatavedas, to the flame, the well-enkindled God,
Devanāgarī: सुसमिद्धाय शोचिषे घृतं तीव्रं जुहोतन
pada pāṭha: su-samiddhāya | śociṣe | ghr̥tam | tīvram | juhotana || agnaye | jāta-vedase ||5.5.1||

IAST: agnaye jātavedase
Griffith: Offer thick sacrificial oil.
Devanāgarī: अग्नये जातवेदसे
pada pāṭha: su-samiddhāya | śociṣe | ghr̥tam | tīvram | juhotana || agnaye | jāta-vedase ||5.5.1||

IAST: narāśaṁsaḥ suṣūdatīmaṁ yajñam adābhyaḥ
Griffith: He, Narasamsa, ne'er beguiled, inspiriteth this sacrifice:
Devanāgarī: नराशंसः सुषूदतीमं यज्ञमदाभ्यः
pada pāṭha: narāśaṁsaḥ | susūdati | imam | yajñam | adābhyaḥ || kaviḥ | hi | madhu-hastyaḥ ||5.5.2||

IAST: kavir hi madhuhastyaḥ
Griffith: For sage is he, with sweets in hand.
Devanāgarī: कविर्हि मधुहस्त्यः
pada pāṭha: narāśaṁsaḥ | susūdati | imam | yajñam | adābhyaḥ || kaviḥ | hi | madhu-hastyaḥ ||5.5.2||

IAST: īḻito agna ā vahendraṁ citram iha priyam
Griffith: Adored, O Agni, hither bring Indra the Wonderful, the Friend,
Devanāgarī: ईळितो अग्न आ वहेन्द्रं चित्रमिह प्रियम्
pada pāṭha: īḷitaḥ | agne | ā | vaha | indram | citram | iha | priyam || su-khaiḥ | rathebhiḥ | ūtaye ||5.5.3||

IAST: sukhai rathebhir ūtaye
Griffith: On lightly-rolling car to aid.
Devanāgarī: सुखै रथेभिरूतये
pada pāṭha: īḷitaḥ | agne | ā | vaha | indram | citram | iha | priyam || su-khaiḥ | rathebhiḥ | ūtaye ||5.5.3||

IAST: ūrṇamradā vi prathasvābhy arkā anūṣata
Griffith: Spread thyself out, thou soft as wool The holy hymns have sung to thee.
Devanāgarī: ऊर्णम्रदा वि प्रथस्वाभ्यर्का अनूषत
pada pāṭha: ūrṇa-mradāḥ | vi | prathasva | abhi | arkāḥ | anūṣata || bhava | naḥ | śubhra | sātaye ||5.5.4||

IAST: bhavā naḥ śubhra sātaye
Griffith: Bring gain to us, O beautiful!
Devanāgarī: भवा नः शुभ्र सातये
pada pāṭha: ūrṇa-mradāḥ | vi | prathasva | abhi | arkāḥ | anūṣata || bhava | naḥ | śubhra | sātaye ||5.5.4||

IAST: devīr dvāro vi śrayadhvaṁ suprāyaṇā na ūtaye
Griffith: Open yourselves, ye Doors Divine, easy of access for our aid:
Devanāgarī: देवीर्द्वारो वि श्रयध्वं सुप्रायणा न ऊतये
pada pāṭha: devīḥ | dvāraḥ | vi | śrayadhvam | supra-ayanāḥ | naḥ | ūtaye || pra-pra | yajñam | pr̥ṇītana ||5.5.5||

IAST: pra-pra yajñam pṛṇītana
Griffith: Fill, more and more, the sacrifice.
Devanāgarī: प्रप्र यज्ञं पृणीतन
pada pāṭha: devīḥ | dvāraḥ | vi | śrayadhvam | supra-ayanāḥ | naḥ | ūtaye || pra-pra | yajñam | pr̥ṇītana ||5.5.5||

IAST: supratīke vayovṛdhā yahvī ṛtasya mātarā
Griffith: Fair strengtheners of vital power, young Mothers of eternal Law,
Devanāgarī: सुप्रतीके वयोवृधा यह्वी ऋतस्य मातरा
pada pāṭha: supratīke iti su-pratīke | vayaḥ-vr̥dhā | yahvī iti | r̥tasya | mātarā || doṣām | uṣasam | īmahe ||5.5.6||

IAST: doṣām uṣāsam īmahe
Griffith: Morning and Night we supplicate.
Devanāgarī: दोषामुषासमीमहे
pada pāṭha: supratīke iti su-pratīke | vayaḥ-vr̥dhā | yahvī iti | r̥tasya | mātarā || doṣām | uṣasam | īmahe ||5.5.6||

IAST: vātasya patmann īḻitā daivyā hotārā manuṣaḥ
Griffith: On the wind's flight come, glorified, ye two celestial Priests of man
Devanāgarī: वातस्य पत्मन्नीळिता दैव्या होतारा मनुषः
pada pāṭha: vātasya | patman | īḷitā | daivyā | hotārā | manuṣaḥ || imam | naḥ | yajñam | ā | gatam ||5.5.7||

IAST: imaṁ no yajñam ā gatam
Griffith: Come ye to this our sacrifice.
Devanāgarī: इमं नो यज्ञमा गतम्
pada pāṭha: vātasya | patman | īḷitā | daivyā | hotārā | manuṣaḥ || imam | naḥ | yajñam | ā | gatam ||5.5.7||

IAST: iḻā sarasvatī mahī tisro devīr mayobhuvaḥ
Griffith: Ila, Sarasvati, Mahi, three Goddesses who bring us weal,
Devanāgarī: इळा सरस्वती मही तिस्रो देवीर्मयोभुवः
pada pāṭha: iḷā | sarasvatī | mahī | tisraḥ | devīḥ | mayaḥ-bhuvaḥ || barhiḥ | sīdantu | asridhaḥ ||5.5.8||

IAST: barhiḥ sīdantv asridhaḥ
Griffith: Be seated harmless on the grass.
Devanāgarī: बर्हिः सीदन्त्वस्रिधः
pada pāṭha: iḷā | sarasvatī | mahī | tisraḥ | devīḥ | mayaḥ-bhuvaḥ || barhiḥ | sīdantu | asridhaḥ ||5.5.8||

IAST: śivas tvaṣṭar ihā gahi vibhuḥ poṣa uta tmanā
Griffith: Rich in all plenty, Tvastar, come auspicious of thine own accord
Devanāgarī: शिवस्त्वष्टरिहा गहि विभुः पोष उत त्मना
pada pāṭha: śivaḥ | tvaṣṭaḥ | iha | ā | gahi | vi-bhuḥ | poṣe | uta | tmanā || yajñe-yajñe | naḥ | ut | ava ||5.5.9||

IAST: yajñe-yajñe na ud ava
Griffith: Help us in every sacrifice.
Devanāgarī: यज्ञेयज्ञे न उदव
pada pāṭha: śivaḥ | tvaṣṭaḥ | iha | ā | gahi | vi-bhuḥ | poṣe | uta | tmanā || yajñe-yajñe | naḥ | ut | ava ||5.5.9||

IAST: yatra vettha vanaspate devānāṁ guhyā nāmāni
Griffith: Vanaspati, wherever thou knowest the Gods' mysterious names,
Devanāgarī: यत्र वेत्थ वनस्पते देवानां गुह्या नामानि
pada pāṭha: yatra | vettha | vanaspate | devānām | guhyā | nāmāni || tatra | havyāni | gamaya ||5.5.10||

IAST: tatra havyāni gāmaya
Griffith: Send our oblations thitherward.
Devanāgarī: तत्र हव्यानि गामय
pada pāṭha: yatra | vettha | vanaspate | devānām | guhyā | nāmāni || tatra | havyāni | gamaya ||5.5.10||

IAST: svāhāgnaye varuṇāya svāhendrāya marudbhyaḥ
Griffith: To Agni and to Varuna, Indra, the Maruts, and the Gods,
Devanāgarī: स्वाहाग्नये वरुणाय स्वाहेन्द्राय मरुद्भ्यः
pada pāṭha: svāhā | agnaye | varuṇāya | svāhā | indrāya | marut-bhyaḥ || svāhā | devebhyaḥ | haviḥ ||5.5.11||

IAST: svāhā devebhyo haviḥ
Griffith: With Svaha be oblation brought.
Devanāgarī: स्वाहा देवेभ्यो हविः
pada pāṭha: svāhā | agnaye | varuṇāya | svāhā | indrāya | marut-bhyaḥ || svāhā | devebhyaḥ | haviḥ ||5.5.11||

IAST: agniṁ tam manye yo vasur astaṁ yaṁ yanti dhenavaḥ
Griffith: I VALUE Agni that good Lord, the home to which the kine return:
Devanāgarī: अग्निं तं मन्ये यो वसुरस्तं यं यन्ति धेनवः
pada pāṭha: agnim | tam | manye | yaḥ | vasuḥ | astam | yam | yanti | dhenavaḥ || astam | arvantaḥ | āśavaḥ | astam | nityāsaḥ | vājinaḥ | iṣam | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | ā | bhara ||5.6.1||

IAST: astam arvanta āśavo 'staṁ nityāso vājina iṣaṁ stotṛbhya ā bhara
Griffith: Whom fleet-foot coursers seek as home, and strong enduring steeds as home. Bring food to those who sing
Devanāgarī: अस्तमर्वन्त आशवोऽस्तं नित्यासो वाजिन इषं स्तोतृभ्य आ भर
pada pāṭha: agnim | tam | manye | yaḥ | vasuḥ | astam | yam | yanti | dhenavaḥ || astam | arvantaḥ | āśavaḥ | astam | nityāsaḥ | vājinaḥ | iṣam | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | ā | bhara ||5.6.1||

IAST: so agnir yo vasur gṛṇe saṁ yam āyanti dhenavaḥ
Griffith: Tis Agni whom we laud as good, to whom the milch-kine come in herds,
Devanāgarī: सो अग्निर्यो वसुर्गृणे सं यमायन्ति धेनवः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | agniḥ | yaḥ | vasuḥ | gr̥ṇe | sam | yam | ā-yanti | dhenavaḥ || sam | arvantaḥ | raghu-druvaḥ | sam | su-jātāsaḥ | sūraya | iṣam | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | ā | bhara ||5.6.2||

IAST: sam arvanto raghudruvaḥ saṁ sujātāsaḥ sūraya iṣaṁ stotṛbhya ā bhara
Griffith: To whom the chargers swift of foot, to whom our well-born princes come. Bring food to those who sing thy
Devanāgarī: समर्वन्तो रघुद्रुवः सं सुजातासः सूरय इषं स्तोतृभ्य आ भर
pada pāṭha: saḥ | agniḥ | yaḥ | vasuḥ | gr̥ṇe | sam | yam | ā-yanti | dhenavaḥ || sam | arvantaḥ | raghu-druvaḥ | sam | su-jātāsaḥ | sūraya | iṣam | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | ā | bhara ||5.6.2||

IAST: agnir hi vājinaṁ viśe dadāti viśvacarṣaṇiḥ
Griffith: Agni the God of all mankind, gives, verily, a steed to man.
Devanāgarī: अग्निर्हि वाजिनं विशे ददाति विश्वचर्षणिः
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | hi | vājinam | viśe | dadāti | viśva-carṣaṇiḥ || agniḥ | rāye | su-ābhuvam | saḥ | prītaḥ | yāti | vāryam | iṣam | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | ā | bhara ||5.6.3||

IAST: agnī rāye svābhuvaṁ sa prīto yāti vāryam iṣaṁ stotṛbhya ā bhara
Griffith: Agni gives precious gear for wealth, treasure he gives when he is pleased. Bring food to those who sing
Devanāgarī: अग्नी राये स्वाभुवं स प्रीतो याति वार्यमिषं स्तोतृभ्य आ भर
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | hi | vājinam | viśe | dadāti | viśva-carṣaṇiḥ || agniḥ | rāye | su-ābhuvam | saḥ | prītaḥ | yāti | vāryam | iṣam | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | ā | bhara ||5.6.3||

IAST: ā te agna idhīmahi dyumantaṁ devājaram
Griffith: God, Agni, we will kindle thee, rich in thy splendour, fading not,
Devanāgarī: आ ते अग्न इधीमहि द्युमन्तं देवाजरम्
pada pāṭha: ā | te | agne | idhīmahi | dyu-mantam | deva | ajaram || yat | ha | syā | te | panīyasī | sam-it | dīdayati | dyavi | iṣam | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | ā | bhara ||5.6.4||

IAST: yad dha syā te panīyasī samid dīdayati dyavīṣaṁ stotṛbhya ā bhara
Griffith: So that this glorious fuel may send forth by day its light for thee. Bring food to those who sing thy p
Devanāgarī: यद्ध स्या ते पनीयसी समिद्दीदयति द्यवीषं स्तोतृभ्य आ भर
pada pāṭha: ā | te | agne | idhīmahi | dyu-mantam | deva | ajaram || yat | ha | syā | te | panīyasī | sam-it | dīdayati | dyavi | iṣam | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | ā | bhara ||5.6.4||

IAST: ā te agna ṛcā haviḥ śukrasya śociṣas pate
Griffith: To thee the splendid, Lord of flame, bright, wondrous, Prince of men, is brought.
Devanāgarī: आ ते अग्न ऋचा हविः शुक्रस्य शोचिषस्पते
pada pāṭha: ā | te | agne | r̥cā | haviḥ | śukrasya | śociṣaḥ | pate || su-candra | dasma | viśpate | havya-vāṭ | tubhyam | hūyate | iṣam | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | ā | bhara ||5.6.5||

IAST: suścandra dasma viśpate havyavāṭ tubhyaṁ hūyata iṣaṁ stotṛbhya ā bhara
Griffith: Oblation with the holy verse, O Agni, bearer of our gifts. Bring food to those who sing thy praise.
Devanāgarī: सुश्चन्द्र दस्म विश्पते हव्यवाट् तुभ्यं हूयत इषं स्तोतृभ्य आ भर
pada pāṭha: ā | te | agne | r̥cā | haviḥ | śukrasya | śociṣaḥ | pate || su-candra | dasma | viśpate | havya-vāṭ | tubhyam | hūyate | iṣam | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | ā | bhara ||5.6.5||

IAST: pro tye agnayo 'gniṣu viśvam puṣyanti vāryam
Griffith: These Agnis in the seats of the fire nourish each thing most excellent.
Devanāgarī: प्रो त्ये अग्नयोऽग्निषु विश्वं पुष्यन्ति वार्यम्
pada pāṭha: pro iti | tye | agnayaḥ | agniṣu | viśvam | puṣyanti | vāryam || te | hinvire | te | invire | te | iṣaṇyanti | ānuṣak | iṣam | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | ā | bhara ||5.6.6||

IAST: te hinvire ta invire ta iṣaṇyanty ānuṣag iṣaṁ stotṛbhya ā bhara
Griffith: They give delight, they spread abroad, they move themselves continually. Bring food to those who sing t
Devanāgarī: ते हिन्विरे त इन्विरे त इषण्यन्त्यानुषगिषं स्तोतृभ्य आ भर
pada pāṭha: pro iti | tye | agnayaḥ | agniṣu | viśvam | puṣyanti | vāryam || te | hinvire | te | invire | te | iṣaṇyanti | ānuṣak | iṣam | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | ā | bhara ||5.6.6||

IAST: tava tye agne arcayo mahi vrādhanta vājinaḥ
Griffith: Agni, these brilliant flames of thine wax like strong chargers mightily,
Devanāgarī: तव त्ये अग्ने अर्चयो महि व्राधन्त वाजिनः
pada pāṭha: tava | tye | agne | arcayaḥ | mahi | vrādhanta | vājinaḥ || ye | patva-bhiḥ | śaphānām | vrajā | bhuranta | gonām | iṣam | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | ā | bhara ||5.6.7||

IAST: ye patvabhiḥ śaphānāṁ vrajā bhuranta gonām iṣaṁ stotṛbhya ā bhara
Griffith: Who with the treadings of their hoofs go swiftly to the stalls of kine. Bring food to those who sing thy
Devanāgarī: ये पत्वभिः शफानां व्रजा भुरन्त गोनामिषं स्तोतृभ्य आ भर
pada pāṭha: tava | tye | agne | arcayaḥ | mahi | vrādhanta | vājinaḥ || ye | patva-bhiḥ | śaphānām | vrajā | bhuranta | gonām | iṣam | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | ā | bhara ||5.6.7||

IAST: navā no agna ā bhara stotṛbhyaḥ sukṣitīr iṣaḥ
Griffith: To us who laud thee, Agni, bring fresh food and safe and happy homes.
Devanāgarī: नवा नो अग्न आ भर स्तोतृभ्यः सुक्षितीरिषः
pada pāṭha: navāḥ | naḥ | agne | ā | bhara | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | su-kṣitīḥ | iṣaḥ || te | syāma | ye | ānr̥cuḥ | tvā-dūtāsaḥ | dame-dame | iṣam | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | ā | bhara ||5.6.8||

IAST: te syāma ya ānṛcus tvādūtāso dame-dama iṣaṁ stotṛbhya ā bhara
Griffith: May we who have sung hymns to thee have thee for envoy in each house. Bring food to those who sing thy
Devanāgarī: ते स्याम य आनृचुस्त्वादूतासो दमेदम इषं स्तोतृभ्य आ भर
pada pāṭha: navāḥ | naḥ | agne | ā | bhara | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | su-kṣitīḥ | iṣaḥ || te | syāma | ye | ānr̥cuḥ | tvā-dūtāsaḥ | dame-dame | iṣam | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | ā | bhara ||5.6.8||

IAST: ubhe suścandra sarpiṣo darvī śrīṇīṣa āsani
Griffith: Thou, brilliant God, within thy mouth warmest both ladies of the oil.
Devanāgarī: उभे सुश्चन्द्र सर्पिषो दर्वी श्रीणीष आसनि
pada pāṭha: ubhe iti | su-candra | sarpiṣaḥ | darvī iti | śrīṇīṣe | āsani || uto iti | naḥ | ut | pupūryāḥ | uktheṣu | śavasaḥ | pate | iṣam | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | ā | bhara ||5.6.9||

IAST: uto na ut pupūryā uktheṣu śavasas pata iṣaṁ stotṛbhya ā bhara
Griffith: So fill us also, in our hymns, abundantly, O Lord of Strength,Bring food to those who sing thy praise.
Devanāgarī: उतो न उत्पुपूर्या उक्थेषु शवसस्पत इषं स्तोतृभ्य आ भर
pada pāṭha: ubhe iti | su-candra | sarpiṣaḥ | darvī iti | śrīṇīṣe | āsani || uto iti | naḥ | ut | pupūryāḥ | uktheṣu | śavasaḥ | pate | iṣam | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | ā | bhara ||5.6.9||

IAST: evām̐ agnim ajuryamur gīrbhir yajñebhir ānuṣak
Griffith: Thus Agni have we duly served with sacrifices and with hymns.
Devanāgarī: एवाँ अग्निमजुर्यमुर्गीर्भिर्यज्ञेभिरानुषक्
pada pāṭha: eva | agnim | ajuryamuḥ | gīḥ-bhiḥ | yajñebhiḥ | ānuṣak || dadhat | asme iti | su-vīryam | uta | tyat | āśu-aśvyam | iṣam | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | ā | bhara ||5.6.10||

IAST: dadhad asme suvīryam uta tyad āśvaśvyam iṣaṁ stotṛbhya ā bhara
Griffith: So may he give us what we crave, store of brave sons and fleet-foot steeds. Bring food to those who sing
Devanāgarī: दधदस्मे सुवीर्यमुत त्यदाश्वश्व्यमिषं स्तोतृभ्य आ भर
pada pāṭha: eva | agnim | ajuryamuḥ | gīḥ-bhiḥ | yajñebhiḥ | ānuṣak || dadhat | asme iti | su-vīryam | uta | tyat | āśu-aśvyam | iṣam | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | ā | bhara ||5.6.10||

IAST: sakhāyaḥ saṁ vaḥ samyañcam iṣaṁ stomaṁ cāgnaye
Griffith: OFFER to Agni, O my friends, your seemly food, your seemly praise;
Devanāgarī: सखायः सं वः सम्यञ्चमिषं स्तोमं चाग्नये
pada pāṭha: sakhāyaḥ | sam | vaḥ | samyañcam | iṣam | stomam | ca | agnaye || varṣiṣṭhāya | kṣitīnām | ūrjaḥ | naptre | sahasvate ||5.7.1||

IAST: varṣiṣṭhāya kṣitīnām ūrjo naptre sahasvate
Griffith: To him supremest o'er the folk, the Son of Strength, the mighty Lord:
Devanāgarī: वर्षिष्ठाय क्षितीनामूर्जो नप्त्रे सहस्वते
pada pāṭha: sakhāyaḥ | sam | vaḥ | samyañcam | iṣam | stomam | ca | agnaye || varṣiṣṭhāya | kṣitīnām | ūrjaḥ | naptre | sahasvate ||5.7.1||

IAST: kutrā cid yasya samṛtau raṇvā naro nṛṣadane
Griffith: Him in whose presence, when they meet in full assembly, men rejoice;
Devanāgarī: कुत्रा चिद्यस्य समृतौ रण्वा नरो नृषदने
pada pāṭha: kutra | cit | yasya | sam-r̥tau | raṇvāḥ | naraḥ | nr̥-sadane || arhantaḥ | cit | yam | indhate | sam-janayanti | jantavaḥ ||5.7.2||

IAST: arhantaś cid yam indhate saṁjanayanti jantavaḥ
Griffith: Even him whom worthy ones inflame, and living creatures bring to life.
Devanāgarī: अर्हन्तश्चिद्यमिन्धते संजनयन्ति जन्तवः
pada pāṭha: kutra | cit | yasya | sam-r̥tau | raṇvāḥ | naraḥ | nr̥-sadane || arhantaḥ | cit | yam | indhate | sam-janayanti | jantavaḥ ||5.7.2||

IAST: saṁ yad iṣo vanāmahe saṁ havyā mānuṣāṇām
Griffith: When we present to him the food and sacrificial gifts of men,
Devanāgarī: सं यदिषो वनामहे सं हव्या मानुषाणाम्
pada pāṭha: sam | yat | iṣaḥ | vanāmahe | sam | havyā | mānuṣāṇām || uta | dyumnasya | śavasā | r̥tasya | raśmim | ā | dade ||5.7.3||

IAST: uta dyumnasya śavasa ṛtasya raśmim ā dade
Griffith: He by the might of splendour grasps the holy Ordinance's rein.
Devanāgarī: उत द्युम्नस्य शवस ऋतस्य रश्मिमा ददे
pada pāṭha: sam | yat | iṣaḥ | vanāmahe | sam | havyā | mānuṣāṇām || uta | dyumnasya | śavasā | r̥tasya | raśmim | ā | dade ||5.7.3||

IAST: sa smā kṛṇoti ketum ā naktaṁ cid dūra ā sate
Griffith: He gives a signal in the night even to him who is afar,
Devanāgarī: स स्मा कृणोति केतुमा नक्तं चिद्दूर आ सते
pada pāṭha: saḥ | sma | kr̥ṇoti | ketum | ā | naktam | cit | dūre | ā | sate || pāvakaḥ | yat | vanaspatīn | pra | sma | mināti | ajaraḥ ||5.7.4||

IAST: pāvako yad vanaspatīn pra smā mināty ajaraḥ
Griffith: When he, the Bright, unchanged by eld, consumes the sovrans of the wood.
Devanāgarī: पावको यद्वनस्पतीन्प्र स्मा मिनात्यजरः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | sma | kr̥ṇoti | ketum | ā | naktam | cit | dūre | ā | sate || pāvakaḥ | yat | vanaspatīn | pra | sma | mināti | ajaraḥ ||5.7.4||

IAST: ava sma yasya veṣaṇe svedam pathiṣu juhvati
Griffith: He in whose service on the ways they offer up their drops of sweat,
Devanāgarī: अव स्म यस्य वेषणे स्वेदं पथिषु जुह्वति
pada pāṭha: ava | sma | yasya | veṣaṇe | svedam | pathiṣu | juhvati || abhi | īm | aha | sva-jenyam | bhūma | pr̥ṣṭhā-iva | ruruhuḥ ||5.7.5||

IAST: abhīm aha svajenyam bhūmā pṛṣṭheva ruruhuḥ
Griffith: On him is their high kin have they mounted, as ridges on the earth.
Devanāgarī: अभीमह स्वजेन्यं भूमा पृष्ठेव रुरुहुः
pada pāṭha: ava | sma | yasya | veṣaṇe | svedam | pathiṣu | juhvati || abhi | īm | aha | sva-jenyam | bhūma | pr̥ṣṭhā-iva | ruruhuḥ ||5.7.5||

IAST: yam martyaḥ puruspṛhaṁ vidad viśvasya dhāyase
Griffith: Whom, sought of many, mortal man hath found to be the Stay of all;
Devanāgarī: यं मर्त्यः पुरुस्पृहं विदद्विश्वस्य धायसे
pada pāṭha: yam | martyaḥ | puru-spr̥ham | vidat | viśvasya | dhāyase || pra | svādanam | pitūnām | asta-tātim | cit | āyave ||5.7.6||

IAST: pra svādanam pitūnām astatātiṁ cid āyave
Griffith: He who gives flavour to our food, the home of every man that lives.
Devanāgarī: प्र स्वादनं पितूनामस्ततातिं चिदायवे
pada pāṭha: yam | martyaḥ | puru-spr̥ham | vidat | viśvasya | dhāyase || pra | svādanam | pitūnām | asta-tātim | cit | āyave ||5.7.6||

IAST: sa hi ṣmā dhanvākṣitaṁ dātā na dāty ā paśuḥ
Griffith: Even as a herd that crops the grass he shears the field and wilderness,
Devanāgarī: स हि ष्मा धन्वाक्षितं दाता न दात्या पशुः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | hi | sma | dhanva | ā-kṣitam | dātā | na | dāti | ā | paśuḥ || hiri-śmaśruḥ | śuci-dan | r̥bhuḥ | anibhr̥ṣṭa-taviṣiḥ ||5.7.7||

IAST: hiriśmaśruḥ śucidann ṛbhur anibhṛṣṭataviṣiḥ
Griffith: With flashing teeth and beard of gold, deft with his unabated might.
Devanāgarī: हिरिश्मश्रुः शुचिदन्नृभुरनिभृष्टतविषिः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | hi | sma | dhanva | ā-kṣitam | dātā | na | dāti | ā | paśuḥ || hiri-śmaśruḥ | śuci-dan | r̥bhuḥ | anibhr̥ṣṭa-taviṣiḥ ||5.7.7||

IAST: śuciḥ ṣma yasmā atrivat pra svadhitīva rīyate
Griffith: For him, to whom, bright as an axe he, as to Atri, hath flashed forth,
Devanāgarī: शुचिः ष्म यस्मा अत्रिवत्प्र स्वधितीव रीयते
pada pāṭha: śuciḥ | sma | yasmai | atri-vat | pra | svadhitiḥ-iva | rīyate || su-sūḥ | asūta | mātā | krāṇā | yat | ānaśe | bhagam ||5.7.8||

IAST: suṣūr asūta mātā krāṇā yad ānaśe bhagam
Griffith: Hath the well-bearing Mother borne, producing when her time is come.
Devanāgarī: सुषूरसूत माता क्राणा यदानशे भगम्
pada pāṭha: śuciḥ | sma | yasmai | atri-vat | pra | svadhitiḥ-iva | rīyate || su-sūḥ | asūta | mātā | krāṇā | yat | ānaśe | bhagam ||5.7.8||

IAST: ā yas te sarpirāsute 'gne śam asti dhāyase
Griffith: Agni to whom the oil is shed by him thou lovest to support,
Devanāgarī: आ यस्ते सर्पिरासुतेऽग्ने शमस्ति धायसे
pada pāṭha: ā | yaḥ | te | sarpiḥ-āsute | agne | śam | asti | dhāyase || ā | eṣu | dyumnam | uta | śravaḥ | ā | cittam | martyeṣu | dhāḥ ||5.7.9||

IAST: aiṣu dyumnam uta śrava ā cittam martyeṣu dhāḥ
Griffith: Bestow upon these mortals fame and splendour and intelligence.
Devanāgarī: ऐषु द्युम्नमुत श्रव आ चित्तं मर्त्येषु धाः
pada pāṭha: ā | yaḥ | te | sarpiḥ-āsute | agne | śam | asti | dhāyase || ā | eṣu | dyumnam | uta | śravaḥ | ā | cittam | martyeṣu | dhāḥ ||5.7.9||

IAST: iti cin manyum adhrijas tvādātam ā paśuṁ dade
Griffith: Such zeal hath he, resistless one: he gained the cattle given by thee.
Devanāgarī: इति चिन्मन्युमध्रिजस्त्वादातमा पशुं ददे
pada pāṭha: iti | cit | manyum | adhrijaḥ | tvā-dātam | ā | paśum | dade || āt | agne | apr̥ṇataḥ | atriḥ | sasahyāt | dasyūn | iṣaḥ | sasahyāt | nr̥̄n ||5.7.10||

IAST: ād agne apṛṇato 'triḥ sāsahyād dasyūn iṣaḥ sāsahyān nṝn
Griffith: Agni, may Atri overcome the Dasyus who bestow no gifts, subdue the men who give no food.
Devanāgarī: आदग्ने अपृणतोऽत्रिः सासह्याद्दस्यूनिषः सासह्यान्नॄन्
pada pāṭha: iti | cit | manyum | adhrijaḥ | tvā-dātam | ā | paśum | dade || āt | agne | apr̥ṇataḥ | atriḥ | sasahyāt | dasyūn | iṣaḥ | sasahyāt | nr̥̄n ||5.7.10||

IAST: tvām agna ṛtāyavaḥ sam īdhire pratnam pratnāsa ūtaye sahaskṛta
Griffith: O AGNI urged to strength, the men of old who loved the Law enkindled thee, the Ancient, for their aid,
Devanāgarī: त्वामग्न ऋतायवः समीधिरे प्रत्नं प्रत्नास ऊतये सहस्कृत
pada pāṭha: tvām | agne | r̥ta-yavaḥ | sam | īdhire | pratnam | pratnāsaḥ | ūtaye | sahaḥ-kr̥ta || puru-candram | yajatam | viśva-dhāyasam | damūnasam | gr̥ha-patim | vareṇyam ||5.8.1||

IAST: puruścandraṁ yajataṁ viśvadhāyasaṁ damūnasaṁ gṛhapatiṁ vareṇyam
Griffith: Thee very bright, and holy, nourisher of all, most excellent, the Friend and Master of the home.
Devanāgarī: पुरुश्चन्द्रं यजतं विश्वधायसं दमूनसं गृहपतिं वरेण्यम्
pada pāṭha: tvām | agne | r̥ta-yavaḥ | sam | īdhire | pratnam | pratnāsaḥ | ūtaye | sahaḥ-kr̥ta || puru-candram | yajatam | viśva-dhāyasam | damūnasam | gr̥ha-patim | vareṇyam ||5.8.1||

IAST: tvām agne atithim pūrvyaṁ viśaḥ śociṣkeśaṁ gṛhapatiṁ ni ṣedire
Griffith: Thee, Agni, men have stablished as their guest of old, as Master of the household, thee, with hair of flam
Devanāgarī: त्वामग्ने अतिथिं पूर्व्यं विशः शोचिष्केशं गृहपतिं नि षेदिरे
pada pāṭha: tvām | agne | atithim | pūrvyam | viśaḥ | śociḥ-keśam | gr̥ha-patim | ni | sedire || br̥hat-ketum | puru-rūpam | dhana-spr̥tam | su-śarmāṇam | su-avasam | jarat-viṣam ||5.8.2||

IAST: bṛhatketum pururūpaṁ dhanaspṛtaṁ suśarmāṇaṁ svavasaṁ jaradviṣam
Griffith: High-bannered, multiform, distributor of wealth, kind helper, good protector, drier of the floods.
Devanāgarī: बृहत्केतुं पुरुरूपं धनस्पृतं सुशर्माणं स्ववसं जरद्विषम्
pada pāṭha: tvām | agne | atithim | pūrvyam | viśaḥ | śociḥ-keśam | gr̥ha-patim | ni | sedire || br̥hat-ketum | puru-rūpam | dhana-spr̥tam | su-śarmāṇam | su-avasam | jarat-viṣam ||5.8.2||

IAST: tvām agne mānuṣīr īḻate viśo hotrāvidaṁ viviciṁ ratnadhātamam
Griffith: The tribes of men praise thee, Agni, who knowest well burnt offerings, the Discerner, lavishest of wealth
Devanāgarī: त्वामग्ने मानुषीरीळते विशो होत्राविदं विविचिं रत्नधातमम्
pada pāṭha: tvām | agne | mānuṣīḥ | īḷate | viśaḥ | hotrā-vidam | vivicim | ratna-dhātamam || guhā | santam | su-bhaga | viśva-darśatam | tuvi-svaṇasam | su-yajam | ghr̥ta-śriyam ||5.8.3||

IAST: guhā santaṁ subhaga viśvadarśataṁ tuviṣvaṇasaṁ suyajaṁ ghṛtaśriyam
Griffith: Dwelling in secret, Blest One! visible to all, loud-roaring, skilled in worship, glorified with oil.
Devanāgarī: गुहा सन्तं सुभग विश्वदर्शतं तुविष्वणसं सुयजं घृतश्रियम्
pada pāṭha: tvām | agne | mānuṣīḥ | īḷate | viśaḥ | hotrā-vidam | vivicim | ratna-dhātamam || guhā | santam | su-bhaga | viśva-darśatam | tuvi-svaṇasam | su-yajam | ghr̥ta-śriyam ||5.8.3||

IAST: tvām agne dharṇasiṁ viśvadhā vayaṁ gīrbhir gṛṇanto namasopa sedima
Griffith: Ever to thee, O Agni, as exceeding strong have we drawn nigh with songs and reverence singing hymns.
Devanāgarī: त्वामग्ने धर्णसिं विश्वधा वयं गीर्भिर्गृणन्तो नमसोप सेदिम
pada pāṭha: tvām | agne | dharṇasim | viśvadhā | vayam | gīḥ-bhiḥ | gr̥ṇantaḥ | namasā | upa | sedima || saḥ | naḥ | juṣasva | sam-idhānaḥ | aṅgiraḥ | devaḥ | martasya | yaśasā | sudīti-bhiḥ ||5.8.4||

IAST: sa no juṣasva samidhāno aṅgiro devo martasya yaśasā sudītibhiḥ
Griffith: So be thou pleased with us, Angiras! as a God enkindled by the noble with man's goodly light.
Devanāgarī: स नो जुषस्व समिधानो अङ्गिरो देवो मर्तस्य यशसा सुदीतिभिः
pada pāṭha: tvām | agne | dharṇasim | viśvadhā | vayam | gīḥ-bhiḥ | gr̥ṇantaḥ | namasā | upa | sedima || saḥ | naḥ | juṣasva | sam-idhānaḥ | aṅgiraḥ | devaḥ | martasya | yaśasā | sudīti-bhiḥ ||5.8.4||

IAST: tvam agne pururūpo viśe-viśe vayo dadhāsi pratnathā puruṣṭuta
Griffith: Thou, Agni! multiform, God who art lauded much! givest in every house subsistence as of old.
Devanāgarī: त्वमग्ने पुरुरूपो विशेविशे वयो दधासि प्रत्नथा पुरुष्टुत
pada pāṭha: tvam | agne | puru-rūpaḥ | viśe-viśe | vayaḥ | dadhāsi | pratna-thā | puru-stuta || purūṇi | annā | sahasā | vi | rājasi | tviṣiḥ | sā | te | titviṣāṇasya | na | ā-dhr̥ṣe ||5.8.5||

IAST: purūṇy annā sahasā vi rājasi tviṣiḥ sā te titviṣāṇasya nādhṛṣe
Griffith: Thou rulest by thy might o'er food of many a sort: that light of thine when blazing may not be opposed.
Devanāgarī: पुरूण्यन्ना सहसा वि राजसि त्विषिः सा ते तित्विषाणस्य नाधृषे
pada pāṭha: tvam | agne | puru-rūpaḥ | viśe-viśe | vayaḥ | dadhāsi | pratna-thā | puru-stuta || purūṇi | annā | sahasā | vi | rājasi | tviṣiḥ | sā | te | titviṣāṇasya | na | ā-dhr̥ṣe ||5.8.5||

IAST: tvām agne samidhānaṁ yaviṣṭhya devā dūtaṁ cakrire havyavāhanam
Griffith: The Gods, Most Youthful Agni, have made thee, inflamed, the bearer of oblations and the messenger.
Devanāgarī: त्वामग्ने समिधानं यविष्ठ्य देवा दूतं चक्रिरे हव्यवाहनम्
pada pāṭha: tvām | agne | sam-idhānam | yaviṣṭhya | devāḥ | dūtam | cakrire | havya-vāhanam || uru-jrayasam | ghr̥ta-yonim | ā-hutam | tveṣam | cakṣuḥ | dadhire | codayat-mati ||5.8.6||

IAST: urujrayasaṁ ghṛtayonim āhutaṁ tveṣaṁ cakṣur dadhire codayanmati
Griffith: Thee, widely-reaching, homed in sacred oil, invoked, effulgent, have they made the Eye that stirs the t
Devanāgarī: उरुज्रयसं घृतयोनिमाहुतं त्वेषं चक्षुर्दधिरे चोदयन्मति
pada pāṭha: tvām | agne | sam-idhānam | yaviṣṭhya | devāḥ | dūtam | cakrire | havya-vāhanam || uru-jrayasam | ghr̥ta-yonim | ā-hutam | tveṣam | cakṣuḥ | dadhire | codayat-mati ||5.8.6||

IAST: tvām agne pradiva āhutaṁ ghṛtaiḥ sumnāyavaḥ suṣamidhā sam īdhire
Griffith: Men seeking joy have lit thee worshipped from of old, O Agni, with good fuel and with sacred oil.
Devanāgarī: त्वामग्ने प्रदिव आहुतं घृतैः सुम्नायवः सुषमिधा समीधिरे
pada pāṭha: tvām | agne | pra-divaḥ | ā-hutam | ghr̥taiḥ | sumna-yavaḥ | su-samidhā | sam | īdhire || saḥ | vavr̥dhānaḥ | oṣadhībhiḥ | ukṣitaḥ | abhi | jrayāṁsi | pārthivā | vi | tiṣṭhase ||5.8.7||

IAST: sa vāvṛdhāna oṣadhībhir ukṣito 'bhi jrayāṁsi pārthivā vi tiṣṭhase
Griffith: So thou, bedewed and waxing mighty by the plants, spreadest thyself abroad over the realms of earth.
Devanāgarī: स वावृधान ओषधीभिरुक्षितोऽभि ज्रयांसि पार्थिवा वि तिष्ठसे
pada pāṭha: tvām | agne | pra-divaḥ | ā-hutam | ghr̥taiḥ | sumna-yavaḥ | su-samidhā | sam | īdhire || saḥ | vavr̥dhānaḥ | oṣadhībhiḥ | ukṣitaḥ | abhi | jrayāṁsi | pārthivā | vi | tiṣṭhase ||5.8.7||

IAST: tvām agne haviṣmanto devam martāsa īḻate
Griffith: BEARING; oblations mortal men, O Agni, worship thee the God.
Devanāgarī: त्वामग्ने हविष्मन्तो देवं मर्तास ईळते
pada pāṭha: tvām | agne | haviṣmantaḥ | devam | martāsaḥ | īḷate || manye | tvā | jāta-vedasam | saḥ | havyā | vakṣi | ānuṣak ||5.9.1||

IAST: manye tvā jātavedasaṁ sa havyā vakṣy ānuṣak
Griffith: I deem thee Jatavedas: bear our offerings, thou, unceasingly.
Devanāgarī: मन्ये त्वा जातवेदसं स हव्या वक्ष्यानुषक्
pada pāṭha: tvām | agne | haviṣmantaḥ | devam | martāsaḥ | īḷate || manye | tvā | jāta-vedasam | saḥ | havyā | vakṣi | ānuṣak ||5.9.1||

IAST: agnir hotā dāsvataḥ kṣayasya vṛktabarhiṣaḥ
Griffith: In the man's home who offers gifts, where grass is trimmed, Agni is Priest,
Devanāgarī: अग्निर्होता दास्वतः क्षयस्य वृक्तबर्हिषः
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | hotā | dāsvataḥ | kṣayasya | vr̥kta-barhiṣaḥ || sam | yajñāsaḥ | caranti | yam | sam | vājāsaḥ | śravasyavaḥ ||5.9.2||

IAST: saṁ yajñāsaś caranti yaṁ saṁ vājāsaḥ śravasyavaḥ
Griffith: To whom all sacrifices come and strengthenings that win renown.
Devanāgarī: सं यज्ञासश्चरन्ति यं सं वाजासः श्रवस्यवः
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | hotā | dāsvataḥ | kṣayasya | vr̥kta-barhiṣaḥ || sam | yajñāsaḥ | caranti | yam | sam | vājāsaḥ | śravasyavaḥ ||5.9.2||

IAST: uta sma yaṁ śiśuṁ yathā navaṁ janiṣṭāraṇī
Griffith: Whom, as an infant newly-born, the kindling-sticks have brought to life,
Devanāgarī: उत स्म यं शिशुं यथा नवं जनिष्टारणी
pada pāṭha: uta | sma | yam | śiśum | yathā | navam | janiṣṭa | araṇī iti || dhartāram | mānuṣīṇām | viśām | agnim | su-adhvaram ||5.9.3||

IAST: dhartāram mānuṣīṇāṁ viśām agniṁ svadhvaram
Griffith: Sustainer of the tribes of men, skilled in well-ordered sacrifice.
Devanāgarī: धर्तारं मानुषीणां विशामग्निं स्वध्वरम्
pada pāṭha: uta | sma | yam | śiśum | yathā | navam | janiṣṭa | araṇī iti || dhartāram | mānuṣīṇām | viśām | agnim | su-adhvaram ||5.9.3||

IAST: uta sma durgṛbhīyase putro na hvāryāṇām
Griffith: Yea, very hard art thou to grasp, like offspring of the wriggling snakes,
Devanāgarī: उत स्म दुर्गृभीयसे पुत्रो न ह्वार्याणाम्
pada pāṭha: uta | sma | duḥ-gr̥bhīyase | putraḥ | na | hvāryāṇām || puru | yaḥ | dagdhā | asi | vanā | agne | paśuḥ | na | yavase ||5.9.4||

IAST: purū yo dagdhāsi vanāgne paśur na yavase
Griffith: When thou consumest many woods like an ox, Agni, in the mead.
Devanāgarī: पुरू यो दग्धासि वनाग्ने पशुर्न यवसे
pada pāṭha: uta | sma | duḥ-gr̥bhīyase | putraḥ | na | hvāryāṇām || puru | yaḥ | dagdhā | asi | vanā | agne | paśuḥ | na | yavase ||5.9.4||

IAST: adha sma yasyārcayaḥ samyak saṁyanti dhūminaḥ
Griffith: Whose flames, when thou art sending forth the smoke, completely reach the mark,
Devanāgarī: अध स्म यस्यार्चयः सम्यक्संयन्ति धूमिनः
pada pāṭha: adha | sma | yasya | arcayaḥ | samyak | sam-yanti | dhūminaḥ || yat | īm | aha | tritaḥ | divi | upa | dhmātā-iva | dhamati | śiśīte | dhmātari | yathā ||5.9.5||

IAST: yad īm aha trito divy upa dhmāteva dhamati śiśīte dhmātarī yathā
Griffith: When Trta in the height of heaven, like as a smelter fanneth thee, e'en as a smelter sharpeneth thee.
Devanāgarī: यदीमह त्रितो दिव्युप ध्मातेव धमति शिशीते ध्मातरी यथा
pada pāṭha: adha | sma | yasya | arcayaḥ | samyak | sam-yanti | dhūminaḥ || yat | īm | aha | tritaḥ | divi | upa | dhmātā-iva | dhamati | śiśīte | dhmātari | yathā ||5.9.5||

IAST: tavāham agna ūtibhir mitrasya ca praśastibhiḥ
Griffith: O Agni, by thy succour and by Mitra's friendly furtherance,
Devanāgarī: तवाहमग्न ऊतिभिर्मित्रस्य च प्रशस्तिभिः
pada pāṭha: tava | aham | agne | ūti-bhiḥ | mitrasya | ca | praśasti-bhiḥ || dveṣaḥ-yutaḥ | na | duḥ-itā | turyāma | martyānām ||5.9.6||

IAST: dveṣoyuto na duritā turyāma martyānām
Griffith: May we, averting hate, subbue the wickedness of mortal men.
Devanāgarī: द्वेषोयुतो न दुरिता तुर्याम मर्त्यानाम्
pada pāṭha: tava | aham | agne | ūti-bhiḥ | mitrasya | ca | praśasti-bhiḥ || dveṣaḥ-yutaḥ | na | duḥ-itā | turyāma | martyānām ||5.9.6||

IAST: taṁ no agne abhī naro rayiṁ sahasva ā bhara
Griffith: O Agni, to our heroes bring such riches, thou victorious God.
Devanāgarī: तं नो अग्ने अभी नरो रयिं सहस्व आ भर
pada pāṭha: tam | naḥ | agne | abhi | naraḥ | rayim | sahasvaḥ | ā | bhara || saḥ | kṣepayat | saḥ | poṣayat | bhuvat | vājasya | sātaye | uta | edhi | pr̥tsu | naḥ | vr̥dhe ||5.9.7||

IAST: sa kṣepayat sa poṣayad bhuvad vājasya sātaya utaidhi pṛtsu no vṛdhe
Griffith: May he protect and nourish us, and help in aining strength: be thou near us in rht for our success.
Devanāgarī: स क्षेपयत्स पोषयद्भुवद्वाजस्य सातय उतैधि पृत्सु नो वृधे
pada pāṭha: tam | naḥ | agne | abhi | naraḥ | rayim | sahasvaḥ | ā | bhara || saḥ | kṣepayat | saḥ | poṣayat | bhuvat | vājasya | sātaye | uta | edhi | pr̥tsu | naḥ | vr̥dhe ||5.9.7||

IAST: agna ojiṣṭham ā bhara dyumnam asmabhyam adhrigo
Griffith: BRING us most mighty splendour thou, Agni, resistless on thy way.
Devanāgarī: अग्न ओजिष्ठमा भर द्युम्नमस्मभ्यमध्रिगो
pada pāṭha: agne | ojiṣṭham | ā | bhara | dyumnam | asmabhyam | adhrigo ityadhri-go || pra | naḥ | rāyā | parīṇasā | ratsi | vājāya | panthām ||5.10.1||

IAST: pra no rāyā parīṇasā ratsi vājāya panthām
Griffith: With overflowing store of wealth mark out for us a path to strength.
Devanāgarī: प्र नो राया परीणसा रत्सि वाजाय पन्थाम्
pada pāṭha: agne | ojiṣṭham | ā | bhara | dyumnam | asmabhyam | adhrigo ityadhri-go || pra | naḥ | rāyā | parīṇasā | ratsi | vājāya | panthām ||5.10.1||

IAST: tvaṁ no agne adbhuta kratvā dakṣasya maṁhanā
Griffith: Ours art thou, wondrous Agni, bywisdom and bounteousness of power.
Devanāgarī: त्वं नो अग्ने अद्भुत क्रत्वा दक्षस्य मंहना
pada pāṭha: tvam | naḥ | agne | adbhuta | kratvā | dakṣasya | maṁhanā || tve iti | asuryam | ā | aruhat | krāṇā | mitraḥ | na | yajñiyaḥ ||5.10.2||

IAST: tve asuryam āruhat krāṇā mitro na yajñiyaḥ
Griffith: The might of Asuras rests on thee, like Mitra worshipful in act.
Devanāgarī: त्वे असुर्यमारुहत्क्राणा मित्रो न यज्ञियः
pada pāṭha: tvam | naḥ | agne | adbhuta | kratvā | dakṣasya | maṁhanā || tve iti | asuryam | ā | aruhat | krāṇā | mitraḥ | na | yajñiyaḥ ||5.10.2||

IAST: tvaṁ no agna eṣāṁ gayam puṣṭiṁ ca vardhaya
Griffith: Agni, increase our means of life, increase the house and home of these,
Devanāgarī: त्वं नो अग्न एषां गयं पुष्टिं च वर्धय
pada pāṭha: tvam | naḥ | agne | eṣām | gayam | puṣṭim | ca | vardhaya || ye | stomebhiḥ | pra | sūrayaḥ | naraḥ | maghāni | ānaśuḥ ||5.10.3||

IAST: ye stomebhiḥ pra sūrayo naro maghāny ānaśuḥ
Griffith: The men, the princes who have won great riches through our hymns of praise.
Devanāgarī: ये स्तोमेभिः प्र सूरयो नरो मघान्यानशुः
pada pāṭha: tvam | naḥ | agne | eṣām | gayam | puṣṭim | ca | vardhaya || ye | stomebhiḥ | pra | sūrayaḥ | naraḥ | maghāni | ānaśuḥ ||5.10.3||

IAST: ye agne candra te giraḥ śumbhanty aśvarādhasaḥ
Griffith: Bright Agni, they who deck their songs for thee have horses as their meed.
Devanāgarī: ये अग्ने चन्द्र ते गिरः शुम्भन्त्यश्वराधसः
pada pāṭha: ye | agne | candra | te | giraḥ | śumbhanti | aśva-rādhasaḥ || śuṣmebhiḥ | śuṣmiṇaḥ | naraḥ | divaḥ | cit | yeṣām | br̥hat | su-kīrtiḥ | bodhati | tmanā ||5.10.4||

IAST: śuṣmebhiḥ śuṣmiṇo naro divaś cid yeṣām bṛhat sukīrtir bodhati tmanā
Griffith: The men are mighty in their might, they whose high laud, as that of heaven, awakes thee of its own acco
Devanāgarī: शुष्मेभिः शुष्मिणो नरो दिवश्चिद्येषां बृहत्सुकीर्तिर्बोधति त्मना
pada pāṭha: ye | agne | candra | te | giraḥ | śumbhanti | aśva-rādhasaḥ || śuṣmebhiḥ | śuṣmiṇaḥ | naraḥ | divaḥ | cit | yeṣām | br̥hat | su-kīrtiḥ | bodhati | tmanā ||5.10.4||

IAST: tava tye agne arcayo bhrājanto yanti dhṛṣṇuyā
Griffith: O Agni, those resplendent flames of thine go valorously forth,
Devanāgarī: तव त्ये अग्ने अर्चयो भ्राजन्तो यन्ति धृष्णुया
pada pāṭha: tava | tye | agne | arcayaḥ | bhrājantaḥ | yanti | dhr̥ṣṇu-yā || pari-jmānaḥ | na | vi-dyutaḥ | svānaḥ | rathaḥ | na | vāja-yuḥ ||5.10.5||

IAST: parijmāno na vidyutaḥ svāno ratho na vājayuḥ
Griffith: Like lightnings flashing round us, like a rattling car that seeks the spoil.
Devanāgarī: परिज्मानो न विद्युतः स्वानो रथो न वाजयुः
pada pāṭha: tava | tye | agne | arcayaḥ | bhrājantaḥ | yanti | dhr̥ṣṇu-yā || pari-jmānaḥ | na | vi-dyutaḥ | svānaḥ | rathaḥ | na | vāja-yuḥ ||5.10.5||

IAST: nū no agna ūtaye sabādhasaś ca rātaye
Griffith: Now, Agni, come to succour us; let priests draw nigh to offer gifts;
Devanāgarī: नू नो अग्न ऊतये सबाधसश्च रातये
pada pāṭha: nu | naḥ | agne | ūtaye | sa-bādhasaḥ | ca | rātaye || asmākāsaḥ | ca | sūrayaḥ | viśvāḥ | āśāḥ | tarīṣaṇi ||5.10.6||

IAST: asmākāsaś ca sūrayo viśvā āśās tarīṣaṇi
Griffith: And let the patrons of our rites subdue all regions of the earth.
Devanāgarī: अस्माकासश्च सूरयो विश्वा आशास्तरीषणि
pada pāṭha: nu | naḥ | agne | ūtaye | sa-bādhasaḥ | ca | rātaye || asmākāsaḥ | ca | sūrayaḥ | viśvāḥ | āśāḥ | tarīṣaṇi ||5.10.6||

IAST: tvaṁ no agne aṅgiraḥ stutaḥ stavāna ā bhara
Griffith: Bring to us, Agni, Angiras, lauded of old and lauded now,
Devanāgarī: त्वं नो अग्ने अङ्गिरः स्तुतः स्तवान आ भर
pada pāṭha: tvam | naḥ | agne | aṅgiraḥ | stutaḥ | stavānaḥ | ā | bhara || hotaḥ | vibhva-saham | rayim | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | stavase | ca | naḥ | uta | edhi | pr̥t-su | naḥ | vr̥dhe ||5.10.7||

IAST: hotar vibhvāsahaṁ rayiṁ stotṛbhyaḥ stavase ca na utaidhi pṛtsu no vṛdhe
Griffith: Invoker! wealth to quell the strong, that singers may extol thee. Be near us in fight for our success.
Devanāgarī: होतर्विभ्वासहं रयिं स्तोतृभ्यः स्तवसे च न उतैधि पृत्सु नो वृधे
pada pāṭha: tvam | naḥ | agne | aṅgiraḥ | stutaḥ | stavānaḥ | ā | bhara || hotaḥ | vibhva-saham | rayim | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | stavase | ca | naḥ | uta | edhi | pr̥t-su | naḥ | vr̥dhe ||5.10.7||

IAST: janasya gopā ajaniṣṭa jāgṛvir agniḥ sudakṣaḥ suvitāya navyase
Griffith: THE watchful Guardian of the people hath been born, Agni, the very strong, for fresh prosperity.
Devanāgarī: जनस्य गोपा अजनिष्ट जागृविरग्निः सुदक्षः सुविताय नव्यसे
pada pāṭha: janasya | gopāḥ | ajaniṣṭa | jāgr̥viḥ | agniḥ | su-dakṣaḥ | suvitāya | navyase || ghr̥ta-pratīkaḥ | br̥hatā | divi-spr̥śā | dyu-mat | vi | bhāti | bharatebhyaḥ | śuciḥ ||5.11.1||

IAST: ghṛtapratīko bṛhatā divispṛśā dyumad vi bhāti bharatebhyaḥ śuciḥ
Griffith: With oil upon his face, with high heaventouching flame, he shineth splendidly, pure, for the Bharatas.
Devanāgarī: घृतप्रतीको बृहता दिविस्पृशा द्युमद्वि भाति भरतेभ्यः शुचिः
pada pāṭha: janasya | gopāḥ | ajaniṣṭa | jāgr̥viḥ | agniḥ | su-dakṣaḥ | suvitāya | navyase || ghr̥ta-pratīkaḥ | br̥hatā | divi-spr̥śā | dyu-mat | vi | bhāti | bharatebhyaḥ | śuciḥ ||5.11.1||

IAST: yajñasya ketum prathamam purohitam agniṁ naras triṣadhasthe sam īdhire
Griffith: Ensign of sacrifice, the earliest Household-Priest, the. men have kindled Agni in his threefold seat,
Devanāgarī: यज्ञस्य केतुं प्रथमं पुरोहितमग्निं नरस्त्रिषधस्थे समीधिरे
pada pāṭha: yajñasya | ketum | prathamam | puraḥ-hitam | agnim | naraḥ | tri-sadhasthe | sam | īdhire || indreṇa | devaiḥ | sa-ratham | saḥ | barhiṣi | sīdat | ni | hotā | yajathāya | su-kratuḥ ||5.11.2||

IAST: indreṇa devaiḥ sarathaṁ sa barhiṣi sīdan ni hotā yajathāya sukratuḥ
Griffith: With Indra and the Gods together on the grass let the wise Priest sit to complete the sacrifice.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रेण देवैः सरथं स बर्हिषि सीदन्नि होता यजथाय सुक्रतुः
pada pāṭha: yajñasya | ketum | prathamam | puraḥ-hitam | agnim | naraḥ | tri-sadhasthe | sam | īdhire || indreṇa | devaiḥ | sa-ratham | saḥ | barhiṣi | sīdat | ni | hotā | yajathāya | su-kratuḥ ||5.11.2||

IAST: asammṛṣṭo jāyase mātroḥ śucir mandraḥ kavir ud atiṣṭho vivasvataḥ
Griffith: Pure , unadorned, from thy two Mothers art thou born: thou camest fromVivasvan as a charming Sage.
Devanāgarī: असम्मृष्टो जायसे मात्रोः शुचिर्मन्द्रः कविरुदतिष्ठो विवस्वतः
pada pāṭha: asam-mr̥ṣṭaḥ | jāyase | mātroḥ | śuciḥ | mandraḥ | kaviḥ | ut | atiṣṭhaḥ | vivasvataḥ || ghr̥tena | tvā | avardhayan | agne | ā-huta | dhūmaḥ | te | ketuḥ | abhavat | divi | śritaḥ ||5.11.3||

IAST: ghṛtena tvāvardhayann agna āhuta dhūmas te ketur abhavad divi śritaḥ
Griffith: With oil they strengthened thee, O Agni, worshipped God: thy banner was the smoke that mounted to the s
Devanāgarī: घृतेन त्वावर्धयन्नग्न आहुत धूमस्ते केतुरभवद्दिवि श्रितः
pada pāṭha: asam-mr̥ṣṭaḥ | jāyase | mātroḥ | śuciḥ | mandraḥ | kaviḥ | ut | atiṣṭhaḥ | vivasvataḥ || ghr̥tena | tvā | avardhayan | agne | ā-huta | dhūmaḥ | te | ketuḥ | abhavat | divi | śritaḥ ||5.11.3||

IAST: agnir no yajñam upa vetu sādhuyāgniṁ naro vi bharante gṛhe-gṛhe
Griffith: May Agni graciously come to our sacrifice. The men bear Agni here and there in every house.
Devanāgarī: अग्निर्नो यज्ञमुप वेतु साधुयाग्निं नरो वि भरन्ते गृहेगृहे
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | naḥ | yajñam | upa | vetu | sādhu-yā | agnim | naraḥ | vi | bharante | gr̥he-gr̥he || agniḥ | dūtaḥ | abhavat | havya-vāhanaḥ | agnim | vr̥ṇānāḥ | vr̥ṇate | kavi-kratum ||5.11.4||

IAST: agnir dūto abhavad dhavyavāhano 'gniṁ vṛṇānā vṛṇate kavikratum
Griffith: He hath become an envoy, bearer of our gifts: electing Agni, men choose one exceeding wise.
Devanāgarī: अग्निर्दूतो अभवद्धव्यवाहनोऽग्निं वृणाना वृणते कविक्रतुम्
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | naḥ | yajñam | upa | vetu | sādhu-yā | agnim | naraḥ | vi | bharante | gr̥he-gr̥he || agniḥ | dūtaḥ | abhavat | havya-vāhanaḥ | agnim | vr̥ṇānāḥ | vr̥ṇate | kavi-kratum ||5.11.4||

IAST: tubhyedam agne madhumattamaṁ vacas tubhyam manīṣā iyam astu śaṁ hṛde
Griffith: For thee, O Agni, is this sweetest prayer of mine: dear to thy spirit be this product of my thought.
Devanāgarī: तुभ्येदमग्ने मधुमत्तमं वचस्तुभ्यं मनीषा इयमस्तु शं हृदे
pada pāṭha: tubhya | idam | agne | madhumat-tamam | vacaḥ | tubhyam | manīṣā | iyam | astu | śam | hr̥de || tvām | giraḥ | sindhum-iva | avanīḥ | mahīḥ | ā | pr̥ṇanti | śavasā | vardhayanti | ca ||5.11.5||

IAST: tvāṁ giraḥ sindhum ivāvanīr mahīr ā pṛṇanti śavasā vardhayanti ca
Griffith: As great streams fill the river so our song of praise fill thee, and make thee yet more mighty in thy s
Devanāgarī: त्वां गिरः सिन्धुमिवावनीर्महीरा पृणन्ति शवसा वर्धयन्ति च
pada pāṭha: tubhya | idam | agne | madhumat-tamam | vacaḥ | tubhyam | manīṣā | iyam | astu | śam | hr̥de || tvām | giraḥ | sindhum-iva | avanīḥ | mahīḥ | ā | pr̥ṇanti | śavasā | vardhayanti | ca ||5.11.5||

IAST: tvām agne aṅgiraso guhā hitam anv avindañ chiśriyāṇaṁ vane-vane
Griffith: O Agni, the Angirases discovered thee what time thou layest hidden, fleeing back from wood to wood.
Devanāgarī: त्वामग्ने अङ्गिरसो गुहा हितमन्वविन्दञ्छिश्रियाणं वनेवने
pada pāṭha: tvām | agne | aṅgirasaḥ | guhā | hitam | anu | avindan | śiśriyāṇam | vane-vane || saḥ | jāyase | mathyamānaḥ | sahaḥ | mahat | tvām | āhuḥ | sahasaḥ | putram | aṅgiraḥ ||5.11.6||

IAST: sa jāyase mathyamānaḥ saho mahat tvām āhuḥ sahasas putram aṅgiraḥ
