Griffith: Thou by attrition art produced as conquer.ing might, and men, O Angiras, call thee the Son of Strength.
Devanāgarī: स जायसे मथ्यमानः सहो महत्त्वामाहुः सहसस्पुत्रमङ्गिरः
pada pāṭha: tvām | agne | aṅgirasaḥ | guhā | hitam | anu | avindan | śiśriyāṇam | vane-vane || saḥ | jāyase | mathyamānaḥ | sahaḥ | mahat | tvām | āhuḥ | sahasaḥ | putram | aṅgiraḥ ||5.11.6||

IAST: prāgnaye bṛhate yajñiyāya ṛtasya vṛṣṇe asurāya manma
Griffith: I. To Agni, lofty Asura, meet for worship, Steer of eternal Law, my prayer I offer;
Devanāgarī: प्राग्नये बृहते यज्ञियाय ऋतस्य वृष्णे असुराय मन्म
pada pāṭha: pra | agnaye | br̥hate | yajñiyāya | r̥tasya | vr̥ṣṇe | asurāya | manma || ghr̥tam | na | yajñe | āsye | su-pūtam | giram | bhare | vr̥ṣabhāya | pratīcīm ||5.12.1||

IAST: ghṛtaṁ na yajña āsye supūtaṁ giram bhare vṛṣabhāya pratīcīm
Griffith: I bring my song directed to the Mighty like pure oil for his mouth at sacrifices.
Devanāgarī: घृतं न यज्ञ आस्ये सुपूतं गिरं भरे वृषभाय प्रतीचीम्
pada pāṭha: pra | agnaye | br̥hate | yajñiyāya | r̥tasya | vr̥ṣṇe | asurāya | manma || ghr̥tam | na | yajñe | āsye | su-pūtam | giram | bhare | vr̥ṣabhāya | pratīcīm ||5.12.1||

IAST: ṛtaṁ cikitva ṛtam ic cikiddhy ṛtasya dhārā anu tṛndhi pūrvīḥ
Griffith: Mark the Law, thou who knowest, yea, observe it: send forth the full streams of eternal Order.
Devanāgarī: ऋतं चिकित्व ऋतमिच्चिकिद्ध्यृतस्य धारा अनु तृन्धि पूर्वीः
pada pāṭha: r̥tam | cikitvaḥ | r̥tam | it | cikiddhi | r̥tasya | dhārāḥ | anu | tr̥ndhi | pūrvīḥ || na | aham | yātum | sahasā | na | dvayena | r̥tam | sapāmi | aruṣasya | vr̥ṣṇaḥ ||5.12.2||

IAST: nāhaṁ yātuṁ sahasā na dvayena ṛtaṁ sapāmy aruṣasya vṛṣṇaḥ
Griffith: I use no sorcery with might or falsehood the sacred Law of the Red Steer I follow.
Devanāgarī: नाहं यातुं सहसा न द्वयेन ऋतं सपाम्यरुषस्य वृष्णः
pada pāṭha: r̥tam | cikitvaḥ | r̥tam | it | cikiddhi | r̥tasya | dhārāḥ | anu | tr̥ndhi | pūrvīḥ || na | aham | yātum | sahasā | na | dvayena | r̥tam | sapāmi | aruṣasya | vr̥ṣṇaḥ ||5.12.2||

IAST: kayā no agna ṛtayann ṛtena bhuvo navedā ucathasya navyaḥ
Griffith: How hast thou, follower of the Law eternal, become the knower of a new song, Agni?
Devanāgarī: कया नो अग्न ऋतयन्नृतेन भुवो नवेदा उचथस्य नव्यः
pada pāṭha: kayā | naḥ | agne | r̥tayan | r̥tena | bhuvaḥ | navedāḥ | ucathasya | navyaḥ || veda | me | devaḥ | r̥tu-pāḥ | r̥tūnām | na | aham | patim | sanituḥ | asya | rāyaḥ ||5.12.3||

IAST: vedā me deva ṛtupā ṛtūnāṁ nāham patiṁ sanitur asya rāyaḥ
Griffith: The God, the Guardian of the seasons, knows me: the Lord of him who won this wealth I know not.
Devanāgarī: वेदा मे देव ऋतुपा ऋतूनां नाहं पतिं सनितुरस्य रायः
pada pāṭha: kayā | naḥ | agne | r̥tayan | r̥tena | bhuvaḥ | navedāḥ | ucathasya | navyaḥ || veda | me | devaḥ | r̥tu-pāḥ | r̥tūnām | na | aham | patim | sanituḥ | asya | rāyaḥ ||5.12.3||

IAST: ke te agne ripave bandhanāsaḥ ke pāyavaḥ saniṣanta dyumantaḥ
Griffith: Who, Agni, in alliance with thy foeman, what splendid helpers won for them their riches?
Devanāgarī: के ते अग्ने रिपवे बन्धनासः के पायवः सनिषन्त द्युमन्तः
pada pāṭha: ke | te | agne | ripave | bandhanāsaḥ | ke | pāyavaḥ | saniṣanta | dyu-mantaḥ || ke | dhāsim | agne | anr̥tasya | pānti | ke | asataḥ | vacasaḥ | santi | gopāḥ ||5.12.4||

IAST: ke dhāsim agne anṛtasya pānti ka āsato vacasaḥ santi gopāḥ
Griffith: Agni, who guard the dwelling-place of falsehood? Who are protectors of the speech of liars?
Devanāgarī: के धासिमग्ने अनृतस्य पान्ति क आसतो वचसः सन्ति गोपाः
pada pāṭha: ke | te | agne | ripave | bandhanāsaḥ | ke | pāyavaḥ | saniṣanta | dyu-mantaḥ || ke | dhāsim | agne | anr̥tasya | pānti | ke | asataḥ | vacasaḥ | santi | gopāḥ ||5.12.4||

IAST: sakhāyas te viṣuṇā agna ete śivāsaḥ santo aśivā abhūvan
Griffith: Agni, those friends of thine have turned them from thee: gracious of old, they have become ungracious.
Devanāgarī: सखायस्ते विषुणा अग्न एते शिवासः सन्तो अशिवा अभूवन्
pada pāṭha: sakhāyaḥ | te | viṣuṇāḥ | agne | ete | śivāsaḥ | santaḥ | aśivāḥ | abhūvan || adhūrṣata | svayam | ete | vacaḥ-bhiḥ | r̥ju-yate | vr̥jināni | bruvantaḥ ||5.12.5||

IAST: adhūrṣata svayam ete vacobhir ṛjūyate vṛjināni bruvantaḥ
Griffith: They have deceived themselves by their own speeches, uttering wicked words against the righteous.
Devanāgarī: अधूर्षत स्वयमेते वचोभिरृजूयते वृजिनानि ब्रुवन्तः
pada pāṭha: sakhāyaḥ | te | viṣuṇāḥ | agne | ete | śivāsaḥ | santaḥ | aśivāḥ | abhūvan || adhūrṣata | svayam | ete | vacaḥ-bhiḥ | r̥ju-yate | vr̥jināni | bruvantaḥ ||5.12.5||

IAST: yas te agne namasā yajñam īṭṭa ṛtaṁ sa pāty aruṣasya vṛṣṇaḥ
Griffith: He who pays sacrifice to thee with homage, O Agni, keeps the Red Steer's Law eternal;
Devanāgarī: यस्ते अग्ने नमसा यज्ञमीट्ट ऋतं स पात्यरुषस्य वृष्णः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | te | agne | namasā | yajñam | īṭṭe | r̥tam | saḥ | pāti | aruṣasya | vr̥ṣṇaḥ || tasya | kṣayaḥ | pr̥thuḥ | ā | sādhuḥ | etu | pra-sarsrāṇasya | nahuṣasya | śeṣaḥ ||5.12.6||

IAST: tasya kṣayaḥ pṛthur ā sādhur etu prasarsrāṇasya nahuṣasya śeṣaḥ
Griffith: Wide is his dwelling. May the noble offipring of Nahusa who wandered forth come hither.
Devanāgarī: तस्य क्षयः पृथुरा साधुरेतु प्रसर्स्राणस्य नहुषस्य शेषः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | te | agne | namasā | yajñam | īṭṭe | r̥tam | saḥ | pāti | aruṣasya | vr̥ṣṇaḥ || tasya | kṣayaḥ | pr̥thuḥ | ā | sādhuḥ | etu | pra-sarsrāṇasya | nahuṣasya | śeṣaḥ ||5.12.6||

IAST: arcantas tvā havāmahe 'rcantaḥ sam idhīmahi
Griffith: WITH songs of praise we call on thee, we kindle thee with songs of praise,
Devanāgarī: अर्चन्तस्त्वा हवामहेऽर्चन्तः समिधीमहि
pada pāṭha: arcantaḥ | tvā | havāmahe | arcantaḥ | sam | idhīmahi || agne | arcantaḥ | ūtaye ||5.13.1||

IAST: agne arcanta ūtaye
Griffith: Agni, -with songs of praise, for help.
Devanāgarī: अग्ने अर्चन्त ऊतये
pada pāṭha: arcantaḥ | tvā | havāmahe | arcantaḥ | sam | idhīmahi || agne | arcantaḥ | ūtaye ||5.13.1||

IAST: agneḥ stomam manāmahe sidhram adya divispṛśaḥ
Griffith: Eager for wealth, we meditate Agni's effectual praise to-day,
Devanāgarī: अग्नेः स्तोमं मनामहे सिध्रमद्य दिविस्पृशः
pada pāṭha: agneḥ | stomam | manāmahe | sidhram | adya | divi-spr̥śaḥ || devasya | draviṇasyavaḥ ||5.13.2||

IAST: devasya draviṇasyavaḥ
Griffith: Praise of the God who touches heaven.
Devanāgarī: देवस्य द्रविणस्यवः
pada pāṭha: agneḥ | stomam | manāmahe | sidhram | adya | divi-spr̥śaḥ || devasya | draviṇasyavaḥ ||5.13.2||

IAST: agnir juṣata no giro hotā yo mānuṣeṣv ā
Griffith: May Agni, Priest among mankind, take pleasure in our songs of praise,
Devanāgarī: अग्निर्जुषत नो गिरो होता यो मानुषेष्वा
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | juṣata | naḥ | giraḥ | hotā | yaḥ | mānuṣeṣu | ā || saḥ | yakṣat | daivyam | janam ||5.13.3||

IAST: sa yakṣad daivyaṁ janam
Griffith: And worship the Celestial Folk.
Devanāgarī: स यक्षद्दैव्यं जनम्
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | juṣata | naḥ | giraḥ | hotā | yaḥ | mānuṣeṣu | ā || saḥ | yakṣat | daivyam | janam ||5.13.3||

IAST: tvam agne saprathā asi juṣṭo hotā vareṇyaḥ
Griffith: Thou, Agni, art spread widely forth, Priest dear and excellent; through thee
Devanāgarī: त्वमग्ने सप्रथा असि जुष्टो होता वरेण्यः
pada pāṭha: tvam | agne | sa-prathāḥ | asi | juṣṭaḥ | hotā | vareṇyaḥ || tvayā | yajñam | vi | tanvate ||5.13.4||

IAST: tvayā yajñaṁ vi tanvate
Griffith: Men make the sacrifice complete.
Devanāgarī: त्वया यज्ञं वि तन्वते
pada pāṭha: tvam | agne | sa-prathāḥ | asi | juṣṭaḥ | hotā | vareṇyaḥ || tvayā | yajñam | vi | tanvate ||5.13.4||

IAST: tvām agne vājasātamaṁ viprā vardhanti suṣṭutam
Griffith: Singers exalt thee, Agni, well lauded, best giver of our strength:
Devanāgarī: त्वामग्ने वाजसातमं विप्रा वर्धन्ति सुष्टुतम्
pada pāṭha: tvām | agne | vāja-sātamam | viprāḥ | vardhanti | su-stutam || saḥ | naḥ | rāsva | su-vīryam ||5.13.5||

IAST: sa no rāsva suvīryam
Griffith: So grant thou us heroic might.
Devanāgarī: स नो रास्व सुवीर्यम्
pada pāṭha: tvām | agne | vāja-sātamam | viprāḥ | vardhanti | su-stutam || saḥ | naḥ | rāsva | su-vīryam ||5.13.5||

IAST: agne nemir arām̐ iva devām̐s tvam paribhūr asi
Griffith: Thou Agni, as the felly rings the spokes, encompassest the Gods.
Devanāgarī: अग्ने नेमिरराँ इव देवाँस्त्वं परिभूरसि
pada pāṭha: agne | nemiḥ | arān-iva | devān | tvam | pari-bhūḥ | asi || ā | rādhaḥ | citram | r̥ñjase ||5.13.6||

IAST: ā rādhaś citram ṛñjase
Griffith: yearn for bounty manifold.
Devanāgarī: आ राधश्चित्रमृञ्जसे
pada pāṭha: agne | nemiḥ | arān-iva | devān | tvam | pari-bhūḥ | asi || ā | rādhaḥ | citram | r̥ñjase ||5.13.6||

IAST: agniṁ stomena bodhaya samidhāno amartyam
Griffith: ENKINDLING the Immortal, wake Agni with song of praise:
Devanāgarī: अग्निं स्तोमेन बोधय समिधानो अमर्त्यम्
pada pāṭha: agnim | stomena | bodhaya | sam-idhānaḥ | amartyam || havyā | deveṣu | naḥ | dadhat ||5.14.1||

IAST: havyā deveṣu no dadhat
Griffith: may he bear our oblations to the Gods.
Devanāgarī: हव्या देवेषु नो दधत्
pada pāṭha: agnim | stomena | bodhaya | sam-idhānaḥ | amartyam || havyā | deveṣu | naḥ | dadhat ||5.14.1||

IAST: tam adhvareṣv īḻate devam martā amartyam
Griffith: At high solemnities mortal men glorify him the Immortal, best
Devanāgarī: तमध्वरेष्वीळते देवं मर्ता अमर्त्यम्
pada pāṭha: tam | adhvareṣu | īḷate | devam | martāḥ | amartyam || yajiṣṭham | mānuṣe | jane ||5.14.2||

IAST: yajiṣṭham mānuṣe jane
Griffith: At sacrifice among mankind.
Devanāgarī: यजिष्ठं मानुषे जने
pada pāṭha: tam | adhvareṣu | īḷate | devam | martāḥ | amartyam || yajiṣṭham | mānuṣe | jane ||5.14.2||

IAST: taṁ hi śaśvanta īḻate srucā devaṁ ghṛtaścutā
Griffith: That he may bear their gifts to heaven, all glorify him Agni, God,
Devanāgarī: तं हि शश्वन्त ईळते स्रुचा देवं घृतश्चुता
pada pāṭha: tam | hi | śaśvantaḥ | īḷate | srucā | devam | ghr̥ta-ścutā || agnim | havyāya | voḷhave ||5.14.3||

IAST: agniṁ havyāya voḻhave
Griffith: With ladle that distilleth oil.
Devanāgarī: अग्निं हव्याय वोळ्हवे
pada pāṭha: tam | hi | śaśvantaḥ | īḷate | srucā | devam | ghr̥ta-ścutā || agnim | havyāya | voḷhave ||5.14.3||

IAST: agnir jāto arocata ghnan dasyūñ jyotiṣā tamaḥ
Griffith: Agni shone bright when born, with light killing the Dasyus and the dark:
Devanāgarī: अग्निर्जातो अरोचत घ्नन्दस्यूञ्ज्योतिषा तमः
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | jātaḥ | arocata | ghnan | dasyūn | jyotiṣā | tamaḥ || avindat | gāḥ | apaḥ | svariti svaḥ ||5.14.4||

IAST: avindad gā apaḥ svaḥ
Griffith: He found the Kine, the Floods, the Sun.
Devanāgarī: अविन्दद्गा अपः स्वः
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | jātaḥ | arocata | ghnan | dasyūn | jyotiṣā | tamaḥ || avindat | gāḥ | apaḥ | svariti svaḥ ||5.14.4||

IAST: agnim īḻenyaṁ kaviṁ ghṛtapṛṣṭhaṁ saparyata
Griffith: Serve Agni, God adorable, the Sage whose back is balmed with oil:
Devanāgarī: अग्निमीळेन्यं कविं घृतपृष्ठं सपर्यत
pada pāṭha: agnim | īḷenyam | kavim | ghr̥ta-pr̥ṣṭham | saparyata || vetu | me | śr̥ṇavat | havam ||5.14.5||

IAST: vetu me śṛṇavad dhavam
Griffith: Let him approach, and hear my call.
Devanāgarī: वेतु मे शृणवद्धवम्
pada pāṭha: agnim | īḷenyam | kavim | ghr̥ta-pr̥ṣṭham | saparyata || vetu | me | śr̥ṇavat | havam ||5.14.5||

IAST: agniṁ ghṛtena vāvṛdhuḥ stomebhir viśvacarṣaṇim
Griffith: They have exalted Agni, God of all mankind, with oil and hymns
Devanāgarī: अग्निं घृतेन वावृधुः स्तोमेभिर्विश्वचर्षणिम्
pada pāṭha: agnim | ghr̥tena | vavr̥dhuḥ | stomebhiḥ | viśva-carṣaṇim || su-ādhībhiḥ | vacasyu-bhiḥ ||5.14.6||

IAST: svādhībhir vacasyubhiḥ
Griffith: Of praise, devout and eloquent.
Devanāgarī: स्वाधीभिर्वचस्युभिः
pada pāṭha: agnim | ghr̥tena | vavr̥dhuḥ | stomebhiḥ | viśva-carṣaṇim || su-ādhībhiḥ | vacasyu-bhiḥ ||5.14.6||

IAST: pra vedhase kavaye vedyāya giram bhare yaśase pūrvyāya
Griffith: To him, the far-renowned, the wise Ordainer, ancient and glorious, a song I offer.
Devanāgarī: प्र वेधसे कवये वेद्याय गिरं भरे यशसे पूर्व्याय
pada pāṭha: pra | vedhase | kavaye | vedyāya | giram | bhare | yaśase | pūrvyāya || ghr̥ta-prasattaḥ | asuraḥ | su-śevaḥ | rāyaḥ | dhartā | dharuṇaḥ | vasvaḥ | agniḥ ||5.15.1||

IAST: ghṛtaprasatto asuraḥ suśevo rāyo dhartā dharuṇo vasvo agniḥ
Griffith: Enthroned in oil, the Asura, bliss-giver, is Agni, firm support of noble, riches.
Devanāgarī: घृतप्रसत्तो असुरः सुशेवो रायो धर्ता धरुणो वस्वो अग्निः
pada pāṭha: pra | vedhase | kavaye | vedyāya | giram | bhare | yaśase | pūrvyāya || ghr̥ta-prasattaḥ | asuraḥ | su-śevaḥ | rāyaḥ | dhartā | dharuṇaḥ | vasvaḥ | agniḥ ||5.15.1||

IAST: ṛtena ṛtaṁ dharuṇaṁ dhārayanta yajñasya śāke parame vyoman
Griffith: By holy Law they kept supporting Order, by help of sacrifice, in loftiest heaven,-
Devanāgarī: ऋतेन ऋतं धरुणं धारयन्त यज्ञस्य शाके परमे व्योमन्
pada pāṭha: r̥tena | r̥tam | dharuṇam | dhārayanta | yajñasya | śoke | parame | vi-oman || divaḥ | dharman | dharuṇe | seduṣaḥ | nr̥̄n | jātaiḥ | ajātān | abhi | ye | nanakṣuḥ ||5.15.2||

IAST: divo dharman dharuṇe seduṣo nṝñ jātair ajātām̐ abhi ye nanakṣuḥ
Griffith: They who attained with born men to the unborn, men seated on that stay, heaven's firm sustainer.
Devanāgarī: दिवो धर्मन्धरुणे सेदुषो नॄञ्जातैरजाताँ अभि ये ननक्षुः
pada pāṭha: r̥tena | r̥tam | dharuṇam | dhārayanta | yajñasya | śoke | parame | vi-oman || divaḥ | dharman | dharuṇe | seduṣaḥ | nr̥̄n | jātaiḥ | ajātān | abhi | ye | nanakṣuḥ ||5.15.2||

IAST: aṅhoyuvas tanvas tanvate vi vayo mahad duṣṭaram pūrvyāya
Griffith: Averting woe, they labour hard to bring him, the ancient, plenteous food as power resistless.
Devanāgarī: अङ्होयुवस्तन्वस्तन्वते वि वयो महद्दुष्टरं पूर्व्याय
pada pāṭha: aṁhaḥ-yuvaḥ | tanvaḥ | tanvate | vi | vayaḥ | mahat | dustaram | pūrvyāya || saḥ | sam-vataḥ | nava-jātaḥ | tuturyāt | siṁham | na | kruddham | abhitaḥ | pari | sthuḥ ||5.15.3||

IAST: sa saṁvato navajātas tuturyāt siṅhaṁ na kruddham abhitaḥ pari ṣṭhuḥ
Griffith: May he, born newly, conquer his assailants: round him they stand as round an angry lion.
Devanāgarī: स संवतो नवजातस्तुतुर्यात्सिङ्हं न क्रुद्धमभितः परि ष्ठुः
pada pāṭha: aṁhaḥ-yuvaḥ | tanvaḥ | tanvate | vi | vayaḥ | mahat | dustaram | pūrvyāya || saḥ | sam-vataḥ | nava-jātaḥ | tuturyāt | siṁham | na | kruddham | abhitaḥ | pari | sthuḥ ||5.15.3||

IAST: māteva yad bharase paprathāno janaṁ-janaṁ dhāyase cakṣase ca
Griffith: When, like a mother, spreading forth to nourish, to cherish and regard each man that liveth,-
Devanāgarī: मातेव यद्भरसे पप्रथानो जनंजनं धायसे चक्षसे च
pada pāṭha: mātā-iva | yat | bharase | paprathānaḥ | janam-janam | dhāyase | cakṣase | ca || vayaḥ-vayaḥ | jarase | yat | dadhānaḥ | pari | tmanā | viṣu-rūpaḥ | jigāsi ||5.15.4||

IAST: vayo-vayo jarase yad dadhānaḥ pari tmanā viṣurūpo jigāsi
Griffith: Consuming all the strength that thou hast gotten, thou wanderest round, thyself, in varied fashion.
Devanāgarī: वयोवयो जरसे यद्दधानः परि त्मना विषुरूपो जिगासि
pada pāṭha: mātā-iva | yat | bharase | paprathānaḥ | janam-janam | dhāyase | cakṣase | ca || vayaḥ-vayaḥ | jarase | yat | dadhānaḥ | pari | tmanā | viṣu-rūpaḥ | jigāsi ||5.15.4||

IAST: vājo nu te śavasas pātv antam uruṁ doghaṁ dharuṇaṁ deva rāyaḥ
Griffith: May strength preserve the compass of thy vigour, God! that broad stream of thine that beareth riches.
Devanāgarī: वाजो नु ते शवसस्पात्वन्तमुरुं दोघं धरुणं देव रायः
pada pāṭha: vājaḥ | nu | te | śavasaḥ | pātu | antam | urum | dogham | dharuṇam | deva | rāyaḥ || padam | na | tāyuḥ | guhā | dadhānaḥ | mahaḥ | rāye | citayan | atrim | asparityaspaḥ ||5.15.5||

IAST: padaṁ na tāyur guhā dadhāno maho rāye citayann atrim aspaḥ
Griffith: Thou, like a thief who keeps his refuge secret, hast holpen Atri to great wealth, by teaching.
Devanāgarī: पदं न तायुर्गुहा दधानो महो राये चितयन्नत्रिमस्पः
pada pāṭha: vājaḥ | nu | te | śavasaḥ | pātu | antam | urum | dogham | dharuṇam | deva | rāyaḥ || padam | na | tāyuḥ | guhā | dadhānaḥ | mahaḥ | rāye | citayan | atrim | asparityaspaḥ ||5.15.5||

IAST: bṛhad vayo hi bhānave 'rcā devāyāgnaye
Griffith: GREAT power is in the beam of light, sing praise to, Agni, to the God
Devanāgarī: बृहद्वयो हि भानवेऽर्चा देवायाग्नये
pada pāṭha: br̥hat | vayaḥ | hi | bhānave | arca | devāya | agnaye || yam | mitram | na | praśasti-bhiḥ | martāsaḥ | dadhire | puraḥ ||5.16.1||

IAST: yam mitraṁ na praśastibhir martāso dadhire puraḥ
Griffith: Whom men have set in foremost place like Mitra with their eulogies.
Devanāgarī: यं मित्रं न प्रशस्तिभिर्मर्तासो दधिरे पुरः
pada pāṭha: br̥hat | vayaḥ | hi | bhānave | arca | devāya | agnaye || yam | mitram | na | praśasti-bhiḥ | martāsaḥ | dadhire | puraḥ ||5.16.1||

IAST: sa hi dyubhir janānāṁ hotā dakṣasya bāhvoḥ
Griffith: He by the splendour of his arms is Priest of every able man.
Devanāgarī: स हि द्युभिर्जनानां होता दक्षस्य बाह्वोः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | hi | dyu-bhiḥ | janānām | hotā | dakṣasya | bāhvoḥ || vi | havyam | agniḥ | ānuṣak | bhagaḥ | na | vāram | r̥ṇvati ||5.16.2||

IAST: vi havyam agnir ānuṣag bhago na vāram ṛṇvati
Griffith: Agni conveys oblation straight, and deals, as Bhaga deals, his boons.
Devanāgarī: वि हव्यमग्निरानुषग्भगो न वारमृण्वति
pada pāṭha: saḥ | hi | dyu-bhiḥ | janānām | hotā | dakṣasya | bāhvoḥ || vi | havyam | agniḥ | ānuṣak | bhagaḥ | na | vāram | r̥ṇvati ||5.16.2||

IAST: asya stome maghonaḥ sakhye vṛddhaśociṣaḥ
Griffith: All rests upon the laud and love of him the rich, high-flaming God,
Devanāgarī: अस्य स्तोमे मघोनः सख्ये वृद्धशोचिषः
pada pāṭha: asya | stome | maghonaḥ | sakhye | vr̥ddha-śociṣaḥ || viśvā | yasmin | tuvi-svaṇi | sam | arye | śuṣmam | ā-dadhuḥ ||5.16.3||

IAST: viśvā yasmin tuviṣvaṇi sam arye śuṣmam ādadhuḥ
Griffith: On whom, loud-roaring, men have laid great strength as on a faithful friend.
Devanāgarī: विश्वा यस्मिन्तुविष्वणि समर्ये शुष्ममादधुः
pada pāṭha: asya | stome | maghonaḥ | sakhye | vr̥ddha-śociṣaḥ || viśvā | yasmin | tuvi-svaṇi | sam | arye | śuṣmam | ā-dadhuḥ ||5.16.3||

IAST: adhā hy agna eṣāṁ suvīryasya maṁhanā
Griffith: So, Agni, be the Friend of these with liberal gift of hero strength.
Devanāgarī: अधा ह्यग्न एषां सुवीर्यस्य मंहना
pada pāṭha: adha | hi | agne | eṣām | su-vīryasya | maṁhanā || tam | it | yahvam | na | rodasī iti | pari | śravaḥ | babhūvatuḥ ||5.16.4||

IAST: tam id yahvaṁ na rodasī pari śravo babhūvatuḥ
Griffith: Yea, Heaven and Earth have not surpassed this Youthful One in glorious fame.
Devanāgarī: तमिद्यह्वं न रोदसी परि श्रवो बभूवतुः
pada pāṭha: adha | hi | agne | eṣām | su-vīryasya | maṁhanā || tam | it | yahvam | na | rodasī iti | pari | śravaḥ | babhūvatuḥ ||5.16.4||

IAST: nū na ehi vāryam agne gṛṇāna ā bhara
Griffith: O Agni, quickly come to us, and, glorified, bring precious wealth.
Devanāgarī: नू न एहि वार्यमग्ने गृणान आ भर
pada pāṭha: nu | naḥ | ā | ihi | vāryam | agne | gr̥ṇānaḥ | ā | bhara || ye | vayam | ye | ca | sūrayaḥ | svasti | dhāmahe | sacā | uta | edhi | pr̥t-su | naḥ | vr̥dhe ||5.16.5||

IAST: ye vayaṁ ye ca sūrayaḥ svasti dhāmahe sacotaidhi pṛtsu no vṛdhe
Griffith: So we and these our princes will assemble for the good of all. Be near in fight to prosper us.
Devanāgarī: ये वयं ये च सूरयः स्वस्ति धामहे सचोतैधि पृत्सु नो वृधे
pada pāṭha: nu | naḥ | ā | ihi | vāryam | agne | gr̥ṇānaḥ | ā | bhara || ye | vayam | ye | ca | sūrayaḥ | svasti | dhāmahe | sacā | uta | edhi | pr̥t-su | naḥ | vr̥dhe ||5.16.5||

IAST: ā yajñair deva martya itthā tavyāṁsam ūtaye
Griffith: GOD, may a mortal call the Strong hither, with solemn rites, to aid,
Devanāgarī: आ यज्ञैर्देव मर्त्य इत्था तव्यांसमूतये
pada pāṭha: ā | yajñaiḥ | deva | martyaḥ | itthā | tavyāṁsam | ūtaye || agnim | kr̥te | su-adhvare | pūruḥ | īḷīta | avase ||5.17.1||

IAST: agniṁ kṛte svadhvare pūrur īḻītāvase
Griffith: A man call Agni to protect when sacrifice is well prepared.
Devanāgarī: अग्निं कृते स्वध्वरे पूरुरीळीतावसे
pada pāṭha: ā | yajñaiḥ | deva | martyaḥ | itthā | tavyāṁsam | ūtaye || agnim | kr̥te | su-adhvare | pūruḥ | īḷīta | avase ||5.17.1||

IAST: asya hi svayaśastara āsā vidharman manyase
Griffith: Near him thou seemest mightier still in native glory, set to hold
Devanāgarī: अस्य हि स्वयशस्तर आसा विधर्मन्मन्यसे
pada pāṭha: asya | hi | svayaśaḥ-taraḥ | āsā | vi-dharman | manyase || tam | nākam | citra-śociṣam | mandram | paraḥ | manīṣayā ||5.17.2||

IAST: taṁ nākaṁ citraśociṣam mandram paro manīṣayā
Griffith: Apart yon flame-hued vault of heaven, lovely beyond the thought of man.
Devanāgarī: तं नाकं चित्रशोचिषं मन्द्रं परो मनीषया
pada pāṭha: asya | hi | svayaśaḥ-taraḥ | āsā | vi-dharman | manyase || tam | nākam | citra-śociṣam | mandram | paraḥ | manīṣayā ||5.17.2||

IAST: asya vāsā u arciṣā ya āyukta tujā girā
Griffith: Yea, this is by the light of him whom powerful siong hath bound to act,
Devanāgarī: अस्य वासा उ अर्चिषा य आयुक्त तुजा गिरा
pada pāṭha: asya | vai | asau | ūm̐ iti | arciṣā | yaḥ | ayukta | tujā | girā || divaḥ | na | yasya | retasā | br̥hat | śocanti | arcayaḥ ||5.17.3||

IAST: divo na yasya retasā bṛhac chocanty arcayaḥ
Griffith: Whose bearns of splendour flash on high as though they sprang from heavenly seed.
Devanāgarī: दिवो न यस्य रेतसा बृहच्छोचन्त्यर्चयः
pada pāṭha: asya | vai | asau | ūm̐ iti | arciṣā | yaḥ | ayukta | tujā | girā || divaḥ | na | yasya | retasā | br̥hat | śocanti | arcayaḥ ||5.17.3||

IAST: asya kratvā vicetaso dasmasya vasu ratha ā
Griffith: Wealth loads the Wonder-Worker's car through his, the very wise One's power.
Devanāgarī: अस्य क्रत्वा विचेतसो दस्मस्य वसु रथ आ
pada pāṭha: asya | kratvā | vi-cetasaḥ | dasmasya | vasu | rathe | ā || adha | viśvāsu | havyaḥ | agniḥ | vikṣu | pra | śasyate ||5.17.4||

IAST: adhā viśvāsu havyo 'gnir vikṣu pra śasyate
Griffith: Then, meet to be invoked among all tribes, is Agni ghorified.
Devanāgarī: अधा विश्वासु हव्योऽग्निर्विक्षु प्र शस्यते
pada pāṭha: asya | kratvā | vi-cetasaḥ | dasmasya | vasu | rathe | ā || adha | viśvāsu | havyaḥ | agniḥ | vikṣu | pra | śasyate ||5.17.4||

IAST: nū na id dhi vāryam āsā sacanta sūrayaḥ
Griffith: Now, too, the princes shall obtain excellent riches by our lips.
Devanāgarī: नू न इद्धि वार्यमासा सचन्त सूरयः
pada pāṭha: nu | naḥ | it | hi | vāryam | āsā | sacanta | sūrayaḥ || ūrjaḥ | napāt | abhiṣṭaye | pāhi | śagdhi | svastaye | uta | edhi | pr̥t-su | naḥ | vr̥dhe ||5.17.5||

IAST: ūrjo napād abhiṣṭaye pāhi śagdhi svastaya utaidhi pṛtsu no vṛdhe
Griffith: Protect us for our welfare: lend thy succour, O thou Son of Strength. Be near in fight to prosper us.
Devanāgarī: ऊर्जो नपादभिष्टये पाहि शग्धि स्वस्तय उतैधि पृत्सु नो वृधे
pada pāṭha: nu | naḥ | it | hi | vāryam | āsā | sacanta | sūrayaḥ || ūrjaḥ | napāt | abhiṣṭaye | pāhi | śagdhi | svastaye | uta | edhi | pr̥t-su | naḥ | vr̥dhe ||5.17.5||

IAST: prātar agniḥ purupriyo viśaḥ stavetātithiḥ
Griffith: AT dawn let: Agni, much-beloved guest of the house, be glorified;
Devanāgarī: प्रातरग्निः पुरुप्रियो विशः स्तवेतातिथिः
pada pāṭha: prātaḥ | agniḥ | puru-priyaḥ | viśaḥ | staveta | atithiḥ || viśvāni | yaḥ | amartyaḥ | havyā | marteṣu | raṇyati ||5.18.1||

IAST: viśvāni yo amartyo havyā marteṣu raṇyati
Griffith: Immortal who delights in all oblations brought by mortal men.
Devanāgarī: विश्वानि यो अमर्त्यो हव्या मर्तेषु रण्यति
pada pāṭha: prātaḥ | agniḥ | puru-priyaḥ | viśaḥ | staveta | atithiḥ || viśvāni | yaḥ | amartyaḥ | havyā | marteṣu | raṇyati ||5.18.1||

IAST: dvitāya mṛktavāhase svasya dakṣasya maṁhanā
Griffith: For Dvita who receives through wealth of native strength maimed offerings,
Devanāgarī: द्विताय मृक्तवाहसे स्वस्य दक्षस्य मंहना
pada pāṭha: dvitāya | mr̥kta-vāhase | svasya | dakṣasya | maṁhanā || indum | saḥ | dhatte | ānuṣak | stotā | cit | te | amartya ||5.18.2||

IAST: induṁ sa dhatta ānuṣak stotā cit te amartya
Griffith: Thy praiser even gains at once the Soma-drops, Immortal Gods!
Devanāgarī: इन्दुं स धत्त आनुषक्स्तोता चित्ते अमर्त्य
pada pāṭha: dvitāya | mr̥kta-vāhase | svasya | dakṣasya | maṁhanā || indum | saḥ | dhatte | ānuṣak | stotā | cit | te | amartya ||5.18.2||

IAST: taṁ vo dīrghāyuśociṣaṁ girā huve maghonām
Griffith: Nobles, with song I call that car of yours that shines with lengthened life,
Devanāgarī: तं वो दीर्घायुशोचिषं गिरा हुवे मघोनाम्
pada pāṭha: tam | vaḥ | dīrghāyu-śociṣam | girā | huve | maghonām || ariṣṭaḥ | yeṣām | rathaḥ | vi | aśva-dāvan | īyate ||5.18.3||

IAST: ariṣṭo yeṣāṁ ratho vy aśvadāvann īyate
Griffith: For, God who givest steeds! that car hither and thither goes unharmed.
Devanāgarī: अरिष्टो येषां रथो व्यश्वदावन्नीयते
pada pāṭha: tam | vaḥ | dīrghāyu-śociṣam | girā | huve | maghonām || ariṣṭaḥ | yeṣām | rathaḥ | vi | aśva-dāvan | īyate ||5.18.3||

IAST: citrā vā yeṣu dīdhitir āsann ukthā pānti ye
Griffith: They who have varied ways of thought, who guard, the lauds within their lips,
Devanāgarī: चित्रा वा येषु दीधितिरासन्नुक्था पान्ति ये
pada pāṭha: citrā | vā | yeṣu | dīdhitiḥ | āsan | ukthā | pānti | ye || stīrṇam | barhiḥ | svaḥ-nare | śravāṁsi | dadhire | pari ||5.18.4||

IAST: stīrṇam barhiḥ svarṇare śravāṁsi dadhire pari
Griffith: And strew the grass before the light, have decked themselves with high renown.
Devanāgarī: स्तीर्णं बर्हिः स्वर्णरे श्रवांसि दधिरे परि
pada pāṭha: citrā | vā | yeṣu | dīdhitiḥ | āsan | ukthā | pānti | ye || stīrṇam | barhiḥ | svaḥ-nare | śravāṁsi | dadhire | pari ||5.18.4||

IAST: ye me pañcāśataṁ dadur aśvānāṁ sadhastuti
Griffith: Immortal Agni, give the chiefs, heroes who institute the rite,
Devanāgarī: ये मे पञ्चाशतं ददुरश्वानां सधस्तुति
pada pāṭha: ye | me | pañcāśatam | daduḥ | aśvānām | sadha-stuti || dyu-mat | agne | mahi | śravaḥ | br̥hat | kr̥dhi | maghonām | nr̥-vat | amr̥ta | nr̥ṇām ||5.18.5||

IAST: dyumad agne mahi śravo bṛhat kṛdhi maghonāṁ nṛvad amṛta nṛṇām
Griffith: Heroes' illustrious, lofty fame, who at the synod met for praise presented me with fifty steeds.
Devanāgarī: द्युमदग्ने महि श्रवो बृहत्कृधि मघोनां नृवदमृत नृणाम्
pada pāṭha: ye | me | pañcāśatam | daduḥ | aśvānām | sadha-stuti || dyu-mat | agne | mahi | śravaḥ | br̥hat | kr̥dhi | maghonām | nr̥-vat | amr̥ta | nr̥ṇām ||5.18.5||

IAST: abhy avasthāḥ pra jāyante pra vavrer vavriś ciketa
Griffith: ONE state begets another state: husk is made visible from husk:
Devanāgarī: अभ्यवस्थाः प्र जायन्ते प्र वव्रेर्वव्रिश्चिकेत
pada pāṭha: abhi | ava-sthāḥ | pra | jāyante | pra | vavreḥ | vavriḥ | ciketa || upa-sthe | mātuḥ | vi | caṣṭe ||5.19.1||

IAST: upasthe mātur vi caṣṭe
Griffith: Within his Mother's side he speaks.
Devanāgarī: उपस्थे मातुर्वि चष्टे
pada pāṭha: abhi | ava-sthāḥ | pra | jāyante | pra | vavreḥ | vavriḥ | ciketa || upa-sthe | mātuḥ | vi | caṣṭe ||5.19.1||

IAST: juhure vi citayanto 'nimiṣaṁ nṛmṇam pānti
Griffith: Discerning, have they offered gifts: they guard the strength that never wastes.
Devanāgarī: जुहुरे वि चितयन्तोऽनिमिषं नृम्णं पान्ति
pada pāṭha: juhure | vi | citayantaḥ | ani-miṣam | nr̥mṇam | pānti || ā | dr̥ḷhām | puram | viviśuḥ ||5.19.2||

IAST: ā dṛḻhām puraṁ viviśuḥ
Griffith: To a strong fort have they pressed in.
Devanāgarī: आ दृळ्हां पुरं विविशुः
pada pāṭha: juhure | vi | citayantaḥ | ani-miṣam | nr̥mṇam | pānti || ā | dr̥ḷhām | puram | viviśuḥ ||5.19.2||

IAST: ā śvaitreyasya jantavo dyumad vardhanta kṛṣṭayaḥ
Griffith: Svaitreya's people, all his men, have gloriously increased in might.
Devanāgarī: आ श्वैत्रेयस्य जन्तवो द्युमद्वर्धन्त कृष्टयः
pada pāṭha: ā | śvaitreyasya | jantavaḥ | dyu-mat | vardhanta | kr̥ṣṭayaḥ || niṣka-grīvaḥ | br̥hat-ukthaḥ | enā | madhvā | na | vāja-yuḥ ||5.19.3||

IAST: niṣkagrīvo bṛhaduktha enā madhvā na vājayuḥ
Griffith: A gold chain Brhaduktha wears, as, through this Soma, seeking spoil.
Devanāgarī: निष्कग्रीवो बृहदुक्थ एना मध्वा न वाजयुः
pada pāṭha: ā | śvaitreyasya | jantavaḥ | dyu-mat | vardhanta | kr̥ṣṭayaḥ || niṣka-grīvaḥ | br̥hat-ukthaḥ | enā | madhvā | na | vāja-yuḥ ||5.19.3||

IAST: priyaṁ dugdhaṁ na kāmyam ajāmi jāmyoḥ sacā
Griffith: I bring, as 'twere, the longed-for milk, the dear milk of the Sister-Pair.
Devanāgarī: प्रियं दुग्धं न काम्यमजामि जाम्योः सचा
pada pāṭha: priyam | dugdham | na | kāmyam | ajāmi | jāmyoḥ | sacā || gharmaḥ | na | vāja-jaṭharaḥ | adabdhaḥ | śaśvataḥ | dabhaḥ ||5.19.4||

IAST: gharmo na vājajaṭharo 'dabdhaḥ śaśvato dabhaḥ
Griffith: Like to a caldron filled with food is he, unconquered, conquering all.
Devanāgarī: घर्मो न वाजजठरोऽदब्धः शश्वतो दभः
pada pāṭha: priyam | dugdham | na | kāmyam | ajāmi | jāmyoḥ | sacā || gharmaḥ | na | vāja-jaṭharaḥ | adabdhaḥ | śaśvataḥ | dabhaḥ ||5.19.4||

IAST: krīḻan no raśma ā bhuvaḥ sam bhasmanā vāyunā vevidānaḥ
Griffith: Beam of light, come to us in sportive fashion, finding thyself close to the wind that fans thee.
Devanāgarī: क्रीळन्नो रश्म आ भुवः सं भस्मना वायुना वेविदानः
pada pāṭha: krīḷan | naḥ | raśme | ā | bhuvaḥ | sam | bhasmanā | vāyunā | vevidānaḥ || tāḥ | asya | san | dhr̥ṣajaḥ | na | tigmāḥ | su-saṁśitāḥ | vakṣyaḥ | vakṣaṇe-sthāḥ ||5.19.5||

IAST: tā asya san dhṛṣajo na tigmāḥ susaṁśitā vakṣyo vakṣaṇesthāḥ
Griffith: These flames of his are wasting flames, like arrows keen-pointed, sharpened, on his breast.
Devanāgarī: ता अस्य सन्धृषजो न तिग्माः सुसंशिता वक्ष्यो वक्षणेस्थाः
pada pāṭha: krīḷan | naḥ | raśme | ā | bhuvaḥ | sam | bhasmanā | vāyunā | vevidānaḥ || tāḥ | asya | san | dhr̥ṣajaḥ | na | tigmāḥ | su-saṁśitāḥ | vakṣyaḥ | vakṣaṇe-sthāḥ ||5.19.5||

IAST: yam agne vājasātama tvaṁ cin manyase rayim
Griffith: AGNI, best winner of the spoil, cause us to praise before the Gods
Devanāgarī: यमग्ने वाजसातम त्वं चिन्मन्यसे रयिम्
pada pāṭha: yam | agne | vāja-sātama | tvam | cit | manyase | rayim || tam | naḥ | gīḥ-bhiḥ | śravāyyam | deva-trā | panaya | yujam ||5.20.1||

IAST: taṁ no gīrbhiḥ śravāyyaṁ devatrā panayā yujam
Griffith: As our associate meet for lauds, wealth which thou verily deemest wealth.
Devanāgarī: तं नो गीर्भिः श्रवाय्यं देवत्रा पनया युजम्
pada pāṭha: yam | agne | vāja-sātama | tvam | cit | manyase | rayim || tam | naḥ | gīḥ-bhiḥ | śravāyyam | deva-trā | panaya | yujam ||5.20.1||

IAST: ye agne nerayanti te vṛddhā ugrasya śavasaḥ
Griffith: Agni, the great who ward not off the anger of thy power and might
Devanāgarī: ये अग्ने नेरयन्ति ते वृद्धा उग्रस्य शवसः
pada pāṭha: ye | agne | na | īrayanti | te | vr̥ddhāḥ | ugrasya | śavasaḥ || apa | dveṣaḥ | apa | hvaraḥ | anya-vratasya | saścire ||5.20.2||

IAST: apa dveṣo apa hvaro 'nyavratasya saścire
Griffith: Stir up the wrath and hatred due to one who holds an alien creed.
Devanāgarī: अप द्वेषो अप ह्वरोऽन्यव्रतस्य सश्चिरे
pada pāṭha: ye | agne | na | īrayanti | te | vr̥ddhāḥ | ugrasya | śavasaḥ || apa | dveṣaḥ | apa | hvaraḥ | anya-vratasya | saścire ||5.20.2||

IAST: hotāraṁ tvā vṛṇīmahe 'gne dakṣasya sādhanam
Griffith: Thee, Agni, would we choose as Priest, the perfecter of strength and skill;
Devanāgarī: होतारं त्वा वृणीमहेऽग्ने दक्षस्य साधनम्
pada pāṭha: hotāram | tvā | vr̥ṇīmahe | agne | dakṣasya | sādhanam || yajñeṣu | pūrvyam | girā | prayasvantaḥ | havāmahe ||5.20.3||

IAST: yajñeṣu pūrvyaṁ girā prayasvanto havāmahe
Griffith: We who bring sacred food invoke with song thee Chief at holy rites.
Devanāgarī: यज्ञेषु पूर्व्यं गिरा प्रयस्वन्तो हवामहे
pada pāṭha: hotāram | tvā | vr̥ṇīmahe | agne | dakṣasya | sādhanam || yajñeṣu | pūrvyam | girā | prayasvantaḥ | havāmahe ||5.20.3||

IAST: itthā yathā ta ūtaye sahasāvan dive-dive
Griffith: Here as is needful for thine aid we toil, O Conqueror, day by day,
Devanāgarī: इत्था यथा त ऊतये सहसावन्दिवेदिवे
pada pāṭha: itthā | yathā | te | ūtaye | sahasā-van | dive-dive || rāye | r̥tāya | sukrato iti su-krato | gobhiḥ | syāma | sadha-mādaḥ | vīraiḥ | syāma | sadha-mādaḥ ||5.20.4||

IAST: rāya ṛtāya sukrato gobhiḥ ṣyāma sadhamādo vīraiḥ syāma sadhamādaḥ
Griffith: For wealth, for Law. May we rejoice, Most Wise One! at the feast, with kine, rejoice, with heroes, at t
Devanāgarī: राय ऋताय सुक्रतो गोभिः ष्याम सधमादो वीरैः स्याम सधमादः
pada pāṭha: itthā | yathā | te | ūtaye | sahasā-van | dive-dive || rāye | r̥tāya | sukrato iti su-krato | gobhiḥ | syāma | sadha-mādaḥ | vīraiḥ | syāma | sadha-mādaḥ ||5.20.4||

IAST: manuṣvat tvā ni dhīmahi manuṣvat sam idhīmahi
Griffith: WE stablish thee as Manus used, as Manus used we kindle thee.
Devanāgarī: मनुष्वत्त्वा नि धीमहि मनुष्वत्समिधीमहि
pada pāṭha: manuṣvat | tvā | ni | dhīmahi | manuṣvat | sam | idhīmahi || agne | manuṣvat | aṅgiraḥ | devān | deva-yate | yaja ||5.21.1||

IAST: agne manuṣvad aṅgiro devān devayate yaja
Griffith: Like Manus, for the pious man , Angiras, Agni, worship Gods.
Devanāgarī: अग्ने मनुष्वदङ्गिरो देवान्देवयते यज
pada pāṭha: manuṣvat | tvā | ni | dhīmahi | manuṣvat | sam | idhīmahi || agne | manuṣvat | aṅgiraḥ | devān | deva-yate | yaja ||5.21.1||

IAST: tvaṁ hi mānuṣe jane 'gne suprīta idhyase
Griffith: For well, O Agni, art thou pleased when thou art kindled mid mankind.
Devanāgarī: त्वं हि मानुषे जनेऽग्ने सुप्रीत इध्यसे
pada pāṭha: tvam | hi | mānuṣe | jane | agne | su-prītaḥ | idhyase || srucaḥ | tvā | yanti | ānuṣak | su-jāta | sarpiḥ-āsute ||5.21.2||

IAST: srucas tvā yanty ānuṣak sujāta sarpirāsute
Griffith: Straight go the ladles unto thee, thou highborn God whose food is oil.
Devanāgarī: स्रुचस्त्वा यन्त्यानुषक्सुजात सर्पिरासुते
pada pāṭha: tvam | hi | mānuṣe | jane | agne | su-prītaḥ | idhyase || srucaḥ | tvā | yanti | ānuṣak | su-jāta | sarpiḥ-āsute ||5.21.2||

IAST: tvāṁ viśve sajoṣaso devāso dūtam akrata
Griffith: Thee have all Gods of one accord established as their messenger.
Devanāgarī: त्वां विश्वे सजोषसो देवासो दूतमक्रत
pada pāṭha: tvām | viśve | sa-joṣasaḥ | devāsaḥ | dūtam | akrata || saparyantaḥ | tvā | kave | yajñeṣu | devam | īḷate ||5.21.3||

IAST: saparyantas tvā kave yajñeṣu devam īḻate
Griffith: Serving at sacrifices men adore thee as a God, O Sage.
Devanāgarī: सपर्यन्तस्त्वा कवे यज्ञेषु देवमीळते
pada pāṭha: tvām | viśve | sa-joṣasaḥ | devāsaḥ | dūtam | akrata || saparyantaḥ | tvā | kave | yajñeṣu | devam | īḷate ||5.21.3||

IAST: devaṁ vo devayajyayāgnim īḻīta martyaḥ
Griffith: Let mortal man adore your God, Agni, with worship due to Gods.
Devanāgarī: देवं वो देवयज्ययाग्निमीळीत मर्त्यः
pada pāṭha: devam | vaḥ | deva-yajyayā | agnim | īḷīta | martyaḥ || sam-iddhaḥ | śukra | dīdihi | r̥tasya | yonim | ā | asadaḥ | sasasya | yonim | ā | asadaḥ ||5.21.4||

IAST: samiddhaḥ śukra dīdihy ṛtasya yonim āsadaḥ sasasya yonim āsadaḥ
Griffith: Shine forth enkindled, Radiant One. Sit in the chamber of the Law, sit in the chamber of the food.
Devanāgarī: समिद्धः शुक्र दीदिह्यृतस्य योनिमासदः ससस्य योनिमासदः
pada pāṭha: devam | vaḥ | deva-yajyayā | agnim | īḷīta | martyaḥ || sam-iddhaḥ | śukra | dīdihi | r̥tasya | yonim | ā | asadaḥ | sasasya | yonim | ā | asadaḥ ||5.21.4||

IAST: pra viśvasāmann atrivad arcā pāvakaśociṣe
Griffith: LIKE Atri, Visvasaman! sing to him of purifying light,
Devanāgarī: प्र विश्वसामन्नत्रिवदर्चा पावकशोचिषे
pada pāṭha: pra | viśva-sāman | atri-vat | arca | pāvaka-śociṣe || yaḥ | adhvareṣu | īḍyaḥ | hotā | mandra-tamaḥ | viśi ||5.22.1||

IAST: yo adhvareṣv īḍyo hotā mandratamo viśi
Griffith: Who must be praised in holy rites, the Priest most welcome in the house.
Devanāgarī: यो अध्वरेष्वीड्यो होता मन्द्रतमो विशि
pada pāṭha: pra | viśva-sāman | atri-vat | arca | pāvaka-śociṣe || yaḥ | adhvareṣu | īḍyaḥ | hotā | mandra-tamaḥ | viśi ||5.22.1||

IAST: ny agniṁ jātavedasaṁ dadhātā devam ṛtvijam
Griffith: Set Jatavedas in his place, Agni the God and Minister.
Devanāgarī: न्यग्निं जातवेदसं दधाता देवमृत्विजम्
pada pāṭha: ni | agnim | jāta-vedasam | dadhāta | devam | r̥tvijam || pra | yajñaḥ | etu | ānuṣak | adya | devavyacaḥ-tamaḥ ||5.22.2||

IAST: pra yajña etv ānuṣag adyā devavyacastamaḥ
Griffith: Let sacrifice proceed to-day duly, comprising all the Gods.
Devanāgarī: प्र यज्ञ एत्वानुषगद्या देवव्यचस्तमः
pada pāṭha: ni | agnim | jāta-vedasam | dadhāta | devam | r̥tvijam || pra | yajñaḥ | etu | ānuṣak | adya | devavyacaḥ-tamaḥ ||5.22.2||

IAST: cikitvinmanasaṁ tvā devam martāsa ūtaye
Griffith: All mortals come to thee for aid, the God of most observant mind.
Devanāgarī: चिकित्विन्मनसं त्वा देवं मर्तास ऊतये
pada pāṭha: cikitvit-manasam | tvā | devam | martāsaḥ | ūtaye || vareṇyasya | te | avasaḥ | iyānāsaḥ | amanmahi ||5.22.3||

IAST: vareṇyasya te 'vasa iyānāso amanmahi
Griffith: Of thine excelling favour we bethink us as we long for it.
Devanāgarī: वरेण्यस्य तेऽवस इयानासो अमन्महि
pada pāṭha: cikitvit-manasam | tvā | devam | martāsaḥ | ūtaye || vareṇyasya | te | avasaḥ | iyānāsaḥ | amanmahi ||5.22.3||

IAST: agne cikiddhy asya na idaṁ vacaḥ sahasya
Griffith: Mark with attention this our speech, O Agni, thou victorious One.
Devanāgarī: अग्ने चिकिद्ध्यस्य न इदं वचः सहस्य
pada pāṭha: agne | cikiddhi | asya | naḥ | idam | vacaḥ | sahasya || tam | tvā | su-śipra | dam-pate | stomaiḥ | vardhanti | atrayaḥ | gīḥ-bhiḥ | śumbhanti | atrayaḥ ||5.22.4||

IAST: taṁ tvā suśipra dampate stomair vardhanty atrayo gīrbhiḥ śumbhanty atrayaḥ
Griffith: Thee, Strong-jawed! as the homestead's Lord, the Atris with their lauds exalt, the Atris beautify with s
Devanāgarī: तं त्वा सुशिप्र दम्पते स्तोमैर्वर्धन्त्यत्रयो गीर्भिः शुम्भन्त्यत्रयः
pada pāṭha: agne | cikiddhi | asya | naḥ | idam | vacaḥ | sahasya || tam | tvā | su-śipra | dam-pate | stomaiḥ | vardhanti | atrayaḥ | gīḥ-bhiḥ | śumbhanti | atrayaḥ ||5.22.4||

IAST: agne sahantam ā bhara dyumnasya prāsahā rayim
Griffith: By thy fair splendour's mighty power, O Agni, bring victorious wealth,
Devanāgarī: अग्ने सहन्तमा भर द्युम्नस्य प्रासहा रयिम्
pada pāṭha: agne | sahantam | ā | bhara | dyumnasya | pra-sahā | rayim || viśvāḥ | yaḥ | carṣaṇīḥ | abhi | āsā | vājeṣu | sasahat ||5.23.1||

IAST: viśvā yaś carṣaṇīr abhy āsā vājeṣu sāsahat
Griffith: Wealth that o'ercometh all mankind, and, near us, conquereth in fight.
Devanāgarī: विश्वा यश्चर्षणीरभ्यासा वाजेषु सासहत्
pada pāṭha: agne | sahantam | ā | bhara | dyumnasya | pra-sahā | rayim || viśvāḥ | yaḥ | carṣaṇīḥ | abhi | āsā | vājeṣu | sasahat ||5.23.1||

IAST: tam agne pṛtanāṣahaṁ rayiṁ sahasva ā bhara
Griffith: Victorious Agni, bring to us the wealth that vanquisheth in war;
Devanāgarī: तमग्ने पृतनाषहं रयिं सहस्व आ भर
pada pāṭha: tam | agne | pr̥tanā-saham | rayim | sahasvaḥ | ā | bhara || tvam | hi | satyaḥ | adbhutaḥ | dātā | vājasya | go-mataḥ ||5.23.2||

IAST: tvaṁ hi satyo adbhuto dātā vājasya gomataḥ
Griffith: For thou art wonderful and true, giver of strength in herds of kine.
Devanāgarī: त्वं हि सत्यो अद्भुतो दाता वाजस्य गोमतः
pada pāṭha: tam | agne | pr̥tanā-saham | rayim | sahasvaḥ | ā | bhara || tvam | hi | satyaḥ | adbhutaḥ | dātā | vājasya | go-mataḥ ||5.23.2||

IAST: viśve hi tvā sajoṣaso janāso vṛktabarhiṣaḥ
Griffith: For all the folk with one accord, whose sacred grass is trimmed and strewn,
Devanāgarī: विश्वे हि त्वा सजोषसो जनासो वृक्तबर्हिषः
pada pāṭha: viśve | hi | tvā | sa-joṣasaḥ | janāsaḥ | vr̥kta-barhiṣaḥ || hotāram | sadma-su | priyam | vyanti | vāryā | puru ||5.23.3||

IAST: hotāraṁ sadmasu priyaṁ vyanti vāryā puru
Griffith: Invite thee to their worship-halls, as a dear Priest, for choicest wealth.
Devanāgarī: होतारं सद्मसु प्रियं व्यन्ति वार्या पुरु
pada pāṭha: viśve | hi | tvā | sa-joṣasaḥ | janāsaḥ | vr̥kta-barhiṣaḥ || hotāram | sadma-su | priyam | vyanti | vāryā | puru ||5.23.3||

IAST: sa hi ṣmā viśvacarṣaṇir abhimāti saho dadhe
Griffith: For he, the God of all men, hath gotten him might that quelleth foes.
Devanāgarī: स हि ष्मा विश्वचर्षणिरभिमाति सहो दधे
pada pāṭha: saḥ | hi | sma | viśva-carṣaṇiḥ | abhi-māti | sahaḥ | dadhe || agne | eṣu | kṣayeṣu | ā | revat | naḥ | śukra | dīdihi | dyu-mat | pāvaka | dīdihi ||5.23.4||

IAST: agna eṣu kṣayeṣv ā revan naḥ śukra dīdihi dyumat pāvaka dīdihi
Griffith: O Agni, in these homes shine forth, bright God! for our prosperity, shine, Purifier! splendidly.
Devanāgarī: अग्न एषु क्षयेष्वा रेवन्नः शुक्र दीदिहि द्युमत्पावक दीदिहि
pada pāṭha: saḥ | hi | sma | viśva-carṣaṇiḥ | abhi-māti | sahaḥ | dadhe || agne | eṣu | kṣayeṣu | ā | revat | naḥ | śukra | dīdihi | dyu-mat | pāvaka | dīdihi ||5.23.4||

IAST: agne tvaṁ no antama uta trātā śivo bhavā varūthyaḥ
Griffith: O AGNI, be our nearest Friend, be thou a kind deliverer and a gracious Friend.
Devanāgarī: अग्ने त्वं नो अन्तम उत त्राता शिवो भवा वरूथ्यः॥ ५.०२४.०
pada pāṭha: agne | tvam | naḥ | antamaḥ | uta | trātā | śivaḥ | bhava | varūthyaḥ ||5.24.1||

IAST: vasur agnir vasuśravā acchā nakṣi dyumattamaṁ rayiṁ dāḥ
Griffith: Excellent Agni, come thou nigh to us, and give us wealth most splendidly renowned.
Devanāgarī: वसुरग्निर्वसुश्रवा अच्छा नक्षि द्युमत्तमं रयिं दाः॥ ५.०२४.०
pada pāṭha: vasuḥ | agniḥ | vasu-śravāḥ | accha | nakṣi | dyumat-tamam | rayim | dāḥ ||5.24.2||

IAST: sa no bodhi śrudhī havam uruṣyā ṇo aghāyataḥ samasmāt
Griffith: So hear us, listen to this call of ours, and keep us far from every sinful man.
Devanāgarī: स नो बोधि श्रुधी हवमुरुष्या णो अघायतः समस्मात्॥ ५.०२४.०
pada pāṭha: saḥ | naḥ | bodhi | śrudhi | havam | uruṣya | naḥ | agha-yataḥ | samasmāt ||5.24.3||

IAST: taṁ tvā śociṣṭha dīdivaḥ sumnāya nūnam īmahe sakhibhyaḥ
Griffith: To thee then, O Most Bright, O Radiant God, we come with prayer for happiness for our friends.
Devanāgarī: तं त्वा शोचिष्ठ दीदिवः सुम्नाय नूनमीमहे सखिभ्यः॥ ५.०२४.०
pada pāṭha: tam | tvā | śociṣṭha | dīdi-vaḥ | sumnāya | nūnam | īmahe | sakhi-bhyaḥ ||5.24.4||

IAST: acchā vo agnim avase devaṁ gāsi sa no vasuḥ
Griffith: I WILL sing near, for grace, your God Agni, for he is good to us.
Devanāgarī: अच्छा वो अग्निमवसे देवं गासि स नो वसुः
pada pāṭha: accha | vaḥ | agnim | avase | devam | gāsi | saḥ | naḥ | vasuḥ || rāsat | putraḥ | r̥ṣūṇām | r̥ta-vā | parṣati | dviṣaḥ ||5.25.1||

IAST: rāsat putra ṛṣūṇām ṛtāvā parṣati dviṣaḥ
Griffith: Son of the Brands, may he give gifts, and, righteous, save us from the foe.
Devanāgarī: रासत्पुत्र ऋषूणामृतावा पर्षति द्विषः
pada pāṭha: accha | vaḥ | agnim | avase | devam | gāsi | saḥ | naḥ | vasuḥ || rāsat | putraḥ | r̥ṣūṇām | r̥ta-vā | parṣati | dviṣaḥ ||5.25.1||

IAST: sa hi satyo yam pūrve cid devāsaś cid yam īdhire
Griffith: For be is true, whpm men of old enkindled, and the Gods themselves,
Devanāgarī: स हि सत्यो यं पूर्वे चिद्देवासश्चिद्यमीधिरे
pada pāṭha: saḥ | hi | satyaḥ | yam | pūrve | cit | devāsaḥ | cit | yam | īdhire || hotāram | mandra-jihvam | it | sudīti-bhiḥ | vibhā-vasum ||5.25.2||

IAST: hotāram mandrajihvam it sudītibhir vibhāvasum
Griffith: The Priest with the delicious tongue, rich with the light of glorious beams.
Devanāgarī: होतारं मन्द्रजिह्वमित्सुदीतिभिर्विभावसुम्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | hi | satyaḥ | yam | pūrve | cit | devāsaḥ | cit | yam | īdhire || hotāram | mandra-jihvam | it | sudīti-bhiḥ | vibhā-vasum ||5.25.2||

IAST: sa no dhītī variṣṭhayā śreṣṭhayā ca sumatyā
Griffith: With wisdom that surpasseth all, with gracious will most excellent,
Devanāgarī: स नो धीती वरिष्ठया श्रेष्ठया च सुमत्या
pada pāṭha: saḥ | naḥ | dhītī | variṣṭhayā | śreṣṭhayā | ca | su-matyā || agne | rāyaḥ | didīhi | naḥ | suvr̥kti-bhiḥ | vareṇya ||5.25.3||

IAST: agne rāyo didīhi naḥ suvṛktibhir vareṇya
Griffith: O Agni, worthy of our choice, shine wealth on us through hymns of praise.
Devanāgarī: अग्ने रायो दिदीहि नः सुवृक्तिभिर्वरेण्य
pada pāṭha: saḥ | naḥ | dhītī | variṣṭhayā | śreṣṭhayā | ca | su-matyā || agne | rāyaḥ | didīhi | naḥ | suvr̥kti-bhiḥ | vareṇya ||5.25.3||

IAST: agnir deveṣu rājaty agnir marteṣv āviśan
Griffith: Agni is King, for he extends to mortals and to Gods alike.
Devanāgarī: अग्निर्देवेषु राजत्यग्निर्मर्तेष्वाविशन्
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | deveṣu | rājati | agniḥ | marteṣu | ā-viśan || agniḥ | naḥ | havya-vāhanaḥ | agnim | dhībhiḥ | saparyata ||5.25.4||

IAST: agnir no havyavāhano 'gniṁ dhībhiḥ saparyata
Griffith: Agni is bearer of our gifts. Worship ye Agni with your thoughts.
Devanāgarī: अग्निर्नो हव्यवाहनोऽग्निं धीभिः सपर्यत
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | deveṣu | rājati | agniḥ | marteṣu | ā-viśan || agniḥ | naḥ | havya-vāhanaḥ | agnim | dhībhiḥ | saparyata ||5.25.4||

IAST: agnis tuviśravastamaṁ tuvibrahmāṇam uttamam
Griffith: Agni gives to the worshipper a son, the best, of mightiest fame,
Devanāgarī: अग्निस्तुविश्रवस्तमं तुविब्रह्माणमुत्तमम्
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | tuviśravaḥ-tamam | tuvi-brahmāṇam | ut-tamam || atūrtam | śravayat-patim | putram | dadāti | dāśuṣe ||5.25.5||

IAST: atūrtaṁ śrāvayatpatim putraṁ dadāti dāśuṣe
Griffith: Of deep devotion, ne'er subdued, bringer of glory to his sire.
Devanāgarī: अतूर्तं श्रावयत्पतिं पुत्रं ददाति दाशुषे
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | tuviśravaḥ-tamam | tuvi-brahmāṇam | ut-tamam || atūrtam | śravayat-patim | putram | dadāti | dāśuṣe ||5.25.5||

IAST: agnir dadāti satpatiṁ sāsāha yo yudhā nṛbhiḥ
Griffith: Agni bestows the hero-lord who conquers with the men in fight.
Devanāgarī: अग्निर्ददाति सत्पतिं सासाह यो युधा नृभिः
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | dadāti | sat-patim | sasāha | yaḥ | yudhā | nr̥-bhiḥ || agniḥ | atyam | raghu-syadam | jetāram | aparā-jitam ||5.25.6||

IAST: agnir atyaṁ raghuṣyadaṁ jetāram aparājitam
Griffith: Agni bestows the fleet-foot steed, the victor never overcome.
Devanāgarī: अग्निरत्यं रघुष्यदं जेतारमपराजितम्
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | dadāti | sat-patim | sasāha | yaḥ | yudhā | nr̥-bhiḥ || agniḥ | atyam | raghu-syadam | jetāram | aparā-jitam ||5.25.6||

IAST: yad vāhiṣṭhaṁ tad agnaye bṛhad arca vibhāvaso
Griffith: The mightiest song is Agni's: shine on high, thou who art rich in light.
Devanāgarī: यद्वाहिष्ठं तदग्नये बृहदर्च विभावसो
pada pāṭha: yat | vāhiṣṭham | tat | agnaye | br̥hat | arca | vibhāvaso iti vibhā-vaso || mahiṣī-iva | tvat | rayiḥ | tvat | vājāḥ | ut | īrate ||5.25.7||

IAST: mahiṣīva tvad rayis tvad vājā ud īrate
Griffith: Like the Chief Consort of a King, riches and strength proceed -from thee.
Devanāgarī: महिषीव त्वद्रयिस्त्वद्वाजा उदीरते
pada pāṭha: yat | vāhiṣṭham | tat | agnaye | br̥hat | arca | vibhāvaso iti vibhā-vaso || mahiṣī-iva | tvat | rayiḥ | tvat | vājāḥ | ut | īrate ||5.25.7||

IAST: tava dyumanto arcayo grāvevocyate bṛhat
Griffith: Resplendent are thy rays of light: loud is thy voice like pressing-stones.
Devanāgarī: तव द्युमन्तो अर्चयो ग्रावेवोच्यते बृहत्
pada pāṭha: tava | dyu-mantaḥ | arcayaḥ | grāvā-iva | ucyate | br̥hat || uto iti | te | tanyatuḥ | yathā | svānaḥ | arta | tmanā | divaḥ ||5.25.8||

IAST: uto te tanyatur yathā svāno arta tmanā divaḥ
Griffith: Yea, of itself thy thunder goes forth like the roaring of the heaven.
Devanāgarī: उतो ते तन्यतुर्यथा स्वानो अर्त त्मना दिवः
pada pāṭha: tava | dyu-mantaḥ | arcayaḥ | grāvā-iva | ucyate | br̥hat || uto iti | te | tanyatuḥ | yathā | svānaḥ | arta | tmanā | divaḥ ||5.25.8||

IAST: evām̐ agniṁ vasūyavaḥ sahasānaṁ vavandima
Griffith: Thus, seeking riches, have we paid homage to Agni Conqueror.
Devanāgarī: एवाँ अग्निं वसूयवः सहसानं ववन्दिम
pada pāṭha: eva | agnim | vasu-yavaḥ | sahasānam | vavandima || saḥ | naḥ | viśvāḥ | ati | dviṣaḥ | parṣat | nāvā-iva | su-kratuḥ ||5.25.9||

IAST: sa no viśvā ati dviṣaḥ parṣan nāveva sukratuḥ
Griffith: May he, most wise, as with a ship, carry us over all our foes.
Devanāgarī: स नो विश्वा अति द्विषः पर्षन्नावेव सुक्रतुः
pada pāṭha: eva | agnim | vasu-yavaḥ | sahasānam | vavandima || saḥ | naḥ | viśvāḥ | ati | dviṣaḥ | parṣat | nāvā-iva | su-kratuḥ ||5.25.9||

IAST: agne pāvaka rociṣā mandrayā deva jihvayā
Griffith: O AGNI, Holy and Divine, with splendour and thy pleasant tongue
Devanāgarī: अग्ने पावक रोचिषा मन्द्रया देव जिह्वया
pada pāṭha: agne | pāvaka | rociṣā | mandrayā | deva | jihvayā || ā | devān | vakṣi | yakṣi | ca ||5.26.1||

IAST: ā devān vakṣi yakṣi ca
Griffith: Bring hither and adore the Gods.
Devanāgarī: आ देवान्वक्षि यक्षि च
pada pāṭha: agne | pāvaka | rociṣā | mandrayā | deva | jihvayā || ā | devān | vakṣi | yakṣi | ca ||5.26.1||

IAST: taṁ tvā ghṛtasnav īmahe citrabhāno svardṛśam
Griffith: We pray thee, thou who droppest oil, bright-rayed! who lookest on the Sun,
Devanāgarī: तं त्वा घृतस्नवीमहे चित्रभानो स्वर्दृशम्
pada pāṭha: tam | tvā | ghr̥tasno iti ghr̥ta-sno | īmahe | citrabhāno iti citra-bhāno | svaḥ-dr̥śam || devān | ā | vītaye | vaha ||5.26.2||

IAST: devām̐ ā vītaye vaha
Griffith: Bring the Gods hither to the feast.
Devanāgarī: देवाँ आ वीतये वह
pada pāṭha: tam | tvā | ghr̥tasno iti ghr̥ta-sno | īmahe | citrabhāno iti citra-bhāno | svaḥ-dr̥śam || devān | ā | vītaye | vaha ||5.26.2||

IAST: vītihotraṁ tvā kave dyumantaṁ sam idhīmahi
Griffith: We have enkindled thee, O Sage, bright caller of the Gods to feast.
Devanāgarī: वीतिहोत्रं त्वा कवे द्युमन्तं समिधीमहि
pada pāṭha: vīti-hotram | tvā | kave | dyu-mantam | sam | idhīmahi || agne | br̥hantam | adhvare ||5.26.3||

IAST: agne bṛhantam adhvare
Griffith: O Agni, great in Sacrifice.
Devanāgarī: अग्ने बृहन्तमध्वरे
pada pāṭha: vīti-hotram | tvā | kave | dyu-mantam | sam | idhīmahi || agne | br̥hantam | adhvare ||5.26.3||

IAST: agne viśvebhir ā gahi devebhir havyadātaye
Griffith: O Agni, come with all the Gods, come to our sacrificial gift:
Devanāgarī: अग्ने विश्वेभिरा गहि देवेभिर्हव्यदातये
pada pāṭha: agne | viśve-bhiḥ | ā | gahi | devebhiḥ | havya-dātaye || hotāram | tvā | vr̥ṇīmahe ||5.26.4||

IAST: hotāraṁ tvā vṛṇīmahe
Griffith: We choose thee as Invoking Priest.
Devanāgarī: होतारं त्वा वृणीमहे
pada pāṭha: agne | viśve-bhiḥ | ā | gahi | devebhiḥ | havya-dātaye || hotāram | tvā | vr̥ṇīmahe ||5.26.4||

IAST: yajamānāya sunvata āgne suvīryaṁ vaha
Griffith: Bring, Agni, to the worshipper who pours the juice, heroic strength:
Devanāgarī: यजमानाय सुन्वत आग्ने सुवीर्यं वह
pada pāṭha: yajamānāya | sunvate | ā | agne | su-vīryam | vaha || devaiḥ | ā | satsi | barhiṣi ||5.26.5||

IAST: devair ā satsi barhiṣi
Griffith: Sit with the Gods upon the grass.
Devanāgarī: देवैरा सत्सि बर्हिषि
pada pāṭha: yajamānāya | sunvate | ā | agne | su-vīryam | vaha || devaiḥ | ā | satsi | barhiṣi ||5.26.5||

IAST: samidhānaḥ sahasrajid agne dharmāṇi puṣyasi
Griffith: Victor of thousands, Agni, thou, enkindled, cherishest the laws,
Devanāgarī: समिधानः सहस्रजिदग्ने धर्माणि पुष्यसि
pada pāṭha: sam-idhānaḥ | sahasra-jit | agne | dharmāṇi | puṣyasi || devānām | dūtaḥ | ukthyaḥ ||5.26.6||

IAST: devānāṁ dūta ukthyaḥ
Griffith: Laud-worthy, envoy of the Gods.
Devanāgarī: देवानां दूत उक्थ्यः
pada pāṭha: sam-idhānaḥ | sahasra-jit | agne | dharmāṇi | puṣyasi || devānām | dūtaḥ | ukthyaḥ ||5.26.6||

IAST: ny agniṁ jātavedasaṁ hotravāhaṁ yaviṣṭhyam
Griffith: Set Agni Jatavedas down, the bearer of our sacred gifts,
Devanāgarī: न्यग्निं जातवेदसं होत्रवाहं यविष्ठ्यम्
pada pāṭha: ni | agnim | jāta-vedasam | hotra-vāham | yaviṣṭhyam || dadhāta | devam | r̥tvijam ||5.26.7||

IAST: dadhātā devam ṛtvijam
Griffith: MostYouthful, God and Minister.
Devanāgarī: दधाता देवमृत्विजम्
pada pāṭha: ni | agnim | jāta-vedasam | hotra-vāham | yaviṣṭhyam || dadhāta | devam | r̥tvijam ||5.26.7||

IAST: pra yajña etv ānuṣag adyā devavyacastamaḥ
Griffith: Duly proceed our sacrifice, comprising all the Gods, to-day:
Devanāgarī: प्र यज्ञ एत्वानुषगद्या देवव्यचस्तमः
pada pāṭha: pra | yajñaḥ | etu | ānuṣak | adya | devavyacaḥ-tamaḥ || str̥ṇīta | barhiḥ | ā-sade ||5.26.8||

IAST: stṛṇīta barhir āsade
Griffith: Strew holy grass to be their seat.
Devanāgarī: स्तृणीत बर्हिरासदे
pada pāṭha: pra | yajñaḥ | etu | ānuṣak | adya | devavyacaḥ-tamaḥ || str̥ṇīta | barhiḥ | ā-sade ||5.26.8||

IAST: edam maruto aśvinā mitraḥ sīdantu varuṇaḥ
Griffith: So may the Maruts sit thereon, the Asvins, Mitra, Varuna:
Devanāgarī: एदं मरुतो अश्विना मित्रः सीदन्तु वरुणः
pada pāṭha: ā | idam | marutaḥ | aśvinā | mitraḥ | sīdantu | varuṇaḥ || devāsaḥ | sarvayā | viśā ||5.26.9||

IAST: devāsaḥ sarvayā viśā
Griffith: The Gods with all their company.
Devanāgarī: देवासः सर्वया विशा
pada pāṭha: ā | idam | marutaḥ | aśvinā | mitraḥ | sīdantu | varuṇaḥ || devāsaḥ | sarvayā | viśā ||5.26.9||

IAST: anasvantā satpatir māmahe me gāvā cetiṣṭho asuro maghonaḥ
Griffith: THE Godlike hero, famousest of nobles, hath granted me two oxen with a wagon.
Devanāgarī: अनस्वन्ता सत्पतिर्मामहे मे गावा चेतिष्ठो असुरो मघोनः
pada pāṭha: anasvantā | sat-patiḥ | mamahe | me | gāvā | cetiṣṭhaḥ | asuraḥ | maghonaḥ || traivr̥ṣṇaḥ | agne | daśa-bhiḥ | sahasraiḥ | vaiśvānara | tri-aruṇaḥ | ciketa ||5.27.1||

IAST: traivṛṣṇo agne daśabhiḥ sahasrair vaiśvānara tryaruṇaś ciketa
Griffith: Trvrsan's son Tryaruna hath distinguished himself, Vaisvanara Agni! with ten thousands.
Devanāgarī: त्रैवृष्णो अग्ने दशभिः सहस्रैर्वैश्वानर त्र्यरुणश्चिकेत
pada pāṭha: anasvantā | sat-patiḥ | mamahe | me | gāvā | cetiṣṭhaḥ | asuraḥ | maghonaḥ || traivr̥ṣṇaḥ | agne | daśa-bhiḥ | sahasraiḥ | vaiśvānara | tri-aruṇaḥ | ciketa ||5.27.1||

IAST: yo me śatā ca viṁśatiṁ ca gonāṁ harī ca yuktā sudhurā dadāti
Griffith: Protect Tryaruna, as thou art waxing strong and art highly praised, Vaisvanara Agni!
Devanāgarī: यो मे शता च विंशतिं च गोनां हरी च युक्ता सुधुरा ददाति
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | me | śatā | ca | viṁśatim | ca | gonām | harī iti | ca | yuktā | su-dhurā | dadāti || vaiśvānara | su-stutaḥ | vavr̥dhānaḥ | agne | yaccha | tri-aruṇāya | śarma ||5.27.2||

IAST: vaiśvānara suṣṭuto vāvṛdhāno 'gne yaccha tryaruṇāya śarma
Griffith: Who granteth me a hundred kine and twenty, and two bay horses, good at draught, and harnessed.
Devanāgarī: वैश्वानर सुष्टुतो वावृधानोऽग्ने यच्छ त्र्यरुणाय शर्म
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | me | śatā | ca | viṁśatim | ca | gonām | harī iti | ca | yuktā | su-dhurā | dadāti || vaiśvānara | su-stutaḥ | vavr̥dhānaḥ | agne | yaccha | tri-aruṇāya | śarma ||5.27.2||

IAST: evā te agne sumatiṁ cakāno naviṣṭhāya navamaṁ trasadasyuḥ
Griffith: So Trasadasyu served thee, God Most Youthful, craving thy favour for the ninth time, Agni;
Devanāgarī: एवा ते अग्ने सुमतिं चकानो नविष्ठाय नवमं त्रसदस्युः
pada pāṭha: eva | te | agne | su-matim | cakānaḥ | naviṣṭhāya | navamam | trasadasyuḥ || yaḥ | me | giraḥ | tuvi-jātasya | pūrvīḥ | yuktena | abhi | tri-aruṇaḥ | gr̥ṇāti ||5.27.3||

IAST: yo me giras tuvijātasya pūrvīr yuktenābhi tryaruṇo gṛṇāti
Griffith: Tryaruya who with attentive spirit accepteth many a song from me the mighty.
Devanāgarī: यो मे गिरस्तुविजातस्य पूर्वीर्युक्तेनाभि त्र्यरुणो गृणाति
pada pāṭha: eva | te | agne | su-matim | cakānaḥ | naviṣṭhāya | navamam | trasadasyuḥ || yaḥ | me | giraḥ | tuvi-jātasya | pūrvīḥ | yuktena | abhi | tri-aruṇaḥ | gr̥ṇāti ||5.27.3||

IAST: yo ma iti pravocaty aśvamedhāya sūraye
Griffith: He who declares his wish to me, to Asvamedha, to the Prince,
Devanāgarī: यो म इति प्रवोचत्यश्वमेधाय सूरये
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | me | iti | pra-vocati | aśva-medhāya | sūraye || dadat | r̥cā | sanim | yate | dadat | medhām | r̥ta-yate ||5.27.4||

IAST: dadad ṛcā saniṁ yate dadan medhām ṛtāyate
Griffith: Pays him who with his verse seeks gain, gives power to him who keeps the Law.
Devanāgarī: दददृचा सनिं यते ददन्मेधामृतायते
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | me | iti | pra-vocati | aśva-medhāya | sūraye || dadat | r̥cā | sanim | yate | dadat | medhām | r̥ta-yate ||5.27.4||

IAST: yasya mā paruṣāḥ śatam uddharṣayanty ukṣaṇaḥ
Griffith: From whom a hundred oxen, all of speckled hue, delight my heart,
Devanāgarī: यस्य मा परुषाः शतमुद्धर्षयन्त्युक्षणः
pada pāṭha: yasya | mā | paruṣāḥ | śatam | ut-harṣayanti | ukṣaṇaḥ || aśva-medhasya | dānāḥ | somāḥ-iva | tri-āśiraḥ ||5.27.5||

IAST: aśvamedhasya dānāḥ somā iva tryāśiraḥ
Griffith: The gifts of Asvamedha, like thrice-mingled draughts of Soma juice.
Devanāgarī: अश्वमेधस्य दानाः सोमा इव त्र्याशिरः
pada pāṭha: yasya | mā | paruṣāḥ | śatam | ut-harṣayanti | ukṣaṇaḥ || aśva-medhasya | dānāḥ | somāḥ-iva | tri-āśiraḥ ||5.27.5||

IAST: indrāgnī śatadāvny aśvamedhe suvīryam
Griffith: To Asvamedha who bestows a hundred gifts grant hero power,
Devanāgarī: इन्द्राग्नी शतदाव्न्यश्वमेधे सुवीर्यम्
pada pāṭha: indrāgnī iti | śata-dāvni | aśva-medhe | su-vīryam || kṣatram | dhārayatam | br̥hat | divi | sūryam-iva | ajaram ||5.27.6||

IAST: kṣatraṁ dhārayatam bṛhad divi sūryam ivājaram
Griffith: O Indra-Agni! lofty rule like the unwasting Sun in heaven.
Devanāgarī: क्षत्रं धारयतं बृहद्दिवि सूर्यमिवाजरम्
pada pāṭha: indrāgnī iti | śata-dāvni | aśva-medhe | su-vīryam || kṣatram | dhārayatam | br̥hat | divi | sūryam-iva | ajaram ||5.27.6||

IAST: samiddho agnir divi śocir aśret pratyaṅṅ uṣasam urviyā vi bhāti
Griffith: AGNI inflamed hath sent to heaven his lustre: he shines forth widely turning unto Morning.
Devanāgarī: समिद्धो अग्निर्दिवि शोचिरश्रेत्प्रत्यङ्ङुषसमुर्विया वि भाति
pada pāṭha: sam-iddhaḥ | agniḥ | divi | śociḥ | aśret | pratyaṅ | uṣasam | urviyā | vi | bhāti || eti | prācī | viśva-vārā | namaḥ-bhiḥ | devān | īḷānā | haviṣā | ghr̥tācī ||5.28.1||

IAST: eti prācī viśvavārā namobhir devām̐ īḻānā haviṣā ghṛtācī
Griffith: Eastward the ladle goes that brings all blessing, praising the Godswith homage and oblation.
Devanāgarī: एति प्राची विश्ववारा नमोभिर्देवाँ ईळाना हविषा घृताची
pada pāṭha: sam-iddhaḥ | agniḥ | divi | śociḥ | aśret | pratyaṅ | uṣasam | urviyā | vi | bhāti || eti | prācī | viśva-vārā | namaḥ-bhiḥ | devān | īḷānā | haviṣā | ghr̥tācī ||5.28.1||

IAST: samidhyamāno amṛtasya rājasi haviṣ kṛṇvantaṁ sacase svastaye
Griffith: Enkindled, thou art King of the immortal world: him who brings offerings thou attendest for his weal.
Devanāgarī: समिध्यमानो अमृतस्य राजसि हविष्कृण्वन्तं सचसे स्वस्तये
pada pāṭha: sam-idhyamānaḥ | amr̥tasya | rājasi | haviḥ | kr̥ṇvantam | sacase | svastaye || viśvam | saḥ | dhatte | draviṇam | yam | invasi | ātithyam | agne | ni | ca | dhatte | it | puraḥ ||5.28.2||

IAST: viśvaṁ sa dhatte draviṇaṁ yam invasy ātithyam agne ni ca dhatta it puraḥ
Griffith: He whom thou urgest on makes all possessions his: he sets before thee, Agni, gifts that guests may claim
Devanāgarī: विश्वं स धत्ते द्रविणं यमिन्वस्यातिथ्यमग्ने नि च धत्त इत्पुरः
pada pāṭha: sam-idhyamānaḥ | amr̥tasya | rājasi | haviḥ | kr̥ṇvantam | sacase | svastaye || viśvam | saḥ | dhatte | draviṇam | yam | invasi | ātithyam | agne | ni | ca | dhatte | it | puraḥ ||5.28.2||

IAST: agne śardha mahate saubhagāya tava dyumnāny uttamāni santu
Griffith: Show thyself strong for mighty bliss, O Agni, most excellent be thine effulgent splendours.
Devanāgarī: अग्ने शर्ध महते सौभगाय तव द्युम्नान्युत्तमानि सन्तु
pada pāṭha: agne | śardha | mahate | saubhagāya | tava | dyumnāni | ut-tamāni | santu || sam | jāḥ-patyam | su-yamam | ā | kr̥ṇuṣva | śatru-yatām | abhi | tiṣṭha | mahāṁsi ||5.28.3||

IAST: saṁ jāspatyaṁ suyamam ā kṛṇuṣva śatrūyatām abhi tiṣṭhā mahāṁsi
Griffith: Make easy to maintain our household lordship, and overcome the might of those who hate us.
Devanāgarī: सं जास्पत्यं सुयममा कृणुष्व शत्रूयतामभि तिष्ठा महांसि
pada pāṭha: agne | śardha | mahate | saubhagāya | tava | dyumnāni | ut-tamāni | santu || sam | jāḥ-patyam | su-yamam | ā | kr̥ṇuṣva | śatru-yatām | abhi | tiṣṭha | mahāṁsi ||5.28.3||

IAST: samiddhasya pramahaso 'gne vande tava śriyam
Griffith: Thy glory, Agni, I adore, kindled, exalted in thy strength.
Devanāgarī: समिद्धस्य प्रमहसोऽग्ने वन्दे तव श्रियम्
pada pāṭha: sam-iddhasya | pra-mahasaḥ | agne | vande | tava | śriyam || vr̥ṣabhaḥ | dyumna-vān | asi | sam | adhvareṣu | idhyase ||5.28.4||

IAST: vṛṣabho dyumnavām̐ asi sam adhvareṣv idhyase
Griffith: A Steer of brilliant splendour, thou art lighted well at sacred rites.
Devanāgarī: वृषभो द्युम्नवाँ असि समध्वरेष्विध्यसे
pada pāṭha: sam-iddhasya | pra-mahasaḥ | agne | vande | tava | śriyam || vr̥ṣabhaḥ | dyumna-vān | asi | sam | adhvareṣu | idhyase ||5.28.4||

IAST: samiddho agna āhuta devān yakṣi svadhvara
Griffith: Agni, invoked and kindled, serve the Gods, thou skilled in sacrifice:
Devanāgarī: समिद्धो अग्न आहुत देवान्यक्षि स्वध्वर
pada pāṭha: sam-iddhaḥ | agne | ā-huta | devān | yakṣi | su-adhvara || tvam | hi | havya-vāṭ | asi ||5.28.5||

IAST: tvaṁ hi havyavāḻ asi
Griffith: For thou art bearer of our gifts.
Devanāgarī: त्वं हि हव्यवाळसि
pada pāṭha: sam-iddhaḥ | agne | ā-huta | devān | yakṣi | su-adhvara || tvam | hi | havya-vāṭ | asi ||5.28.5||

IAST: ā juhotā duvasyatāgnim prayaty adhvare
Griffith: Invoke and worship Agni while the sacrificial rite proceeds:
Devanāgarī: आ जुहोता दुवस्यताग्निं प्रयत्यध्वरे
pada pāṭha: ā | juhota | duvasyata | agnim | pra-yati | adhvare || vr̥ṇīdhvam | havya-vāhanam ||5.28.6||

IAST: vṛṇīdhvaṁ havyavāhanam
Griffith: For offering-bearer choose ye him.
Devanāgarī: वृणीध्वं हव्यवाहनम्
pada pāṭha: ā | juhota | duvasyata | agnim | pra-yati | adhvare || vr̥ṇīdhvam | havya-vāhanam ||5.28.6||

IAST: try aryamā manuṣo devatātā trī rocanā divyā dhārayanta
Griffith: MAN'S worship of the Gods hath three great lustres, and three celestial lights have they established
Devanāgarī: त्र्यर्यमा मनुषो देवताता त्री रोचना दिव्या धारयन्त
pada pāṭha: trī | aryamā | manuṣaḥ | deva-tātā | trī | rocanā | divyā | dhārayanta || arcanti | tvā | marutaḥ | pūta-dakṣāḥ | tvam | eṣām | r̥ṣiḥ | indra | asi | dhīraḥ ||5.29.1||

IAST: arcanti tvā marutaḥ pūtadakṣās tvam eṣām ṛṣir indrāsi dhīraḥ
Griffith: The Maruts gifted with pure strength adore thee, for thou, O Indra, art their sapient Rsi.
Devanāgarī: अर्चन्ति त्वा मरुतः पूतदक्षास्त्वमेषामृषिरिन्द्रासि धीरः
pada pāṭha: trī | aryamā | manuṣaḥ | deva-tātā | trī | rocanā | divyā | dhārayanta || arcanti | tvā | marutaḥ | pūta-dakṣāḥ | tvam | eṣām | r̥ṣiḥ | indra | asi | dhīraḥ ||5.29.1||

IAST: anu yad īm maruto mandasānam ārcann indram papivāṁsaṁ sutasya
Griffith: What time the Maruts sang their song to Indra, joyous when he had drunk of Soma juices,
Devanāgarī: अनु यदीं मरुतो मन्दसानमार्चन्निन्द्रं पपिवांसं सुतस्य
pada pāṭha: anu | yat | īm | marutaḥ | mandasānam | ārcan | indram | papi-vāṁsam | sutasya || ā | adatta | vajram | abhi | yat | ahim | han | apaḥ | yahvīḥ | asr̥jat | sartavai | ūm̐ iti ||5.29.2||

IAST: ādatta vajram abhi yad ahiṁ hann apo yahvīr asṛjat sartavā u
Griffith: He grasped his thunderbolt to slay the Dragon, and loosed, that they might flow, the youthful Waters.
Devanāgarī: आदत्त वज्रमभि यदहिं हन्नपो यह्वीरसृजत्सर्तवा उ
pada pāṭha: anu | yat | īm | marutaḥ | mandasānam | ārcan | indram | papi-vāṁsam | sutasya || ā | adatta | vajram | abhi | yat | ahim | han | apaḥ | yahvīḥ | asr̥jat | sartavai | ūm̐ iti ||5.29.2||

IAST: uta brahmāṇo maruto me asyendraḥ somasya suṣutasya peyāḥ
Griffith: And, O ye Brahmans, Maruts, so may Indra drink draughts of this my carefully pressed Sorna;
Devanāgarī: उत ब्रह्माणो मरुतो मे अस्येन्द्रः सोमस्य सुषुतस्य पेयाः
pada pāṭha: uta | brahmāṇaḥ | marutaḥ | me | asya | indraḥ | somasya | su-sutasya | peyāḥ || tat | hi | havyam | manuṣe | gāḥ | avindat | ahan | ahim | papi-vān | indraḥ | asya ||5.29.3||

IAST: tad dhi havyam manuṣe gā avindad ahann ahim papivām̐ indro asya
Griffith: For this oblation found for man the cattle, and Indra, having quaffed it, slew the Dragon.
Devanāgarī: तद्धि हव्यं मनुषे गा अविन्ददहन्नहिं पपिवाँ इन्द्रो अस्य
pada pāṭha: uta | brahmāṇaḥ | marutaḥ | me | asya | indraḥ | somasya | su-sutasya | peyāḥ || tat | hi | havyam | manuṣe | gāḥ | avindat | ahan | ahim | papi-vān | indraḥ | asya ||5.29.3||

IAST: ād rodasī vitaraṁ vi ṣkabhāyat saṁvivyānaś cid bhiyase mṛgaṁ kaḥ
Griffith: Then heaven and earth he sundered and supported: wrapped even in these he struck the Beast with terror.
Devanāgarī: आद्रोदसी वितरं वि ष्कभायत्संविव्यानश्चिद्भियसे मृगं कः
pada pāṭha: āt | rodasī iti | vi-taram | vi | skabhāyat | sam-vivyānaḥ | cit | bhiyase | mr̥gam | kariti kaḥ || jigartim | indraḥ | apa-jargurāṇaḥ | prati | śvasantam | ava | dānavam | hanniti han ||5.29.4||

IAST: jigartim indro apajargurāṇaḥ prati śvasantam ava dānavaṁ han
Griffith: So Indra forced the Engulfer to disgorgement, and slew the Danava. panting against him.
Devanāgarī: जिगर्तिमिन्द्रो अपजर्गुराणः प्रति श्वसन्तमव दानवं हन्
pada pāṭha: āt | rodasī iti | vi-taram | vi | skabhāyat | sam-vivyānaḥ | cit | bhiyase | mr̥gam | kariti kaḥ || jigartim | indraḥ | apa-jargurāṇaḥ | prati | śvasantam | ava | dānavam | hanniti han ||5.29.4||

IAST: adha kratvā maghavan tubhyaṁ devā anu viśve adaduḥ somapeyam
Griffith: Thus all the Gods, O Maghavan, delivered to thee of their free will the draught of Soma;
Devanāgarī: अध क्रत्वा मघवन्तुभ्यं देवा अनु विश्वे अददुः सोमपेयम्
pada pāṭha: adha | kratvā | magha-van | tubhyam | devāḥ | anu | viśve | adaduḥ | soma-peyam || yat | sūryasya | haritaḥ | patantīḥ | puraḥ | satīḥ | uparāḥ | etaśe | kariti kaḥ ||5.29.5||

IAST: yat sūryasya haritaḥ patantīḥ puraḥ satīr uparā etaśe kaḥ
Griffith: When thou for Etasa didst cause to tarry the flying mares of Surya racing forward.
Devanāgarī: यत्सूर्यस्य हरितः पतन्तीः पुरः सतीरुपरा एतशे कः
pada pāṭha: adha | kratvā | magha-van | tubhyam | devāḥ | anu | viśve | adaduḥ | soma-peyam || yat | sūryasya | haritaḥ | patantīḥ | puraḥ | satīḥ | uparāḥ | etaśe | kariti kaḥ ||5.29.5||

IAST: nava yad asya navatiṁ ca bhogān sākaṁ vajreṇa maghavā vivṛścat
Griffith: When Maghavan with the thunderbolt demolished his nine-and-ninety castles all together,
Devanāgarī: नव यदस्य नवतिं च भोगान्साकं वज्रेण मघवा विवृश्चत्
pada pāṭha: nava | yat | asya | navatim | ca | bhogān | sākam | vajreṇa | magha-vā | vivr̥ścat || arcanti | indram | marutaḥ | sadha-sthe | traistubhena | vacasā | bādhata | dyām ||5.29.6||

IAST: arcantīndram marutaḥ sadhasthe traiṣṭubhena vacasā bādhata dyām
Griffith: The Maruts, where they met, glorified Indra: ye with the Trstup hymn obstructed heaven.
Devanāgarī: अर्चन्तीन्द्रं मरुतः सधस्थे त्रैष्टुभेन वचसा बाधत द्याम्
pada pāṭha: nava | yat | asya | navatim | ca | bhogān | sākam | vajreṇa | magha-vā | vivr̥ścat || arcanti | indram | marutaḥ | sadha-sthe | traistubhena | vacasā | bādhata | dyām ||5.29.6||

IAST: sakhā sakhye apacat tūyam agnir asya kratvā mahiṣā trī śatāni
Griffith: As friend to aid a friend, Agni dressed quickly three hundred buffaloes, even as he willed it.
Devanāgarī: सखा सख्ये अपचत्तूयमग्निरस्य क्रत्वा महिषा त्री शतानि
pada pāṭha: sakhā | sakhye | apacat | tūyam | agniḥ | asya | kratvā | mahiṣā | trī | śatāni || trī | sākam | indraḥ | manuṣaḥ | sarāṁsi | sutam | pibat | vr̥tra-hatyāya | somam ||5.29.7||

IAST: trī sākam indro manuṣaḥ sarāṁsi sutam pibad vṛtrahatyāya somam
Griffith: And Indra, from man's gift, for Vrtra's slaughter, drank ofr at once three lakes of pressed-out Soma.
Devanāgarī: त्री साकमिन्द्रो मनुषः सरांसि सुतं पिबद्वृत्रहत्याय सोमम्
pada pāṭha: sakhā | sakhye | apacat | tūyam | agniḥ | asya | kratvā | mahiṣā | trī | śatāni || trī | sākam | indraḥ | manuṣaḥ | sarāṁsi | sutam | pibat | vr̥tra-hatyāya | somam ||5.29.7||

IAST: trī yac chatā mahiṣāṇām agho mās trī sarāṁsi maghavā somyāpāḥ
Griffith: When thou three hundred buffaloes' flesh hadst eaten, and drunk, as Maghavan, three lakes of Soma,
Devanāgarī: त्री यच्छता महिषाणामघो मास्त्री सरांसि मघवा सोम्यापाः
pada pāṭha: trī | yat | śatā | mahiṣāṇām | aghaḥ | māḥ | trī | sarāṁsi | magha-vā | somyā | apāḥ || kāram | na | viśve | ahvanta | devāḥ | bharam | indrāya | yat | ahim | jaghāna ||5.29.8||

IAST: kāraṁ na viśve ahvanta devā bharam indrāya yad ahiṁ jaghāna
Griffith: All the Gods raised as 'twere a shout of triumph to Indra praise because he slew the Dragon.
Devanāgarī: कारं न विश्वे अह्वन्त देवा भरमिन्द्राय यदहिं जघान
pada pāṭha: trī | yat | śatā | mahiṣāṇām | aghaḥ | māḥ | trī | sarāṁsi | magha-vā | somyā | apāḥ || kāram | na | viśve | ahvanta | devāḥ | bharam | indrāya | yat | ahim | jaghāna ||5.29.8||

IAST: uśanā yat sahasyair ayātaṁ gṛham indra jūjuvānebhir aśvaiḥ
Griffith: What time ye came with strong steeds swiftly speeding, O Usana and Indra, to the dwelling,
Devanāgarī: उशना यत्सहस्यैरयातं गृहमिन्द्र जूजुवानेभिरश्वैः
pada pāṭha: uśanā | yat | sahasyaiḥ | ayātam | gr̥ham | indra | jūjuvānebhiḥ | aśvaiḥ || vanvānaḥ | atra | sa-ratham | yayātha | kutsena | devaiḥ | avanoḥ | ha | śuṣṇam ||5.29.9||

IAST: vanvāno atra sarathaṁ yayātha kutsena devair avanor ha śuṣṇam
Griffith: Thou camest thither -conquering together with Kutsa and the Gods: thou slewest Susna.
Devanāgarī: वन्वानो अत्र सरथं ययाथ कुत्सेन देवैरवनोर्ह शुष्णम्
pada pāṭha: uśanā | yat | sahasyaiḥ | ayātam | gr̥ham | indra | jūjuvānebhiḥ | aśvaiḥ || vanvānaḥ | atra | sa-ratham | yayātha | kutsena | devaiḥ | avanoḥ | ha | śuṣṇam ||5.29.9||

IAST: prānyac cakram avṛhaḥ sūryasya kutsāyānyad varivo yātave 'kaḥ
Griffith: One car-wheel of the Sun thou rolledst forward, and one thou settest free to move for Kutsa.
Devanāgarī: प्रान्यच्चक्रमवृहः सूर्यस्य कुत्सायान्यद्वरिवो यातवेऽकः
pada pāṭha: pra | anyat | cakram | avr̥haḥ | sūryasya | kutsāya | anyat | varivaḥ | yātave | akarityakaḥ || anāsaḥ | dasyūn | amr̥ṇaḥ | vadhena | ni | duryoṇe | avr̥ṇak | mr̥dhra-vācaḥ ||5.29.10||

IAST: anāso dasyūm̐r amṛṇo vadhena ni duryoṇa āvṛṇaṅ mṛdhravācaḥ
Griffith: Thou slewest noseless Dasyus with thy weapon, and in their home o'erthrewest hostile speakers.
Devanāgarī: अनासो दस्यूँरमृणो वधेन नि दुर्योण आवृणङ्मृध्रवाचः
pada pāṭha: pra | anyat | cakram | avr̥haḥ | sūryasya | kutsāya | anyat | varivaḥ | yātave | akarityakaḥ || anāsaḥ | dasyūn | amr̥ṇaḥ | vadhena | ni | duryoṇe | avr̥ṇak | mr̥dhra-vācaḥ ||5.29.10||

IAST: stomāsas tvā gaurivīter avardhann arandhayo vaidathināya piprum
Griffith: The lauds of Gauriviti made thee mighty to Vidathin's son, as prey, thou gavest Pipru.
Devanāgarī: स्तोमासस्त्वा गौरिवीतेरवर्धन्नरन्धयो वैदथिनाय पिप्रुम्
pada pāṭha: stomāsaḥ | tvā | gauri-vīteḥ | avardhan | arandhayaḥ | vaidathināya | piprum || ā | tvām | r̥jiśvā | sakhyāya | cakre | pacan | paktīḥ | apibaḥ | somam | asya ||5.29.11||

IAST: ā tvām ṛjiśvā sakhyāya cakre pacan paktīr apibaḥ somam asya
Griffith: Rjisivan drew thee into friendship dressing the sacred food, and thou hast drunk his Soma.
Devanāgarī: आ त्वामृजिश्वा सख्याय चक्रे पचन्पक्तीरपिबः सोममस्य
pada pāṭha: stomāsaḥ | tvā | gauri-vīteḥ | avardhan | arandhayaḥ | vaidathināya | piprum || ā | tvām | r̥jiśvā | sakhyāya | cakre | pacan | paktīḥ | apibaḥ | somam | asya ||5.29.11||

IAST: navagvāsaḥ sutasomāsa indraṁ daśagvāso abhy arcanty arkaiḥ
Griffith: Navagvas and Dasgvas with libations of Soma juice sing hymns of praise to Indra.
Devanāgarī: नवग्वासः सुतसोमास इन्द्रं दशग्वासो अभ्यर्चन्त्यर्कैः
pada pāṭha: nava-gvāsaḥ | suta-somāsaḥ | indram | daśa-gvāsaḥ | abhi | arcanti | arkaiḥ || gavyam | cit | ūrvam | apidhāna-vantam | tam | cit | naraḥ | śaśamānāḥ | apa | vran ||5.29.12||

IAST: gavyaṁ cid ūrvam apidhānavantaṁ taṁ cin naraḥ śaśamānā apa vran
Griffith: Labouring at their task the men laid open the stall of Kine though firmly closed and fastened.
Devanāgarī: गव्यं चिदूर्वमपिधानवन्तं तं चिन्नरः शशमाना अप व्रन्
pada pāṭha: nava-gvāsaḥ | suta-somāsaḥ | indram | daśa-gvāsaḥ | abhi | arcanti | arkaiḥ || gavyam | cit | ūrvam | apidhāna-vantam | tam | cit | naraḥ | śaśamānāḥ | apa | vran ||5.29.12||

IAST: katho nu te pari carāṇi vidvān vīryā maghavan yā cakartha
Griffith: How shall I serve thee, Maghavan, though knowing full well what hero deeds thou hast accomplished?
Devanāgarī: कथो नु ते परि चराणि विद्वान्वीर्या मघवन्या चकर्थ
pada pāṭha: katho iti | nu | te | pari | carāṇi | vidvān | vīryā | magha-van | yā | cakartha || yā | co iti | nu | navyā | kr̥ṇavaḥ | śaviṣṭha | pra | it | ūm̐ iti | tā | te | vidatheṣu | bravāma ||5.29.13||

IAST: yā co nu navyā kṛṇavaḥ śaviṣṭha pred u tā te vidatheṣu bravāma
Griffith: And the fresh deeds which thou wilt do, Most Mighty! these, too, will we tell forth in sacred synods.
Devanāgarī: या चो नु नव्या कृणवः शविष्ठ प्रेदु ता ते विदथेषु ब्रवाम
pada pāṭha: katho iti | nu | te | pari | carāṇi | vidvān | vīryā | magha-van | yā | cakartha || yā | co iti | nu | navyā | kr̥ṇavaḥ | śaviṣṭha | pra | it | ūm̐ iti | tā | te | vidatheṣu | bravāma ||5.29.13||

IAST: etā viśvā cakṛvām̐ indra bhūry aparīto januṣā vīryeṇa
Griffith: Resistless from of old through hero courage, thou hast done all these many acts, O Indra.
Devanāgarī: एता विश्वा चकृवाँ इन्द्र भूर्यपरीतो जनुषा वीर्येण
pada pāṭha: etā | viśvā | cakr̥-vān | indra | bhūri | apari-itaḥ | januṣā | vīryeṇa || yā | cit | nu | vajrin | kr̥ṇavaḥ | dadhr̥ṣvān | na | te | vartā | taviṣyāḥ | asti | tasyāḥ ||5.29.14||

IAST: yā cin nu vajrin kṛṇavo dadhṛṣvān na te vartā taviṣyā asti tasyāḥ
Griffith: What thou wilt do in bravery, Thunder-wielder! none is there who may hinder this thy prowess.
Devanāgarī: या चिन्नु वज्रिन्कृणवो दधृष्वान्न ते वर्ता तविष्या अस्ति तस्याः
pada pāṭha: etā | viśvā | cakr̥-vān | indra | bhūri | apari-itaḥ | januṣā | vīryeṇa || yā | cit | nu | vajrin | kr̥ṇavaḥ | dadhr̥ṣvān | na | te | vartā | taviṣyāḥ | asti | tasyāḥ ||5.29.14||

IAST: indra brahma kriyamāṇā juṣasva yā te śaviṣṭha navyā akarma
Griffith: Indra, accept the prayers which now are offered, accept the new prayers, Mightiest! which we utter.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्र ब्रह्म क्रियमाणा जुषस्व या ते शविष्ठ नव्या अकर्म
pada pāṭha: indra | brahma | kriyamāṇā | juṣasva | yā | te | śaviṣṭha | navyāḥ | akarma || vastrā-iva | bhadrā | su-kr̥tā | vasu-yuḥ | ratham | na | dhīraḥ | su-apāḥ | atakṣam ||5.29.15||

IAST: vastreva bhadrā sukṛtā vasūyū rathaṁ na dhīraḥ svapā atakṣam
Griffith: Like fair and well-made robes, I, seeking riches, as a deft craftsman makes a car, have wrought them.
Devanāgarī: वस्त्रेव भद्रा सुकृता वसूयू रथं न धीरः स्वपा अतक्षम्
pada pāṭha: indra | brahma | kriyamāṇā | juṣasva | yā | te | śaviṣṭha | navyāḥ | akarma || vastrā-iva | bhadrā | su-kr̥tā | vasu-yuḥ | ratham | na | dhīraḥ | su-apāḥ | atakṣam ||5.29.15||

IAST: kva sya vīraḥ ko apaśyad indraṁ sukharatham īyamānaṁ haribhyām
Griffith: WHERE is that Hero? Who hath looked on Indra borne on light-rolling car by Tawny Coursers,
Devanāgarī: क्व स्य वीरः को अपश्यदिन्द्रं सुखरथमीयमानं हरिभ्याम्
pada pāṭha: kva | syaḥ | vīraḥ | kaḥ | apaśyat | indram | sukha-ratham | īyamānam | hari-bhyām || yaḥ | rāyā | vajrī | suta-somam | icchan | tat | okaḥ | gantā | puru-hūtaḥ | ūtī ||5.30.1||

IAST: yo rāyā vajrī sutasomam icchan tad oko gantā puruhūta ūtī
Griffith: Who, Thunderer, seeks with wealth the Soma-presser, and to his house goes, much-invoked, to aid him?
Devanāgarī: यो राया वज्री सुतसोममिच्छन्तदोको गन्ता पुरुहूत ऊती
pada pāṭha: kva | syaḥ | vīraḥ | kaḥ | apaśyat | indram | sukha-ratham | īyamānam | hari-bhyām || yaḥ | rāyā | vajrī | suta-somam | icchan | tat | okaḥ | gantā | puru-hūtaḥ | ūtī ||5.30.1||

IAST: avācacakṣam padam asya sasvar ugraṁ nidhātur anv āyam icchan
Griffith: I have beheld his strong and secret dwelling, longing have sought the Founder's habitation.
Devanāgarī: अवाचचक्षं पदमस्य सस्वरुग्रं निधातुरन्वायमिच्छन्
pada pāṭha: ava | acacakṣam | padam | asya | sasvaḥ | ugram | ni-dhātuḥ | anu | āyam | icchan || apr̥ccham | anyān | uta | te | me | āhuḥ | indram | naraḥ | bubudhānāḥ | aśema ||5.30.2||

IAST: apṛccham anyām̐ uta te ma āhur indraṁ naro bubudhānā aśema
Griffith: I asked of others, and they said in answer, May we, awakened men, attain to Indra.
Devanāgarī: अपृच्छमन्याँ उत ते म आहुरिन्द्रं नरो बुबुधाना अशेम
pada pāṭha: ava | acacakṣam | padam | asya | sasvaḥ | ugram | ni-dhātuḥ | anu | āyam | icchan || apr̥ccham | anyān | uta | te | me | āhuḥ | indram | naraḥ | bubudhānāḥ | aśema ||5.30.2||

IAST: pra nu vayaṁ sute yā te kṛtānīndra bravāma yāni no jujoṣaḥ
Griffith: We will tell, Indra, when we pour libation, what mighty deeds thou hast performed to please us.
Devanāgarī: प्र नु वयं सुते या ते कृतानीन्द्र ब्रवाम यानि नो जुजोषः
pada pāṭha: pra | nu | vayam | sute | yā | te | kr̥tāni | indra | bravāma | yāni | naḥ | jujoṣaḥ || vedat | avidvān | śr̥ṇavat | ca | vidvān | vahate | ayam | magha-vā | sarva-senaḥ ||5.30.3||

IAST: vedad avidvāñ chṛṇavac ca vidvān vahate 'yam maghavā sarvasenaḥ
Griffith: Let him who knows not learn, who knows them listen: hither rides Maghavan with all his army.
Devanāgarī: वेददविद्वाञ्छृणवच्च विद्वान्वहतेऽयं मघवा सर्वसेनः
pada pāṭha: pra | nu | vayam | sute | yā | te | kr̥tāni | indra | bravāma | yāni | naḥ | jujoṣaḥ || vedat | avidvān | śr̥ṇavat | ca | vidvān | vahate | ayam | magha-vā | sarva-senaḥ ||5.30.3||

IAST: sthiram manaś cakṛṣe jāta indra veṣīd eko yudhaye bhūyasaś cit
Griffith: Indra, when born, thou madest firm thy spirit: alone thou seekest war to fight with many.
Devanāgarī: स्थिरं मनश्चकृषे जात इन्द्र वेषीदेको युधये भूयसश्चित्
pada pāṭha: sthiram | manaḥ | cakr̥ṣe | jātaḥ | indra | veṣi | it | ekaḥ | yudhaye | bhūyasaḥ | cit || aśmānam | cit | śavasā | didyutaḥ | vi | vidaḥ | gavām | ūrvam | usriyāṇām ||5.30.4||

IAST: aśmānaṁ cic chavasā didyuto vi vido gavām ūrvam usriyāṇām
Griffith: With might thou clavest e'en the rock asunder, and foundest out the stable of the Milch-kine.
Devanāgarī: अश्मानं चिच्छवसा दिद्युतो वि विदो गवामूर्वमुस्रियाणाम्
pada pāṭha: sthiram | manaḥ | cakr̥ṣe | jātaḥ | indra | veṣi | it | ekaḥ | yudhaye | bhūyasaḥ | cit || aśmānam | cit | śavasā | didyutaḥ | vi | vidaḥ | gavām | ūrvam | usriyāṇām ||5.30.4||

IAST: paro yat tvam parama ājaniṣṭhāḥ parāvati śrutyaṁ nāma bibhrat
Griffith: When thou wast born supremest at a distance, bearing a name renowned in far-off regions,
Devanāgarī: परो यत्त्वं परम आजनिष्ठाः परावति श्रुत्यं नाम बिभ्रत्
pada pāṭha: paraḥ | yat | tvam | paramaḥ | ā-janiṣṭhāḥ | parā-vati | śrutyam | nāma | bibhrat || ataḥ | cit | indrāt | abhayanta | devāḥ | viśvāḥ | apaḥ | ajayat | dāsa-patnīḥ ||5.30.5||

IAST: ataś cid indrād abhayanta devā viśvā apo ajayad dāsapatnīḥ
Griffith: Since then e'en Gods have been afraid of Indra: he conquered all the floods which served the Dasa.
Devanāgarī: अतश्चिदिन्द्रादभयन्त देवा विश्वा अपो अजयद्दासपत्नीः
pada pāṭha: paraḥ | yat | tvam | paramaḥ | ā-janiṣṭhāḥ | parā-vati | śrutyam | nāma | bibhrat || ataḥ | cit | indrāt | abhayanta | devāḥ | viśvāḥ | apaḥ | ajayat | dāsa-patnīḥ ||5.30.5||

IAST: tubhyed ete marutaḥ suśevā arcanty arkaṁ sunvanty andhaḥ
Griffith: These blissful Maruts sing their psalm to praise thee, and pour to thee libation of the Soma.
Devanāgarī: तुभ्येदेते मरुतः सुशेवा अर्चन्त्यर्कं सुन्वन्त्यन्धः
pada pāṭha: tubhya | it | ete | marutaḥ | su-śevāḥ | arcanti | arkam | sunvanti | andhaḥ || ahim | ohānam | apaḥ | ā-śayānam | pra | māyābhiḥ | māyinam | sakṣat | indraḥ ||5.30.6||

IAST: ahim ohānam apa āśayānam pra māyābhir māyinaṁ sakṣad indraḥ
Griffith: Indra with wondrous powers subdued the Dragon, the guileful lurker who beset the waters.
Devanāgarī: अहिमोहानमप आशयानं प्र मायाभिर्मायिनं सक्षदिन्द्रः
pada pāṭha: tubhya | it | ete | marutaḥ | su-śevāḥ | arcanti | arkam | sunvanti | andhaḥ || ahim | ohānam | apaḥ | ā-śayānam | pra | māyābhiḥ | māyinam | sakṣat | indraḥ ||5.30.6||

IAST: vi ṣū mṛdho januṣā dānam invann ahan gavā maghavan saṁcakānaḥ
Griffith: Thou, Maghavan, from the first didst scatter foemen, speeding, while joying in the milk, the Giver.
Devanāgarī: वि षू मृधो जनुषा दानमिन्वन्नहन्गवा मघवन्संचकानः
pada pāṭha: vi | su | mr̥dhaḥ | januṣā | dānam | invan | ahan | gavā | magha-van | sam-cakānaḥ || atra | dāsasya | namuceḥ | śiraḥ | yat | avartayaḥ | manave | gātum | icchan ||5.30.7||

IAST: atrā dāsasya namuceḥ śiro yad avartayo manave gātum icchan
Griffith: There, seeking man's prosperity, thou torest away the head of Namuci the Dasa.
Devanāgarī: अत्रा दासस्य नमुचेः शिरो यदवर्तयो मनवे गातुमिच्छन्
pada pāṭha: vi | su | mr̥dhaḥ | januṣā | dānam | invan | ahan | gavā | magha-van | sam-cakānaḥ || atra | dāsasya | namuceḥ | śiraḥ | yat | avartayaḥ | manave | gātum | icchan ||5.30.7||

IAST: yujaṁ hi mām akṛthā ād id indra śiro dāsasya namucer mathāyan
Griffith: Pounding the head of Namuci the Dasa, me, too thou madest thine associate, Indra!
Devanāgarī: युजं हि मामकृथा आदिदिन्द्र शिरो दासस्य नमुचेर्मथायन्
pada pāṭha: yujam | hi | mām | akr̥thāḥ | āt | it | indra | śiraḥ | dāsasya | namuceḥ | mathāyan || aśmānam | cit | svaryam | vartamānam | pra | cakriyā-iva | rodasī iti | marut-bhyaḥ ||5.30.8||

IAST: aśmānaṁ cit svaryaṁ vartamānam pra cakriyeva rodasī marudbhyaḥ
Griffith: Yea, and the rolling stone that is in heaven both worlds, as on a car, brought to the Maruts.
Devanāgarī: अश्मानं चित्स्वर्यं वर्तमानं प्र चक्रियेव रोदसी मरुद्भ्यः
pada pāṭha: yujam | hi | mām | akr̥thāḥ | āt | it | indra | śiraḥ | dāsasya | namuceḥ | mathāyan || aśmānam | cit | svaryam | vartamānam | pra | cakriyā-iva | rodasī iti | marut-bhyaḥ ||5.30.8||

IAST: striyo hi dāsa āyudhāni cakre kim mā karann abalā asya senāḥ
Griffith: Women for weapons hath the Dasa taken, What injury can his feeble armies To me?
Devanāgarī: स्त्रियो हि दास आयुधानि चक्रे किं मा करन्नबला अस्य सेनाः
pada pāṭha: striyaḥ | hi | dāsaḥ | āyudhāni | cakre | kim | mā | karan | abalāḥ | asya | senāḥ || antaḥ | hi | akhyat | ubhe iti | asya | dhene iti | atha | upa | pra | ait | yudhaye | dasyum | indraḥ ||5.30.9||

IAST: antar hy akhyad ubhe asya dhene athopa praid yudhaye dasyum indraḥ
Griffith: Well he distinguished his two different voices, and Indra then advanced to fight the Dasyu.
Devanāgarī: अन्तर्ह्यख्यदुभे अस्य धेने अथोप प्रैद्युधये दस्युमिन्द्रः
pada pāṭha: striyaḥ | hi | dāsaḥ | āyudhāni | cakre | kim | mā | karan | abalāḥ | asya | senāḥ || antaḥ | hi | akhyat | ubhe iti | asya | dhene iti | atha | upa | pra | ait | yudhaye | dasyum | indraḥ ||5.30.9||

IAST: sam atra gāvo 'bhito 'navanteheha vatsair viyutā yad āsan
