Griffith: Divided from their calves the Cows went lowing around, on every side, hither and thither.
Devanāgarī: समत्र गावोऽभितोऽनवन्तेहेह वत्सैर्वियुता यदासन्
pada pāṭha: sam | atra | gāvaḥ | abhitaḥ | anavanta | iha-iha | vatsaiḥ | vi-yutāḥ | yat | āsan || sam | tāḥ | indraḥ | asr̥jat | asya | śākaiḥ | yat | īm | somāsaḥ | su-sutāḥ | amandan ||5.30.10||

IAST: saṁ tā indro asṛjad asya śākair yad īṁ somāsaḥ suṣutā amandan
Griffith: These Indra re-united with his helpers, what time the well-pressed Soma made him joyful.
Devanāgarī: सं ता इन्द्रो असृजदस्य शाकैर्यदीं सोमासः सुषुता अमन्दन्
pada pāṭha: sam | atra | gāvaḥ | abhitaḥ | anavanta | iha-iha | vatsaiḥ | vi-yutāḥ | yat | āsan || sam | tāḥ | indraḥ | asr̥jat | asya | śākaiḥ | yat | īm | somāsaḥ | su-sutāḥ | amandan ||5.30.10||

IAST: yad īṁ somā babhrudhūtā amandann aroravīd vṛṣabhaḥ sādaneṣu
Griffith: What time the Somas mixed by Babhru cheered him, loud the Steer bellowed in his habitations.
Devanāgarī: यदीं सोमा बभ्रुधूता अमन्दन्नरोरवीद्वृषभः सादनेषु
pada pāṭha: yat | īm | somāḥ | babhru-dhūtāḥ | amandan | aroravīt | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | sādaneṣu || puram-daraḥ | papi-vān | indraḥ | asya | punaḥ | gavām | adadāt | usriyāṇām ||5.30.11||

IAST: puraṁdaraḥ papivām̐ indro asya punar gavām adadād usriyāṇām
Griffith: So Indra drank thereof, the Fort-destroyer, and gave him guerdon, in return, of milch-kine.
Devanāgarī: पुरंदरः पपिवाँ इन्द्रो अस्य पुनर्गवामददादुस्रियाणाम्
pada pāṭha: yat | īm | somāḥ | babhru-dhūtāḥ | amandan | aroravīt | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | sādaneṣu || puram-daraḥ | papi-vān | indraḥ | asya | punaḥ | gavām | adadāt | usriyāṇām ||5.30.11||

IAST: bhadram idaṁ ruśamā agne akran gavāṁ catvāri dadataḥ sahasrā
Griffith: This good deed have the Rusamas done, Agni! that they have granted me four thousand cattle.
Devanāgarī: भद्रमिदं रुशमा अग्ने अक्रन्गवां चत्वारि ददतः सहस्रा
pada pāṭha: bhadram | idam | ruśamāḥ | agne | akran | gavām | catvāri | dadataḥ | sahasrā || r̥ṇam-cayasya | pra-yatā | maghāni | prati | agrabhīṣma | nr̥-tamasya | nr̥ṇām ||5.30.12||

IAST: ṛṇaṁcayasya prayatā maghāni praty agrabhīṣma nṛtamasya nṛṇām
Griffith: We have received Rnancaya's wealth, of heroes the most heroic, which was freely offered.
Devanāgarī: ऋणंचयस्य प्रयता मघानि प्रत्यग्रभीष्म नृतमस्य नृणाम्
pada pāṭha: bhadram | idam | ruśamāḥ | agne | akran | gavām | catvāri | dadataḥ | sahasrā || r̥ṇam-cayasya | pra-yatā | maghāni | prati | agrabhīṣma | nr̥-tamasya | nr̥ṇām ||5.30.12||

IAST: supeśasam māva sṛjanty astaṁ gavāṁ sahasrai ruśamāso agne
Griffith: The Rusamas, O Agni, sent me homeward with fair adornment and with kine in thousands.
Devanāgarī: सुपेशसं माव सृजन्त्यस्तं गवां सहस्रै रुशमासो अग्ने
pada pāṭha: su-peśasam | mā | ava | sr̥janti | astam | gavām | sahasraiḥ | ruśamāsaḥ | agne || tīvrāḥ | indram | amamanduḥ | sutāsaḥ | aktoḥ | vi-uṣṭau | pari-takmyāyāḥ ||5.30.13||

IAST: tīvrā indram amamanduḥ sutāso 'ktor vyuṣṭau paritakmyāyāḥ
Griffith: The strong libations have made Indra joyful, when night, whose course was ending, changed to morning.
Devanāgarī: तीव्रा इन्द्रमममन्दुः सुतासोऽक्तोर्व्युष्टौ परितक्म्यायाः
pada pāṭha: su-peśasam | mā | ava | sr̥janti | astam | gavām | sahasraiḥ | ruśamāsaḥ | agne || tīvrāḥ | indram | amamanduḥ | sutāsaḥ | aktoḥ | vi-uṣṭau | pari-takmyāyāḥ ||5.30.13||

IAST: aucchat sā rātrī paritakmyā yām̐ ṛṇaṁcaye rājani ruśamānām
Griffith: Night, well-nigh ended, at Rnancaya's coming, King of the Rusamas, was changed to morning.
Devanāgarī: औच्छत्सा रात्री परितक्म्या याँ ऋणंचये राजनि रुशमानाम्
pada pāṭha: aucchat | sā | rātrī | pari-takmyā | yā | r̥ṇam-caye | rājani | ruśamānām || atyaḥ | na | vājī | raghuḥ | ajyamānaḥ | babhruḥ | catvāri | asanat | sahasrā ||5.30.14||

IAST: atyo na vājī raghur ajyamāno babhruś catvāry asanat sahasrā
Griffith: Like a strong courser, fleet of foot, urged onward, Babhru hath gained four thousand as his guerdon.
Devanāgarī: अत्यो न वाजी रघुरज्यमानो बभ्रुश्चत्वार्यसनत्सहस्रा
pada pāṭha: aucchat | sā | rātrī | pari-takmyā | yā | r̥ṇam-caye | rājani | ruśamānām || atyaḥ | na | vājī | raghuḥ | ajyamānaḥ | babhruḥ | catvāri | asanat | sahasrā ||5.30.14||

IAST: catuḥsahasraṁ gavyasya paśvaḥ praty agrabhīṣma ruśameṣv agne
Griffith: We have received four thousand head of cattle presented by the Rusamas, O Agni.
Devanāgarī: चतुःसहस्रं गव्यस्य पश्वः प्रत्यग्रभीष्म रुशमेष्वग्ने
pada pāṭha: catuḥ-sahasram | gavyasya | paśvaḥ | prati | agrabhīṣma | ruśameṣu | agne || gharmaḥ | cit | taptaḥ | pra-vr̥je | yaḥ | āsīt | ayasmayaḥ | tam | ūm̐ iti | ādāma | viprāḥ ||5.30.15||

IAST: gharmaś cit taptaḥ pravṛje ya āsīd ayasmayas tam v ādāma viprāḥ
Griffith: And we, the singers, have received the caldron of metal which was heated for Pravargya.
Devanāgarī: घर्मश्चित्तप्तः प्रवृजे य आसीदयस्मयस्तम्वादाम विप्राः
pada pāṭha: catuḥ-sahasram | gavyasya | paśvaḥ | prati | agrabhīṣma | ruśameṣu | agne || gharmaḥ | cit | taptaḥ | pra-vr̥je | yaḥ | āsīt | ayasmayaḥ | tam | ūm̐ iti | ādāma | viprāḥ ||5.30.15||

IAST: indro rathāya pravataṁ kṛṇoti yam adhyasthān maghavā vājayantam
Griffith: MAGHAVAN Indra turns his chariot downward, the strength-displaying car which he hath mounted.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रो रथाय प्रवतं कृणोति यमध्यस्थान्मघवा वाजयन्तम्
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | rathāya | pra-vatam | kr̥ṇoti | yam | adhi-asthāt | magha-vā | vāja-yantam || yūthā-iva | paśvaḥ | vi | unoti | gopāḥ | ariṣṭaḥ | yāti | prathamaḥ | sisāsan ||5.31.1||

IAST: yūtheva paśvo vy unoti gopā ariṣṭo yāti prathamaḥ siṣāsan
Griffith: Even as a herdsman driveth forth his cattle, he goeth, first, uninjured, fain for treasure.
Devanāgarī: यूथेव पश्वो व्युनोति गोपा अरिष्टो याति प्रथमः सिषासन्
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | rathāya | pra-vatam | kr̥ṇoti | yam | adhi-asthāt | magha-vā | vāja-yantam || yūthā-iva | paśvaḥ | vi | unoti | gopāḥ | ariṣṭaḥ | yāti | prathamaḥ | sisāsan ||5.31.1||

IAST: ā pra drava harivo mā vi venaḥ piśaṅgarāte abhi naḥ sacasva
Griffith: Haste to us, Lord of Bays; be not ungracious: visit us, lover of gold-hued oblation.
Devanāgarī: आ प्र द्रव हरिवो मा वि वेनः पिशङ्गराते अभि नः सचस्व
pada pāṭha: ā | pra | drava | hari-vaḥ | mā | vi | venaḥ | piśaṅga-rāte | abhi | naḥ | sacasva || nahi | tvat | indra | vasyaḥ | anyat | asti | amenān | cit | jani-vataḥ | cakartha ||5.31.2||

IAST: nahi tvad indra vasyo anyad asty amenām̐ś cij janivataś cakartha
Griffith: There is naught else better than thou art, Indra: e'en to the wifeless hast thou given spouses.
Devanāgarī: नहि त्वदिन्द्र वस्यो अन्यदस्त्यमेनाँश्चिज्जनिवतश्चकर्थ
pada pāṭha: ā | pra | drava | hari-vaḥ | mā | vi | venaḥ | piśaṅga-rāte | abhi | naḥ | sacasva || nahi | tvat | indra | vasyaḥ | anyat | asti | amenān | cit | jani-vataḥ | cakartha ||5.31.2||

IAST: ud yat sahaḥ sahasa ājaniṣṭa dediṣṭa indra indriyāṇi viśvā
Griffith: When out of strength arose the strength that conquers, Indra displayed all powers that he possesses.
Devanāgarī: उद्यत्सहः सहस आजनिष्ट देदिष्ट इन्द्र इन्द्रियाणि विश्वा
pada pāṭha: ut | yat | sahaḥ | sahasaḥ | ā | ajaniṣṭa | dediṣṭe | indraḥ | indriyāṇi | viśvā || pra | acodayat | su-dughāḥ | vavre | antaḥ | vi | jyotiṣā | sam-vavr̥tvat | tamaḥ | avarityavaḥ ||5.31.3||

IAST: prācodayat sudughā vavre antar vi jyotiṣā saṁvavṛtvat tamo 'vaḥ
Griffith: Forth from the cave he drove the milky mothers, and with the light laid bare investing darkness.
Devanāgarī: प्राचोदयत्सुदुघा वव्रे अन्तर्वि ज्योतिषा संववृत्वत्तमोऽवः
pada pāṭha: ut | yat | sahaḥ | sahasaḥ | ā | ajaniṣṭa | dediṣṭe | indraḥ | indriyāṇi | viśvā || pra | acodayat | su-dughāḥ | vavre | antaḥ | vi | jyotiṣā | sam-vavr̥tvat | tamaḥ | avarityavaḥ ||5.31.3||

IAST: anavas te ratham aśvāya takṣan tvaṣṭā vajram puruhūta dyumantam
Griffith: Anus have wrought a chariot for thy Courser, and Tvastar, Much-invoked! thy bolt that glitters.
Devanāgarī: अनवस्ते रथमश्वाय तक्षन्त्वष्टा वज्रं पुरुहूत द्युमन्तम्
pada pāṭha: anavaḥ | te | ratham | aśvāya | takṣan | tvaṣṭā | vajram | puru-hūta | dyu-mantam || brahmāṇaḥ | indram | mahayantaḥ | arkaiḥ | avardhayan | ahaye | hantavai | ūm̐ iti ||5.31.4||

IAST: brahmāṇa indram mahayanto arkair avardhayann ahaye hantavā u
Griffith: The Brahmans with their songs exalting Indra increased his strength that he might slaughter Ahi.
Devanāgarī: ब्रह्माण इन्द्रं महयन्तो अर्कैरवर्धयन्नहये हन्तवा उ
pada pāṭha: anavaḥ | te | ratham | aśvāya | takṣan | tvaṣṭā | vajram | puru-hūta | dyu-mantam || brahmāṇaḥ | indram | mahayantaḥ | arkaiḥ | avardhayan | ahaye | hantavai | ūm̐ iti ||5.31.4||

IAST: vṛṣṇe yat te vṛṣaṇo arkam arcān indra grāvāṇo aditiḥ sajoṣāḥ
Griffith: When heroes sang their laud to thee the Hero, Indra! and stones and Aditi accordant,
Devanāgarī: वृष्णे यत्ते वृषणो अर्कमर्चानिन्द्र ग्रावाणो अदितिः सजोषाः
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣṇe | yat | te | vr̥ṣaṇaḥ | arkam | arcān | indra | grāvāṇaḥ | aditiḥ | sa-joṣāḥ || anaśvāsaḥ | ye | pavayaḥ | arathāḥ | indra-iṣitāḥ | abhi | avartanta | dasyūn ||5.31.5||

IAST: anaśvāso ye pavayo 'rathā indreṣitā abhy avartanta dasyūn
Griffith: Without or steed or chariot were the fellies which, sped by Indra, rolled upon the Dasytis.
Devanāgarī: अनश्वासो ये पवयोऽरथा इन्द्रेषिता अभ्यवर्तन्त दस्यून्
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣṇe | yat | te | vr̥ṣaṇaḥ | arkam | arcān | indra | grāvāṇaḥ | aditiḥ | sa-joṣāḥ || anaśvāsaḥ | ye | pavayaḥ | arathāḥ | indra-iṣitāḥ | abhi | avartanta | dasyūn ||5.31.5||

IAST: pra te pūrvāṇi karaṇāni vocam pra nūtanā maghavan yā cakartha
Griffith: I will declare thine exploits wrought aforetime, and, Maghavan, thy deeds of late achievement,
Devanāgarī: प्र ते पूर्वाणि करणानि वोचं प्र नूतना मघवन्या चकर्थ
pada pāṭha: pra | te | pūrvāṇi | karaṇāni | vocam | pra | nūtanā | magha-van | yā | cakartha || śakti-vaḥ | yat | vi-bharāḥ | rodasī iti | ubhe iti | jayan | apaḥ | manave | dānu-citrāḥ ||5.31.6||

IAST: śaktīvo yad vibharā rodasī ubhe jayann apo manave dānucitrāḥ
Griffith: When, Lord of Might, thou sunderedst earth and heaven, winning for man the moistly-gleaming waters.
Devanāgarī: शक्तीवो यद्विभरा रोदसी उभे जयन्नपो मनवे दानुचित्राः
pada pāṭha: pra | te | pūrvāṇi | karaṇāni | vocam | pra | nūtanā | magha-van | yā | cakartha || śakti-vaḥ | yat | vi-bharāḥ | rodasī iti | ubhe iti | jayan | apaḥ | manave | dānu-citrāḥ ||5.31.6||

IAST: tad in nu te karaṇaṁ dasma viprāhiṁ yad ghnann ojo atrāmimīthāḥ
Griffith: This is thy deed, e'en this, Wonderful! Singer! that, slaying Ahi, here thy strength thou showedst,
Devanāgarī: तदिन्नु ते करणं दस्म विप्राहिं यद्घ्नन्नोजो अत्रामिमीथाः
pada pāṭha: tat | it | nu | te | karaṇam | dasma | vipra | ahim | yat | ghnan | ojaḥ | atra | amimīthāḥ || śuṣṇasya | cit | pari | māyāḥ | agr̥bhṇāḥ | pra-pitvam | yan | apa | dasyūn | asedhaḥ ||5.31.7||

IAST: śuṣṇasya cit pari māyā agṛbhṇāḥ prapitvaṁ yann apa dasyūm̐r asedhaḥ
Griffith: Didst check and stay e'en gusna's wiles and magic, and, drawing nigh, didst chase away the Dasytis.
Devanāgarī: शुष्णस्य चित्परि माया अगृभ्णाः प्रपित्वं यन्नप दस्यूँरसेधः
pada pāṭha: tat | it | nu | te | karaṇam | dasma | vipra | ahim | yat | ghnan | ojaḥ | atra | amimīthāḥ || śuṣṇasya | cit | pari | māyāḥ | agr̥bhṇāḥ | pra-pitvam | yan | apa | dasyūn | asedhaḥ ||5.31.7||

IAST: tvam apo yadave turvaśāyāramayaḥ sudughāḥ pāra indra
Griffith: Thou, Indra, on the farther bank forYadu and Turvaga didst stay the gushing waters.
Devanāgarī: त्वमपो यदवे तुर्वशायारमयः सुदुघाः पार इन्द्र
pada pāṭha: tvam | apaḥ | yadave | turvaśāya | aramayaḥ | su-dughāḥ | pāraḥ | indra || ugram | ayātam | avahaḥ | ha | kutsam | sam | ha | yat | vām | uśanā | aranta | devāḥ ||5.31.8||

IAST: ugram ayātam avaho ha kutsaṁ saṁ ha yad vām uśanāranta devāḥ
Griffith: Ye both assailed the fierce: thou barest Kutsa: when Gods and Usana came to you together.
Devanāgarī: उग्रमयातमवहो ह कुत्सं सं ह यद्वामुशनारन्त देवाः
pada pāṭha: tvam | apaḥ | yadave | turvaśāya | aramayaḥ | su-dughāḥ | pāraḥ | indra || ugram | ayātam | avahaḥ | ha | kutsam | sam | ha | yat | vām | uśanā | aranta | devāḥ ||5.31.8||

IAST: indrākutsā vahamānā rathenā vām atyā api karṇe vahantu
Griffith: Let the steeds bring you both, Indra and Kutsa, borne on the chariot within hearing-distance.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्राकुत्सा वहमाना रथेना वामत्या अपि कर्णे वहन्तु
pada pāṭha: indrākutsā | vahamānā | rathena | ā | vām | atyāḥ | api | karṇe | vahantu || niḥ | sīm | at-bhyaḥ | dhamathaḥ | niḥ | sadha-sthāt | maghonaḥ | hr̥daḥ | varathaḥ | tamāṁsi ||5.31.9||

IAST: niḥ ṣīm adbhyo dhamatho niḥ ṣadhasthān maghono hṛdo varathas tamāṁsi
Griffith: Ye blew him from the waters, from his dwelling, and chased the darkness from the noble's spirit.
Devanāgarī: निः षीमद्भ्यो धमथो निः षधस्थान्मघोनो हृदो वरथस्तमांसि
pada pāṭha: indrākutsā | vahamānā | rathena | ā | vām | atyāḥ | api | karṇe | vahantu || niḥ | sīm | at-bhyaḥ | dhamathaḥ | niḥ | sadha-sthāt | maghonaḥ | hr̥daḥ | varathaḥ | tamāṁsi ||5.31.9||

IAST: vātasya yuktān suyujaś cid aśvān kaviś cid eṣo ajagann avasyuḥ
Griffith: Even this sage hath come looking for succour even to Vata's docile harnessed horses.
Devanāgarī: वातस्य युक्तान्सुयुजश्चिदश्वान्कविश्चिदेषो अजगन्नवस्युः
pada pāṭha: vātasya | yuktān | su-yujaḥ | cit | aśvān | kaviḥ | cit | eṣaḥ | ajagan | avasyuḥ || viśve | te | atra | marutaḥ | sakhāyaḥ | indra | brahmāṇi | taviṣīm | avardhan ||5.31.10||

IAST: viśve te atra marutaḥ sakhāya indra brahmāṇi taviṣīm avardhan
Griffith: Here are the Maruts, all, thy dear companions: prayers have increased thy power and might, O Indra.
Devanāgarī: विश्वे ते अत्र मरुतः सखाय इन्द्र ब्रह्माणि तविषीमवर्धन्
pada pāṭha: vātasya | yuktān | su-yujaḥ | cit | aśvān | kaviḥ | cit | eṣaḥ | ajagan | avasyuḥ || viśve | te | atra | marutaḥ | sakhāyaḥ | indra | brahmāṇi | taviṣīm | avardhan ||5.31.10||

IAST: sūraś cid ratham paritakmyāyām pūrvaṁ karad uparaṁ jūjuvāṁsam
Griffith: When night was near its close he carried forward e'en the Sun's chariot backward in its running.
Devanāgarī: सूरश्चिद्रथं परितक्म्यायां पूर्वं करदुपरं जूजुवांसम्
pada pāṭha: sūraḥ | cit | ratham | pari-takmyāyām | pūrvam | karat | uparam | jūju-vāṁsam || bharat | cakram | etaśaḥ | sam | riṇāti | puraḥ | dadhat | saniṣyati | kratum | naḥ ||5.31.11||

IAST: bharac cakram etaśaḥ saṁ riṇāti puro dadhat saniṣyati kratuṁ naḥ
Griffith: Etaga brought his wheel and firmly stays it: setting it eastward he shall give us courage.
Devanāgarī: भरच्चक्रमेतशः सं रिणाति पुरो दधत्सनिष्यति क्रतुं नः
pada pāṭha: sūraḥ | cit | ratham | pari-takmyāyām | pūrvam | karat | uparam | jūju-vāṁsam || bharat | cakram | etaśaḥ | sam | riṇāti | puraḥ | dadhat | saniṣyati | kratum | naḥ ||5.31.11||

IAST: āyaṁ janā abhicakṣe jagāmendraḥ sakhāyaṁ sutasomam icchan
Griffith: This Indra, O ye men, hath come to see you, seeking a friend who hath expressed the Soma.
Devanāgarī: आयं जना अभिचक्षे जगामेन्द्रः सखायं सुतसोममिच्छन्
pada pāṭha: ā | ayam | janāḥ | abhi-cakṣe | jagāma | indraḥ | sakhāyam | suta-somam | icchan || vadan | grāvā | ava | vedim | bhriyāte | yasya | jīram | adhvaryavaḥ | caranti ||5.31.12||

IAST: vadan grāvāva vedim bhriyāte yasya jīram adhvaryavaś caranti
Griffith: The creaking stone is laid upon the altar, and the Adhvaryus come to turn it quickly.
Devanāgarī: वदन्ग्रावाव वेदिं भ्रियाते यस्य जीरमध्वर्यवश्चरन्ति
pada pāṭha: ā | ayam | janāḥ | abhi-cakṣe | jagāma | indraḥ | sakhāyam | suta-somam | icchan || vadan | grāvā | ava | vedim | bhriyāte | yasya | jīram | adhvaryavaḥ | caranti ||5.31.12||

IAST: ye cākananta cākananta nū te martā amṛta mo te aṁha āran
Griffith: Let mortals who were happy still be happy; let them not come to sorrow, O Immortal.
Devanāgarī: ये चाकनन्त चाकनन्त नू ते मर्ता अमृत मो ते अंह आरन्
pada pāṭha: ye | cākananta | cākananta | nu | te | martāḥ | amr̥ta | mo iti | te | aṁhaḥ | ā | aran || vavandhi | yajyūn | uta | teṣu | dhehi | ojaḥ | janeṣu | yeṣu | te | syāma ||5.31.13||

IAST: vāvandhi yajyūm̐r uta teṣu dhehy ojo janeṣu yeṣu te syāma
Griffith: Love thou the pious, and to these thy people-with whom may we be numbered-give thou vigour.
Devanāgarī: वावन्धि यज्यूँरुत तेषु धेह्योजो जनेषु येषु ते स्याम
pada pāṭha: ye | cākananta | cākananta | nu | te | martāḥ | amr̥ta | mo iti | te | aṁhaḥ | ā | aran || vavandhi | yajyūn | uta | teṣu | dhehi | ojaḥ | janeṣu | yeṣu | te | syāma ||5.31.13||

IAST: adardar utsam asṛjo vi khāni tvam arṇavān badbadhānām̐ aramṇāḥ
Griffith: THE well thou clavest, settest free the fountains, and gavest rest to floods that were obstructed.
Devanāgarī: अदर्दरुत्समसृजो वि खानि त्वमर्णवान्बद्बधानाँ अरम्णाः
pada pāṭha: adardaḥ | utsam | asr̥jaḥ | vi | khāni | tvam | arṇavān | badbadhānān | aramṇāḥ || mahāntam | indra | parvatam | vi | yat | variti vaḥ | sr̥jaḥ | vi | dhārāḥ | ava | dānavam | hanniti han ||5.32.1||

IAST: mahāntam indra parvataṁ vi yad vaḥ sṛjo vi dhārā ava dānavaṁ han
Griffith: Thou, Indra, laying the great mountain open, slaying the Danava, didst loose the torrents.
Devanāgarī: महान्तमिन्द्र पर्वतं वि यद्वः सृजो वि धारा अव दानवं हन्
pada pāṭha: adardaḥ | utsam | asr̥jaḥ | vi | khāni | tvam | arṇavān | badbadhānān | aramṇāḥ || mahāntam | indra | parvatam | vi | yat | variti vaḥ | sr̥jaḥ | vi | dhārāḥ | ava | dānavam | hanniti han ||5.32.1||

IAST: tvam utsām̐ ṛtubhir badbadhānām̐ araṁha ūdhaḥ parvatasya vajrin
Griffith: The fountain-depths obstructed in their seasons, thou, Thunderer! madest flow, the mountain's udder.
Devanāgarī: त्वमुत्साँ ऋतुभिर्बद्बधानाँ अरंह ऊधः पर्वतस्य वज्रिन्
pada pāṭha: tvam | utsān | r̥tu-bhiḥ | badbadhānān | araṁhaḥ | ūdhaḥ | parvatasya | vajrin || ahim | cit | ugra | pra-yutam | śayānam | jaghanvān | indra | taviṣīm | adhatthāḥ ||5.32.2||

IAST: ahiṁ cid ugra prayutaṁ śayānaṁ jaghanvām̐ indra taviṣīm adhatthāḥ
Griffith: Strong Indra, thou by slaying e'en the Dragon that lay extended there hast shown thy vigour.
Devanāgarī: अहिं चिदुग्र प्रयुतं शयानं जघन्वाँ इन्द्र तविषीमधत्थाः
pada pāṭha: tvam | utsān | r̥tu-bhiḥ | badbadhānān | araṁhaḥ | ūdhaḥ | parvatasya | vajrin || ahim | cit | ugra | pra-yutam | śayānam | jaghanvān | indra | taviṣīm | adhatthāḥ ||5.32.2||

IAST: tyasya cin mahato nir mṛgasya vadhar jaghāna taviṣībhir indraḥ
Griffith: Indra with violence smote down the weapon, yea, even of that wild and mighty creature.
Devanāgarī: त्यस्य चिन्महतो निर्मृगस्य वधर्जघान तविषीभिरिन्द्रः
pada pāṭha: tyasya | cit | mahataḥ | niḥ | mr̥gasya | vadhaḥ | jaghāna | taviṣībhiḥ | indraḥ || yaḥ | ekaḥ | it | apratiḥ | manyamānaḥ | āt | asmāt | anyaḥ | ajaniṣṭa | tavyān ||5.32.3||

IAST: ya eka id apratir manyamāna ād asmād anyo ajaniṣṭa tavyān
Griffith: Although he deemed himself alone unequalled, another had been born e'en yet more potent.
Devanāgarī: य एक इदप्रतिर्मन्यमान आदस्मादन्यो अजनिष्ट तव्यान्
pada pāṭha: tyasya | cit | mahataḥ | niḥ | mr̥gasya | vadhaḥ | jaghāna | taviṣībhiḥ | indraḥ || yaḥ | ekaḥ | it | apratiḥ | manyamānaḥ | āt | asmāt | anyaḥ | ajaniṣṭa | tavyān ||5.32.3||

IAST: tyaṁ cid eṣāṁ svadhayā madantam miho napātaṁ suvṛdhaṁ tamogām
Griffith: Him, whom the heavenly food of these delighted, child of the mist, strong waxing, couched in darkness,
Devanāgarī: त्यं चिदेषां स्वधया मदन्तं मिहो नपातं सुवृधं तमोगाम्
pada pāṭha: tyam | cit | eṣām | svadhayā | madantam | mihaḥ | napātam | su-vr̥dham | tamaḥ-gām || vr̥ṣa-prabharmā | dānavasya | bhāmam | vajreṇa | vajrī | ni | jaghāna | śuṣṇam ||5.32.4||

IAST: vṛṣaprabharmā dānavasya bhāmaṁ vajreṇa vajrī ni jaghāna śuṣṇam
Griffith: Him the bolt-hurling Thunderer with his lightning smote down and slew, the Danava's wrath-fire, Susna.
Devanāgarī: वृषप्रभर्मा दानवस्य भामं वज्रेण वज्री नि जघान शुष्णम्
pada pāṭha: tyam | cit | eṣām | svadhayā | madantam | mihaḥ | napātam | su-vr̥dham | tamaḥ-gām || vr̥ṣa-prabharmā | dānavasya | bhāmam | vajreṇa | vajrī | ni | jaghāna | śuṣṇam ||5.32.4||

IAST: tyaṁ cid asya kratubhir niṣattam amarmaṇo vidad id asya marma
Griffith: Though he might ne'er be wounded still his vitals felt that, the God's bolt, which his powers supported,
Devanāgarī: त्यं चिदस्य क्रतुभिर्निषत्तममर्मणो विददिदस्य मर्म
pada pāṭha: tyam | cit | asya | kratu-bhiḥ | ni-sattam | amarmaṇaḥ | vidat | it | asya | marma || yat | īm | su-kṣatra | pra-bhr̥tā | madasya | yuyutsantam | tamasi | harmye | dhāḥ ||5.32.5||

IAST: yad īṁ sukṣatra prabhṛtā madasya yuyutsantaṁ tamasi harmye dhāḥ
Griffith: When, after offered draughts, Strong Lord, thou laidest him, fain to battle, in the pit in darkness.
Devanāgarī: यदीं सुक्षत्र प्रभृता मदस्य युयुत्सन्तं तमसि हर्म्ये धाः
pada pāṭha: tyam | cit | asya | kratu-bhiḥ | ni-sattam | amarmaṇaḥ | vidat | it | asya | marma || yat | īm | su-kṣatra | pra-bhr̥tā | madasya | yuyutsantam | tamasi | harmye | dhāḥ ||5.32.5||

IAST: tyaṁ cid itthā katpayaṁ śayānam asūrye tamasi vāvṛdhānam
Griffith: Him as he lay there huge in length extended, still waxing in the gloom which no sun lightened,
Devanāgarī: त्यं चिदित्था कत्पयं शयानमसूर्ये तमसि वावृधानम्
pada pāṭha: tyam | cit | itthā | katpayam | śayānam | asūrye | tamasi | vavr̥dhānam || tam | cit | mandānaḥ | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | sutasya | uccaiḥ | indraḥ | apa-gūrya | jaghāna ||5.32.6||

IAST: taṁ cin mandāno vṛṣabhaḥ sutasyoccair indro apagūryā jaghāna
Griffith: Him, after loud-voiced threats, the Hero Indra, rejoicing in the poured libation, slaughtered.
Devanāgarī: तं चिन्मन्दानो वृषभः सुतस्योच्चैरिन्द्रो अपगूर्या जघान
pada pāṭha: tyam | cit | itthā | katpayam | śayānam | asūrye | tamasi | vavr̥dhānam || tam | cit | mandānaḥ | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | sutasya | uccaiḥ | indraḥ | apa-gūrya | jaghāna ||5.32.6||

IAST: ud yad indro mahate dānavāya vadhar yamiṣṭa saho apratītam
Griffith: When 'gainst the mighty Danava his weapon Indra uplifted, power which none could combat,
Devanāgarī: उद्यदिन्द्रो महते दानवाय वधर्यमिष्ट सहो अप्रतीतम्
pada pāṭha: ut | yat | indraḥ | mahate | dānavāya | vadhaḥ | yamiṣṭa | sahaḥ | aprati-itam || yat | īm | vajrasya | pra-bhr̥tau | dadābha | viśvasya | jantoḥ | adhamam | cakāra ||5.32.7||

IAST: yad īṁ vajrasya prabhṛtau dadābha viśvasya jantor adhamaṁ cakāra
Griffith: When at the hurling of his bolt he smote him, he made him lower than all living creatures.
Devanāgarī: यदीं वज्रस्य प्रभृतौ ददाभ विश्वस्य जन्तोरधमं चकार
pada pāṭha: ut | yat | indraḥ | mahate | dānavāya | vadhaḥ | yamiṣṭa | sahaḥ | aprati-itam || yat | īm | vajrasya | pra-bhr̥tau | dadābha | viśvasya | jantoḥ | adhamam | cakāra ||5.32.7||

IAST: tyaṁ cid arṇam madhupaṁ śayānam asinvaṁ vavram mahy ādad ugraḥ
Griffith: The fierce God seized that huge and restless coiler, insatiate, drinker of the sweets, recumbent,
Devanāgarī: त्यं चिदर्णं मधुपं शयानमसिन्वं वव्रं मह्याददुग्रः
pada pāṭha: tyam | cit | arṇam | madhu-pam | śayānam | asinvam | vavram | mahi | ādat | ugraḥ || apādam | atram | mahatā | vadhena | ni | duryoṇe | avr̥ṇak | mr̥dhra-vācam ||5.32.8||

IAST: apādam atram mahatā vadhena ni duryoṇa āvṛṇaṅ mṛdhravācam
Griffith: And with his mighty weapon in his dwelling smote down the footless evil-speaking ogre.
Devanāgarī: अपादमत्रं महता वधेन नि दुर्योण आवृणङ्मृध्रवाचम्
pada pāṭha: tyam | cit | arṇam | madhu-pam | śayānam | asinvam | vavram | mahi | ādat | ugraḥ || apādam | atram | mahatā | vadhena | ni | duryoṇe | avr̥ṇak | mr̥dhra-vācam ||5.32.8||

IAST: ko asya śuṣmaṁ taviṣīṁ varāta eko dhanā bharate apratītaḥ
Griffith: Who may arrest his strength or cheek his vigour? Alone, resistless, he bears off all riches.
Devanāgarī: को अस्य शुष्मं तविषीं वरात एको धना भरते अप्रतीतः
pada pāṭha: kaḥ | asya | śuṣmam | taviṣīm | varāte | ekaḥ | dhanā | bharate | aprati-itaḥ || ime iti | cit | asya | jrayasaḥ | nu | devī iti | indrasya | ojasaḥ | bhiyasā | jihāte iti ||5.32.9||

IAST: ime cid asya jrayaso nu devī indrasyaujaso bhiyasā jihāte
Griffith: Even these Twain, these Goddesses, through terror of Indra's might, retire from his dominion.
Devanāgarī: इमे चिदस्य ज्रयसो नु देवी इन्द्रस्यौजसो भियसा जिहाते
pada pāṭha: kaḥ | asya | śuṣmam | taviṣīm | varāte | ekaḥ | dhanā | bharate | aprati-itaḥ || ime iti | cit | asya | jrayasaḥ | nu | devī iti | indrasya | ojasaḥ | bhiyasā | jihāte iti ||5.32.9||

IAST: ny asmai devī svadhitir jihīta indrāya gātur uśatīva yeme
Griffith: E'en the Celestial Axe bows down before him, and the Earth, lover-like, gives way to Indra.
Devanāgarī: न्यस्मै देवी स्वधितिर्जिहीत इन्द्राय गातुरुशतीव येमे
pada pāṭha: ni | asmai | devī | sva-dhitiḥ | jihīte | indrāya | gātuḥ | uśatī-iva | yeme || sam | yat | ojaḥ | yuvate | viśvam | ābhiḥ | anu | svadhā-vne | kṣitayaḥ | namanta ||5.32.10||

IAST: saṁ yad ojo yuvate viśvam ābhir anu svadhāvne kṣitayo namanta
Griffith: As he imparts all vigour to these people, straightway the folk bend them to him the Godlike.
Devanāgarī: सं यदोजो युवते विश्वमाभिरनु स्वधाव्ने क्षितयो नमन्त
pada pāṭha: ni | asmai | devī | sva-dhitiḥ | jihīte | indrāya | gātuḥ | uśatī-iva | yeme || sam | yat | ojaḥ | yuvate | viśvam | ābhiḥ | anu | svadhā-vne | kṣitayaḥ | namanta ||5.32.10||

IAST: ekaṁ nu tvā satpatim pāñcajanyaṁ jātaṁ śṛṇomi yaśasaṁ janeṣu
Griffith: I hear that thou wast born sole Lord of heroes of the Five Races, famed among the people.
Devanāgarī: एकं नु त्वा सत्पतिं पाञ्चजन्यं जातं शृणोमि यशसं जनेषु
pada pāṭha: ekam | nu | tvā | sat-patim | pāñca-janyam | jātam | śr̥ṇomi | yaśasam | janeṣu || tam | me | jagr̥bhre | ā-śasaḥ | naviṣṭham | doṣā | vastoḥ | havamānāsaḥ | indram ||5.32.11||

IAST: tam me jagṛbhra āśaso naviṣṭhaṁ doṣā vastor havamānāsa indram
Griffith: As such my wishes have most lately grasped him, invoking Indra both at eve and morning.
Devanāgarī: तं मे जगृभ्र आशसो नविष्ठं दोषा वस्तोर्हवमानास इन्द्रम्
pada pāṭha: ekam | nu | tvā | sat-patim | pāñca-janyam | jātam | śr̥ṇomi | yaśasam | janeṣu || tam | me | jagr̥bhre | ā-śasaḥ | naviṣṭham | doṣā | vastoḥ | havamānāsaḥ | indram ||5.32.11||

IAST: evā hi tvām ṛtuthā yātayantam maghā viprebhyo dadataṁ śṛṇomi
Griffith: So, too, I hear of thee as in due season urging to action and enriching singers.
Devanāgarī: एवा हि त्वामृतुथा यातयन्तं मघा विप्रेभ्यो ददतं शृणोमि
pada pāṭha: eva | hi | tvām | r̥tu-thā | yātayantam | maghā | viprebhyaḥ | dadatam | śr̥ṇomi || kim | te | brahmāṇaḥ | gr̥hate | sakhāyaḥ | ye | tvā-yā | ni-dadhuḥ | kāmam | indra ||5.32.12||

IAST: kiṁ te brahmāṇo gṛhate sakhāyo ye tvāyā nidadhuḥ kāmam indra
Griffith: What have thy friends received from thee, the Brahmans who, faithful, rest their hopes on thee, O Indra?
Devanāgarī: किं ते ब्रह्माणो गृहते सखायो ये त्वाया निदधुः काममिन्द्र
pada pāṭha: eva | hi | tvām | r̥tu-thā | yātayantam | maghā | viprebhyaḥ | dadatam | śr̥ṇomi || kim | te | brahmāṇaḥ | gr̥hate | sakhāyaḥ | ye | tvā-yā | ni-dadhuḥ | kāmam | indra ||5.32.12||

IAST: mahi mahe tavase dīdhye nṝn indrāyetthā tavase atavyān
Griffith: GREAT praise to Indra, great and strong mid heroes, I ponder thus, the feeble to the Mighty,
Devanāgarī: महि महे तवसे दीध्ये नॄनिन्द्रायेत्था तवसे अतव्यान्
pada pāṭha: mahi | mahe | tavase | dīdhye | nr̥̄n | indrāya | itthā | tavase | atavyān || yaḥ | asmai | su-matim | vāja-sātau | stutaḥ | jane | sa-maryaḥ | ciketa ||5.33.1||

IAST: yo asmai sumatiṁ vājasātau stuto jane samaryaś ciketa
Griffith: Who with his band shows favour to this people, when lauded, in the fight where spoil is gathered.
Devanāgarī: यो अस्मै सुमतिं वाजसातौ स्तुतो जने समर्यश्चिकेत
pada pāṭha: mahi | mahe | tavase | dīdhye | nr̥̄n | indrāya | itthā | tavase | atavyān || yaḥ | asmai | su-matim | vāja-sātau | stutaḥ | jane | sa-maryaḥ | ciketa ||5.33.1||

IAST: sa tvaṁ na indra dhiyasāno arkair harīṇāṁ vṛṣan yoktram aśreḥ
Griffith: So made attentive by our hymns, Steer! Indra! thou fastenedst the girth of thy Bay Coursers,
Devanāgarī: स त्वं न इन्द्र धियसानो अर्कैर्हरीणां वृषन्योक्त्रमश्रेः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | tvam | naḥ | indra | dhiyasānaḥ | arkaiḥ | harīṇām | vr̥ṣan | yoktram | aśreḥ || yāḥ | itthā | magha-van | anu | joṣam | vakṣaḥ | abhi | pra | aryaḥ | sakṣi | janān ||5.33.2||

IAST: yā itthā maghavann anu joṣaṁ vakṣo abhi prāryaḥ sakṣi janān
Griffith: Which, Maghavan, at thy will thou drivest hither. With these subdue for us the men who hate us.
Devanāgarī: या इत्था मघवन्ननु जोषं वक्षो अभि प्रार्यः सक्षि जनान्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | tvam | naḥ | indra | dhiyasānaḥ | arkaiḥ | harīṇām | vr̥ṣan | yoktram | aśreḥ || yāḥ | itthā | magha-van | anu | joṣam | vakṣaḥ | abhi | pra | aryaḥ | sakṣi | janān ||5.33.2||

IAST: na te ta indrābhy asmad ṛṣvāyuktāso abrahmatā yad asan
Griffith: They were not turned to us-wtrd, lofty Indra! while yet through lack of prayer they stood unharnessed.
Devanāgarī: न ते त इन्द्राभ्यस्मदृष्वायुक्तासो अब्रह्मता यदसन्
pada pāṭha: na | te | te | indra | abhi | asmat | r̥ṣva | ayuktāsaḥ | abrahmatā | yat | asan || tiṣṭha | ratham | adhi | tam | vajra-hasta | ā | raśmim | deva | yamase | su-aśvaḥ ||5.33.3||

IAST: tiṣṭhā ratham adhi taṁ vajrahastā raśmiṁ deva yamase svaśvaḥ
Griffith: Ascend this chariot, thou whose hand wields thunder, and draw the rein, O Lord of noble horses.
Devanāgarī: तिष्ठा रथमधि तं वज्रहस्ता रश्मिं देव यमसे स्वश्वः
pada pāṭha: na | te | te | indra | abhi | asmat | r̥ṣva | ayuktāsaḥ | abrahmatā | yat | asan || tiṣṭha | ratham | adhi | tam | vajra-hasta | ā | raśmim | deva | yamase | su-aśvaḥ ||5.33.3||

IAST: purū yat ta indra santy ukthā gave cakarthorvarāsu yudhyan
Griffith: Thou, because many lauds are thine, O Indra, wast active warring in the fields for cattle.
Devanāgarī: पुरू यत्त इन्द्र सन्त्युक्था गवे चकर्थोर्वरासु युध्यन्
pada pāṭha: puru | yat | te | indra | santi | ukthā | gave | cakartha | urvarāsu | yudhyan || tatakṣe | sūryāya | cit | okasi | sve | vr̥ṣā | samat-su | dāsasya | nāma | cit ||5.33.4||

IAST: tatakṣe sūryāya cid okasi sve vṛṣā samatsu dāsasya nāma cit
Griffith: For Surya in his own abode thou, Hero, formedst in fights even a Dasa's nature.
Devanāgarī: ततक्षे सूर्याय चिदोकसि स्वे वृषा समत्सु दासस्य नाम चित्
pada pāṭha: puru | yat | te | indra | santi | ukthā | gave | cakartha | urvarāsu | yudhyan || tatakṣe | sūryāya | cit | okasi | sve | vr̥ṣā | samat-su | dāsasya | nāma | cit ||5.33.4||

IAST: vayaṁ te ta indra ye ca naraḥ śardho jajñānā yātāś ca rathāḥ
Griffith: Thine are we, Indra; thine are all these people, conscious of might, whose cars are set in motion.
Devanāgarī: वयं ते त इन्द्र ये च नरः शर्धो जज्ञाना याताश्च रथाः
pada pāṭha: vayam | te | te | indra | ye | ca | naraḥ | śardhaḥ | jajñānāḥ | yātāḥ | ca | rathāḥ || ā | asmān | jagamyāt | ahi-śuṣma | satvā | bhagaḥ | na | havyaḥ | pra-bhr̥theṣu | cāruḥ ||5.33.5||

IAST: āsmāñ jagamyād ahiśuṣma satvā bhago na havyaḥ prabhṛtheṣu cāruḥ
Griffith: Some hero come to us, O Strong as Ahi beauteous in war, to be invoked like Bhaga.
Devanāgarī: आस्माञ्जगम्यादहिशुष्म सत्वा भगो न हव्यः प्रभृथेषु चारुः
pada pāṭha: vayam | te | te | indra | ye | ca | naraḥ | śardhaḥ | jajñānāḥ | yātāḥ | ca | rathāḥ || ā | asmān | jagamyāt | ahi-śuṣma | satvā | bhagaḥ | na | havyaḥ | pra-bhr̥theṣu | cāruḥ ||5.33.5||

IAST: papṛkṣeṇyam indra tve hy ojo nṛmṇāni ca nṛtamāno amartaḥ
Griffith: Strength much to be desired is in thee, Indra: the Immortal dances forth his hero exploits.
Devanāgarī: पपृक्षेण्यमिन्द्र त्वे ह्योजो नृम्णानि च नृतमानो अमर्तः
pada pāṭha: papr̥kṣeṇyam | indra | tve iti | hi | ojaḥ | nr̥mṇāni | ca | nr̥tamānaḥ | amartaḥ || saḥ | naḥ | enīm | vasavānaḥ | rayim | dāḥ | pra | aryaḥ | stuṣe | tuvi-maghasya | dānam ||5.33.6||

IAST: sa na enīṁ vasavāno rayiṁ dāḥ prāryaḥ stuṣe tuvimaghasya dānam
Griffith: Such, Lord of Treasure, give us splendid riches. I praise the Friend's gift, his whose wealth is mighty
Devanāgarī: स न एनीं वसवानो रयिं दाः प्रार्यः स्तुषे तुविमघस्य दानम्
pada pāṭha: papr̥kṣeṇyam | indra | tve iti | hi | ojaḥ | nr̥mṇāni | ca | nr̥tamānaḥ | amartaḥ || saḥ | naḥ | enīm | vasavānaḥ | rayim | dāḥ | pra | aryaḥ | stuṣe | tuvi-maghasya | dānam ||5.33.6||

IAST: evā na indrotibhir ava pāhi gṛṇataḥ śūra kārūn
Griffith: Thus favour us, O Indra, with ihy succour; Hero, protect the bards who sing thy praises.
Devanāgarī: एवा न इन्द्रोतिभिरव पाहि गृणतः शूर कारून्
pada pāṭha: eva | naḥ | indra | ūti-bhiḥ | ava | pāhi | gr̥ṇataḥ | śūra | kārūn || uta | tvacam | dadataḥ | vāja-sātau | piprīhi | madhvaḥ | su-sutasya | cāroḥ ||5.33.7||

IAST: uta tvacaṁ dadato vājasātau piprīhi madhvaḥ suṣutasya cāroḥ
Griffith: Be friendly in the fray to those who offer the skin of beautiful and well-pressed Soma.
Devanāgarī: उत त्वचं ददतो वाजसातौ पिप्रीहि मध्वः सुषुतस्य चारोः
pada pāṭha: eva | naḥ | indra | ūti-bhiḥ | ava | pāhi | gr̥ṇataḥ | śūra | kārūn || uta | tvacam | dadataḥ | vāja-sātau | piprīhi | madhvaḥ | su-sutasya | cāroḥ ||5.33.7||

IAST: uta tye mā paurukutsyasya sūres trasadasyor hiraṇino rarāṇāḥ
Griffith: And these ten steeds which Trasadasyu gives me, the goldrich chief, the son of Purukutsa,
Devanāgarī: उत त्ये मा पौरुकुत्स्यस्य सूरेस्त्रसदस्योर्हिरणिनो रराणाः
pada pāṭha: uta | tye | mā | pauru-kutsyasya | sūreḥ | trasadasyoḥ | hiraṇinaḥ | rarāṇāḥ || vahantu | mā | daśa | śyetāsaḥ | asya | gairi-kṣitasya | kratu-bhiḥ | nu | saśce ||5.33.8||

IAST: vahantu mā daśa śyetāso asya gairikṣitasya kratubhir nu saśce
Griffith: Resplendent in their brightness shall convey me. Gairiksita willed it and so came I hither.
Devanāgarī: वहन्तु मा दश श्येतासो अस्य गैरिक्षितस्य क्रतुभिर्नु सश्चे
pada pāṭha: uta | tye | mā | pauru-kutsyasya | sūreḥ | trasadasyoḥ | hiraṇinaḥ | rarāṇāḥ || vahantu | mā | daśa | śyetāsaḥ | asya | gairi-kṣitasya | kratu-bhiḥ | nu | saśce ||5.33.8||

IAST: uta tye mā mārutāśvasya śoṇāḥ kratvāmaghāso vidathasya rātau
Griffith: And these, bestowed as sacrificial guerdon, the powerful tawny steeds of Marutasva;
Devanāgarī: उत त्ये मा मारुताश्वस्य शोणाः क्रत्वामघासो विदथस्य रातौ
pada pāṭha: uta | tye | mā | māruta-aśvasya | śoṇāḥ | kratvā-maghāsaḥ | vidathasya | rātau || sahasrā | me | cyavatānaḥ | dadānaḥ | ānūkam | aryaḥ | vapuṣe | na | ārcat ||5.33.9||

IAST: sahasrā me cyavatāno dadāna ānūkam aryo vapuṣe nārcat
Griffith: And thousands which kind Cyavatana gave me, abundantly bestowed for my adornment.
Devanāgarī: सहस्रा मे च्यवतानो ददान आनूकमर्यो वपुषे नार्चत्
pada pāṭha: uta | tye | mā | māruta-aśvasya | śoṇāḥ | kratvā-maghāsaḥ | vidathasya | rātau || sahasrā | me | cyavatānaḥ | dadānaḥ | ānūkam | aryaḥ | vapuṣe | na | ārcat ||5.33.9||

IAST: uta tye mā dhvanyasya juṣṭā lakṣmaṇyasya suruco yatānāḥ
Griffith: And these commended horses, bright and active, by Dhvanya son of Laksmana presented,
Devanāgarī: उत त्ये मा ध्वन्यस्य जुष्टा लक्ष्मण्यस्य सुरुचो यतानाः
pada pāṭha: uta | tye | mā | dhvanyasya | juṣṭāḥ | lakṣmaṇyasya | su-rucaḥ | yatānāḥ || mahnā | rāyaḥ | sam-varaṇasya | r̥ṣeḥ | vrajam | na | gāvaḥ | pra-yatāḥ | api | gman ||5.33.10||

IAST: mahnā rāyaḥ saṁvaraṇasya ṛṣer vrajaṁ na gāvaḥ prayatā api gman
Griffith: Came unto me, as cows into the Rsi Samvarana's stall, with magnitude of riches.
Devanāgarī: मह्ना रायः संवरणस्य ऋषेर्व्रजं न गावः प्रयता अपि ग्मन्
pada pāṭha: uta | tye | mā | dhvanyasya | juṣṭāḥ | lakṣmaṇyasya | su-rucaḥ | yatānāḥ || mahnā | rāyaḥ | sam-varaṇasya | r̥ṣeḥ | vrajam | na | gāvaḥ | pra-yatāḥ | api | gman ||5.33.10||

IAST: ajātaśatrum ajarā svarvaty anu svadhāmitā dasmam īyate
Griffith: BOUNDLESS and wasting not, the heavenly food of Gods goes to the foeless One, doer of wondrous deeds.
Devanāgarī: अजातशत्रुमजरा स्वर्वत्यनु स्वधामिता दस्ममीयते
pada pāṭha: ajāta-śatrum | ajarā | svaḥ-vatī | anu | svadhā | amitā | dasmam | īyate || sunotana | pacata | brahma-vāhase | puru-stutāya | pra-taram | dadhātana ||5.34.1||

IAST: sunotana pacata brahmavāhase puruṣṭutāya prataraṁ dadhātana
Griffith: Press out, make ready, offer gifts with special zeal to him whom many laud, accepter of the prayer.
Devanāgarī: सुनोतन पचत ब्रह्मवाहसे पुरुष्टुताय प्रतरं दधातन
pada pāṭha: ajāta-śatrum | ajarā | svaḥ-vatī | anu | svadhā | amitā | dasmam | īyate || sunotana | pacata | brahma-vāhase | puru-stutāya | pra-taram | dadhātana ||5.34.1||

IAST: ā yaḥ somena jaṭharam apipratāmandata maghavā madhvo andhasaḥ
Griffith: He who filled full his belly with the Soma's juice, Maghavan, was delighted with the meath's sweet draugh
Devanāgarī: आ यः सोमेन जठरमपिप्रतामन्दत मघवा मध्वो अन्धसः
pada pāṭha: ā | yaḥ | somena | jaṭharam | apiprata | amandata | magha-vā | madhvaḥ | andhasaḥ || yat | īm | mr̥gāya | hantave | mahā-vadhaḥ | sahasra-bhr̥ṣṭim | uśanā | vadham | yamat ||5.34.2||

IAST: yad īm mṛgāya hantave mahāvadhaḥ sahasrabhṛṣṭim uśanā vadhaṁ yamat
Griffith: When Usana, that he might slay the monstrous beast, gave him the mighty weapon with a thousand points.
Devanāgarī: यदीं मृगाय हन्तवे महावधः सहस्रभृष्टिमुशना वधं यमत्
pada pāṭha: ā | yaḥ | somena | jaṭharam | apiprata | amandata | magha-vā | madhvaḥ | andhasaḥ || yat | īm | mr̥gāya | hantave | mahā-vadhaḥ | sahasra-bhr̥ṣṭim | uśanā | vadham | yamat ||5.34.2||

IAST: yo asmai ghraṁsa uta vā ya ūdhani somaṁ sunoti bhavati dyumām̐ aha
Griffith: Illustrious is the man whoever presseth out Soma for him in sunshine or in cloud and rain.
Devanāgarī: यो अस्मै घ्रंस उत वा य ऊधनि सोमं सुनोति भवति द्युमाँ अह
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | asmai | ghraṁse | uta | vā | yaḥ | ūdhani | somam | sunoti | bhavati | dyu-mān | aha || apa-apa | śakraḥ | tatanuṣṭim | ūhati | tanū-śubhram | magha-vā | yaḥ | kava-sakhaḥ ||5.34.3||

IAST: apāpa śakras tatanuṣṭim ūhati tanūśubhram maghavā yaḥ kavāsakhaḥ
Griffith: The mighty Maghavan who is the sage's Friend advanceth more and more his beauteous progeny.
Devanāgarī: अपाप शक्रस्ततनुष्टिमूहति तनूशुभ्रं मघवा यः कवासखः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | asmai | ghraṁse | uta | vā | yaḥ | ūdhani | somam | sunoti | bhavati | dyu-mān | aha || apa-apa | śakraḥ | tatanuṣṭim | ūhati | tanū-śubhram | magha-vā | yaḥ | kava-sakhaḥ ||5.34.3||

IAST: yasyāvadhīt pitaraṁ yasya mātaraṁ yasya śakro bhrātaraṁ nāta īṣate
Griffith: The Strong God doth not flee away from him whose sire, whose mother or whose brother he hath done to deat
Devanāgarī: यस्यावधीत्पितरं यस्य मातरं यस्य शक्रो भ्रातरं नात ईषते
pada pāṭha: yasya | avadhīt | pitaram | yasya | mātaram | yasya | śakraḥ | bhrātaram | na | ataḥ | īṣate || veti | it | ūm̐ iti | asya | pra-yatā | yatam-karaḥ | na | kilbiṣāt | īṣate | vasvaḥ | ā-karaḥ ||5.34.4||

IAST: vetīd v asya prayatā yataṁkaro na kilbiṣād īṣate vasva ākaraḥ
Griffith: He, the Avenger, seeketh this man's offered gifts: this God, the source of riches, doth not flee from si
Devanāgarī: वेतीद्वस्य प्रयता यतंकरो न किल्बिषादीषते वस्व आकरः
pada pāṭha: yasya | avadhīt | pitaram | yasya | mātaram | yasya | śakraḥ | bhrātaram | na | ataḥ | īṣate || veti | it | ūm̐ iti | asya | pra-yatā | yatam-karaḥ | na | kilbiṣāt | īṣate | vasvaḥ | ā-karaḥ ||5.34.4||

IAST: na pañcabhir daśabhir vaṣṭy ārabhaṁ nāsunvatā sacate puṣyatā cana
Griffith: He seeks no enterprise with five or ten to aid, nor stays with him who pours no juice though prospering we
Devanāgarī: न पञ्चभिर्दशभिर्वष्ट्यारभं नासुन्वता सचते पुष्यता चन
pada pāṭha: na | pañca-bhiḥ | daśa-bhiḥ | vaṣṭi | ā-rabham | na | asunvatā | sacate | puṣyatā | cana || jināti | vā | it | amuyā | hanti | vā | dhuniḥ | ā | deva-yum | bhajati | go-mati | vraje ||5.34.5||

IAST: jināti ved amuyā hanti vā dhunir ā devayum bhajati gomati vraje
Griffith: The Shaker conquers or slays in this way or that, and to the pious gives a stable full of kine.
Devanāgarī: जिनाति वेदमुया हन्ति वा धुनिरा देवयुं भजति गोमति व्रजे
pada pāṭha: na | pañca-bhiḥ | daśa-bhiḥ | vaṣṭi | ā-rabham | na | asunvatā | sacate | puṣyatā | cana || jināti | vā | it | amuyā | hanti | vā | dhuniḥ | ā | deva-yum | bhajati | go-mati | vraje ||5.34.5||

IAST: vitvakṣaṇaḥ samṛtau cakramāsajo 'sunvato viṣuṇaḥ sunvato vṛdhaḥ
Griffith: Exceeding strong in war he stays the chariot wheel, and, hating him who pours not, prospers him who pours
Devanāgarī: वित्वक्षणः समृतौ चक्रमासजोऽसुन्वतो विषुणः सुन्वतो वृधः
pada pāṭha: vi-tvakṣaṇaḥ | sam-r̥tau | cakram-āsajaḥ | asunvataḥ | viṣuṇaḥ | sunvataḥ | vr̥dhaḥ || indraḥ | viśvasya | damitā | vi-bhīṣaṇaḥ | yathā-vaśam | nayati | dāsam | āryaḥ ||5.34.6||

IAST: indro viśvasya damitā vibhīṣaṇo yathāvaśaṁ nayati dāsam āryaḥ
Griffith: Indra the terrible, tamer of every man, as Arya leads away the Dasa at his will.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रो विश्वस्य दमिता विभीषणो यथावशं नयति दासमार्यः
pada pāṭha: vi-tvakṣaṇaḥ | sam-r̥tau | cakram-āsajaḥ | asunvataḥ | viṣuṇaḥ | sunvataḥ | vr̥dhaḥ || indraḥ | viśvasya | damitā | vi-bhīṣaṇaḥ | yathā-vaśam | nayati | dāsam | āryaḥ ||5.34.6||

IAST: sam īm paṇer ajati bhojanam muṣe vi dāśuṣe bhajati sūnaraṁ vasu
Griffith: He gathers up for plunder all the niggard&#;s gear: excellent wealth he gives to him who offers gifts.
Devanāgarī: समीं पणेरजति भोजनं मुषे वि दाशुषे भजति सूनरं वसु
pada pāṭha: sam | īm | paṇeḥ | ajati | bhojanam | muṣe | vi | dāśuṣe | bhajati | sūnaram | vasu || duḥ-ge | cana | dhriyate | viśvaḥ | ā | puru | janaḥ | yaḥ | asya | taviṣīm | acukrudhat ||5.34.7||

IAST: durge cana dhriyate viśva ā puru jano yo asya taviṣīm acukrudhat
Griffith: Not even in wide stronghold may all the folk stand firm who have provoked to anger his surpassing might
Devanāgarī: दुर्गे चन ध्रियते विश्व आ पुरु जनो यो अस्य तविषीमचुक्रुधत्
pada pāṭha: sam | īm | paṇeḥ | ajati | bhojanam | muṣe | vi | dāśuṣe | bhajati | sūnaram | vasu || duḥ-ge | cana | dhriyate | viśvaḥ | ā | puru | janaḥ | yaḥ | asya | taviṣīm | acukrudhat ||5.34.7||

IAST: saṁ yaj janau sudhanau viśvaśardhasāv aved indro maghavā goṣu śubhriṣu
Griffith: When Indra Maghavan hath marked two wealthy men fighting for beauteous cows with all their followers,
Devanāgarī: सं यज्जनौ सुधनौ विश्वशर्धसाववेदिन्द्रो मघवा गोषु शुभ्रिषु
pada pāṭha: sam | yat | janau | su-dhanau | viśva-śardhasau | avet | indraḥ | magha-vā | goṣu | śubhriṣu || yujam | hi | anyam | akr̥ta | pra-vepanī | ut | īm | gavyam | sr̥jate | satva-bhiḥ | dhuniḥ ||5.34.8||

IAST: yujaṁ hy anyam akṛta pravepany ud īṁ gavyaṁ sṛjate satvabhir dhuniḥ
Griffith: He who stirs all things takes one as his close ally, and, Shaker, with his Heroes, sends the kine to him
Devanāgarī: युजं ह्यन्यमकृत प्रवेपन्युदीं गव्यं सृजते सत्वभिर्धुनिः
pada pāṭha: sam | yat | janau | su-dhanau | viśva-śardhasau | avet | indraḥ | magha-vā | goṣu | śubhriṣu || yujam | hi | anyam | akr̥ta | pra-vepanī | ut | īm | gavyam | sr̥jate | satva-bhiḥ | dhuniḥ ||5.34.8||

IAST: sahasrasām āgniveśiṁ gṛṇīṣe śatrim agna upamāṁ ketum aryaḥ
Griffith: Agni! I laud the liberal Agnivesi, Satri the type and standard of the pious.
Devanāgarī: सहस्रसामाग्निवेशिं गृणीषे शत्रिमग्न उपमां केतुमर्यः
pada pāṭha: sahasra-sām | āgni-veśim | gr̥ṇīṣe | śatrim | agne | upa-mām | ketum | aryaḥ || tasmai | āpaḥ | sam-yataḥ | pīpayanta | tasmin | kṣatram | ama-vat | tveṣam | astu ||5.34.9||

IAST: tasmā āpaḥ saṁyataḥ pīpayanta tasmin kṣatram amavat tveṣam astu
Griffith: May the collected waters yield him plenty, and his be powerful and bright dominion.
Devanāgarī: तस्मा आपः संयतः पीपयन्त तस्मिन्क्षत्रममवत्त्वेषमस्तु
pada pāṭha: sahasra-sām | āgni-veśim | gr̥ṇīṣe | śatrim | agne | upa-mām | ketum | aryaḥ || tasmai | āpaḥ | sam-yataḥ | pīpayanta | tasmin | kṣatram | ama-vat | tveṣam | astu ||5.34.9||

IAST: yas te sādhiṣṭho 'vasa indra kratuṣ ṭam ā bhara
Griffith: INDRA, for our assistance bring that most effectual power of thine,
Devanāgarī: यस्ते साधिष्ठोऽवस इन्द्र क्रतुष्टमा भर
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | te | sādhiṣṭhaḥ | avase | indra | kratuḥ | tam | ā | bhara || asmabhyam | carṣaṇi-saham | sasnim | vājeṣu | dustaram ||5.35.1||

IAST: asmabhyaṁ carṣaṇīsahaṁ sasniṁ vājeṣu duṣṭaram
Griffith: Which conquers men for us, and wins the spoil, invincible in fight.
Devanāgarī: अस्मभ्यं चर्षणीसहं सस्निं वाजेषु दुष्टरम्
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | te | sādhiṣṭhaḥ | avase | indra | kratuḥ | tam | ā | bhara || asmabhyam | carṣaṇi-saham | sasnim | vājeṣu | dustaram ||5.35.1||

IAST: yad indra te catasro yac chūra santi tisraḥ
Griffith: Indra, whatever aids be thine, four be they, or, O Hero, three,
Devanāgarī: यदिन्द्र ते चतस्रो यच्छूर सन्ति तिस्रः
pada pāṭha: yat | indra | te | catasraḥ | yat | śūra | santi | tisraḥ || yat | vā | pañca | kṣitīnām | avaḥ | tat | su | naḥ | ā | bhara ||5.35.2||

IAST: yad vā pañca kṣitīnām avas tat su na ā bhara
Griffith: Or those of the Five Tribes of men, bring quickly all that help to us.
Devanāgarī: यद्वा पञ्च क्षितीनामवस्तत्सु न आ भर
pada pāṭha: yat | indra | te | catasraḥ | yat | śūra | santi | tisraḥ || yat | vā | pañca | kṣitīnām | avaḥ | tat | su | naḥ | ā | bhara ||5.35.2||

IAST: ā te 'vo vareṇyaṁ vṛṣantamasya hūmahe
Griffith: The aid most excellent of thee the Mightiest hitherward we call,
Devanāgarī: आ तेऽवो वरेण्यं वृषन्तमस्य हूमहे
pada pāṭha: ā | te | avaḥ | vareṇyam | vr̥ṣan-tamasya | hūmahe || vr̥ṣa-jūtiḥ | hi | jajñiṣe | ā-bhūbhiḥ | indra | turvaṇiḥ ||5.35.3||

IAST: vṛṣajūtir hi jajñiṣa ābhūbhir indra turvaṇiḥ
Griffith: For thou wast born with hero might, conquering, Indra, with the Strong.
Devanāgarī: वृषजूतिर्हि जज्ञिष आभूभिरिन्द्र तुर्वणिः
pada pāṭha: ā | te | avaḥ | vareṇyam | vr̥ṣan-tamasya | hūmahe || vr̥ṣa-jūtiḥ | hi | jajñiṣe | ā-bhūbhiḥ | indra | turvaṇiḥ ||5.35.3||

IAST: vṛṣā hy asi rādhase jajñiṣe vṛṣṇi te śavaḥ
Griffith: Mighty to prosper us wast thou born, and mighty is the strength thou hast.
Devanāgarī: वृषा ह्यसि राधसे जज्ञिषे वृष्णि ते शवः
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣā | hi | asi | rādhase | jajñiṣe | vr̥ṣṇi | te | śavaḥ || sva-kṣatram | te | dhr̥ṣat | manaḥ | satrā-ham | indra | pauṁsyam ||5.35.4||

IAST: svakṣatraṁ te dhṛṣan manaḥ satrāham indra pauṁsyam
Griffith: In native power thy soul is firm: thy valour, Indra, slays a host.
Devanāgarī: स्वक्षत्रं ते धृषन्मनः सत्राहमिन्द्र पौंस्यम्
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣā | hi | asi | rādhase | jajñiṣe | vr̥ṣṇi | te | śavaḥ || sva-kṣatram | te | dhr̥ṣat | manaḥ | satrā-ham | indra | pauṁsyam ||5.35.4||

IAST: tvaṁ tam indra martyam amitrayantam adrivaḥ
Griffith: O Satakratu, Lord of Strength, O Indra, Caster of the Stone.
Devanāgarī: त्वं तमिन्द्र मर्त्यममित्रयन्तमद्रिवः
pada pāṭha: tvam | tam | indra | martyam | amitra-yantam | adri-vaḥ || sarva-rathā | śatakrato iti śata-krato | ni | yāhi | śavasaḥ | pate ||5.35.5||

IAST: sarvarathā śatakrato ni yāhi śavasas pate
Griffith: With all thy chariot's force assail the man who shows himself thy foe.
Devanāgarī: सर्वरथा शतक्रतो नि याहि शवसस्पते
pada pāṭha: tvam | tam | indra | martyam | amitra-yantam | adri-vaḥ || sarva-rathā | śatakrato iti śata-krato | ni | yāhi | śavasaḥ | pate ||5.35.5||

IAST: tvām id vṛtrahantama janāso vṛktabarhiṣaḥ
Griffith: For, Mightiest Vrtra-slayer, thee, fierce, foremost among many, folk
Devanāgarī: त्वामिद्वृत्रहन्तम जनासो वृक्तबर्हिषः
pada pāṭha: tvām | it | vr̥trahan-tama | janāsaḥ | vr̥kta-barhiṣaḥ || ugram | pūrvīṣu | pūrvyam | havante | vāja-sātaye ||5.35.6||

IAST: ugram pūrvīṣu pūrvyaṁ havante vājasātaye
Griffith: Whose sacred grass is trimmed invite to battle where the spoil is won.
Devanāgarī: उग्रं पूर्वीषु पूर्व्यं हवन्ते वाजसातये
pada pāṭha: tvām | it | vr̥trahan-tama | janāsaḥ | vr̥kta-barhiṣaḥ || ugram | pūrvīṣu | pūrvyam | havante | vāja-sātaye ||5.35.6||

IAST: asmākam indra duṣṭaram puroyāvānam ājiṣu
Griffith: Indra, do thou protect our car that mingles foremost in the fights,
Devanāgarī: अस्माकमिन्द्र दुष्टरं पुरोयावानमाजिषु
pada pāṭha: asmākam | indra | dustaram | puraḥ-yāvānam | ājiṣu || sa-yāvānam | dhane-dhane | vāja-yantam | ava | ratham ||5.35.7||

IAST: sayāvānaṁ dhane-dhane vājayantam avā ratham
Griffith: That bears its part in every fray, invincible and seeking spoil.
Devanāgarī: सयावानं धनेधने वाजयन्तमवा रथम्
pada pāṭha: asmākam | indra | dustaram | puraḥ-yāvānam | ājiṣu || sa-yāvānam | dhane-dhane | vāja-yantam | ava | ratham ||5.35.7||

IAST: asmākam indrehi no ratham avā puraṁdhyā
Griffith: Come to us, Indra, and protect our car with thine intelligence.
Devanāgarī: अस्माकमिन्द्रेहि नो रथमवा पुरंध्या
pada pāṭha: asmākam | indra | ā | ihi | naḥ | ratham | ava | puram-dhyā || vayam | śaviṣṭha | vāryam | divi | śravaḥ | dadhīmahi | divi | stomam | manāmahe ||5.35.8||

IAST: vayaṁ śaviṣṭha vāryaṁ divi śravo dadhīmahi divi stomam manāmahe
Griffith: May we, O Mightiest One, obtain excellent fame at break of day, and meditate our hymn at dawn.
Devanāgarī: वयं शविष्ठ वार्यं दिवि श्रवो दधीमहि दिवि स्तोमं मनामहे
pada pāṭha: asmākam | indra | ā | ihi | naḥ | ratham | ava | puram-dhyā || vayam | śaviṣṭha | vāryam | divi | śravaḥ | dadhīmahi | divi | stomam | manāmahe ||5.35.8||

IAST: sa ā gamad indro yo vasūnāṁ ciketad dātuṁ dāmano rayīṇām
Griffith: MAY Indra come to us, he who knows rightly to give forth treasures from his store of riches.
Devanāgarī: स आ गमदिन्द्रो यो वसूनां चिकेतद्दातुं दामनो रयीणाम्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | ā | gamat | indraḥ | yaḥ | vasūnām | ciketat | dātum | dāmanaḥ | rayīṇām || dhanva-caraḥ | na | vaṁsagaḥ | tr̥ṣāṇaḥ | cakamānaḥ | pibatu | dugdham | aṁśum ||5.36.1||

IAST: dhanvacaro na vaṁsagas tṛṣāṇaś cakamānaḥ pibatu dugdham aṁśum
Griffith: Even as a thirsty steer who roams the deserts may he drink eagerly the milked-out Soma.
Devanāgarī: धन्वचरो न वंसगस्तृषाणश्चकमानः पिबतु दुग्धमंशुम्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | ā | gamat | indraḥ | yaḥ | vasūnām | ciketat | dātum | dāmanaḥ | rayīṇām || dhanva-caraḥ | na | vaṁsagaḥ | tr̥ṣāṇaḥ | cakamānaḥ | pibatu | dugdham | aṁśum ||5.36.1||

IAST: ā te hanū harivaḥ śūra śipre ruhat somo na parvatasya pṛṣṭhe
Griffith: Lord of Bay Horses, Hero, may the Soma rise to thy cheeks and jaws like mountain-ridges.
Devanāgarī: आ ते हनू हरिवः शूर शिप्रे रुहत्सोमो न पर्वतस्य पृष्ठे
pada pāṭha: ā | te | hanū iti | hari-vaḥ | śūra | śipre iti | ruhat | somaḥ | na | parvatasya | pr̥ṣṭhe || anu | tvā | rājan | arvataḥ | na | hinvan | gīḥ-bhiḥ | madema | puru-hūta | viśve ||5.36.2||

IAST: anu tvā rājann arvato na hinvan gīrbhir madema puruhūta viśve
Griffith: May we, O King, as he who driveth coursers, all joy in thee with hymns, invoked of many!
Devanāgarī: अनु त्वा राजन्नर्वतो न हिन्वन्गीर्भिर्मदेम पुरुहूत विश्वे
pada pāṭha: ā | te | hanū iti | hari-vaḥ | śūra | śipre iti | ruhat | somaḥ | na | parvatasya | pr̥ṣṭhe || anu | tvā | rājan | arvataḥ | na | hinvan | gīḥ-bhiḥ | madema | puru-hūta | viśve ||5.36.2||

IAST: cakraṁ na vṛttam puruhūta vepate mano bhiyā me amater id adrivaḥ
Griffith: Invoked of many, Caster of the Stone my heart quakes like a rolling wheel for fear of penury.
Devanāgarī: चक्रं न वृत्तं पुरुहूत वेपते मनो भिया मे अमतेरिदद्रिवः
pada pāṭha: cakram | na | vr̥ttam | puru-hūta | vepate | manaḥ | bhiyā | me | amateḥ | it | adri-vaḥ || rathāt | adhi | tvā | jaritā | sadā-vr̥dha | kuvit | nu | stoṣat | magha-van | puru-vasuḥ ||5.36.3||

IAST: rathād adhi tvā jaritā sadāvṛdha kuvin nu stoṣan maghavan purūvasuḥ
Griffith: Shall not Puruvasu the singer give thee praise, O ever-prospering Maghavan, mounted on thy car?
Devanāgarī: रथादधि त्वा जरिता सदावृध कुविन्नु स्तोषन्मघवन्पुरूवसुः
pada pāṭha: cakram | na | vr̥ttam | puru-hūta | vepate | manaḥ | bhiyā | me | amateḥ | it | adri-vaḥ || rathāt | adhi | tvā | jaritā | sadā-vr̥dha | kuvit | nu | stoṣat | magha-van | puru-vasuḥ ||5.36.3||

IAST: eṣa grāveva jaritā ta indreyarti vācam bṛhad āśuṣāṇaḥ
Griffith: Like the press-stone is this thy praiser, Indra. Loudly he lifts his voice with strong endeavour.
Devanāgarī: एष ग्रावेव जरिता त इन्द्रेयर्ति वाचं बृहदाशुषाणः
pada pāṭha: eṣaḥ | grāvā-iva | jaritā | te | indra | iyarti | vācam | br̥hat | āśuṣāṇaḥ || pra | savyena | magha-van | yaṁsi | rāyaḥ | pra | dakṣiṇit | hari-vaḥ | mā | vi | venaḥ ||5.36.4||

IAST: pra savyena maghavan yaṁsi rāyaḥ pra dakṣiṇid dharivo mā vi venaḥ
Griffith: With thy left hand, O Maghavan, give us riches: with thy right, Lord of Bays, be not reluctant.
Devanāgarī: प्र सव्येन मघवन्यंसि रायः प्र दक्षिणिद्धरिवो मा वि वेनः
pada pāṭha: eṣaḥ | grāvā-iva | jaritā | te | indra | iyarti | vācam | br̥hat | āśuṣāṇaḥ || pra | savyena | magha-van | yaṁsi | rāyaḥ | pra | dakṣiṇit | hari-vaḥ | mā | vi | venaḥ ||5.36.4||

IAST: vṛṣā tvā vṛṣaṇaṁ vardhatu dyaur vṛṣā vṛṣabhyāṁ vahase haribhyām
Griffith: May the strong Heaven make thee the Strong wax stronger: Strong, thou art borne by thy two strong Bay Hors
Devanāgarī: वृषा त्वा वृषणं वर्धतु द्यौर्वृषा वृषभ्यां वहसे हरिभ्याम्
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣā | tvā | vr̥ṣaṇam | vardhatu | dyauḥ | vr̥ṣā | vr̥ṣa-bhyām | vahase | hari-bhyām || saḥ | naḥ | vr̥ṣā | vr̥ṣa-rathaḥ | su-śipra | vr̥ṣakrato iti vr̥ṣa-krato | vr̥ṣā | vajrin | bhare | dhāḥ ||5.36.5||

IAST: sa no vṛṣā vṛṣarathaḥ suśipra vṛṣakrato vṛṣā vajrin bhare dhāḥ
Griffith: So, fair of cheek, with mighty chariot, mighty, uphold us, strong-willed, thunderarmed, in battle.
Devanāgarī: स नो वृषा वृषरथः सुशिप्र वृषक्रतो वृषा वज्रिन्भरे धाः
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣā | tvā | vr̥ṣaṇam | vardhatu | dyauḥ | vr̥ṣā | vr̥ṣa-bhyām | vahase | hari-bhyām || saḥ | naḥ | vr̥ṣā | vr̥ṣa-rathaḥ | su-śipra | vr̥ṣakrato iti vr̥ṣa-krato | vr̥ṣā | vajrin | bhare | dhāḥ ||5.36.5||

IAST: yo rohitau vājinau vājinīvān tribhiḥ śataiḥ sacamānāv adiṣṭa
Griffith: Maruts, let all the people in obeisance bow down before this youthful Srutaratha,
Devanāgarī: यो रोहितौ वाजिनौ वाजिनीवान्त्रिभिः शतैः सचमानावदिष्ट
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | rohitau | vājinau | vājinī-vān | tri-bhiḥ | śataiḥ | sacamānau | adiṣṭa || yūne | sam | asmai | kṣitayaḥ | namantām | śruta-rathāya | marutaḥ | duvaḥ-yā ||5.36.6||

IAST: yūne sam asmai kṣitayo namantāṁ śrutarathāya maruto duvoyā
Griffith: Who, rich in steeds, gave me two dark red horses together with three hundred head of cattle.
Devanāgarī: यूने समस्मै क्षितयो नमन्तां श्रुतरथाय मरुतो दुवोया
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | rohitau | vājinau | vājinī-vān | tri-bhiḥ | śataiḥ | sacamānau | adiṣṭa || yūne | sam | asmai | kṣitayaḥ | namantām | śruta-rathāya | marutaḥ | duvaḥ-yā ||5.36.6||

IAST: sam bhānunā yatate sūryasyājuhvāno ghṛtapṛṣṭhaḥ svañcāḥ
Griffith: BEDEWED with holy oil and meetly worshipped, the Swift One vies with Surya's beam in splendour.
Devanāgarī: सं भानुना यतते सूर्यस्याजुह्वानो घृतपृष्ठः स्वञ्चाः
pada pāṭha: sam | bhānunā | yatate | sūryasya | ā-juhvānaḥ | ghr̥ta-pr̥ṣṭhaḥ | su-añcāḥ || tasmai | amr̥dhrāḥ | uṣasaḥ | vi | ucchān | yaḥ | indrāya | sunavāma | iti | āha ||5.37.1||

IAST: tasmā amṛdhrā uṣaso vy ucchān ya indrāya sunavāmety āha
Griffith: For him may mornings dawn without cessation who saith, Let us press Soma out for Indra.
Devanāgarī: तस्मा अमृध्रा उषसो व्युच्छान्य इन्द्राय सुनवामेत्याह
pada pāṭha: sam | bhānunā | yatate | sūryasya | ā-juhvānaḥ | ghr̥ta-pr̥ṣṭhaḥ | su-añcāḥ || tasmai | amr̥dhrāḥ | uṣasaḥ | vi | ucchān | yaḥ | indrāya | sunavāma | iti | āha ||5.37.1||

IAST: samiddhāgnir vanavat stīrṇabarhir yuktagrāvā sutasomo jarāte
Griffith: With kindled fire and strewn grass let him worship, and, Soma-presser, sing with stones adjusted:
Devanāgarī: समिद्धाग्निर्वनवत्स्तीर्णबर्हिर्युक्तग्रावा सुतसोमो जराते
pada pāṭha: samiddha-agniḥ | vanavat | stīrṇa-barhiḥ | yukta-grāvā | suta-somaḥ | jarāte || grāvāṇaḥ | yasya | iṣiram | vadanti | ayat | adhvaryuḥ | haviṣā | ava | sindhum ||5.37.2||

IAST: grāvāṇo yasyeṣiraṁ vadanty ayad adhvaryur haviṣāva sindhum
Griffith: And let the priest whose press-stones ring forth loudly, go down with his oblation to the river.
Devanāgarī: ग्रावाणो यस्येषिरं वदन्त्ययदध्वर्युर्हविषाव सिन्धुम्
pada pāṭha: samiddha-agniḥ | vanavat | stīrṇa-barhiḥ | yukta-grāvā | suta-somaḥ | jarāte || grāvāṇaḥ | yasya | iṣiram | vadanti | ayat | adhvaryuḥ | haviṣā | ava | sindhum ||5.37.2||

IAST: vadhūr iyam patim icchanty eti ya īṁ vahāte mahiṣīm iṣirām
Griffith: This wife is coming near who loves her husband who carries to his home a vigorous consort.
Devanāgarī: वधूरियं पतिमिच्छन्त्येति य ईं वहाते महिषीमिषिराम्
pada pāṭha: vadhūḥ | iyam | patim | icchantī | eti | yaḥ | īm | vahāte | mahiṣīm | iṣirām || ā | asya | śravasyāt | rathaḥ | ā | ca | ghoṣāt | puru | sahasrā | pari | vartayāte ||5.37.3||

IAST: āsya śravasyād ratha ā ca ghoṣāt purū sahasrā pari vartayāte
Griffith: Here may his car seek fame, here loudly thunder, and his wheel make a thousand revolutions.
Devanāgarī: आस्य श्रवस्याद्रथ आ च घोषात्पुरू सहस्रा परि वर्तयाते
pada pāṭha: vadhūḥ | iyam | patim | icchantī | eti | yaḥ | īm | vahāte | mahiṣīm | iṣirām || ā | asya | śravasyāt | rathaḥ | ā | ca | ghoṣāt | puru | sahasrā | pari | vartayāte ||5.37.3||

IAST: na sa rājā vyathate yasminn indras tīvraṁ somam pibati gosakhāyam
Griffith: No troubles vex that King in whose home Indra drinks the sharp Soma juice with milk commingled.
Devanāgarī: न स राजा व्यथते यस्मिन्निन्द्रस्तीव्रं सोमं पिबति गोसखायम्
pada pāṭha: na | saḥ | rājā | vyathate | yasmin | indraḥ | tīvram | somam | pibati | go-sakhāyam || ā | satvanaiḥ | ajati | hanti | vr̥tram | kṣeti | kṣitīḥ | su-bhagaḥ | nāma | puṣyan ||5.37.4||

IAST: ā satvanair ajati hanti vṛtraṁ kṣeti kṣitīḥ subhago nāma puṣyan
Griffith: With heroes he drives near, he slays the foeman: Blest, cherishing that name, he guards his people.
Devanāgarī: आ सत्वनैरजति हन्ति वृत्रं क्षेति क्षितीः सुभगो नाम पुष्यन्
pada pāṭha: na | saḥ | rājā | vyathate | yasmin | indraḥ | tīvram | somam | pibati | go-sakhāyam || ā | satvanaiḥ | ajati | hanti | vr̥tram | kṣeti | kṣitīḥ | su-bhagaḥ | nāma | puṣyan ||5.37.4||

IAST: puṣyāt kṣeme abhi yoge bhavāty ubhe vṛtau saṁyatī saṁ jayāti
Griffith: May he support in peace and win in battle: he masters both the hosts that meet together.
Devanāgarī: पुष्यात्क्षेमे अभि योगे भवात्युभे वृतौ संयती सं जयाति
pada pāṭha: puṣyāt | kṣeme | abhi | yoge | bhavāti | ubhe iti | vr̥tau | saṁyatī iti sam-yatī | sam | jayāti || priyaḥ | sūrye | priyaḥ | agnā | bhavāti | yaḥ | indrāya | suta-somaḥ | dadāśat ||5.37.5||

IAST: priyaḥ sūrye priyo agnā bhavāti ya indrāya sutasomo dadāśat
Griffith: Dear shall he be to Surya, dear to Agni, who with pressed Soma offers gifts to India.
Devanāgarī: प्रियः सूर्ये प्रियो अग्ना भवाति य इन्द्राय सुतसोमो ददाशत्
pada pāṭha: puṣyāt | kṣeme | abhi | yoge | bhavāti | ubhe iti | vr̥tau | saṁyatī iti sam-yatī | sam | jayāti || priyaḥ | sūrye | priyaḥ | agnā | bhavāti | yaḥ | indrāya | suta-somaḥ | dadāśat ||5.37.5||

IAST: uroṣ ṭa indra rādhaso vibhvī rātiḥ śatakrato
Griffith: WIDE, Indra Satakratu, spreads the bounty of thine ample grace:
Devanāgarī: उरोष्ट इन्द्र राधसो विभ्वी रातिः शतक्रतो
pada pāṭha: uroḥ | te | indra | rādhasaḥ | vi-bhvī | rātiḥ | śatakrato iti śata-krato || adha | naḥ | viśva-carṣaṇe | dyumnā | su-kṣatra | maṁhaya ||5.38.1||

IAST: adhā no viśvacarṣaṇe dyumnā sukṣatra maṁhaya
Griffith: So, Lord of fair dominion, Friend of all men, give us splendid wealth.
Devanāgarī: अधा नो विश्वचर्षणे द्युम्ना सुक्षत्र मंहय
pada pāṭha: uroḥ | te | indra | rādhasaḥ | vi-bhvī | rātiḥ | śatakrato iti śata-krato || adha | naḥ | viśva-carṣaṇe | dyumnā | su-kṣatra | maṁhaya ||5.38.1||

IAST: yad īm indra śravāyyam iṣaṁ śaviṣṭha dadhiṣe
Griffith: The food which, Mightiest Indra, thou possessest worthy of renown
Devanāgarī: यदीमिन्द्र श्रवाय्यमिषं शविष्ठ दधिषे
pada pāṭha: yat | īm | indra | śravāyyam | iṣam | śaviṣṭha | dadhiṣe || paprathe | dīrghaśrut-tamam | hiraṇya-varṇa | dustaram ||5.38.2||

IAST: paprathe dīrghaśruttamaṁ hiraṇyavarṇa duṣṭaram
Griffith: Is bruited as most widely famed, invincible, O Golden-hued!
Devanāgarī: पप्रथे दीर्घश्रुत्तमं हिरण्यवर्ण दुष्टरम्
pada pāṭha: yat | īm | indra | śravāyyam | iṣam | śaviṣṭha | dadhiṣe || paprathe | dīrghaśrut-tamam | hiraṇya-varṇa | dustaram ||5.38.2||

IAST: śuṣmāso ye te adrivo mehanā ketasāpaḥ
Griffith: O Darter of the Stone, the powers which readily obey thy will,-
Devanāgarī: शुष्मासो ये ते अद्रिवो मेहना केतसापः
pada pāṭha: śuṣmāsaḥ | ye | te | adri-vaḥ | mehanā | keta-sāpaḥ || ubhā | devau | abhiṣṭaye | divaḥ | ca | gmaḥ | ca | rājathaḥ ||5.38.3||

IAST: ubhā devāv abhiṣṭaye divaś ca gmaś ca rājathaḥ
Griffith: Divinities, both thou and they, ye rule, to guard them, earth and heaven.
Devanāgarī: उभा देवावभिष्टये दिवश्च ग्मश्च राजथः
pada pāṭha: śuṣmāsaḥ | ye | te | adri-vaḥ | mehanā | keta-sāpaḥ || ubhā | devau | abhiṣṭaye | divaḥ | ca | gmaḥ | ca | rājathaḥ ||5.38.3||

IAST: uto no asya kasya cid dakṣasya tava vṛtrahan
Griffith: And from whatever power of thine, O Vrtra-slayer, it may be,
Devanāgarī: उतो नो अस्य कस्य चिद्दक्षस्य तव वृत्रहन्
pada pāṭha: uto iti | naḥ | asya | kasya | cit | dakṣasya | tava | vr̥tra-han || asmabhyam | nr̥mṇam | ā | bhara | asmabhyam | nr̥-manasyase ||5.38.4||

IAST: asmabhyaṁ nṛmṇam ā bharāsmabhyaṁ nṛmaṇasyase
Griffith: Bring thou to us heroic strength: thou hast a man's regard for us.
Devanāgarī: अस्मभ्यं नृम्णमा भरास्मभ्यं नृमणस्यसे
pada pāṭha: uto iti | naḥ | asya | kasya | cit | dakṣasya | tava | vr̥tra-han || asmabhyam | nr̥mṇam | ā | bhara | asmabhyam | nr̥-manasyase ||5.38.4||

IAST: nū ta ābhir abhiṣṭibhis tava śarmañ chatakrato
Griffith: In thy protection, with these aids of thine, O Lord of Hundred Powers,
Devanāgarī: नू त आभिरभिष्टिभिस्तव शर्मञ्छतक्रतो
pada pāṭha: nu | te | ābhiḥ | abhiṣṭi-bhiḥ | tava | śarman | śatakrato iti śata-krato || indra | syāma | su-gopāḥ | śūra | syāma | su-gopāḥ ||5.38.5||

IAST: indra syāma sugopāḥ śūra syāma sugopāḥ
Griffith: Indra, may we be guarded well, Hero, may we be guarded well.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्र स्याम सुगोपाः शूर स्याम सुगोपाः
pada pāṭha: nu | te | ābhiḥ | abhiṣṭi-bhiḥ | tava | śarman | śatakrato iti śata-krato || indra | syāma | su-gopāḥ | śūra | syāma | su-gopāḥ ||5.38.5||

IAST: yad indra citra mehanāsti tvādātam adrivaḥ
Griffith: STONE-DARTING Indra. Wondrous One, what wealth is richly given from thee,
Devanāgarī: यदिन्द्र चित्र मेहनास्ति त्वादातमद्रिवः
pada pāṭha: yat | indra | citra | mehanā | asti | tvā-dātam | adri-vaḥ || rādhaḥ | tat | naḥ | vidadvaso iti vidat-vaso | ubhayāhasti | ā | bhara ||5.39.1||

IAST: rādhas tan no vidadvasa ubhayāhasty ā bhara
Griffith: That bounty, Treasure-Finder! bring filling both thy hands, to us.
Devanāgarī: राधस्तन्नो विदद्वस उभयाहस्त्या भर
pada pāṭha: yat | indra | citra | mehanā | asti | tvā-dātam | adri-vaḥ || rādhaḥ | tat | naḥ | vidadvaso iti vidat-vaso | ubhayāhasti | ā | bhara ||5.39.1||

IAST: yan manyase vareṇyam indra dyukṣaṁ tad ā bhara
Griffith: Bring what thou deemest worth the wish, O Indra, that which is in heaven.
Devanāgarī: यन्मन्यसे वरेण्यमिन्द्र द्युक्षं तदा भर
pada pāṭha: yat | manyase | vareṇyam | indra | dyukṣam | tat | ā | bhara || vidyāma | tasya | te | vayam | akūpārasya | dāvane ||5.39.2||

IAST: vidyāma tasya te vayam akūpārasya dāvane
Griffith: So may we know thee as thou art, boundless in thy munificence.
Devanāgarī: विद्याम तस्य ते वयमकूपारस्य दावने
pada pāṭha: yat | manyase | vareṇyam | indra | dyukṣam | tat | ā | bhara || vidyāma | tasya | te | vayam | akūpārasya | dāvane ||5.39.2||

IAST: yat te ditsu prarādhyam mano asti śrutam bṛhat
Griffith: Thy lofty spirit, far-renowned as fain to give and prompt to win,-
Devanāgarī: यत्ते दित्सु प्रराध्यं मनो अस्ति श्रुतं बृहत्
pada pāṭha: yat | te | ditsu | pra-rādhyam | manaḥ | asti | śrutam | br̥hat || tena | dr̥ḷhā | cit | adri-vaḥ | ā | vājam | darṣi | sātaye ||5.39.3||

IAST: tena dṛḻhā cid adriva ā vājaṁ darṣi sātaye
Griffith: With this thou rendest e'en the firm, Stone-Darter! so to gain thee strength.
Devanāgarī: तेन दृळ्हा चिदद्रिव आ वाजं दर्षि सातये
pada pāṭha: yat | te | ditsu | pra-rādhyam | manaḥ | asti | śrutam | br̥hat || tena | dr̥ḷhā | cit | adri-vaḥ | ā | vājam | darṣi | sātaye ||5.39.3||

IAST: maṁhiṣṭhaṁ vo maghonāṁ rājānaṁ carṣaṇīnām
Griffith: Singers with many songs have made Indra propitious to their fame,
Devanāgarī: मंहिष्ठं वो मघोनां राजानं चर्षणीनाम्
pada pāṭha: maṁhiṣṭham | vaḥ | maghonām | rājānam | carṣaṇīnām || indram | upa | pra-śastaye | pūrvībhiḥ | jujuṣe | giraḥ ||5.39.4||

IAST: indram upa praśastaye pūrvībhir jujuṣe giraḥ
Griffith: Him who is King of human kind, most liberal of your wealthy ones.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रमुप प्रशस्तये पूर्वीभिर्जुजुषे गिरः
pada pāṭha: maṁhiṣṭham | vaḥ | maghonām | rājānam | carṣaṇīnām || indram | upa | pra-śastaye | pūrvībhiḥ | jujuṣe | giraḥ ||5.39.4||

IAST: asmā it kāvyaṁ vaca uktham indrāya śaṁsyam
Griffith: To him, to Indra must be sung the poet's word, the hymn of praise.
Devanāgarī: अस्मा इत्काव्यं वच उक्थमिन्द्राय शंस्यम्
pada pāṭha: asmai | it | kāvyam | vacaḥ | uktham | indrāya | śaṁsyam || tasmai | ūm̐ iti | brahma-vāhase | giraḥ | vardhanti | atrayaḥ | giraḥ | śumbhanti | atrayaḥ ||5.39.5||

IAST: tasmā u brahmavāhase giro vardhanty atrayo giraḥ śumbhanty atrayaḥ
Griffith: To him, accepter of the prayer, the Atris raise their songs on high, the Atris beautify their songs.
Devanāgarī: तस्मा उ ब्रह्मवाहसे गिरो वर्धन्त्यत्रयो गिरः शुम्भन्त्यत्रयः
pada pāṭha: asmai | it | kāvyam | vacaḥ | uktham | indrāya | śaṁsyam || tasmai | ūm̐ iti | brahma-vāhase | giraḥ | vardhanti | atrayaḥ | giraḥ | śumbhanti | atrayaḥ ||5.39.5||

IAST: ā yāhy adribhiḥ sutaṁ somaṁ somapate piba
Griffith: COME thou to what the stones have pressed, drink Soma, O thou Soma's Lord,
Devanāgarī: आ याह्यद्रिभिः सुतं सोमं सोमपते पिब
pada pāṭha: ā | yāhi | adri-bhiḥ | sutam | somam | soma-pate | piba || vr̥ṣan | indra | vr̥ṣa-bhiḥ | vr̥trahan-tama ||5.40.1||

IAST: vṛṣann indra vṛṣabhir vṛtrahantama
Griffith: Indra best Vrtra-slayer Strong One, with the Strong.
Devanāgarī: वृषन्निन्द्र वृषभिर्वृत्रहन्तम
pada pāṭha: ā | yāhi | adri-bhiḥ | sutam | somam | soma-pate | piba || vr̥ṣan | indra | vr̥ṣa-bhiḥ | vr̥trahan-tama ||5.40.1||

IAST: vṛṣā grāvā vṛṣā mado vṛṣā somo ayaṁ sutaḥ
Griffith: Strong is the stone, the draught is strong, strong is this Soma that is pressed,
Devanāgarī: वृषा ग्रावा वृषा मदो वृषा सोमो अयं सुतः
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣā | grāvā | vr̥ṣā | madaḥ | vr̥ṣā | somaḥ | ayam | sutaḥ || vr̥ṣan | indra | vr̥ṣa-bhiḥ | vr̥trahan-tama ||5.40.2||

IAST: vṛṣann indra vṛṣabhir vṛtrahantama
Griffith: Indra, best Vrtra-slayer, Strong One with the Strong.
Devanāgarī: वृषन्निन्द्र वृषभिर्वृत्रहन्तम
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣā | grāvā | vr̥ṣā | madaḥ | vr̥ṣā | somaḥ | ayam | sutaḥ || vr̥ṣan | indra | vr̥ṣa-bhiḥ | vr̥trahan-tama ||5.40.2||

IAST: vṛṣā tvā vṛṣaṇaṁ huve vajriñ citrābhir ūtibhiḥ
Griffith: As strong I call on thee the Strong, O Thunder-armed, with various aids,
Devanāgarī: वृषा त्वा वृषणं हुवे वज्रिञ्चित्राभिरूतिभिः
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣā | tvā | vr̥ṣaṇam | huve | vajrin | citrābhiḥ | ūti-bhiḥ || vr̥ṣan | indra | vr̥ṣa-bhiḥ | vr̥trahan-tama ||5.40.3||

IAST: vṛṣann indra vṛṣabhir vṛtrahantama
Griffith: Indra, best Vrtra-slayer, Strong One with the Strong.
Devanāgarī: वृषन्निन्द्र वृषभिर्वृत्रहन्तम
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣā | tvā | vr̥ṣaṇam | huve | vajrin | citrābhiḥ | ūti-bhiḥ || vr̥ṣan | indra | vr̥ṣa-bhiḥ | vr̥trahan-tama ||5.40.3||

IAST: ṛjīṣī vajrī vṛṣabhas turāṣāṭ chuṣmī rājā vṛtrahā somapāvā
Griffith: Impetuous, Thunderer, Strong, quelling the mighty, King, potent, Vrtra-slayer, Soma-drinker,
Devanāgarī: ऋजीषी वज्री वृषभस्तुराषाट् छुष्मी राजा वृत्रहा सोमपावा
pada pāṭha: r̥jīṣī | vajrī | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | turāṣāṭ | śuṣmī | rājā | vr̥tra-hā | soma-pāvā || yuktvā | hari-bhyām | upa | yāsat | arvāṅ | mādhyandine | savane | matsat | indraḥ ||5.40.4||

IAST: yuktvā haribhyām upa yāsad arvāṅ mādhyaṁdine savane matsad indraḥ
Griffith: May he come hither with his yoked Bay Horses; may Indra gladden him at the noon libation.
Devanāgarī: युक्त्वा हरिभ्यामुप यासदर्वाङ्माध्यंदिने सवने मत्सदिन्द्रः
pada pāṭha: r̥jīṣī | vajrī | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | turāṣāṭ | śuṣmī | rājā | vr̥tra-hā | soma-pāvā || yuktvā | hari-bhyām | upa | yāsat | arvāṅ | mādhyandine | savane | matsat | indraḥ ||5.40.4||

IAST: yat tvā sūrya svarbhānus tamasāvidhyad āsuraḥ
Griffith: O Surya, when the Asura's descendant Svarbhanu, pierced thee through and through with darkness,
Devanāgarī: यत्त्वा सूर्य स्वर्भानुस्तमसाविध्यदासुरः
pada pāṭha: yat | tvā | sūrya | svaḥ-bhānuḥ | tamasā | avidhyat | āsuraḥ || akṣetra-vit | yathā | mugdhaḥ | bhuvanāni | adīdhayuḥ ||5.40.5||

IAST: akṣetravid yathā mugdho bhuvanāny adīdhayuḥ
Griffith: All creatures looked like one who is bewildered, who knoweth not the place where he is standing.
Devanāgarī: अक्षेत्रविद्यथा मुग्धो भुवनान्यदीधयुः
pada pāṭha: yat | tvā | sūrya | svaḥ-bhānuḥ | tamasā | avidhyat | āsuraḥ || akṣetra-vit | yathā | mugdhaḥ | bhuvanāni | adīdhayuḥ ||5.40.5||

IAST: svarbhānor adha yad indra māyā avo divo vartamānā avāhan
Griffith: What time thou smotest down Svarbhanu's magic that spread itself beneath the sky, O Indra,
Devanāgarī: स्वर्भानोरध यदिन्द्र माया अवो दिवो वर्तमाना अवाहन्
pada pāṭha: svaḥ-bhānoḥ | adha | yat | indra | māyāḥ | avaḥ | divaḥ | vartamānāḥ | ava-ahan || gūḷham | sūryam | tamasā | apa-vratena | turīyeṇa | brahmaṇā | avindat | atriḥ ||5.40.6||

IAST: gūḻhaṁ sūryaṁ tamasāpavratena turīyeṇa brahmaṇāvindad atriḥ
Griffith: By his fourth sacred prayer Atri disoovered Surya concealed in gloom that stayed his function.
Devanāgarī: गूळ्हं सूर्यं तमसापव्रतेन तुरीयेण ब्रह्मणाविन्ददत्रिः
pada pāṭha: svaḥ-bhānoḥ | adha | yat | indra | māyāḥ | avaḥ | divaḥ | vartamānāḥ | ava-ahan || gūḷham | sūryam | tamasā | apa-vratena | turīyeṇa | brahmaṇā | avindat | atriḥ ||5.40.6||

IAST: mā mām imaṁ tava santam atra irasyā drugdho bhiyasā ni gārīt
Griffith: Let not the oppressor with this dread, through anger swallow me up, for I am thine, O Atri.
Devanāgarī: मा मामिमं तव सन्तमत्र इरस्या द्रुग्धो भियसा नि गारीत्
pada pāṭha: mā | mām | imam | tava | santam | atre | irasyā | drugdhaḥ | bhiyasā | ni | gārīt || tvam | mitraḥ | asi | satya-rādhāḥ | tau | mā | iha | avatam | varuṇaḥ | ca | rājā ||5.40.7||

IAST: tvam mitro asi satyarādhās tau mehāvataṁ varuṇaś ca rājā
Griffith: Mitra art thou, the sender of true blessings: thou and King Varuna be both my helpers.
Devanāgarī: त्वं मित्रो असि सत्यराधास्तौ मेहावतं वरुणश्च राजा
pada pāṭha: mā | mām | imam | tava | santam | atre | irasyā | drugdhaḥ | bhiyasā | ni | gārīt || tvam | mitraḥ | asi | satya-rādhāḥ | tau | mā | iha | avatam | varuṇaḥ | ca | rājā ||5.40.7||

IAST: grāvṇo brahmā yuyujānaḥ saparyan kīriṇā devān namasopaśikṣan
Griffith: The Brahman Atri, as he set the press-stones, serving the Gods with praise and adoration,
Devanāgarī: ग्राव्णो ब्रह्मा युयुजानः सपर्यन्कीरिणा देवान्नमसोपशिक्षन्
pada pāṭha: grāvṇaḥ | brahmā | yuyujānaḥ | saparyan | kīriṇā | devān | namasā | upa-śikṣan || atriḥ | sūryasya | divi | cakṣuḥ | ā | adhāt | svaḥ-bhānoḥ | apa | māyāḥ | aghukṣat ||5.40.8||

IAST: atriḥ sūryasya divi cakṣur ādhāt svarbhānor apa māyā aghukṣat
Griffith: Established in the heaven the eye of Surya, and caused Svarbhanu's magic arts to vanish.
Devanāgarī: अत्रिः सूर्यस्य दिवि चक्षुराधात्स्वर्भानोरप माया अघुक्षत्
pada pāṭha: grāvṇaḥ | brahmā | yuyujānaḥ | saparyan | kīriṇā | devān | namasā | upa-śikṣan || atriḥ | sūryasya | divi | cakṣuḥ | ā | adhāt | svaḥ-bhānoḥ | apa | māyāḥ | aghukṣat ||5.40.8||

IAST: yaṁ vai sūryaṁ svarbhānus tamasāvidhyad āsuraḥ
Griffith: The Atris found the Sun again, him whom Svarbhanu of the brood
Devanāgarī: यं वै सूर्यं स्वर्भानुस्तमसाविध्यदासुरः
pada pāṭha: yam | vai | sūryam | svaḥ-bhānuḥ | tamasā | avidhyat | āsuraḥ || atrayaḥ | tam | anu | avindan | nahi | anye | aśaknuvan ||5.40.9||

IAST: atrayas tam anv avindan nahy anye aśaknuvan
Griffith: Of Asuras had pierced with gloom. This none besides had power to do.
Devanāgarī: अत्रयस्तमन्वविन्दन्नह्यन्ये अशक्नुवन्
pada pāṭha: yam | vai | sūryam | svaḥ-bhānuḥ | tamasā | avidhyat | āsuraḥ || atrayaḥ | tam | anu | avindan | nahi | anye | aśaknuvan ||5.40.9||

IAST: ko nu vām mitrāvaruṇāv ṛtāyan divo vā mahaḥ pārthivasya vā de
Griffith: WHO, Mitra-Varuna, is your pious servant to give you gifts from earth or mighty heaven?
Devanāgarī: को नु वां मित्रावरुणावृतायन्दिवो वा महः पार्थिवस्य वा दे
pada pāṭha: kaḥ | nu | vām | mitrāvaruṇau | r̥ta-yan | divaḥ | vā | mahaḥ | pārthivasya | vā | de || r̥tasya | vā | sadasi | trāsīthām | naḥ | yajña-yate | vā | paśu-saḥ | na | vājān ||5.41.1||

IAST: ṛtasya vā sadasi trāsīthāṁ no yajñāyate vā paśuṣo na vājān
Griffith: Preserve us in the seat of holy Order, and give the offerer power that winneth cattle.
Devanāgarī: ऋतस्य वा सदसि त्रासीथां नो यज्ञायते वा पशुषो न वाजान्
pada pāṭha: kaḥ | nu | vām | mitrāvaruṇau | r̥ta-yan | divaḥ | vā | mahaḥ | pārthivasya | vā | de || r̥tasya | vā | sadasi | trāsīthām | naḥ | yajña-yate | vā | paśu-saḥ | na | vājān ||5.41.1||

IAST: te no mitro varuṇo aryamāyur indra ṛbhukṣā maruto juṣanta
Griffith: May Mitra, Varuna, Aryaman, and Ayu, Indra Rbhuksan, and the Maruts, love us,
Devanāgarī: ते नो मित्रो वरुणो अर्यमायुरिन्द्र ऋभुक्षा मरुतो जुषन्त
pada pāṭha: te | naḥ | mitraḥ | varuṇaḥ | aryamā | āyuḥ | indraḥ | r̥bhukṣāḥ | marutaḥ | juṣanta || namaḥ-bhiḥ | vā | ye | dadhate | su-vr̥ktim | stomam | rudrāya | mīḷhuṣe | sa-joṣāḥ ||5.41.2||

IAST: namobhir vā ye dadhate suvṛktiṁ stomaṁ rudrāya mīḻhuṣe sajoṣāḥ
Griffith: And they who of one mind with bounteous Rudra accept the hymn and laud with adorations.
Devanāgarī: नमोभिर्वा ये दधते सुवृक्तिं स्तोमं रुद्राय मीळ्हुषे सजोषाः
pada pāṭha: te | naḥ | mitraḥ | varuṇaḥ | aryamā | āyuḥ | indraḥ | r̥bhukṣāḥ | marutaḥ | juṣanta || namaḥ-bhiḥ | vā | ye | dadhate | su-vr̥ktim | stomam | rudrāya | mīḷhuṣe | sa-joṣāḥ ||5.41.2||

IAST: ā vāṁ yeṣṭhāśvinā huvadhyai vātasya patman rathyasya puṣṭau
Griffith: You will I call to feed the car-horse, Asvins, with the wind's flight swiftest of those who travel:
Devanāgarī: आ वां येष्ठाश्विना हुवध्यै वातस्य पत्मन्रथ्यस्य पुष्टौ
pada pāṭha: ā | vām | yeṣṭhā | aśvinā | huvadhyai | vātasya | patman | rathyasya | puṣṭau || uta | vā | divaḥ | asurāya | manma | pra | andhāṁsi-iva | yajyave | bharadhvam ||5.41.3||

IAST: uta vā divo asurāya manma prāndhāṁsīva yajyave bharadhvam
Griffith: Or also to the Asura of heaven, Worshipful, bring a hymn as 'twere libation.
Devanāgarī: उत वा दिवो असुराय मन्म प्रान्धांसीव यज्यवे भरध्वम्
pada pāṭha: ā | vām | yeṣṭhā | aśvinā | huvadhyai | vātasya | patman | rathyasya | puṣṭau || uta | vā | divaḥ | asurāya | manma | pra | andhāṁsi-iva | yajyave | bharadhvam ||5.41.3||

IAST: pra sakṣaṇo divyaḥ kaṇvahotā trito divaḥ sajoṣā vāto agniḥ
Griffith: The heavenly Victor, he whose priest is Kanva, Trta with Dyaus accordant, Vata, Agni,
Devanāgarī: प्र सक्षणो दिव्यः कण्वहोता त्रितो दिवः सजोषा वातो अग्निः
pada pāṭha: pra | sakṣaṇaḥ | divyaḥ | kaṇva-hotā | tritaḥ | divaḥ | sa-joṣāḥ | vātaḥ | agniḥ || pūṣā | bhagaḥ | pra-bhr̥the | viśva-bhojāḥ | ājim | na | jagmuḥ | āśvaśva-tamāḥ ||5.41.4||

IAST: pūṣā bhagaḥ prabhṛthe viśvabhojā ājiṁ na jagmur āśvaśvatamāḥ
Griffith: All-feeding Pusan, Bhaga sought the oblation, as they whose steeds are fleetest seek the contest.
Devanāgarī: पूषा भगः प्रभृथे विश्वभोजा आजिं न जग्मुराश्वश्वतमाः
pada pāṭha: pra | sakṣaṇaḥ | divyaḥ | kaṇva-hotā | tritaḥ | divaḥ | sa-joṣāḥ | vātaḥ | agniḥ || pūṣā | bhagaḥ | pra-bhr̥the | viśva-bhojāḥ | ājim | na | jagmuḥ | āśvaśva-tamāḥ ||5.41.4||

IAST: pra vo rayiṁ yuktāśvam bharadhvaṁ rāya eṣe 'vase dadhīta dhīḥ
Griffith: Bring ye your riches forward borne on horses: let thought be framed for help and gain of treasure.
Devanāgarī: प्र वो रयिं युक्ताश्वं भरध्वं राय एषेऽवसे दधीत धीः
pada pāṭha: pra | vaḥ | rayim | yukta-aśvam | bharadhvam | rāyaḥ | eṣe | avase | dadhīta | dhīḥ || su-śevaḥ | evaiḥ | auśijasya | hotā | ye | vaḥ | evāḥ | marutaḥ | turāṇām ||5.41.5||

IAST: suśeva evair auśijasya hotā ye va evā marutas turāṇām
Griffith: Blest he the priest of Ausija through courses, the courses which are yours the fleet, O Maruts.
Devanāgarī: सुशेव एवैरौशिजस्य होता ये व एवा मरुतस्तुराणाम्
pada pāṭha: pra | vaḥ | rayim | yukta-aśvam | bharadhvam | rāyaḥ | eṣe | avase | dadhīta | dhīḥ || su-śevaḥ | evaiḥ | auśijasya | hotā | ye | vaḥ | evāḥ | marutaḥ | turāṇām ||5.41.5||

IAST: pra vo vāyuṁ rathayujaṁ kṛṇudhvam pra devaṁ vipram panitāram arkaiḥ
Griffith: Bring hither him who yokes the car, your Vayu, who praises with his songs, the God and Singer;
Devanāgarī: प्र वो वायुं रथयुजं कृणुध्वं प्र देवं विप्रं पनितारमर्कैः
pada pāṭha: pra | vaḥ | vāyum | ratha-yujam | kr̥ṇudhvam | pra | devam | vipram | panitāram | arkaiḥ || iṣudhyavaḥ | r̥ta-sāpaḥ | puram-dhīḥ | vasvīḥ | naḥ | atra | patnīḥ | ā | dhiye | dhuriti dhuḥ ||5.41.6||

IAST: iṣudhyava ṛtasāpaḥ puraṁdhīr vasvīr no atra patnīr ā dhiye dhuḥ
Griffith: And, praying and devout, noble and prudent, may the Gods' Spouses in their thoughts retain us.
Devanāgarī: इषुध्यव ऋतसापः पुरंधीर्वस्वीर्नो अत्र पत्नीरा धिये धुः
pada pāṭha: pra | vaḥ | vāyum | ratha-yujam | kr̥ṇudhvam | pra | devam | vipram | panitāram | arkaiḥ || iṣudhyavaḥ | r̥ta-sāpaḥ | puram-dhīḥ | vasvīḥ | naḥ | atra | patnīḥ | ā | dhiye | dhuriti dhuḥ ||5.41.6||

IAST: upa va eṣe vandyebhiḥ śūṣaiḥ pra yahvī divaś citayadbhir arkaiḥ
Griffith: I speed to you with powers that should be honoured, with songs distinguishing Heaven's mighty Daughters,
Devanāgarī: उप व एषे वन्द्येभिः शूषैः प्र यह्वी दिवश्चितयद्भिरर्कैः
pada pāṭha: upa | vaḥ | eṣe | vandyebhiḥ | śūṣaiḥ | pra | yahvī iti | divaḥ | citayat-bhiḥ | arkaiḥ || uṣasānaktā | viduṣī iveti viduṣī-iva | viśvam | ā | ha | vahataḥ | martyāya | yajñam ||5.41.7||

IAST: uṣāsānaktā viduṣīva viśvam ā hā vahato martyāya yajñam
Griffith: Morning and Night, the Two, as 'twere all-knowing: these bring the sacrifice unto the mortal.
Devanāgarī: उषासानक्ता विदुषीव विश्वमा हा वहतो मर्त्याय यज्ञम्
pada pāṭha: upa | vaḥ | eṣe | vandyebhiḥ | śūṣaiḥ | pra | yahvī iti | divaḥ | citayat-bhiḥ | arkaiḥ || uṣasānaktā | viduṣī iveti viduṣī-iva | viśvam | ā | ha | vahataḥ | martyāya | yajñam ||5.41.7||

IAST: abhi vo arce poṣyāvato nṝn vāstoṣ patiṁ tvaṣṭāraṁ rarāṇaḥ
Griffith: You I extol, the nourishers of heroes bringing you gifts, Vastospati and Tvastar-
Devanāgarī: अभि वो अर्चे पोष्यावतो नॄन्वास्तोष्पतिं त्वष्टारं रराणः
pada pāṭha: abhi | vaḥ | arce | poṣyā-vataḥ | nr̥̄n | vāstoḥ | patim | tvaṣṭāram | rarāṇaḥ || dhanyā | sa-joṣāḥ | dhiṣaṇā | namaḥ-bhiḥ | vanaspatīn | oṣadhīḥ | rāyaḥ | eṣe ||5.41.8||

IAST: dhanyā sajoṣā dhiṣaṇā namobhir vanaspatīm̐r oṣadhī rāya eṣe
Griffith: Rich Dhisana accords through our obeisance - andTrees and Plants, for the swift gain of riches.
Devanāgarī: धन्या सजोषा धिषणा नमोभिर्वनस्पतीँरोषधी राय एषे
pada pāṭha: abhi | vaḥ | arce | poṣyā-vataḥ | nr̥̄n | vāstoḥ | patim | tvaṣṭāram | rarāṇaḥ || dhanyā | sa-joṣāḥ | dhiṣaṇā | namaḥ-bhiḥ | vanaspatīn | oṣadhīḥ | rāyaḥ | eṣe ||5.41.8||

IAST: tuje nas tane parvatāḥ santu svaitavo ye vasavo na vīrāḥ
Griffith: Ours be the Parvatas, even they, for offspring, free-moving, who are Heroes like the Vasus.
Devanāgarī: तुजे नस्तने पर्वताः सन्तु स्वैतवो ये वसवो न वीराः
pada pāṭha: tuje | naḥ | tane | parvatāḥ | santu | sva-etavaḥ | ye | vasavaḥ | na | vīrāḥ || panitaḥ | āptyaḥ | yajataḥ | sadā | naḥ | vardhāt | naḥ | śaṁsam | naryaḥ | abhiṣṭau ||5.41.9||

IAST: panita āptyo yajataḥ sadā no vardhān naḥ śaṁsaṁ naryo abhiṣṭau
Griffith: May holy Aptya, Friend of man, exalted, strengthen our word for ever and be near us.
Devanāgarī: पनित आप्त्यो यजतः सदा नो वर्धान्नः शंसं नर्यो अभिष्टौ
pada pāṭha: tuje | naḥ | tane | parvatāḥ | santu | sva-etavaḥ | ye | vasavaḥ | na | vīrāḥ || panitaḥ | āptyaḥ | yajataḥ | sadā | naḥ | vardhāt | naḥ | śaṁsam | naryaḥ | abhiṣṭau ||5.41.9||

IAST: vṛṣṇo astoṣi bhūmyasya garbhaṁ trito napātam apāṁ suvṛkti
Griffith: Trta praised him, germ of the earthly hero, with pure songs him the Offspring of the Waters.
Devanāgarī: वृष्णो अस्तोषि भूम्यस्य गर्भं त्रितो नपातमपां सुवृक्ति
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣṇaḥ | astoṣi | bhūmyasya | garbham | tritaḥ | napātam | apām | su-vr̥kti || gr̥ṇīte | agniḥ | etari | na | śūṣaiḥ | śociḥ-keśaḥ | ni | riṇāti | vanā ||5.41.10||

IAST: gṛṇīte agnir etarī na śūṣaiḥ śociṣkeśo ni riṇāti vanā
Griffith: Agn; with might neighs loudly like a charger: he of the flaming hair destroys the forests.
Devanāgarī: गृणीते अग्निरेतरी न शूषैः शोचिष्केशो नि रिणाति वना
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣṇaḥ | astoṣi | bhūmyasya | garbham | tritaḥ | napātam | apām | su-vr̥kti || gr̥ṇīte | agniḥ | etari | na | śūṣaiḥ | śociḥ-keśaḥ | ni | riṇāti | vanā ||5.41.10||

IAST: kathā mahe rudriyāya bravāma kad rāye cikituṣe bhagāya
Griffith: How shall we speak to the great might of Rudra? How speak to Bhaga who takes thought for riches?
Devanāgarī: कथा महे रुद्रियाय ब्रवाम कद्राये चिकितुषे भगाय
pada pāṭha: kathā | mahe | rudriyāya | bravāma | kat | rāye | cikituṣe | bhagāya || āpaḥ | oṣadhīḥ | uta | naḥ | avantu | dyauḥ | vanā | girayaḥ | vr̥kṣa-keśāḥ ||5.41.11||

IAST: āpa oṣadhīr uta no 'vantu dyaur vanā girayo vṛkṣakeśāḥ
Griffith: May Plants, the Waters, and the Sky preserve us, and Woods and Mountains with their trees for tresses.
Devanāgarī: आप ओषधीरुत नोऽवन्तु द्यौर्वना गिरयो वृक्षकेशाः
pada pāṭha: kathā | mahe | rudriyāya | bravāma | kat | rāye | cikituṣe | bhagāya || āpaḥ | oṣadhīḥ | uta | naḥ | avantu | dyauḥ | vanā | girayaḥ | vr̥kṣa-keśāḥ ||5.41.11||

IAST: śṛṇotu na ūrjām patir giraḥ sa nabhas tarīyām̐ iṣiraḥ parijmā
