Griffith: May the swift Wanderer, Lord of refreshments listen to our songs, who speeds throuih cloudy heaven:
Devanāgarī: शृणोतु न ऊर्जां पतिर्गिरः स नभस्तरीयाँ इषिरः परिज्मा
pada pāṭha: śr̥ṇotu | naḥ | ūrjām | patiḥ | giraḥ | saḥ | nabhaḥ | tarīyān | iṣiraḥ | pari-jmā || śr̥ṇvantu | āpaḥ | puraḥ | na | śubhrāḥ | pari | srucaḥ | babr̥hāṇasya | adreḥ ||5.41.12||

IAST: śṛṇvantv āpaḥ puro na śubhrāḥ pari sruco babṛhāṇasyādreḥ
Griffith: And may the Waters, bright like castles, hear us, as they flow onward from the cloven mountain.
Devanāgarī: शृण्वन्त्वापः पुरो न शुभ्राः परि स्रुचो बबृहाणस्याद्रेः
pada pāṭha: śr̥ṇotu | naḥ | ūrjām | patiḥ | giraḥ | saḥ | nabhaḥ | tarīyān | iṣiraḥ | pari-jmā || śr̥ṇvantu | āpaḥ | puraḥ | na | śubhrāḥ | pari | srucaḥ | babr̥hāṇasya | adreḥ ||5.41.12||

IAST: vidā cin nu mahānto ye va evā bravāma dasmā vāryaṁ dadhānāḥ
Griffith: We know your ways, ye Mighty Ones receiving choice meed, ye Wonderful, we will proclaim it.
Devanāgarī: विदा चिन्नु महान्तो ये व एवा ब्रवाम दस्मा वार्यं दधानाः
pada pāṭha: vida | cit | nu | mahāntaḥ | ye | vaḥ | evāḥ | bravāma | dasmāḥ | vāryam | dadhānāḥ || vayaḥ | cana | su-bhvaḥ | ā | ava | yanti | kṣubhā | martam | anu-yatam | vadha-snaiḥ ||5.41.13||

IAST: vayaś cana subhva āva yanti kṣubhā martam anuyataṁ vadhasnaiḥ
Griffith: Even strong birds descend not to the mortal who strives to reach them with swift blow and weapons.
Devanāgarī: वयश्चन सुभ्व आव यन्ति क्षुभा मर्तमनुयतं वधस्नैः
pada pāṭha: vida | cit | nu | mahāntaḥ | ye | vaḥ | evāḥ | bravāma | dasmāḥ | vāryam | dadhānāḥ || vayaḥ | cana | su-bhvaḥ | ā | ava | yanti | kṣubhā | martam | anu-yatam | vadha-snaiḥ ||5.41.13||

IAST: ā daivyāni pārthivāni janmāpaś cācchā sumakhāya vocam
Griffith: Celestial and terrestrial generations, and Waters will I summon to the feasting.
Devanāgarī: आ दैव्यानि पार्थिवानि जन्मापश्चाच्छा सुमखाय वोचम्
pada pāṭha: ā | daivyāni | pārthivāni | janma | apaḥ | ca | accha | su-makhāya | vocam || vardhantām | dyāvaḥ | giraḥ | candra-agrāḥ | udā | vardhantām | abhi-sātāḥ | arṇāḥ ||5.41.14||

IAST: vardhantāṁ dyāvo giraś candrāgrā udā vardhantām abhiṣātā arṇāḥ
Griffith: May days with bright dawns cause my songs to prosper, and may the conquered streams increase their wate
Devanāgarī: वर्धन्तां द्यावो गिरश्चन्द्राग्रा उदा वर्धन्तामभिषाता अर्णाः
pada pāṭha: ā | daivyāni | pārthivāni | janma | apaḥ | ca | accha | su-makhāya | vocam || vardhantām | dyāvaḥ | giraḥ | candra-agrāḥ | udā | vardhantām | abhi-sātāḥ | arṇāḥ ||5.41.14||

IAST: pade-pade me jarimā ni dhāyi varūtrī vā śakrā yā pāyubhiś ca
Griffith: Duly to each one hath my laud been offered. Strong be Varutri with her powers to succour.
Devanāgarī: पदेपदे मे जरिमा नि धायि वरूत्री वा शक्रा या पायुभिश्च
pada pāṭha: pade-pade | me | jarimā | ni | dhāyi | varūtrī | vā | śakrā | yā | pāyu-bhiḥ | ca || sisaktu | mātā | mahī | rasā | naḥ | smat | sūri-bhiḥ | r̥ju-hastā | r̥ju-vaniḥ ||5.41.15||

IAST: siṣaktu mātā mahī rasā naḥ smat sūribhir ṛjuhasta ṛjuvaniḥ
Griffith: May the great Mother Rasa here befriend us, straight-handed, with the princes, striving forward.
Devanāgarī: सिषक्तु माता मही रसा नः स्मत्सूरिभिरृजुहस्त ऋजुवनिः
pada pāṭha: pade-pade | me | jarimā | ni | dhāyi | varūtrī | vā | śakrā | yā | pāyu-bhiḥ | ca || sisaktu | mātā | mahī | rasā | naḥ | smat | sūri-bhiḥ | r̥ju-hastā | r̥ju-vaniḥ ||5.41.15||

IAST: kathā dāśema namasā sudānūn evayā maruto acchoktau praśravaso maruto acchoktau
Griffith: How may we serve the Liberal Ones with worship, the Maruts swift of course in invocation, the Maruts far
Devanāgarī: कथा दाशेम नमसा सुदानूनेवया मरुतो अच्छोक्तौ प्रश्रवसो मरुतो अच्छोक्तौ
pada pāṭha: kathā | dāśema | namasā | su-dānūn | eva-yā | marutaḥ | accha-uktau | pra-śravasaḥ | marutaḥ | accha-uktau || mā | naḥ | ahiḥ | budhnyaḥ | riṣe | dhāt | asmākam | bhūt | upamāti-vaniḥ ||5.41.16||

IAST: mā no 'hir budhnyo riṣe dhād asmākam bhūd upamātivaniḥ
Griffith: Let not the Dragon of the Deep annoy us, and gladly may he welcome our addresses.
Devanāgarī: मा नोऽहिर्बुध्न्यो रिषे धादस्माकं भूदुपमातिवनिः
pada pāṭha: kathā | dāśema | namasā | su-dānūn | eva-yā | marutaḥ | accha-uktau | pra-śravasaḥ | marutaḥ | accha-uktau || mā | naḥ | ahiḥ | budhnyaḥ | riṣe | dhāt | asmākam | bhūt | upamāti-vaniḥ ||5.41.16||

IAST: iti cin nu prajāyai paśumatyai devāso vanate martyo va ā devāso vanate martyo vaḥ
Griffith: Thus thinking, O ye Gods, the mortal wins you to give him increase of his herds of cattle: the mortal wi
Devanāgarī: इति चिन्नु प्रजायै पशुमत्यै देवासो वनते मर्त्यो व आ देवासो वनते मर्त्यो वः
pada pāṭha: iti | cit | nu | pra-jāyai | paśu-matyai | devāsaḥ | vanate | martyaḥ | vaḥ | ā | devāsaḥ | vanate | martyaḥ | vaḥ || atra | śivām | tanvaḥ | dhāsim | asyāḥ | jarām | cit | me | niḥ-r̥tiḥ | jagrasīta ||5.41.17||

IAST: atrā śivāṁ tanvo dhāsim asyā jarāṁ cin me nirṛtir jagrasīta
Griffith: Here he wins wholesome food to feed this body: as for mine old age, Nirrti consume it
Devanāgarī: अत्रा शिवां तन्वो धासिमस्या जरां चिन्मे निरृतिर्जग्रसीत
pada pāṭha: iti | cit | nu | pra-jāyai | paśu-matyai | devāsaḥ | vanate | martyaḥ | vaḥ | ā | devāsaḥ | vanate | martyaḥ | vaḥ || atra | śivām | tanvaḥ | dhāsim | asyāḥ | jarām | cit | me | niḥ-r̥tiḥ | jagrasīta ||5.41.17||

IAST: tāṁ vo devāḥ sumatim ūrjayantīm iṣam aśyāma vasavaḥ śasā goḥ
Griffith: O Gods, may we obtain from you this favour, strengthening food through the Cow's praise, ye Vasus.
Devanāgarī: तां वो देवाः सुमतिमूर्जयन्तीमिषमश्याम वसवः शसा गोः
pada pāṭha: tām | vaḥ | devāḥ | su-matim | ūrjayantīm | iṣam | aśyāma | vasavaḥ | śasā | goḥ || sā | naḥ | su-dānuḥ | mr̥ḷayantī | devī | prati | dravantī | suvitāya | gamyāḥ ||5.41.18||

IAST: sā naḥ sudānur mṛḻayantī devī prati dravantī suvitāya gamyāḥ
Griffith: May she who gives good gifts, the gracious Goddes. s, come speeding nigh to us for our well-being.
Devanāgarī: सा नः सुदानुर्मृळयन्ती देवी प्रति द्रवन्ती सुविताय गम्याः
pada pāṭha: tām | vaḥ | devāḥ | su-matim | ūrjayantīm | iṣam | aśyāma | vasavaḥ | śasā | goḥ || sā | naḥ | su-dānuḥ | mr̥ḷayantī | devī | prati | dravantī | suvitāya | gamyāḥ ||5.41.18||

IAST: abhi na iḻā yūthasya mātā sman nadībhir urvaśī vā gṛṇātu
Griffith: May Ila, Mother of the herds of cattle, and Urvasi with all the streams accept us;
Devanāgarī: अभि न इळा यूथस्य माता स्मन्नदीभिरुर्वशी वा गृणातु
pada pāṭha: abhi | naḥ | iḷā | yūthasya | mātā | smat | nadībhiḥ | urvaśī | vā | gr̥ṇātu || urvaśī | vā | br̥hat-divā | gr̥ṇānā | abhi-ūrṇvānā | pra-bhr̥thasya | āyoḥ ||5.41.19||

IAST: urvaśī vā bṛhaddivā gṛṇānābhyūrṇvānā prabhṛthasyāyoḥ
Griffith: May Urvasi in lofty heaven accepting, as she partakes the oblation of the living,
Devanāgarī: उर्वशी वा बृहद्दिवा गृणानाभ्यूर्ण्वाना प्रभृथस्यायोः
pada pāṭha: abhi | naḥ | iḷā | yūthasya | mātā | smat | nadībhiḥ | urvaśī | vā | gr̥ṇātu || urvaśī | vā | br̥hat-divā | gr̥ṇānā | abhi-ūrṇvānā | pra-bhr̥thasya | āyoḥ ||5.41.19||

IAST: siṣaktu na ūrjavyasya puṣṭeḥ
Griffith: Visit us while she shares Urjavya's food.
Devanāgarī: सिषक्तु न ऊर्जव्यस्य पुष्टेः॥ ५.०४१.२
pada pāṭha: sisaktu | naḥ | ūrjavyasya | puṣṭeḥ ||5.41.20||

IAST: pra śaṁtamā varuṇaṁ dīdhitī gīr mitram bhagam aditiṁ nūnam aśyāḥ
Griffith: Now may our sweetest song with deep devotion reach Varuna, Mitra, Aditi, and Bhaga.
Devanāgarī: प्र शंतमा वरुणं दीधिती गीर्मित्रं भगमदितिं नूनमश्याः
pada pāṭha: pra | śam-tamā | varuṇam | dīdhitī | gīḥ | mitram | bhagam | aditim | nūnam | aśyāḥ || pr̥ṣat-yoniḥ | pañca-hotā | śr̥ṇotu | atūrta-panthāḥ | asuraḥ | mayaḥ-bhuḥ ||5.42.1||

IAST: pṛṣadyoniḥ pañcahotā śṛṇotv atūrtapanthā asuro mayobhuḥ
Griffith: May the Five Priests' Lord, dwelling in oblations, bliss-giving Asura, hear, whose paths are open.
Devanāgarī: पृषद्योनिः पञ्चहोता शृणोत्वतूर्तपन्था असुरो मयोभुः
pada pāṭha: pra | śam-tamā | varuṇam | dīdhitī | gīḥ | mitram | bhagam | aditim | nūnam | aśyāḥ || pr̥ṣat-yoniḥ | pañca-hotā | śr̥ṇotu | atūrta-panthāḥ | asuraḥ | mayaḥ-bhuḥ ||5.42.1||

IAST: prati me stomam aditir jagṛbhyāt sūnuṁ na mātā hṛdyaṁ suśevam
Griffith: May Aditi welcome, even as a mother her dear heart-gladdening son, my song that lauds her.
Devanāgarī: प्रति मे स्तोममदितिर्जगृभ्यात्सूनुं न माता हृद्यं सुशेवम्
pada pāṭha: prati | me | stomam | aditiḥ | jagr̥bhyāt | sūnum | na | mātā | hr̥dyam | su-śevam || brahma | priyam | deva-hitam | yat | asti | aham | mitre | varuṇe | yat | mayaḥ-bhuḥ ||5.42.2||

IAST: brahma priyaṁ devahitaṁ yad asty aham mitre varuṇe yan mayobhu
Griffith: The prayer they love, bliss-giving, God-appointed, I offer unto Varuna and Mitra.
Devanāgarī: ब्रह्म प्रियं देवहितं यदस्त्यहं मित्रे वरुणे यन्मयोभु
pada pāṭha: prati | me | stomam | aditiḥ | jagr̥bhyāt | sūnum | na | mātā | hr̥dyam | su-śevam || brahma | priyam | deva-hitam | yat | asti | aham | mitre | varuṇe | yat | mayaḥ-bhuḥ ||5.42.2||

IAST: ud īraya kavitamaṁ kavīnām unattainam abhi madhvā ghṛtena
Griffith: In spirit him, the Sagest of the Sages; with sacrificial oil and meath bedew him
Devanāgarī: उदीरय कवितमं कवीनामुनत्तैनमभि मध्वा घृतेन
pada pāṭha: ut | īraya | kavi-tamam | kavīnām | unatta | enam | abhi | madhvā | ghr̥tena || saḥ | naḥ | vasūni | pra-yatā | hitāni | candrāṇi | devaḥ | savitā | suvāti ||5.42.3||

IAST: sa no vasūni prayatā hitāni candrāṇi devaḥ savitā suvāti
Griffith: So then let him, God Savitar, provide us excellent, ready, and resplendent treasures.
Devanāgarī: स नो वसूनि प्रयता हितानि चन्द्राणि देवः सविता सुवाति
pada pāṭha: ut | īraya | kavi-tamam | kavīnām | unatta | enam | abhi | madhvā | ghr̥tena || saḥ | naḥ | vasūni | pra-yatā | hitāni | candrāṇi | devaḥ | savitā | suvāti ||5.42.3||

IAST: sam indra ṇo manasā neṣi gobhiḥ saṁ sūribhir harivaḥ saṁ svasti
Griffith: With willing mind, Indra, vouchsafe us cattle, prosperity, Lord of Bays! and pious patrons;
Devanāgarī: समिन्द्र णो मनसा नेषि गोभिः सं सूरिभिर्हरिवः सं स्वस्ति
pada pāṭha: sam | indra | naḥ | manasā | neṣi | gobhiḥ | sam | sūri-bhiḥ | hari-vaḥ | sam | svasti || sam | brahmaṇā | deva-hitam | yat | asti | sam | devānām | su-matyā | yajñiyānām ||5.42.4||

IAST: sam brahmaṇā devahitaṁ yad asti saṁ devānāṁ sumatyā yajñiyānām
Griffith: And, with the sacred prayer by Gods appointed, give us the holy Deities' lovingkindness.
Devanāgarī: सं ब्रह्मणा देवहितं यदस्ति सं देवानां सुमत्या यज्ञियानाम्
pada pāṭha: sam | indra | naḥ | manasā | neṣi | gobhiḥ | sam | sūri-bhiḥ | hari-vaḥ | sam | svasti || sam | brahmaṇā | deva-hitam | yat | asti | sam | devānām | su-matyā | yajñiyānām ||5.42.4||

IAST: devo bhagaḥ savitā rāyo aṁśa indro vṛtrasya saṁjito dhanānām
Griffith: God Bhaga, Savitar who deals forth riches, Indra, and they who conquer Vrtra's treasures,
Devanāgarī: देवो भगः सविता रायो अंश इन्द्रो वृत्रस्य संजितो धनानाम्
pada pāṭha: devaḥ | bhagaḥ | savitā | rāyaḥ | aṁśaḥ | indraḥ | vr̥trasya | sam-jitaḥ | dhanānām || r̥bhukṣāḥ | vājaḥ | uta | vā | puram-dhiḥ | avantu | naḥ | amr̥tāsaḥ | turāsaḥ ||5.42.5||

IAST: ṛbhukṣā vāja uta vā puraṁdhir avantu no amṛtāsas turāsaḥ
Griffith: And Vaja and Rbhuksan and Purandhi, the Mighty and Immortal Ones, protect us!
Devanāgarī: ऋभुक्षा वाज उत वा पुरंधिरवन्तु नो अमृतासस्तुरासः
pada pāṭha: devaḥ | bhagaḥ | savitā | rāyaḥ | aṁśaḥ | indraḥ | vr̥trasya | sam-jitaḥ | dhanānām || r̥bhukṣāḥ | vājaḥ | uta | vā | puram-dhiḥ | avantu | naḥ | amr̥tāsaḥ | turāsaḥ ||5.42.5||

IAST: marutvato apratītasya jiṣṇor ajūryataḥ pra bravāmā kṛtāni
Griffith: Let us declare his deeds, the undecaying unrivalled Victor whom the Maruts follow.
Devanāgarī: मरुत्वतो अप्रतीतस्य जिष्णोरजूर्यतः प्र ब्रवामा कृतानि
pada pāṭha: marutvataḥ | aprati-itasya | jiṣṇoḥ | ajūryataḥ | pra | bravāma | kr̥tāni || na | te | pūrve | magha-van | na | aparāsaḥ | na | vīryam | nūtanaḥ | kaḥ | cana | āpa ||5.42.6||

IAST: na te pūrve maghavan nāparāso na vīryaṁ nūtanaḥ kaś canāpa
Griffith: None of old times, O Maghavan, nor later, none of these days hath reached thy hero prowess.
Devanāgarī: न ते पूर्वे मघवन्नापरासो न वीर्यं नूतनः कश्चनाप
pada pāṭha: marutvataḥ | aprati-itasya | jiṣṇoḥ | ajūryataḥ | pra | bravāma | kr̥tāni || na | te | pūrve | magha-van | na | aparāsaḥ | na | vīryam | nūtanaḥ | kaḥ | cana | āpa ||5.42.6||

IAST: upa stuhi prathamaṁ ratnadheyam bṛhaspatiṁ sanitāraṁ dhanānām
Griffith: Praise him the Chief who gives the boon of riches, Brhaspati distributor of treasures,
Devanāgarī: उप स्तुहि प्रथमं रत्नधेयं बृहस्पतिं सनितारं धनानाम्
pada pāṭha: upa | stuhi | prathamam | ratna-dheyam | br̥haspatim | sanitāram | dhanānām || yaḥ | śaṁsate | stuvate | śam-bhaviṣṭhaḥ | puru-vasuḥ | ā-gamat | johuvānam ||5.42.7||

IAST: yaḥ śaṁsate stuvate śambhaviṣṭhaḥ purūvasur āgamaj johuvānam
Griffith: Who, blessing most the man who sings and praises, comes with abundant wealth to his invoker.
Devanāgarī: यः शंसते स्तुवते शम्भविष्ठः पुरूवसुरागमज्जोहुवानम्
pada pāṭha: upa | stuhi | prathamam | ratna-dheyam | br̥haspatim | sanitāram | dhanānām || yaḥ | śaṁsate | stuvate | śam-bhaviṣṭhaḥ | puru-vasuḥ | ā-gamat | johuvānam ||5.42.7||

IAST: tavotibhiḥ sacamānā ariṣṭā bṛhaspate maghavānaḥ suvīrāḥ
Griffith: Tended, Brhaspati, with thy protections, the princes are unharmed and girt by heroes.
Devanāgarī: तवोतिभिः सचमाना अरिष्टा बृहस्पते मघवानः सुवीराः
pada pāṭha: tava | ūti-bhiḥ | sacamānāḥ | ariṣṭāḥ | br̥haspate | magha-vānaḥ | su-vīrāḥ || ye | aśva-dāḥ | uta | vā | santi | go-dāḥ | ye | vastra-dāḥ | su-bhagāḥ | teṣu | rāyaḥ ||5.42.8||

IAST: ye aśvadā uta vā santi godā ye vastradāḥ subhagās teṣu rāyaḥ
Griffith: Wealth that brings bliss is found among the givers of horses and of cattle and of raiment.
Devanāgarī: ये अश्वदा उत वा सन्ति गोदा ये वस्त्रदाः सुभगास्तेषु रायः
pada pāṭha: tava | ūti-bhiḥ | sacamānāḥ | ariṣṭāḥ | br̥haspate | magha-vānaḥ | su-vīrāḥ || ye | aśva-dāḥ | uta | vā | santi | go-dāḥ | ye | vastra-dāḥ | su-bhagāḥ | teṣu | rāyaḥ ||5.42.8||

IAST: visarmāṇaṁ kṛṇuhi vittam eṣāṁ ye bhuñjate apṛṇanto na ukthaiḥ
Griffith: Make their wealth flee who, through our hymns enjoying their riches, yield us not an ample guerdon.
Devanāgarī: विसर्माणं कृणुहि वित्तमेषां ये भुञ्जते अपृणन्तो न उक्थैः
pada pāṭha: vi-sarmāṇam | kr̥ṇuhi | vittam | eṣām | ye | bhuñjate | apr̥ṇantaḥ | naḥ | ukthaiḥ || apa-vratān | pra-save | vavr̥dhānān | brahma-dviṣaḥ | sūryāt | yavayasva ||5.42.9||

IAST: apavratān prasave vāvṛdhānān brahmadviṣaḥ sūryād yāvayasva
Griffith: Far from the sun keep those who hate devotion, the godless, prospering in their vocation.
Devanāgarī: अपव्रतान्प्रसवे वावृधानान्ब्रह्मद्विषः सूर्याद्यावयस्व
pada pāṭha: vi-sarmāṇam | kr̥ṇuhi | vittam | eṣām | ye | bhuñjate | apr̥ṇantaḥ | naḥ | ukthaiḥ || apa-vratān | pra-save | vavr̥dhānān | brahma-dviṣaḥ | sūryāt | yavayasva ||5.42.9||

IAST: ya ohate rakṣaso devavītāv acakrebhis tam maruto ni yāta
Griffith: With wheelless chariots drive down him, O Maruts, who at the feasts of Gods regards the demons.
Devanāgarī: य ओहते रक्षसो देववीतावचक्रेभिस्तं मरुतो नि यात
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | ohate | rakṣasaḥ | deva-vītau | acakrebhiḥ | tam | marutaḥ | ni | yāta || yaḥ | vaḥ | śamīm | śaśamānasya | nindāt | tucchyān | kāmān | karate | sisvidānaḥ ||5.42.10||

IAST: yo vaḥ śamīṁ śaśamānasya nindāt tucchyān kāmān karate siṣvidānaḥ
Griffith: May he, though bathed in sweat, form empty wishes, who blames his sacred rite who toils to serve you.
Devanāgarī: यो वः शमीं शशमानस्य निन्दात्तुच्छ्यान्कामान्करते सिष्विदानः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | ohate | rakṣasaḥ | deva-vītau | acakrebhiḥ | tam | marutaḥ | ni | yāta || yaḥ | vaḥ | śamīm | śaśamānasya | nindāt | tucchyān | kāmān | karate | sisvidānaḥ ||5.42.10||

IAST: tam u ṣṭuhi yaḥ sviṣuḥ sudhanvā yo viśvasya kṣayati bheṣajasya
Griffith: Praise him whose bow is strong and sure his arrow, him who is Lord of every balm that bealeth.
Devanāgarī: तमु ष्टुहि यः स्विषुः सुधन्वा यो विश्वस्य क्षयति भेषजस्य
pada pāṭha: tam | ūm̐ iti | stuhi | yaḥ | su-iṣuḥ | su-dhanvā | yaḥ | viśvasya | kṣayati | bheṣajasya || yakṣva | mahe | saumanasāya | rudram | namaḥ-bhiḥ | devam | asuram | duvasya ||5.42.11||

IAST: yakṣvā mahe saumanasāya rudraṁ namobhir devam asuraṁ duvasya
Griffith: Worship thou Rudra for his great good favour: adore the Asura, God, with salutations.
Devanāgarī: यक्ष्वा महे सौमनसाय रुद्रं नमोभिर्देवमसुरं दुवस्य
pada pāṭha: tam | ūm̐ iti | stuhi | yaḥ | su-iṣuḥ | su-dhanvā | yaḥ | viśvasya | kṣayati | bheṣajasya || yakṣva | mahe | saumanasāya | rudram | namaḥ-bhiḥ | devam | asuram | duvasya ||5.42.11||

IAST: damūnaso apaso ye suhastā vṛṣṇaḥ patnīr nadyo vibhvataṣṭāḥ
Griffith: May the House-friends, the cunning-handed Artists, may the Steer's Wives, the streams carved out by Vibhv
Devanāgarī: दमूनसो अपसो ये सुहस्ता वृष्णः पत्नीर्नद्यो विभ्वतष्टाः
pada pāṭha: damūnasaḥ | apasaḥ | ye | su-hastāḥ | vr̥ṣṇaḥ | patnīḥ | nadyaḥ | vibhva-taṣṭāḥ || sarasvatī | br̥hat-divā | uta | rākā | daśasyantīḥ | varivasyantu | śubhrāḥ ||5.42.12||

IAST: sarasvatī bṛhaddivota rākā daśasyantīr varivasyantu śubhrāḥ
Griffith: And may the fair Ones honour and befriend us, Sarasvati, Brhaddiva, and Raka.
Devanāgarī: सरस्वती बृहद्दिवोत राका दशस्यन्तीर्वरिवस्यन्तु शुभ्राः
pada pāṭha: damūnasaḥ | apasaḥ | ye | su-hastāḥ | vr̥ṣṇaḥ | patnīḥ | nadyaḥ | vibhva-taṣṭāḥ || sarasvatī | br̥hat-divā | uta | rākā | daśasyantīḥ | varivasyantu | śubhrāḥ ||5.42.12||

IAST: pra sū mahe suśaraṇāya medhāṁ giram bhare navyasīṁ jāyamānām
Griffith: My newest song, thought that now springs within me, I offer to the Great, the Sure Protector,
Devanāgarī: प्र सू महे सुशरणाय मेधां गिरं भरे नव्यसीं जायमानाम्
pada pāṭha: pra | su | mahe | su-śaraṇāya | medhām | giram | bhare | navyasīm | jāyamānām || yaḥ | āhanāḥ | duhituḥ | vakṣaṇāsu | rūpā | minānaḥ | akr̥ṇot | idam | naḥ ||5.42.13||

IAST: ya āhanā duhitur vakṣaṇāsu rūpā mināno akṛṇod idaṁ naḥ
Griffith: Who made for us this All, in fond love laying each varied form within his Daughter's bosom.
Devanāgarī: य आहना दुहितुर्वक्षणासु रूपा मिनानो अकृणोदिदं नः
pada pāṭha: pra | su | mahe | su-śaraṇāya | medhām | giram | bhare | navyasīm | jāyamānām || yaḥ | āhanāḥ | duhituḥ | vakṣaṇāsu | rūpā | minānaḥ | akr̥ṇot | idam | naḥ ||5.42.13||

IAST: pra suṣṭutiḥ stanayantaṁ ruvantam iḻas patiṁ jaritar nūnam aśyāḥ
Griffith: Now, even now, may thy fair praise, O Singer, attain Idaspati who roars and thunders,
Devanāgarī: प्र सुष्टुतिः स्तनयन्तं रुवन्तमिळस्पतिं जरितर्नूनमश्याः
pada pāṭha: pra | su-stutiḥ | stanayantam | ruvantam | iḷaḥ | patim | jaritaḥ | nūnam | aśyāḥ || yaḥ | abdi-mān | udani-mān | iyarti | pra | vi-dyutā | rodasī iti | ukṣamāṇaḥ ||5.42.14||

IAST: yo abdimām̐ udanimām̐ iyarti pra vidyutā rodasī ukṣamāṇaḥ
Griffith: Who, rich in clouds and waters with his lightning speeds forth bedewing both the earth and heaven.
Devanāgarī: यो अब्दिमाँ उदनिमाँ इयर्ति प्र विद्युता रोदसी उक्षमाणः
pada pāṭha: pra | su-stutiḥ | stanayantam | ruvantam | iḷaḥ | patim | jaritaḥ | nūnam | aśyāḥ || yaḥ | abdi-mān | udani-mān | iyarti | pra | vi-dyutā | rodasī iti | ukṣamāṇaḥ ||5.42.14||

IAST: eṣa stomo mārutaṁ śardho acchā rudrasya sūnūm̐r yuvanyūm̐r ud aśyāḥ
Griffith: May this my laud attain the troop of Maruts, those who are youths in act, the Sons of Rudra.
Devanāgarī: एष स्तोमो मारुतं शर्धो अच्छा रुद्रस्य सूनूँर्युवन्यूँरुदश्याः
pada pāṭha: eṣaḥ | stomaḥ | mārutam | śardhaḥ | accha | rudrasya | sūnūn | yuvanyūn | ut | aśyāḥ || kāmaḥ | rāye | havate | mā | svasti | upa | stuhi | pr̥ṣat-aśvān | ayāsaḥ ||5.42.15||

IAST: kāmo rāye havate mā svasty upa stuhi pṛṣadaśvām̐ ayāsaḥ
Griffith: The wish calls me to riches and well-being: praise the unwearied Ones whose steeds are dappled.
Devanāgarī: कामो राये हवते मा स्वस्त्युप स्तुहि पृषदश्वाँ अयासः
pada pāṭha: eṣaḥ | stomaḥ | mārutam | śardhaḥ | accha | rudrasya | sūnūn | yuvanyūn | ut | aśyāḥ || kāmaḥ | rāye | havate | mā | svasti | upa | stuhi | pr̥ṣat-aśvān | ayāsaḥ ||5.42.15||

IAST: praiṣa stomaḥ pṛthivīm antarikṣaṁ vanaspatīm̐r oṣadhī rāye aśyāḥ
Griffith: May this my laud reach earth and air's mid-region, and forest trees and plants to win me riches.
Devanāgarī: प्रैष स्तोमः पृथिवीमन्तरिक्षं वनस्पतीँरोषधी राये अश्याः
pada pāṭha: pra | eṣaḥ | stomaḥ | pr̥thivīm | antarikṣam | vanaspatīn | oṣadhīḥ | rāye | aśyāḥ || devaḥ-devaḥ | su-havaḥ | bhūtu | mahyam | mā | naḥ | mātā | pr̥thivī | duḥ-matau | dhāt ||5.42.16||

IAST: devo-devaḥ suhavo bhūtu mahyam mā no mātā pṛthivī durmatau dhāt
Griffith: May every Deity be swift to listen, and Mother Earth with no ill thought regard me.
Devanāgarī: देवोदेवः सुहवो भूतु मह्यं मा नो माता पृथिवी दुर्मतौ धात्
pada pāṭha: pra | eṣaḥ | stomaḥ | pr̥thivīm | antarikṣam | vanaspatīn | oṣadhīḥ | rāye | aśyāḥ || devaḥ-devaḥ | su-havaḥ | bhūtu | mahyam | mā | naḥ | mātā | pr̥thivī | duḥ-matau | dhāt ||5.42.16||

IAST: urau devā anibādhe syāma
Griffith: Gods, may we dwell in free untroubled bliss.
Devanāgarī: उरौ देवा अनिबाधे स्याम॥ ५.०४२.१
pada pāṭha: urau | devāḥ | ani-bādhe | syāma ||5.42.17||

IAST: sam aśvinor avasā nūtanena mayobhuvā supraṇītī gamema
Griffith: May we obtain the Asvins' newest favour, and gain their health-bestowing happy guidance.
Devanāgarī: समश्विनोरवसा नूतनेन मयोभुवा सुप्रणीती गमेम
pada pāṭha: sam | aśvinoḥ | avasā | nūtanena | mayaḥ-bhuvā | su-pranītī | gamema || ā | naḥ | rayim | vahatam | ā | uta | vīrān | ā | viśvāni | amr̥tā | saubhagāni ||5.42.18||

IAST: ā no rayiṁ vahatam ota vīrān ā viśvāny amṛtā saubhagāni
Griffith: Bring riches hither unto us, and heroes, and all felicity and joy, Immortals!
Devanāgarī: आ नो रयिं वहतमोत वीराना विश्वान्यमृता सौभगानि
pada pāṭha: sam | aśvinoḥ | avasā | nūtanena | mayaḥ-bhuvā | su-pranītī | gamema || ā | naḥ | rayim | vahatam | ā | uta | vīrān | ā | viśvāni | amr̥tā | saubhagāni ||5.42.18||

IAST: ā dhenavaḥ payasā tūrṇyarthā amardhantīr upa no yantu madhvā
Griffith: MAY the Milch-cows who hasten to their object come harmless unto us with liquid sweetness.
Devanāgarī: आ धेनवः पयसा तूर्ण्यर्था अमर्धन्तीरुप नो यन्तु मध्वा
pada pāṭha: ā | dhenavaḥ | payasā | tūrṇi-arthāḥ | amardhantīḥ | upa | naḥ | yantu | madhvā || mahaḥ | rāye | br̥hatīḥ | sapta | vipraḥ | mayaḥ-bhuvaḥ | jaritā | johavīti ||5.43.1||

IAST: maho rāye bṛhatīḥ sapta vipro mayobhuvo jaritā johavīti
Griffith: The Singer, lauding, calls, for ample riches, the Seven Mighty Ones who bring enjoyment.
Devanāgarī: महो राये बृहतीः सप्त विप्रो मयोभुवो जरिता जोहवीति
pada pāṭha: ā | dhenavaḥ | payasā | tūrṇi-arthāḥ | amardhantīḥ | upa | naḥ | yantu | madhvā || mahaḥ | rāye | br̥hatīḥ | sapta | vipraḥ | mayaḥ-bhuvaḥ | jaritā | johavīti ||5.43.1||

IAST: ā suṣṭutī namasā vartayadhyai dyāvā vājāya pṛthivī amṛdhre
Griffith: With reverence and fair praise will I bring hither, for sake of strength, exhaustless Earth and Heaven.
Devanāgarī: आ सुष्टुती नमसा वर्तयध्यै द्यावा वाजाय पृथिवी अमृध्रे
pada pāṭha: ā | su-stutī | namasā | vartayadhyai | dyāvā | vājāya | pr̥thivī iti | amr̥dhre iti || pitā | mātā | madhu-vacāḥ | su-hastā | bhare-bhare | naḥ | yaśasau | aviṣṭām ||5.43.2||

IAST: pitā mātā madhuvacāḥ suhastā bhare-bhare no yaśasāv aviṣṭām
Griffith: Father and Mother, sweetof speech, fairhanded, may they, far-famed, in every fight protect us.
Devanāgarī: पिता माता मधुवचाः सुहस्ता भरेभरे नो यशसावविष्टाम्
pada pāṭha: ā | su-stutī | namasā | vartayadhyai | dyāvā | vājāya | pr̥thivī iti | amr̥dhre iti || pitā | mātā | madhu-vacāḥ | su-hastā | bhare-bhare | naḥ | yaśasau | aviṣṭām ||5.43.2||

IAST: adhvaryavaś cakṛvāṁso madhūni pra vāyave bharata cāru śukram
Griffith: Adhvaryus, make the sweet libations ready, and bring the beautiful bright juice to Vayu.
Devanāgarī: अध्वर्यवश्चकृवांसो मधूनि प्र वायवे भरत चारु शुक्रम्
pada pāṭha: adhvaryavaḥ | cakr̥-vāṁsaḥ | madhūni | pra | vāyave | bharata | cāru | śukram || hotā-iva | naḥ | prathamaḥ | pāhi | asya | deva | madhvaḥ | rarima | te | madāya ||5.43.3||

IAST: hoteva naḥ prathamaḥ pāhy asya deva madhvo rarimā te madāya
Griffith: God, as our Priest, be thou the first to drink it: we give thee of the mead to make thee joyful.
Devanāgarī: होतेव नः प्रथमः पाह्यस्य देव मध्वो ररिमा ते मदाय
pada pāṭha: adhvaryavaḥ | cakr̥-vāṁsaḥ | madhūni | pra | vāyave | bharata | cāru | śukram || hotā-iva | naḥ | prathamaḥ | pāhi | asya | deva | madhvaḥ | rarima | te | madāya ||5.43.3||

IAST: daśa kṣipo yuñjate bāhū adriṁ somasya yā śamitārā suhastā
Griffith: Two arms-the Soma's dexterous immo. lators-and the ten fingers set and fix the press-stone.
Devanāgarī: दश क्षिपो युञ्जते बाहू अद्रिं सोमस्य या शमितारा सुहस्ता
pada pāṭha: daśa | kṣipaḥ | yuñjate | bāhū iti | adrim | somasya | yā | śamitārā | su-hastā || madhvaḥ | rasam | su-gabhastiḥ | giri-sthām | caniścadat | duduhe | śukram | aṁśuḥ ||5.43.4||

IAST: madhvo rasaṁ sugabhastir giriṣṭhāṁ caniścadad duduhe śukram aṁśuḥ
Griffith: The stalk hath poured, fair with its spreading branches, the mead's bright glittering juice that dwells
Devanāgarī: मध्वो रसं सुगभस्तिर्गिरिष्ठां चनिश्चदद्दुदुहे शुक्रमंशुः
pada pāṭha: daśa | kṣipaḥ | yuñjate | bāhū iti | adrim | somasya | yā | śamitārā | su-hastā || madhvaḥ | rasam | su-gabhastiḥ | giri-sthām | caniścadat | duduhe | śukram | aṁśuḥ ||5.43.4||

IAST: asāvi te jujuṣāṇāya somaḥ kratve dakṣāya bṛhate madāya
Griffith: The Soma hath been pressed for thee, its lover, to give thee power and might and high enjoyment.
Devanāgarī: असावि ते जुजुषाणाय सोमः क्रत्वे दक्षाय बृहते मदाय
pada pāṭha: asāvi | te | jujuṣāṇāya | somaḥ | kratve | dakṣāya | br̥hate | madāya || harī iti | rathe | su-dhurā | yoge | arvāk | indra | priyā | kr̥ṇuhi | hūyamānaḥ ||5.43.5||

IAST: harī rathe sudhurā yoge arvāg indra priyā kṛṇuhi hūyamānaḥ
Griffith: Invoked, turn hither in thy car, O Indra, at need, thy two well-trained and dear Bay Horses.
Devanāgarī: हरी रथे सुधुरा योगे अर्वागिन्द्र प्रिया कृणुहि हूयमानः
pada pāṭha: asāvi | te | jujuṣāṇāya | somaḥ | kratve | dakṣāya | br̥hate | madāya || harī iti | rathe | su-dhurā | yoge | arvāk | indra | priyā | kr̥ṇuhi | hūyamānaḥ ||5.43.5||

IAST: ā no mahīm aramatiṁ sajoṣā gnāṁ devīṁ namasā rātahavyām
Griffith: Bring by God-traversed paths, accordant, Agni, the great Aramati, Celestial Lady,
Devanāgarī: आ नो महीमरमतिं सजोषा ग्नां देवीं नमसा रातहव्याम्
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | mahīm | aramatim | sa-joṣāḥ | gnām | devīm | namasā | rāta-havyām || madhoḥ | madāya | br̥hatīm | r̥ta-jñām | ā | agne | vaha | pathi-bhiḥ | deva-yānaiḥ ||5.43.6||

IAST: madhor madāya bṛhatīm ṛtajñām āgne vaha pathibhir devayānaiḥ
Griffith: Exalted, worshipped with our gifts and homage, who knoweth holy Law, to drink sweet Soma.
Devanāgarī: मधोर्मदाय बृहतीमृतज्ञामाग्ने वह पथिभिर्देवयानैः
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | mahīm | aramatim | sa-joṣāḥ | gnām | devīm | namasā | rāta-havyām || madhoḥ | madāya | br̥hatīm | r̥ta-jñām | ā | agne | vaha | pathi-bhiḥ | deva-yānaiḥ ||5.43.6||

IAST: añjanti yam prathayanto na viprā vapāvantaṁ nāgninā tapantaḥ
Griffith: As on his father's lap the son, the darling, so on the fire is set the sacred caldron,
Devanāgarī: अञ्जन्ति यं प्रथयन्तो न विप्रा वपावन्तं नाग्निना तपन्तः
pada pāṭha: añjanti | yam | prathayantaḥ | na | viprāḥ | vapā-vantam | na | agninā | tapantaḥ || pituḥ | na | putraḥ | upasi | preṣṭhaḥ | ā | gharmaḥ | agnim | r̥tayan | asādi ||5.43.7||

IAST: pitur na putra upasi preṣṭha ā gharmo agnim ṛtayann asādi
Griffith: Which holy singers deck, as if extending and heating that which holds the fatty membrane.
Devanāgarī: पितुर्न पुत्र उपसि प्रेष्ठ आ घर्मो अग्निमृतयन्नसादि
pada pāṭha: añjanti | yam | prathayantaḥ | na | viprāḥ | vapā-vantam | na | agninā | tapantaḥ || pituḥ | na | putraḥ | upasi | preṣṭhaḥ | ā | gharmaḥ | agnim | r̥tayan | asādi ||5.43.7||

IAST: acchā mahī bṛhatī śaṁtamā gīr dūto na gantv aśvinā huvadhyai
Griffith: Hither, as herald to invite the Asvins, come the great lofty song, most sweet and pleasant!
Devanāgarī: अच्छा मही बृहती शंतमा गीर्दूतो न गन्त्वश्विना हुवध्यै
pada pāṭha: accha | mahī | br̥hatī | śam-tamā | gīḥ | dūtaḥ | na | gantu | aśvinā | huvadhyai || mayaḥ-bhuvā | sa-rathā | ā | yātam | arvāk | gantam | ni-dhim | dhuram | āṇiḥ | na | nābhim ||5.43.8||

IAST: mayobhuvā sarathā yātam arvāg gantaṁ nidhiṁ dhuram āṇir na nābhim
Griffith: Come in one car, joy-givers! to the banquet, like the bolt binding pole and nave, come hither.
Devanāgarī: मयोभुवा सरथा यातमर्वाग्गन्तं निधिं धुरमाणिर्न नाभिम्
pada pāṭha: accha | mahī | br̥hatī | śam-tamā | gīḥ | dūtaḥ | na | gantu | aśvinā | huvadhyai || mayaḥ-bhuvā | sa-rathā | ā | yātam | arvāk | gantam | ni-dhim | dhuram | āṇiḥ | na | nābhim ||5.43.8||

IAST: pra tavyaso namaüktiṁ turasyāham pūṣṇa uta vāyor adikṣi
Griffith: I have declared this speech of adoration to mightiest Pusan and victorious Vayu,
Devanāgarī: प्र तव्यसो नम‍उक्तिं तुरस्याहं पूष्ण उत वायोरदिक्षि
pada pāṭha: pra | tavyasaḥ | namaḥ-uktim | turasya | aham | pūṣṇaḥ | uta | vāyoḥ | adikṣi || yā | rādhasā | coditārā | matīnām | yā | vājasya | draviṇaḥ-dau | uta | tman ||5.43.9||

IAST: yā rādhasā coditārā matīnāṁ yā vājasya draviṇodā uta tman
Griffith: Who by their bounty are the hymns' inspirers, and of themselves give power as a possession.
Devanāgarī: या राधसा चोदितारा मतीनां या वाजस्य द्रविणोदा उत त्मन्
pada pāṭha: pra | tavyasaḥ | namaḥ-uktim | turasya | aham | pūṣṇaḥ | uta | vāyoḥ | adikṣi || yā | rādhasā | coditārā | matīnām | yā | vājasya | draviṇaḥ-dau | uta | tman ||5.43.9||

IAST: ā nāmabhir maruto vakṣi viśvān ā rūpebhir jātavedo huvānaḥ
Griffith: Invoked by us bring hither, jatavedas the Maruts all under their names and figures.
Devanāgarī: आ नामभिर्मरुतो वक्षि विश्वाना रूपेभिर्जातवेदो हुवानः
pada pāṭha: ā | nāma-bhiḥ | marutaḥ | vakṣi | viśvān | ā | rūpebhiḥ | jāta-vedaḥ | huvānaḥ || yajñam | giraḥ | jarituḥ | su-stutim | ca | viśve | ganta | marutaḥ | viśve | ūtī ||5.43.10||

IAST: yajñaṁ giro jarituḥ suṣṭutiṁ ca viśve ganta maruto viśva ūtī
Griffith: Come to the sacrifice with aid all Maruts, all to the songs and praises of the singer!
Devanāgarī: यज्ञं गिरो जरितुः सुष्टुतिं च विश्वे गन्त मरुतो विश्व ऊती
pada pāṭha: ā | nāma-bhiḥ | marutaḥ | vakṣi | viśvān | ā | rūpebhiḥ | jāta-vedaḥ | huvānaḥ || yajñam | giraḥ | jarituḥ | su-stutim | ca | viśve | ganta | marutaḥ | viśve | ūtī ||5.43.10||

IAST: ā no divo bṛhataḥ parvatād ā sarasvatī yajatā gantu yajñam
Griffith: From high heaven may Sarasvati the Holy visit our sacrifice, and from the mountain.
Devanāgarī: आ नो दिवो बृहतः पर्वतादा सरस्वती यजता गन्तु यज्ञम्
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | divaḥ | br̥hataḥ | parvatāt | ā | sarasvatī | yajatā | gantu | yajñam || havam | devī | jujuṣāṇā | ghr̥tācī | śagmām | naḥ | vācam | uśatī | śr̥ṇotu ||5.43.11||

IAST: havaṁ devī jujuṣāṇā ghṛtācī śagmāṁ no vācam uśatī śṛṇotu
Griffith: Eager, propitious, may the balmy Goddess hear our effectual speech, our invocation.
Devanāgarī: हवं देवी जुजुषाणा घृताची शग्मां नो वाचमुशती शृणोतु
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | divaḥ | br̥hataḥ | parvatāt | ā | sarasvatī | yajatā | gantu | yajñam || havam | devī | jujuṣāṇā | ghr̥tācī | śagmām | naḥ | vācam | uśatī | śr̥ṇotu ||5.43.11||

IAST: ā vedhasaṁ nīlapṛṣṭham bṛhantam bṛhaspatiṁ sadane sādayadhvam
Griffith: Set in his seat the God whose back is dusky, Brhaspati the lofty, the Disposer.
Devanāgarī: आ वेधसं नीलपृष्ठं बृहन्तं बृहस्पतिं सदने सादयध्वम्
pada pāṭha: ā | vedhasam | nīla-pr̥ṣṭham | br̥hantam | br̥haspatim | sadane | sādayadhvam || sādat-yonim | dame | ā | dīdi-vāṁsam | hiraṇya-varṇam | aruṣam | sapema ||5.43.12||

IAST: sādadyoniṁ dama ā dīdivāṁsaṁ hiraṇyavarṇam aruṣaṁ sapema
Griffith: Him let us worship, set within the dwelling, the red, the golden-hued, the allresplendent.
Devanāgarī: सादद्योनिं दम आ दीदिवांसं हिरण्यवर्णमरुषं सपेम
pada pāṭha: ā | vedhasam | nīla-pr̥ṣṭham | br̥hantam | br̥haspatim | sadane | sādayadhvam || sādat-yonim | dame | ā | dīdi-vāṁsam | hiraṇya-varṇam | aruṣam | sapema ||5.43.12||

IAST: ā dharṇasir bṛhaddivo rarāṇo viśvebhir gantv omabhir huvānaḥ
Griffith: May the Sustainer, high in heaven, come hither, the Bounteous One, invoked, with all his favours,
Devanāgarī: आ धर्णसिर्बृहद्दिवो रराणो विश्वेभिर्गन्त्वोमभिर्हुवानः
pada pāṭha: ā | dharṇasiḥ | br̥hat-divaḥ | rarāṇaḥ | viśvebhiḥ | gantu | oma-bhiḥ | huvānaḥ || gnāḥ | vasānaḥ | oṣadhīḥ | amr̥dhraḥ | tridhātu-śr̥ṅgaḥ | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | vayaḥ-dhāḥ ||5.43.13||

IAST: gnā vasāna oṣadhīr amṛdhras tridhātuśṛṅgo vṛṣabho vayodhāḥ
Griffith: Dweller with Dames divine, with plants, unwearied, the Steer with triple horn, the life-bestower.
Devanāgarī: ग्ना वसान ओषधीरमृध्रस्त्रिधातुशृङ्गो वृषभो वयोधाः
pada pāṭha: ā | dharṇasiḥ | br̥hat-divaḥ | rarāṇaḥ | viśvebhiḥ | gantu | oma-bhiḥ | huvānaḥ || gnāḥ | vasānaḥ | oṣadhīḥ | amr̥dhraḥ | tridhātu-śr̥ṅgaḥ | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | vayaḥ-dhāḥ ||5.43.13||

IAST: mātuṣ pade parame śukra āyor vipanyavo rāspirāso agman
Griffith: The tuneful eloquent priests of him who liveth have sought the Mother's bright and loftiest station.
Devanāgarī: मातुष्पदे परमे शुक्र आयोर्विपन्यवो रास्पिरासो अग्मन्
pada pāṭha: mātuḥ | pade | parame | śukre | āyoḥ | vipanyavaḥ | rāspirāsaḥ | agman || su-śevyam | namasā | rāta-havyāḥ | śiśum | mr̥janti | āyavaḥ | na | vāse ||5.43.14||

IAST: suśevyaṁ namasā rātahavyāḥ śiśum mṛjanty āyavo na vāse
Griffith: As living men, with offered gifts and homage they deck the most auspicious Child to clothe him.
Devanāgarī: सुशेव्यं नमसा रातहव्याः शिशुं मृजन्त्यायवो न वासे
pada pāṭha: mātuḥ | pade | parame | śukre | āyoḥ | vipanyavaḥ | rāspirāsaḥ | agman || su-śevyam | namasā | rāta-havyāḥ | śiśum | mr̥janti | āyavaḥ | na | vāse ||5.43.14||

IAST: bṛhad vayo bṛhate tubhyam agne dhiyājuro mithunāsaḥ sacanta
Griffith: Agni, great vital power is thine, the mighty: pairs waxing old in their devotion seek thee.
Devanāgarī: बृहद्वयो बृहते तुभ्यमग्ने धियाजुरो मिथुनासः सचन्त
pada pāṭha: br̥hat | vayaḥ | br̥hate | tubhyam | agne | dhiyā-juraḥ | mithunāsaḥ | sacanta || devaḥ-devaḥ | su-havaḥ | bhūtu | mahyam | mā | naḥ | mātā | pr̥thivī | duḥ-matau | dhāt ||5.43.15||

IAST: devo-devaḥ suhavo bhūtu mahyam mā no mātā pṛthivī durmatau dhāt
Griffith: May every Deity be swift to listen, and Mother Earth with no ill thought regard me.
Devanāgarī: देवोदेवः सुहवो भूतु मह्यं मा नो माता पृथिवी दुर्मतौ धात्
pada pāṭha: br̥hat | vayaḥ | br̥hate | tubhyam | agne | dhiyā-juraḥ | mithunāsaḥ | sacanta || devaḥ-devaḥ | su-havaḥ | bhūtu | mahyam | mā | naḥ | mātā | pr̥thivī | duḥ-matau | dhāt ||5.43.15||

IAST: urau devā anibādhe syāma
Griffith: Gods, may we dwell in free untroubled bliss.
Devanāgarī: उरौ देवा अनिबाधे स्याम॥ ५.०४३.१
pada pāṭha: urau | devāḥ | ani-bādhe | syāma ||5.43.16||

IAST: sam aśvinor avasā nūtanena mayobhuvā supraṇītī gamema
Griffith: May we obtain the Asvins' newest favour, and gain their health-bestowing happy guidance.
Devanāgarī: समश्विनोरवसा नूतनेन मयोभुवा सुप्रणीती गमेम
pada pāṭha: sam | aśvinoḥ | avasā | nūtanena | mayaḥ-bhuvā | su-pranītī | gamema || ā | naḥ | rayim | vahatam | ā | uta | vīrān | ā | viśvāni | amr̥tā | saubhagāni ||5.43.17||

IAST: ā no rayiṁ vahatam ota vīrān ā viśvāny amṛtā saubhagāni
Griffith: Bring riches hither unto us, and heroes, and all felicity and joy, Immortals!
Devanāgarī: आ नो रयिं वहतमोत वीराना विश्वान्यमृता सौभगानि
pada pāṭha: sam | aśvinoḥ | avasā | nūtanena | mayaḥ-bhuvā | su-pranītī | gamema || ā | naḥ | rayim | vahatam | ā | uta | vīrān | ā | viśvāni | amr̥tā | saubhagāni ||5.43.17||

IAST: tam pratnathā pūrvathā viśvathemathā jyeṣṭhatātim barhiṣadaṁ svarvidam
Griffith: As in the first old times, as all were wont, as now, he draweth forth the power turned hitherward with so
Devanāgarī: तं प्रत्नथा पूर्वथा विश्वथेमथा ज्येष्ठतातिं बर्हिषदं स्वर्विदम्
pada pāṭha: tam | pratna-thā | pūrva-thā | viśva-thā | im-athā | jyeṣṭha-tātim | barhi-sadam | svaḥ-vidam || pratīcīnam | vr̥janam | dohase | girā | āśum | jayantam | anu | yāsu | vardhase ||5.44.1||

IAST: pratīcīnaṁ vṛjanaṁ dohase girāśuṁ jayantam anu yāsu vardhase
Griffith: The Princedom throned on holy grass, who findeth light, swift, conquering in the' plants wherein he waxe
Devanāgarī: प्रतीचीनं वृजनं दोहसे गिराशुं जयन्तमनु यासु वर्धसे
pada pāṭha: tam | pratna-thā | pūrva-thā | viśva-thā | im-athā | jyeṣṭha-tātim | barhi-sadam | svaḥ-vidam || pratīcīnam | vr̥janam | dohase | girā | āśum | jayantam | anu | yāsu | vardhase ||5.44.1||

IAST: śriye sudṛśīr uparasya yāḥ svar virocamānaḥ kakubhām acodate
Griffith: Shining to him who leaves heaven's regions undisturbed, which to his sheen who is beneath show fair in lig
Devanāgarī: श्रिये सुदृशीरुपरस्य याः स्वर्विरोचमानः ककुभामचोदते
pada pāṭha: śriye | su-dr̥śīḥ | uparasya | yāḥ | svaḥ | vi-rocamānaḥ | kakubhām | acodate || su-gopāḥ | asi | na | dabhāya | sukrato iti su-krato | paraḥ | māyābhiḥ | r̥te | āsa | nāma | te ||5.44.2||

IAST: sugopā asi na dabhāya sukrato paro māyābhir ṛta āsa nāma te
Griffith: Good guardian art thou, not to be deceived, Most Wise! Far from deceits thy name dwelleth in holy Law.
Devanāgarī: सुगोपा असि न दभाय सुक्रतो परो मायाभिरृत आस नाम ते
pada pāṭha: śriye | su-dr̥śīḥ | uparasya | yāḥ | svaḥ | vi-rocamānaḥ | kakubhām | acodate || su-gopāḥ | asi | na | dabhāya | sukrato iti su-krato | paraḥ | māyābhiḥ | r̥te | āsa | nāma | te ||5.44.2||

IAST: atyaṁ haviḥ sacate sac ca dhātu cāriṣṭagātuḥ sa hotā sahobhariḥ
Griffith: Truth waits upon oblation present and to come: naught checks him in his way, this vic tory- bringing Pries
Devanāgarī: अत्यं हविः सचते सच्च धातु चारिष्टगातुः स होता सहोभरिः
pada pāṭha: atyam | haviḥ | sacate | sat | ca | dhātu | ca | ariṣṭa-gātuḥ | saḥ | hotā | sahaḥ-bhariḥ || pra-sarsrāṇaḥ | anu | barhiḥ | vr̥ṣā | śiśuḥ | madhye | yuvā | ajaraḥ | vi-sruhā | hitaḥ ||5.44.3||

IAST: prasarsrāṇo anu barhir vṛṣā śiśur madhye yuvājaro visruhā hitaḥ
Griffith: The Mighty Child who glides along the sacred grass, the undecaying Youth set in the midst of plants.
Devanāgarī: प्रसर्स्राणो अनु बर्हिर्वृषा शिशुर्मध्ये युवाजरो विस्रुहा हितः
pada pāṭha: atyam | haviḥ | sacate | sat | ca | dhātu | ca | ariṣṭa-gātuḥ | saḥ | hotā | sahaḥ-bhariḥ || pra-sarsrāṇaḥ | anu | barhiḥ | vr̥ṣā | śiśuḥ | madhye | yuvā | ajaraḥ | vi-sruhā | hitaḥ ||5.44.3||

IAST: pra va ete suyujo yāmann iṣṭaye nīcīr amuṣmai yamya ṛtāvṛdhaḥ
Griffith: These come, well-yoked, to you for furtherance in the rite: down come the twinborn strengtheners of Law fo
Devanāgarī: प्र व एते सुयुजो यामन्निष्टये नीचीरमुष्मै यम्य ऋतावृधः
pada pāṭha: pra | vaḥ | ete | su-yujaḥ | yāman | iṣṭaye | nīcīḥ | amuṣmai | yamyaḥ | r̥ta-vr̥dhaḥ || suyantu-bhiḥ | sarva-śāsaiḥ | abhīśu-bhiḥ | kriviḥ | nāmāni | pravaṇe | muṣāyati ||5.44.4||

IAST: suyantubhiḥ sarvaśāsair abhīśubhiḥ krivir nāmāni pravaṇe muṣāyati
Griffith: With reins easily guided and commanding all. In the deep fall the hide stealeth away their names.
Devanāgarī: सुयन्तुभिः सर्वशासैरभीशुभिः क्रिविर्नामानि प्रवणे मुषायति
pada pāṭha: pra | vaḥ | ete | su-yujaḥ | yāman | iṣṭaye | nīcīḥ | amuṣmai | yamyaḥ | r̥ta-vr̥dhaḥ || suyantu-bhiḥ | sarva-śāsaiḥ | abhīśu-bhiḥ | kriviḥ | nāmāni | pravaṇe | muṣāyati ||5.44.4||

IAST: saṁjarbhurāṇas tarubhiḥ sutegṛbhaṁ vayākinaṁ cittagarbhāsu susvaruḥ
Griffith: Thou, moving beauteously in visibly pregnant ones, snatching with trees the branching plant that grasps t
Devanāgarī: संजर्भुराणस्तरुभिः सुतेगृभं वयाकिनं चित्तगर्भासु सुस्वरुः
pada pāṭha: sam-jarbhurāṇaḥ | taru-bhiḥ | sute-gr̥bham | vayākinam | citta-garbhāsu | su-svaruḥ || dhāra-vākeṣu | r̥ju-gātha | śobhase | vardhasva | patnīḥ | abhi | jīvaḥ | adhvare ||5.44.5||

IAST: dhāravākeṣv ṛjugātha śobhase vardhasva patnīr abhi jīvo adhvare
Griffith: Shinest, true Singer! mid the upholders of the voice. Increase thy Consorts thou, lively at sacrifice.
Devanāgarī: धारवाकेष्वृजुगाथ शोभसे वर्धस्व पत्नीरभि जीवो अध्वरे
pada pāṭha: sam-jarbhurāṇaḥ | taru-bhiḥ | sute-gr̥bham | vayākinam | citta-garbhāsu | su-svaruḥ || dhāra-vākeṣu | r̥ju-gātha | śobhase | vardhasva | patnīḥ | abhi | jīvaḥ | adhvare ||5.44.5||

IAST: yādṛg eva dadṛśe tādṛg ucyate saṁ chāyayā dadhire sidhrayāpsv ā
Griffith: Like as he is beheld such is he said to be. They with effectual splendour in the floods have made,
Devanāgarī: यादृगेव ददृशे तादृगुच्यते सं छायया दधिरे सिध्रयाप्स्वा
pada pāṭha: yādr̥k | eva | dadr̥śe | tādr̥k | ucyate | sam | chāyayā | dadhire | sidhrayā | ap-su | ā || mahīm | asmabhyam | uru-sām | uru | jrayaḥ | br̥hat | su-vīram | anapa-cyutam | sahaḥ ||5.44.6||

IAST: mahīm asmabhyam uruṣām uru jrayo bṛhat suvīram anapacyutaṁ sahaḥ
Griffith: Earth yield us room enough and amply wide extent, great might invincible, with store of hero sons.
Devanāgarī: महीमस्मभ्यमुरुषामुरु ज्रयो बृहत्सुवीरमनपच्युतं सहः
pada pāṭha: yādr̥k | eva | dadr̥śe | tādr̥k | ucyate | sam | chāyayā | dadhire | sidhrayā | ap-su | ā || mahīm | asmabhyam | uru-sām | uru | jrayaḥ | br̥hat | su-vīram | anapa-cyutam | sahaḥ ||5.44.6||

IAST: vety agrur janivān vā ati spṛdhaḥ samaryatā manasā sūryaḥ kaviḥ
Griffith: Surya the Sage, as if unwedded, with a Spouse, in battle-loving spirit moveth o'er the foes.
Devanāgarī: वेत्यग्रुर्जनिवान्वा अति स्पृधः समर्यता मनसा सूर्यः कविः
pada pāṭha: veti | agruḥ | jani-vān | vai | ati | spr̥dhaḥ | sa-maryatā | manasā | sūryaḥ | kaviḥ || ghraṁsam | rakṣantam | pari | viśvataḥ | gayam | asmākam | śarma | vanavat | sva-vasuḥ ||5.44.7||

IAST: ghraṁsaṁ rakṣantam pari viśvato gayam asmākaṁ śarma vanavat svāvasuḥ
Griffith: May he, self-excellent, grant us a sheltering home, a house that wards the fierce heat off on every side
Devanāgarī: घ्रंसं रक्षन्तं परि विश्वतो गयमस्माकं शर्म वनवत्स्वावसुः
pada pāṭha: veti | agruḥ | jani-vān | vai | ati | spr̥dhaḥ | sa-maryatā | manasā | sūryaḥ | kaviḥ || ghraṁsam | rakṣantam | pari | viśvataḥ | gayam | asmākam | śarma | vanavat | sva-vasuḥ ||5.44.7||

IAST: jyāyāṁsam asya yatunasya ketuna ṛṣisvaraṁ carati yāsu nāma te
Griffith: Thy name, sung forth by Rsis in these hymns of ours, goes to the loftier One with this swift mover's ligh
Devanāgarī: ज्यायांसमस्य यतुनस्य केतुन ऋषिस्वरं चरति यासु नाम ते
pada pāṭha: jyāyāṁsam | asya | yatunasya | ketunā | r̥ṣi-svaram | carati | yāsu | nāma | te || yādr̥śmin | dhāyi | tam | apasyayā | vidat | yaḥ | ūm̐ iti | svayam | vahate | saḥ | aram | karat ||5.44.8||

IAST: yādṛśmin dhāyi tam apasyayā vidad ya u svayaṁ vahate so araṁ karat
Griffith: By skill he wins the boon whereon his heart is set: he who bestirs himself shall bring the thing to pass
Devanāgarī: यादृश्मिन्धायि तमपस्यया विदद्य उ स्वयं वहते सो अरं करत्
pada pāṭha: jyāyāṁsam | asya | yatunasya | ketunā | r̥ṣi-svaram | carati | yāsu | nāma | te || yādr̥śmin | dhāyi | tam | apasyayā | vidat | yaḥ | ūm̐ iti | svayam | vahate | saḥ | aram | karat ||5.44.8||

IAST: samudram āsām ava tasthe agrimā na riṣyati savanaṁ yasminn āyatā
Griffith: The chief and best of these abideth in the sea, nor doth libation fail wherein it is prolonged.
Devanāgarī: समुद्रमासामव तस्थे अग्रिमा न रिष्यति सवनं यस्मिन्नायता
pada pāṭha: samudram | āsām | ava | tasthe | agrimā | na | riṣyati | savanam | yasmin | ā-yatā || atra | na | hārdi | kravaṇasya | rejate | yatra | matiḥ | vidyate | pūta-bandhanī ||5.44.9||

IAST: atrā na hārdi kravaṇasya rejate yatrā matir vidyate pūtabandhanī
Griffith: The heart of him who praiseth trembleth not in fear there where the hymn is found connected with the pu
Devanāgarī: अत्रा न हार्दि क्रवणस्य रेजते यत्रा मतिर्विद्यते पूतबन्धनी
pada pāṭha: samudram | āsām | ava | tasthe | agrimā | na | riṣyati | savanam | yasmin | ā-yatā || atra | na | hārdi | kravaṇasya | rejate | yatra | matiḥ | vidyate | pūta-bandhanī ||5.44.9||

IAST: sa hi kṣatrasya manasasya cittibhir evāvadasya yajatasya sadhreḥ
Griffith: For it is he: with though to of Ksatra, Manasa, of Yajata, and Sadhri, and Evavada,
Devanāgarī: स हि क्षत्रस्य मनसस्य चित्तिभिरेवावदस्य यजतस्य सध्रेः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | hi | kṣatrasya | manasasya | citti-bhiḥ | eva-vadasya | yajatasya | sadhreḥ || ava-tsārasya | spr̥ṇavāma | raṇva-bhiḥ | śaviṣṭham | vājam | viduṣā | cit | ardhyam ||5.44.10||

IAST: avatsārasya spṛṇavāma raṇvabhiḥ śaviṣṭhaṁ vājaṁ viduṣā cid ardhyam
Griffith: With Avatsara's sweet songs will we strive to win the mightiest strength which even he who knows should
Devanāgarī: अवत्सारस्य स्पृणवाम रण्वभिः शविष्ठं वाजं विदुषा चिदर्ध्यम्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | hi | kṣatrasya | manasasya | citti-bhiḥ | eva-vadasya | yajatasya | sadhreḥ || ava-tsārasya | spr̥ṇavāma | raṇva-bhiḥ | śaviṣṭham | vājam | viduṣā | cit | ardhyam ||5.44.10||

IAST: śyena āsām aditiḥ kakṣyo mado viśvavārasya yajatasya māyinaḥ
Griffith: The Hawk is their full source, girth-stretching rapturous drink of Visvavara, of Mayin, and Yajata.
Devanāgarī: श्येन आसामदितिः कक्ष्यो मदो विश्ववारस्य यजतस्य मायिनः
pada pāṭha: śyenaḥ | āsām | aditiḥ | kakṣyaḥ | madaḥ | viśva-vārasya | yajatasya | māyinaḥ || sam | anyam-anyam | arthayanti | etave | viduḥ | vi-sāṇam | pari-pānam | anti | te ||5.44.11||

IAST: sam anyam-anyam arthayanty etave vidur viṣāṇam paripānam anti te
Griffith: They ever seek a fresh draught so that they may come, know when thy time to halt and drink thy fill is
Devanāgarī: समन्यमन्यमर्थयन्त्येतवे विदुर्विषाणं परिपानमन्ति ते
pada pāṭha: śyenaḥ | āsām | aditiḥ | kakṣyaḥ | madaḥ | viśva-vārasya | yajatasya | māyinaḥ || sam | anyam-anyam | arthayanti | etave | viduḥ | vi-sāṇam | pari-pānam | anti | te ||5.44.11||

IAST: sadāpṛṇo yajato vi dviṣo vadhīd bāhuvṛktaḥ śrutavit taryo vaḥ sacā
Griffith: Sadaprna the holy, Tarya, Srutavit, and Bahuvrkta, joined with you, have slain the foes.
Devanāgarī: सदापृणो यजतो वि द्विषो वधीद्बाहुवृक्तः श्रुतवित्तर्यो वः सचा
pada pāṭha: sadā-pr̥ṇaḥ | yajataḥ | vi | dviṣaḥ | vadhīt | bāhu-vr̥ktaḥ | śruta-vit | taryaḥ | vaḥ | sacā || ubhā | saḥ | varā | prati | eti | bhāti | ca | yat | īm | gaṇam | bhajate | suprayāva-bhiḥ ||5.44.12||

IAST: ubhā sa varā praty eti bhāti ca yad īṁ gaṇam bhajate suprayāvabhiḥ
Griffith: He gains his wish in both the worlds and brightly shines-when he adores the host with well-advancing ste
Devanāgarī: उभा स वरा प्रत्येति भाति च यदीं गणं भजते सुप्रयावभिः
pada pāṭha: sadā-pr̥ṇaḥ | yajataḥ | vi | dviṣaḥ | vadhīt | bāhu-vr̥ktaḥ | śruta-vit | taryaḥ | vaḥ | sacā || ubhā | saḥ | varā | prati | eti | bhāti | ca | yat | īm | gaṇam | bhajate | suprayāva-bhiḥ ||5.44.12||

IAST: sutambharo yajamānasya satpatir viśvāsām ūdhaḥ sa dhiyām udañcanaḥ
Griffith: The worshipper's defender is Sutambhara, producer and uplifter of all holy thoughts.
Devanāgarī: सुतम्भरो यजमानस्य सत्पतिर्विश्वासामूधः स धियामुदञ्चनः
pada pāṭha: sutam-bharaḥ | yajamānasya | sat-patiḥ | viśvāsām | ūdhaḥ | saḥ | dhiyām | ut-añcanaḥ || bharat | dhenuḥ | rasa-vat | śiśriye | payaḥ | anu-bruvāṇaḥ | adhi | eti | na | svapan ||5.44.13||

IAST: bharad dhenū rasavac chiśriye payo 'nubruvāṇo adhy eti na svapan
Griffith: The milch-cow brought, sweet-flavoured milk was dealt around. Who speaks the bidding text knows this, no
Devanāgarī: भरद्धेनू रसवच्छिश्रिये पयोऽनुब्रुवाणो अध्येति न स्वपन्
pada pāṭha: sutam-bharaḥ | yajamānasya | sat-patiḥ | viśvāsām | ūdhaḥ | saḥ | dhiyām | ut-añcanaḥ || bharat | dhenuḥ | rasa-vat | śiśriye | payaḥ | anu-bruvāṇaḥ | adhi | eti | na | svapan ||5.44.13||

IAST: yo jāgāra tam ṛcaḥ kāmayante yo jāgāra tam u sāmāni yanti
Griffith: The sacred hymns love him who wakes and watches: to him who watches come the Sama verses.
Devanāgarī: यो जागार तमृचः कामयन्ते यो जागार तमु सामानि यन्ति
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | jāgāra | tam | r̥caḥ | kāmayante | yaḥ | jāgāra | tam | ūm̐ iti | sāmāni | yanti || yaḥ | jāgāra | tam | ayam | somaḥ | āha | tava | aham | asmi | sakhye | ni-okāḥ ||5.44.14||

IAST: yo jāgāra tam ayaṁ soma āha tavāham asmi sakhye nyokāḥ
Griffith: This Soma saith unto the man who watches, I rest and have my dwelling in thy friendship.
Devanāgarī: यो जागार तमयं सोम आह तवाहमस्मि सख्ये न्योकाः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | jāgāra | tam | r̥caḥ | kāmayante | yaḥ | jāgāra | tam | ūm̐ iti | sāmāni | yanti || yaḥ | jāgāra | tam | ayam | somaḥ | āha | tava | aham | asmi | sakhye | ni-okāḥ ||5.44.14||

IAST: agnir jāgāra tam ṛcaḥ kāmayante 'gnir jāgāra tam u sāmāni yanti
Griffith: Agni is watchful, and the gcas love him; Agni is watchful, Sama verses seek him.
Devanāgarī: अग्निर्जागार तमृचः कामयन्तेऽग्निर्जागार तमु सामानि यन्ति
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | jāgāra | tam | r̥caḥ | kāmayante | agniḥ | jāgāra | tam | ūm̐ iti | sāmāni | yanti || agniḥ | jāgāra | tam | ayam | somaḥ | āha | tava | aham | asmi | sakhye | ni-okāḥ ||5.44.15||

IAST: agnir jāgāra tam ayaṁ soma āha tavāham asmi sakhye nyokāḥ
Griffith: Agni is watchful, to him saith this Soma, I rest and have my dwelling in thy friendship.
Devanāgarī: अग्निर्जागार तमयं सोम आह तवाहमस्मि सख्ये न्योकाः
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | jāgāra | tam | r̥caḥ | kāmayante | agniḥ | jāgāra | tam | ūm̐ iti | sāmāni | yanti || agniḥ | jāgāra | tam | ayam | somaḥ | āha | tava | aham | asmi | sakhye | ni-okāḥ ||5.44.15||

IAST: vidā divo viṣyann adrim ukthair āyatyā uṣaso arcino guḥ
Griffith: BARDS of approaching Dawn who know the heavens are come with hymns to throw the mountain open.
Devanāgarī: विदा दिवो विष्यन्नद्रिमुक्थैरायत्या उषसो अर्चिनो गुः
pada pāṭha: vidāḥ | divaḥ | vi-syan | adrim | ukthaiḥ | ā-yatyāḥ | uṣasaḥ | arcinaḥ | guḥ || apa | avr̥ta | vrajinīḥ | ut | svaḥ | gāt | vi | duraḥ | mānuṣīḥ | devaḥ | āvarityāvaḥ ||5.45.1||

IAST: apāvṛta vrajinīr ut svar gād vi duro mānuṣīr deva āvaḥ
Griffith: The Sun hath risen and oped the stable portals: the doors of men, too, hath the God thrown open.
Devanāgarī: अपावृत व्रजिनीरुत्स्वर्गाद्वि दुरो मानुषीर्देव आवः
pada pāṭha: vidāḥ | divaḥ | vi-syan | adrim | ukthaiḥ | ā-yatyāḥ | uṣasaḥ | arcinaḥ | guḥ || apa | avr̥ta | vrajinīḥ | ut | svaḥ | gāt | vi | duraḥ | mānuṣīḥ | devaḥ | āvarityāvaḥ ||5.45.1||

IAST: vi sūryo amatiṁ na śriyaṁ sād orvād gavām mātā jānatī gāt
Griffith: Surya hath spread his light as splendour: hither came the Cows' Mother, conscious, from the stable,
Devanāgarī: वि सूर्यो अमतिं न श्रियं सादोर्वाद्गवां माता जानती गात्
pada pāṭha: vi | sūryaḥ | amatim | na | śriyam | sāt | ā | ūrvāt | gavām | mātā | jānatī | gāt || dhanva-arṇasaḥ | nadyaḥ | khādaḥ-arṇāḥ | sthūṇā-iva | su-mitā | dr̥ṁhata | dyauḥ ||5.45.2||

IAST: dhanvarṇaso nadyaḥ khādoarṇāḥ sthūṇeva sumitā dṛṁhata dyauḥ
Griffith: To streams that flow with biting waves to deserts; and heaven is stablished like a firm-set pillar.
Devanāgarī: धन्वर्णसो नद्यः खादोअर्णाः स्थूणेव सुमिता दृंहत द्यौः
pada pāṭha: vi | sūryaḥ | amatim | na | śriyam | sāt | ā | ūrvāt | gavām | mātā | jānatī | gāt || dhanva-arṇasaḥ | nadyaḥ | khādaḥ-arṇāḥ | sthūṇā-iva | su-mitā | dr̥ṁhata | dyauḥ ||5.45.2||

IAST: asmā ukthāya parvatasya garbho mahīnāṁ januṣe pūrvyāya
Griffith: This laud hath won the burden of the mountain. To aid the ancient birth of mighty waters
Devanāgarī: अस्मा उक्थाय पर्वतस्य गर्भो महीनां जनुषे पूर्व्याय
pada pāṭha: asmai | ukthāya | parvatasya | garbhaḥ | mahīnām | januṣe | pūrvyāya || vi | parvataḥ | jihīta | sādhata | dyauḥ | ā-vivāsantaḥ | dasayanta | bhūma ||5.45.3||

IAST: vi parvato jihīta sādhata dyaur āvivāsanto dasayanta bhūma
Griffith: The mountain parted, Heaven performed his office. The worshippers were worn with constant serving.
Devanāgarī: वि पर्वतो जिहीत साधत द्यौराविवासन्तो दसयन्त भूम
pada pāṭha: asmai | ukthāya | parvatasya | garbhaḥ | mahīnām | januṣe | pūrvyāya || vi | parvataḥ | jihīta | sādhata | dyauḥ | ā-vivāsantaḥ | dasayanta | bhūma ||5.45.3||

IAST: sūktebhir vo vacobhir devajuṣṭair indrā nv agnī avase huvadhyai
Griffith: With hymns and God-loved words will I invoke you, Indra and Agni, to obtain your favour,
Devanāgarī: सूक्तेभिर्वो वचोभिर्देवजुष्टैरिन्द्रा न्वग्नी अवसे हुवध्यै
pada pāṭha: su-uktebhiḥ | vaḥ | vacaḥ-bhiḥ | deva-juṣṭaiḥ | indrā | nu | agnī iti | avase | huvadhyai || ukthebhiḥ | hi | sma | kavayaḥ | su-yajñāḥ | ā-vivāsantaḥ | marutaḥ | yajanti ||5.45.4||

IAST: ukthebhir hi ṣmā kavayaḥ suyajñā āvivāsanto maruto yajanti
Griffith: For verily sages, skilled in sacrificing, worship the Maruts and with lauds invite them.
Devanāgarī: उक्थेभिर्हि ष्मा कवयः सुयज्ञा आविवासन्तो मरुतो यजन्ति
pada pāṭha: su-uktebhiḥ | vaḥ | vacaḥ-bhiḥ | deva-juṣṭaiḥ | indrā | nu | agnī iti | avase | huvadhyai || ukthebhiḥ | hi | sma | kavayaḥ | su-yajñāḥ | ā-vivāsantaḥ | marutaḥ | yajanti ||5.45.4||

IAST: eto nv adya sudhyo bhavāma pra ducchunā minavāmā varīyaḥ
Griffith: This day approach us: may our thoughts be holy, far from us let us cast away misfortune.
Devanāgarī: एतो न्वद्य सुध्यो भवाम प्र दुच्छुना मिनवामा वरीयः
pada pāṭha: eto iti | nu | adya | su-dhyaḥ | bhavāma | pra | ducchunāḥ | minavāma | varīyaḥ || āre | dveṣāṁsi | sanutaḥ | dadhāma | ayāma | prāñcaḥ | yajamānam | accha ||5.45.5||

IAST: āre dveṣāṁsi sanutar dadhāmāyāma prāñco yajamānam accha
Griffith: Let us keep those who hate us at a distance, and haste to meet the man who sacrifices.
Devanāgarī: आरे द्वेषांसि सनुतर्दधामायाम प्राञ्चो यजमानमच्छ
pada pāṭha: eto iti | nu | adya | su-dhyaḥ | bhavāma | pra | ducchunāḥ | minavāma | varīyaḥ || āre | dveṣāṁsi | sanutaḥ | dadhāma | ayāma | prāñcaḥ | yajamānam | accha ||5.45.5||

IAST: etā dhiyaṁ kṛṇavāmā sakhāyo 'pa yā mātām̐ ṛṇuta vrajaṁ goḥ
Griffith: Come, let us carry out, O friends, the purpose wherewith the Mother threw the Cow's stall open,
Devanāgarī: एता धियं कृणवामा सखायोऽप या माताँ ऋणुत व्रजं गोः
pada pāṭha: ā | ita | dhiyam | kr̥ṇavāma | sakhāyaḥ | apa | yā | mātā | r̥ṇuta | vrajam | goḥ || yayā | manuḥ | viśi-śipram | jigāya | yayā | vaṇik | vaṅkuḥ | āpa | purīṣam ||5.45.6||

IAST: yayā manur viśiśipraṁ jigāya yayā vaṇig vaṅkur āpā purīṣam
Griffith: That wherewith Manu conquered Visisipra, wherewith the wandering merchant gained heaven's water.
Devanāgarī: यया मनुर्विशिशिप्रं जिगाय यया वणिग्वङ्कुरापा पुरीषम्
pada pāṭha: ā | ita | dhiyam | kr̥ṇavāma | sakhāyaḥ | apa | yā | mātā | r̥ṇuta | vrajam | goḥ || yayā | manuḥ | viśi-śipram | jigāya | yayā | vaṇik | vaṅkuḥ | āpa | purīṣam ||5.45.6||

IAST: anūnod atra hastayato adrir ārcan yena daśa māso navagvāḥ
Griffith: Here, urged by hands, loudly hath rung the press-stone wherewith Navagvas through ten months sang praises
Devanāgarī: अनूनोदत्र हस्तयतो अद्रिरार्चन्येन दश मासो नवग्वाः
pada pāṭha: anūnot | atra | hasta-yataḥ | adriḥ | ārcan | yena | daśa | māsaḥ | nava-gvāḥ || r̥tam | yatī | saramā | gāḥ | avindat | viśvāni | satyā | aṅgirāḥ | cakāra ||5.45.7||

IAST: ṛtaṁ yatī saramā gā avindad viśvāni satyāṅgirāś cakāra
Griffith: Sarama went aright and found the cattle. Angiras gave effect to all their labours.
Devanāgarī: ऋतं यती सरमा गा अविन्दद्विश्वानि सत्याङ्गिराश्चकार
pada pāṭha: anūnot | atra | hasta-yataḥ | adriḥ | ārcan | yena | daśa | māsaḥ | nava-gvāḥ || r̥tam | yatī | saramā | gāḥ | avindat | viśvāni | satyā | aṅgirāḥ | cakāra ||5.45.7||

IAST: viśve asyā vyuṣi māhināyāḥ saṁ yad gobhir aṅgiraso navanta
Griffith: When at the dawning of this mighty Goddess, Angirases all sang forth with the cattle,-
Devanāgarī: विश्वे अस्या व्युषि माहिनायाः सं यद्गोभिरङ्गिरसो नवन्त
pada pāṭha: viśve | asyāḥ | vi-uṣi | māhināyāḥ | sam | yat | gobhiḥ | aṅgirasaḥ | navanta || utsaḥ | āsām | parame | sadha-sthe | r̥tasya | pathā | saramā | vidat | gāḥ ||5.45.8||

IAST: utsa āsām parame sadhastha ṛtasya pathā saramā vidad gāḥ
Griffith: Their spring is in the loftiest place of meeting,-Sarama found the kine by Order's pathway.
Devanāgarī: उत्स आसां परमे सधस्थ ऋतस्य पथा सरमा विदद्गाः
pada pāṭha: viśve | asyāḥ | vi-uṣi | māhināyāḥ | sam | yat | gobhiḥ | aṅgirasaḥ | navanta || utsaḥ | āsām | parame | sadha-sthe | r̥tasya | pathā | saramā | vidat | gāḥ ||5.45.8||

IAST: ā sūryo yātu saptāśvaḥ kṣetraṁ yad asyorviyā dīrghayāthe
Griffith: Borne by his Coursers Seven may Surya visit the field that spreadeth wide for his long journey.
Devanāgarī: आ सूर्यो यातु सप्ताश्वः क्षेत्रं यदस्योर्विया दीर्घयाथे
pada pāṭha: ā | sūryaḥ | yātu | sapta-aśvaḥ | kṣetram | yat | asya | urviyā | dīrgha-yāthe || raghuḥ | śyenaḥ | patayat | andhaḥ | accha | yuvā | kaviḥ | dīdayat | goṣu | gacchan ||5.45.9||

IAST: raghuḥ śyenaḥ patayad andho acchā yuvā kavir dīdayad goṣu gacchan
Griffith: Down on the Soma swooped the rapid Falcon. Bright was the young Sage moving mid his cattle.
Devanāgarī: रघुः श्येनः पतयदन्धो अच्छा युवा कविर्दीदयद्गोषु गच्छन्
pada pāṭha: ā | sūryaḥ | yātu | sapta-aśvaḥ | kṣetram | yat | asya | urviyā | dīrgha-yāthe || raghuḥ | śyenaḥ | patayat | andhaḥ | accha | yuvā | kaviḥ | dīdayat | goṣu | gacchan ||5.45.9||

IAST: ā sūryo aruhac chukram arṇo 'yukta yad dharito vītapṛṣṭhāḥ
Griffith: Surya hath mounted to the shining ocean when he hath yoked his fair-backed Tawny Horses.
Devanāgarī: आ सूर्यो अरुहच्छुक्रमर्णोऽयुक्त यद्धरितो वीतपृष्ठाः
pada pāṭha: ā | sūryaḥ | aruhat | śukram | arṇaḥ | ayukta | yat | haritaḥ | vīta-pr̥ṣṭhāḥ || udnā | na | nāvam | anayanta | dhīrāḥ | ā-śr̥ṇvatīḥ | āpaḥ | arvāk | atiṣṭhan ||5.45.10||

IAST: udnā na nāvam anayanta dhīrā āśṛṇvatīr āpo arvāg atiṣṭhan
Griffith: The wise have drawn him like a ship through water: the floods obedient have descended hither.
Devanāgarī: उद्ना न नावमनयन्त धीरा आशृण्वतीरापो अर्वागतिष्ठन्
pada pāṭha: ā | sūryaḥ | aruhat | śukram | arṇaḥ | ayukta | yat | haritaḥ | vīta-pr̥ṣṭhāḥ || udnā | na | nāvam | anayanta | dhīrāḥ | ā-śr̥ṇvatīḥ | āpaḥ | arvāk | atiṣṭhan ||5.45.10||

IAST: dhiyaṁ vo apsu dadhiṣe svarṣāṁ yayātaran daśa māso navagvāḥ
Griffith: I lay upon the Floods your hymn, lightwinning, wherewith Navagvas their ten months completed.
Devanāgarī: धियं वो अप्सु दधिषे स्वर्षां ययातरन्दश मासो नवग्वाः
pada pāṭha: dhiyam | vaḥ | ap-su | dadhiṣe | svaḥ-sām | yayā | ataran | daśa | māsaḥ | nava-gvāḥ || ayā | dhiyā | syāma | deva-gopāḥ | ayā | dhiyā | tuturyāma | ati | aṁhaḥ ||5.45.11||

IAST: ayā dhiyā syāma devagopā ayā dhiyā tuturyāmāty aṁhaḥ
Griffith: Through this our hymn may we have Gods to guard us: through this our hymn pass safe beyond affliction.
Devanāgarī: अया धिया स्याम देवगोपा अया धिया तुतुर्यामात्यंहः
pada pāṭha: dhiyam | vaḥ | ap-su | dadhiṣe | svaḥ-sām | yayā | ataran | daśa | māsaḥ | nava-gvāḥ || ayā | dhiyā | syāma | deva-gopāḥ | ayā | dhiyā | tuturyāma | ati | aṁhaḥ ||5.45.11||

IAST: hayo na vidvām̐ ayuji svayaṁ dhuri tāṁ vahāmi prataraṇīm avasyuvam
Griffith: WELL knowing I have bound me, horselike, to the pole: I carry that which bears as on and gives us help.
Devanāgarī: हयो न विद्वाँ अयुजि स्वयं धुरि तां वहामि प्रतरणीमवस्युवम्
pada pāṭha: hayaḥ | na | vidvān | ayuji | svayam | dhuri | tām | vahāmi | pra-taraṇīm | avasyuvam || na | asyāḥ | vaśmi | vi-mucam | na | ā-vr̥tam | punaḥ | vidvān | pathaḥ | puraḥ-etā | r̥ju | neṣati ||5.46.1||

IAST: nāsyā vaśmi vimucaṁ nāvṛtam punar vidvān pathaḥ puraeta ṛju neṣati
Griffith: I seek for no release, no turning back therefrom. May he who knows the way, the Leader, guide me straig
Devanāgarī: नास्या वश्मि विमुचं नावृतं पुनर्विद्वान्पथः पुरएत ऋजु नेषति
pada pāṭha: hayaḥ | na | vidvān | ayuji | svayam | dhuri | tām | vahāmi | pra-taraṇīm | avasyuvam || na | asyāḥ | vaśmi | vi-mucam | na | ā-vr̥tam | punaḥ | vidvān | pathaḥ | puraḥ-etā | r̥ju | neṣati ||5.46.1||

IAST: agna indra varuṇa mitra devāḥ śardhaḥ pra yanta mārutota viṣṇo
Griffith: O Agni, Indra, Varuna, and Mitra, give, O ye Gods, and Marut host, and Visnu.
Devanāgarī: अग्न इन्द्र वरुण मित्र देवाः शर्धः प्र यन्त मारुतोत विष्णो
pada pāṭha: agne | indra | varuṇa | mitra | devāḥ | śardhaḥ | pra | yanta | māruta | uta | viṣṇo iti || ubhā | nāsatyā | rudraḥ | adha | gnāḥ | pūṣā | bhagaḥ | sarasvatī | juṣanta ||5.46.2||

IAST: ubhā nāsatyā rudro adha gnāḥ pūṣā bhagaḥ sarasvatī juṣanta
Griffith: May both Nasatyas, Rudra, heavenly Matrons, Pusan, Sarasvati, Bhaga, accept us.
Devanāgarī: उभा नासत्या रुद्रो अध ग्नाः पूषा भगः सरस्वती जुषन्त
pada pāṭha: agne | indra | varuṇa | mitra | devāḥ | śardhaḥ | pra | yanta | māruta | uta | viṣṇo iti || ubhā | nāsatyā | rudraḥ | adha | gnāḥ | pūṣā | bhagaḥ | sarasvatī | juṣanta ||5.46.2||

IAST: indrāgnī mitrāvaruṇāditiṁ svaḥ pṛthivīṁ dyām marutaḥ parvatām̐ apaḥ
Griffith: Indra and Agni, Mitra, Varuna, Aditi, the Waters, Mountains, Maruts, Sky, and Earth and Heaven,
Devanāgarī: इन्द्राग्नी मित्रावरुणादितिं स्वः पृथिवीं द्यां मरुतः पर्वताँ अपः
pada pāṭha: indrāgnī iti | mitrāvaruṇā | aditim | svariti svaḥ | pr̥thivīm | dyām | marutaḥ | parvatān | apaḥ || huve | viṣṇum | pūṣaṇam | brahmaṇaḥ | patim | bhagam | nu | śaṁsam | savitāram | ūtaye ||5.46.3||

IAST: huve viṣṇum pūṣaṇam brahmaṇas patim bhagaṁ nu śaṁsaṁ savitāram ūtaye
Griffith: Visnu I call, Pusan, and Brahmanaspati, and Bhaga, Samsa, Savitar that they may help.
Devanāgarī: हुवे विष्णुं पूषणं ब्रह्मणस्पतिं भगं नु शंसं सवितारमूतये
pada pāṭha: indrāgnī iti | mitrāvaruṇā | aditim | svariti svaḥ | pr̥thivīm | dyām | marutaḥ | parvatān | apaḥ || huve | viṣṇum | pūṣaṇam | brahmaṇaḥ | patim | bhagam | nu | śaṁsam | savitāram | ūtaye ||5.46.3||

IAST: uta no viṣṇur uta vāto asridho draviṇodā uta somo mayas karat
Griffith: May Visnu also and Vata who injures none, and Soma granter of possessions give us joy;
Devanāgarī: उत नो विष्णुरुत वातो अस्रिधो द्रविणोदा उत सोमो मयस्करत्
pada pāṭha: uta | naḥ | viṣṇuḥ | uta | vātaḥ | asridhaḥ | draviṇaḥ-dāḥ | uta | somaḥ | mayaḥ | karat || uta | r̥bhavaḥ | uta | rāye | naḥ | aśvinā | uta | tvaṣṭā | uta | vi-bhvā | anu | maṁsate ||5.46.4||

IAST: uta ṛbhava uta rāye no aśvinota tvaṣṭota vibhvānu maṁsate
Griffith: And may the Rbhus and the Asvins, Tvastar and Vibhvan remember us so that we may have wealth.
Devanāgarī: उत ऋभव उत राये नो अश्विनोत त्वष्टोत विभ्वानु मंसते
pada pāṭha: uta | naḥ | viṣṇuḥ | uta | vātaḥ | asridhaḥ | draviṇaḥ-dāḥ | uta | somaḥ | mayaḥ | karat || uta | r̥bhavaḥ | uta | rāye | naḥ | aśvinā | uta | tvaṣṭā | uta | vi-bhvā | anu | maṁsate ||5.46.4||

IAST: uta tyan no mārutaṁ śardha ā gamad divikṣayaṁ yajatam barhir āsade
Griffith: So may the band of Maruts dwelling in the sky, the holy, come to us to sit on sacred grass;
Devanāgarī: उत त्यन्नो मारुतं शर्ध आ गमद्दिविक्षयं यजतं बर्हिरासदे
pada pāṭha: uta | tyat | naḥ | mārutam | śardhaḥ | ā | gamat | divi-kṣayam | yajatam | barhiḥ | ā-sade || br̥haspatiḥ | śarma | pūṣā | uta | naḥ | yamat | varūthyam | varuṇaḥ | mitraḥ | aryamā ||5.46.5||

IAST: bṛhaspatiḥ śarma pūṣota no yamad varūthyaṁ varuṇo mitro aryamā
Griffith: Brhaspati and Pusan grant us sure defence, Varuna, Mitra, Aryaman guard and shelter us.
Devanāgarī: बृहस्पतिः शर्म पूषोत नो यमद्वरूथ्यं वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा
pada pāṭha: uta | tyat | naḥ | mārutam | śardhaḥ | ā | gamat | divi-kṣayam | yajatam | barhiḥ | ā-sade || br̥haspatiḥ | śarma | pūṣā | uta | naḥ | yamat | varūthyam | varuṇaḥ | mitraḥ | aryamā ||5.46.5||

IAST: uta tye naḥ parvatāsaḥ suśastayaḥ sudītayo nadyas trāmaṇe bhuvan
Griffith: And may the Mountains famed in noble eulogies, and the fair-gleaming Rivers keep us safe from harm.
Devanāgarī: उत त्ये नः पर्वतासः सुशस्तयः सुदीतयो नद्यस्त्रामणे भुवन्
pada pāṭha: uta | tye | naḥ | parvatāsaḥ | su-śastayaḥ | su-dītayaḥ | nadyaḥ | trāmaṇe | bhuvan || bhagaḥ | vi-bhaktā | śavasā | avasā | ā | gamat | uru-vyacāḥ | aditiḥ | śrotu | me | havam ||5.46.6||

IAST: bhago vibhaktā śavasāvasā gamad uruvyacā aditiḥ śrotu me havam
Griffith: May Bhaga the Dispenser come with power and grace, and far-pervading Aditi listen to my call.
Devanāgarī: भगो विभक्ता शवसावसा गमदुरुव्यचा अदितिः श्रोतु मे हवम्
pada pāṭha: uta | tye | naḥ | parvatāsaḥ | su-śastayaḥ | su-dītayaḥ | nadyaḥ | trāmaṇe | bhuvan || bhagaḥ | vi-bhaktā | śavasā | avasā | ā | gamat | uru-vyacāḥ | aditiḥ | śrotu | me | havam ||5.46.6||

IAST: devānām patnīr uśatīr avantu naḥ prāvantu nas tujaye vājasātaye
Griffith: May the Gods' Spouses aid us of their own freewill, aid us to offspring and the winning of the spoil.
Devanāgarī: देवानां पत्नीरुशतीरवन्तु नः प्रावन्तु नस्तुजये वाजसातये
pada pāṭha: devānām | patnīḥ | uśatīḥ | avantu | naḥ | pra | avantu | naḥ | tujaye | vāja-sātaye || yāḥ | pārthivāsaḥ | yāḥ | apām | api | vrate | tāḥ | naḥ | devīḥ | su-havāḥ | śarma | yacchata ||5.46.7||

IAST: yāḥ pārthivāso yā apām api vrate tā no devīḥ suhavāḥ śarma yacchata
Griffith: Grant us protection, O ye gracious Goddesses, ye who are on the earth or in the waters' realm.
Devanāgarī: याः पार्थिवासो या अपामपि व्रते ता नो देवीः सुहवाः शर्म यच्छत
pada pāṭha: devānām | patnīḥ | uśatīḥ | avantu | naḥ | pra | avantu | naḥ | tujaye | vāja-sātaye || yāḥ | pārthivāsaḥ | yāḥ | apām | api | vrate | tāḥ | naḥ | devīḥ | su-havāḥ | śarma | yacchata ||5.46.7||

IAST: uta gnā vyantu devapatnīr indrāṇy agnāyy aśvinī rāṭ
Griffith: May the Dames, wives of Gods, enjoy our presents, Rat, Asvini, Agnayi, and Indrani.
Devanāgarī: उत ग्ना व्यन्तु देवपत्नीरिन्द्राण्यग्नाय्यश्विनी राट्
pada pāṭha: uta | gnāḥ | vyantu | deva-patnīḥ | indrāṇī | agnāyī | aśvinī | rāṭ || ā | rodasī iti | varuṇānī | śr̥ṇotu | vyantu | devīḥ | yaḥ | r̥tuḥ | janīnām ||5.46.8||

IAST: ā rodasī varuṇānī śṛṇotu vyantu devīr ya ṛtur janīnām
Griffith: May Rodasi and Varunani hear us, and Goddesses come at the Matrons' season.
Devanāgarī: आ रोदसी वरुणानी शृणोतु व्यन्तु देवीर्य ऋतुर्जनीनाम्
pada pāṭha: uta | gnāḥ | vyantu | deva-patnīḥ | indrāṇī | agnāyī | aśvinī | rāṭ || ā | rodasī iti | varuṇānī | śr̥ṇotu | vyantu | devīḥ | yaḥ | r̥tuḥ | janīnām ||5.46.8||

IAST: prayuñjatī diva eti bruvāṇā mahī mātā duhitur bodhayantī
Griffith: URGING to toil and making proclamation, seeking Heaven's Daughter comes the Mighty Mother:
Devanāgarī: प्रयुञ्जती दिव एति ब्रुवाणा मही माता दुहितुर्बोधयन्ती
pada pāṭha: pra-yuñjatī | divaḥ | eti | bruvāṇā | mahī | mātā | duhituḥ | bodhayantī || ā-vivāsantī | yuvatiḥ | manīṣā | pitr̥-bhyaḥ | ā | sadane | johuvānā ||5.47.1||

IAST: āvivāsantī yuvatir manīṣā pitṛbhya ā sadane johuvānā
Griffith: She comes, the youthful Hymn, unto the Fathers, inviting to her home and loudly calling.
Devanāgarī: आविवासन्ती युवतिर्मनीषा पितृभ्य आ सदने जोहुवाना
pada pāṭha: pra-yuñjatī | divaḥ | eti | bruvāṇā | mahī | mātā | duhituḥ | bodhayantī || ā-vivāsantī | yuvatiḥ | manīṣā | pitr̥-bhyaḥ | ā | sadane | johuvānā ||5.47.1||

IAST: ajirāsas tadapa īyamānā ātasthivāṁso amṛtasya nābhim
Griffith: Swift in their motion, hasting to their duty, reaching the central point of life immortal,
Devanāgarī: अजिरासस्तदप ईयमाना आतस्थिवांसो अमृतस्य नाभिम्
pada pāṭha: ajirāsaḥ | tat-apaḥ | īyamānāḥ | ātasthi-vāṁsaḥ | amr̥tasya | nābhim || anantāsaḥ | uravaḥ | viśvataḥ | sīm | pari | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | yanti | panthāḥ ||5.47.2||

IAST: anantāsa uravo viśvataḥ sīm pari dyāvāpṛthivī yanti panthāḥ
Griffith: On every side about the earth and heaven go forth the spacious paths without a limit.
Devanāgarī: अनन्तास उरवो विश्वतः सीं परि द्यावापृथिवी यन्ति पन्थाः
pada pāṭha: ajirāsaḥ | tat-apaḥ | īyamānāḥ | ātasthi-vāṁsaḥ | amr̥tasya | nābhim || anantāsaḥ | uravaḥ | viśvataḥ | sīm | pari | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | yanti | panthāḥ ||5.47.2||

IAST: ukṣā samudro aruṣaḥ suparṇaḥ pūrvasya yonim pitur ā viveśa
Griffith: Steer, Sea, Red Bird with strong wings, he hath entered the dwelling-place of the Primeval Father.
Devanāgarī: उक्षा समुद्रो अरुषः सुपर्णः पूर्वस्य योनिं पितुरा विवेश
pada pāṭha: ukṣā | samudraḥ | aruṣaḥ | su-parṇaḥ | pūrvasya | yonim | pituḥ | ā | viveśa || madhye | divaḥ | ni-hitaḥ | pr̥śniḥ | aśmā | vi | cakrame | rajasaḥ | pāti | antau ||5.47.3||

IAST: madhye divo nihitaḥ pṛśnir aśmā vi cakrame rajasas pāty antau
Griffith: A gay-hued Stone set in the midst of heaven, he hath gone forth and guards mid-air's two limits.
Devanāgarī: मध्ये दिवो निहितः पृश्निरश्मा वि चक्रमे रजसस्पात्यन्तौ
pada pāṭha: ukṣā | samudraḥ | aruṣaḥ | su-parṇaḥ | pūrvasya | yonim | pituḥ | ā | viveśa || madhye | divaḥ | ni-hitaḥ | pr̥śniḥ | aśmā | vi | cakrame | rajasaḥ | pāti | antau ||5.47.3||

IAST: catvāra īm bibhrati kṣemayanto daśa garbhaṁ carase dhāpayante
Griffith: Four bear him up and give him rest and quiet, and ten invigorate the Babe for travel.
Devanāgarī: चत्वार ईं बिभ्रति क्षेमयन्तो दश गर्भं चरसे धापयन्ते
pada pāṭha: catvāraḥ | īm | bibhrati | kṣema-yantaḥ | daśa | garbham | carase | dhāpayante || tri-dhātavaḥ | paramāḥ | asya | gāvaḥ | divaḥ | caranti | pari | sadyaḥ | antān ||5.47.4||

IAST: tridhātavaḥ paramā asya gāvo divaś caranti pari sadyo antān
Griffith: His kine most excellent, of threefold nature, pass swiftly round the boundaries of heaven.
Devanāgarī: त्रिधातवः परमा अस्य गावो दिवश्चरन्ति परि सद्यो अन्तान्
pada pāṭha: catvāraḥ | īm | bibhrati | kṣema-yantaḥ | daśa | garbham | carase | dhāpayante || tri-dhātavaḥ | paramāḥ | asya | gāvaḥ | divaḥ | caranti | pari | sadyaḥ | antān ||5.47.4||

IAST: idaṁ vapur nivacanaṁ janāsaś caranti yan nadyas tasthur āpaḥ
Griffith: Wondrous, O people, is the mystic knowledge that while the waters stand the streams are flowing:
Devanāgarī: इदं वपुर्निवचनं जनासश्चरन्ति यन्नद्यस्तस्थुरापः
pada pāṭha: idam | vapuḥ | ni-vacanam | janāsaḥ | caranti | yat | nadyaḥ | tasthuḥ | āpaḥ || dve iti | yat | īm | bibhr̥taḥ | mātuḥ | anye iti | iha-iha | jāte iti | yamyā | sabandhū iti sa-bandhū ||5.47.5||

IAST: dve yad īm bibhṛto mātur anye iheha jāte yamyā sabandhū
Griffith: That, separate from his Mother, Two support him, closely-united, twins, here made apparent.
Devanāgarī: द्वे यदीं बिभृतो मातुरन्ये इहेह जाते यम्या सबन्धू
pada pāṭha: idam | vapuḥ | ni-vacanam | janāsaḥ | caranti | yat | nadyaḥ | tasthuḥ | āpaḥ || dve iti | yat | īm | bibhr̥taḥ | mātuḥ | anye iti | iha-iha | jāte iti | yamyā | sabandhū iti sa-bandhū ||5.47.5||

IAST: vi tanvate dhiyo asmā apāṁsi vastrā putrāya mātaro vayanti
Griffith: For him they lenghten prayers and acts of worship: the Mothers weave garments for him their offspring.
Devanāgarī: वि तन्वते धियो अस्मा अपांसि वस्त्रा पुत्राय मातरो वयन्ति
pada pāṭha: vi | tanvate | dhiyaḥ | asmai | apāṁsi | vastrā | putrāya | mātaraḥ | vayanti || upa-prakṣe | vr̥ṣaṇaḥ | modamānāḥ | divaḥ | pathā | vadhvaḥ | yanti | accha ||5.47.6||

IAST: upaprakṣe vṛṣaṇo modamānā divas pathā vadhvo yanty accha
Griffith: Rejoicing, for the Steer's impregning contact, his Spouses move on paths or heaven to meet him.
Devanāgarī: उपप्रक्षे वृषणो मोदमाना दिवस्पथा वध्वो यन्त्यच्छ
pada pāṭha: vi | tanvate | dhiyaḥ | asmai | apāṁsi | vastrā | putrāya | mātaraḥ | vayanti || upa-prakṣe | vr̥ṣaṇaḥ | modamānāḥ | divaḥ | pathā | vadhvaḥ | yanti | accha ||5.47.6||

IAST: tad astu mitrāvaruṇā tad agne śaṁ yor asmabhyam idam astu śastam
Griffith: Be this our praise, O Varuna and Mitra may this be health and force to us, O Agni.
Devanāgarī: तदस्तु मित्रावरुणा तदग्ने शं योरस्मभ्यमिदमस्तु शस्तम्
pada pāṭha: tat | astu | mitrāvaruṇā | tat | agne | śam | yoḥ | asmabhyam | idam | astu | śastam || aśīmahi | gādham | uta | prati-sthām | namaḥ | dive | br̥hate | sādanāya ||5.47.7||

IAST: aśīmahi gādham uta pratiṣṭhāṁ namo dive bṛhate sādanāya
Griffith: May we obtain firm ground and room for resting: Glory to Heaven, the lofty habitation!
Devanāgarī: अशीमहि गाधमुत प्रतिष्ठां नमो दिवे बृहते सादनाय
pada pāṭha: tat | astu | mitrāvaruṇā | tat | agne | śam | yoḥ | asmabhyam | idam | astu | śastam || aśīmahi | gādham | uta | prati-sthām | namaḥ | dive | br̥hate | sādanāya ||5.47.7||

IAST: kad u priyāya dhāmne manāmahe svakṣatrāya svayaśase mahe vayam
Griffith: WHAT may we meditate for the beloved Power, mighty in native strength and glorious in itself,
Devanāgarī: कदु प्रियाय धाम्ने मनामहे स्वक्षत्राय स्वयशसे महे वयम्
pada pāṭha: kat | ūm̐ iti | priyāya | dhāmne | manāmahe | sva-kṣatrāya | sva-yaśase | mahe | vayam || ā-menyasya | rajasaḥ | yat | abhre | ā | apaḥ | vr̥ṇānā | vi-tanoti | māyinī ||5.48.1||

IAST: āmenyasya rajaso yad abhra ām̐ apo vṛṇānā vitanoti māyinī
Griffith: Which as a magic energy seeking waters spreads even to theimmeasurable middle region's cloud?
Devanāgarī: आमेन्यस्य रजसो यदभ्र आँ अपो वृणाना वितनोति मायिनी
pada pāṭha: kat | ūm̐ iti | priyāya | dhāmne | manāmahe | sva-kṣatrāya | sva-yaśase | mahe | vayam || ā-menyasya | rajasaḥ | yat | abhre | ā | apaḥ | vr̥ṇānā | vi-tanoti | māyinī ||5.48.1||

IAST: tā atnata vayunaṁ vīravakṣaṇaṁ samānyā vṛtayā viśvam ā rajaḥ
Griffith: O'er all the region with their uniform advance these have spread out the lore that giveth heroes strength
Devanāgarī: ता अत्नत वयुनं वीरवक्षणं समान्या वृतया विश्वमा रजः
pada pāṭha: tāḥ | atnata | vayunam | vīra-vakṣaṇam | samānyā | vr̥tayā | viśvam | ā | rajaḥ || apo iti | apācīḥ | aparāḥ | apa | ījate | pra | pūrvābhiḥ | tirate | deva-yuḥ | janaḥ ||5.48.2||

IAST: apo apācīr aparā apejate pra pūrvābhis tirate devayur janaḥ
Griffith: Back, with their course reversed, the others pass away: the pious lengthens life with those that are bef
Devanāgarī: अपो अपाचीरपरा अपेजते प्र पूर्वाभिस्तिरते देवयुर्जनः
pada pāṭha: tāḥ | atnata | vayunam | vīra-vakṣaṇam | samānyā | vr̥tayā | viśvam | ā | rajaḥ || apo iti | apācīḥ | aparāḥ | apa | ījate | pra | pūrvābhiḥ | tirate | deva-yuḥ | janaḥ ||5.48.2||

IAST: ā grāvabhir ahanyebhir aktubhir variṣṭhaṁ vajram ā jigharti māyini
Griffith: With pressing-stones and with the bright beams of the day he hurls his broadest bolt against the Guileful
Devanāgarī: आ ग्रावभिरहन्येभिरक्तुभिर्वरिष्ठं वज्रमा जिघर्ति मायिनि
pada pāṭha: ā | grāva-bhiḥ | ahanyebhiḥ | aktu-bhiḥ | variṣṭham | vajram | ā | jigharti | māyini || śatam | vā | yasya | pra-caran | sve | dame | sam-vartayantaḥ | vi | ca | vartayan | ahā ||5.48.3||

IAST: śataṁ vā yasya pracaran sve dame saṁvartayanto vi ca vartayann ahā
Griffith: Even he whose hundred wander in his own abode, driving the days afar and bringing them again.
Devanāgarī: शतं वा यस्य प्रचरन्स्वे दमे संवर्तयन्तो वि च वर्तयन्नहा
pada pāṭha: ā | grāva-bhiḥ | ahanyebhiḥ | aktu-bhiḥ | variṣṭham | vajram | ā | jigharti | māyini || śatam | vā | yasya | pra-caran | sve | dame | sam-vartayantaḥ | vi | ca | vartayan | ahā ||5.48.3||

IAST: tām asya rītim paraśor iva praty anīkam akhyam bhuje asya varpasaḥ
Griffith: I, to enjoy the beauty of his form, behold that rapid rush of his as 'twere an axe's edge,
Devanāgarī: तामस्य रीतिं परशोरिव प्रत्यनीकमख्यं भुजे अस्य वर्पसः
pada pāṭha: tām | asya | rītim | paraśoḥ-iva | prati | anīkam | akhyam | bhuje | asya | varpasaḥ || sacā | yadi | pitumantam-iva | kṣayam | ratnam | dadhāti | bhara-hūtaye | viśe ||5.48.4||

IAST: sacā yadi pitumantam iva kṣayaṁ ratnaṁ dadhāti bharahūtaye viśe
Griffith: What time he gives the man who calls on him in fight wealth like a dwelling-house filled full with store
Devanāgarī: सचा यदि पितुमन्तमिव क्षयं रत्नं दधाति भरहूतये विशे
pada pāṭha: tām | asya | rītim | paraśoḥ-iva | prati | anīkam | akhyam | bhuje | asya | varpasaḥ || sacā | yadi | pitumantam-iva | kṣayam | ratnam | dadhāti | bhara-hūtaye | viśe ||5.48.4||

IAST: sa jihvayā caturanīka ṛñjate cāru vasāno varuṇo yatann arim
Griffith: Four-faced and nobly clad, Varuna, urging on the pious to his task, stirs himself with the tongue.
Devanāgarī: स जिह्वया चतुरनीक ऋञ्जते चारु वसानो वरुणो यतन्नरिम्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | jihvayā | catuḥ-anīkaḥ | r̥ñjate | cāru | vasānaḥ | varuṇaḥ | yatan | arim || na | tasya | vidma | puruṣatvatā | vayam | yataḥ | bhagaḥ | savitā | dāti | vāryam ||5.48.5||

IAST: na tasya vidma puruṣatvatā vayaṁ yato bhagaḥ savitā dāti vāryam
Griffith: Naught by our human nature do we know of him, him from whom Bhaga Savitar bestows the boon.
Devanāgarī: न तस्य विद्म पुरुषत्वता वयं यतो भगः सविता दाति वार्यम्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | jihvayā | catuḥ-anīkaḥ | r̥ñjate | cāru | vasānaḥ | varuṇaḥ | yatan | arim || na | tasya | vidma | puruṣatvatā | vayam | yataḥ | bhagaḥ | savitā | dāti | vāryam ||5.48.5||

IAST: devaṁ vo adya savitāram eṣe bhagaṁ ca ratnaṁ vibhajantam āyoḥ
Griffith: THIS day I bring God Savitar to meet you, and Bhaga who allots the wealth of mortals.
Devanāgarī: देवं वो अद्य सवितारमेषे भगं च रत्नं विभजन्तमायोः
pada pāṭha: devam | vaḥ | adya | savitāram | ā | īṣe | bhagam | ca | ratnam | vi-bhajantam | āyoḥ || ā | vām | narā | puru-bhujā | vavr̥tyām | dive-dive | cit | aśvinā | sakhi-yan ||5.49.1||

IAST: ā vāṁ narā purubhujā vavṛtyāṁ dive-dive cid aśvinā sakhīyan
Griffith: You, Asvins, Heroes rich in treasures, daily seeking your friendship fain would I turn hither.
Devanāgarī: आ वां नरा पुरुभुजा ववृत्यां दिवेदिवे चिदश्विना सखीयन्
pada pāṭha: devam | vaḥ | adya | savitāram | ā | īṣe | bhagam | ca | ratnam | vi-bhajantam | āyoḥ || ā | vām | narā | puru-bhujā | vavr̥tyām | dive-dive | cit | aśvinā | sakhi-yan ||5.49.1||

IAST: prati prayāṇam asurasya vidvān sūktair devaṁ savitāraṁ duvasya
Griffith: Knowing full well the Asura's time of coming, worship God Savitar with hymns and praises.
Devanāgarī: प्रति प्रयाणमसुरस्य विद्वान्सूक्तैर्देवं सवितारं दुवस्य
pada pāṭha: prati | pra-yānam | asurasya | vidvān | su-uktaiḥ | devam | savitāram | duvasya || upa | bruvīta | namasā | vi-jānan | jyeṣṭham | ca | ratnam | vi-bhajantam | āyoḥ ||5.49.2||

IAST: upa bruvīta namasā vijānañ jyeṣṭhaṁ ca ratnaṁ vibhajantam āyoḥ
Griffith: Let him who rightly knoweth speak with homage to him who dealeth out man's noblest treasure.
Devanāgarī: उप ब्रुवीत नमसा विजानञ्ज्येष्ठं च रत्नं विभजन्तमायोः
pada pāṭha: prati | pra-yānam | asurasya | vidvān | su-uktaiḥ | devam | savitāram | duvasya || upa | bruvīta | namasā | vi-jānan | jyeṣṭham | ca | ratnam | vi-bhajantam | āyoḥ ||5.49.2||

IAST: adatrayā dayate vāryāṇi pūṣā bhago aditir vasta usraḥ
Griffith: Not for reward doth Pusan send his blessings, Bhaga, or Aditi: his garb is splendour.
Devanāgarī: अदत्रया दयते वार्याणि पूषा भगो अदितिर्वस्त उस्रः
pada pāṭha: adatra-yā | dayate | vāryāṇi | pūṣā | bhagaḥ | aditiḥ | vaste | usraḥ || indraḥ | viṣṇuḥ | varuṇaḥ | mitraḥ | agniḥ | ahāni | bhadrā | janayanta | dasmāḥ ||5.49.3||

IAST: indro viṣṇur varuṇo mitro agnir ahāni bhadrā janayanta dasmāḥ
Griffith: May Indra, Visniu, Varuna, Mitra, Agni produce auspicious days, the Wonder-Workers.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रो विष्णुर्वरुणो मित्रो अग्निरहानि भद्रा जनयन्त दस्माः
pada pāṭha: adatra-yā | dayate | vāryāṇi | pūṣā | bhagaḥ | aditiḥ | vaste | usraḥ || indraḥ | viṣṇuḥ | varuṇaḥ | mitraḥ | agniḥ | ahāni | bhadrā | janayanta | dasmāḥ ||5.49.3||

IAST: tan no anarvā savitā varūthaṁ tat sindhava iṣayanto anu gman
Griffith: Sending the shelter which we ask, the foeless Savitar and the Rivers shall approach us.
Devanāgarī: तन्नो अनर्वा सविता वरूथं तत्सिन्धव इषयन्तो अनु ग्मन्
pada pāṭha: tat | naḥ | anarvā | savitā | varūtham | tat | sindhavaḥ | iṣayantaḥ | anu | gman || upa | yat | voce | adhvarasya | hotā | rāyaḥ | syāma | patayaḥ | vāja-ratnāḥ ||5.49.4||

IAST: upa yad voce adhvarasya hotā rāyaḥ syāma patayo vājaratnāḥ
Griffith: When I, the sacrifice's priest, invite them, may we he lords of wealth and rich possessions.
Devanāgarī: उप यद्वोचे अध्वरस्य होता रायः स्याम पतयो वाजरत्नाः
pada pāṭha: tat | naḥ | anarvā | savitā | varūtham | tat | sindhavaḥ | iṣayantaḥ | anu | gman || upa | yat | voce | adhvarasya | hotā | rāyaḥ | syāma | patayaḥ | vāja-ratnāḥ ||5.49.4||

IAST: pra ye vasubhya īvad ā namo dur ye mitre varuṇe sūktavācaḥ
Griffith: They who devote such worship to the Vasus, singing their hymns to Varuna and Mitra,
Devanāgarī: प्र ये वसुभ्य ईवदा नमो दुर्ये मित्रे वरुणे सूक्तवाचः
pada pāṭha: pra | ye | vasu-bhyaḥ | īvat | ā | namaḥ | duḥ | ye | mitre | varuṇe | sūkta-vācaḥ || ava | etu | abhvam | kr̥ṇuta | varīyaḥ | divaḥpr̥thivyoḥ | avasā | madema ||5.49.5||

IAST: avaitv abhvaṁ kṛṇutā varīyo divaspṛthivyor avasā madema
Griffith: Vouchsafe them ample room, far off be danger. Through grace of Heaven and Earth may we be happy.
Devanāgarī: अवैत्वभ्वं कृणुता वरीयो दिवस्पृथिव्योरवसा मदेम
pada pāṭha: pra | ye | vasu-bhyaḥ | īvat | ā | namaḥ | duḥ | ye | mitre | varuṇe | sūkta-vācaḥ || ava | etu | abhvam | kr̥ṇuta | varīyaḥ | divaḥpr̥thivyoḥ | avasā | madema ||5.49.5||

IAST: viśvo devasya netur marto vurīta sakhyam
Griffith: LET every mortal man elect the friendship of the guiding God.
Devanāgarī: विश्वो देवस्य नेतुर्मर्तो वुरीत सख्यम्
pada pāṭha: viśvaḥ | devasya | netuḥ | martaḥ | vurīta | sakhyam || viśvaḥ | rāye | iṣudhyati | dyumnam | vr̥ṇīta | puṣyase ||5.50.1||

IAST: viśvo rāya iṣudhyati dyumnaṁ vṛṇīta puṣyase
Griffith: Each one solicits him for wealth and seeks renown to prosper him.
Devanāgarī: विश्वो राय इषुध्यति द्युम्नं वृणीत पुष्यसे
pada pāṭha: viśvaḥ | devasya | netuḥ | martaḥ | vurīta | sakhyam || viśvaḥ | rāye | iṣudhyati | dyumnam | vr̥ṇīta | puṣyase ||5.50.1||

IAST: te te deva netar ye cemām̐ anuśase
Griffith: These, leading God, are thine, and these here ready to speak after us.
Devanāgarī: ते ते देव नेतर्ये चेमाँ अनुशसे
pada pāṭha: te | te | deva | netaḥ | ye | ca | imān | anu-śase || te | rāyā | te | hi | ā-pr̥ce | sacemahi | sacathyaiḥ ||5.50.2||

IAST: te rāyā te hy āpṛce sacemahi sacathyaiḥ
Griffith: As such may we attain to wealth and wait with services on thee.
Devanāgarī: ते राया ते ह्यापृचे सचेमहि सचथ्यैः
