pada pāṭha: te | te | deva | netaḥ | ye | ca | imān | anu-śase || te | rāyā | te | hi | ā-pr̥ce | sacemahi | sacathyaiḥ ||5.50.2||

IAST: ato na ā nṝn atithīn ataḥ patnīr daśasyata
Griffith: So further honour as our guests the Hero Gods and then the Dames.
Devanāgarī: अतो न आ नॄनतिथीनतः पत्नीर्दशस्यत
pada pāṭha: ataḥ | naḥ | ā | nr̥̄n | atithīn | ataḥ | patnīḥ | daśasyata || āre | viśvam | pathe-sthām | dviṣaḥ | yuyotu | yuyuviḥ ||5.50.3||

IAST: āre viśvam patheṣṭhāṁ dviṣo yuyotu yūyuviḥ
Griffith: May he remove and keep afar our foes and all who block our path.
Devanāgarī: आरे विश्वं पथेष्ठां द्विषो युयोतु यूयुविः
pada pāṭha: ataḥ | naḥ | ā | nr̥̄n | atithīn | ataḥ | patnīḥ | daśasyata || āre | viśvam | pathe-sthām | dviṣaḥ | yuyotu | yuyuviḥ ||5.50.3||

IAST: yatra vahnir abhihito dudravad droṇyaḥ paśuḥ
Griffith: Where fire is set, and swiftly runs the victim dwelling in the trough,
Devanāgarī: यत्र वह्निरभिहितो दुद्रवद्द्रोण्यः पशुः
pada pāṭha: yatra | vahniḥ | abhi-hitaḥ | dudravat | droṇyaḥ | paśuḥ || nr̥-manāḥ | vīra-pastyaḥ | arṇā | dhīrā-iva | sanitā ||5.50.4||

IAST: nṛmaṇā vīrapastyo 'rṇā dhīreva sanitā
Griffith: He wins, with heroes in his home, friendly to man, like constant streams.
Devanāgarī: नृमणा वीरपस्त्योऽर्णा धीरेव सनिता
pada pāṭha: yatra | vahniḥ | abhi-hitaḥ | dudravat | droṇyaḥ | paśuḥ || nr̥-manāḥ | vīra-pastyaḥ | arṇā | dhīrā-iva | sanitā ||5.50.4||

IAST: eṣa te deva netā rathaspatiḥ śaṁ rayiḥ
Griffith: May these thy riches, Leader God! that rule the car, be blest to us,
Devanāgarī: एष ते देव नेता रथस्पतिः शं रयिः
pada pāṭha: eṣaḥ | te | deva | netariti | rathaḥpatiḥ | śam | rayiḥ || śam | rāye | śam | svastaye | iṣaḥ-stutaḥ | manāmahe | deva-stutaḥ | manāmahe ||5.50.5||

IAST: śaṁ rāye śaṁ svastaya iṣaḥstuto manāmahe devastuto manāmahe
Griffith: Yea, blest to us for wealth and weal. This will we ponder praising strength, this ponder as we praise t
Devanāgarī: शं राये शं स्वस्तय इषःस्तुतो मनामहे देवस्तुतो मनामहे
pada pāṭha: eṣaḥ | te | deva | netariti | rathaḥpatiḥ | śam | rayiḥ || śam | rāye | śam | svastaye | iṣaḥ-stutaḥ | manāmahe | deva-stutaḥ | manāmahe ||5.50.5||

IAST: agne sutasya pītaye viśvair ūmebhir ā gahi
Griffith: WITH all assistants, Agni, come hither to drink the Soma-juice;
Devanāgarī: अग्ने सुतस्य पीतये विश्वैरूमेभिरा गहि
pada pāṭha: agne | sutasya | pītaye | viśvaiḥ | ūmebhiḥ | ā | gahi || devebhiḥ | havya-dātaye ||5.51.1||

IAST: devebhir havyadātaye
Griffith: With Gods unto our sacred gifts.
Devanāgarī: देवेभिर्हव्यदातये
pada pāṭha: agne | sutasya | pītaye | viśvaiḥ | ūmebhiḥ | ā | gahi || devebhiḥ | havya-dātaye ||5.51.1||

IAST: ṛtadhītaya ā gata satyadharmāṇo adhvaram
Griffith: Come to the sacrifice, O ye whose ways are right, whose laws are true,
Devanāgarī: ऋतधीतय आ गत सत्यधर्माणो अध्वरम्
pada pāṭha: r̥ta-dhītayaḥ | ā | gata | satya-dharmāṇaḥ | adhvaram || agneḥ | pibata | jihvayā ||5.51.2||

IAST: agneḥ pibata jihvayā
Griffith: And drink the draught with Agni's tongue.
Devanāgarī: अग्नेः पिबत जिह्वया
pada pāṭha: r̥ta-dhītayaḥ | ā | gata | satya-dharmāṇaḥ | adhvaram || agneḥ | pibata | jihvayā ||5.51.2||

IAST: viprebhir vipra santya prātaryāvabhir ā gahi
Griffith: O Singer, with the singers, O Gracious, with those who move at dawn,
Devanāgarī: विप्रेभिर्विप्र सन्त्य प्रातर्यावभिरा गहि
pada pāṭha: viprebhiḥ | vipra | santya | prātaryāva-bhiḥ | ā | gahi || devebhiḥ | soma-pītaye ||5.51.3||

IAST: devebhiḥ somapītaye
Griffith: Come to the Soma-draught with Gods.
Devanāgarī: देवेभिः सोमपीतये
pada pāṭha: viprebhiḥ | vipra | santya | prātaryāva-bhiḥ | ā | gahi || devebhiḥ | soma-pītaye ||5.51.3||

IAST: ayaṁ somaś camū suto 'matre pari ṣicyate
Griffith: To Indra and to Vayu dear, this Soma, by the mortar pressed,
Devanāgarī: अयं सोमश्चमू सुतोऽमत्रे परि षिच्यते
pada pāṭha: ayam | somaḥ | camū iti | sutaḥ | amatre | pari | sicyate || priyaḥ | indrāya | vāyave ||5.51.4||

IAST: priya indrāya vāyave
Griffith: Is now poured forth to fill the jar.
Devanāgarī: प्रिय इन्द्राय वायवे
pada pāṭha: ayam | somaḥ | camū iti | sutaḥ | amatre | pari | sicyate || priyaḥ | indrāya | vāyave ||5.51.4||

IAST: vāyav ā yāhi vītaye juṣāṇo havyadātaye
Griffith: Vayu, come hither to the feast, wellpleased unto our sacred gifts:
Devanāgarī: वायवा याहि वीतये जुषाणो हव्यदातये
pada pāṭha: vāyo iti | ā | yāhi | vītaye | juṣāṇaḥ | havya-dātaye || piba | sutasya | andhasaḥ | abhi | prayaḥ ||5.51.5||

IAST: pibā sutasyāndhaso abhi prayaḥ
Griffith: Drink of the Soma juice effused come to the food.
Devanāgarī: पिबा सुतस्यान्धसो अभि प्रयः
pada pāṭha: vāyo iti | ā | yāhi | vītaye | juṣāṇaḥ | havya-dātaye || piba | sutasya | andhasaḥ | abhi | prayaḥ ||5.51.5||

IAST: indraś ca vāyav eṣāṁ sutānām pītim arhathaḥ
Griffith: Ye, Indra, Vayu, well deserve to drink the juices pressed by us.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रश्च वायवेषां सुतानां पीतिमर्हथः
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | ca | vāyo iti | eṣām | sutānām | pītim | arhathaḥ || tān | juṣethām | arepasau | abhi | prayaḥ ||5.51.6||

IAST: tāñ juṣethām arepasāv abhi prayaḥ
Griffith: Gladly accept them, spotless Pair come to the food.
Devanāgarī: ताञ्जुषेथामरेपसावभि प्रयः
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | ca | vāyo iti | eṣām | sutānām | pītim | arhathaḥ || tān | juṣethām | arepasau | abhi | prayaḥ ||5.51.6||

IAST: sutā indrāya vāyave somāso dadhyāśiraḥ
Griffith: For Indra and for Vayu pressed are Soma juices blent with curd,
Devanāgarī: सुता इन्द्राय वायवे सोमासो दध्याशिरः
pada pāṭha: sutāḥ | indrāya | vāyave | somāsaḥ | dadhi-āśiraḥ || nimnam | na | yanti | sindhavaḥ | abhi | prayaḥ ||5.51.7||

IAST: nimnaṁ na yanti sindhavo 'bhi prayaḥ
Griffith: As rivers to the lowland flow: come to the food.
Devanāgarī: निम्नं न यन्ति सिन्धवोऽभि प्रयः
pada pāṭha: sutāḥ | indrāya | vāyave | somāsaḥ | dadhi-āśiraḥ || nimnam | na | yanti | sindhavaḥ | abhi | prayaḥ ||5.51.7||

IAST: sajūr viśvebhir devebhir aśvibhyām uṣasā sajūḥ
Griffith: Associate with all the Gods, come, with the Asvins and with Dawn,
Devanāgarī: सजूर्विश्वेभिर्देवेभिरश्विभ्यामुषसा सजूः
pada pāṭha: sa-jūḥ | viśvebhiḥ | devebhiḥ | aśvi-bhyām | uṣasā | sa-jūḥ || ā | yāhi | agne | atri-vat | sute | raṇa ||5.51.8||

IAST: ā yāhy agne atrivat sute raṇa
Griffith: Agni, as erst with Atri, so enjoy the juice.
Devanāgarī: आ याह्यग्ने अत्रिवत्सुते रण
pada pāṭha: sa-jūḥ | viśvebhiḥ | devebhiḥ | aśvi-bhyām | uṣasā | sa-jūḥ || ā | yāhi | agne | atri-vat | sute | raṇa ||5.51.8||

IAST: sajūr mitrāvaruṇābhyāṁ sajūḥ somena viṣṇunā
Griffith: Associate with Varuna, with Mitra, Soma, Visnu, come,
Devanāgarī: सजूर्मित्रावरुणाभ्यां सजूः सोमेन विष्णुना
pada pāṭha: sa-jūḥ | mitrāvaruṇābhyām | sa-jūḥ | somena | viṣṇunā || ā | yāhi | agne | atri-vat | sute | raṇa ||5.51.9||

IAST: ā yāhy agne atrivat sute raṇa
Griffith: Agni, as erstwith Atri, so enjoy the juice.
Devanāgarī: आ याह्यग्ने अत्रिवत्सुते रण
pada pāṭha: sa-jūḥ | mitrāvaruṇābhyām | sa-jūḥ | somena | viṣṇunā || ā | yāhi | agne | atri-vat | sute | raṇa ||5.51.9||

IAST: sajūr ādityair vasubhiḥ sajūr indreṇa vāyunā
Griffith: Associate with Vasus, with Adityas, Indra, Vishnu,
Devanāgarī: सजूरादित्यैर्वसुभिः सजूरिन्द्रेण वायुना
pada pāṭha: sa-jūḥ | ādityaiḥ | vasu-bhiḥ | sa-jūḥ | indreṇa | vāyunā || ā | yāhi | agne | atri-vat | sute | raṇa ||5.51.10||

IAST: ā yāhy agne atrivat sute raṇa
Griffith: come, Agni as erst with Atri, so enjoy the juice.
Devanāgarī: आ याह्यग्ने अत्रिवत्सुते रण
pada pāṭha: sa-jūḥ | ādityaiḥ | vasu-bhiḥ | sa-jūḥ | indreṇa | vāyunā || ā | yāhi | agne | atri-vat | sute | raṇa ||5.51.10||

IAST: svasti no mimītām aśvinā bhagaḥ svasti devy aditir anarvaṇaḥ
Griffith: May Bhaga and the Asvins grant us health and wealth, and Goddess Adid and he whom none resist.
Devanāgarī: स्वस्ति नो मिमीतामश्विना भगः स्वस्ति देव्यदितिरनर्वणः
pada pāṭha: svasti | naḥ | mimītām | aśvinā | bhagaḥ | svasti | devī | aditiḥ | anarvaṇaḥ || svasti | pūṣā | asuraḥ | dadhātu | naḥ | svasti | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | su-cetunā ||5.51.11||

IAST: svasti pūṣā asuro dadhātu naḥ svasti dyāvāpṛthivī sucetunā
Griffith: The Asura Pusan grant us all prosperity, and Heaven and Earth most wise vouchsafe us happiness.
Devanāgarī: स्वस्ति पूषा असुरो दधातु नः स्वस्ति द्यावापृथिवी सुचेतुना
pada pāṭha: svasti | naḥ | mimītām | aśvinā | bhagaḥ | svasti | devī | aditiḥ | anarvaṇaḥ || svasti | pūṣā | asuraḥ | dadhātu | naḥ | svasti | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | su-cetunā ||5.51.11||

IAST: svastaye vāyum upa bravāmahai somaṁ svasti bhuvanasya yas patiḥ
Griffith: Let us solicit Vayu for prosperity, and Soma who is Lord of all the world for weal;
Devanāgarī: स्वस्तये वायुमुप ब्रवामहै सोमं स्वस्ति भुवनस्य यस्पतिः
pada pāṭha: svastaye | vāyum | upa | bravāmahai | somam | svasti | bhuvanasya | yaḥ | patiḥ || br̥haspatim | sarva-gaṇam | svastaye | svastaye | ādityāsaḥ | bhavantu | naḥ ||5.51.12||

IAST: bṛhaspatiṁ sarvagaṇaṁ svastaye svastaya ādityāso bhavantu naḥ
Griffith: For weal Brhaspati with all his company. May the Adityas bring us health and happiness.
Devanāgarī: बृहस्पतिं सर्वगणं स्वस्तये स्वस्तय आदित्यासो भवन्तु नः
pada pāṭha: svastaye | vāyum | upa | bravāmahai | somam | svasti | bhuvanasya | yaḥ | patiḥ || br̥haspatim | sarva-gaṇam | svastaye | svastaye | ādityāsaḥ | bhavantu | naḥ ||5.51.12||

IAST: viśve devā no adyā svastaye vaiśvānaro vasur agniḥ svastaye
Griffith: May all the Gods, may Agni the beneficent, God of all men, this day be with us for our weal.
Devanāgarī: विश्वे देवा नो अद्या स्वस्तये वैश्वानरो वसुरग्निः स्वस्तये
pada pāṭha: viśve | devāḥ | naḥ | adya | svastaye | vaiśvānaraḥ | vasuḥ | agniḥ | svastaye || devāḥ | avantu | r̥bhavaḥ | svastaye | svasti | naḥ | rudraḥ | pātu | aṁhasaḥ ||5.51.13||

IAST: devā avantv ṛbhavaḥ svastaye svasti no rudraḥ pātv aṁhasaḥ
Griffith: Help us the Rbhus, the Divine Ones, for our good. May Rudra bless and keep us from calamity.
Devanāgarī: देवा अवन्त्वृभवः स्वस्तये स्वस्ति नो रुद्रः पात्वंहसः
pada pāṭha: viśve | devāḥ | naḥ | adya | svastaye | vaiśvānaraḥ | vasuḥ | agniḥ | svastaye || devāḥ | avantu | r̥bhavaḥ | svastaye | svasti | naḥ | rudraḥ | pātu | aṁhasaḥ ||5.51.13||

IAST: svasti mitrāvaruṇā svasti pathye revati
Griffith: Prosper us, Mitra, Varuna. O wealthy Pathya, prosper us.
Devanāgarī: स्वस्ति मित्रावरुणा स्वस्ति पथ्ये रेवति
pada pāṭha: svasti | mitrāvaruṇā | svasti | pathye | revati || svasti | naḥ | indraḥ | ca | agniḥ | ca | svasti | naḥ | adite | kr̥dhi ||5.51.14||

IAST: svasti na indraś cāgniś ca svasti no adite kṛdhi
Griffith: Indra and Agni, prosper us; prosper us thou, O Aditi.
Devanāgarī: स्वस्ति न इन्द्रश्चाग्निश्च स्वस्ति नो अदिते कृधि
pada pāṭha: svasti | mitrāvaruṇā | svasti | pathye | revati || svasti | naḥ | indraḥ | ca | agniḥ | ca | svasti | naḥ | adite | kr̥dhi ||5.51.14||

IAST: svasti panthām anu carema sūryācandramasāv iva
Griffith: Like Sun and Moon may we pursue in full prosperity our path,
Devanāgarī: स्वस्ति पन्थामनु चरेम सूर्याचन्द्रमसाविव
pada pāṭha: svasti | panthām | anu | carema | sūryācandramasau-iva || punaḥ | dadatā | aghnatā | jānatā | sam | gamemahi ||5.51.15||

IAST: punar dadatāghnatā jānatā saṁ gamemahi
Griffith: And meet with one who gives again, -who knows us well and slays us not.
Devanāgarī: पुनर्ददताघ्नता जानता सं गमेमहि
pada pāṭha: svasti | panthām | anu | carema | sūryācandramasau-iva || punaḥ | dadatā | aghnatā | jānatā | sam | gamemahi ||5.51.15||

IAST: pra śyāvāśva dhṛṣṇuyārcā marudbhir ṛkvabhiḥ
Griffith: SING boldly forth, Syavasva, with the Maruts who are loud in song,
Devanāgarī: प्र श्यावाश्व धृष्णुयार्चा मरुद्भिरृक्वभिः
pada pāṭha: pra | śyāva-aśva | dhr̥ṣṇu-yā | arca | marut-bhiḥ | r̥kva-bhiḥ || ye | adrogham | anu-svadham | śravaḥ | madanti | yajñiyāḥ ||5.52.1||

IAST: ye adrogham anuṣvadhaṁ śravo madanti yajñiyāḥ
Griffith: Who, holy, as their wont is, joy in glory that is free from guile.
Devanāgarī: ये अद्रोघमनुष्वधं श्रवो मदन्ति यज्ञियाः
pada pāṭha: pra | śyāva-aśva | dhr̥ṣṇu-yā | arca | marut-bhiḥ | r̥kva-bhiḥ || ye | adrogham | anu-svadham | śravaḥ | madanti | yajñiyāḥ ||5.52.1||

IAST: te hi sthirasya śavasaḥ sakhāyaḥ santi dhṛṣṇuyā
Griffith: For in their boldness they are friends of firm and sure heroic strength.
Devanāgarī: ते हि स्थिरस्य शवसः सखायः सन्ति धृष्णुया
pada pāṭha: te | hi | sthirasya | śavasaḥ | sakhāyaḥ | santi | dhr̥ṣṇu-yā || te | yāman | ā | dhr̥ṣat-vinaḥ | tmanā | pānti | śaśvataḥ ||5.52.2||

IAST: te yāmann ā dhṛṣadvinas tmanā pānti śaśvataḥ
Griffith: They in their course, bold-spirited, guard all men of their own accord.
Devanāgarī: ते यामन्ना धृषद्विनस्त्मना पान्ति शश्वतः
pada pāṭha: te | hi | sthirasya | śavasaḥ | sakhāyaḥ | santi | dhr̥ṣṇu-yā || te | yāman | ā | dhr̥ṣat-vinaḥ | tmanā | pānti | śaśvataḥ ||5.52.2||

IAST: te syandrāso nokṣaṇo 'ti ṣkandanti śarvarīḥ
Griffith: Like steers in rapid motion they advance and overtake the nights;
Devanāgarī: ते स्यन्द्रासो नोक्षणोऽति ष्कन्दन्ति शर्वरीः
pada pāṭha: te | spandrāsaḥ | na | ukṣaṇaḥ | ati | skandanti | śarvarīḥ || marutām | adha | mahaḥ | divi | kṣamā | ca | manmahe ||5.52.3||

IAST: marutām adhā maho divi kṣamā ca manmahe
Griffith: And thus the Maruts' power in heaven and on the earth we celebrate.
Devanāgarī: मरुतामधा महो दिवि क्षमा च मन्महे
pada pāṭha: te | spandrāsaḥ | na | ukṣaṇaḥ | ati | skandanti | śarvarīḥ || marutām | adha | mahaḥ | divi | kṣamā | ca | manmahe ||5.52.3||

IAST: marutsu vo dadhīmahi stomaṁ yajñaṁ ca dhṛṣṇuyā
Griffith: With boldness to your Maruts let us offer laud and sacrifice:
Devanāgarī: मरुत्सु वो दधीमहि स्तोमं यज्ञं च धृष्णुया
pada pāṭha: marut-su | vaḥ | dadhīmahi | stomam | yajñam | ca | dhr̥ṣṇu-yā || viśve | ye | mānuṣā | yugā | pānti | martyam | riṣaḥ ||5.52.4||

IAST: viśve ye mānuṣā yugā pānti martyaṁ riṣaḥ
Griffith: Who all, through ages of mankind, guard mortal man from injury.
Devanāgarī: विश्वे ये मानुषा युगा पान्ति मर्त्यं रिषः
pada pāṭha: marut-su | vaḥ | dadhīmahi | stomam | yajñam | ca | dhr̥ṣṇu-yā || viśve | ye | mānuṣā | yugā | pānti | martyam | riṣaḥ ||5.52.4||

IAST: arhanto ye sudānavo naro asāmiśavasaḥ
Griffith: Praiseworthy, givers of good gifts, Heroes with full and perfect strength -
Devanāgarī: अर्हन्तो ये सुदानवो नरो असामिशवसः
pada pāṭha: arhantaḥ | ye | su-dānavaḥ | naraḥ | asāmi-śavasaḥ || pra | yajñam | yajñiyebhyaḥ | divaḥ | arca | marut-bhyaḥ ||5.52.5||

IAST: pra yajñaṁ yajñiyebhyo divo arcā marudbhyaḥ
Griffith: To Maruts, Holy Ones of heaven, will I extol the sacrifice.
Devanāgarī: प्र यज्ञं यज्ञियेभ्यो दिवो अर्चा मरुद्भ्यः
pada pāṭha: arhantaḥ | ye | su-dānavaḥ | naraḥ | asāmi-śavasaḥ || pra | yajñam | yajñiyebhyaḥ | divaḥ | arca | marut-bhyaḥ ||5.52.5||

IAST: ā rukmair ā yudhā nara ṛṣvā ṛṣṭīr asṛkṣata
Griffith: The lofty Heroes cast their spears and weapons bright with gleaming gold.
Devanāgarī: आ रुक्मैरा युधा नर ऋष्वा ऋष्टीरसृक्षत
pada pāṭha: ā | rukmaiḥ | ā | yudhā | naraḥ | r̥ṣvāḥ | r̥ṣṭīḥ | asr̥kṣata || anu | enān | aha | vi-dyutaḥ | marutaḥ | jajjhatīḥ-iva | bhānuḥ | arta | tmanā | divaḥ ||5.52.6||

IAST: anv enām̐ aha vidyuto maruto jajjhatīr iva bhānur arta tmanā divaḥ
Griffith: After these Maruts followed close, like laughing lightning from the sky, a splendour of its own accord.
Devanāgarī: अन्वेनाँ अह विद्युतो मरुतो जज्झतीरिव भानुरर्त त्मना दिवः
pada pāṭha: ā | rukmaiḥ | ā | yudhā | naraḥ | r̥ṣvāḥ | r̥ṣṭīḥ | asr̥kṣata || anu | enān | aha | vi-dyutaḥ | marutaḥ | jajjhatīḥ-iva | bhānuḥ | arta | tmanā | divaḥ ||5.52.6||

IAST: ye vāvṛdhanta pārthivā ya urāv antarikṣa ā
Griffith: They who waxed mighty, of the earth, they who are in the wide mid-air,
Devanāgarī: ये वावृधन्त पार्थिवा य उरावन्तरिक्ष आ
pada pāṭha: ye | vavr̥dhanta | pārthivāḥ | ye | urau | antarikṣe | ā || vr̥jane | vā | nadīnām | sadha-sthe | vā | mahaḥ | divaḥ ||5.52.7||

IAST: vṛjane vā nadīnāṁ sadhasthe vā maho divaḥ
Griffith: Or in the rivers' compass, or in the abode of ample heaven.
Devanāgarī: वृजने वा नदीनां सधस्थे वा महो दिवः
pada pāṭha: ye | vavr̥dhanta | pārthivāḥ | ye | urau | antarikṣe | ā || vr̥jane | vā | nadīnām | sadha-sthe | vā | mahaḥ | divaḥ ||5.52.7||

IAST: śardho mārutam uc chaṁsa satyaśavasam ṛbhvasam
Griffith: Praise thou the Maruts' company, the valorous and truly strong,
Devanāgarī: शर्धो मारुतमुच्छंस सत्यशवसमृभ्वसम्
pada pāṭha: śardhaḥ | mārutam | ut | śaṁsa | satya-śavasam | r̥bhvasam || uta | sma | te | śubhe | naraḥ | pra | spandrāḥ | yujata | tmanā ||5.52.8||

IAST: uta sma te śubhe naraḥ pra syandrā yujata tmanā
Griffith: The Heroes, hasting, by themselves have yoked their deer for victory.
Devanāgarī: उत स्म ते शुभे नरः प्र स्यन्द्रा युजत त्मना
pada pāṭha: śardhaḥ | mārutam | ut | śaṁsa | satya-śavasam | r̥bhvasam || uta | sma | te | śubhe | naraḥ | pra | spandrāḥ | yujata | tmanā ||5.52.8||

IAST: uta sma te paruṣṇyām ūrṇā vasata śundhyavaḥ
Griffith: Fair-gleaming, on Parusni they have clothed themselves in robes of wool,
Devanāgarī: उत स्म ते परुष्ण्यामूर्णा वसत शुन्ध्यवः
pada pāṭha: uta | sma | te | paruṣṇyām | ūrṇāḥ | vasata | śundhyavaḥ || uta | pavyā | rathānām | adrim | bhindanti | ojasā ||5.52.9||

IAST: uta pavyā rathānām adrim bhindanty ojasā
Griffith: And with their chariot tires they cleave the rock asunder in their might.
Devanāgarī: उत पव्या रथानामद्रिं भिन्दन्त्योजसा
pada pāṭha: uta | sma | te | paruṣṇyām | ūrṇāḥ | vasata | śundhyavaḥ || uta | pavyā | rathānām | adrim | bhindanti | ojasā ||5.52.9||

IAST: āpathayo vipathayo 'ntaspathā anupathāḥ
Griffith: Whether as wanderers from the way or speeders on or to the path,
Devanāgarī: आपथयो विपथयोऽन्तस्पथा अनुपथाः
pada pāṭha: āpathayaḥ | vi-pathayaḥ | antaḥ-pathāḥ | anu-pathāḥ || etebhiḥ | mahyam | nāma-bhiḥ | yajñam | vi-stāraḥ | ohate ||5.52.10||

IAST: etebhir mahyaṁ nāmabhir yajñaṁ viṣṭāra ohate
Griffith: Under these names the spreading band tend well the sacrifice for me.
Devanāgarī: एतेभिर्मह्यं नामभिर्यज्ञं विष्टार ओहते
pada pāṭha: āpathayaḥ | vi-pathayaḥ | antaḥ-pathāḥ | anu-pathāḥ || etebhiḥ | mahyam | nāma-bhiḥ | yajñam | vi-stāraḥ | ohate ||5.52.10||

IAST: adhā naro ny ohate 'dhā niyuta ohate
Griffith: To this the Heroes well attend, well do their teams attend to this.
Devanāgarī: अधा नरो न्योहतेऽधा नियुत ओहते
pada pāṭha: adha | naraḥ | ni | ohate | adha | ni-yutaḥ | ohate || adha | pārāvatāḥ | iti | citrā | rūpāṇi | darśyā ||5.52.11||

IAST: adhā pārāvatā iti citrā rūpāṇi darśyā
Griffith: Visible are their varied forms. Behold, they are Paravatas.
Devanāgarī: अधा पारावता इति चित्रा रूपाणि दर्श्या
pada pāṭha: adha | naraḥ | ni | ohate | adha | ni-yutaḥ | ohate || adha | pārāvatāḥ | iti | citrā | rūpāṇi | darśyā ||5.52.11||

IAST: chandaḥstubhaḥ kubhanyava utsam ā kīriṇo nṛtuḥ
Griffith: Hymn-singing, seeking water, they, praising, have danced about the spring.
Devanāgarī: छन्दःस्तुभः कुभन्यव उत्समा कीरिणो नृतुः
pada pāṭha: chandaḥ-stubhaḥ | kubhanyavaḥ | utsam | ā | kīriṇaḥ | nr̥tuḥ || te | me | ke | cit | na | tāyavaḥ | ūmāḥ | āsan | dr̥śi | tviṣe ||5.52.12||

IAST: te me ke cin na tāyava ūmā āsan dṛśi tviṣe
Griffith: What are they unto me? No thieves, but helpers, splendid to behold.
Devanāgarī: ते मे के चिन्न तायव ऊमा आसन्दृशि त्विषे
pada pāṭha: chandaḥ-stubhaḥ | kubhanyavaḥ | utsam | ā | kīriṇaḥ | nr̥tuḥ || te | me | ke | cit | na | tāyavaḥ | ūmāḥ | āsan | dr̥śi | tviṣe ||5.52.12||

IAST: ya ṛṣvā ṛṣṭividyutaḥ kavayaḥ santi vedhasaḥ
Griffith: Sublime, with lightnings for their spears, Sages and Orderers are they.
Devanāgarī: य ऋष्वा ऋष्टिविद्युतः कवयः सन्ति वेधसः
pada pāṭha: ye | r̥ṣvāḥ | r̥ṣṭi-vidyutaḥ | kavayaḥ | santi | vedhasaḥ || tam | r̥ṣe | mārutam | gaṇam | namasya | ramaya | girā ||5.52.13||

IAST: tam ṛṣe mārutaṁ gaṇaṁ namasyā ramayā girā
Griffith: Rsi, adore that Marut host, and make them happy with thy song.
Devanāgarī: तमृषे मारुतं गणं नमस्या रमया गिरा
pada pāṭha: ye | r̥ṣvāḥ | r̥ṣṭi-vidyutaḥ | kavayaḥ | santi | vedhasaḥ || tam | r̥ṣe | mārutam | gaṇam | namasya | ramaya | girā ||5.52.13||

IAST: accha ṛṣe mārutaṁ gaṇaṁ dānā mitraṁ na yoṣaṇā
Griffith: Rsi, invite the Marut band with offerings, as a maid her friend.
Devanāgarī: अच्छ ऋषे मारुतं गणं दाना मित्रं न योषणा
pada pāṭha: accha | r̥ṣe | mārutam | gaṇam | dānā | mitram | na | yoṣaṇā || divaḥ | vā | dhr̥ṣṇavaḥ | ojasā | stutāḥ | dhībhiḥ | iṣaṇyata ||5.52.14||

IAST: divo vā dhṛṣṇava ojasā stutā dhībhir iṣaṇyata
Griffith: From heaven, too, Bold Ones, in your might haste hither glorified with songs.
Devanāgarī: दिवो वा धृष्णव ओजसा स्तुता धीभिरिषण्यत
pada pāṭha: accha | r̥ṣe | mārutam | gaṇam | dānā | mitram | na | yoṣaṇā || divaḥ | vā | dhr̥ṣṇavaḥ | ojasā | stutāḥ | dhībhiḥ | iṣaṇyata ||5.52.14||

IAST: nū manvāna eṣāṁ devām̐ acchā na vakṣaṇā
Griffith: Thinking of these now let him come, as with the escort of the Gods,
Devanāgarī: नू मन्वान एषां देवाँ अच्छा न वक्षणा
pada pāṭha: nu | manvānaḥ | eṣām | devān | accha | na | vakṣaṇā || dānā | saceta | sūri-bhiḥ | yāma-śrutebhiḥ | añji-bhiḥ ||5.52.15||

IAST: dānā saceta sūribhir yāmaśrutebhir añjibhiḥ
Griffith: And with the splendid Princes, famed for rapid courses, to the gifts.
Devanāgarī: दाना सचेत सूरिभिर्यामश्रुतेभिरञ्जिभिः
pada pāṭha: nu | manvānaḥ | eṣām | devān | accha | na | vakṣaṇā || dānā | saceta | sūri-bhiḥ | yāma-śrutebhiḥ | añji-bhiḥ ||5.52.15||

IAST: pra ye me bandhveṣe gāṁ vocanta sūrayaḥ pṛśniṁ vocanta mātaram
Griffith: Princes, who, when I asked their kin, named Prsni as their Mother-cow,
Devanāgarī: प्र ये मे बन्ध्वेषे गां वोचन्त सूरयः पृश्निं वोचन्त मातरम्
pada pāṭha: pra | ye | me | bandhu-eṣe | gām | vocanta | sūrayaḥ | pr̥śnim | vocanta | mātaram || adha | pitaram | iṣmiṇam | rudram | vocanta | śikvasaḥ ||5.52.16||

IAST: adhā pitaram iṣmiṇaṁ rudraṁ vocanta śikvasaḥ
Griffith: And the impetuous Rudra they, the Mighty Ones, declared their Sire.
Devanāgarī: अधा पितरमिष्मिणं रुद्रं वोचन्त शिक्वसः
pada pāṭha: pra | ye | me | bandhu-eṣe | gām | vocanta | sūrayaḥ | pr̥śnim | vocanta | mātaram || adha | pitaram | iṣmiṇam | rudram | vocanta | śikvasaḥ ||5.52.16||

IAST: sapta me sapta śākina ekam-ekā śatā daduḥ
Griffith: The mighty ones, the seven times seven, have singly given me hundred gifts.
Devanāgarī: सप्त मे सप्त शाकिन एकमेका शता ददुः
pada pāṭha: sapta | me | sapta | śākinaḥ | ekam-ekā | śatā | daduḥ || yamunāyām | adhi | śrutam | ut | rādhaḥ | gavyam | mr̥je | ni | rādhaḥ | aśvyam | mr̥je ||5.52.17||

IAST: yamunāyām adhi śrutam ud rādho gavyam mṛje ni rādho aśvyam mṛje
Griffith: I have obtained on Yamuna famed wealth in kine and wealth in steeds.
Devanāgarī: यमुनायामधि श्रुतमुद्राधो गव्यं मृजे नि राधो अश्व्यं मृजे
pada pāṭha: sapta | me | sapta | śākinaḥ | ekam-ekā | śatā | daduḥ || yamunāyām | adhi | śrutam | ut | rādhaḥ | gavyam | mr̥je | ni | rādhaḥ | aśvyam | mr̥je ||5.52.17||

IAST: ko veda jānam eṣāṁ ko vā purā sumneṣv āsa marutām
Griffith: Who knows the birth of these, or who lived in the Maruts' favour in the days of old
Devanāgarī: को वेद जानमेषां को वा पुरा सुम्नेष्वास मरुताम्
pada pāṭha: kaḥ | veda | jānam | eṣām | kaḥ | vā | purā | sumneṣu | āsa | marutām || yat | yuyujre | kilāsyaḥ ||5.53.1||

IAST: yad yuyujre kilāsyaḥ
Griffith: What time their spotted deer were yoked?
Devanāgarī: यद्युयुज्रे किलास्यः
pada pāṭha: kaḥ | veda | jānam | eṣām | kaḥ | vā | purā | sumneṣu | āsa | marutām || yat | yuyujre | kilāsyaḥ ||5.53.1||

IAST: aitān ratheṣu tasthuṣaḥ kaḥ śuśrāva kathā yayuḥ
Griffith: Who, when they stood upon their cars, hath heard them tell the way they went?
Devanāgarī: ऐतान्रथेषु तस्थुषः कः शुश्राव कथा ययुः
pada pāṭha: ā | etān | ratheṣu | tasthuṣaḥ | kaḥ | śuśrāva | kathā | yayuḥ || kasmai | sasruḥ | su-dāse | anu | āpayaḥ | iḷābhiḥ | vr̥ṣṭayaḥ | saha ||5.53.2||

IAST: kasmai sasruḥ sudāse anv āpaya iḻābhir vṛṣṭayaḥ saha
Griffith: Who was the bounteous man to whom their kindred rains flowed down with food of sacrifice?
Devanāgarī: कस्मै सस्रुः सुदासे अन्वापय इळाभिर्वृष्टयः सह
pada pāṭha: ā | etān | ratheṣu | tasthuṣaḥ | kaḥ | śuśrāva | kathā | yayuḥ || kasmai | sasruḥ | su-dāse | anu | āpayaḥ | iḷābhiḥ | vr̥ṣṭayaḥ | saha ||5.53.2||

IAST: te ma āhur ya āyayur upa dyubhir vibhir made
Griffith: To me they told it, and they came with winged steeds radiant to the draught,
Devanāgarī: ते म आहुर्य आययुरुप द्युभिर्विभिर्मदे
pada pāṭha: te | me | āhuḥ | ye | ā-yayuḥ | upa | dyu-bhiḥ | vi-bhiḥ | made || naraḥ | maryāḥ | arepasaḥ | imān | paśyan | iti | stuhi ||5.53.3||

IAST: naro maryā arepasa imān paśyann iti ṣṭuhi
Griffith: Youths, Heroes free from spot or stain: Behold us here and praise thou us;
Devanāgarī: नरो मर्या अरेपस इमान्पश्यन्निति ष्टुहि
pada pāṭha: te | me | āhuḥ | ye | ā-yayuḥ | upa | dyu-bhiḥ | vi-bhiḥ | made || naraḥ | maryāḥ | arepasaḥ | imān | paśyan | iti | stuhi ||5.53.3||

IAST: ye añjiṣu ye vāśīṣu svabhānavaḥ srakṣu rukmeṣu khādiṣu
Griffith: Who shine self-luminous with ornaments and swords, with breastplates, armlets, and with wreaths,
Devanāgarī: ये अञ्जिषु ये वाशीषु स्वभानवः स्रक्षु रुक्मेषु खादिषु
pada pāṭha: ye | añjiṣu | ye | vāśīṣu | sva-bhānavaḥ | srakṣu | rukmeṣu | khādiṣu || śrāyāḥ | ratheṣu | dhanva-su ||5.53.4||

IAST: śrāyā ratheṣu dhanvasu
Griffith: Arrayed on chariots and with bows.
Devanāgarī: श्राया रथेषु धन्वसु
pada pāṭha: ye | añjiṣu | ye | vāśīṣu | sva-bhānavaḥ | srakṣu | rukmeṣu | khādiṣu || śrāyāḥ | ratheṣu | dhanva-su ||5.53.4||

IAST: yuṣmākaṁ smā rathām̐ anu mude dadhe maruto jīradānavaḥ
Griffith: O swift to pour your bounties down, ye Maruts, with delight I look upon your cars,
Devanāgarī: युष्माकं स्मा रथाँ अनु मुदे दधे मरुतो जीरदानवः
pada pāṭha: yuṣmākam | sma | rathān | anu | mude | dadhe | marutaḥ | jīra-dānavaḥ || vr̥ṣṭī | dyāvaḥ | yatīḥ-iva ||5.53.5||

IAST: vṛṣṭī dyāvo yatīr iva
Griffith: Like splendours coming through the rain.
Devanāgarī: वृष्टी द्यावो यतीरिव
pada pāṭha: yuṣmākam | sma | rathān | anu | mude | dadhe | marutaḥ | jīra-dānavaḥ || vr̥ṣṭī | dyāvaḥ | yatīḥ-iva ||5.53.5||

IAST: ā yaṁ naraḥ sudānavo dadāśuṣe divaḥ kośam acucyavuḥ
Griffith: Munificent Heroes, they have cast heaven's treasury down for the worshipper's behoof:
Devanāgarī: आ यं नरः सुदानवो ददाशुषे दिवः कोशमचुच्यवुः
pada pāṭha: ā | yam | naraḥ | su-dānavaḥ | dadāśuṣe | divaḥ | kośam | acucyavuḥ || vi | parjanyam | sr̥janti | rodasī iti | anu | dhanvanā | yanti | vr̥ṣṭayaḥ ||5.53.6||

IAST: vi parjanyaṁ sṛjanti rodasī anu dhanvanā yanti vṛṣṭayaḥ
Griffith: They set the storm-cloud free tostream through both the worlds, and rainfloods flow o'er desert spots.
Devanāgarī: वि पर्जन्यं सृजन्ति रोदसी अनु धन्वना यन्ति वृष्टयः
pada pāṭha: ā | yam | naraḥ | su-dānavaḥ | dadāśuṣe | divaḥ | kośam | acucyavuḥ || vi | parjanyam | sr̥janti | rodasī iti | anu | dhanvanā | yanti | vr̥ṣṭayaḥ ||5.53.6||

IAST: tatṛdānāḥ sindhavaḥ kṣodasā rajaḥ pra sasrur dhenavo yathā
Griffith: The bursting streams m billowy flood have spread abroad, like milch-kine, o'er the firmament.
Devanāgarī: ततृदानाः सिन्धवः क्षोदसा रजः प्र सस्रुर्धेनवो यथा
pada pāṭha: tatr̥dānāḥ | sindhavaḥ | kṣodasā | rajaḥ | pra | sasruḥ | dhenavaḥ | yathā || syannāḥ | aśvāḥ-iva | adhvanaḥ | vi-mocane | vi | yat | vartante | enyaḥ ||5.53.7||

IAST: syannā aśvā ivādhvano vimocane vi yad vartanta enyaḥ
Griffith: Like swift steeds hasting to their journey's resting-place, to every side run glittering brooks.
Devanāgarī: स्यन्ना अश्वा इवाध्वनो विमोचने वि यद्वर्तन्त एन्यः
pada pāṭha: tatr̥dānāḥ | sindhavaḥ | kṣodasā | rajaḥ | pra | sasruḥ | dhenavaḥ | yathā || syannāḥ | aśvāḥ-iva | adhvanaḥ | vi-mocane | vi | yat | vartante | enyaḥ ||5.53.7||

IAST: ā yāta maruto diva āntarikṣād amād uta
Griffith: Hither, O Maruts, come from heaven, from mid-air, or from near at hand
Devanāgarī: आ यात मरुतो दिव आन्तरिक्षादमादुत
pada pāṭha: ā | yāta | marutaḥ | divaḥ | ā | antarikṣāt | amāt | uta || mā | ava | sthāta | parā-vataḥ ||5.53.8||

IAST: māva sthāta parāvataḥ
Griffith: Tarry not far away from us.
Devanāgarī: माव स्थात परावतः
pada pāṭha: ā | yāta | marutaḥ | divaḥ | ā | antarikṣāt | amāt | uta || mā | ava | sthāta | parā-vataḥ ||5.53.8||

IAST: mā vo rasānitabhā kubhā krumur mā vaḥ sindhur ni rīramat
Griffith: So let not Rasa, Krumu, or Anitabha, Kubha, or Sindhu hold you back.
Devanāgarī: मा वो रसानितभा कुभा क्रुमुर्मा वः सिन्धुर्नि रीरमत्
pada pāṭha: mā | vaḥ | rasā | anitabhā | kubhā | krumuḥ | mā | vaḥ | sindhuḥ | ni | rīramat || mā | vaḥ | pari | sthāt | sarayuḥ | purīṣiṇī | asme iti | it | sumnam | astu | vaḥ ||5.53.9||

IAST: mā vaḥ pari ṣṭhāt sarayuḥ purīṣiṇy asme it sumnam astu vaḥ
Griffith: Let not the watery Sarayti obstruct your way. With us be all the bliss ye give.
Devanāgarī: मा वः परि ष्ठात्सरयुः पुरीषिण्यस्मे इत्सुम्नमस्तु वः
pada pāṭha: mā | vaḥ | rasā | anitabhā | kubhā | krumuḥ | mā | vaḥ | sindhuḥ | ni | rīramat || mā | vaḥ | pari | sthāt | sarayuḥ | purīṣiṇī | asme iti | it | sumnam | astu | vaḥ ||5.53.9||

IAST: taṁ vaḥ śardhaṁ rathānāṁ tveṣaṁ gaṇam mārutaṁ navyasīnām
Griffith: That brilliant gathering of your cars, the company of Maruts, of the Youthful Ones,
Devanāgarī: तं वः शर्धं रथानां त्वेषं गणं मारुतं नव्यसीनाम्
pada pāṭha: tam | vaḥ | śardham | rathānām | tveṣam | gaṇam | mārutam | navyasīnām || anu | pra | yanti | vr̥ṣṭayaḥ ||5.53.10||

IAST: anu pra yanti vṛṣṭayaḥ
Griffith: The rain-showers, speeding on, attend.
Devanāgarī: अनु प्र यन्ति वृष्टयः
pada pāṭha: tam | vaḥ | śardham | rathānām | tveṣam | gaṇam | mārutam | navyasīnām || anu | pra | yanti | vr̥ṣṭayaḥ ||5.53.10||

IAST: śardhaṁ-śardhaṁ va eṣāṁ vrātaṁ-vrātaṁ gaṇaṁ-gaṇaṁ suśastibhiḥ
Griffith: With eulogies and hymns may we follow your army, troop by troop, and band by band,
Devanāgarī: शर्धंशर्धं व एषां व्रातंव्रातं गणंगणं सुशस्तिभिः
pada pāṭha: śardham-śardham | vaḥ | eṣām | vrātam-vrātam | gaṇam-gaṇam | suśasti-bhiḥ || anu | krāmema | dhīti-bhiḥ ||5.53.11||

IAST: anu krāmema dhītibhiḥ
Griffith: And company by company.
Devanāgarī: अनु क्रामेम धीतिभिः
pada pāṭha: śardham-śardham | vaḥ | eṣām | vrātam-vrātam | gaṇam-gaṇam | suśasti-bhiḥ || anu | krāmema | dhīti-bhiḥ ||5.53.11||

IAST: kasmā adya sujātāya rātahavyāya pra yayuḥ
Griffith: To what oblation-giver, sprung of noble ancestry, have sped
Devanāgarī: कस्मा अद्य सुजाताय रातहव्याय प्र ययुः
pada pāṭha: kasmai | adya | su-jātāya | rāta-havyāya | pra | yayuḥ || enā | yāmena | marutaḥ ||5.53.12||

IAST: enā yāmena marutaḥ
Griffith: The Maruts on this course to-day?
Devanāgarī: एना यामेन मरुतः
pada pāṭha: kasmai | adya | su-jātāya | rāta-havyāya | pra | yayuḥ || enā | yāmena | marutaḥ ||5.53.12||

IAST: yena tokāya tanayāya dhānyam bījaṁ vahadhve akṣitam
Griffith: Vouchsafe to us the bounty, that which we implore, through which, for child and progeny,
Devanāgarī: येन तोकाय तनयाय धान्यं बीजं वहध्वे अक्षितम्
pada pāṭha: yena | tokāya | tanayāya | dhānyam | bījam | vahadhve | akṣitam || asmabhyam | tat | dhattana | yat | vaḥ | īmahe | rādhaḥ | viśva-āyu | saubhagam ||5.53.13||

IAST: asmabhyaṁ tad dhattana yad va īmahe rādho viśvāyu saubhagam
Griffith: Ye give the seed of corn that wasteth not away, and bliss that reacheth to all life.
Devanāgarī: अस्मभ्यं तद्धत्तन यद्व ईमहे राधो विश्वायु सौभगम्
pada pāṭha: yena | tokāya | tanayāya | dhānyam | bījam | vahadhve | akṣitam || asmabhyam | tat | dhattana | yat | vaḥ | īmahe | rādhaḥ | viśva-āyu | saubhagam ||5.53.13||

IAST: atīyāma nidas tiraḥ svastibhir hitvāvadyam arātīḥ
Griffith: May we in safety pass by those who slander us, leaving behind disgrace and hate.
Devanāgarī: अतीयाम निदस्तिरः स्वस्तिभिर्हित्वावद्यमरातीः
pada pāṭha: ati | iyāma | nidaḥ | tiraḥ | svasti-bhiḥ | hitvā | avadyam | arātīḥ || vr̥ṣṭvī | sam | yoḥ | āpaḥ | usri | bheṣajam | syāma | marutaḥ | saha ||5.53.14||

IAST: vṛṣṭvī śaṁ yor āpa usri bheṣajaṁ syāma marutaḥ saha
Griffith: Maruts, may we be there when ye, at dawn, in rest and toil, rain waters down and balm.
Devanāgarī: वृष्ट्वी शं योराप उस्रि भेषजं स्याम मरुतः सह
pada pāṭha: ati | iyāma | nidaḥ | tiraḥ | svasti-bhiḥ | hitvā | avadyam | arātīḥ || vr̥ṣṭvī | sam | yoḥ | āpaḥ | usri | bheṣajam | syāma | marutaḥ | saha ||5.53.14||

IAST: sudevaḥ samahāsati suvīro naro marutaḥ sa martyaḥ
Griffith: Favoured by Gods shall he the man, O Heroes, Marutr! and possessed of noble sons,
Devanāgarī: सुदेवः समहासति सुवीरो नरो मरुतः स मर्त्यः
pada pāṭha: su-devaḥ | samaha | asati | su-vīraḥ | naraḥ | marutaḥ | saḥ | martyaḥ || yam | trāyadhve | syāma | te ||5.53.15||

IAST: yaṁ trāyadhve syāma te
Griffith: Whom ye protect. Such may we be.
Devanāgarī: यं त्रायध्वे स्याम ते
pada pāṭha: su-devaḥ | samaha | asati | su-vīraḥ | naraḥ | marutaḥ | saḥ | martyaḥ || yam | trāyadhve | syāma | te ||5.53.15||

IAST: stuhi bhojān stuvato asya yāmani raṇan gāvo na yavase
Griffith: Praise the Free-givers. At this liberal patron's rite they joy like cattle in the mead.
Devanāgarī: स्तुहि भोजान्स्तुवतो अस्य यामनि रणन्गावो न यवसे
pada pāṭha: stuhi | bhojān | stuvataḥ | asya | yāmani | raṇan | gāvaḥ | na | yavase || yataḥ | pūrvān-iva | sakhīn | anu | hvaya | girā | gr̥ṇīhi | kāminaḥ ||5.53.16||

IAST: yataḥ pūrvām̐ iva sakhīm̐r anu hvaya girā gṛṇīhi kāminaḥ
Griffith: So call thou unto them who come as ancient Friends: hymn those who love thee with a song.
Devanāgarī: यतः पूर्वाँ इव सखीँरनु ह्वय गिरा गृणीहि कामिनः
pada pāṭha: stuhi | bhojān | stuvataḥ | asya | yāmani | raṇan | gāvaḥ | na | yavase || yataḥ | pūrvān-iva | sakhīn | anu | hvaya | girā | gr̥ṇīhi | kāminaḥ ||5.53.16||

IAST: pra śardhāya mārutāya svabhānava imāṁ vācam anajā parvatacyute
Griffith: THIS hymn will I make for the Marut host who bright in native splendour cast the mountains down.
Devanāgarī: प्र शर्धाय मारुताय स्वभानव इमां वाचमनजा पर्वतच्युते
pada pāṭha: pra | śardhāya | mārutāya | sva-bhānave | imām | vācam | anaja | parvata-cyute || gharma-stubhe | divaḥ | ā | pr̥ṣṭha-yajvane | dyumna-śravase | mahi | nr̥mṇam | arcata ||5.54.1||

IAST: gharmastubhe diva ā pṛṣṭhayajvane dyumnaśravase mahi nṛmṇam arcata
Griffith: Sing the great strength of those illustrious in renown, who stay the heat, who sacrifice on heights of
Devanāgarī: घर्मस्तुभे दिव आ पृष्ठयज्वने द्युम्नश्रवसे महि नृम्णमर्चत
pada pāṭha: pra | śardhāya | mārutāya | sva-bhānave | imām | vācam | anaja | parvata-cyute || gharma-stubhe | divaḥ | ā | pr̥ṣṭha-yajvane | dyumna-śravase | mahi | nr̥mṇam | arcata ||5.54.1||

IAST: pra vo marutas taviṣā udanyavo vayovṛdho aśvayujaḥ parijrayaḥ
Griffith: O Maruts, rich in water, strengtheners of life are your strong bands with harnessed steeds, that wander fa
Devanāgarī: प्र वो मरुतस्तविषा उदन्यवो वयोवृधो अश्वयुजः परिज्रयः
pada pāṭha: pra | vaḥ | marutaḥ | taviṣāḥ | udanyavaḥ | vayaḥ-vr̥dhaḥ | aśva-yujaḥ | pari-jrayaḥ || sam | vi-dyutā | dadhati | vāśati | tritaḥ | svaranti | āpaḥ | avanā | pari-jrayaḥ ||5.54.2||

IAST: saṁ vidyutā dadhati vāśati tritaḥ svaranty āpo 'vanā parijrayaḥ
Griffith: Trita roars out at him who aims the lightning-flash. The waters sweeping round are thundering on their w
Devanāgarī: सं विद्युता दधति वाशति त्रितः स्वरन्त्यापोऽवना परिज्रयः
pada pāṭha: pra | vaḥ | marutaḥ | taviṣāḥ | udanyavaḥ | vayaḥ-vr̥dhaḥ | aśva-yujaḥ | pari-jrayaḥ || sam | vi-dyutā | dadhati | vāśati | tritaḥ | svaranti | āpaḥ | avanā | pari-jrayaḥ ||5.54.2||

IAST: vidyunmahaso naro aśmadidyavo vātatviṣo marutaḥ parvatacyutaḥ
Griffith: They gleam with lightning, Heroes, Casters of the Stone, wind-rapid Maruts, overthrowers of the bills,
Devanāgarī: विद्युन्महसो नरो अश्मदिद्यवो वातत्विषो मरुतः पर्वतच्युतः
pada pāṭha: vidyut-mahasaḥ | naraḥ | aśma-didyavaḥ | vāta-tviṣaḥ | marutaḥ | parvata-cyutaḥ || abda-yā | cit | muhuḥ | ā | hrāduni-vr̥taḥ | stanayat-amāḥ | rabhasāḥ | ut-ojasaḥ ||5.54.3||

IAST: abdayā cin muhur ā hrādunīvṛtaḥ stanayadamā rabhasā udojasaḥ
Griffith: Oft through desire to rain coming with storm of hail, roaring in onset, violent and exceeding strong.
Devanāgarī: अब्दया चिन्मुहुरा ह्रादुनीवृतः स्तनयदमा रभसा उदोजसः
pada pāṭha: vidyut-mahasaḥ | naraḥ | aśma-didyavaḥ | vāta-tviṣaḥ | marutaḥ | parvata-cyutaḥ || abda-yā | cit | muhuḥ | ā | hrāduni-vr̥taḥ | stanayat-amāḥ | rabhasāḥ | ut-ojasaḥ ||5.54.3||

IAST: vy aktūn rudrā vy ahāni śikvaso vy antarikṣaṁ vi rajāṁsi dhūtayaḥ
Griffith: When, mighty Rudras, through the nights and through the days, when through the sky and realms of air, sha
Devanāgarī: व्यक्तून्रुद्रा व्यहानि शिक्वसो व्यन्तरिक्षं वि रजांसि धूतयः
pada pāṭha: vi | aktūn | rudrāḥ | vi | ahāni | śikvasaḥ | vi | antarikṣam | vi | rajāṁsi | dhūtayaḥ || vi | yat | ajrān | ajatha | nāvaḥ | īm | yathā | vi | duḥ-gāni | marutaḥ | na | aha | riṣyatha ||5.54.4||

IAST: vi yad ajrām̐ ajatha nāva īṁ yathā vi durgāṇi maruto nāha riṣyatha
Griffith: When over the broad fields ye drive along like ships, e'en to strongholds ye come, Maruts, but are not
Devanāgarī: वि यदज्राँ अजथ नाव ईं यथा वि दुर्गाणि मरुतो नाह रिष्यथ
pada pāṭha: vi | aktūn | rudrāḥ | vi | ahāni | śikvasaḥ | vi | antarikṣam | vi | rajāṁsi | dhūtayaḥ || vi | yat | ajrān | ajatha | nāvaḥ | īm | yathā | vi | duḥ-gāni | marutaḥ | na | aha | riṣyatha ||5.54.4||

IAST: tad vīryaṁ vo maruto mahitvanaṁ dīrghaṁ tatāna sūryo na yojanam
Griffith: Maruts, this hero strength and majesty of yours hath, like the Sun, extended o'er a lengthened way,
Devanāgarī: तद्वीर्यं वो मरुतो महित्वनं दीर्घं ततान सूर्यो न योजनम्
pada pāṭha: tat | vīryam | vaḥ | marutaḥ | mahi-tvanam | dīrgham | tatāna | sūryaḥ | na | yojanam || etāḥ | na | yāme | agr̥bhīta-śociṣaḥ | anaśva-dām | yat | ni | ayātana | girim ||5.54.5||

IAST: etā na yāme agṛbhītaśociṣo 'naśvadāṁ yan ny ayātanā girim
Griffith: When in your course like deer with splendour unsubdued ye bowed the hill that gives imperishable rain.
Devanāgarī: एता न यामे अगृभीतशोचिषोऽनश्वदां यन्न्ययातना गिरिम्
pada pāṭha: tat | vīryam | vaḥ | marutaḥ | mahi-tvanam | dīrgham | tatāna | sūryaḥ | na | yojanam || etāḥ | na | yāme | agr̥bhīta-śociṣaḥ | anaśva-dām | yat | ni | ayātana | girim ||5.54.5||

IAST: abhrāji śardho maruto yad arṇasam moṣathā vṛkṣaṁ kapaneva vedhasaḥ
Griffith: Bright shone your host, ye Sages, Maruts, when ye smote the waving tree as when the worm consumeth it.
Devanāgarī: अभ्राजि शर्धो मरुतो यदर्णसं मोषथा वृक्षं कपनेव वेधसः
pada pāṭha: abhrāji | śardhaḥ | marutaḥ | yat | arṇasam | moṣatha | vr̥kṣam | kapanā-iva | vedhasaḥ || adha | sma | naḥ | aramatim | sa-joṣasaḥ | cakṣuḥ-iva | yantam | anu | neṣatha | su-gam ||5.54.6||

IAST: adha smā no aramatiṁ sajoṣasaś cakṣur iva yantam anu neṣathā sugam
Griffith: Accordant, as the eye guides him who walks, have ye led our devotion onward by an easy path.
Devanāgarī: अध स्मा नो अरमतिं सजोषसश्चक्षुरिव यन्तमनु नेषथा सुगम्
pada pāṭha: abhrāji | śardhaḥ | marutaḥ | yat | arṇasam | moṣatha | vr̥kṣam | kapanā-iva | vedhasaḥ || adha | sma | naḥ | aramatim | sa-joṣasaḥ | cakṣuḥ-iva | yantam | anu | neṣatha | su-gam ||5.54.6||

IAST: na sa jīyate maruto na hanyate na sredhati na vyathate na riṣyati
Griffith: Never is he, O Maruts, slain or overcome, never doth he decay ne'er is distressed or harmed;
Devanāgarī: न स जीयते मरुतो न हन्यते न स्रेधति न व्यथते न रिष्यति
pada pāṭha: na | saḥ | jīyate | marutaḥ | na | hanyate | na | sredhati | na | vyathate | na | riṣyati || na | asya | rāyaḥ | upa | dasyanti | na | ūtayaḥ | r̥ṣim | vā | yam | rājānam | vā | susūdatha ||5.54.7||

IAST: nāsya rāya upa dasyanti notaya ṛṣiṁ vā yaṁ rājānaṁ vā suṣūdatha
Griffith: His treasures, his resources, never waste away, whom. whether he be prince or Rsi, ye direct.
Devanāgarī: नास्य राय उप दस्यन्ति नोतय ऋषिं वा यं राजानं वा सुषूदथ
pada pāṭha: na | saḥ | jīyate | marutaḥ | na | hanyate | na | sredhati | na | vyathate | na | riṣyati || na | asya | rāyaḥ | upa | dasyanti | na | ūtayaḥ | r̥ṣim | vā | yam | rājānam | vā | susūdatha ||5.54.7||

IAST: niyutvanto grāmajito yathā naro 'ryamaṇo na marutaḥ kabandhinaḥ
Griffith: With harnessed team like heroes overcoming troops, the friendly Maruts, laden with their water-casks,
Devanāgarī: नियुत्वन्तो ग्रामजितो यथा नरोऽर्यमणो न मरुतः कबन्धिनः
pada pāṭha: niyutvantaḥ | grāma-jitaḥ | yathā | naraḥ | aryamaṇaḥ | na | marutaḥ | kavandhinaḥ || pinvanti | utsam | yat | ināsaḥ | asvaran | vi | undanti | pr̥thivīm | madhvaḥ | andhasā ||5.54.8||

IAST: pinvanty utsaṁ yad ināso asvaran vy undanti pṛthivīm madhvo andhasā
Griffith: Let the spring flow, and when impetuous' they roar they inundate the earth with floods of pleasant meat
Devanāgarī: पिन्वन्त्युत्सं यदिनासो अस्वरन्व्युन्दन्ति पृथिवीं मध्वो अन्धसा
pada pāṭha: niyutvantaḥ | grāma-jitaḥ | yathā | naraḥ | aryamaṇaḥ | na | marutaḥ | kavandhinaḥ || pinvanti | utsam | yat | ināsaḥ | asvaran | vi | undanti | pr̥thivīm | madhvaḥ | andhasā ||5.54.8||

IAST: pravatvatīyam pṛthivī marudbhyaḥ pravatvatī dyaur bhavati prayadbhyaḥ
Griffith: Free for the Maruts is the earth with sloping ways, free for the rushing Ones is heaven with steep descen
Devanāgarī: प्रवत्वतीयं पृथिवी मरुद्भ्यः प्रवत्वती द्यौर्भवति प्रयद्भ्यः
pada pāṭha: pravatvatī | iyam | pr̥thivī | marut-bhyaḥ | pravatvatī | dyauḥ | bhavati | prayat-bhyaḥ || pravatvatīḥ | pathyāḥ | antarikṣyāḥ | pravatvantaḥ | parvatāḥ | jīra-dānavaḥ ||5.54.9||

IAST: pravatvatīḥ pathyā antarikṣyāḥ pravatvantaḥ parvatā jīradānavaḥ
Griffith: The paths of air's mid-region are precipitous, precipitous the mountains with their running streams.
Devanāgarī: प्रवत्वतीः पथ्या अन्तरिक्ष्याः प्रवत्वन्तः पर्वता जीरदानवः
pada pāṭha: pravatvatī | iyam | pr̥thivī | marut-bhyaḥ | pravatvatī | dyauḥ | bhavati | prayat-bhyaḥ || pravatvatīḥ | pathyāḥ | antarikṣyāḥ | pravatvantaḥ | parvatāḥ | jīra-dānavaḥ ||5.54.9||

IAST: yan marutaḥ sabharasaḥ svarṇaraḥ sūrya udite madathā divo naraḥ
Griffith: When, as the Sun hath risen up, ye take delight, O bounteous radiant Maruts, Heroes of the sky,
Devanāgarī: यन्मरुतः सभरसः स्वर्णरः सूर्य उदिते मदथा दिवो नरः
pada pāṭha: yat | marutaḥ | sa-bharasaḥ | svaḥ-naraḥ | sūrye | ut-ite | madatha | divaḥ | naraḥ || na | vaḥ | aśvāḥ | śrathayanta | aha | sisrataḥ | sadyaḥ | asya | adhvanaḥ | pāram | aśnutha ||5.54.10||

IAST: na vo 'śvāḥ śrathayantāha sisrataḥ sadyo asyādhvanaḥ pāram aśnutha
Griffith: Your coursers weary not when speeding on.their way, and rapidly ye reach the end of this your path.
Devanāgarī: न वोऽश्वाः श्रथयन्ताह सिस्रतः सद्यो अस्याध्वनः पारमश्नुथ
pada pāṭha: yat | marutaḥ | sa-bharasaḥ | svaḥ-naraḥ | sūrye | ut-ite | madatha | divaḥ | naraḥ || na | vaḥ | aśvāḥ | śrathayanta | aha | sisrataḥ | sadyaḥ | asya | adhvanaḥ | pāram | aśnutha ||5.54.10||

IAST: aṁseṣu va ṛṣṭayaḥ patsu khādayo vakṣaḥsu rukmā maruto rathe śubhaḥ
Griffith: Lances are on your shoulders, anklets on your feet, gold chains are on your breasts, gems, Maruts, on yo
Devanāgarī: अंसेषु व ऋष्टयः पत्सु खादयो वक्षस्सु रुक्मा मरुतो रथे शुभः
pada pāṭha: aṁseṣu | vaḥ | r̥ṣṭayaḥ | pat-su | khādayaḥ | vakṣaḥ-su | rukmāḥ | marutaḥ | rathe | śubhaḥ || agni-bhrājasaḥ | vi-dyutaḥ | gabhastyoḥ | śiprāḥ | śīrṣa-su | vi-tatāḥ | hiraṇyayīḥ ||5.54.11||

IAST: agnibhrājaso vidyuto gabhastyoḥ śiprāḥ śīrṣasu vitatā hiraṇyayīḥ
Griffith: Lightnings aglow with flame are flashing in your hands, and visors wroughtof gold are laid upon your hea
Devanāgarī: अग्निभ्राजसो विद्युतो गभस्त्योः शिप्राः शीर्षसु वितता हिरण्ययीः
pada pāṭha: aṁseṣu | vaḥ | r̥ṣṭayaḥ | pat-su | khādayaḥ | vakṣaḥ-su | rukmāḥ | marutaḥ | rathe | śubhaḥ || agni-bhrājasaḥ | vi-dyutaḥ | gabhastyoḥ | śiprāḥ | śīrṣa-su | vi-tatāḥ | hiraṇyayīḥ ||5.54.11||

IAST: taṁ nākam aryo agṛbhītaśociṣaṁ ruśat pippalam maruto vi dhūnutha
Griffith: Maruts, in eager stir ye shake the vault of heaven, splendid beyond conception, for its shining fruit.
Devanāgarī: तं नाकमर्यो अगृभीतशोचिषं रुशत्पिप्पलं मरुतो वि धूनुथ
pada pāṭha: tam | nākam | aryaḥ | agr̥bhīta-śociṣam | ruśat | pippalam | marutaḥ | vi | dhūnutha || sam | acyanta | vr̥janā | atitviṣanta | yat | svaranti | ghoṣam | vi-tatam | r̥ta-yavaḥ ||5.54.12||

IAST: sam acyanta vṛjanātitviṣanta yat svaranti ghoṣaṁ vitatam ṛtāyavaḥ
Griffith: They gathered when they let their deeds of might flash forth. The Pious Ones send forth a far-resounding
Devanāgarī: समच्यन्त वृजनातित्विषन्त यत्स्वरन्ति घोषं विततमृतायवः
pada pāṭha: tam | nākam | aryaḥ | agr̥bhīta-śociṣam | ruśat | pippalam | marutaḥ | vi | dhūnutha || sam | acyanta | vr̥janā | atitviṣanta | yat | svaranti | ghoṣam | vi-tatam | r̥ta-yavaḥ ||5.54.12||

IAST: yuṣmādattasya maruto vicetaso rāyaḥ syāma rathyo vayasvataḥ
Griffith: Sage Maruts, may we be the drivers of the car of riches ful I of life that have been given by you.
Devanāgarī: युष्मादत्तस्य मरुतो विचेतसो रायः स्याम रथ्यो वयस्वतः
pada pāṭha: yuṣmā-dattasya | marutaḥ | vi-cetasaḥ | rāyaḥ | syāma | rathyaḥ | vayasvataḥ || na | yaḥ | yucchati | tiṣyaḥ | yathā | divaḥ | asme iti | raranta | marutaḥ | sahasriṇam ||5.54.13||

IAST: na yo yucchati tiṣyo yathā divo 'sme rāranta marutaḥ sahasriṇam
Griffith: O Maruts, let that wealth in thousands dwell with us which never vanishes like Tisya from the sky.
Devanāgarī: न यो युच्छति तिष्यो यथा दिवोऽस्मे रारन्त मरुतः सहस्रिणम्
pada pāṭha: yuṣmā-dattasya | marutaḥ | vi-cetasaḥ | rāyaḥ | syāma | rathyaḥ | vayasvataḥ || na | yaḥ | yucchati | tiṣyaḥ | yathā | divaḥ | asme iti | raranta | marutaḥ | sahasriṇam ||5.54.13||

IAST: yūyaṁ rayim marutaḥ spārhavīraṁ yūyam ṛṣim avatha sāmavipram
Griffith: Maruts, ye further wealth with longedfor heroes, further the Rsi skilled in chanted verses.
Devanāgarī: यूयं रयिं मरुतः स्पार्हवीरं यूयमृषिमवथ सामविप्रम्
pada pāṭha: yūyam | rayim | marutaḥ | spārha-vīram | yūyam | r̥ṣim | avatha | sāma-vipram || yūyam | arvantam | bharatāya | vājam | yūyam | dhattha | rājānam | śruṣṭi-mantam ||5.54.14||

IAST: yūyam arvantam bharatāya vājaṁ yūyaṁ dhattha rājānaṁ śruṣṭimantam
Griffith: Ye give the Bharata as his strength, a charger, and ye bestow a king who quickly listens.
Devanāgarī: यूयमर्वन्तं भरताय वाजं यूयं धत्थ राजानं श्रुष्टिमन्तम्
pada pāṭha: yūyam | rayim | marutaḥ | spārha-vīram | yūyam | r̥ṣim | avatha | sāma-vipram || yūyam | arvantam | bharatāya | vājam | yūyam | dhattha | rājānam | śruṣṭi-mantam ||5.54.14||

IAST: tad vo yāmi draviṇaṁ sadyaūtayo yenā svar ṇa tatanāma nṝm̐r abhi
Griffith: Of you, most swift to succour! I solicit wealth wherewith we may spread forth mid men like as the Sun.
Devanāgarī: तद्वो यामि द्रविणं सद्यऊतयो येना स्वर्ण ततनाम नॄँरभि
pada pāṭha: tat | vaḥ | yāmi | draviṇam | sadyaḥ-ūtayaḥ | yena | svaḥ | na | tatanāma | nr̥̄n | abhi || idam | su | me | marutaḥ | haryata | vacaḥ | yasya | tarema | tarasā | śatam | himāḥ ||5.54.15||

IAST: idaṁ su me maruto haryatā vaco yasya tarema tarasā śataṁ himāḥ
Griffith: Accept, O Maruts, graciously this hymn of mine that we may live a hundred winters through its power.
Devanāgarī: इदं सु मे मरुतो हर्यता वचो यस्य तरेम तरसा शतं हिमाः
pada pāṭha: tat | vaḥ | yāmi | draviṇam | sadyaḥ-ūtayaḥ | yena | svaḥ | na | tatanāma | nr̥̄n | abhi || idam | su | me | marutaḥ | haryata | vacaḥ | yasya | tarema | tarasā | śatam | himāḥ ||5.54.15||

IAST: prayajyavo maruto bhrājadṛṣṭayo bṛhad vayo dadhire rukmavakṣasaḥ
Griffith: WITH gleaming lances, with their breasts adorned with gold, the Maruts, rushing onward, hold high power of
Devanāgarī: प्रयज्यवो मरुतो भ्राजदृष्टयो बृहद्वयो दधिरे रुक्मवक्षसः
pada pāṭha: pra-yajyavaḥ | marutaḥ | bhrājat-r̥ṣṭayaḥ | br̥hat | vayaḥ | dadhire | rukma-vakṣasaḥ || īyante | aśvaiḥ | su-yamebhiḥ | āśu-bhiḥ | śubham | yātām | anu | rathāḥ | avr̥tsata ||5.55.1||

IAST: īyante aśvaiḥ suyamebhir āśubhiḥ śubhaṁ yātām anu rathā avṛtsata
Griffith: They hasten with swift steeds easy to be controlled. Their cars moved onward as they went to victory.
Devanāgarī: ईयन्ते अश्वैः सुयमेभिराशुभिः शुभं यातामनु रथा अवृत्सत
pada pāṭha: pra-yajyavaḥ | marutaḥ | bhrājat-r̥ṣṭayaḥ | br̥hat | vayaḥ | dadhire | rukma-vakṣasaḥ || īyante | aśvaiḥ | su-yamebhiḥ | āśu-bhiḥ | śubham | yātām | anu | rathāḥ | avr̥tsata ||5.55.1||

IAST: svayaṁ dadhidhve taviṣīṁ yathā vida bṛhan mahānta urviyā vi rājatha
Griffith: Ye, as ye wist, have gained of your own selves your power: high, O ye Mighty Ones, and wide ye shine abroa
Devanāgarī: स्वयं दधिध्वे तविषीं यथा विद बृहन्महान्त उर्विया वि राजथ
pada pāṭha: svayam | dadhidhve | taviṣīm | yathā | vida | br̥hat | mahāntaḥ | urviyā | vi | rājatha || uta | antarikṣam | mamire | vi | ojasā | śubham | yātām | anu | rathāḥ | avr̥tsata ||5.55.2||

IAST: utāntarikṣam mamire vy ojasā śubhaṁ yātām anu rathā avṛtsata
Griffith: They with their strength have even measured out the sky. Their cars moved onward as they went to victory.
Devanāgarī: उतान्तरिक्षं ममिरे व्योजसा शुभं यातामनु रथा अवृत्सत
pada pāṭha: svayam | dadhidhve | taviṣīm | yathā | vida | br̥hat | mahāntaḥ | urviyā | vi | rājatha || uta | antarikṣam | mamire | vi | ojasā | śubham | yātām | anu | rathāḥ | avr̥tsata ||5.55.2||

IAST: sākaṁ jātāḥ subhvaḥ sākam ukṣitāḥ śriye cid ā prataraṁ vāvṛdhur naraḥ
Griffith: Strong, born together, they together have waxed great: the Heroes more and more have grown to majesty
Devanāgarī: साकं जाताः सुभ्वः साकमुक्षिताः श्रिये चिदा प्रतरं वावृधुर्नरः
pada pāṭha: sākam | jātāḥ | su-bhvaḥ | sākam | ukṣitāḥ | śriye | cit | ā | pra-taram | vavr̥dhuḥ | naraḥ || vi-rokiṇaḥ | sūryasya-iva | raśmayaḥ | śubham | yātām | anu | rathāḥ | avr̥tsata ||5.55.3||

IAST: virokiṇaḥ sūryasyeva raśmayaḥ śubhaṁ yātām anu rathā avṛtsata
Griffith: Resplendent as the Sun's beams in their light are they. Their cars moved onward as they went to victory
Devanāgarī: विरोकिणः सूर्यस्येव रश्मयः शुभं यातामनु रथा अवृत्सत
pada pāṭha: sākam | jātāḥ | su-bhvaḥ | sākam | ukṣitāḥ | śriye | cit | ā | pra-taram | vavr̥dhuḥ | naraḥ || vi-rokiṇaḥ | sūryasya-iva | raśmayaḥ | śubham | yātām | anu | rathāḥ | avr̥tsata ||5.55.3||

IAST: ābhūṣeṇyaṁ vo maruto mahitvanaṁ didṛkṣeṇyaṁ sūryasyeva cakṣaṇam
Griffith: Maruts, your mightiness deserves to be adored, sight to be longed for like the shining of the Sun.
Devanāgarī: आभूषेण्यं वो मरुतो महित्वनं दिदृक्षेण्यं सूर्यस्येव चक्षणम्
pada pāṭha: ā-bhūṣeṇyam | vaḥ | marutaḥ | mahi-tvanam | didr̥kṣeṇyam | sūryasya-iva | cakṣaṇam || uto iti | asmān | amr̥ta-tve | dadhātana | śubham | yātām | anu | rathāḥ | avr̥tsata ||5.55.4||

IAST: uto asmām̐ amṛtatve dadhātana śubhaṁ yātām anu rathā avṛtsata
Griffith: So lead us with your aid to immortality. Their cars moved onward as they went to victory.
Devanāgarī: उतो अस्माँ अमृतत्वे दधातन शुभं यातामनु रथा अवृत्सत
pada pāṭha: ā-bhūṣeṇyam | vaḥ | marutaḥ | mahi-tvanam | didr̥kṣeṇyam | sūryasya-iva | cakṣaṇam || uto iti | asmān | amr̥ta-tve | dadhātana | śubham | yātām | anu | rathāḥ | avr̥tsata ||5.55.4||

IAST: ud īrayathā marutaḥ samudrato yūyaṁ vṛṣṭiṁ varṣayathā purīṣiṇaḥ
Griffith: O Maruts, from the Ocean ye uplift the rain, and fraught with vaporous moisture pour the torrents down.
Devanāgarī: उदीरयथा मरुतः समुद्रतो यूयं वृष्टिं वर्षयथा पुरीषिणः
pada pāṭha: ut | īrayatha | marutaḥ | samudrataḥ | yūyam | vr̥ṣṭim | varṣayatha | purīṣiṇaḥ || na | vaḥ | dasrā | upa | dasyanti | dhenavaḥ | śubham | yātām | anu | rathāḥ | avr̥tsata ||5.55.5||

IAST: na vo dasrā upa dasyanti dhenavaḥ śubhaṁ yātām anu rathā avṛtsata
Griffith: Never, ye Wonder-Workers, are your Milch-kine dry. Their cars moved onward as they went to victory.
Devanāgarī: न वो दस्रा उप दस्यन्ति धेनवः शुभं यातामनु रथा अवृत्सत
pada pāṭha: ut | īrayatha | marutaḥ | samudrataḥ | yūyam | vr̥ṣṭim | varṣayatha | purīṣiṇaḥ || na | vaḥ | dasrā | upa | dasyanti | dhenavaḥ | śubham | yātām | anu | rathāḥ | avr̥tsata ||5.55.5||

IAST: yad aśvān dhūrṣu pṛṣatīr ayugdhvaṁ hiraṇyayān praty atkām̐ amugdhvam
Griffith: When to your car-poles ye have yoked your spotted deer to be your steeds, and put your golden mantles on,
Devanāgarī: यदश्वान्धूर्षु पृषतीरयुग्ध्वं हिरण्ययान्प्रत्यत्काँ अमुग्ध्वम्
pada pāṭha: yat | aśvān | dhūḥ-su | pr̥ṣatīḥ | ayugdhvam | hiraṇyayān | prati | atkān | amugdhvam || viśvāḥ | it | spr̥dhaḥ | marutaḥ | vi | asyatha | śubham | yātām | anu | rathāḥ | avr̥tsata ||5.55.6||

IAST: viśvā it spṛdho maruto vy asyatha śubhaṁ yātām anu rathā avṛtsata
Griffith: O Maruts, ye disperse all enemies abroad. Their cars moved onward as they went to victory.
Devanāgarī: विश्वा इत्स्पृधो मरुतो व्यस्यथ शुभं यातामनु रथा अवृत्सत
pada pāṭha: yat | aśvān | dhūḥ-su | pr̥ṣatīḥ | ayugdhvam | hiraṇyayān | prati | atkān | amugdhvam || viśvāḥ | it | spr̥dhaḥ | marutaḥ | vi | asyatha | śubham | yātām | anu | rathāḥ | avr̥tsata ||5.55.6||

IAST: na parvatā na nadyo varanta vo yatrācidhvam maruto gacchathed u tat
Griffith: Neither the mountains nor the rivers keep you back: whither ye have resolved thither ye, Maruts, go.
Devanāgarī: न पर्वता न नद्यो वरन्त वो यत्राचिध्वं मरुतो गच्छथेदु तत्
pada pāṭha: na | parvatāḥ | na | nadyaḥ | varanta | vaḥ | yatra | acidhvam | marutaḥ | gacchatha | it | ūm̐ iti | tat || uta | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | yāthana | pari | śubham | yātām | anu | rathāḥ | avr̥tsata ||5.55.7||

IAST: uta dyāvāpṛthivī yāthanā pari śubhaṁ yātām anu rathā avṛtsata
Griffith: Ye compass round about even the heaven and earth. Their cars moved onward as they went to victory.
Devanāgarī: उत द्यावापृथिवी याथना परि शुभं यातामनु रथा अवृत्सत
pada pāṭha: na | parvatāḥ | na | nadyaḥ | varanta | vaḥ | yatra | acidhvam | marutaḥ | gacchatha | it | ūm̐ iti | tat || uta | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | yāthana | pari | śubham | yātām | anu | rathāḥ | avr̥tsata ||5.55.7||

IAST: yat pūrvyam maruto yac ca nūtanaṁ yad udyate vasavo yac ca śasyate
Griffith: Whate'er is ancient, Maruts, what of recent time, whate'er is spoken, Vasus, what is chanted forth,
Devanāgarī: यत्पूर्व्यं मरुतो यच्च नूतनं यदुद्यते वसवो यच्च शस्यते
pada pāṭha: yat | pūrvyam | marutaḥ | yat | ca | nūtanam | yat | udyate | vasavaḥ | yat | ca | śasyate || viśvasya | tasya | bhavatha | navedasaḥ | śubham | yātām | anu | rathāḥ | avr̥tsata ||5.55.8||

IAST: viśvasya tasya bhavathā navedasaḥ śubhaṁ yātām anu rathā avṛtsata
Griffith: They who take cognizance of all of this are ye. Their cars moved onward as they went to victory.
Devanāgarī: विश्वस्य तस्य भवथा नवेदसः शुभं यातामनु रथा अवृत्सत
pada pāṭha: yat | pūrvyam | marutaḥ | yat | ca | nūtanam | yat | udyate | vasavaḥ | yat | ca | śasyate || viśvasya | tasya | bhavatha | navedasaḥ | śubham | yātām | anu | rathāḥ | avr̥tsata ||5.55.8||

IAST: mṛḻata no maruto mā vadhiṣṭanāsmabhyaṁ śarma bahulaṁ vi yantana
Griffith: Be gracious unto us, ye Maruts, slay us not extend ye unto us shelter of many a sort.
Devanāgarī: मृळत नो मरुतो मा वधिष्टनास्मभ्यं शर्म बहुलं वि यन्तन
pada pāṭha: mr̥ḷata | naḥ | marutaḥ | mā | vadhiṣṭana | asmabhyam | śarma | bahulam | vi | yantana || adhi | stotrasya | sakhyasya | gātana | śubham | yātām | anu | rathāḥ | avr̥tsata ||5.55.9||

IAST: adhi stotrasya sakhyasya gātana śubhaṁ yātām anu rathā avṛtsata
Griffith: Pay due regard unto our friendship and our praise. Their cars moved onward as they went to victory.
Devanāgarī: अधि स्तोत्रस्य सख्यस्य गातन शुभं यातामनु रथा अवृत्सत
pada pāṭha: mr̥ḷata | naḥ | marutaḥ | mā | vadhiṣṭana | asmabhyam | śarma | bahulam | vi | yantana || adhi | stotrasya | sakhyasya | gātana | śubham | yātām | anu | rathāḥ | avr̥tsata ||5.55.9||

IAST: yūyam asmān nayata vasyo acchā nir aṁhatibhyo maruto gṛṇānāḥ
Griffith: O Maruts, lead us on to higher fortune deliver us, when lauded, from afflictions.
Devanāgarī: यूयमस्मान्नयत वस्यो अच्छा निरंहतिभ्यो मरुतो गृणानाः
pada pāṭha: yūyam | asmān | nayata | vasyaḥ | accha | niḥ | aṁhati-bhyaḥ | marutaḥ | gr̥ṇānāḥ || juṣadhvam | naḥ | havya-dātim | yajatrāḥ | vayam | syāma | patayaḥ | rayīṇām ||5.55.10||

IAST: juṣadhvaṁ no havyadātiṁ yajatrā vayaṁ syāma patayo rayīṇām
Griffith: Accept, ye Holy Ones, the gifts we bring you. May we be masters of abundant riches.
Devanāgarī: जुषध्वं नो हव्यदातिं यजत्रा वयं स्याम पतयो रयीणाम्
pada pāṭha: yūyam | asmān | nayata | vasyaḥ | accha | niḥ | aṁhati-bhyaḥ | marutaḥ | gr̥ṇānāḥ || juṣadhvam | naḥ | havya-dātim | yajatrāḥ | vayam | syāma | patayaḥ | rayīṇām ||5.55.10||

IAST: agne śardhantam ā gaṇam piṣṭaṁ rukmebhir añjibhiḥ
Griffith: AGNI, that valorous company adorned with ornaments of gold,
Devanāgarī: अग्ने शर्धन्तमा गणं पिष्टं रुक्मेभिरञ्जिभिः
pada pāṭha: agne | śardhantam | ā | gaṇam | piṣṭam | rukmebhiḥ | añji-bhiḥ || viśaḥ | adya | marutām | ava | hvaye | divaḥ | cit | rocanāt | adhi ||5.56.1||

IAST: viśo adya marutām ava hvaye divaś cid rocanād adhi
Griffith: The people of the Maruts, I call down to-day even from the luminous realm of heaven.
Devanāgarī: विशो अद्य मरुतामव ह्वये दिवश्चिद्रोचनादधि
pada pāṭha: agne | śardhantam | ā | gaṇam | piṣṭam | rukmebhiḥ | añji-bhiḥ || viśaḥ | adya | marutām | ava | hvaye | divaḥ | cit | rocanāt | adhi ||5.56.1||

IAST: yathā cin manyase hṛdā tad in me jagmur āśasaḥ
Griffith: Even as thou thinkest in thy heart, thither my wishes also tend.
Devanāgarī: यथा चिन्मन्यसे हृदा तदिन्मे जग्मुराशसः
pada pāṭha: yathā | cit | manyase | hr̥dā | tat | it | me | jagmuḥ | ā-śasaḥ || ye | te | nediṣṭham | havanāni | ā-gaman | tān | vardha | bhīma-saṁdr̥śaḥ ||5.56.2||

IAST: ye te nediṣṭhaṁ havanāny āgaman tān vardha bhīmasaṁdṛśaḥ
Griffith: Those who have come most near to thine invoking calls, strengthen them fearful to behold.
Devanāgarī: ये ते नेदिष्ठं हवनान्यागमन्तान्वर्ध भीमसंदृशः
pada pāṭha: yathā | cit | manyase | hr̥dā | tat | it | me | jagmuḥ | ā-śasaḥ || ye | te | nediṣṭham | havanāni | ā-gaman | tān | vardha | bhīma-saṁdr̥śaḥ ||5.56.2||

IAST: mīḻhuṣmatīva pṛthivī parāhatā madanty ety asmad ā
Griffith: Earth, like a bounteous lady, liberal of her gifts, struck down and shaken, yet exultant, comes to us.
Devanāgarī: मीळ्हुष्मतीव पृथिवी पराहता मदन्त्येत्यस्मदा
pada pāṭha: mīḷhuṣmatī-iva | pr̥thivī | parā-hatā | madantī | eti | asmat | ā || r̥kṣaḥ | na | vaḥ | marutaḥ | śimī-vān | amaḥ | dudhraḥ | gauḥ-iva | bhīma-yuḥ ||5.56.3||

IAST: ṛkṣo na vo marutaḥ śimīvām̐ amo dudhro gaur iva bhīmayuḥ
Griffith: Impetuous as a bear, O Maruts, is youi rush terrible as a dreadful bull..
Devanāgarī: ऋक्षो न वो मरुतः शिमीवाँ अमो दुध्रो गौरिव भीमयुः
pada pāṭha: mīḷhuṣmatī-iva | pr̥thivī | parā-hatā | madantī | eti | asmat | ā || r̥kṣaḥ | na | vaḥ | marutaḥ | śimī-vān | amaḥ | dudhraḥ | gauḥ-iva | bhīma-yuḥ ||5.56.3||

IAST: ni ye riṇanty ojasā vṛthā gāvo na durdhuraḥ
Griffith: They who with mighty strength o'erthrow like oxen difficult to yoke,
Devanāgarī: नि ये रिणन्त्योजसा वृथा गावो न दुर्धुरः
pada pāṭha: ni | ye | riṇanti | ojasā | vr̥thā | gāvaḥ | na | duḥ-dhuraḥ || aśmānam | cit | svaryam | parvatam | girim | pra | cyavayanti | yāma-bhiḥ ||5.56.4||

IAST: aśmānaṁ cit svaryam parvataṁ girim pra cyāvayanti yāmabhiḥ
Griffith: Cause e'en the heavenly stone to shake ' yea, shake the rocky mountain as they race along.
Devanāgarī: अश्मानं चित्स्वर्यं पर्वतं गिरिं प्र च्यावयन्ति यामभिः
pada pāṭha: ni | ye | riṇanti | ojasā | vr̥thā | gāvaḥ | na | duḥ-dhuraḥ || aśmānam | cit | svaryam | parvatam | girim | pra | cyavayanti | yāma-bhiḥ ||5.56.4||

IAST: ut tiṣṭha nūnam eṣāṁ stomaiḥ samukṣitānām
Griffith: Rise up! even now with lauds I call the very numerous company,
Devanāgarī: उत्तिष्ठ नूनमेषां स्तोमैः समुक्षितानाम्
pada pāṭha: ut | tiṣṭha | nūnam | eṣām | stomaiḥ | sam-ukṣitānām || marutām | puru-tamam | apūrvyam | gavām | sargam-iva | hvaye ||5.56.5||

IAST: marutām purutamam apūrvyaṁ gavāṁ sargam iva hvaye
Griffith: Unequalled, of these Maruts, like a herd of kine, grown up together in their strength.
Devanāgarī: मरुतां पुरुतममपूर्व्यं गवां सर्गमिव ह्वये
pada pāṭha: ut | tiṣṭha | nūnam | eṣām | stomaiḥ | sam-ukṣitānām || marutām | puru-tamam | apūrvyam | gavām | sargam-iva | hvaye ||5.56.5||

IAST: yuṅgdhvaṁ hy aruṣī rathe yuṅgdhvaṁ ratheṣu rohitaḥ
Griffith: Bind to your car the bright red mares, yoke the red coursers to your car.
Devanāgarī: युङ्ग्ध्वं ह्यरुषी रथे युङ्ग्ध्वं रथेषु रोहितः
pada pāṭha: yuṅgdhvam | hi | aruṣīḥ | rathe | yuṅgdhvam | ratheṣu | rohitaḥ || yuṅgdhvam | harī iti | ajirā | dhuri | voḷhave | vahiṣṭhā | dhuri | voḷhave ||5.56.6||

IAST: yuṅgdhvaṁ harī ajirā dhuri voḻhave vahiṣṭhā dhuri voḻhave
Griffith: Bind to the pole, to draw, the fleet-foot tawny steeds, the best at drawing, to the pole.
Devanāgarī: युङ्ग्ध्वं हरी अजिरा धुरि वोळ्हवे वहिष्ठा धुरि वोळ्हवे
pada pāṭha: yuṅgdhvam | hi | aruṣīḥ | rathe | yuṅgdhvam | ratheṣu | rohitaḥ || yuṅgdhvam | harī iti | ajirā | dhuri | voḷhave | vahiṣṭhā | dhuri | voḷhave ||5.56.6||

IAST: uta sya vājy aruṣas tuviṣvaṇir iha sma dhāyi darśataḥ
Griffith: Yea, and this loudly-neighing bright red vigorous horse who hath been sutioned, fair to see,
Devanāgarī: उत स्य वाज्यरुषस्तुविष्वणिरिह स्म धायि दर्शतः
pada pāṭha: uta | syaḥ | vājī | aruṣaḥ | tuvi-svaṇiḥ | iha | sma | dhāyi | darśataḥ || mā | vaḥ | yāmeṣu | marutaḥ | ciram | karat | pra | tam | ratheṣu | codata ||5.56.7||

IAST: mā vo yāmeṣu marutaś ciraṁ karat pra taṁ ratheṣu codata
Griffith: Let him not cause delay, O Maruts,, in your course, urge ye him onward in your cars.
Devanāgarī: मा वो यामेषु मरुतश्चिरं करत्प्र तं रथेषु चोदत
pada pāṭha: uta | syaḥ | vājī | aruṣaḥ | tuvi-svaṇiḥ | iha | sma | dhāyi | darśataḥ || mā | vaḥ | yāmeṣu | marutaḥ | ciram | karat | pra | tam | ratheṣu | codata ||5.56.7||

IAST: rathaṁ nu mārutaṁ vayaṁ śravasyum ā huvāmahe
Griffith: The Maruts' chariot, ever fain to gather glory, we invoke,
Devanāgarī: रथं नु मारुतं वयं श्रवस्युमा हुवामहे
pada pāṭha: ratham | nu | mārutam | vayam | śravasyum | ā | huvāmahe || ā | yasmin | tasthau | su-raṇāni | bibhratī | sacā | marut-su | rodasī ||5.56.8||

IAST: ā yasmin tasthau suraṇāni bibhratī sacā marutsu rodasī
Griffith: Which Rodasi hath mounted, bringing pleasant gifts, with Maruts in her company.
Devanāgarī: आ यस्मिन्तस्थौ सुरणानि बिभ्रती सचा मरुत्सु रोदसी
pada pāṭha: ratham | nu | mārutam | vayam | śravasyum | ā | huvāmahe || ā | yasmin | tasthau | su-raṇāni | bibhratī | sacā | marut-su | rodasī ||5.56.8||

IAST: taṁ vaḥ śardhaṁ ratheśubhaṁ tveṣam panasyum ā huve
Griffith: I call that brilliant band of yours, adorable, rapid on the car
Devanāgarī: तं वः शर्धं रथेशुभं त्वेषं पनस्युमा हुवे
pada pāṭha: tam | vaḥ | śardham | rathe-śubham | tveṣam | panasyum | ā | huve || yasmin | su-jātā | su-bhagā | mahīyate | sacā | marut-su | mīḷhuṣī ||5.56.9||

IAST: yasmin sujātā subhagā mahīyate sacā marutsu mīḻhuṣī
Griffith: Whereon the bounteous Dame, auspicious, nobly born, shows glorious with the Marut host.
Devanāgarī: यस्मिन्सुजाता सुभगा महीयते सचा मरुत्सु मीळ्हुषी
pada pāṭha: tam | vaḥ | śardham | rathe-śubham | tveṣam | panasyum | ā | huve || yasmin | su-jātā | su-bhagā | mahīyate | sacā | marut-su | mīḷhuṣī ||5.56.9||

IAST: ā rudrāsa indravantaḥ sajoṣaso hiraṇyarathāḥ suvitāya gantana
Griffith: OF one accord, with Indra, O ye Rudras, come borne on your golden car for our prosperity.
Devanāgarī: आ रुद्रास इन्द्रवन्तः सजोषसो हिरण्यरथाः सुविताय गन्तन
pada pāṭha: ā | rudrāsaḥ | indra-vantaḥ | sa-joṣasaḥ | hiraṇya-rathāḥ | suvitāya | gantana || iyam | vaḥ | asmat | prati | haryate | matiḥ | tr̥ṣṇa-je | na | divaḥ | utsāḥ | udanyave ||5.57.1||

IAST: iyaṁ vo asmat prati haryate matis tṛṣṇaje na diva utsā udanyave
Griffith: An offering from us, this hymn is brought to you, as, unto one who th irsts for water, heavenly springs
Devanāgarī: इयं वो अस्मत्प्रति हर्यते मतिस्तृष्णजे न दिव उत्सा उदन्यवे
pada pāṭha: ā | rudrāsaḥ | indra-vantaḥ | sa-joṣasaḥ | hiraṇya-rathāḥ | suvitāya | gantana || iyam | vaḥ | asmat | prati | haryate | matiḥ | tr̥ṣṇa-je | na | divaḥ | utsāḥ | udanyave ||5.57.1||

IAST: vāśīmanta ṛṣṭimanto manīṣiṇaḥ sudhanvāna iṣumanto niṣaṅgiṇaḥ
Griffith: Armed with your daggers, full of wisdom, armed with spears, armed with your quivers, armed with arrows, wi
Devanāgarī: वाशीमन्त ऋष्टिमन्तो मनीषिणः सुधन्वान इषुमन्तो निषङ्गिणः
pada pāṭha: vāśī-mantaḥ | r̥ṣṭi-mantaḥ | manīṣiṇaḥ | su-dhanvānaḥ | iṣu-mantaḥ | niṣaṅgiṇaḥ || su-aśvāḥ | stha | su-rathāḥ | pr̥śni-mātaraḥ | su-āyudhāḥ | marutaḥ | yāthana | śubham ||5.57.2||

IAST: svaśvāḥ stha surathāḥ pṛśnimātaraḥ svāyudhā maruto yāthanā śubham
Griffith: Good horses and good cars have ye, O Prsni's Sons: ye, Maruts, with good weapons go to victory.
Devanāgarī: स्वश्वाः स्थ सुरथाः पृश्निमातरः स्वायुधा मरुतो याथना शुभम्
pada pāṭha: vāśī-mantaḥ | r̥ṣṭi-mantaḥ | manīṣiṇaḥ | su-dhanvānaḥ | iṣu-mantaḥ | niṣaṅgiṇaḥ || su-aśvāḥ | stha | su-rathāḥ | pr̥śni-mātaraḥ | su-āyudhāḥ | marutaḥ | yāthana | śubham ||5.57.2||

IAST: dhūnutha dyām parvatān dāśuṣe vasu ni vo vanā jihate yāmano bhiyā
Griffith: From hills and heaven ye shake wealth for the worshipper: in terror at your coming low the woods bow down
Devanāgarī: धूनुथ द्यां पर्वतान्दाशुषे वसु नि वो वना जिहते यामनो भिया
pada pāṭha: dhūnutha | dyām | parvatān | dāśuṣe | vasu | ni | vaḥ | vanā | jihate | yāmanaḥ | bhiyā || kopayatha | pr̥thivīm | pr̥śni-mātaraḥ | śubhe | yat | ugrāḥ | pr̥ṣatīḥ | ayugdhvam ||5.57.3||

IAST: kopayatha pṛthivīm pṛśnimātaraḥ śubhe yad ugrāḥ pṛṣatīr ayugdhvam
Griffith: Ye make the earth to tremble, Sons of Prsni, when for victory ye have yoked, fierce Ones! your spotted d
Devanāgarī: कोपयथ पृथिवीं पृश्निमातरः शुभे यदुग्राः पृषतीरयुग्ध्वम्
pada pāṭha: dhūnutha | dyām | parvatān | dāśuṣe | vasu | ni | vaḥ | vanā | jihate | yāmanaḥ | bhiyā || kopayatha | pr̥thivīm | pr̥śni-mātaraḥ | śubhe | yat | ugrāḥ | pr̥ṣatīḥ | ayugdhvam ||5.57.3||

IAST: vātatviṣo maruto varṣanirṇijo yamā iva susadṛśaḥ supeśasaḥ
Griffith: Bright with the blasts of wind, wrapped in their robes of rain, like twins of noble aspect and of lovely f
Devanāgarī: वातत्विषो मरुतो वर्षनिर्णिजो यमा इव सुसदृशः सुपेशसः
pada pāṭha: vāta-tviṣaḥ | marutaḥ | varṣa-nirnijaḥ | yamāḥ-iva | su-sadr̥śaḥ | su-peśasaḥ || piśaṅga-aśvāḥ | aruṇa-aśvāḥ | arepasaḥ | pra-tvakṣasaḥ | mahinā | dyauḥ-iva | uravaḥ ||5.57.4||

IAST: piśaṅgāśvā aruṇāśvā arepasaḥ pratvakṣaso mahinā dyaur ivoravaḥ
Griffith: The Maruts, spotless, with steeds tawnyhued and red, strong in their mightiness and spreading wide like
Devanāgarī: पिशङ्गाश्वा अरुणाश्वा अरेपसः प्रत्वक्षसो महिना द्यौरिवोरवः
pada pāṭha: vāta-tviṣaḥ | marutaḥ | varṣa-nirnijaḥ | yamāḥ-iva | su-sadr̥śaḥ | su-peśasaḥ || piśaṅga-aśvāḥ | aruṇa-aśvāḥ | arepasaḥ | pra-tvakṣasaḥ | mahinā | dyauḥ-iva | uravaḥ ||5.57.4||

IAST: purudrapsā añjimantaḥ sudānavas tveṣasaṁdṛśo anavabhrarādhasaḥ
Griffith: Rich in adornment, rich in drops, munificent, bright in their aspect, yielding bounties that endure,
Devanāgarī: पुरुद्रप्सा अञ्जिमन्तः सुदानवस्त्वेषसंदृशो अनवभ्रराधसः
pada pāṭha: puru-drapsāḥ | añji-mantaḥ | su-dānavaḥ | tveṣa-saṁdr̥śaḥ | anavabhra-rādhasaḥ || su-jātāsaḥ | januṣā | rukma-vakṣasaḥ | divaḥ | arkāḥ | amr̥tam | nāma | bhejire ||5.57.5||

IAST: sujātāso januṣā rukmavakṣaso divo arkā amṛtaṁ nāma bhejire
Griffith: Noble by birth, adorned with gold upon their breasts, the Singers of the sky have won immortal fame.
Devanāgarī: सुजातासो जनुषा रुक्मवक्षसो दिवो अर्का अमृतं नाम भेजिरे
pada pāṭha: puru-drapsāḥ | añji-mantaḥ | su-dānavaḥ | tveṣa-saṁdr̥śaḥ | anavabhra-rādhasaḥ || su-jātāsaḥ | januṣā | rukma-vakṣasaḥ | divaḥ | arkāḥ | amr̥tam | nāma | bhejire ||5.57.5||

IAST: ṛṣṭayo vo maruto aṁsayor adhi saha ojo bāhvor vo balaṁ hitam
Griffith: Borne on both shoulders, O ye Maruts, are your spears: within your arms is laid your energy and trength.
Devanāgarī: ऋष्टयो वो मरुतो अंसयोरधि सह ओजो बाह्वोर्वो बलं हितम्
pada pāṭha: r̥ṣṭayaḥ | vaḥ | marutaḥ | aṁsayoḥ | adhi | sahaḥ | ojaḥ | bāhvoḥ | vaḥ | balam | hitam || nr̥mṇā | śīrṣa-su | āyudhā | ratheṣu | vaḥ | viśvā | vaḥ | śrīḥ | adhi | tanūṣu | pipiśe ||5.57.6||

IAST: nṛmṇā śīrṣasv āyudhā ratheṣu vo viśvā vaḥ śrīr adhi tanūṣu pipiśe
Griffith: Bold thoughts are in your heads, your weapons in your cars, all glorious majesty is moulded on your form
Devanāgarī: नृम्णा शीर्षस्वायुधा रथेषु वो विश्वा वः श्रीरधि तनूषु पिपिशे
pada pāṭha: r̥ṣṭayaḥ | vaḥ | marutaḥ | aṁsayoḥ | adhi | sahaḥ | ojaḥ | bāhvoḥ | vaḥ | balam | hitam || nr̥mṇā | śīrṣa-su | āyudhā | ratheṣu | vaḥ | viśvā | vaḥ | śrīḥ | adhi | tanūṣu | pipiśe ||5.57.6||

IAST: gomad aśvāvad rathavat suvīraṁ candravad rādho maruto dadā naḥ
Griffith: Vouchsafe to us, O Maruts, splendid bounty in cattle and in steeds, in cars and heroes.
Devanāgarī: गोमदश्वावद्रथवत्सुवीरं चन्द्रवद्राधो मरुतो ददा नः
pada pāṭha: go-mat | aśva-vat | ratha-vat | su-vīram | candra-vat | rādhaḥ | marutaḥ | dada | naḥ || pra-śastim | naḥ | kr̥ṇuta | rudriyāsaḥ | bhakṣīya | vaḥ | avasaḥ | daivyasya ||5.57.7||

IAST: praśastiṁ naḥ kṛṇuta rudriyāso bhakṣīya vo 'vaso daivyasya
Griffith: Children of Rudra, give us high distinction: may I enjoy your Godlike help and favour.
Devanāgarī: प्रशस्तिं नः कृणुत रुद्रियासो भक्षीय वोऽवसो दैव्यस्य
pada pāṭha: go-mat | aśva-vat | ratha-vat | su-vīram | candra-vat | rādhaḥ | marutaḥ | dada | naḥ || pra-śastim | naḥ | kr̥ṇuta | rudriyāsaḥ | bhakṣīya | vaḥ | avasaḥ | daivyasya ||5.57.7||

IAST: haye naro maruto mṛḻatā nas tuvīmaghāso amṛtā ṛtajñāḥ
Griffith: Ho! Maruts, Heroes, skilled in Law, immortal, be gracious unto us, ye rich in treasures,
Devanāgarī: हये नरो मरुतो मृळता नस्तुवीमघासो अमृता ऋतज्ञाः
pada pāṭha: haye | naraḥ | marutaḥ | mr̥ḷata | naḥ | tuvi-maghāsaḥ | amr̥tāḥ | r̥ta-jñāḥ || satya-śrutaḥ | kavayaḥ | yuvānaḥ | br̥hat-girayaḥ | br̥hat | ukṣamāṇāḥ ||5.57.8||

IAST: satyaśrutaḥ kavayo yuvāno bṛhadgirayo bṛhad ukṣamāṇāḥ
Griffith: Ye hearers of the truth, ye sage and youthful, grown mighty, dwelling on the lofty mountains.
Devanāgarī: सत्यश्रुतः कवयो युवानो बृहद्गिरयो बृहदुक्षमाणाः
pada pāṭha: haye | naraḥ | marutaḥ | mr̥ḷata | naḥ | tuvi-maghāsaḥ | amr̥tāḥ | r̥ta-jñāḥ || satya-śrutaḥ | kavayaḥ | yuvānaḥ | br̥hat-girayaḥ | br̥hat | ukṣamāṇāḥ ||5.57.8||

IAST: tam u nūnaṁ taviṣīmantam eṣāṁ stuṣe gaṇam mārutaṁ navyasīnām
Griffith: Now do I glorify their mighty cohort, the company of these the youthful Maruts,
Devanāgarī: तमु नूनं तविषीमन्तमेषां स्तुषे गणं मारुतं नव्यसीनाम्
pada pāṭha: tam | ūm̐ iti | nūnam | taviṣī-mantam | eṣām | stuṣe | gaṇam | mārutam | navyasīnām || ye | āśu-aśvāḥ | ama-vat | vahante | uta | īśire | amr̥tasya | sva-rājaḥ ||5.58.1||

IAST: ya āśvaśvā amavad vahanta uteśire amṛtasya svarājaḥ
Griffith: Who ride impetuous on with rapid horses, and radiant in themselves, are Lords of Amrta.
Devanāgarī: य आश्वश्वा अमवद्वहन्त उतेशिरे अमृतस्य स्वराजः
pada pāṭha: tam | ūm̐ iti | nūnam | taviṣī-mantam | eṣām | stuṣe | gaṇam | mārutam | navyasīnām || ye | āśu-aśvāḥ | ama-vat | vahante | uta | īśire | amr̥tasya | sva-rājaḥ ||5.58.1||

IAST: tveṣaṁ gaṇaṁ tavasaṁ khādihastaṁ dhunivratam māyinaṁ dātivāram
Griffith: The mighty glittering band, arm-bound with bracelets, givers of bliss, unmeasured in their greatness,
Devanāgarī: त्वेषं गणं तवसं खादिहस्तं धुनिव्रतं मायिनं दातिवारम्
pada pāṭha: tveṣam | gaṇam | tavasam | khādi-hastam | dhuni-vratam | māyinam | dāti-vāram || mayaḥ-bhuvaḥ | ye | amitāḥ | mahi-tvā | vandasva | vipra | tuvi-rādhasaḥ | nr̥̄n ||5.58.2||

IAST: mayobhuvo ye amitā mahitvā vandasva vipra tuvirādhaso nṝn
Griffith: With magical powers, bountiful, ever-roaring,-these, liberal Heroes, venerate thou singer.
Devanāgarī: मयोभुवो ये अमिता महित्वा वन्दस्व विप्र तुविराधसो नॄन्
pada pāṭha: tveṣam | gaṇam | tavasam | khādi-hastam | dhuni-vratam | māyinam | dāti-vāram || mayaḥ-bhuvaḥ | ye | amitāḥ | mahi-tvā | vandasva | vipra | tuvi-rādhasaḥ | nr̥̄n ||5.58.2||

IAST: ā vo yantūdavāhāso adya vṛṣṭiṁ ye viśve maruto junanti
Griffith: This day may all your water-bringers, Maruts, they who impel the falling rain, approach us.
Devanāgarī: आ वो यन्तूदवाहासो अद्य वृष्टिं ये विश्वे मरुतो जुनन्ति
pada pāṭha: ā | vaḥ | yantu | uda-vāhāsaḥ | adya | vr̥ṣṭim | ye | viśve | marutaḥ | junanti || ayam | yaḥ | agniḥ | marutaḥ | sam-iddhaḥ | etam | juṣadhvam | kavayaḥ | yuvānaḥ ||5.58.3||

IAST: ayaṁ yo agnir marutaḥ samiddha etaṁ juṣadhvaṁ kavayo yuvānaḥ
Griffith: This fire, O Maruts, hath been duly kindled; let it find favour with you, youthful Sages.
Devanāgarī: अयं यो अग्निर्मरुतः समिद्ध एतं जुषध्वं कवयो युवानः
pada pāṭha: ā | vaḥ | yantu | uda-vāhāsaḥ | adya | vr̥ṣṭim | ye | viśve | marutaḥ | junanti || ayam | yaḥ | agniḥ | marutaḥ | sam-iddhaḥ | etam | juṣadhvam | kavayaḥ | yuvānaḥ ||5.58.3||

IAST: yūyaṁ rājānam iryaṁ janāya vibhvataṣṭaṁ janayathā yajatrāḥ
Griffith: Ye raise up for the folk an active ruler whom, Holy Ones! a Master's hand hath fashioned.
Devanāgarī: यूयं राजानमिर्यं जनाय विभ्वतष्टं जनयथा यजत्राः
pada pāṭha: yūyam | rājānam | iryam | janāya | vibhva-taṣṭam | janayatha | yajatrāḥ || yuṣmat | eti | muṣṭi-hā | bāhu-jūtaḥ | yuṣmat | sat-aśvaḥ | marutaḥ | su-vīraḥ ||5.58.4||

IAST: yuṣmad eti muṣṭihā bāhujūto yuṣmat sadaśvo marutaḥ suvīraḥ
Griffith: Ye send the fighter hand to hand, armmighty, and the brave hero, Maruts with good horses.
Devanāgarī: युष्मदेति मुष्टिहा बाहुजूतो युष्मत्सदश्वो मरुतः सुवीरः
pada pāṭha: yūyam | rājānam | iryam | janāya | vibhva-taṣṭam | janayatha | yajatrāḥ || yuṣmat | eti | muṣṭi-hā | bāhu-jūtaḥ | yuṣmat | sat-aśvaḥ | marutaḥ | su-vīraḥ ||5.58.4||

IAST: arā ived acaramā aheva pra-pra jāyante akavā mahobhiḥ
Griffith: They spring forth more and more, strong in their glories, like days, like spokes where none are last in o
Devanāgarī: अरा इवेदचरमा अहेव प्रप्र जायन्ते अकवा महोभिः
pada pāṭha: arāḥ-iva | it | acaramāḥ | ahā-iva | pra-pra | jāyante | akavāḥ | mahaḥ-bhiḥ || pr̥śneḥ | putrāḥ | upa-māsaḥ | rabhiṣṭhāḥ | svayā | matyā | marutaḥ | sam | mimikṣuḥ ||5.58.5||

IAST: pṛśneḥ putrā upamāso rabhiṣṭhāḥ svayā matyā marutaḥ sam mimikṣuḥ
Griffith: Highest and mightiest are the Sons of Prsni. Firm to their own intention cling the Maruts.
Devanāgarī: पृश्नेः पुत्रा उपमासो रभिष्ठाः स्वया मत्या मरुतः सं मिमिक्षुः
pada pāṭha: arāḥ-iva | it | acaramāḥ | ahā-iva | pra-pra | jāyante | akavāḥ | mahaḥ-bhiḥ || pr̥śneḥ | putrāḥ | upa-māsaḥ | rabhiṣṭhāḥ | svayā | matyā | marutaḥ | sam | mimikṣuḥ ||5.58.5||

IAST: yat prāyāsiṣṭa pṛṣatībhir aśvair vīḻupavibhir maruto rathebhiḥ
Griffith: When ye have hastened on with spotted coursers, O Maruts, on your cars with strong-wrought fellies,
Devanāgarī: यत्प्रायासिष्ट पृषतीभिरश्वैर्वीळुपविभिर्मरुतो रथेभिः
pada pāṭha: yat | pra | ayāsiṣṭa | pr̥ṣatībhiḥ | aśvaiḥ | vīḷupavi-bhiḥ | marutaḥ | rathebhiḥ || kṣodante | āpaḥ | riṇate | vanāni | ava | usriyaḥ | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | krandatu | dyauḥ ||5.58.6||

IAST: kṣodanta āpo riṇate vanāny avosriyo vṛṣabhaḥ krandatu dyauḥ
Griffith: The waters are disturbed, the woods are shattered. Let Dyaus the Red Steer send his thunder downward.
Devanāgarī: क्षोदन्त आपो रिणते वनान्यवोस्रियो वृषभः क्रन्दतु द्यौः
pada pāṭha: yat | pra | ayāsiṣṭa | pr̥ṣatībhiḥ | aśvaiḥ | vīḷupavi-bhiḥ | marutaḥ | rathebhiḥ || kṣodante | āpaḥ | riṇate | vanāni | ava | usriyaḥ | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | krandatu | dyauḥ ||5.58.6||

IAST: prathiṣṭa yāman pṛthivī cid eṣām bharteva garbhaṁ svam ic chavo dhuḥ
Griffith: Even Earth hath spread herself wide at their coming, and they as husbands have with power impregned her.
Devanāgarī: प्रथिष्ट यामन्पृथिवी चिदेषां भर्तेव गर्भं स्वमिच्छवो धुः
pada pāṭha: prathiṣṭa | yāman | pr̥thivī | cit | eṣām | bhartā-iva | garbham | svam | it | śavaḥ | dhuḥ || vātān | hi | aśvān | dhuri | ā-yuyujre | varṣam | svedam | cakrire | rudriyāsaḥ ||5.58.7||

IAST: vātān hy aśvān dhury āyuyujre varṣaṁ svedaṁ cakrire rudriyāsaḥ
Griffith: They to the pole have yoked the winds for coursers: their sweat have they made rain, these Sons of Rudra
Devanāgarī: वातान्ह्यश्वान्धुर्यायुयुज्रे वर्षं स्वेदं चक्रिरे रुद्रियासः
pada pāṭha: prathiṣṭa | yāman | pr̥thivī | cit | eṣām | bhartā-iva | garbham | svam | it | śavaḥ | dhuḥ || vātān | hi | aśvān | dhuri | ā-yuyujre | varṣam | svedam | cakrire | rudriyāsaḥ ||5.58.7||

IAST: haye naro maruto mṛḻatā nas tuvīmaghāso amṛtā ṛtajñāḥ
Griffith: Ho! Maruts, Heroes, skilled in Law, immortal, be gracious unto us, ye rich in treasures,
Devanāgarī: हये नरो मरुतो मृळता नस्तुवीमघासो अमृता ऋतज्ञाः
pada pāṭha: haye | naraḥ | marutaḥ | mr̥ḷata | naḥ | tuvi-maghāsaḥ | amr̥tāḥ | r̥ta-jñāḥ || satya-śrutaḥ | kavayaḥ | yuvānaḥ | br̥hat-girayaḥ | br̥hat | ukṣamāṇāḥ ||5.58.8||

IAST: satyaśrutaḥ kavayo yuvāno bṛhadgirayo bṛhad ukṣamāṇāḥ
Griffith: Ye hearers of the truth, ye sage and youthful, grown mighty, dwelling on the lofty mountains.
Devanāgarī: सत्यश्रुतः कवयो युवानो बृहद्गिरयो बृहदुक्षमाणाः
pada pāṭha: haye | naraḥ | marutaḥ | mr̥ḷata | naḥ | tuvi-maghāsaḥ | amr̥tāḥ | r̥ta-jñāḥ || satya-śrutaḥ | kavayaḥ | yuvānaḥ | br̥hat-girayaḥ | br̥hat | ukṣamāṇāḥ ||5.58.8||

IAST: pra vaḥ spaḻ akran suvitāya dāvane 'rcā dive pra pṛthivyā ṛtam bhare
Griffith: YOUR spy hath called to you to give prosperity. I sing to Heaven and Earth and offer sacrifice.
Devanāgarī: प्र वः स्पळक्रन्सुविताय दावनेऽर्चा दिवे प्र पृथिव्या ऋतं भरे
pada pāṭha: pra | vaḥ | spaṭ | akran | suvitāya | dāvane | arca | dive | pra | pr̥thivyai | r̥tam | bhare || ukṣante | aśvān | taruṣante | ā | rajaḥ | anu | svam | bhānum | śrathayante | arṇavaiḥ ||5.59.1||

IAST: ukṣante aśvān taruṣanta ā rajo 'nu svam bhānuṁ śrathayante arṇavaiḥ
Griffith: They bathe their steeds and hasten through the firmament: they spread abroad their radiance through the
Devanāgarī: उक्षन्ते अश्वान्तरुषन्त आ रजोऽनु स्वं भानुं श्रथयन्ते अर्णवैः
pada pāṭha: pra | vaḥ | spaṭ | akran | suvitāya | dāvane | arca | dive | pra | pr̥thivyai | r̥tam | bhare || ukṣante | aśvān | taruṣante | ā | rajaḥ | anu | svam | bhānum | śrathayante | arṇavaiḥ ||5.59.1||

IAST: amād eṣām bhiyasā bhūmir ejati naur na pūrṇā kṣarati vyathir yatī
Griffith: Earth shakes and reels in terror at their onward rush, like a full ship which, quivering, lets the water i
Devanāgarī: अमादेषां भियसा भूमिरेजति नौर्न पूर्णा क्षरति व्यथिर्यती
pada pāṭha: amāt | eṣām | bhiyasā | bhūmiḥ | ejati | nauḥ | na | pūrṇā | kṣarati | vyathiḥ | yatī || dūre-dr̥śaḥ | ye | citayante | ema-bhiḥ | antaḥ | mahe | vidathe | yetire | naraḥ ||5.59.2||

IAST: dūredṛśo ye citayanta emabhir antar mahe vidathe yetire naraḥ
Griffith: Marked on their ways are they, visible from afar: the Heroes press between in mighty armament.
Devanāgarī: दूरेदृशो ये चितयन्त एमभिरन्तर्महे विदथे येतिरे नरः
pada pāṭha: amāt | eṣām | bhiyasā | bhūmiḥ | ejati | nauḥ | na | pūrṇā | kṣarati | vyathiḥ | yatī || dūre-dr̥śaḥ | ye | citayante | ema-bhiḥ | antaḥ | mahe | vidathe | yetire | naraḥ ||5.59.2||

IAST: gavām iva śriyase śṛṅgam uttamaṁ sūryo na cakṣū rajaso visarjane
Griffith: As the exalted horn of bulls for splendid might, as the Sun's eye set in the firmament's expanse,
Devanāgarī: गवामिव श्रियसे शृङ्गमुत्तमं सूर्यो न चक्षू रजसो विसर्जने
pada pāṭha: gavām-iva | śriyase | śr̥ṅgam | ut-tamam | sūryaḥ | na | cakṣuḥ | rajasaḥ | vi-sarjane || atyāḥ-iva | su-bhvaḥ | cāravaḥ | sthana | maryāḥ-iva | śriyase | cetatha | naraḥ ||5.59.3||

IAST: atyā iva subhvaś cāravaḥ sthana maryā iva śriyase cetathā naraḥ
Griffith: Like vigorous horses ye are beauteous to behold, and for your glory show like bridegrooms, O ye Men.
Devanāgarī: अत्या इव सुभ्वश्चारवः स्थन मर्या इव श्रियसे चेतथा नरः
pada pāṭha: gavām-iva | śriyase | śr̥ṅgam | ut-tamam | sūryaḥ | na | cakṣuḥ | rajasaḥ | vi-sarjane || atyāḥ-iva | su-bhvaḥ | cāravaḥ | sthana | maryāḥ-iva | śriyase | cetatha | naraḥ ||5.59.3||

IAST: ko vo mahānti mahatām ud aśnavat kas kāvyā marutaḥ ko ha pauṁsyā
Griffith: Who, O ye Maruts, may attain the mighty lore of you the mighty, who may reach your manly deeds?
Devanāgarī: को वो महान्ति महतामुदश्नवत्कस्काव्या मरुतः को ह पौंस्या
pada pāṭha: kaḥ | vaḥ | mahānti | mahatām | ut | aśnavat | kaḥ | kāvyā | marutaḥ | kaḥ | ha | pauṁsyā || yūyam | ha | bhūmim | kiraṇam | na | rejatha | pra | yat | bharadhve | suvitāya | dāvane ||5.59.4||

IAST: yūyaṁ ha bhūmiṁ kiraṇaṁ na rejatha pra yad bharadhve suvitāya dāvane
Griffith: Ye, verily, make earth tremble like a ray of light what time ye bring your boons to give prosperity,
Devanāgarī: यूयं ह भूमिं किरणं न रेजथ प्र यद्भरध्वे सुविताय दावने
pada pāṭha: kaḥ | vaḥ | mahānti | mahatām | ut | aśnavat | kaḥ | kāvyā | marutaḥ | kaḥ | ha | pauṁsyā || yūyam | ha | bhūmim | kiraṇam | na | rejatha | pra | yat | bharadhve | suvitāya | dāvane ||5.59.4||

IAST: aśvā ived aruṣāsaḥ sabandhavaḥ śūrā iva prayudhaḥ prota yuyudhuḥ
Griffith: Like steeds of ruddy colour, scions of one race, as foremost champions they have battled in the van.
Devanāgarī: अश्वा इवेदरुषासः सबन्धवः शूरा इव प्रयुधः प्रोत युयुधुः
pada pāṭha: aśvāḥ-iva | it | aruṣāsaḥ | sa-bandhavaḥ | śūrāḥ-iva | pra-yudhaḥ | pra | uta | yuyudhuḥ || maryāḥ-iva | su-vr̥dhaḥ | vavr̥dhuḥ | naraḥ | sūryasya | cakṣuḥ | pra | minanti | vr̥ṣṭi-bhiḥ ||5.59.5||

IAST: maryā iva suvṛdho vāvṛdhur naraḥ sūryasya cakṣuḥ pra minanti vṛṣṭibhiḥ
Griffith: The Heroes have waxed strong like we.grown manly youths; with floods of rain they make the Sun's eye fa
Devanāgarī: मर्या इव सुवृधो वावृधुर्नरः सूर्यस्य चक्षुः प्र मिनन्ति वृष्टिभिः
