pada pāṭha: aśvāḥ-iva | it | aruṣāsaḥ | sa-bandhavaḥ | śūrāḥ-iva | pra-yudhaḥ | pra | uta | yuyudhuḥ || maryāḥ-iva | su-vr̥dhaḥ | vavr̥dhuḥ | naraḥ | sūryasya | cakṣuḥ | pra | minanti | vr̥ṣṭi-bhiḥ ||5.59.5||

IAST: te ajyeṣṭhā akaniṣṭhāsa udbhido 'madhyamāso mahasā vi vāvṛdhuḥ
Griffith: Having no eldest and no youngest in their band, no middlomost, preeminent they have waxed in might,
Devanāgarī: ते अज्येष्ठा अकनिष्ठास उद्भिदोऽमध्यमासो महसा वि वावृधुः
pada pāṭha: te | ajyeṣṭhāḥ | akaniṣṭhāsaḥ | ut-bhidaḥ | amadhyamāsaḥ | mahasā | vi | vavr̥dhuḥ || su-jātāsaḥ | januṣā | pr̥śni-mātaraḥ | divaḥ | maryāḥ | ā | naḥ | accha | jigātana ||5.59.6||

IAST: sujātāso januṣā pṛśnimātaro divo maryā ā no acchā jigātana
Griffith: These Sons of Prsni, sprung of noble ancestry: come hitberward to us, ye bridegrooms of the sky.
Devanāgarī: सुजातासो जनुषा पृश्निमातरो दिवो मर्या आ नो अच्छा जिगातन
pada pāṭha: te | ajyeṣṭhāḥ | akaniṣṭhāsaḥ | ut-bhidaḥ | amadhyamāsaḥ | mahasā | vi | vavr̥dhuḥ || su-jātāsaḥ | januṣā | pr̥śni-mātaraḥ | divaḥ | maryāḥ | ā | naḥ | accha | jigātana ||5.59.6||

IAST: vayo na ye śreṇīḥ paptur ojasāntān divo bṛhataḥ sānunas pari
Griffith: Like birds of air they flew with might in lengthened lines from heaven's high ridges to the borders of the
Devanāgarī: वयो न ये श्रेणीः पप्तुरोजसान्तान्दिवो बृहतः सानुनस्परि
pada pāṭha: vayaḥ | na | ye | śreṇīḥ | paptuḥ | ojasā | antān | divaḥ | br̥hataḥ | sānunaḥ | pari || aśvāsaḥ | eṣām | ubhaye | yathā | viduḥ | pra | parvatasya | nabhanūn | acucyavuḥ ||5.59.7||

IAST: aśvāsa eṣām ubhaye yathā viduḥ pra parvatasya nabhanūm̐r acucyavuḥ
Griffith: The steeds who carry them, as Gods and mortals know, have caused the waters of the mounuains to desGend
Devanāgarī: अश्वास एषामुभये यथा विदुः प्र पर्वतस्य नभनूँरचुच्यवुः
pada pāṭha: vayaḥ | na | ye | śreṇīḥ | paptuḥ | ojasā | antān | divaḥ | br̥hataḥ | sānunaḥ | pari || aśvāsaḥ | eṣām | ubhaye | yathā | viduḥ | pra | parvatasya | nabhanūn | acucyavuḥ ||5.59.7||

IAST: mimātu dyaur aditir vītaye naḥ saṁ dānucitrā uṣaso yatantām
Griffith: May Dyaus, the Infinite, roar for our banquet: may Dawns toil for us, glittering with moisture.
Devanāgarī: मिमातु द्यौरदितिर्वीतये नः सं दानुचित्रा उषसो यतन्ताम्
pada pāṭha: mimātu | dyauḥ | aditiḥ | vītaye | naḥ | sam | dānu-citrāḥ | uṣasaḥ | yatantām || ā | acucyavuḥ | divyam | kośam | ete | r̥ṣe | rudrasya | marutaḥ | gr̥ṇānāḥ ||5.59.8||

IAST: ācucyavur divyaṁ kośam eta ṛṣe rudrasya maruto gṛṇānāḥ
Griffith: Lauded by thee, these Maruts, Sons o Rudra, O Rsi, have sent down the heavenly treasure.
Devanāgarī: आचुच्यवुर्दिव्यं कोशमेत ऋषे रुद्रस्य मरुतो गृणानाः
pada pāṭha: mimātu | dyauḥ | aditiḥ | vītaye | naḥ | sam | dānu-citrāḥ | uṣasaḥ | yatantām || ā | acucyavuḥ | divyam | kośam | ete | r̥ṣe | rudrasya | marutaḥ | gr̥ṇānāḥ ||5.59.8||

IAST: īḻe agniṁ svavasaṁ namobhir iha prasatto vi cayat kṛtaṁ naḥ
Griffith: I LAUD with reverence the gracious Agni: here may he sit and part our meed among us.
Devanāgarī: ईळे अग्निं स्ववसं नमोभिरिह प्रसत्तो वि चयत्कृतं नः
pada pāṭha: iḷe | agnim | su-avasam | namaḥ-bhiḥ | iha | pra-sattaḥ | vi | cayat | kr̥tam | naḥ || rathaiḥ-iva | pra | bhare | vājayat-bhiḥ | pra-dakṣiṇit | marutām | stomam | r̥dhyām ||5.60.1||

IAST: rathair iva pra bhare vājayadbhiḥ pradakṣiṇin marutāṁ stomam ṛdhyām
Griffith: As with spoil-seeking cars I bring oblation: turned rightward I will swell the Marut's, praise-song.
Devanāgarī: रथैरिव प्र भरे वाजयद्भिः प्रदक्षिणिन्मरुतां स्तोममृध्याम्
pada pāṭha: iḷe | agnim | su-avasam | namaḥ-bhiḥ | iha | pra-sattaḥ | vi | cayat | kr̥tam | naḥ || rathaiḥ-iva | pra | bhare | vājayat-bhiḥ | pra-dakṣiṇit | marutām | stomam | r̥dhyām ||5.60.1||

IAST: ā ye tasthuḥ pṛṣatīṣu śrutāsu sukheṣu rudrā maruto ratheṣu
Griffith: The Maruts, yea, the Rudras, who have mounted their famous spotted deer and cars swift-moving,-
Devanāgarī: आ ये तस्थुः पृषतीषु श्रुतासु सुखेषु रुद्रा मरुतो रथेषु
pada pāṭha: ā | ye | tasthuḥ | pr̥ṣatīṣu | śrutāsu | su-kheṣu | rudrāḥ | marutaḥ | ratheṣu || vanā | cit | ugrāḥ | jihate | ni | vaḥ | bhiyā | pr̥thivī | cit | rejate | parvataḥ | cit ||5.60.2||

IAST: vanā cid ugrā jihate ni vo bhiyā pṛthivī cid rejate parvataś cit
Griffith: Before you, fierce Ones! woods bow down in terror: Earth, even the mountain, trembles at your coming.
Devanāgarī: वना चिदुग्रा जिहते नि वो भिया पृथिवी चिद्रेजते पर्वतश्चित्
pada pāṭha: ā | ye | tasthuḥ | pr̥ṣatīṣu | śrutāsu | su-kheṣu | rudrāḥ | marutaḥ | ratheṣu || vanā | cit | ugrāḥ | jihate | ni | vaḥ | bhiyā | pr̥thivī | cit | rejate | parvataḥ | cit ||5.60.2||

IAST: parvataś cin mahi vṛddho bibhāya divaś cit sānu rejata svane vaḥ
Griffith: Though vast and tall, the mountain is affrighted, the height of heaven is shaken at your roaring
Devanāgarī: पर्वतश्चिन्महि वृद्धो बिभाय दिवश्चित्सानु रेजत स्वने वः
pada pāṭha: parvataḥ | cit | mahi | vr̥ddhaḥ | bibhāya | divaḥ | cit | sānu | rejata | svane | vaḥ || yat | krīḷatha | marutaḥ | r̥ṣṭi-mantaḥ | āpaḥ-iva | sadhryañcaḥ | dhavadhve ||5.60.3||

IAST: yat krīḻatha maruta ṛṣṭimanta āpa iva sadhryañco dhavadhve
Griffith: When, armed with lances, ye are sporting, Maruts, and rush along together like the waters.
Devanāgarī: यत्क्रीळथ मरुत ऋष्टिमन्त आप इव सध्र्यञ्चो धवध्वे
pada pāṭha: parvataḥ | cit | mahi | vr̥ddhaḥ | bibhāya | divaḥ | cit | sānu | rejata | svane | vaḥ || yat | krīḷatha | marutaḥ | r̥ṣṭi-mantaḥ | āpaḥ-iva | sadhryañcaḥ | dhavadhve ||5.60.3||

IAST: varā ived raivatāso hiraṇyair abhi svadhābhis tanvaḥ pipiśre
Griffith: They, like young suitors, sons of wealthy houses, have with their golden natures decked their bodies.
Devanāgarī: वरा इवेद्रैवतासो हिरण्यैरभि स्वधाभिस्तन्वः पिपिश्रे
pada pāṭha: varāḥ-iva | it | raivatāsaḥ | hiraṇyaiḥ | abhi | svadhābhiḥ | tanvaḥ | pipiśre || śriye | śreyāṁsaḥ | tavasaḥ | ratheṣu | satrā | mahāṁsi | cakrire | tanūṣu ||5.60.4||

IAST: śriye śreyāṁsas tavaso ratheṣu satrā mahāṁsi cakrire tanūṣu
Griffith: Strong on their cars, the lordly Ones, for glory, have set their splendours on their forms for ever.
Devanāgarī: श्रिये श्रेयांसस्तवसो रथेषु सत्रा महांसि चक्रिरे तनूषु
pada pāṭha: varāḥ-iva | it | raivatāsaḥ | hiraṇyaiḥ | abhi | svadhābhiḥ | tanvaḥ | pipiśre || śriye | śreyāṁsaḥ | tavasaḥ | ratheṣu | satrā | mahāṁsi | cakrire | tanūṣu ||5.60.4||

IAST: ajyeṣṭhāso akaniṣṭhāsa ete sam bhrātaro vāvṛdhuḥ saubhagāya
Griffith: None being eldest, none among them youngest, as brothers they have grown to happy fortune.
Devanāgarī: अज्येष्ठासो अकनिष्ठास एते सं भ्रातरो वावृधुः सौभगाय
pada pāṭha: ajyeṣṭhāsaḥ | akaniṣṭhāsaḥ | ete | sam | bhrātaraḥ | vavr̥dhuḥ | saubhagāya || yuvā | pitā | su-apā | rudraḥ | eṣām | su-dughā | pr̥śniḥ | su-dinā | marut-bhyaḥ ||5.60.5||

IAST: yuvā pitā svapā rudra eṣāṁ sudughā pṛśniḥ sudinā marudbhyaḥ
Griffith: May their Sire Rudra, young and deft, and Prsni pouring much milk, bring fair days to the Maruts.
Devanāgarī: युवा पिता स्वपा रुद्र एषां सुदुघा पृश्निः सुदिना मरुद्भ्यः
pada pāṭha: ajyeṣṭhāsaḥ | akaniṣṭhāsaḥ | ete | sam | bhrātaraḥ | vavr̥dhuḥ | saubhagāya || yuvā | pitā | su-apā | rudraḥ | eṣām | su-dughā | pr̥śniḥ | su-dinā | marut-bhyaḥ ||5.60.5||

IAST: yad uttame maruto madhyame vā yad vāvame subhagāso divi ṣṭha
Griffith: Whether, O blessed Maruts, ye be dwelling in highest, midmost, or in lowest heaven,
Devanāgarī: यदुत्तमे मरुतो मध्यमे वा यद्वावमे सुभगासो दिवि ष्ठ
pada pāṭha: yat | ut-tame | marutaḥ | madhyame | vā | yat | vā | avame | su-bhagāsaḥ | divi | stha || ataḥ | naḥ | rudrāḥ | uta | vā | nu | asya | agne | vittāt | haviṣaḥ | yat | yajāma ||5.60.6||

IAST: ato no rudrā uta vā nv asyāgne vittād dhaviṣo yad yajāma
Griffith: Thence, O ye Rudras, and thou also, Agni, notice the sacrificial food we offer.
Devanāgarī: अतो नो रुद्रा उत वा न्वस्याग्ने वित्ताद्धविषो यद्यजाम
pada pāṭha: yat | ut-tame | marutaḥ | madhyame | vā | yat | vā | avame | su-bhagāsaḥ | divi | stha || ataḥ | naḥ | rudrāḥ | uta | vā | nu | asya | agne | vittāt | haviṣaḥ | yat | yajāma ||5.60.6||

IAST: agniś ca yan maruto viśvavedaso divo vahadhva uttarād adhi ṣṇubhiḥ
Griffith: O Maruts, Lords of all, when Agni and when ye drive downward from sublimest heaven along the heights,
Devanāgarī: अग्निश्च यन्मरुतो विश्ववेदसो दिवो वहध्व उत्तरादधि ष्णुभिः
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | ca | yat | marutaḥ | viśva-vedasaḥ | divaḥ | vahadhve | ut-tarāt | adhi | snu-bhiḥ || te | mandasānāḥ | dhunayaḥ | riśādasaḥ | vāmam | dhatta | yajamānāya | sunvate ||5.60.7||

IAST: te mandasānā dhunayo riśādaso vāmaṁ dhatta yajamānāya sunvate
Griffith: Shakers of all, rejoicing, slayers of the foe, give riches to the Soma-pressing worshipper.
Devanāgarī: ते मन्दसाना धुनयो रिशादसो वामं धत्त यजमानाय सुन्वते
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | ca | yat | marutaḥ | viśva-vedasaḥ | divaḥ | vahadhve | ut-tarāt | adhi | snu-bhiḥ || te | mandasānāḥ | dhunayaḥ | riśādasaḥ | vāmam | dhatta | yajamānāya | sunvate ||5.60.7||

IAST: agne marudbhiḥ śubhayadbhir ṛkvabhiḥ somam piba mandasāno gaṇaśribhiḥ
Griffith: O Agni, with the Maruts as they gleam and sing, gathered in troop, rejoicing drink the Soma juice;
Devanāgarī: अग्ने मरुद्भिः शुभयद्भिरृक्वभिः सोमं पिब मन्दसानो गणश्रिभिः
pada pāṭha: agne | marut-bhiḥ | śubhayat-bhiḥ | r̥kva-bhiḥ | somam | piba | mandasānaḥ | gaṇaśri-bhiḥ || pāvakebhiḥ | viśvam-invebhiḥ | āyu-bhiḥ | vaiśvānara | pra-divā | ketunā | sa-jūḥ ||5.60.8||

IAST: pāvakebhir viśvaminvebhir āyubhir vaiśvānara pradivā ketunā sajūḥ
Griffith: With these the living ones who cleanse and further all, joined with thy banner, O Vaisvanara, from of ol
Devanāgarī: पावकेभिर्विश्वमिन्वेभिरायुभिर्वैश्वानर प्रदिवा केतुना सजूः
pada pāṭha: agne | marut-bhiḥ | śubhayat-bhiḥ | r̥kva-bhiḥ | somam | piba | mandasānaḥ | gaṇaśri-bhiḥ || pāvakebhiḥ | viśvam-invebhiḥ | āyu-bhiḥ | vaiśvānara | pra-divā | ketunā | sa-jūḥ ||5.60.8||

IAST: ke ṣṭhā naraḥ śreṣṭhatamā ya eka-eka āyaya
Griffith: O HEROES lordliest of all, who are ye that have singly come
Devanāgarī: के ष्ठा नरः श्रेष्ठतमा य एकएक आयय
pada pāṭha: ke | stha | naraḥ | śreṣṭha-tamāḥ | ye | ekaḥ-ekaḥ | ā-yaya || paramasyāḥ | parā-vataḥ ||5.61.1||

IAST: paramasyāḥ parāvataḥ
Griffith: Forth from a region most remote?
Devanāgarī: परमस्याः परावतः
pada pāṭha: ke | stha | naraḥ | śreṣṭha-tamāḥ | ye | ekaḥ-ekaḥ | ā-yaya || paramasyāḥ | parā-vataḥ ||5.61.1||

IAST: kva vo 'śvāḥ kvābhīśavaḥ kathaṁ śeka kathā yaya
Griffith: Where are your horses, where the reins? How came ye? how had ye the power?
Devanāgarī: क्व वोऽश्वाः क्वाभीशवः कथं शेक कथा यय
pada pāṭha: kva | vaḥ | aśvāḥ | kva | abhīśavaḥ | katham | śeka | kathā | yaya || pr̥ṣṭhe | sadaḥ | nasoḥ | yamaḥ ||5.61.2||

IAST: pṛṣṭhe sado nasor yamaḥ
Griffith: Rein was on nose and seat on back.
Devanāgarī: पृष्ठे सदो नसोर्यमः
pada pāṭha: kva | vaḥ | aśvāḥ | kva | abhīśavaḥ | katham | śeka | kathā | yaya || pr̥ṣṭhe | sadaḥ | nasoḥ | yamaḥ ||5.61.2||

IAST: jaghane coda eṣāṁ vi sakthāni naro yamuḥ
Griffith: The whip is laid upon the flank. The heroes stretch their thighs apart,
Devanāgarī: जघने चोद एषां वि सक्थानि नरो यमुः
pada pāṭha: jaghane | codaḥ | eṣām | vi | sakthāni | naraḥ | yamuḥ || putra-kr̥the | na | janayaḥ ||5.61.3||

IAST: putrakṛthe na janayaḥ
Griffith: Like women when the babe is born.
Devanāgarī: पुत्रकृथे न जनयः
pada pāṭha: jaghane | codaḥ | eṣām | vi | sakthāni | naraḥ | yamuḥ || putra-kr̥the | na | janayaḥ ||5.61.3||

IAST: parā vīrāsa etana maryāso bhadrajānayaḥ
Griffith: Go ye, O Heroes, far away, ye bridegrooms with a lovely Spouse
Devanāgarī: परा वीरास एतन मर्यासो भद्रजानयः
pada pāṭha: parā | vīrāsaḥ | itana | maryāsaḥ | bhadra-jānayaḥ || agni-tapaḥ | yathā | asatha ||5.61.4||

IAST: agnitapo yathāsatha
Griffith: That ye may warm you at the fire.
Devanāgarī: अग्नितपो यथासथ
pada pāṭha: parā | vīrāsaḥ | itana | maryāsaḥ | bhadra-jānayaḥ || agni-tapaḥ | yathā | asatha ||5.61.4||

IAST: sanat sāśvyam paśum uta gavyaṁ śatāvayam
Griffith: May she gain cattle for her meed, hundreds of sheep and steeds and kine,
Devanāgarī: सनत्साश्व्यं पशुमुत गव्यं शतावयम्
pada pāṭha: sanat | sā | aśvyam | paśum | uta | gavyam | śata-avayam || śyāvāśva-stutāya | yā | doḥ | vīrāya | upa-barbr̥hat ||5.61.5||

IAST: śyāvāśvastutāya yā dor vīrāyopabarbṛhat
Griffith: Who threw embracing arms around the hero whom gyavaiva praised.
Devanāgarī: श्यावाश्वस्तुताय या दोर्वीरायोपबर्बृहत्
pada pāṭha: sanat | sā | aśvyam | paśum | uta | gavyam | śata-avayam || śyāvāśva-stutāya | yā | doḥ | vīrāya | upa-barbr̥hat ||5.61.5||

IAST: uta tvā strī śaśīyasī puṁso bhavati vasyasī
Griffith: Yea, many a woman is more firm and better than the man who turns
Devanāgarī: उत त्वा स्त्री शशीयसी पुंसो भवति वस्यसी
pada pāṭha: uta | tvā | strī | śaśīyasī | puṁsaḥ | bhavati | vasyasī || adeva-trāt | arādhasaḥ ||5.61.6||

IAST: adevatrād arādhasaḥ
Griffith: Away from Gods, andoffers not.
Devanāgarī: अदेवत्रादराधसः
pada pāṭha: uta | tvā | strī | śaśīyasī | puṁsaḥ | bhavati | vasyasī || adeva-trāt | arādhasaḥ ||5.61.6||

IAST: vi yā jānāti jasuriṁ vi tṛṣyantaṁ vi kāminam
Griffith: She who discerns the weak and worn, the man who thirsts and is in want
Devanāgarī: वि या जानाति जसुरिं वि तृष्यन्तं वि कामिनम्
pada pāṭha: vi | yā | jānāti | jasurim | vi | tr̥ṣyantam | vi | kāminam || deva-trā | kr̥ṇute | manaḥ ||5.61.7||

IAST: devatrā kṛṇute manaḥ
Griffith: She sets her mind upon the Gods.
Devanāgarī: देवत्रा कृणुते मनः
pada pāṭha: vi | yā | jānāti | jasurim | vi | tr̥ṣyantam | vi | kāminam || deva-trā | kr̥ṇute | manaḥ ||5.61.7||

IAST: uta ghā nemo astutaḥ pumām̐ iti bruve paṇiḥ
Griffith: And yet full many a one, unpraised, mean niggard, is entitled man:
Devanāgarī: उत घा नेमो अस्तुतः पुमाँ इति ब्रुवे पणिः
pada pāṭha: uta | gha | nemaḥ | astutaḥ | pumān | iti | bruve | paṇiḥ || saḥ | vaira-deye | it | samaḥ ||5.61.8||

IAST: sa vairadeya it samaḥ
Griffith: Only in weregild is he such.
Devanāgarī: स वैरदेय इत्समः
pada pāṭha: uta | gha | nemaḥ | astutaḥ | pumān | iti | bruve | paṇiḥ || saḥ | vaira-deye | it | samaḥ ||5.61.8||

IAST: uta me 'rapad yuvatir mamanduṣī prati śyāvāya vartanim
Griffith: And she, the young, the joyous-spirited, divulged the path to Syava, yea, to me.
Devanāgarī: उत मेऽरपद्युवतिर्ममन्दुषी प्रति श्यावाय वर्तनिम्
pada pāṭha: uta | me | arapat | yuvatiḥ | mamanduṣī | prati | śyāvāya | vartanim || vi | rohitā | puru-mīḷhāya | yematuḥ | viprāya | dīrgha-yaśase ||5.61.9||

IAST: vi rohitā purumīḻhāya yematur viprāya dīrghayaśase
Griffith: Two red steeds carried me to Purumilha's side, that sage of far-extended fame,
Devanāgarī: वि रोहिता पुरुमीळ्हाय येमतुर्विप्राय दीर्घयशसे
pada pāṭha: uta | me | arapat | yuvatiḥ | mamanduṣī | prati | śyāvāya | vartanim || vi | rohitā | puru-mīḷhāya | yematuḥ | viprāya | dīrgha-yaśase ||5.61.9||

IAST: yo me dhenūnāṁ śataṁ vaidadaśvir yathā dadat
Griffith: Him who, like Vaidadasvi, like Taranta, hath bestowed on me
Devanāgarī: यो मे धेनूनां शतं वैददश्विर्यथा ददत्
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | me | dhenūnām | śatam | vaidat-aśviḥ | yathā | dadat || tarantaḥ-iva | maṁhanā ||5.61.10||

IAST: taranta iva maṁhanā
Griffith: A hundred cows in liberal gift.
Devanāgarī: तरन्त इव मंहना
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | me | dhenūnām | śatam | vaidat-aśviḥ | yathā | dadat || tarantaḥ-iva | maṁhanā ||5.61.10||

IAST: ya īṁ vahanta āśubhiḥ pibanto madiram madhu
Griffith: They who are borne by rapid steeds, drinking the meath that gives delight,
Devanāgarī: य ईं वहन्त आशुभिः पिबन्तो मदिरं मधु
pada pāṭha: ye | īm | vahante | āśu-bhiḥ | pibantaḥ | madiram | madhu || atra | śravāṁsi | dadhire ||5.61.11||

IAST: atra śravāṁsi dadhire
Griffith: They have attained high glories here.
Devanāgarī: अत्र श्रवांसि दधिरे
pada pāṭha: ye | īm | vahante | āśu-bhiḥ | pibantaḥ | madiram | madhu || atra | śravāṁsi | dadhire ||5.61.11||

IAST: yeṣāṁ śriyādhi rodasī vibhrājante ratheṣv ā
Griffith: They by whose splendour both the worlds are over-spread they shine on cars
Devanāgarī: येषां श्रियाधि रोदसी विभ्राजन्ते रथेष्वा
pada pāṭha: yeṣām | śriyā | adhi | rodasī iti | vi-bhrājante | ratheṣu | ā || divi | rukmaḥ-iva | upari ||5.61.12||

IAST: divi rukma ivopari
Griffith: As the gold gleams above in heaven.
Devanāgarī: दिवि रुक्म इवोपरि
pada pāṭha: yeṣām | śriyā | adhi | rodasī iti | vi-bhrājante | ratheṣu | ā || divi | rukmaḥ-iva | upari ||5.61.12||

IAST: yuvā sa māruto gaṇas tveṣaratho anedyaḥ
Griffith: That Marut band is ever young, borne on bright cars, unblamable,
Devanāgarī: युवा स मारुतो गणस्त्वेषरथो अनेद्यः
pada pāṭha: yuvā | saḥ | mārutaḥ | gaṇaḥ | tveṣa-rathaḥ | anedyaḥ || śubham-yāvā | aprati-skutaḥ ||5.61.13||

IAST: śubhaṁyāvāpratiṣkutaḥ
Griffith: Moving to victory, checked by none.
Devanāgarī: शुभंयावाप्रतिष्कुतः
pada pāṭha: yuvā | saḥ | mārutaḥ | gaṇaḥ | tveṣa-rathaḥ | anedyaḥ || śubham-yāvā | aprati-skutaḥ ||5.61.13||

IAST: ko veda nūnam eṣāṁ yatrā madanti dhūtayaḥ
Griffith: Who knoweth, verily, of these where the All-shakers take delight,
Devanāgarī: को वेद नूनमेषां यत्रा मदन्ति धूतयः
pada pāṭha: kaḥ | veda | nūnam | eṣām | yatra | madanti | dhūtayaḥ || r̥ta-jātāḥ | arepasaḥ ||5.61.14||

IAST: ṛtajātā arepasaḥ
Griffith: Born, spotless, after sacred Law?
Devanāgarī: ऋतजाता अरेपसः
pada pāṭha: kaḥ | veda | nūnam | eṣām | yatra | madanti | dhūtayaḥ || r̥ta-jātāḥ | arepasaḥ ||5.61.14||

IAST: yūyam martaṁ vipanyavaḥ praṇetāra itthā dhiyā
Griffith: Guides are ye, lovers of the song to mortal man through holy hymn,
Devanāgarī: यूयं मर्तं विपन्यवः प्रणेतार इत्था धिया
pada pāṭha: yūyam | martam | vipanyavaḥ | pra-netāraḥ | itthā | dhiyā || śrotāraḥ | yāma-hūtiṣu ||5.61.15||

IAST: śrotāro yāmahūtiṣu
Griffith: And hearers when he cries for help.
Devanāgarī: श्रोतारो यामहूतिषु
pada pāṭha: yūyam | martam | vipanyavaḥ | pra-netāraḥ | itthā | dhiyā || śrotāraḥ | yāma-hūtiṣu ||5.61.15||

IAST: te no vasūni kāmyā puruścandrā riśādasaḥ
Griffith: Do ye, destroyers of the foe, worshipful and exceeding bright,
Devanāgarī: ते नो वसूनि काम्या पुरुश्चन्द्रा रिशादसः
pada pāṭha: te | naḥ | vasūni | kāmyā | puru-candrāḥ | riśādasaḥ || ā | yajñiyāsaḥ | vavr̥ttana ||5.61.16||

IAST: ā yajñiyāso vavṛttana
Griffith: Send down the treasures that we crave.
Devanāgarī: आ यज्ञियासो ववृत्तन
pada pāṭha: te | naḥ | vasūni | kāmyā | puru-candrāḥ | riśādasaḥ || ā | yajñiyāsaḥ | vavr̥ttana ||5.61.16||

IAST: etam me stomam ūrmye dārbhyāya parā vaha
Griffith: OUrmya, bear thou far away to Darbhya this my hymn of praise,
Devanāgarī: एतं मे स्तोममूर्म्ये दार्भ्याय परा वह
pada pāṭha: etam | me | stomam | ūrmye | dārbhyāya | parā | vaha || giraḥ | devi | rathīḥ-iva ||5.61.17||

IAST: giro devi rathīr iva
Griffith: Songs, Goddess, as if chariot-borne.
Devanāgarī: गिरो देवि रथीरिव
pada pāṭha: etam | me | stomam | ūrmye | dārbhyāya | parā | vaha || giraḥ | devi | rathīḥ-iva ||5.61.17||

IAST: uta me vocatād iti sutasome rathavītau
Griffith: From me to Rathaviti say, when he hath pressed the Soma juice,
Devanāgarī: उत मे वोचतादिति सुतसोमे रथवीतौ
pada pāṭha: uta | me | vocatāt | iti | suta-some | ratha-vītau || na | kāmaḥ | apa | veti | me ||5.61.18||

IAST: na kāmo apa veti me
Griffith: The wish I had departeth not.
Devanāgarī: न कामो अप वेति मे
pada pāṭha: uta | me | vocatāt | iti | suta-some | ratha-vītau || na | kāmaḥ | apa | veti | me ||5.61.18||

IAST: eṣa kṣeti rathavītir maghavā gomatīr anu
Griffith: This wealthy Rathaviti dwells among the people rich in kine,
Devanāgarī: एष क्षेति रथवीतिर्मघवा गोमतीरनु
pada pāṭha: eṣaḥ | kṣeti | ratha-vītiḥ | magha-vā | go-matīḥ | anu || parvateṣu | apa-śritaḥ ||5.61.19||

IAST: parvateṣv apaśritaḥ
Griffith: Among the mountains, far withdrawn.
Devanāgarī: पर्वतेष्वपश्रितः
pada pāṭha: eṣaḥ | kṣeti | ratha-vītiḥ | magha-vā | go-matīḥ | anu || parvateṣu | apa-śritaḥ ||5.61.19||

IAST: ṛtena ṛtam apihitaṁ dhruvaṁ vāṁ sūryasya yatra vimucanty aśvān
Griffith: BY your high Law firm order is established there where they loose for travel Surya's horses.
Devanāgarī: ऋतेन ऋतमपिहितं ध्रुवं वां सूर्यस्य यत्र विमुचन्त्यश्वान्
pada pāṭha: r̥tena | r̥tam | api-hitam | dhruvam | vām | sūryasya | yatra | vi-mucanti | aśvān || daśa | śatā | saha | tasthuḥ | tat | ekam | devānām | śreṣṭham | vapuṣām | apaśyam ||5.62.1||

IAST: daśa śatā saha tasthus tad ekaṁ devānāṁ śreṣṭhaṁ vapuṣām apaśyam
Griffith: Ten hundred stood together: there I looked on this the most marvellous Deities' one chief glory.
Devanāgarī: दश शता सह तस्थुस्तदेकं देवानां श्रेष्ठं वपुषामपश्यम्
pada pāṭha: r̥tena | r̥tam | api-hitam | dhruvam | vām | sūryasya | yatra | vi-mucanti | aśvān || daśa | śatā | saha | tasthuḥ | tat | ekam | devānām | śreṣṭham | vapuṣām | apaśyam ||5.62.1||

IAST: tat su vām mitrāvaruṇā mahitvam īrmā tasthuṣīr ahabhir duduhre
Griffith: This, Mitra-Varuna, is your special greatness: floods that stood there they with the days attracted.
Devanāgarī: तत्सु वां मित्रावरुणा महित्वमीर्मा तस्थुषीरहभिर्दुदुह्रे
pada pāṭha: tat | su | vām | mitrāvaruṇā | mahi-tvam | īrmā | tasthuṣīḥ | aha-bhiḥ | duduhre || viśvāḥ | pinvathaḥ | svasarasya | dhenāḥ | anu | vām | ekaḥ | paviḥ | ā | vavarta ||5.62.2||

IAST: viśvāḥ pinvathaḥ svasarasya dhenā anu vām ekaḥ pavir ā vavarta
Griffith: Ye cause to flow all voices of the cowpen: your single chariotfelly hath rolled hither.
Devanāgarī: विश्वाः पिन्वथः स्वसरस्य धेना अनु वामेकः पविरा ववर्त
pada pāṭha: tat | su | vām | mitrāvaruṇā | mahi-tvam | īrmā | tasthuṣīḥ | aha-bhiḥ | duduhre || viśvāḥ | pinvathaḥ | svasarasya | dhenāḥ | anu | vām | ekaḥ | paviḥ | ā | vavarta ||5.62.2||

IAST: adhārayatam pṛthivīm uta dyām mitrarājānā varuṇā mahobhiḥ
Griffith: O Mitra-Varuna, ye by your greatness, both Kings, have firmly stablished earth and heaven,
Devanāgarī: अधारयतं पृथिवीमुत द्यां मित्रराजाना वरुणा महोभिः
pada pāṭha: adhārayatam | pr̥thivīm | uta | dyām | mitra-rājānā | varuṇā | mahaḥ-bhiḥ || vardhayatam | oṣadhīḥ | pinvatam | gāḥ | ava | vr̥ṣṭim | sr̥jatam | jīradānū iti jīra-dānū ||5.62.3||

IAST: vardhayatam oṣadhīḥ pinvataṁ gā ava vṛṣṭiṁ sṛjataṁ jīradānū
Griffith: Ye caused the cows to stream, the plants to flourish, and, scattering swift drops, sent down the rain-fl
Devanāgarī: वर्धयतमोषधीः पिन्वतं गा अव वृष्टिं सृजतं जीरदानू
pada pāṭha: adhārayatam | pr̥thivīm | uta | dyām | mitra-rājānā | varuṇā | mahaḥ-bhiḥ || vardhayatam | oṣadhīḥ | pinvatam | gāḥ | ava | vr̥ṣṭim | sr̥jatam | jīradānū iti jīra-dānū ||5.62.3||

IAST: ā vām aśvāsaḥ suyujo vahantu yataraśmaya upa yantv arvāk
Griffith: Let your well-harnessed horses bear you hither: hitherward let them come with reins drawn tightly.
Devanāgarī: आ वामश्वासः सुयुजो वहन्तु यतरश्मय उप यन्त्वर्वाक्
pada pāṭha: ā | vām | aśvāsaḥ | su-yujaḥ | vahantu | yata-raśmayaḥ | upa | yantu | arvāk || ghr̥tasya | niḥ-nik | anu | vartate | vām | upa | sindhavaḥ | pra-divi | kṣaranti ||5.62.4||

IAST: ghṛtasya nirṇig anu vartate vām upa sindhavaḥ pradivi kṣaranti
Griffith: A covering cloud of sacred oil attends you, and your streams flow to us from days aforetime.
Devanāgarī: घृतस्य निर्णिगनु वर्तते वामुप सिन्धवः प्रदिवि क्षरन्ति
pada pāṭha: ā | vām | aśvāsaḥ | su-yujaḥ | vahantu | yata-raśmayaḥ | upa | yantu | arvāk || ghr̥tasya | niḥ-nik | anu | vartate | vām | upa | sindhavaḥ | pra-divi | kṣaranti ||5.62.4||

IAST: anu śrutām amatiṁ vardhad urvīm barhir iva yajuṣā rakṣamāṇā
Griffith: To make the lustre wider and more famous, guarding the sacred grass with veneration,
Devanāgarī: अनु श्रुताममतिं वर्धदुर्वीं बर्हिरिव यजुषा रक्षमाणा
pada pāṭha: anu | śrutām | amatim | vardhat | urvīm | barhiḥ-iva | yajuṣā | rakṣamāṇā || namasvantā | dhr̥ta-dakṣā | adhi | garte | mitra | āsāthe iti | varuṇa | iḷāsu | antariti ||5.62.5||

IAST: namasvantā dhṛtadakṣādhi garte mitrāsāthe varuṇeḻāsv antaḥ
Griffith: Ye, Mitra-Varuna, firm, strong, awe-inspiring, are seated on a throne amid oblations.
Devanāgarī: नमस्वन्ता धृतदक्षाधि गर्ते मित्रासाथे वरुणेळास्वन्तः
pada pāṭha: anu | śrutām | amatim | vardhat | urvīm | barhiḥ-iva | yajuṣā | rakṣamāṇā || namasvantā | dhr̥ta-dakṣā | adhi | garte | mitra | āsāthe iti | varuṇa | iḷāsu | antariti ||5.62.5||

IAST: akravihastā sukṛte paraspā yaṁ trāsāthe varuṇeḻāsv antaḥ
Griffith: With hands that shed no blood, guarding the pious, whom, Varuni, ye save amid oblations.
Devanāgarī: अक्रविहस्ता सुकृते परस्पा यं त्रासाथे वरुणेळास्वन्तः
pada pāṭha: akravi-hastā | su-kr̥te | paraḥ-pā | yam | trāsāthe iti | varuṇā | iḷāsu | antariti || rājānā | kṣatram | ahr̥ṇīyamānā | sahasra-sthūṇam | bibhr̥thaḥ | saha | dvau ||5.62.6||

IAST: rājānā kṣatram ahṛṇīyamānā sahasrasthūṇam bibhṛthaḥ saha dvau
Griffith: Ye Twain, together, Kings of willing spirit, uphold dominion based on thousand pillars.
Devanāgarī: राजाना क्षत्रमहृणीयमाना सहस्रस्थूणं बिभृथः सह द्वौ
pada pāṭha: akravi-hastā | su-kr̥te | paraḥ-pā | yam | trāsāthe iti | varuṇā | iḷāsu | antariti || rājānā | kṣatram | ahr̥ṇīyamānā | sahasra-sthūṇam | bibhr̥thaḥ | saha | dvau ||5.62.6||

IAST: hiraṇyanirṇig ayo asya sthūṇā vi bhrājate divy aśvājanīva
Griffith: Adorned with gold, its columns are of iron. in heaven it glitters like a whip for horses;
Devanāgarī: हिरण्यनिर्णिगयो अस्य स्थूणा वि भ्राजते दिव्यश्वाजनीव
pada pāṭha: hiraṇya-nirnik | ayaḥ | asya | sthūṇā | vi | bhrājate | divi | aśvājanī-iva || bhadre | kṣetre | ni-mitā | talvile | vā | sanema | madhvaḥ | adhi-gartyasya ||5.62.7||

IAST: bhadre kṣetre nimitā tilvile vā sanema madhvo adhigartyasya
Griffith: Or stablished on a field deep-spoiled and fruitful. So may we share the meath that loads your car-seat.
Devanāgarī: भद्रे क्षेत्रे निमिता तिल्विले वा सनेम मध्वो अधिगर्त्यस्य
pada pāṭha: hiraṇya-nirnik | ayaḥ | asya | sthūṇā | vi | bhrājate | divi | aśvājanī-iva || bhadre | kṣetre | ni-mitā | talvile | vā | sanema | madhvaḥ | adhi-gartyasya ||5.62.7||

IAST: hiraṇyarūpam uṣaso vyuṣṭāv ayaḥsthūṇam uditā sūryasya
Griffith: Ye mount your car gold-hued at break of morning, and iron-pillared when the Sun is setting,
Devanāgarī: हिरण्यरूपमुषसो व्युष्टावयःस्थूणमुदिता सूर्यस्य
pada pāṭha: hiraṇya-rūpam | uṣasaḥ | vi-uṣṭau | ayaḥ-sthūṇam | ut-itā | sūryasya || ā | rohathaḥ | varuṇa | mitra | gartam | ataḥ | cakṣāthe iti | aditim | ditim | ca ||5.62.8||

IAST: ā rohatho varuṇa mitra gartam ataś cakṣāthe aditiṁ ditiṁ ca
Griffith: And from that place, O Varuna and Mitra, behold infinity and limit~tion.
Devanāgarī: आ रोहथो वरुण मित्र गर्तमतश्चक्षाथे अदितिं दितिं च
pada pāṭha: hiraṇya-rūpam | uṣasaḥ | vi-uṣṭau | ayaḥ-sthūṇam | ut-itā | sūryasya || ā | rohathaḥ | varuṇa | mitra | gartam | ataḥ | cakṣāthe iti | aditim | ditim | ca ||5.62.8||

IAST: yad baṁhiṣṭhaṁ nātividhe sudānū acchidraṁ śarma bhuvanasya gopā
Griffith: Bountiful guardians of the world! the shelter that is impenetrable, strongest, flawless,
Devanāgarī: यद्बंहिष्ठं नातिविधे सुदानू अच्छिद्रं शर्म भुवनस्य गोपा
pada pāṭha: yat | baṁhiṣṭham | na | ati-vidhe | sudānū iti su-dānū | acchidram | śarma | bhuvanasya | gopā || tena | naḥ | mitrāvaruṇau | aviṣṭam | sisāsantaḥ | jigīvāṁsaḥ | syāma ||5.62.9||

IAST: tena no mitrāvaruṇāv aviṣṭaṁ siṣāsanto jigīvāṁsaḥ syāma
Griffith: Aid us with that, O Varuna and Mitra, and when we long to win may we be victors.
Devanāgarī: तेन नो मित्रावरुणावविष्टं सिषासन्तो जिगीवांसः स्याम
pada pāṭha: yat | baṁhiṣṭham | na | ati-vidhe | sudānū iti su-dānū | acchidram | śarma | bhuvanasya | gopā || tena | naḥ | mitrāvaruṇau | aviṣṭam | sisāsantaḥ | jigīvāṁsaḥ | syāma ||5.62.9||

IAST: ṛtasya gopāv adhi tiṣṭhatho rathaṁ satyadharmāṇā parame vyomani
Griffith: GUARDIANS of Order, ye whose Laws are ever true, in the sublimest heaven your chariot ye ascend.
Devanāgarī: ऋतस्य गोपावधि तिष्ठथो रथं सत्यधर्माणा परमे व्योमनि
pada pāṭha: r̥tasya | gopau | adhi | tiṣṭhathaḥ | ratham | satya-dharmāṇā | parame | vi-omani || yam | atra | mitrāvaruṇā | avathaḥ | yuvam | tasmai | vr̥ṣṭiḥ | madhu-mat | pinvate | divaḥ ||5.63.1||

IAST: yam atra mitrāvaruṇāvatho yuvaṁ tasmai vṛṣṭir madhumat pinvate divaḥ
Griffith: O Mitra-Varuna whomsoe'er ye: favour, here, to him the rain with sweetness streameth down from heaven.
Devanāgarī: यमत्र मित्रावरुणावथो युवं तस्मै वृष्टिर्मधुमत्पिन्वते दिवः
pada pāṭha: r̥tasya | gopau | adhi | tiṣṭhathaḥ | ratham | satya-dharmāṇā | parame | vi-omani || yam | atra | mitrāvaruṇā | avathaḥ | yuvam | tasmai | vr̥ṣṭiḥ | madhu-mat | pinvate | divaḥ ||5.63.1||

IAST: samrājāv asya bhuvanasya rājatho mitrāvaruṇā vidathe svardṛśā
Griffith: This world's imperial Kings, O Mitra-Varuna, ye rule in holy synod, looking on the light.
Devanāgarī: सम्राजावस्य भुवनस्य राजथो मित्रावरुणा विदथे स्वर्दृशा
pada pāṭha: sam-rājau | asya | bhuvanasya | rājathaḥ | mitrāvaruṇā | vidathe | svaḥ-dr̥śā || vr̥ṣṭim | vām | rādhaḥ | amr̥ta-tvam | īmahe | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | vi | caranti | tanyavaḥ ||5.63.2||

IAST: vṛṣṭiṁ vāṁ rādho amṛtatvam īmahe dyāvāpṛthivī vi caranti tanyavaḥ
Griffith: We pray for rain, your boon, and immortality. Through heaven and over earth the thunderers take their wa
Devanāgarī: वृष्टिं वां राधो अमृतत्वमीमहे द्यावापृथिवी वि चरन्ति तन्यवः
pada pāṭha: sam-rājau | asya | bhuvanasya | rājathaḥ | mitrāvaruṇā | vidathe | svaḥ-dr̥śā || vr̥ṣṭim | vām | rādhaḥ | amr̥ta-tvam | īmahe | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | vi | caranti | tanyavaḥ ||5.63.2||

IAST: samrājā ugrā vṛṣabhā divas patī pṛthivyā mitrāvaruṇā vicarṣaṇī
Griffith: Imperial Kings, strong, Heroes, Lords of earth and heaven, Mitra and Varuna, ye ever active Ones,
Devanāgarī: सम्राजा उग्रा वृषभा दिवस्पती पृथिव्या मित्रावरुणा विचर्षणी
pada pāṭha: sam-rājau | ugrā | vr̥ṣabhā | divaḥ | patī iti | pr̥thivyāḥ | mitrāvaruṇā | vicarṣaṇī iti vi-carṣaṇī || citrebhiḥ | abhraiḥ | upa | tiṣṭhathaḥ | ravam | dyām | varṣayathaḥ | asurasya | māyayā ||5.63.3||

IAST: citrebhir abhrair upa tiṣṭhatho ravaṁ dyāṁ varṣayatho asurasya māyayā
Griffith: Ye wait on thunder with the many-tinted clouds, and by the Asura's magic power cause Heaven to rain.
Devanāgarī: चित्रेभिरभ्रैरुप तिष्ठथो रवं द्यां वर्षयथो असुरस्य मायया
pada pāṭha: sam-rājau | ugrā | vr̥ṣabhā | divaḥ | patī iti | pr̥thivyāḥ | mitrāvaruṇā | vicarṣaṇī iti vi-carṣaṇī || citrebhiḥ | abhraiḥ | upa | tiṣṭhathaḥ | ravam | dyām | varṣayathaḥ | asurasya | māyayā ||5.63.3||

IAST: māyā vām mitrāvaruṇā divi śritā sūryo jyotiś carati citram āyudham
Griffith: Your magic, Mitra-Varuna, resteth in the heaven. The Sun, the wondrous weapon, cometh forth as light.
Devanāgarī: माया वां मित्रावरुणा दिवि श्रिता सूर्यो ज्योतिश्चरति चित्रमायुधम्
pada pāṭha: māyā | vām | mitrāvaruṇā | divi | śritā | sūryaḥ | jyotiḥ | carati | citram | āyudham || tam | abhreṇa | vr̥ṣṭyā | gūhathaḥ | divi | parjanya | drapsāḥ | madhu-mantaḥ | īrate ||5.63.4||

IAST: tam abhreṇa vṛṣṭyā gūhatho divi parjanya drapsā madhumanta īrate
Griffith: Ye hide him in the sky with cloud and flood of rain, and water-drops, Parjanya! full of sweetness flow.
Devanāgarī: तमभ्रेण वृष्ट्या गूहथो दिवि पर्जन्य द्रप्सा मधुमन्त ईरते
pada pāṭha: māyā | vām | mitrāvaruṇā | divi | śritā | sūryaḥ | jyotiḥ | carati | citram | āyudham || tam | abhreṇa | vr̥ṣṭyā | gūhathaḥ | divi | parjanya | drapsāḥ | madhu-mantaḥ | īrate ||5.63.4||

IAST: rathaṁ yuñjate marutaḥ śubhe sukhaṁ śūro na mitrāvaruṇā gaviṣṭiṣu
Griffith: The Maruts yoke their easy car for victory, O Mitra-Varuna, as a hero in the wars.
Devanāgarī: रथं युञ्जते मरुतः शुभे सुखं शूरो न मित्रावरुणा गविष्टिषु
pada pāṭha: ratham | yuñjate | marutaḥ | śubhe | su-kham | śūraḥ | na | mitrāvaruṇā | go-iṣṭiṣu || rajāṁsi | citrā | vi | caranti | tanyavaḥ | divaḥ | sam-rājā | payasā | naḥ | ukṣatam ||5.63.5||

IAST: rajāṁsi citrā vi caranti tanyavo divaḥ samrājā payasā na ukṣatam
Griffith: The thunderers roam through regions varied in their hues. Imperial Kings, bedew us with the milk of heav
Devanāgarī: रजांसि चित्रा वि चरन्ति तन्यवो दिवः सम्राजा पयसा न उक्षतम्
pada pāṭha: ratham | yuñjate | marutaḥ | śubhe | su-kham | śūraḥ | na | mitrāvaruṇā | go-iṣṭiṣu || rajāṁsi | citrā | vi | caranti | tanyavaḥ | divaḥ | sam-rājā | payasā | naḥ | ukṣatam ||5.63.5||

IAST: vācaṁ su mitrāvaruṇāv irāvatīm parjanyaś citrāṁ vadati tviṣīmatīm
Griffith: Refreshing is your voice, O Mitra-Varuna: Parjanya sendeth out a wondrous mighty voice.
Devanāgarī: वाचं सु मित्रावरुणाविरावतीं पर्जन्यश्चित्रां वदति त्विषीमतीम्
pada pāṭha: vācam | su | mitrāvaruṇau | irā-vatīm | parjanyaḥ | citrām | vadati | tviṣi-matīm || abhrā | vasata | marutaḥ | su | māyayā | dyām | varṣayatam | aruṇām | arepasam ||5.63.6||

IAST: abhrā vasata marutaḥ su māyayā dyāṁ varṣayatam aruṇām arepasam
Griffith: With magic power the Maruts clothe them with the clouds. Ye Two cause Heaven to rain, the red, the spotl
Devanāgarī: अभ्रा वसत मरुतः सु मायया द्यां वर्षयतमरुणामरेपसम्
pada pāṭha: vācam | su | mitrāvaruṇau | irā-vatīm | parjanyaḥ | citrām | vadati | tviṣi-matīm || abhrā | vasata | marutaḥ | su | māyayā | dyām | varṣayatam | aruṇām | arepasam ||5.63.6||

IAST: dharmaṇā mitrāvaruṇā vipaścitā vratā rakṣethe asurasya māyayā
Griffith: Wise, with your Law and through the Asura's magic power ye guard the ordinances, Mitra-Varuna.
Devanāgarī: धर्मणा मित्रावरुणा विपश्चिता व्रता रक्षेथे असुरस्य मायया
pada pāṭha: dharmaṇā | mitrāvaruṇā | vipaḥ-citā | vratā | rakṣethe iti | asurasya | māyayā || r̥tena | viśvam | bhuvanam | vi | rājathaḥ | sūryam | ā | dhatthaḥ | divi | citryam | ratham ||5.63.7||

IAST: ṛtena viśvam bhuvanaṁ vi rājathaḥ sūryam ā dhattho divi citryaṁ ratham
Griffith: Ye by eternal Order govern all the world. Ye set the Sun in heaven as a refulgent car.
Devanāgarī: ऋतेन विश्वं भुवनं वि राजथः सूर्यमा धत्थो दिवि चित्र्यं रथम्
pada pāṭha: dharmaṇā | mitrāvaruṇā | vipaḥ-citā | vratā | rakṣethe iti | asurasya | māyayā || r̥tena | viśvam | bhuvanam | vi | rājathaḥ | sūryam | ā | dhatthaḥ | divi | citryam | ratham ||5.63.7||

IAST: varuṇaṁ vo riśādasam ṛcā mitraṁ havāmahe
Griffith: You, foeman-slaying Varuna and Mitra, we invoke with song,
Devanāgarī: वरुणं वो रिशादसमृचा मित्रं हवामहे
pada pāṭha: varuṇam | vaḥ | riśādasam | r̥cā | mitram | havāmahe || pari | vrajā-iva | bāhvoḥ | jaganvāṁsā | svaḥ-naram ||5.64.1||

IAST: pari vrajeva bāhvor jaganvāṁsā svarṇaram
Griffith: Who, as with penfold of your arms, encompass round the realm of light.
Devanāgarī: परि व्रजेव बाह्वोर्जगन्वांसा स्वर्णरम्
pada pāṭha: varuṇam | vaḥ | riśādasam | r̥cā | mitram | havāmahe || pari | vrajā-iva | bāhvoḥ | jaganvāṁsā | svaḥ-naram ||5.64.1||

IAST: tā bāhavā sucetunā pra yantam asmā arcate
Griffith: Stretch out your arms with favouring love unto this man who singeth hymns,
Devanāgarī: ता बाहवा सुचेतुना प्र यन्तमस्मा अर्चते
pada pāṭha: tā | bāhavā | su-cetunā | pra | yantam | asmai | arcate || śevam | hi | jāryam | vām | viśvāsu | kṣāsu | joguve ||5.64.2||

IAST: śevaṁ hi jāryaṁ vāṁ viśvāsu kṣāsu joguve
Griffith: For in all places is sung forth your evergracious friendliness.
Devanāgarī: शेवं हि जार्यं वां विश्वासु क्षासु जोगुवे
pada pāṭha: tā | bāhavā | su-cetunā | pra | yantam | asmai | arcate || śevam | hi | jāryam | vām | viśvāsu | kṣāsu | joguve ||5.64.2||

IAST: yan nūnam aśyāṁ gatim mitrasya yāyām pathā
Griffith: That I may gain a refuge now, may my steps be on Mitra's path.
Devanāgarī: यन्नूनमश्यां गतिं मित्रस्य यायां पथा
pada pāṭha: yat | nūnam | aśyām | gatim | mitrasya | yāyām | pathā || asya | priyasya | śarmaṇi | ahiṁsānasya | saścire ||5.64.3||

IAST: asya priyasya śarmaṇy ahiṁsānasya saścire
Griffith: Men go protected in the charge of this dear Friend who harms us not.
Devanāgarī: अस्य प्रियस्य शर्मण्यहिंसानस्य सश्चिरे
pada pāṭha: yat | nūnam | aśyām | gatim | mitrasya | yāyām | pathā || asya | priyasya | śarmaṇi | ahiṁsānasya | saścire ||5.64.3||

IAST: yuvābhyām mitrāvaruṇopamaṁ dheyām ṛcā
Griffith: Mitra and Varuna, from you may I, by song, win noblest meed.
Devanāgarī: युवाभ्यां मित्रावरुणोपमं धेयामृचा
pada pāṭha: yuvābhyām | mitrāvaruṇā | upa-mam | dheyām | r̥cā || yat | ha | kṣaye | maghonām | stotr̥̄ṇām | ca | spūrdhase ||5.64.4||

IAST: yad dha kṣaye maghonāṁ stotṝṇāṁ ca spūrdhase
Griffith: That shall stir envy in the homes of wealthy chiefs and those who praise.
Devanāgarī: यद्ध क्षये मघोनां स्तोतॄणां च स्पूर्धसे
pada pāṭha: yuvābhyām | mitrāvaruṇā | upa-mam | dheyām | r̥cā || yat | ha | kṣaye | maghonām | stotr̥̄ṇām | ca | spūrdhase ||5.64.4||

IAST: ā no mitra sudītibhir varuṇaś ca sadhastha ā
Griffith: With your fair splendours, Varuna and Mitra, to our gathering come,
Devanāgarī: आ नो मित्र सुदीतिभिर्वरुणश्च सधस्थ आ
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | mitra | sudīti-bhiḥ | varuṇaḥ | ca | sadha-sthe | ā || sve | kṣaye | maghonām | sakhīnām | ca | vr̥dhase ||5.64.5||

IAST: sve kṣaye maghonāṁ sakhīnāṁ ca vṛdhase
Griffith: That in their homes the wealthy chiefs and they who are your friends may thrive.
Devanāgarī: स्वे क्षये मघोनां सखीनां च वृधसे
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | mitra | sudīti-bhiḥ | varuṇaḥ | ca | sadha-sthe | ā || sve | kṣaye | maghonām | sakhīnām | ca | vr̥dhase ||5.64.5||

IAST: yuvaṁ no yeṣu varuṇa kṣatram bṛhac ca bibhṛthaḥ
Griffith: With those, moreover, among whom ye hold your high supremacy,
Devanāgarī: युवं नो येषु वरुण क्षत्रं बृहच्च बिभृथः
pada pāṭha: yuvam | naḥ | yeṣu | varuṇā | kṣatram | br̥hat | ca | bibhr̥thaḥ || uru | naḥ | vāja-sātaye | kr̥tam | rāye | svastaye ||5.64.6||

IAST: uru ṇo vājasātaye kṛtaṁ rāye svastaye
Griffith: Vouchsafe us room that we may win strength for prosperity and wealth.
Devanāgarī: उरु णो वाजसातये कृतं राये स्वस्तये
pada pāṭha: yuvam | naḥ | yeṣu | varuṇā | kṣatram | br̥hat | ca | bibhr̥thaḥ || uru | naḥ | vāja-sātaye | kr̥tam | rāye | svastaye ||5.64.6||

IAST: ucchantyām me yajatā devakṣatre ruśadgavi
Griffith: When morning flushes, Holy Ones! in the Gods' realm where white Cows shine,
Devanāgarī: उच्छन्त्यां मे यजता देवक्षत्रे रुशद्गवि
pada pāṭha: ucchantyām | me | yajatā | deva-kṣatre | ruśat-gavi || sutam | somam | na | hasti-bhiḥ | ā | paṭ-bhiḥ | dhāvatam | narā | bibhratau | arcanānasam ||5.64.7||

IAST: sutaṁ somaṁ na hastibhir ā paḍbhir dhāvataṁ narā bibhratāv arcanānasam
Griffith: Supporting Arcananas, speed, ye Heroes, with your active feet hither to my pressed Soma juice.
Devanāgarī: सुतं सोमं न हस्तिभिरा पड्भिर्धावतं नरा बिभ्रतावर्चनानसम्
pada pāṭha: ucchantyām | me | yajatā | deva-kṣatre | ruśat-gavi || sutam | somam | na | hasti-bhiḥ | ā | paṭ-bhiḥ | dhāvatam | narā | bibhratau | arcanānasam ||5.64.7||

IAST: yaś ciketa sa sukratur devatrā sa bravītu naḥ
Griffith: Full wise is he who hath discerned: let him speak to us of the gods,
Devanāgarī: यश्चिकेत स सुक्रतुर्देवत्रा स ब्रवीतु नः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | ciketa | saḥ | su-kratuḥ | deva-trā | saḥ | bravītu | naḥ || varuṇaḥ | yasya | darśataḥ | mitraḥ | vā | vanate | giraḥ ||5.65.1||

IAST: varuṇo yasya darśato mitro vā vanate giraḥ
Griffith: the man whose praise-songs Varuna the beautiful, or Mitra, loves.
Devanāgarī: वरुणो यस्य दर्शतो मित्रो वा वनते गिरः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | ciketa | saḥ | su-kratuḥ | deva-trā | saḥ | bravītu | naḥ || varuṇaḥ | yasya | darśataḥ | mitraḥ | vā | vanate | giraḥ ||5.65.1||

IAST: tā hi śreṣṭhavarcasā rājānā dīrghaśruttamā
Griffith: For they are kings of noblest might, of glorious fame most widely spread;
Devanāgarī: ता हि श्रेष्ठवर्चसा राजाना दीर्घश्रुत्तमा
pada pāṭha: tā | hi | śreṣṭha-varcasā | rājānā | dīrghaśrut-tamā || tā | satpatī iti sat-patī | r̥ta-vr̥dhā | r̥ta-vānā | jane-jane ||5.65.2||

IAST: tā satpatī ṛtāvṛdha ṛtāvānā jane-jane
Griffith: Lords of the brave, who strengthen law, the holy ones with every race.
Devanāgarī: ता सत्पती ऋतावृध ऋतावाना जनेजने
pada pāṭha: tā | hi | śreṣṭha-varcasā | rājānā | dīrghaśrut-tamā || tā | satpatī iti sat-patī | r̥ta-vr̥dhā | r̥ta-vānā | jane-jane ||5.65.2||

IAST: tā vām iyāno 'vase pūrvā upa bruve sacā
Griffith: Approaching you with prayer for aid, together I address you first,
Devanāgarī: ता वामियानोऽवसे पूर्वा उप ब्रुवे सचा
pada pāṭha: tā | vām | iyānaḥ | avase | pūrvau | upa | bruve | sacā || su-aśvāsaḥ | su | cetunā | vājān | abhi | pra | dāvane ||5.65.3||

IAST: svaśvāsaḥ su cetunā vājām̐ abhi pra dāvane
Griffith: we who have good steeds call on you, most sage, to give strength besides.
Devanāgarī: स्वश्वासः सु चेतुना वाजाँ अभि प्र दावने
pada pāṭha: tā | vām | iyānaḥ | avase | pūrvau | upa | bruve | sacā || su-aśvāsaḥ | su | cetunā | vājān | abhi | pra | dāvane ||5.65.3||

IAST: mitro aṁhoś cid ād uru kṣayāya gātuṁ vanate
Griffith: Even out of misery Mitra gives a way to dwelling at our case,
Devanāgarī: मित्रो अंहोश्चिदादुरु क्षयाय गातुं वनते
pada pāṭha: mitraḥ | aṁhoḥ | cit | āt | uru | kṣayāya | gātum | vanate || mitrasya | hi | pra-tūrvataḥ | su-matiḥ | asti | vidhataḥ ||5.65.4||

IAST: mitrasya hi pratūrvataḥ sumatir asti vidhataḥ
Griffith: For he who worships hath the grace of Mitra, fighter in the van.
Devanāgarī: मित्रस्य हि प्रतूर्वतः सुमतिरस्ति विधतः
pada pāṭha: mitraḥ | aṁhoḥ | cit | āt | uru | kṣayāya | gātum | vanate || mitrasya | hi | pra-tūrvataḥ | su-matiḥ | asti | vidhataḥ ||5.65.4||

IAST: vayam mitrasyāvasi syāma saprathastame
Griffith: In Mitra's shelter that extends to utmost distance may we dwell,
Devanāgarī: वयं मित्रस्यावसि स्याम सप्रथस्तमे
pada pāṭha: vayam | mitrasya | avasi | syāma | saprathaḥ-tame || anehasaḥ | tvā-ūtayaḥ | satrā | varuṇa-śeṣasaḥ ||5.65.5||

IAST: anehasas tvotayaḥ satrā varuṇaśeṣasaḥ
Griffith: Unmenaced, guarded by the care, ever as sons of Varuna.
Devanāgarī: अनेहसस्त्वोतयः सत्रा वरुणशेषसः
pada pāṭha: vayam | mitrasya | avasi | syāma | saprathaḥ-tame || anehasaḥ | tvā-ūtayaḥ | satrā | varuṇa-śeṣasaḥ ||5.65.5||

IAST: yuvam mitremaṁ janaṁ yatathaḥ saṁ ca nayathaḥ
Griffith: Ye, Mitra, urge this people on, and to one end direct their ways.
Devanāgarī: युवं मित्रेमं जनं यतथः सं च नयथः
pada pāṭha: yuvam | mitrā | imam | janam | yatathaḥ | sam | ca | nayathaḥ || mā | maghonaḥ | pari | khyatam | mo iti | asmākam | r̥ṣīṇām | go-pīthe | naḥ | uruṣyatam ||5.65.6||

IAST: mā maghonaḥ pari khyatam mo asmākam ṛṣīṇāṁ gopīthe na uruṣyatam
Griffith: Neglect not ye the wealthy chiefs, neglect not us the rshis: be our guardians who ye quaff the milk.
Devanāgarī: मा मघोनः परि ख्यतं मो अस्माकमृषीणां गोपीथे न उरुष्यतम्
pada pāṭha: yuvam | mitrā | imam | janam | yatathaḥ | sam | ca | nayathaḥ || mā | maghonaḥ | pari | khyatam | mo iti | asmākam | r̥ṣīṇām | go-pīthe | naḥ | uruṣyatam ||5.65.6||

IAST: ā cikitāna sukratū devau marta riśādasā
Griffith: O SAPIENT man, call the Two Gods, the very wise, who slay the foe.
Devanāgarī: आ चिकितान सुक्रतू देवौ मर्त रिशादसा
pada pāṭha: ā | cikitāna | sukratū iti su-kratū | devau | marta | riśādasā || varuṇāya | r̥ta-peśase | dadhīta | prayase | mahe ||5.66.1||

IAST: varuṇāya ṛtapeśase dadhīta prayase mahe
Griffith: For Varuna, whose form is Law, place offerings for his great delight.
Devanāgarī: वरुणाय ऋतपेशसे दधीत प्रयसे महे
pada pāṭha: ā | cikitāna | sukratū iti su-kratū | devau | marta | riśādasā || varuṇāya | r̥ta-peśase | dadhīta | prayase | mahe ||5.66.1||

IAST: tā hi kṣatram avihrutaṁ samyag asuryam āśāte
Griffith: For they have won unbroken sway in full perfection, power divine.
Devanāgarī: ता हि क्षत्रमविह्रुतं सम्यगसुर्यमाशाते
pada pāṭha: tā | hi | kṣatram | avi-hrutam | samyak | asuryam | āśāte iti || adha | vratā-iva | mānuṣam | svaḥ | na | dhāyi | darśatam ||5.66.2||

IAST: adha vrateva mānuṣaṁ svar ṇa dhāyi darśatam
Griffith: And, like high laws, the world of man hath been made beautiful as light.
Devanāgarī: अध व्रतेव मानुषं स्वर्ण धायि दर्शतम्
pada pāṭha: tā | hi | kṣatram | avi-hrutam | samyak | asuryam | āśāte iti || adha | vratā-iva | mānuṣam | svaḥ | na | dhāyi | darśatam ||5.66.2||

IAST: tā vām eṣe rathānām urvīṁ gavyūtim eṣām
Griffith: Therefore we praise you that your cars may travel far in front of ours-
Devanāgarī: ता वामेषे रथानामुर्वीं गव्यूतिमेषाम्
pada pāṭha: tā | vām | eṣe | rathānām | urvīm | gavyūtim | eṣām || rāta-havyasya | su-stutim | dadhr̥k | stomaiḥ | manāmahe ||5.66.3||

IAST: rātahavyasya suṣṭutiṁ dadhṛk stomair manāmahe
Griffith: You who accept the eulogy of Ratahavya with his hymns.
Devanāgarī: रातहव्यस्य सुष्टुतिं दधृक्स्तोमैर्मनामहे
pada pāṭha: tā | vām | eṣe | rathānām | urvīm | gavyūtim | eṣām || rāta-havyasya | su-stutim | dadhr̥k | stomaiḥ | manāmahe ||5.66.3||

IAST: adhā hi kāvyā yuvaṁ dakṣasya pūrbhir adbhutā
Griffith: And ye show whom, Wondrous Gods with fulness of intellIgence.
Devanāgarī: अधा हि काव्या युवं दक्षस्य पूर्भिरद्भुता
pada pāṭha: adha | hi | kāvyā | yuvam | dakṣasya | pūḥ-bhiḥ | adbhutā || ni | ketunā | janānām | cikethe iti | pūta-dakṣasā ||5.66.4||

IAST: ni ketunā janānāṁ cikethe pūtadakṣasā
Griffith: By men's discernment are Ve marked, O ye whose might is purified.
Devanāgarī: नि केतुना जनानां चिकेथे पूतदक्षसा
pada pāṭha: adha | hi | kāvyā | yuvam | dakṣasya | pūḥ-bhiḥ | adbhutā || ni | ketunā | janānām | cikethe iti | pūta-dakṣasā ||5.66.4||

IAST: tad ṛtam pṛthivi bṛhac chravaeṣa ṛṣīṇām
Griffith: This is the Law sublime, O Earth: to aid the Rsis' toil for fame
Devanāgarī: तदृतं पृथिवि बृहच्छ्रवएष ऋषीणाम्
pada pāṭha: tat | r̥tam | pr̥thivi | br̥hat | śravaḥ-eṣe | r̥ṣīṇām || jrayasānau | aram | pr̥thu | ati | kṣaranti | yāma-bhiḥ ||5.66.5||

IAST: jrayasānāv aram pṛthv ati kṣaranti yāmabhiḥ
Griffith: The Two, wide-spreading, are prepared. They come with ample overflow.
Devanāgarī: ज्रयसानावरं पृथ्वति क्षरन्ति यामभिः
pada pāṭha: tat | r̥tam | pr̥thivi | br̥hat | śravaḥ-eṣe | r̥ṣīṇām || jrayasānau | aram | pr̥thu | ati | kṣaranti | yāma-bhiḥ ||5.66.5||

IAST: ā yad vām īyacakṣasā mitra vayaṁ ca sūrayaḥ
Griffith: Mitra, ye Gods with wandering eyes, would that the worshippers and we
Devanāgarī: आ यद्वामीयचक्षसा मित्र वयं च सूरयः
pada pāṭha: ā | yat | vām | īya-cakṣasā | mitrā | vayam | ca | sūrayaḥ || vyaciṣṭhe | bahu-pāyye | yatemahi | sva-rājye ||5.66.6||

IAST: vyaciṣṭhe bahupāyye yatemahi svarājye
Griffith: Might strive to reach the realm ye rule, most spacious and protected well,
Devanāgarī: व्यचिष्ठे बहुपाय्ये यतेमहि स्वराज्ये
pada pāṭha: ā | yat | vām | īya-cakṣasā | mitrā | vayam | ca | sūrayaḥ || vyaciṣṭhe | bahu-pāyye | yatemahi | sva-rājye ||5.66.6||

IAST: baḻ itthā deva niṣkṛtam ādityā yajatam bṛhat
Griffith: YE Gods, Adityas, Varuna, Aryaman, Mitra, verily
Devanāgarī: बळित्था देव निष्कृतमादित्या यजतं बृहत्
pada pāṭha: baṭ | itthā | devā | niḥ-kr̥tam | ādityā | yajatam | br̥hat || varuṇa | mitra | aryaman | varṣiṣṭham | kṣatram | āśāthe iti ||5.67.1||

IAST: varuṇa mitrāryaman varṣiṣṭhaṁ kṣatram āśāthe
Griffith: Have here obtained supremest sway, high, holy, set apart for you.
Devanāgarī: वरुण मित्रार्यमन्वर्षिष्ठं क्षत्रमाशाथे
pada pāṭha: baṭ | itthā | devā | niḥ-kr̥tam | ādityā | yajatam | br̥hat || varuṇa | mitra | aryaman | varṣiṣṭham | kṣatram | āśāthe iti ||5.67.1||

IAST: ā yad yoniṁ hiraṇyayaṁ varuṇa mitra sadathaḥ
Griffith: When, Varuna and Mitra, ye sit in your golden dwelling-place,
Devanāgarī: आ यद्योनिं हिरण्ययं वरुण मित्र सदथः
pada pāṭha: ā | yat | yonim | hiraṇyayam | varuṇa | mitra | sadathaḥ || dhartārā | carṣaṇīnām | yantam | sumnam | riśādasā ||5.67.2||

IAST: dhartārā carṣaṇīnāṁ yantaṁ sumnaṁ riśādasā
Griffith: Ye Twain, supporters of mankind, foeslayers, give felicity.
Devanāgarī: धर्तारा चर्षणीनां यन्तं सुम्नं रिशादसा
pada pāṭha: ā | yat | yonim | hiraṇyayam | varuṇa | mitra | sadathaḥ || dhartārā | carṣaṇīnām | yantam | sumnam | riśādasā ||5.67.2||

IAST: viśve hi viśvavedaso varuṇo mitro aryamā
Griffith: All these, possessors of all wealth, Varuna, Mitra, Aryaman,
Devanāgarī: विश्वे हि विश्ववेदसो वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा
pada pāṭha: viśve | hi | viśva-vedasaḥ | varuṇaḥ | mitraḥ | aryamā || vratā | padā-iva | saścire | pānti | martyam | riṣaḥ ||5.67.3||

IAST: vratā padeva saścire pānti martyaṁ riṣaḥ
Griffith: Follow their ways, as if with feet, and guard from injury mortal man.
Devanāgarī: व्रता पदेव सश्चिरे पान्ति मर्त्यं रिषः
pada pāṭha: viśve | hi | viśva-vedasaḥ | varuṇaḥ | mitraḥ | aryamā || vratā | padā-iva | saścire | pānti | martyam | riṣaḥ ||5.67.3||

IAST: te hi satyā ṛtaspṛśa ṛtāvāno jane-jane
Griffith: For they are true, they cleave to Law, held holy among every race,
Devanāgarī: ते हि सत्या ऋतस्पृश ऋतावानो जनेजने
pada pāṭha: te | hi | satyāḥ | r̥ta-spr̥śaḥ | r̥ta-vānaḥ | jane-jane || su-nīthāsaḥ | su-dānavaḥ | aṁhoḥ | cit | uru-cakrayaḥ ||5.67.4||

IAST: sunīthāsaḥ sudānavo 'ṁhoś cid urucakrayaḥ
Griffith: Good leaders, bounteous in their gifts, deliverers even from distress.
Devanāgarī: सुनीथासः सुदानवोंऽहोश्चिदुरुचक्रयः
pada pāṭha: te | hi | satyāḥ | r̥ta-spr̥śaḥ | r̥ta-vānaḥ | jane-jane || su-nīthāsaḥ | su-dānavaḥ | aṁhoḥ | cit | uru-cakrayaḥ ||5.67.4||

IAST: ko nu vām mitrāstuto varuṇo vā tanūnām
Griffith: Which of your persons, Varuna or Mitra, merits not our praise?
Devanāgarī: को नु वां मित्रास्तुतो वरुणो वा तनूनाम्
pada pāṭha: kaḥ | nu | vām | mitra | astutaḥ | varuṇaḥ | vā | tanūnām || tat | su | vām | ā | īṣate | matiḥ | atri-bhyaḥ | ā | īṣate | matiḥ ||5.67.5||

IAST: tat su vām eṣate matir atribhya eṣate matiḥ
Griffith: Therefore our thought is turned to you, the Atris' thought is turned to you.
Devanāgarī: तत्सु वामेषते मतिरत्रिभ्य एषते मतिः
pada pāṭha: kaḥ | nu | vām | mitra | astutaḥ | varuṇaḥ | vā | tanūnām || tat | su | vām | ā | īṣate | matiḥ | atri-bhyaḥ | ā | īṣate | matiḥ ||5.67.5||

IAST: pra vo mitrāya gāyata varuṇāya vipā girā
Griffith: SING forth unto your Varuna and Mitra with a song inspired.
Devanāgarī: प्र वो मित्राय गायत वरुणाय विपा गिरा
pada pāṭha: pra | vaḥ | mitrāya | gāyata | varuṇāya | vipā | girā || mahi-kṣatrau | r̥tam | br̥hat ||5.68.1||

IAST: mahikṣatrāv ṛtam bṛhat
Griffith: They, Mighty Lords, are lofty Law
Devanāgarī: महिक्षत्रावृतं बृहत्
pada pāṭha: pra | vaḥ | mitrāya | gāyata | varuṇāya | vipā | girā || mahi-kṣatrau | r̥tam | br̥hat ||5.68.1||

IAST: samrājā yā ghṛtayonī mitraś cobhā varuṇaś ca
Griffith: Full springs of fatness, Sovran Kings, Mitra. and Varuna, the Twain,
Devanāgarī: सम्राजा या घृतयोनी मित्रश्चोभा वरुणश्च
pada pāṭha: sam-rājā | yā | ghr̥tayonī iti ghr̥ta-yonī | mitraḥ | ca | ubhā | varuṇaḥ | ca || devā | deveṣu | pra-śastā ||5.68.2||

IAST: devā deveṣu praśastā
Griffith: Gods glorified among the Gods.
Devanāgarī: देवा देवेषु प्रशस्ता
pada pāṭha: sam-rājā | yā | ghr̥tayonī iti ghr̥ta-yonī | mitraḥ | ca | ubhā | varuṇaḥ | ca || devā | deveṣu | pra-śastā ||5.68.2||

IAST: tā naḥ śaktam pārthivasya maho rāyo divyasya
Griffith: So help ye us to riches, great terrestrial and celestial wealth:
Devanāgarī: ता नः शक्तं पार्थिवस्य महो रायो दिव्यस्य
pada pāṭha: tā | naḥ | śaktam | pārthivasya | mahaḥ | rāyaḥ | divyasya || mahi | vām | kṣatram | deveṣu ||5.68.3||

IAST: mahi vāṁ kṣatraṁ deveṣu
Griffith: Vast is your sway among the Gods.
Devanāgarī: महि वां क्षत्रं देवेषु
pada pāṭha: tā | naḥ | śaktam | pārthivasya | mahaḥ | rāyaḥ | divyasya || mahi | vām | kṣatram | deveṣu ||5.68.3||

IAST: ṛtam ṛtena sapanteṣiraṁ dakṣam āśāte
Griffith: Carefully tending Law with Law they have attained their vigorous might.
Devanāgarī: ऋतमृतेन सपन्तेषिरं दक्षमाशाते
pada pāṭha: r̥tam | r̥tena | sapantā | iṣiram | dakṣam | āśāte iti || adruhā | devau | vardhete iti ||5.68.4||

IAST: adruhā devau vardhete
Griffith: The two Gods wax devoid of guile.
Devanāgarī: अद्रुहा देवौ वर्धेते
pada pāṭha: r̥tam | r̥tena | sapantā | iṣiram | dakṣam | āśāte iti || adruhā | devau | vardhete iti ||5.68.4||

IAST: vṛṣṭidyāvā rītyāpeṣas patī dānumatyāḥ
Griffith: With rainy skies and streaming floods, Lords of the strength that bringeth gifts,
Devanāgarī: वृष्टिद्यावा रीत्यापेषस्पती दानुमत्याः
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣṭi-dyāvā | rīti-āpā | iṣaḥ | patī iti | dānu-matyāḥ || br̥hantam | gartam | āśāte iti ||5.68.5||

IAST: bṛhantaṁ gartam āśāte
Griffith: A lofty seat have they attained.
Devanāgarī: बृहन्तं गर्तमाशाते
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣṭi-dyāvā | rīti-āpā | iṣaḥ | patī iti | dānu-matyāḥ || br̥hantam | gartam | āśāte iti ||5.68.5||

IAST: trī rocanā varuṇa trīm̐r uta dyūn trīṇi mitra dhārayatho rajāṁsi
Griffith: THREE spheres of light, O Varuna, three heavens, three firmaments ye comprehend, O Mitra:
Devanāgarī: त्री रोचना वरुण त्रीँरुत द्यून्त्रीणि मित्र धारयथो रजांसि
pada pāṭha: trī | rocanā | varuṇa | trīn | uta | dyūn | trīṇi | mitra | dhārayathaḥ | rajāṁsi || vavr̥dhānau | amatim | kṣatriyasya | anu | vratam | rakṣamāṇau | ajuryam ||5.69.1||

IAST: vāvṛdhānāv amatiṁ kṣatriyasyānu vrataṁ rakṣamāṇāv ajuryam
Griffith: Waxed strong, ye keep the splendour of dominion, guarding the Ordinance that lasts for ever.
Devanāgarī: वावृधानावमतिं क्षत्रियस्यानु व्रतं रक्षमाणावजुर्यम्
pada pāṭha: trī | rocanā | varuṇa | trīn | uta | dyūn | trīṇi | mitra | dhārayathaḥ | rajāṁsi || vavr̥dhānau | amatim | kṣatriyasya | anu | vratam | rakṣamāṇau | ajuryam ||5.69.1||

IAST: irāvatīr varuṇa dhenavo vām madhumad vāṁ sindhavo mitra duhre
Griffith: Ye, Varuna, have kine who yield refreshment; Mitra, your floods pour water full of sweetness.
Devanāgarī: इरावतीर्वरुण धेनवो वां मधुमद्वां सिन्धवो मित्र दुह्रे
pada pāṭha: irā-vatīḥ | varuṇa | dhenavaḥ | vām | madhu-mat | vām | sindhavaḥ | mitra | duhre || trayaḥ | tasthuḥ | vr̥ṣabhāsaḥ | tisr̥̄ṇām | dhiṣaṇānām | retaḥ-dhāḥ | vi | dyu-mantaḥ ||5.69.2||

IAST: trayas tasthur vṛṣabhāsas tisṛṇāṁ dhiṣaṇānāṁ retodhā vi dyumantaḥ
Griffith: There stand the Three Steers, splendid in their brightness, who fill the three world-bowls with genial m
Devanāgarī: त्रयस्तस्थुर्वृषभासस्तिसृणां धिषणानां रेतोधा वि द्युमन्तः
pada pāṭha: irā-vatīḥ | varuṇa | dhenavaḥ | vām | madhu-mat | vām | sindhavaḥ | mitra | duhre || trayaḥ | tasthuḥ | vr̥ṣabhāsaḥ | tisr̥̄ṇām | dhiṣaṇānām | retaḥ-dhāḥ | vi | dyu-mantaḥ ||5.69.2||

IAST: prātar devīm aditiṁ johavīmi madhyaṁdina uditā sūryasya
Griffith: I call at dawn on Aditi the Goddess, I call at noon and when the Sun is setting.
Devanāgarī: प्रातर्देवीमदितिं जोहवीमि मध्यंदिन उदिता सूर्यस्य
pada pāṭha: prātaḥ | devīm | aditim | johavīmi | madhyaṁdine | ut-itā | sūryasya || rāye | mitrāvaruṇā | sarva-tātā | īḷe | tokāya | tanayāya | śam | yoḥ ||5.69.3||

IAST: rāye mitrāvaruṇā sarvatāteḻe tokāya tanayāya śaṁ yoḥ
Griffith: I pray, O Mitra-Varuna, for safety, for wealth and progeny, in rest and trouble.
Devanāgarī: राये मित्रावरुणा सर्वतातेळे तोकाय तनयाय शं योः
pada pāṭha: prātaḥ | devīm | aditim | johavīmi | madhyaṁdine | ut-itā | sūryasya || rāye | mitrāvaruṇā | sarva-tātā | īḷe | tokāya | tanayāya | śam | yoḥ ||5.69.3||

IAST: yā dhartārā rajaso rocanasyotādityā divyā pārthivasya
Griffith: Ye who uphold the region, sphere of brightness, ye who support earth's realm Divine Adityas,
Devanāgarī: या धर्तारा रजसो रोचनस्योतादित्या दिव्या पार्थिवस्य
pada pāṭha: yā | dhartārā | rajasaḥ | rocanasya | uta | ādityā | divyā | pārthivasya || na | vām | devāḥ | amr̥tāḥ | ā | minanti | vratāni | mitrāvaruṇā | dhruvāṇi ||5.69.4||

IAST: na vāṁ devā amṛtā ā minanti vratāni mitrāvaruṇā dhruvāṇi
Griffith: The Immortal Gods, O Varuna and Mitra, never impair your everlasting statutes.
Devanāgarī: न वां देवा अमृता आ मिनन्ति व्रतानि मित्रावरुणा ध्रुवाणि
pada pāṭha: yā | dhartārā | rajasaḥ | rocanasya | uta | ādityā | divyā | pārthivasya || na | vām | devāḥ | amr̥tāḥ | ā | minanti | vratāni | mitrāvaruṇā | dhruvāṇi ||5.69.4||

IAST: purūruṇā cid dhy asty avo nūnaṁ vāṁ varuṇa
Griffith: EVEN far and wide, O Varuna and Mitra, doth your grace extend.
Devanāgarī: पुरूरुणा चिद्ध्यस्त्यवो नूनं वां वरुण
pada pāṭha: puru-uruṇā | cit | hi | asti | avaḥ | nūnam | vām | varuṇa || mitra | vaṁsi | vām | su-matim ||5.70.1||

IAST: mitra vaṁsi vāṁ sumatim
Griffith: May I obtain your kind good-will.
Devanāgarī: मित्र वंसि वां सुमतिम्
pada pāṭha: puru-uruṇā | cit | hi | asti | avaḥ | nūnam | vām | varuṇa || mitra | vaṁsi | vām | su-matim ||5.70.1||

IAST: tā vāṁ samyag adruhvāṇeṣam aśyāma dhāyase
Griffith: From you, benignant Gods, may we gain fully food for sustenance.
Devanāgarī: ता वां सम्यगद्रुह्वाणेषमश्याम धायसे
pada pāṭha: tā | vām | samyak | adruhvāṇā | iṣam | aśyāma | dhāyase || vayam | te | rudrā | syāma ||5.70.2||

IAST: vayaṁ te rudrā syāma
Griffith: Such, O ye Rudras, my we be.
Devanāgarī: वयं ते रुद्रा स्याम
pada pāṭha: tā | vām | samyak | adruhvāṇā | iṣam | aśyāma | dhāyase || vayam | te | rudrā | syāma ||5.70.2||

IAST: pātaṁ no rudrā pāyubhir uta trāyethāṁ sutrātrā
Griffith: Guard us, O Rudras. with your guar save us, ye skilled to save, my we
Devanāgarī: पातं नो रुद्रा पायुभिरुत त्रायेथां सुत्रात्रा
pada pāṭha: pātam | naḥ | rudrā | pāyu-bhiḥ | uta | trāyethām | su-trātrā || turyāma | dasyūn | tanūbhiḥ ||5.70.3||

IAST: turyāma dasyūn tanūbhiḥ
Griffith: Subdue the Dasyus, we ourselves,
Devanāgarī: तुर्याम दस्यून्तनूभिः
pada pāṭha: pātam | naḥ | rudrā | pāyu-bhiḥ | uta | trāyethām | su-trātrā || turyāma | dasyūn | tanūbhiḥ ||5.70.3||

IAST: mā kasyādbhutakratū yakṣam bhujemā tanūbhiḥ
Griffith: Or ne'er may we, O Wondrous Strong, enjoy another's solemn feast,
Devanāgarī: मा कस्याद्भुतक्रतू यक्षं भुजेमा तनूभिः
pada pāṭha: mā | kasya | adbhutakratū ityadbhuta-kratū | yakṣam | bhujema | tanūbhiḥ || mā | śeṣasā | mā | tanasā ||5.70.4||

IAST: mā śeṣasā mā tanasā
Griffith: Ourselves, our sons, or progeny.
Devanāgarī: मा शेषसा मा तनसा
pada pāṭha: mā | kasya | adbhutakratū ityadbhuta-kratū | yakṣam | bhujema | tanūbhiḥ || mā | śeṣasā | mā | tanasā ||5.70.4||

IAST: ā no gantaṁ riśādasā varuṇa mitra barhaṇā
Griffith: O Varuna and Mitra, ye who slay the foemen, come with might
Devanāgarī: आ नो गन्तं रिशादसा वरुण मित्र बर्हणा
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | gantam | riśādasā | varuṇa | mitra | barhaṇā || upa | imam | cārum | adhvaram ||5.71.1||

IAST: upemaṁ cārum adhvaram
Griffith: To this our goodly sacrifice.
Devanāgarī: उपेमं चारुमध्वरम्
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | gantam | riśādasā | varuṇa | mitra | barhaṇā || upa | imam | cārum | adhvaram ||5.71.1||

IAST: viśvasya hi pracetasā varuṇa mitra rājathaḥ
Griffith: For, Varuna and Mitra, ye Sages are Rulers over all.
Devanāgarī: विश्वस्य हि प्रचेतसा वरुण मित्र राजथः
pada pāṭha: viśvasya | hi | pra-cetasā | varuṇa | mitra | rājathaḥ || īśānā | pipyatam | dhiyaḥ ||5.71.2||

IAST: īśānā pipyataṁ dhiyaḥ
Griffith: Fill full our songs, for this ye can.
Devanāgarī: ईशाना पिप्यतं धियः
pada pāṭha: viśvasya | hi | pra-cetasā | varuṇa | mitra | rājathaḥ || īśānā | pipyatam | dhiyaḥ ||5.71.2||

IAST: upa naḥ sutam ā gataṁ varuṇa mitra dāśuṣaḥ
Griffith: Come to the juice that we have pressed. Varuna, Mitra, come to drink
Devanāgarī: उप नः सुतमा गतं वरुण मित्र दाशुषः
pada pāṭha: upa | naḥ | sutam | ā | gatam | varuṇa | mitra | dāśuṣaḥ || asya | somasya | pītaye ||5.71.3||

IAST: asya somasya pītaye
Griffith: This Soma of the worshipper.
Devanāgarī: अस्य सोमस्य पीतये
pada pāṭha: upa | naḥ | sutam | ā | gatam | varuṇa | mitra | dāśuṣaḥ || asya | somasya | pītaye ||5.71.3||

IAST: ā mitre varuṇe vayaṁ gīrbhir juhumo atrivat
Griffith: To Varuna and Mitra we offerwith songs, as Atri did.
Devanāgarī: आ मित्रे वरुणे वयं गीर्भिर्जुहुमो अत्रिवत्
pada pāṭha: ā | mitre | varuṇe | vayam | gīḥ-bhiḥ | juhumaḥ | atri-vat || ni | barhiṣi | sadatam | soma-pītaye ||5.72.1||

IAST: ni barhiṣi sadataṁ somapītaye
Griffith: Sit on the sacred grass to drink the Soma juice.
Devanāgarī: नि बर्हिषि सदतं सोमपीतये
pada pāṭha: ā | mitre | varuṇe | vayam | gīḥ-bhiḥ | juhumaḥ | atri-vat || ni | barhiṣi | sadatam | soma-pītaye ||5.72.1||

IAST: vratena stho dhruvakṣemā dharmaṇā yātayajjanā
Griffith: By Ordinance and Law ye dwell in peace secure, bestirring men.
Devanāgarī: व्रतेन स्थो ध्रुवक्षेमा धर्मणा यातयज्जना
pada pāṭha: vratena | sthaḥ | dhruva-kṣemā | dharmaṇā | yātayat-janā || ni | barhiṣi | sadatam | soma-pītaye ||5.72.2||

IAST: ni barhiṣi sadataṁ somapītaye
Griffith: Sit on the sacred grass to drink the Soma juice.
Devanāgarī: नि बर्हिषि सदतं सोमपीतये
pada pāṭha: vratena | sthaḥ | dhruva-kṣemā | dharmaṇā | yātayat-janā || ni | barhiṣi | sadatam | soma-pītaye ||5.72.2||

IAST: mitraś ca no varuṇaś ca juṣetāṁ yajñam iṣṭaye
Griffith: May Varuna and Mitra, for our help, accept the sacrifice.
Devanāgarī: मित्रश्च नो वरुणश्च जुषेतां यज्ञमिष्टये
pada pāṭha: mitraḥ | ca | naḥ | varuṇaḥ | ca | juṣetām | yajñam | iṣṭaye || ni | barhiṣi | sadatam | soma-pītaye ||5.72.3||

IAST: ni barhiṣi sadatāṁ somapītaye
Griffith: Sit on the sacred grass to drink the Soma juice.
Devanāgarī: नि बर्हिषि सदतां सोमपीतये
pada pāṭha: mitraḥ | ca | naḥ | varuṇaḥ | ca | juṣetām | yajñam | iṣṭaye || ni | barhiṣi | sadatam | soma-pītaye ||5.72.3||

IAST: yad adya sthaḥ parāvati yad arvāvaty aśvinā
Griffith: WHETHER, O Asvins, ye this day be far remote or near at hand,
Devanāgarī: यदद्य स्थः परावति यदर्वावत्यश्विना
pada pāṭha: yat | adya | sthaḥ | pārā-vati | yat | ārvā-vati | aśvinā || yat | vā | puru | puru-bhujā | yat | antarikṣe | ā | gatam ||5.73.1||

IAST: yad vā purū purubhujā yad antarikṣa ā gatam
Griffith: In many spots or in mid-air, come hither, Lords of ample wealth.
Devanāgarī: यद्वा पुरू पुरुभुजा यदन्तरिक्ष आ गतम्
pada pāṭha: yat | adya | sthaḥ | pārā-vati | yat | ārvā-vati | aśvinā || yat | vā | puru | puru-bhujā | yat | antarikṣe | ā | gatam ||5.73.1||

IAST: iha tyā purubhūtamā purū daṁsāṁsi bibhratā
Griffith: These here, who show o'er widest space, bringing full many a wondrous act,
Devanāgarī: इह त्या पुरुभूतमा पुरू दंसांसि बिभ्रता
pada pāṭha: iha | tyā | puru-bhūtamā | puru | daṁsāṁsi | bibhratā || varasyā | yāmi | adhrigū ityadhri-gū | huve | tuviḥ-tamā | bhuje ||5.73.2||

IAST: varasyā yāmy adhrigū huve tuviṣṭamā bhuje
Griffith: Resistless, lovingly I seek, I call the Mightiest to enjoy.
Devanāgarī: वरस्या याम्यध्रिगू हुवे तुविष्टमा भुजे
pada pāṭha: iha | tyā | puru-bhūtamā | puru | daṁsāṁsi | bibhratā || varasyā | yāmi | adhrigū ityadhri-gū | huve | tuviḥ-tamā | bhuje ||5.73.2||

IAST: īrmānyad vapuṣe vapuś cakraṁ rathasya yemathuḥ
Griffith: Another beauteous wheel have ye fixed there to decorate your car.
Devanāgarī: ईर्मान्यद्वपुषे वपुश्चक्रं रथस्य येमथुः
pada pāṭha: īrmā | anyat | vapuṣe | vapuḥ | cakram | rathasya | yemathuḥ || pari | anyā | nāhuṣā | yugā | mahnā | rajāṁsi | dīyathaḥ ||5.73.3||

IAST: pary anyā nāhuṣā yugā mahnā rajāṁsi dīyathaḥ
Griffith: With others through the realms ye roam in might unto the neighbouring tribes.
Devanāgarī: पर्यन्या नाहुषा युगा मह्ना रजांसि दीयथः
pada pāṭha: īrmā | anyat | vapuṣe | vapuḥ | cakram | rathasya | yemathuḥ || pari | anyā | nāhuṣā | yugā | mahnā | rajāṁsi | dīyathaḥ ||5.73.3||

IAST: tad ū ṣu vām enā kṛtaṁ viśvā yad vām anu ṣṭave
Griffith: That deed of yours that is extolled, Visvas! hath all been done with this.
Devanāgarī: तदू षु वामेना कृतं विश्वा यद्वामनु ष्टवे
pada pāṭha: tat | ūm̐ iti | su | vām | enā | kr̥tam | viśvā | yat | vām | anu | stave || nānā | jātau | arepasā | sam | asme iti | bandhum | ā | īyathuḥ ||5.73.4||

IAST: nānā jātāv arepasā sam asme bandhum eyathuḥ
Griffith: Born otherwise, and spotless, ye have entered kinship's bonds with us.
Devanāgarī: नाना जातावरेपसा समस्मे बन्धुमेयथुः
pada pāṭha: tat | ūm̐ iti | su | vām | enā | kr̥tam | viśvā | yat | vām | anu | stave || nānā | jātau | arepasā | sam | asme iti | bandhum | ā | īyathuḥ ||5.73.4||

IAST: ā yad vāṁ sūryā rathaṁ tiṣṭhad raghuṣyadaṁ sadā
Griffith: When Surya mounted on your car that rolls for ever rapidly,
Devanāgarī: आ यद्वां सूर्या रथं तिष्ठद्रघुष्यदं सदा
pada pāṭha: ā | yat | vām | sūryā | ratham | tiṣṭhat | raghu-syadam | sadā || pari | vām | aruṣāḥ | vayaḥ | ghr̥ṇā | varante | ā-tapaḥ ||5.73.5||

IAST: pari vām aruṣā vayo ghṛṇā varanta ātapaḥ
Griffith: Birds of red hue were round about and burning splendours compassed you.
Devanāgarī: परि वामरुषा वयो घृणा वरन्त आतपः
pada pāṭha: ā | yat | vām | sūryā | ratham | tiṣṭhat | raghu-syadam | sadā || pari | vām | aruṣāḥ | vayaḥ | ghr̥ṇā | varante | ā-tapaḥ ||5.73.5||

IAST: yuvor atriś ciketati narā sumnena cetasā
Griffith: Atri bethinks himself of you, O Heroes, with a friendly mind,
Devanāgarī: युवोरत्रिश्चिकेतति नरा सुम्नेन चेतसा
pada pāṭha: yuvoḥ | atriḥ | ciketati | narā | sumnena | cetasā || gharmam | yat | vām | arepasam | nāsatyā | āsnā | bhuraṇyati ||5.73.6||

IAST: gharmaṁ yad vām arepasaṁ nāsatyāsnā bhuraṇyati
Griffith: What time, Nasatyas, with his mouth he stirs the spotless flame for you.
Devanāgarī: घर्मं यद्वामरेपसं नासत्यास्ना भुरण्यति
pada pāṭha: yuvoḥ | atriḥ | ciketati | narā | sumnena | cetasā || gharmam | yat | vām | arepasam | nāsatyā | āsnā | bhuraṇyati ||5.73.6||

IAST: ugro vāṁ kakuho yayiḥ śṛṇve yāmeṣu saṁtaniḥ
Griffith: Strong is your swiftly moving steed, famed his exertion in the course
Devanāgarī: उग्रो वां ककुहो ययिः शृण्वे यामेषु संतनिः
pada pāṭha: ugraḥ | vām | kakuhaḥ | yayiḥ | śr̥ṇve | yāmeṣu | sam-taniḥ || yat | vām | daṁsaḥ-bhiḥ | aśvinā | atriḥ | narā | ā-vavartati ||5.73.7||

IAST: yad vāṁ daṁsobhir aśvinātrir narāvavartati
Griffith: When by your great deeds, Atyins, Chiefs, Atri is brought to us again.
Devanāgarī: यद्वां दंसोभिरश्विनात्रिर्नराववर्तति
pada pāṭha: ugraḥ | vām | kakuhaḥ | yayiḥ | śr̥ṇve | yāmeṣu | sam-taniḥ || yat | vām | daṁsaḥ-bhiḥ | aśvinā | atriḥ | narā | ā-vavartati ||5.73.7||

IAST: madhva ū ṣu madhūyuvā rudrā siṣakti pipyuṣī
Griffith: Lovers of sweetness, Rudras, she who streams with sweetness waits on you.
Devanāgarī: मध्व ऊ षु मधूयुवा रुद्रा सिषक्ति पिप्युषी
pada pāṭha: madhvaḥ | ūm̐ iti | su | madhu-yuvā | rudrā | sisakti | pipyuṣī || yat | samudrā | ati | parṣathaḥ | pakvāḥ | pr̥kṣaḥ | bharanta | vām ||5.73.8||

IAST: yat samudrāti parṣathaḥ pakvāḥ pṛkṣo bharanta vām
Griffith: When ye have travelled through the seas men bring you gifts of well-dressed food.
Devanāgarī: यत्समुद्राति पर्षथः पक्वाः पृक्षो भरन्त वाम्
pada pāṭha: madhvaḥ | ūm̐ iti | su | madhu-yuvā | rudrā | sisakti | pipyuṣī || yat | samudrā | ati | parṣathaḥ | pakvāḥ | pr̥kṣaḥ | bharanta | vām ||5.73.8||

IAST: satyam id vā u aśvinā yuvām āhur mayobhuvā
Griffith: Asvins, with truth they call you Twain bestowers of felicity;
Devanāgarī: सत्यमिद्वा उ अश्विना युवामाहुर्मयोभुवा
pada pāṭha: satyam | it | vai | ūm̐ iti | aśvinā | yuvām | āhuḥ | mayaḥ-bhuvā || tā | yāman | yāma-hūtamā | yāman | ā | mr̥ḷayat-tamā ||5.73.9||

IAST: tā yāman yāmahūtamā yāmann ā mṛḻayattamā
Griffith: At sacrifice most prompt to hear, most gracious ye at sacrifice.
Devanāgarī: ता यामन्यामहूतमा यामन्ना मृळयत्तमा
pada pāṭha: satyam | it | vai | ūm̐ iti | aśvinā | yuvām | āhuḥ | mayaḥ-bhuvā || tā | yāman | yāma-hūtamā | yāman | ā | mr̥ḷayat-tamā ||5.73.9||

IAST: imā brahmāṇi vardhanāśvibhyāṁ santu śaṁtamā
Griffith: Most pleasing to the Asvins be these prayers which magnify their might,
Devanāgarī: इमा ब्रह्माणि वर्धनाश्विभ्यां सन्तु शंतमा
pada pāṭha: imā | brahmāṇi | vardhanā | aśvi-bhyām | santu | śam-tamā || yā | takṣāma | rathān-iva | avocāma | br̥hat | namaḥ ||5.73.10||

IAST: yā takṣāma rathām̐ ivāvocāma bṛhan namaḥ
Griffith: Which we have fashioned, even as cars high reverence have we spoken forth.
Devanāgarī: या तक्षाम रथाँ इवावोचाम बृहन्नमः
pada pāṭha: imā | brahmāṇi | vardhanā | aśvi-bhyām | santu | śam-tamā || yā | takṣāma | rathān-iva | avocāma | br̥hat | namaḥ ||5.73.10||

IAST: kūṣṭho devāv aśvinādyā divo manāvasū
Griffith: WHERE in the heavens are ye to-day, Gods, Asvins, rich in constancy?
Devanāgarī: कूष्ठो देवावश्विनाद्या दिवो मनावसू
pada pāṭha: kū-sthaḥ | devau | aśvinā | adya | divaḥ | manāvasū iti || tat | śravathaḥ | vr̥ṣaṇvasū iti vr̥ṣaṇ-vasū | atriḥ | vām | ā | vivāsati ||5.74.1||

IAST: tac chravatho vṛṣaṇvasū atrir vām ā vivāsati
Griffith: Hear this, ye excellent as Steers: Atri inviteth you to come.
Devanāgarī: तच्छ्रवथो वृषण्वसू अत्रिर्वामा विवासति
pada pāṭha: kū-sthaḥ | devau | aśvinā | adya | divaḥ | manāvasū iti || tat | śravathaḥ | vr̥ṣaṇvasū iti vr̥ṣaṇ-vasū | atriḥ | vām | ā | vivāsati ||5.74.1||

IAST: kuha tyā kuha nu śrutā divi devā nāsatyā
Griffith: Where are they now? Where are the Twain, the famed Nasatyas, Gods in heaven?
Devanāgarī: कुह त्या कुह नु श्रुता दिवि देवा नासत्या
pada pāṭha: kuha | tyā | kuha | nu | śrutā | divi | devā | nāsatyā || kasmin | ā | yatathaḥ | jane | kaḥ | vām | nadīnām | sacā ||5.74.2||

IAST: kasminn ā yatatho jane ko vāṁ nadīnāṁ sacā
Griffith: Who is the man ye strive to reach? Who of your suppliants is with you?
Devanāgarī: कस्मिन्ना यतथो जने को वां नदीनां सचा
pada pāṭha: kuha | tyā | kuha | nu | śrutā | divi | devā | nāsatyā || kasmin | ā | yatathaḥ | jane | kaḥ | vām | nadīnām | sacā ||5.74.2||

IAST: kaṁ yāthaḥ kaṁ ha gacchathaḥ kam acchā yuñjāthe ratham
Griffith: Whom do ye visit, whom approach? to whom direct your harnessed car?
Devanāgarī: कं याथः कं ह गच्छथः कमच्छा युञ्जाथे रथम्
pada pāṭha: kam | yāthaḥ | kam | ha | gacchathaḥ | kam | accha | yuñjāthe iti | ratham || kasya | brahmāṇi | raṇyathaḥ | vayam | vām | uśmasi | iṣṭaye ||5.74.3||

IAST: kasya brahmāṇi raṇyatho vayaṁ vām uśmasīṣṭaye
Griffith: With whose devotions are ye pleased? We long for you to further us.
Devanāgarī: कस्य ब्रह्माणि रण्यथो वयं वामुश्मसीष्टये
pada pāṭha: kam | yāthaḥ | kam | ha | gacchathaḥ | kam | accha | yuñjāthe iti | ratham || kasya | brahmāṇi | raṇyathaḥ | vayam | vām | uśmasi | iṣṭaye ||5.74.3||

IAST: pauraṁ cid dhy udaprutam paura paurāya jinvathaḥ
Griffith: Ye, Strengtheners, for Paura stir the filler swimming in the flood,
Devanāgarī: पौरं चिद्ध्युदप्रुतं पौर पौराय जिन्वथः
pada pāṭha: pauram | cit | hi | uda-prutam | paura | paurāya | jinvathaḥ || yat | īm | gr̥bhīta-tātaye | siṁham-iva | druhaḥ | pade ||5.74.4||

IAST: yad īṁ gṛbhītatātaye siṁham iva druhas pade
Griffith: Advancing to be captured like a lion to the ambuscade.
Devanāgarī: यदीं गृभीततातये सिंहमिव द्रुहस्पदे
pada pāṭha: pauram | cit | hi | uda-prutam | paura | paurāya | jinvathaḥ || yat | īm | gr̥bhīta-tātaye | siṁham-iva | druhaḥ | pade ||5.74.4||

IAST: pra cyavānāj jujuruṣo vavrim atkaṁ na muñcathaḥ
Griffith: Ye from cyavana worn with age removed his skin as 'twere a robe.
Devanāgarī: प्र च्यवानाज्जुजुरुषो वव्रिमत्कं न मुञ्चथः
pada pāṭha: pra | cyavānāt | jujuruṣaḥ | vavrim | atkam | na | muñcathaḥ || yuvā | yadi | kr̥thaḥ | punaḥ | ā | kāmam | r̥ṇve | vadhvaḥ ||5.74.5||

IAST: yuvā yadī kṛthaḥ punar ā kāmam ṛṇve vadhvaḥ
Griffith: So, when ye made him young again, he stirred the longing of a dame.
Devanāgarī: युवा यदी कृथः पुनरा काममृण्वे वध्वः
pada pāṭha: pra | cyavānāt | jujuruṣaḥ | vavrim | atkam | na | muñcathaḥ || yuvā | yadi | kr̥thaḥ | punaḥ | ā | kāmam | r̥ṇve | vadhvaḥ ||5.74.5||

IAST: asti hi vām iha stotā smasi vāṁ saṁdṛśi śriye
Griffith: Here is the man who lauds you both: to see your glory are we here.
Devanāgarī: अस्ति हि वामिह स्तोता स्मसि वां संदृशि श्रिये
pada pāṭha: asti | hi | vām | iha | stotā | smasi | vām | sam-dr̥śi | śriye || nu | śrutam | me | ā | gatam | avaḥ-bhiḥ | vājinīvasū iti vājinī-vasū ||5.74.6||

IAST: nū śrutam ma ā gatam avobhir vājinīvasū
Griffith: Now bear me, come with saving help, ye who are rich in store of wealth.
Devanāgarī: नू श्रुतं म आ गतमवोभिर्वाजिनीवसू
pada pāṭha: asti | hi | vām | iha | stotā | smasi | vām | sam-dr̥śi | śriye || nu | śrutam | me | ā | gatam | avaḥ-bhiḥ | vājinīvasū iti vājinī-vasū ||5.74.6||

IAST: ko vām adya purūṇām ā vavne martyānām
Griffith: Who among many mortal men this day hath won you to himself?
Devanāgarī: को वामद्य पुरूणामा वव्ने मर्त्यानाम्
pada pāṭha: kaḥ | vām | adya | purūṇām | ā | vavne | martyānām || kaḥ | vipraḥ | vipra-vāhasā | kaḥ | yajñaiḥ | vājinīvasū iti vājinī-vasū ||5.74.7||

IAST: ko vipro vipravāhasā ko yajñair vājinīvasū
Griffith: What bard, accepters of the bard? Who, rich in wealth! with sacrifice?
Devanāgarī: को विप्रो विप्रवाहसा को यज्ञैर्वाजिनीवसू
pada pāṭha: kaḥ | vām | adya | purūṇām | ā | vavne | martyānām || kaḥ | vipraḥ | vipra-vāhasā | kaḥ | yajñaiḥ | vājinīvasū iti vājinī-vasū ||5.74.7||

IAST: ā vāṁ ratho rathānāṁ yeṣṭho yātv aśvinā
Griffith: O Asvins, may your car approach, most excellent of cars for speed.
Devanāgarī: आ वां रथो रथानां येष्ठो यात्वश्विना
pada pāṭha: ā | vām | rathaḥ | rathānām | yeṣṭhaḥ | yātu | aśvinā || puru | cit | asma-yuḥ | tiraḥ | āṅgūṣaḥ | martyeṣu | ā ||5.74.8||

IAST: purū cid asmayus tira āṅgūṣo martyeṣv ā
Griffith: Through many regions may our praise pass onward among mortal men.
Devanāgarī: पुरू चिदस्मयुस्तिर आङ्गूषो मर्त्येष्वा
pada pāṭha: ā | vām | rathaḥ | rathānām | yeṣṭhaḥ | yātu | aśvinā || puru | cit | asma-yuḥ | tiraḥ | āṅgūṣaḥ | martyeṣu | ā ||5.74.8||

IAST: śam ū ṣu vām madhūyuvāsmākam astu carkṛtiḥ
Griffith: May our laudation of you Twain, lovers of meath! be sweet to you.
Devanāgarī: शमू षु वां मधूयुवास्माकमस्तु चर्कृतिः
pada pāṭha: śam | ūm̐ iti | su | vām | madhu-yuvā | asmākam | astu | carkr̥tiḥ || arvācīnā | vi-cetasā | vi-bhiḥ | śyenā-iva | dīyatam ||5.74.9||

IAST: arvācīnā vicetasā vibhiḥ śyeneva dīyatam
Griffith: Fly hitherward, ye wise of heart, like falcons with your winged steeds.
Devanāgarī: अर्वाचीना विचेतसा विभिः श्येनेव दीयतम्
pada pāṭha: śam | ūm̐ iti | su | vām | madhu-yuvā | asmākam | astu | carkr̥tiḥ || arvācīnā | vi-cetasā | vi-bhiḥ | śyenā-iva | dīyatam ||5.74.9||

IAST: aśvinā yad dha karhi cic chuśrūyātam imaṁ havam
Griffith: O Asvins, when at any time ye listen to this call of mine,
Devanāgarī: अश्विना यद्ध कर्हि चिच्छुश्रूयातमिमं हवम्
pada pāṭha: aśvinā | yat | ha | karhi | cit | śuśruyātam | imam | havam || vasvīḥ | ūm̐ iti | su | vām | bhujaḥ | pr̥ñcanti | su | vām | pr̥caḥ ||5.74.10||

IAST: vasvīr ū ṣu vām bhujaḥ pṛñcanti su vām pṛcaḥ
Griffith: For you is dainty food prepared: they mix refreshing food for you.
Devanāgarī: वस्वीरू षु वां भुजः पृञ्चन्ति सु वां पृचः
pada pāṭha: aśvinā | yat | ha | karhi | cit | śuśruyātam | imam | havam || vasvīḥ | ūm̐ iti | su | vām | bhujaḥ | pr̥ñcanti | su | vām | pr̥caḥ ||5.74.10||

IAST: prati priyatamaṁ rathaṁ vṛṣaṇaṁ vasuvāhanam
Griffith: To meet your treasure-bringing car, the mighty car most dear to us,
Devanāgarī: प्रति प्रियतमं रथं वृषणं वसुवाहनम्
pada pāṭha: prati | priya-tamam | ratham | vr̥ṣaṇam | vasu-vāhanam || stotā | vām | aśvinau | r̥ṣiḥ | stomena | prati | bhūṣati | mādhvī iti | mama | śrutam | havam ||5.75.1||

IAST: stotā vām aśvināv ṛṣiḥ stomena prati bhūṣati mādhvī mama śrutaṁ havam
Griffith: Asvins, the Rsi is prepared, your raiser, with his song of praise. Lovers of sweetness, hear my call.
Devanāgarī: स्तोता वामश्विनावृषिः स्तोमेन प्रति भूषति माध्वी मम श्रुतं हवम्
pada pāṭha: prati | priya-tamam | ratham | vr̥ṣaṇam | vasu-vāhanam || stotā | vām | aśvinau | r̥ṣiḥ | stomena | prati | bhūṣati | mādhvī iti | mama | śrutam | havam ||5.75.1||

IAST: atyāyātam aśvinā tiro viśvā ahaṁ sanā
Griffith: Pass, O ye Asvins, pass away beyond all tribes of selfish men,
Devanāgarī: अत्यायातमश्विना तिरो विश्वा अहं सना
pada pāṭha: ati-āyātam | aśvinā | tiraḥ | viśvāḥ | aham | sanā || dasrā | hiraṇyavartanī iti hiraṇya-vartanī | su-sumnā | sindhu-vāhasā | mādhvī iti | mama | śrutam | havam ||5.75.2||

IAST: dasrā hiraṇyavartanī suṣumnā sindhuvāhasā mādhvī mama śrutaṁ havam
Griffith: Wonderful, with your golden paths, most gracious, bringers of the flood. Lovers of sweetness, hear my ca
Devanāgarī: दस्रा हिरण्यवर्तनी सुषुम्ना सिन्धुवाहसा माध्वी मम श्रुतं हवम्
pada pāṭha: ati-āyātam | aśvinā | tiraḥ | viśvāḥ | aham | sanā || dasrā | hiraṇyavartanī iti hiraṇya-vartanī | su-sumnā | sindhu-vāhasā | mādhvī iti | mama | śrutam | havam ||5.75.2||

IAST: ā no ratnāni bibhratāv aśvinā gacchataṁ yuvam
Griffith: Come to us, O ye Asvin Pair, bringing your precious treasures, come
Devanāgarī: आ नो रत्नानि बिभ्रतावश्विना गच्छतं युवम्
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | ratnāni | bibhratau | aśvinā | gacchatam | yuvam || rudrā | hiraṇyavartanī iti hiraṇya-vartanī | juṣāṇā | vājinīvasū iti vājinī-vasū | mādhvī iti | mama | śrutam | havam ||5.75.3||

IAST: rudrā hiraṇyavartanī juṣāṇā vājinīvasū mādhvī mama śrutaṁ havam
Griffith: Ye Rudras, on your paths of gold, rejoicing, rich in store of wealth. Lovers of sweetness, hear my call
Devanāgarī: रुद्रा हिरण्यवर्तनी जुषाणा वाजिनीवसू माध्वी मम श्रुतं हवम्
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | ratnāni | bibhratau | aśvinā | gacchatam | yuvam || rudrā | hiraṇyavartanī iti hiraṇya-vartanī | juṣāṇā | vājinīvasū iti vājinī-vasū | mādhvī iti | mama | śrutam | havam ||5.75.3||

IAST: suṣṭubho vāṁ vṛṣaṇvasū rathe vāṇīcy āhitā
Griffith: O strong and Good, the voice of him who lauds you well cleaves to your car.
Devanāgarī: सुष्टुभो वां वृषण्वसू रथे वाणीच्याहिता
pada pāṭha: su-stubhaḥ | vām | vr̥ṣaṇvasū iti vr̥ṣaṇ-vasū | rathe | vāṇīcī | ā-hitā || uta | vām | kakuhaḥ | mr̥gaḥ | pr̥kṣaḥ | kr̥ṇoti | vāpuṣaḥ | mādhvī iti | mama | śrutam | havam ||5.75.4||

IAST: uta vāṁ kakuho mṛgaḥ pṛkṣaḥ kṛṇoti vāpuṣo mādhvī mama śrutaṁ havam
Griffith: And that great beast, your chariot-steed, fair, wonderful, makes dainty food. Lovers of sweetness, hear
Devanāgarī: उत वां ककुहो मृगः पृक्षः कृणोति वापुषो माध्वी मम श्रुतं हवम्
pada pāṭha: su-stubhaḥ | vām | vr̥ṣaṇvasū iti vr̥ṣaṇ-vasū | rathe | vāṇīcī | ā-hitā || uta | vām | kakuhaḥ | mr̥gaḥ | pr̥kṣaḥ | kr̥ṇoti | vāpuṣaḥ | mādhvī iti | mama | śrutam | havam ||5.75.4||

IAST: bodhinmanasā rathyeṣirā havanaśrutā
Griffith: Watchful in spirit, born on cars, impetuous, listing to his cry,
Devanāgarī: बोधिन्मनसा रथ्येषिरा हवनश्रुता
pada pāṭha: bodhit-manasā | rathyā | iṣirā | havana-śrutā || vi-bhiḥ | cyavānam | aśvinā | ni | yāthaḥ | advayāvinam | mādhvī iti | mama | śrutam | havam ||5.75.5||

IAST: vibhiś cyavānam aśvinā ni yātho advayāvinam mādhvī mama śrutaṁ havam
Griffith: Asvins, with winged steeds ye speed down to cyavana void of guile. Lovers of sweetness, hear my call.
Devanāgarī: विभिश्च्यवानमश्विना नि याथो अद्वयाविनं माध्वी मम श्रुतं हवम्
pada pāṭha: bodhit-manasā | rathyā | iṣirā | havana-śrutā || vi-bhiḥ | cyavānam | aśvinā | ni | yāthaḥ | advayāvinam | mādhvī iti | mama | śrutam | havam ||5.75.5||

IAST: ā vāṁ narā manoyujo 'śvāsaḥ pruṣitapsavaḥ
Griffith: Hither, O Heroes, let your steeds, of dappled hue, yoked at the thought,
Devanāgarī: आ वां नरा मनोयुजोऽश्वासः प्रुषितप्सवः
pada pāṭha: ā | vām | narā | manaḥ-yujaḥ | aśvāsaḥ | pruṣita-psavaḥ || vayaḥ | vahantu | pītaye | saha | sumnebhiḥ | aśvinā | mādhvī iti | mama | śrutam | havam ||5.75.6||

IAST: vayo vahantu pītaye saha sumnebhir aśvinā mādhvī mama śrutaṁ havam
Griffith: Your flying steeds, O Asvins, bring you hitherward, with bliss, to drink. Lovers of sweetness, hear my c
Devanāgarī: वयो वहन्तु पीतये सह सुम्नेभिरश्विना माध्वी मम श्रुतं हवम्
pada pāṭha: ā | vām | narā | manaḥ-yujaḥ | aśvāsaḥ | pruṣita-psavaḥ || vayaḥ | vahantu | pītaye | saha | sumnebhiḥ | aśvinā | mādhvī iti | mama | śrutam | havam ||5.75.6||

IAST: aśvināv eha gacchataṁ nāsatyā mā vi venatam
Griffith: O Asvins, hither come to us; Nasatyas, be not disinclined.
Devanāgarī: अश्विनावेह गच्छतं नासत्या मा वि वेनतम्
pada pāṭha: aśvinau | ā | iha | gacchatam | nāsatyā | mā | vi | venatam || tiraḥ | cit | arya-yā | pari | vartiḥ | yātam | adābhyā | mādhvī iti | mama | śrutam | havam ||5.75.7||

IAST: tiraś cid aryayā pari vartir yātam adābhyā mādhvī mama śrutaṁ havam
Griffith: Through longing for the pious turn out of the way to reach our home. Lovers of sweetness, bear my call.
Devanāgarī: तिरश्चिदर्यया परि वर्तिर्यातमदाभ्या माध्वी मम श्रुतं हवम्
pada pāṭha: aśvinau | ā | iha | gacchatam | nāsatyā | mā | vi | venatam || tiraḥ | cit | arya-yā | pari | vartiḥ | yātam | adābhyā | mādhvī iti | mama | śrutam | havam ||5.75.7||

IAST: asmin yajñe adābhyā jaritāraṁ śubhas patī
Griffith: Ye Lords of Splendour, free from guile, come, stand at this our sacrifice.
Devanāgarī: अस्मिन्यज्ञे अदाभ्या जरितारं शुभस्पती
pada pāṭha: asmin | yajñe | adābhyā | jaritāram | śubhaḥ | patī iti || avasyum | aśvinā | yuvam | gr̥ṇantam | upa | bhūṣathaḥ | mādhvī iti | mama | śrutam | havam ||5.75.8||

IAST: avasyum aśvinā yuvaṁ gṛṇantam upa bhūṣatho mādhvī mama śrutaṁ havam
Griffith: Beside the singer, Asvins, who longs for your grace and lauds you both. Lovers of sweetness, hear my cal
Devanāgarī: अवस्युमश्विना युवं गृणन्तमुप भूषथो माध्वी मम श्रुतं हवम्
pada pāṭha: asmin | yajñe | adābhyā | jaritāram | śubhaḥ | patī iti || avasyum | aśvinā | yuvam | gr̥ṇantam | upa | bhūṣathaḥ | mādhvī iti | mama | śrutam | havam ||5.75.8||

IAST: abhūd uṣā ruśatpaśur āgnir adhāyy ṛtviyaḥ
Griffith: Dawn with her white herd hath appeared, and in due time hath fire been placed.
Devanāgarī: अभूदुषा रुशत्पशुराग्निरधाय्यृत्वियः
pada pāṭha: abhūt | uṣāḥ | ruśat-paśuḥ | ā | agniḥ | adhāyi | r̥tviyaḥ || ayoji | vām | vr̥ṣaṇvasū iti vr̥ṣaṇ-vasū | rathaḥ | dasrau | amartyaḥ | mādhvī iti | mama | śrutam | havam ||5.75.9||

IAST: ayoji vāṁ vṛṣaṇvasū ratho dasrāv amartyo mādhvī mama śrutaṁ havam
Griffith: Harnessed is your immortal car, O WonderWorkers, strong and kind. Lovers of sweetness, bear my call.
Devanāgarī: अयोजि वां वृषण्वसू रथो दस्रावमर्त्यो माध्वी मम श्रुतं हवम्
