pada pāṭha: abhūt | uṣāḥ | ruśat-paśuḥ | ā | agniḥ | adhāyi | r̥tviyaḥ || ayoji | vām | vr̥ṣaṇvasū iti vr̥ṣaṇ-vasū | rathaḥ | dasrau | amartyaḥ | mādhvī iti | mama | śrutam | havam ||5.75.9||

IAST: ā bhāty agnir uṣasām anīkam ud viprāṇāṁ devayā vāco asthuḥ
Griffith: AGNI, the bright face of the Dawns, is shining; the singers' pious voices have ascended.
Devanāgarī: आ भात्यग्निरुषसामनीकमुद्विप्राणां देवया वाचो अस्थुः
pada pāṭha: ā | bhāti | agniḥ | uṣasām | anīkam | ut | viprāṇām | deva-yāḥ | vācaḥ | asthuḥ || arvāñcā | nūnam | rathyā | iha | yātam | pīpi-vāṁsam | aśvinā | gharmam | accha ||5.76.1||

IAST: arvāñcā nūnaṁ rathyeha yātam pīpivāṁsam aśvinā gharmam accha
Griffith: Borne on your chariot, Asvins, turn you hither and come unto our full and rich libation.
Devanāgarī: अर्वाञ्चा नूनं रथ्येह यातं पीपिवांसमश्विना घर्ममच्छ
pada pāṭha: ā | bhāti | agniḥ | uṣasām | anīkam | ut | viprāṇām | deva-yāḥ | vācaḥ | asthuḥ || arvāñcā | nūnam | rathyā | iha | yātam | pīpi-vāṁsam | aśvinā | gharmam | accha ||5.76.1||

IAST: na saṁskṛtam pra mimīto gamiṣṭhānti nūnam aśvinopastuteha
Griffith: Most frequent guests, they scorn not what is ready: even now the lauded Asvins are beside us.
Devanāgarī: न संस्कृतं प्र मिमीतो गमिष्ठान्ति नूनमश्विनोपस्तुतेह
pada pāṭha: na | saṁskr̥tam | pra | mimītaḥ | gamiṣṭhā | anti | nūnam | aśvinā | upa-stutā | iha || divā | abhi-pitve | avasā | ā-gamiṣṭhā | prati | avartim | dāśuṣe | śam-bhaviṣṭhā ||5.76.2||

IAST: divābhipitve 'vasāgamiṣṭhā praty avartiṁ dāśuṣe śambhaviṣṭhā
Griffith: With promptest aid they come at morn and evening, the worshipper's most blessed guards from trouble.
Devanāgarī: दिवाभिपित्वेऽवसागमिष्ठा प्रत्यवर्तिं दाशुषे शम्भविष्ठा
pada pāṭha: na | saṁskr̥tam | pra | mimītaḥ | gamiṣṭhā | anti | nūnam | aśvinā | upa-stutā | iha || divā | abhi-pitve | avasā | ā-gamiṣṭhā | prati | avartim | dāśuṣe | śam-bhaviṣṭhā ||5.76.2||

IAST: utā yātaṁ saṁgave prātar ahno madhyaṁdina uditā sūryasya
Griffith: Yea, come at milking-time, at early morning, at noon of day and when the Sun is setting,
Devanāgarī: उता यातं संगवे प्रातरह्नो मध्यंदिन उदिता सूर्यस्य
pada pāṭha: uta | ā | yātam | sam-gave | prātaḥ | ahnaḥ | madhyaṁdine | ut-itā | sūryasya || divā | naktam | avasā | śam-tamena | na | idānīm | pītiḥ | aśvinā | ā | tatāna ||5.76.3||

IAST: divā naktam avasā śaṁtamena nedānīm pītir aśvinā tatāna
Griffith: By day, by night, with favour most auspicious. Not only now the draught hath drawn the Asvins.
Devanāgarī: दिवा नक्तमवसा शंतमेन नेदानीं पीतिरश्विना ततान
pada pāṭha: uta | ā | yātam | sam-gave | prātaḥ | ahnaḥ | madhyaṁdine | ut-itā | sūryasya || divā | naktam | avasā | śam-tamena | na | idānīm | pītiḥ | aśvinā | ā | tatāna ||5.76.3||

IAST: idaṁ hi vām pradivi sthānam oka ime gṛhā aśvinedaṁ duroṇam
Griffith: For this place, Asvins, was of old your dwelling, these were your houses, this your habitation.
Devanāgarī: इदं हि वां प्रदिवि स्थानमोक इमे गृहा अश्विनेदं दुरोणम्
pada pāṭha: idam | hi | vām | pra-divi | sthānam | okaḥ | ime | gr̥hāḥ | aśvinā | idam | duroṇam || ā | naḥ | divaḥ | br̥hataḥ | parvatāt | ā | at-bhyaḥ | yātam | iṣam | ūrjam | vahantā ||5.76.4||

IAST: ā no divo bṛhataḥ parvatād ādbhyo yātam iṣam ūrjaṁ vahantā
Griffith: Come to us from high heaven and from the mountain. Come from the waters bringing food and vigour.
Devanāgarī: आ नो दिवो बृहतः पर्वतादाद्भ्यो यातमिषमूर्जं वहन्ता
pada pāṭha: idam | hi | vām | pra-divi | sthānam | okaḥ | ime | gr̥hāḥ | aśvinā | idam | duroṇam || ā | naḥ | divaḥ | br̥hataḥ | parvatāt | ā | at-bhyaḥ | yātam | iṣam | ūrjam | vahantā ||5.76.4||

IAST: sam aśvinor avasā nūtanena mayobhuvā supraṇītī gamema
Griffith: May we obtain the Asvins' newest favour, and gain their health-bestowing happy guidance.
Devanāgarī: समश्विनोरवसा नूतनेन मयोभुवा सुप्रणीती गमेम
pada pāṭha: sam | aśvinoḥ | avasā | nūtanena | mayaḥ-bhuvā | su-pranītī | gamema || ā | naḥ | rayim | vahatam | ā | uta | vīrān | ā | viśvāni | amr̥tā | saubhagāni ||5.76.5||

IAST: ā no rayiṁ vahatam ota vīrān ā viśvāny amṛtā saubhagāni
Griffith: Bring riches hither unto us, and heroes, and all felicity and joy, Immortals!
Devanāgarī: आ नो रयिं वहतमोत वीराना विश्वान्यमृता सौभगानि
pada pāṭha: sam | aśvinoḥ | avasā | nūtanena | mayaḥ-bhuvā | su-pranītī | gamema || ā | naḥ | rayim | vahatam | ā | uta | vīrān | ā | viśvāni | amr̥tā | saubhagāni ||5.76.5||

IAST: prātaryāvāṇā prathamā yajadhvam purā gṛdhrād araruṣaḥ pibātaḥ
Griffith: FIRST worship those who come at early morning: let the Twain drink before the giftless niggard.
Devanāgarī: प्रातर्यावाणा प्रथमा यजध्वं पुरा गृध्रादररुषः पिबातः
pada pāṭha: prātaḥ-yāvānā | prathamā | yajadhvam | purā | gr̥dhrāt | araruṣaḥ | pibātaḥ || prātaḥ | hi | yajñam | aśvinā | dadhāte iti | pra | śaṁsanti | kavayaḥ | pūrva-bhājaḥ ||5.77.1||

IAST: prātar hi yajñam aśvinā dadhāte pra śaṁsanti kavayaḥ pūrvabhājaḥ
Griffith: The Asvins claim the sacrifice at daybreak: the sages yielding the first share extol them.
Devanāgarī: प्रातर्हि यज्ञमश्विना दधाते प्र शंसन्ति कवयः पूर्वभाजः
pada pāṭha: prātaḥ-yāvānā | prathamā | yajadhvam | purā | gr̥dhrāt | araruṣaḥ | pibātaḥ || prātaḥ | hi | yajñam | aśvinā | dadhāte iti | pra | śaṁsanti | kavayaḥ | pūrva-bhājaḥ ||5.77.1||

IAST: prātar yajadhvam aśvinā hinota na sāyam asti devayā ajuṣṭam
Griffith: Worship at dawn and instigate the Asvins:nor is the worshipper at eve rejected.
Devanāgarī: प्रातर्यजध्वमश्विना हिनोत न सायमस्ति देवया अजुष्टम्
pada pāṭha: prātaḥ | yajadhvam | aśvinā | hinota | na | sāyam | asti | deva-yāḥ | ajuṣṭam || uta | anyaḥ | asmat | yajate | vi | ca | āvaḥ | pūrvaḥ-pūrvaḥ | yajamānaḥ | vanīyān ||5.77.2||

IAST: utānyo asmad yajate vi cāvaḥ pūrvaḥ-pūrvo yajamāno vanīyān
Griffith: Besides ourselves another craves and worships: each first in worship is most highly favoured.
Devanāgarī: उतान्यो अस्मद्यजते वि चावः पूर्वःपूर्वो यजमानो वनीयान्
pada pāṭha: prātaḥ | yajadhvam | aśvinā | hinota | na | sāyam | asti | deva-yāḥ | ajuṣṭam || uta | anyaḥ | asmat | yajate | vi | ca | āvaḥ | pūrvaḥ-pūrvaḥ | yajamānaḥ | vanīyān ||5.77.2||

IAST: hiraṇyatvaṅ madhuvarṇo ghṛtasnuḥ pṛkṣo vahann ā ratho vartate vām
Griffith: Covered with gold, meath-tinted, dropping fatness, your chariot with its freight of food comes hither,
Devanāgarī: हिरण्यत्वङ्मधुवर्णो घृतस्नुः पृक्षो वहन्ना रथो वर्तते वाम्
pada pāṭha: hiraṇya-tvak | madhu-varṇaḥ | ghr̥ta-snuḥ | pr̥kṣaḥ | vahan | ā | rathaḥ | vartate | vām || manaḥ-javāḥ | aśvinā | vāta-raṁhāḥ | yena | ati-yāthaḥ | duḥ-itāni | viśvā ||5.77.3||

IAST: manojavā aśvinā vātaraṁhā yenātiyātho duritāni viśvā
Griffith: Swift as thought, Asvins, rapid as the tempest, wherewith ye travel over all obstructions.
Devanāgarī: मनोजवा अश्विना वातरंहा येनातियाथो दुरितानि विश्वा
pada pāṭha: hiraṇya-tvak | madhu-varṇaḥ | ghr̥ta-snuḥ | pr̥kṣaḥ | vahan | ā | rathaḥ | vartate | vām || manaḥ-javāḥ | aśvinā | vāta-raṁhāḥ | yena | ati-yāthaḥ | duḥ-itāni | viśvā ||5.77.3||

IAST: yo bhūyiṣṭhaṁ nāsatyābhyāṁ viveṣa caniṣṭham pitvo rarate vibhāge
Griffith: He who hath served most often the Nasatyas, and gives the sweetest food at distribution,
Devanāgarī: यो भूयिष्ठं नासत्याभ्यां विवेष चनिष्ठं पित्वो ररते विभागे
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | bhūyiṣṭham | nāsatyābhyām | viveṣa | caniṣṭham | pitvaḥ | rarate | vi-bhāge || saḥ | tokam | asya | pīparat | śamībhiḥ | anūrdhva-bhāsaḥ | sadam | it | tuturyāt ||5.77.4||

IAST: sa tokam asya pīparac chamībhir anūrdhvabhāsaḥ sadam it tuturyāt
Griffith: Furthers with his own holy works his offspring, and ever passes those whose flames ascend not.
Devanāgarī: स तोकमस्य पीपरच्छमीभिरनूर्ध्वभासः सदमित्तुतुर्यात्
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | bhūyiṣṭham | nāsatyābhyām | viveṣa | caniṣṭham | pitvaḥ | rarate | vi-bhāge || saḥ | tokam | asya | pīparat | śamībhiḥ | anūrdhva-bhāsaḥ | sadam | it | tuturyāt ||5.77.4||

IAST: sam aśvinor avasā nūtanena mayobhuvā supraṇītī gamema
Griffith: May we obtain the Asvins' newest favour, and gain their health-bestowing happy ildance.
Devanāgarī: समश्विनोरवसा नूतनेन मयोभुवा सुप्रणीती गमेम
pada pāṭha: sam | aśvinoḥ | avasā | nūtanena | mayaḥ-bhuvā | su-pranītī | gamema || ā | naḥ | rayim | vahatam | ā | uta | vīrān | ā | viśvāni | amr̥tā | saubhagāni ||5.77.5||

IAST: ā no rayiṁ vahatam ota vīrān ā viśvāny amṛtā saubhagāni
Griffith: Bring riches hither unto us, and heroes, and all felicity and joy, Immortals!
Devanāgarī: आ नो रयिं वहतमोत वीराना विश्वान्यमृता सौभगानि
pada pāṭha: sam | aśvinoḥ | avasā | nūtanena | mayaḥ-bhuvā | su-pranītī | gamema || ā | naḥ | rayim | vahatam | ā | uta | vīrān | ā | viśvāni | amr̥tā | saubhagāni ||5.77.5||

IAST: aśvināv eha gacchataṁ nāsatyā mā vi venatam
Griffith: YE Asvins, hither come to us: Nasatyas, be not disinclined.
Devanāgarī: अश्विनावेह गच्छतं नासत्या मा वि वेनतम्
pada pāṭha: aśvinau | ā | iha | gacchatam | nāsatyā | mā | vi | venatam || haṁsau-iva | patatam | ā | sutān | upa ||5.78.1||

IAST: haṁsāv iva patatam ā sutām̐ upa
Griffith: Fly hither like two swans unto the juice we shed.
Devanāgarī: हंसाविव पततमा सुताँ उप
pada pāṭha: aśvinau | ā | iha | gacchatam | nāsatyā | mā | vi | venatam || haṁsau-iva | patatam | ā | sutān | upa ||5.78.1||

IAST: aśvinā hariṇāv iva gaurāv ivānu yavasam
Griffith: O Asvins, like a pair of deer, like two wild cattle to the mead:
Devanāgarī: अश्विना हरिणाविव गौराविवानु यवसम्
pada pāṭha: aśvinā | hariṇau-iva | gaurau-iva | anu | yavasam || haṁsau-iva | patatam | ā | sutān | upa ||5.78.2||

IAST: haṁsāv iva patatam ā sutām̐ upa
Griffith: Fly hither like two swans unto the juice we shed.
Devanāgarī: हंसाविव पततमा सुताँ उप
pada pāṭha: aśvinā | hariṇau-iva | gaurau-iva | anu | yavasam || haṁsau-iva | patatam | ā | sutān | upa ||5.78.2||

IAST: aśvinā vājinīvasū juṣethāṁ yajñam iṣṭaye
Griffith: O Asvins rich in gifts, accept our sacrifice to prosper it:
Devanāgarī: अश्विना वाजिनीवसू जुषेथां यज्ञमिष्टये
pada pāṭha: aśvinā | vājinīvasū iti vājinī-vasū | juṣethām | yajñam | iṣṭaye || haṁsau-iva | patatam | ā | sutān | upa ||5.78.3||

IAST: haṁsāv iva patatam ā sutām̐ upa
Griffith: Fly hither like two swans unto the juice we shed.
Devanāgarī: हंसाविव पततमा सुताँ उप
pada pāṭha: aśvinā | vājinīvasū iti vājinī-vasū | juṣethām | yajñam | iṣṭaye || haṁsau-iva | patatam | ā | sutān | upa ||5.78.3||

IAST: atrir yad vām avarohann ṛbīsam ajohavīn nādhamāneva yoṣā
Griffith: As Atri when descending to the cavem called on you loudly like a wailing woman.
Devanāgarī: अत्रिर्यद्वामवरोहन्नृबीसमजोहवीन्नाधमानेव योषा
pada pāṭha: atriḥ | yat | vām | ava-rohan | r̥bīsam | ajohavīt | nādhamānā-iva | yoṣā || śyenasya | cit | javasā | nūtanena | ā | agacchatam | aśvinā | śam-tamena ||5.78.4||

IAST: śyenasya cij javasā nūtanenāgacchatam aśvinā śaṁtamena
Griffith: Ye came to him, O Asvins, with the freshest and most auspicious fleetness of a falcon.
Devanāgarī: श्येनस्य चिज्जवसा नूतनेनागच्छतमश्विना शंतमेन
pada pāṭha: atriḥ | yat | vām | ava-rohan | r̥bīsam | ajohavīt | nādhamānā-iva | yoṣā || śyenasya | cit | javasā | nūtanena | ā | agacchatam | aśvinā | śam-tamena ||5.78.4||

IAST: vi jihīṣva vanaspate yoniḥ sūṣyantyā iva
Griffith: Tree, part asunder like the side of her who bringeth forth a child.
Devanāgarī: वि जिहीष्व वनस्पते योनिः सूष्यन्त्या इव
pada pāṭha: vi | jihīṣva | vanaspate | yoniḥ | sūṣyantyāḥ-iva || śrutam | me | aśvinā | havam | sapta-vadhrim | ca | muñcatam ||5.78.5||

IAST: śrutam me aśvinā havaṁ saptavadhriṁ ca muñcatam
Griffith: Ye Asvins, listen to my call: loose Saptavadhri from his bonds.
Devanāgarī: श्रुतं मे अश्विना हवं सप्तवध्रिं च मुञ्चतम्
pada pāṭha: vi | jihīṣva | vanaspate | yoniḥ | sūṣyantyāḥ-iva || śrutam | me | aśvinā | havam | sapta-vadhrim | ca | muñcatam ||5.78.5||

IAST: bhītāya nādhamānāya ṛṣaye saptavadhraye
Griffith: For Saptavadhri, for the seer affrighted when he wept and wafled,
Devanāgarī: भीताय नाधमानाय ऋषये सप्तवध्रये
pada pāṭha: bhītāya | nādhamānāya | r̥ṣaye | sapta-vadhraye || māyābhiḥ | aśvinā | yuvam | vr̥kṣam | sam | ca | vi | ca | acathaḥ ||5.78.6||

IAST: māyābhir aśvinā yuvaṁ vṛkṣaṁ saṁ ca vi cācathaḥ
Griffith: Ye, Asvins, with your magic powers rent up the tree and shattered it.
Devanāgarī: मायाभिरश्विना युवं वृक्षं सं च वि चाचथः
pada pāṭha: bhītāya | nādhamānāya | r̥ṣaye | sapta-vadhraye || māyābhiḥ | aśvinā | yuvam | vr̥kṣam | sam | ca | vi | ca | acathaḥ ||5.78.6||

IAST: yathā vātaḥ puṣkariṇīṁ samiṅgayati sarvataḥ
Griffith: Like as the wind on every side ruffles a pool of lotuses,
Devanāgarī: यथा वातः पुष्करिणीं समिङ्गयति सर्वतः
pada pāṭha: yathā | vātaḥ | puṣkariṇīm | sam-iṅgayati | sarvataḥ || eva | te | garbhaḥ | ejatu | niḥ-aitu | daśa-māsyaḥ ||5.78.7||

IAST: evā te garbha ejatu niraitu daśamāsyaḥ
Griffith: So stir in thee the babe unborn, so may the ten-month babe descend.
Devanāgarī: एवा ते गर्भ एजतु निरैतु दशमास्यः
pada pāṭha: yathā | vātaḥ | puṣkariṇīm | sam-iṅgayati | sarvataḥ || eva | te | garbhaḥ | ejatu | niḥ-aitu | daśa-māsyaḥ ||5.78.7||

IAST: yathā vāto yathā vanaṁ yathā samudra ejati
Griffith: Like as the wind, like as the wood, like as the sea is set astir,
Devanāgarī: यथा वातो यथा वनं यथा समुद्र एजति
pada pāṭha: yathā | vātaḥ | yathā | vanam | yathā | samudraḥ | ejati || eva | tvam | daśa-māsya | saha | ava | ihi | jarāyuṇā ||5.78.8||

IAST: evā tvaṁ daśamāsya sahāvehi jarāyuṇā
Griffith: So also, ten-month babe, descend together with the after-birth.
Devanāgarī: एवा त्वं दशमास्य सहावेहि जरायुणा
pada pāṭha: yathā | vātaḥ | yathā | vanam | yathā | samudraḥ | ejati || eva | tvam | daśa-māsya | saha | ava | ihi | jarāyuṇā ||5.78.8||

IAST: daśa māsāñ chaśayānaḥ kumāro adhi mātari
Griffith: The child who hath for ten months' time been lying in his mother's side,-
Devanāgarī: दश मासाञ्छशयानः कुमारो अधि मातरि
pada pāṭha: daśa | māsān | śaśayānaḥ | kumāraḥ | adhi | mātari || niḥ-aitu | jīvaḥ | akṣataḥ | jīvaḥ | jīvantyāḥ | adhi ||5.78.9||

IAST: niraitu jīvo akṣato jīvo jīvantyā adhi
Griffith: May he come forth alive, unharmed, yea, livingfrorn the living dame.
Devanāgarī: निरैतु जीवो अक्षतो जीवो जीवन्त्या अधि
pada pāṭha: daśa | māsān | śaśayānaḥ | kumāraḥ | adhi | mātari || niḥ-aitu | jīvaḥ | akṣataḥ | jīvaḥ | jīvantyāḥ | adhi ||5.78.9||

IAST: mahe no adya bodhayoṣo rāye divitmatī
Griffith: O HEAVENLY Dawn, awaken us to ample opulence to-day
Devanāgarī: महे नो अद्य बोधयोषो राये दिवित्मती
pada pāṭha: mahe | naḥ | adya | bodhaya | uṣaḥ | rāye | divitmatī || yathā | cit | naḥ | abodhayaḥ | satya-śravasi | vāyye | su-jāte | aśva-sūnr̥te ||5.79.1||

IAST: yathā cin no abodhayaḥ satyaśravasi vāyye sujāte aśvasūnṛte
Griffith: Even as thou hast wakened us with Satyasravas, Vayya's son, high-born! delightful with thy steeds!
Devanāgarī: यथा चिन्नो अबोधयः सत्यश्रवसि वाय्ये सुजाते अश्वसूनृते
pada pāṭha: mahe | naḥ | adya | bodhaya | uṣaḥ | rāye | divitmatī || yathā | cit | naḥ | abodhayaḥ | satya-śravasi | vāyye | su-jāte | aśva-sūnr̥te ||5.79.1||

IAST: yā sunīthe śaucadrathe vy auccho duhitar divaḥ
Griffith: Daughter of Heaven, thou dawnedst on Sunitha Sucadratha's son,
Devanāgarī: या सुनीथे शौचद्रथे व्यौच्छो दुहितर्दिवः
pada pāṭha: yā | su-nīthe | śaucat-rathe | vi | aucchaḥ | duhitaḥ | divaḥ || sā | vi | uccha | sahīyasi | satya-śravasi | vāyye | su-jāte | aśva-sūnr̥te ||5.79.2||

IAST: sā vy uccha sahīyasi satyaśravasi vāyye sujāte aśvasūnṛte
Griffith: So dawn thou on one mightier still, on Satyasravas, Vayya's son, high-born! delightful with thy steeds!
Devanāgarī: सा व्युच्छ सहीयसि सत्यश्रवसि वाय्ये सुजाते अश्वसूनृते
pada pāṭha: yā | su-nīthe | śaucat-rathe | vi | aucchaḥ | duhitaḥ | divaḥ || sā | vi | uccha | sahīyasi | satya-śravasi | vāyye | su-jāte | aśva-sūnr̥te ||5.79.2||

IAST: sā no adyābharadvasur vy ucchā duhitar divaḥ
Griffith: So, bringing treasure, dawn to-day on us thou Daughter of the Sky,
Devanāgarī: सा नो अद्याभरद्वसुर्व्युच्छा दुहितर्दिवः
pada pāṭha: sā | naḥ | adya | ābharat-vasuḥ | vi | uccha | duhitaḥ | divaḥ || yo iti | vi | aucchaḥ | sahīyasi | satya-śravasi | vāyye | su-jāte | aśva-sūnr̥te ||5.79.3||

IAST: yo vy aucchaḥ sahīyasi satyaśravasi vāyye sujāte aśvasūnṛte
Griffith: As thou, O mightier yet. didst shine for Satyatravas, Vayya's son, high-born! delightful with thy steeds
Devanāgarī: यो व्यौच्छः सहीयसि सत्यश्रवसि वाय्ये सुजाते अश्वसूनृते
pada pāṭha: sā | naḥ | adya | ābharat-vasuḥ | vi | uccha | duhitaḥ | divaḥ || yo iti | vi | aucchaḥ | sahīyasi | satya-śravasi | vāyye | su-jāte | aśva-sūnr̥te ||5.79.3||

IAST: abhi ye tvā vibhāvari stomair gṛṇanti vahnayaḥ
Griffith: Here round about thee are the priests who laud thee, Bright One, with their hymns,
Devanāgarī: अभि ये त्वा विभावरि स्तोमैर्गृणन्ति वह्नयः
pada pāṭha: abhi | ye | tvā | vibhā-vari | stomaiḥ | gr̥ṇanti | vahnayaḥ || maghaiḥ | maghoni | su-śriyaḥ | dāman-vantaḥ | su-rātayaḥ | su-jāte | aśva-sūnr̥te ||5.79.4||

IAST: maghair maghoni suśriyo dāmanvantaḥ surātayaḥ sujāte aśvasūnṛte
Griffith: And men with gifts, O Bounteous Dame, splendid with wealth and offering much, high-born! delightful wit
Devanāgarī: मघैर्मघोनि सुश्रियो दामन्वन्तः सुरातयः सुजाते अश्वसूनृते
pada pāṭha: abhi | ye | tvā | vibhā-vari | stomaiḥ | gr̥ṇanti | vahnayaḥ || maghaiḥ | maghoni | su-śriyaḥ | dāman-vantaḥ | su-rātayaḥ | su-jāte | aśva-sūnr̥te ||5.79.4||

IAST: yac cid dhi te gaṇā ime chadayanti maghattaye
Griffith: Whatever these thy bands perform to please thee or to win them wealth,
Devanāgarī: यच्चिद्धि ते गणा इमे छदयन्ति मघत्तये
pada pāṭha: yat | cit | hi | te | gaṇāḥ | ime | chadayanti | maghattaye || pari | cit | vaṣṭayaḥ | dadhuḥ | dadataḥ | rādhaḥ | ahrayam | su-jāte | aśva-sūnr̥te ||5.79.5||

IAST: pari cid vaṣṭayo dadhur dadato rādho ahrayaṁ sujāte aśvasūnṛte
Griffith: E'en fain they gird us round and give rich gifts which ne'er are reft away, high-born! delightful with
Devanāgarī: परि चिद्वष्टयो दधुर्ददतो राधो अह्रयं सुजाते अश्वसूनृते
pada pāṭha: yat | cit | hi | te | gaṇāḥ | ime | chadayanti | maghattaye || pari | cit | vaṣṭayaḥ | dadhuḥ | dadataḥ | rādhaḥ | ahrayam | su-jāte | aśva-sūnr̥te ||5.79.5||

IAST: aiṣu dhā vīravad yaśa uṣo maghoni sūriṣu
Griffith: Give to these wealthy patrons fame, O affluent Dawn, with hero sons,
Devanāgarī: ऐषु धा वीरवद्यश उषो मघोनि सूरिषु
pada pāṭha: ā | eṣu | dhāḥ | vīra-vat | yaśaḥ | uṣaḥ | maghoni | sūriṣu || ye | naḥ | rādhāṁsi | ahrayā | magha-vānaḥ | arāsata | su-jāte | aśva-sūnr̥te ||5.79.6||

IAST: ye no rādhāṁsy ahrayā maghavāno arāsata sujāte aśvasūnṛte
Griffith: To these our princes who have brought rich gifts ne'er to be reft away, highborn! delightful with thy s
Devanāgarī: ये नो राधांस्यह्रया मघवानो अरासत सुजाते अश्वसूनृते
pada pāṭha: ā | eṣu | dhāḥ | vīra-vat | yaśaḥ | uṣaḥ | maghoni | sūriṣu || ye | naḥ | rādhāṁsi | ahrayā | magha-vānaḥ | arāsata | su-jāte | aśva-sūnr̥te ||5.79.6||

IAST: tebhyo dyumnam bṛhad yaśa uṣo maghony ā vaha
Griffith: Bring lofty and resplendent fame, O thou munificent Dawn, to these
Devanāgarī: तेभ्यो द्युम्नं बृहद्यश उषो मघोन्या वह
pada pāṭha: tebhyaḥ | dyumnam | br̥hat | yaśaḥ | uṣaḥ | maghoni | ā | vaha || ye | naḥ | rādhāṁsi | aśvyā | gavyā | bhajanta | sūrayaḥ | su-jāte | aśva-sūnr̥te ||5.79.7||

IAST: ye no rādhāṁsy aśvyā gavyā bhajanta sūrayaḥ sujāte aśvasūnṛte
Griffith: Our wealthy patrons who bestow rich gifts on us of steeds and kine, high-born! delightful with thy steed
Devanāgarī: ये नो राधांस्यश्व्या गव्या भजन्त सूरयः सुजाते अश्वसूनृते
pada pāṭha: tebhyaḥ | dyumnam | br̥hat | yaśaḥ | uṣaḥ | maghoni | ā | vaha || ye | naḥ | rādhāṁsi | aśvyā | gavyā | bhajanta | sūrayaḥ | su-jāte | aśva-sūnr̥te ||5.79.7||

IAST: uta no gomatīr iṣa ā vahā duhitar divaḥ
Griffith: Bring us, O Daughter of the Sky, subsistence in our herds of kine,
Devanāgarī: उत नो गोमतीरिष आ वहा दुहितर्दिवः
pada pāṭha: uta | naḥ | go-matīḥ | iṣaḥ | ā | vaha | duhitaḥ | divaḥ || sākam | sūryasya | raśmi-bhiḥ | śukraiḥ | śocat-bhiḥ | arci-bhiḥ | su-jāte | aśva-sūnr̥te ||5.79.8||

IAST: sākaṁ sūryasya raśmibhiḥ śukraiḥ śocadbhir arcibhiḥ sujāte aśvasūnṛte
Griffith: Together with the sunbeams, with the shine of pure refulgent flames, highborn! delightful with thy steed
Devanāgarī: साकं सूर्यस्य रश्मिभिः शुक्रैः शोचद्भिरर्चिभिः सुजाते अश्वसूनृते
pada pāṭha: uta | naḥ | go-matīḥ | iṣaḥ | ā | vaha | duhitaḥ | divaḥ || sākam | sūryasya | raśmi-bhiḥ | śukraiḥ | śocat-bhiḥ | arci-bhiḥ | su-jāte | aśva-sūnr̥te ||5.79.8||

IAST: vy ucchā duhitar divo mā ciraṁ tanuthā apaḥ
Griffith: O Daughter of the Sky, shine forth; delay not to perform thy task.
Devanāgarī: व्युच्छा दुहितर्दिवो मा चिरं तनुथा अपः
pada pāṭha: vi | uccha | duhitaḥ | divaḥ | mā | ciram | tanuthāḥ | apaḥ || na | it | tvā | stenam | yathā | ripum | tapāti | sūraḥ | arciṣā | su-jāte | aśva-sūnr̥te ||5.79.9||

IAST: net tvā stenaṁ yathā ripuṁ tapāti sūro arciṣā sujāte aśvasūnṛte
Griffith: Let not the Sun with fervent heat consume thee like a robber foe, high-born! delightful with the steeds
Devanāgarī: नेत्त्वा स्तेनं यथा रिपुं तपाति सूरो अर्चिषा सुजाते अश्वसूनृते
pada pāṭha: vi | uccha | duhitaḥ | divaḥ | mā | ciram | tanuthāḥ | apaḥ || na | it | tvā | stenam | yathā | ripum | tapāti | sūraḥ | arciṣā | su-jāte | aśva-sūnr̥te ||5.79.9||

IAST: etāvad ved uṣas tvam bhūyo vā dātum arhasi
Griffith: So much, and more exceedingly, O Dawn, it suits thee to bestow,
Devanāgarī: एतावद्वेदुषस्त्वं भूयो वा दातुमर्हसि
pada pāṭha: etāvat | vā | it | uṣaḥ | tvam | bhūyaḥ | vā | dātum | arhasi || yā | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | vibhā-vari | ucchantī | na | pra-mīyase | su-jāte | aśva-sūnr̥te ||5.79.10||

IAST: yā stotṛbhyo vibhāvary ucchantī na pramīyase sujāte aśvasūnṛte
Griffith: Thou Radiant One who ceasest not to shine for those who sing thy praise, highborn! delightful with thy s
Devanāgarī: या स्तोतृभ्यो विभावर्युच्छन्ती न प्रमीयसे सुजाते अश्वसूनृते
pada pāṭha: etāvat | vā | it | uṣaḥ | tvam | bhūyaḥ | vā | dātum | arhasi || yā | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | vibhā-vari | ucchantī | na | pra-mīyase | su-jāte | aśva-sūnr̥te ||5.79.10||

IAST: dyutadyāmānam bṛhatīm ṛtena ṛtāvarīm aruṇapsuṁ vibhātīm
Griffith: THE singers welcome with their hymns and praises the Goddess Dawn who bringeth in the sunlight,
Devanāgarī: द्युतद्यामानं बृहतीमृतेन ऋतावरीमरुणप्सुं विभातीम्
pada pāṭha: dyutat-yāmānam | br̥hatīm | r̥tena | r̥ta-varīm | aruṇa-psum | vi-bhātīm || devīm | uṣasam | svaḥ | ā-vahantīm | prati | viprāsaḥ | mati-bhiḥ | jarante ||5.80.1||

IAST: devīm uṣasaṁ svar āvahantīm prati viprāso matibhir jarante
Griffith: Sublime, by Law true to eternal Order, bright on her path, red-tinted, far-refulgent.
Devanāgarī: देवीमुषसं स्वरावहन्तीं प्रति विप्रासो मतिभिर्जरन्ते
pada pāṭha: dyutat-yāmānam | br̥hatīm | r̥tena | r̥ta-varīm | aruṇa-psum | vi-bhātīm || devīm | uṣasam | svaḥ | ā-vahantīm | prati | viprāsaḥ | mati-bhiḥ | jarante ||5.80.1||

IAST: eṣā janaṁ darśatā bodhayantī sugān pathaḥ kṛṇvatī yāty agre
Griffith: She comes in front, fair, rousing up the people, making the pathways easy to be travelled.
Devanāgarī: एषा जनं दर्शता बोधयन्ती सुगान्पथः कृण्वती यात्यग्रे
pada pāṭha: eṣā | janam | darśatā | bodhayantī | su-mān | pathaḥ | kr̥ṇvatī | yāti | agre || br̥hat-rathā | br̥hatī | viśvam-invā | uṣāḥ | jyotiḥ | yacchati | agre | ahnām ||5.80.2||

IAST: bṛhadrathā bṛhatī viśvaminvoṣā jyotir yacchaty agre ahnām
Griffith: High, on her lofty chariot, all-impelling, Dawn gives her splendour at the days' beginning.
Devanāgarī: बृहद्रथा बृहती विश्वमिन्वोषा ज्योतिर्यच्छत्यग्रे अह्नाम्
pada pāṭha: eṣā | janam | darśatā | bodhayantī | su-mān | pathaḥ | kr̥ṇvatī | yāti | agre || br̥hat-rathā | br̥hatī | viśvam-invā | uṣāḥ | jyotiḥ | yacchati | agre | ahnām ||5.80.2||

IAST: eṣā gobhir aruṇebhir yujānāsredhantī rayim aprāyu cakre
Griffith: She, harnessing her car with purple oxen. injuring none, hath brought perpetual riches.
Devanāgarī: एषा गोभिररुणेभिर्युजानास्रेधन्ती रयिमप्रायु चक्रे
pada pāṭha: eṣā | gobhiḥ | aruṇebhiḥ | yujānā | asredhantī | rayim | apra-āyu | cakre || pathaḥ | radantī | suvitāya | devī | puru-stutā | viśva-vārā | vi | bhāti ||5.80.3||

IAST: patho radantī suvitāya devī puruṣṭutā viśvavārā vi bhāti
Griffith: Opening paths to happiness, the Goddess shines, praised by all, giver of every blessing.
Devanāgarī: पथो रदन्ती सुविताय देवी पुरुष्टुता विश्ववारा वि भाति
pada pāṭha: eṣā | gobhiḥ | aruṇebhiḥ | yujānā | asredhantī | rayim | apra-āyu | cakre || pathaḥ | radantī | suvitāya | devī | puru-stutā | viśva-vārā | vi | bhāti ||5.80.3||

IAST: eṣā vyenī bhavati dvibarhā āviṣkṛṇvānā tanvam purastāt
Griffith: With changing tints she gleams in double splendour while from the eastward she displays her body.
Devanāgarī: एषा व्येनी भवति द्विबर्हा आविष्कृण्वाना तन्वं पुरस्तात्
pada pāṭha: eṣā | vi-enī | bhavati | dvi-barhāḥ | āviḥ-kr̥ṇvānā | tanvam | purastāt || r̥tasya | panthām | anu | eti | sādhu | prajānatī-iva | na | diśaḥ | mināti ||5.80.4||

IAST: ṛtasya panthām anv eti sādhu prajānatīva na diśo mināti
Griffith: She travels perfectly the path of Order, nor fails to reach, as one who knows, the quarters.
Devanāgarī: ऋतस्य पन्थामन्वेति साधु प्रजानतीव न दिशो मिनाति
pada pāṭha: eṣā | vi-enī | bhavati | dvi-barhāḥ | āviḥ-kr̥ṇvānā | tanvam | purastāt || r̥tasya | panthām | anu | eti | sādhu | prajānatī-iva | na | diśaḥ | mināti ||5.80.4||

IAST: eṣā śubhrā na tanvo vidānordhveva snātī dṛśaye no asthāt
Griffith: As conscious that her limbs are bright with bathing, she stands, as 'twere, erect that we may see her.
Devanāgarī: एषा शुभ्रा न तन्वो विदानोर्ध्वेव स्नाती दृशये नो अस्थात्
pada pāṭha: eṣā | śubhrā | na | tanvaḥ | vidānā | ūrdhvā-iva | snātī | dr̥śaye | naḥ | asthāt || apa | dveṣaḥ | bādhamānā | tamāṁsi | uṣāḥ | divaḥ | duhitā | jyotiṣā | ā | agāt ||5.80.5||

IAST: apa dveṣo bādhamānā tamāṁsy uṣā divo duhitā jyotiṣāgāt
Griffith: Driving away malignity and darkness, Dawn, Child of Heaven, hath come to us with lustre.
Devanāgarī: अप द्वेषो बाधमाना तमांस्युषा दिवो दुहिता ज्योतिषागात्
pada pāṭha: eṣā | śubhrā | na | tanvaḥ | vidānā | ūrdhvā-iva | snātī | dr̥śaye | naḥ | asthāt || apa | dveṣaḥ | bādhamānā | tamāṁsi | uṣāḥ | divaḥ | duhitā | jyotiṣā | ā | agāt ||5.80.5||

IAST: eṣā pratīcī duhitā divo nṝn yoṣeva bhadrā ni riṇīte apsaḥ
Griffith: The Daughter of the Sky, like some chaste woman, bends, opposite to men, her forehead downward.
Devanāgarī: एषा प्रतीची दुहिता दिवो नॄन्योषेव भद्रा नि रिणीते अप्सः
pada pāṭha: eṣā | pratīcī | duhitā | divaḥ | nr̥̄n | yoṣā-iva | bhadrā | ni | riṇīte | apsaḥ || vi-ūrṇvatī | dāśuṣe | vāryāṇi | punaḥ | jyotiḥ | yuvatiḥ | pūrva-thā | akarityakaḥ ||5.80.6||

IAST: vyūrṇvatī dāśuṣe vāryāṇi punar jyotir yuvatiḥ pūrvathākaḥ
Griffith: The Maid, disclosing boons to him who worships, hath brought again the daylight as aforetime.
Devanāgarī: व्यूर्ण्वती दाशुषे वार्याणि पुनर्ज्योतिर्युवतिः पूर्वथाकः
pada pāṭha: eṣā | pratīcī | duhitā | divaḥ | nr̥̄n | yoṣā-iva | bhadrā | ni | riṇīte | apsaḥ || vi-ūrṇvatī | dāśuṣe | vāryāṇi | punaḥ | jyotiḥ | yuvatiḥ | pūrva-thā | akarityakaḥ ||5.80.6||

IAST: yuñjate mana uta yuñjate dhiyo viprā viprasya bṛhato vipaścitaḥ
Griffith: THE priests of him the lofty Priest well-skilled in hymns harness their spirit, yea, harness their holy t
Devanāgarī: युञ्जते मन उत युञ्जते धियो विप्रा विप्रस्य बृहतो विपश्चितः
pada pāṭha: yuñjate | manaḥ | uta | yuñjate | dhiyaḥ | viprāḥ | viprasya | br̥hataḥ | vipaḥ-citaḥ || vi | hotrāḥ | dadhe | vayuna-vit | ekaḥ | it | mahī | devasya | savituḥ | pari-stutiḥ ||5.81.1||

IAST: vi hotrā dadhe vayunāvid eka in mahī devasya savituḥ pariṣṭutiḥ
Griffith: He only knowing works assigns their priestly tasks. Yea, lofty is the praise of Savitar the God.
Devanāgarī: वि होत्रा दधे वयुनाविदेक इन्मही देवस्य सवितुः परिष्टुतिः
pada pāṭha: yuñjate | manaḥ | uta | yuñjate | dhiyaḥ | viprāḥ | viprasya | br̥hataḥ | vipaḥ-citaḥ || vi | hotrāḥ | dadhe | vayuna-vit | ekaḥ | it | mahī | devasya | savituḥ | pari-stutiḥ ||5.81.1||

IAST: viśvā rūpāṇi prati muñcate kaviḥ prāsāvīd bhadraṁ dvipade catuṣpade
Griffith: The Sapient One arrays himself in every form: for quadruped and biped he hath brought forth good.
Devanāgarī: विश्वा रूपाणि प्रति मुञ्चते कविः प्रासावीद्भद्रं द्विपदे चतुष्पदे
pada pāṭha: viśvā | rūpāṇi | prati | muñcate | kaviḥ | pra | asāvīt | bhadram | dvi-pade | catuḥ-pade || vi | nākam | akhyat | savitā | vareṇyaḥ | anu | pra-yānam | uṣasaḥ | vi | rājati ||5.81.2||

IAST: vi nākam akhyat savitā vareṇyo 'nu prayāṇam uṣaso vi rājati
Griffith: Excellent Savitar hath looked on heaven's high vault, and shineth after the outgoing of the Dawn.
Devanāgarī: वि नाकमख्यत्सविता वरेण्योऽनु प्रयाणमुषसो वि राजति
pada pāṭha: viśvā | rūpāṇi | prati | muñcate | kaviḥ | pra | asāvīt | bhadram | dvi-pade | catuḥ-pade || vi | nākam | akhyat | savitā | vareṇyaḥ | anu | pra-yānam | uṣasaḥ | vi | rājati ||5.81.2||

IAST: yasya prayāṇam anv anya id yayur devā devasya mahimānam ojasā
Griffith: Even he, the God whose going-forth and majesty the other Deities have followed with their might,
Devanāgarī: यस्य प्रयाणमन्वन्य इद्ययुर्देवा देवस्य महिमानमोजसा
pada pāṭha: yasya | pra-yānam | anu | anye | it | yayuḥ | devāḥ | devasya | mahimānam | ojasā || yaḥ | pārthivāni | vi-mame | saḥ | etaśaḥ | rajāṁsi | devaḥ | savitā | mahi-tvanā ||5.81.3||

IAST: yaḥ pārthivāni vimame sa etaśo rajāṁsi devaḥ savitā mahitvanā
Griffith: He who hath measured the terrestrial regions out by his great power, he is the Courser Savitar.
Devanāgarī: यः पार्थिवानि विममे स एतशो रजांसि देवः सविता महित्वना
pada pāṭha: yasya | pra-yānam | anu | anye | it | yayuḥ | devāḥ | devasya | mahimānam | ojasā || yaḥ | pārthivāni | vi-mame | saḥ | etaśaḥ | rajāṁsi | devaḥ | savitā | mahi-tvanā ||5.81.3||

IAST: uta yāsi savitas trīṇi rocanota sūryasya raśmibhiḥ sam ucyasi
Griffith: To the three spheres of light thou goest, Savitar, and with the rays of Sidrya thou combinest thee.
Devanāgarī: उत यासि सवितस्त्रीणि रोचनोत सूर्यस्य रश्मिभिः समुच्यसि
pada pāṭha: uta | yāsi | savitariti | trīṇi | rocanā | uta | sūryasya | raśmi-bhiḥ | sam | ucyasi || uta | rātrīm | ubhayataḥ | pari | īyase | uta | mitraḥ | bhavasi | deva | dharma-bhiḥ ||5.81.4||

IAST: uta rātrīm ubhayataḥ parīyasa uta mitro bhavasi deva dharmabhiḥ
Griffith: Around, on both sides thou encompassest the night: yea, thou, O God, art Mitra through thy righteous law
Devanāgarī: उत रात्रीमुभयतः परीयस उत मित्रो भवसि देव धर्मभिः
pada pāṭha: uta | yāsi | savitariti | trīṇi | rocanā | uta | sūryasya | raśmi-bhiḥ | sam | ucyasi || uta | rātrīm | ubhayataḥ | pari | īyase | uta | mitraḥ | bhavasi | deva | dharma-bhiḥ ||5.81.4||

IAST: uteśiṣe prasavasya tvam eka id uta pūṣā bhavasi deva yāmabhiḥ
Griffith: Over all generation thou art Lord alone: Pusan art thou, O God, in all thy goings-forth.
Devanāgarī: उतेशिषे प्रसवस्य त्वमेक इदुत पूषा भवसि देव यामभिः
pada pāṭha: uta | īśiṣe | pra-savasya | tvam | ekaḥ | it | uta | pūṣā | bhavasi | deva | yāma-bhiḥ || uta | idam | viśvam | bhuvanam | vi | rājasi | śyāva-aśvaḥ | te | savitariti | stomam | ānaśe ||5.81.5||

IAST: utedaṁ viśvam bhuvanaṁ vi rājasi śyāvāśvas te savitaḥ stomam ānaśe
Griffith: Yea, thou hast domination over all this world. Syavasva hath brought praise to thee, O Savitar,
Devanāgarī: उतेदं विश्वं भुवनं वि राजसि श्यावाश्वस्ते सवितः स्तोममानशे
pada pāṭha: uta | īśiṣe | pra-savasya | tvam | ekaḥ | it | uta | pūṣā | bhavasi | deva | yāma-bhiḥ || uta | idam | viśvam | bhuvanam | vi | rājasi | śyāva-aśvaḥ | te | savitariti | stomam | ānaśe ||5.81.5||

IAST: tat savitur vṛṇīmahe vayaṁ devasya bhojanam
Griffith: WE crave of Savitar the God this treasure much to be enjoyed.
Devanāgarī: तत्सवितुर्वृणीमहे वयं देवस्य भोजनम्
pada pāṭha: tat | savituḥ | vr̥ṇīmahe | vayam | devasya | bhojanam || śreṣṭham | sarva-dhātamam | turam | bhagasya | dhīmahi ||5.82.1||

IAST: śreṣṭhaṁ sarvadhātamaṁ turam bhagasya dhīmahi
Griffith: The best, all-yielding, conquering gift of Bhaga we would gladly win.
Devanāgarī: श्रेष्ठं सर्वधातमं तुरं भगस्य धीमहि
pada pāṭha: tat | savituḥ | vr̥ṇīmahe | vayam | devasya | bhojanam || śreṣṭham | sarva-dhātamam | turam | bhagasya | dhīmahi ||5.82.1||

IAST: asya hi svayaśastaraṁ savituḥ kac cana priyam
Griffith: Savitar's own supremacy, most glorious and beloved of all,
Devanāgarī: अस्य हि स्वयशस्तरं सवितुः कच्चन प्रियम्
pada pāṭha: asya | hi | svayaśaḥ-taram | savituḥ | kat | cana | priyam || na | minanti | sva-rājyam ||5.82.2||

IAST: na minanti svarājyam
Griffith: No one diminisheth in aught.
Devanāgarī: न मिनन्ति स्वराज्यम्
pada pāṭha: asya | hi | svayaśaḥ-taram | savituḥ | kat | cana | priyam || na | minanti | sva-rājyam ||5.82.2||

IAST: sa hi ratnāni dāśuṣe suvāti savitā bhagaḥ
Griffith: For Savitar who is Bhaga shall send riches to his worshipper.
Devanāgarī: स हि रत्नानि दाशुषे सुवाति सविता भगः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | hi | ratnāni | dāśuṣe | suvāti | savitā | bhagaḥ || tam | bhāgam | citram | īmahe ||5.82.3||

IAST: tam bhāgaṁ citram īmahe
Griffith: That wondrous portion we implore.
Devanāgarī: तं भागं चित्रमीमहे
pada pāṭha: saḥ | hi | ratnāni | dāśuṣe | suvāti | savitā | bhagaḥ || tam | bhāgam | citram | īmahe ||5.82.3||

IAST: adyā no deva savitaḥ prajāvat sāvīḥ saubhagam
Griffith: Send us this day, God Savitar, prosperity with progeny.
Devanāgarī: अद्या नो देव सवितः प्रजावत्सावीः सौभगम्
pada pāṭha: adya | naḥ | deva | savitariti | prajā-vat | sāvīḥ | saubhagam || parā | duḥ-svapnyam | suva ||5.82.4||

IAST: parā duṣṣvapnyaṁ suva
Griffith: Drive thou the evil dream away.
Devanāgarī: परा दुष्ष्वप्न्यं सुव
pada pāṭha: adya | naḥ | deva | savitariti | prajā-vat | sāvīḥ | saubhagam || parā | duḥ-svapnyam | suva ||5.82.4||

IAST: viśvāni deva savitar duritāni parā suva
Griffith: Savitar, God, send far away all sorrows and calamities,
Devanāgarī: विश्वानि देव सवितर्दुरितानि परा सुव
pada pāṭha: viśvāni | deva | savitaḥ | duḥ-itāni | parā | suva || yat | bhadram | tat | naḥ | ā | suva ||5.82.5||

IAST: yad bhadraṁ tan na ā suva
Griffith: And send us only what is good.
Devanāgarī: यद्भद्रं तन्न आ सुव
pada pāṭha: viśvāni | deva | savitaḥ | duḥ-itāni | parā | suva || yat | bhadram | tat | naḥ | ā | suva ||5.82.5||

IAST: anāgaso aditaye devasya savituḥ save
Griffith: Sinless in sight of Aditi through the God Savitar's influence,
Devanāgarī: अनागसो अदितये देवस्य सवितुः सवे
pada pāṭha: anāgasaḥ | aditaye | devasya | savituḥ | save || viśvā | vāmāni | dhīmahi ||5.82.6||

IAST: viśvā vāmāni dhīmahi
Griffith: May we obtain all lovely things.
Devanāgarī: विश्वा वामानि धीमहि
pada pāṭha: anāgasaḥ | aditaye | devasya | savituḥ | save || viśvā | vāmāni | dhīmahi ||5.82.6||

IAST: ā viśvadevaṁ satpatiṁ sūktair adyā vṛṇīmahe
Griffith: We with our hymns this day elect the general God, Lord of the good,
Devanāgarī: आ विश्वदेवं सत्पतिं सूक्तैरद्या वृणीमहे
pada pāṭha: ā | viśva-devam | sat-patim | su-uktaiḥ | adya | vr̥ṇīmahe || satya-savam | savitāram ||5.82.7||

IAST: satyasavaṁ savitāram
Griffith: Savitar whose decrees are true.
Devanāgarī: सत्यसवं सवितारम्
pada pāṭha: ā | viśva-devam | sat-patim | su-uktaiḥ | adya | vr̥ṇīmahe || satya-savam | savitāram ||5.82.7||

IAST: ya ime ubhe ahanī pura ety aprayucchan
Griffith: He who for ever vigilant precedes these Twain, the Day and Night,
Devanāgarī: य इमे उभे अहनी पुर एत्यप्रयुच्छन्
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | ime iti | ubhe iti | ahanī iti | puraḥ | eti | apra-yucchan || su-ādhīḥ | devaḥ | savitā ||5.82.8||

IAST: svādhīr devaḥ savitā
Griffith: Is Savitar the thoughtful God.
Devanāgarī: स्वाधीर्देवः सविता
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | ime iti | ubhe iti | ahanī iti | puraḥ | eti | apra-yucchan || su-ādhīḥ | devaḥ | savitā ||5.82.8||

IAST: ya imā viśvā jātāny āśrāvayati ślokena
Griffith: He who gives glory unto all these living creatures with the song,
Devanāgarī: य इमा विश्वा जातान्याश्रावयति श्लोकेन
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | imā | viśvā | jātāni | ā-śravayati | ślokena || pra | ca | suvāti | savitā ||5.82.9||

IAST: pra ca suvāti savitā
Griffith: And brings them forth, is Savitar.
Devanāgarī: प्र च सुवाति सविता
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | imā | viśvā | jātāni | ā-śravayati | ślokena || pra | ca | suvāti | savitā ||5.82.9||

IAST: acchā vada tavasaṁ gīrbhir ābhiḥ stuhi parjanyaṁ namasā vivāsa
Griffith: SING with these songs thy welcome to the Mighty, with adoration praise and call Parjanya.
Devanāgarī: अच्छा वद तवसं गीर्भिराभिः स्तुहि पर्जन्यं नमसा विवास
pada pāṭha: accha | vada | tavasam | gīḥ-bhiḥ | ābhiḥ | stuhi | parjanyam | namasā | ā |vivāsa || kanikradat | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | jīra-dānuḥ | retaḥ | dadhāti | oṣadhīṣu | garbham ||5.83.1||

IAST: kanikradad vṛṣabho jīradānū reto dadhāty oṣadhīṣu garbham
Griffith: The Bull, loud roaring, swift to send his bounty, lays in the plants the seed. for germination.
Devanāgarī: कनिक्रदद्वृषभो जीरदानू रेतो दधात्योषधीषु गर्भम्
pada pāṭha: accha | vada | tavasam | gīḥ-bhiḥ | ābhiḥ | stuhi | parjanyam | namasā | ā |vivāsa || kanikradat | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | jīra-dānuḥ | retaḥ | dadhāti | oṣadhīṣu | garbham ||5.83.1||

IAST: vi vṛkṣān hanty uta hanti rakṣaso viśvam bibhāya bhuvanam mahāvadhāt
Griffith: He smites the trees apart, he slays the demons: all life fears him who wields the mighty weapon.
Devanāgarī: वि वृक्षान्हन्त्युत हन्ति रक्षसो विश्वं बिभाय भुवनं महावधात्
pada pāṭha: vi | vr̥kṣān | hanti | uta | hanti | rakṣasaḥ | viśvam | bibhāya | bhuvanam | mahā-vadhāt || uta | anāgāḥ | īṣate | vr̥ṣṇya-vataḥ | yat | parjanyaḥ | stanayan | hanti | duḥ-kr̥taḥ ||5.83.2||

IAST: utānāgā īṣate vṛṣṇyāvato yat parjanyaḥ stanayan hanti duṣkṛtaḥ
Griffith: From him exceeding strong fices e'en the guiltless, when thundering Parjanya smites the wicked.
Devanāgarī: उतानागा ईषते वृष्ण्यावतो यत्पर्जन्यः स्तनयन्हन्ति दुष्कृतः
pada pāṭha: vi | vr̥kṣān | hanti | uta | hanti | rakṣasaḥ | viśvam | bibhāya | bhuvanam | mahā-vadhāt || uta | anāgāḥ | īṣate | vr̥ṣṇya-vataḥ | yat | parjanyaḥ | stanayan | hanti | duḥ-kr̥taḥ ||5.83.2||

IAST: rathīva kaśayāśvām̐ abhikṣipann āvir dūtān kṛṇute varṣyām̐ aha
Griffith: Like a car-driver whipping on his horses, he makes the messengers of rain spring forward.
Devanāgarī: रथीव कशयाश्वाँ अभिक्षिपन्नाविर्दूतान्कृणुते वर्ष्याँ अह
pada pāṭha: rathī-iva | kaśayā | aśvān | abhi-kṣipan | āviḥ | dūtān | kr̥ṇute | varṣyān | aha || dūrāt | siṁhasya | stanathāḥ | ut | īrate | yat | parjanyaḥ | kr̥ṇute | varṣyam | nabhaḥ ||5.83.3||

IAST: dūrāt siṁhasya stanathā ud īrate yat parjanyaḥ kṛṇute varṣyaṁ nabhaḥ
Griffith: Far off resounds the roaring of the lion, what time Parjanya fills the sky with rain-cloud.
Devanāgarī: दूरात्सिंहस्य स्तनथा उदीरते यत्पर्जन्यः कृणुते वर्ष्यं नभः
pada pāṭha: rathī-iva | kaśayā | aśvān | abhi-kṣipan | āviḥ | dūtān | kr̥ṇute | varṣyān | aha || dūrāt | siṁhasya | stanathāḥ | ut | īrate | yat | parjanyaḥ | kr̥ṇute | varṣyam | nabhaḥ ||5.83.3||

IAST: pra vātā vānti patayanti vidyuta ud oṣadhīr jihate pinvate svaḥ
Griffith: Forth burst the winds, down come the lightning-flashes: the plants shoot up, the realm of light is streami
Devanāgarī: प्र वाता वान्ति पतयन्ति विद्युत उदोषधीर्जिहते पिन्वते स्वः
pada pāṭha: pra | vātāḥ | vānti | patayanti | vi-dyutaḥ | ut | oṣadhīḥ | jihate | pinvate | svariti svaḥ || irā | viśvasmai | bhuvanāya | jāyate | yat | parjanyaḥ | pr̥thivīm | retasā | avati ||5.83.4||

IAST: irā viśvasmai bhuvanāya jāyate yat parjanyaḥ pṛthivīṁ retasāvati
Griffith: Food springs abundant for all living creatures, what time Parjanya quickens earth with moisture.
Devanāgarī: इरा विश्वस्मै भुवनाय जायते यत्पर्जन्यः पृथिवीं रेतसावति
pada pāṭha: pra | vātāḥ | vānti | patayanti | vi-dyutaḥ | ut | oṣadhīḥ | jihate | pinvate | svariti svaḥ || irā | viśvasmai | bhuvanāya | jāyate | yat | parjanyaḥ | pr̥thivīm | retasā | avati ||5.83.4||

IAST: yasya vrate pṛthivī nannamīti yasya vrate śaphavaj jarbhurīti
Griffith: Thou at whose bidding earth bows low before thee, at whose command hoofed cattle fly in terror,
Devanāgarī: यस्य व्रते पृथिवी नन्नमीति यस्य व्रते शफवज्जर्भुरीति
pada pāṭha: yasya | vrate | pr̥thivī | nannamīti | yasya | vrate | śapha-vat | jarbhurīti || yasya | vrate | oṣadhīḥ | viśva-rūpāḥ | saḥ | naḥ | parjanya | mahi | śarma | yaccha ||5.83.5||

IAST: yasya vrata oṣadhīr viśvarūpāḥ sa naḥ parjanya mahi śarma yaccha
Griffith: At whose behest the plants assume all colours, even thou Parjanya, yield us great protection.
Devanāgarī: यस्य व्रत ओषधीर्विश्वरूपाः स नः पर्जन्य महि शर्म यच्छ
pada pāṭha: yasya | vrate | pr̥thivī | nannamīti | yasya | vrate | śapha-vat | jarbhurīti || yasya | vrate | oṣadhīḥ | viśva-rūpāḥ | saḥ | naḥ | parjanya | mahi | śarma | yaccha ||5.83.5||

IAST: divo no vṛṣṭim maruto rarīdhvam pra pinvata vṛṣṇo aśvasya dhārāḥ
Griffith: Send down for us the rain of heaven, ye Maruts, and let the Stallion's flood descend in torrents.
Devanāgarī: दिवो नो वृष्टिं मरुतो ररीध्वं प्र पिन्वत वृष्णो अश्वस्य धाराः
pada pāṭha: divaḥ | naḥ | vr̥ṣṭim | marutaḥ | rarīdhvam | pra | pinvata | vr̥ṣṇaḥ | aśvasya | dhārāḥ || arvāṅ | etena | stanayitnunā | ā | ihi | apaḥ | ni-siñcan | asuraḥ | pitā | nāḥ ||5.83.6||

IAST: arvāṅ etena stanayitnunehy apo niṣiñcann asuraḥ pitā naḥ
Griffith: Come hither with this thunder while thou pourest the waters down, our heavenly Lord and Father.
Devanāgarī: अर्वाङेतेन स्तनयित्नुनेह्यपो निषिञ्चन्नसुरः पिता नः
pada pāṭha: divaḥ | naḥ | vr̥ṣṭim | marutaḥ | rarīdhvam | pra | pinvata | vr̥ṣṇaḥ | aśvasya | dhārāḥ || arvāṅ | etena | stanayitnunā | ā | ihi | apaḥ | ni-siñcan | asuraḥ | pitā | nāḥ ||5.83.6||

IAST: abhi kranda stanaya garbham ā dhā udanvatā pari dīyā rathena
Griffith: Thunder and roar: the germ of life deposit. Fly round us on thy chariot waterladen.
Devanāgarī: अभि क्रन्द स्तनय गर्भमा धा उदन्वता परि दीया रथेन
pada pāṭha: abhi | kranda | stanaya | garbham | ā | dhāḥ | udan-vatā | pari | dīya | rathena || dr̥tim | su | karṣa | vi-sitam | nyañcam | samāḥ | bhavantu | ut-vataḥ | ni-pādāḥ ||5.83.7||

IAST: dṛtiṁ su karṣa viṣitaṁ nyañcaṁ samā bhavantūdvato nipādāḥ
Griffith: Thine opened water-skin draw with thee downward, and let the hollows and the heights be level.
Devanāgarī: दृतिं सु कर्ष विषितं न्यञ्चं समा भवन्तूद्वतो निपादाः
pada pāṭha: abhi | kranda | stanaya | garbham | ā | dhāḥ | udan-vatā | pari | dīya | rathena || dr̥tim | su | karṣa | vi-sitam | nyañcam | samāḥ | bhavantu | ut-vataḥ | ni-pādāḥ ||5.83.7||

IAST: mahāntaṁ kośam ud acā ni ṣiñca syandantāṁ kulyā viṣitāḥ purastāt
Griffith: Lift up the mighty vessel, pour down water, and let the liberated streams rush forward.
Devanāgarī: महान्तं कोशमुदचा नि षिञ्च स्यन्दन्तां कुल्या विषिताः पुरस्तात्
pada pāṭha: mahāntam | kośam | ut | aca | ni | siñca | syandantām | kulyāḥ | vi-sitāḥ | purastāt || ghr̥tena | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | vi | undhi | su-prapānam | bhavatu | aghnyābhyaḥ ||5.83.8||

IAST: ghṛtena dyāvāpṛthivī vy undhi suprapāṇam bhavatv aghnyābhyaḥ
Griffith: Saturate both the earth and heaven with fatness, and for the cows let there be drink abundant.
Devanāgarī: घृतेन द्यावापृथिवी व्युन्धि सुप्रपाणं भवत्वघ्न्याभ्यः
pada pāṭha: mahāntam | kośam | ut | aca | ni | siñca | syandantām | kulyāḥ | vi-sitāḥ | purastāt || ghr̥tena | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | vi | undhi | su-prapānam | bhavatu | aghnyābhyaḥ ||5.83.8||

IAST: yat parjanya kanikradat stanayan haṁsi duṣkṛtaḥ
Griffith: When thou, with thunder and with roar, Parjanya, smitest sinners down,
Devanāgarī: यत्पर्जन्य कनिक्रदत्स्तनयन्हंसि दुष्कृतः
pada pāṭha: yat | parjanya | kanikradat | stanayan | haṁsi | duḥ-kr̥taḥ || prati | idam | viśvam | modate | yat | kim | ca | pr̥thivyām | adhi ||5.83.9||

IAST: pratīdaṁ viśvam modate yat kiṁ ca pṛthivyām adhi
Griffith: This universe exults thereat, yea, all that is upon the earth.
Devanāgarī: प्रतीदं विश्वं मोदते यत्किं च पृथिव्यामधि
pada pāṭha: yat | parjanya | kanikradat | stanayan | haṁsi | duḥ-kr̥taḥ || prati | idam | viśvam | modate | yat | kim | ca | pr̥thivyām | adhi ||5.83.9||

IAST: avarṣīr varṣam ud u ṣū gṛbhāyākar dhanvāny atyetavā u
Griffith: Thou hast poured down the rain-flood now withhold it. Thou hast made desert places fit for travel.
Devanāgarī: अवर्षीर्वर्षमुदु षू गृभायाकर्धन्वान्यत्येतवा उ
pada pāṭha: avarṣīḥ | varṣam | ut | ūm̐ iti | su | gr̥bhāya | akaḥ | dhanvāni | ati-etavai | ūm̐ iti || ajījanaḥ | oṣadhīḥ | bhojanāya | kam | uta | pra-jābhyaḥ | avidaḥ | manīṣām ||5.83.10||

IAST: ajījana oṣadhīr bhojanāya kam uta prajābhyo 'vido manīṣām
Griffith: Thou hast made herbs to grow for our enjoyment: yea, thou hast won thee praise from living creatures.
Devanāgarī: अजीजन ओषधीर्भोजनाय कमुत प्रजाभ्योऽविदो मनीषाम्
pada pāṭha: avarṣīḥ | varṣam | ut | ūm̐ iti | su | gr̥bhāya | akaḥ | dhanvāni | ati-etavai | ūm̐ iti || ajījanaḥ | oṣadhīḥ | bhojanāya | kam | uta | pra-jābhyaḥ | avidaḥ | manīṣām ||5.83.10||

IAST: baḻ itthā parvatānāṁ khidram bibharṣi pṛthivi
Griffith: THOU, of a truth,O Prthivi, bearest the tool that rends the hills:
Devanāgarī: बळित्था पर्वतानां खिद्रं बिभर्षि पृथिवि
pada pāṭha: baṭ | itthā | parvatānām | khidram | bibharṣi | pr̥thivi || pra | yā | bhūmim | pravatvati | mahnā | jinoṣi | mahini ||5.84.1||

IAST: pra yā bhūmim pravatvati mahnā jinoṣi mahini
Griffith: Thou rich in torrents, who with might quickenest earth, O Mighty One.
Devanāgarī: प्र या भूमिं प्रवत्वति मह्ना जिनोषि महिनि
pada pāṭha: baṭ | itthā | parvatānām | khidram | bibharṣi | pr̥thivi || pra | yā | bhūmim | pravatvati | mahnā | jinoṣi | mahini ||5.84.1||

IAST: stomāsas tvā vicāriṇi prati ṣṭobhanty aktubhiḥ
Griffith: To thee, O wanderer at will, ring out the lauds with beams of day,
Devanāgarī: स्तोमासस्त्वा विचारिणि प्रति ष्टोभन्त्यक्तुभिः
pada pāṭha: stomāsaḥ | tvā | vi-cāriṇi | prati | stobhanti | aktu-bhiḥ || pra | yā | vājam | na | heṣantam | perum | asyasi | arjuni ||5.84.2||

IAST: pra yā vājaṁ na heṣantam perum asyasy arjuni
Griffith: Who drivest, like a neighing steed, the swelling cloud, O bright of hue.
Devanāgarī: प्र या वाजं न हेषन्तं पेरुमस्यस्यर्जुनि
pada pāṭha: stomāsaḥ | tvā | vi-cāriṇi | prati | stobhanti | aktu-bhiḥ || pra | yā | vājam | na | heṣantam | perum | asyasi | arjuni ||5.84.2||

IAST: dṛḻhā cid yā vanaspatīn kṣmayā dardharṣy ojasā
Griffith: Who graspest with thy might on earth. e'en the strong sovrans of the wood,
Devanāgarī: दृळ्हा चिद्या वनस्पतीन्क्ष्मया दर्धर्ष्योजसा
pada pāṭha: dr̥ḷhā | cit | yā | vanaspatīn | kṣmayā | dardharṣi | ojasā || yat | te | abhrasya | vi-dyutaḥ | divaḥ | varṣanti | vr̥ṣṭayaḥ ||5.84.3||

IAST: yat te abhrasya vidyuto divo varṣanti vṛṣṭayaḥ
Griffith: When from the lightning of thy cloud the rain-floods of the heaven descend.
Devanāgarī: यत्ते अभ्रस्य विद्युतो दिवो वर्षन्ति वृष्टयः
pada pāṭha: dr̥ḷhā | cit | yā | vanaspatīn | kṣmayā | dardharṣi | ojasā || yat | te | abhrasya | vi-dyutaḥ | divaḥ | varṣanti | vr̥ṣṭayaḥ ||5.84.3||

IAST: pra samrāje bṛhad arcā gabhīram brahma priyaṁ varuṇāya śrutāya
Griffith: SING forth a hymn sublime and solemn, grateful to glorious. Varuna, imperial Ruler,
Devanāgarī: प्र सम्राजे बृहदर्चा गभीरं ब्रह्म प्रियं वरुणाय श्रुताय
pada pāṭha: pra | sam-rāje | br̥hat | arca | gabhīram | brahma | priyam | varuṇāya | śrutāya || vi | yaḥ | jaghāna | śamitā-iva | carma | upa-stire | pr̥thivīm | sūryāya ||5.85.1||

IAST: vi yo jaghāna śamiteva carmopastire pṛthivīṁ sūryāya
Griffith: Who hath struck out, like one who slays the victim, earth as a skin to spread in front of Surya.
Devanāgarī: वि यो जघान शमितेव चर्मोपस्तिरे पृथिवीं सूर्याय
pada pāṭha: pra | sam-rāje | br̥hat | arca | gabhīram | brahma | priyam | varuṇāya | śrutāya || vi | yaḥ | jaghāna | śamitā-iva | carma | upa-stire | pr̥thivīm | sūryāya ||5.85.1||

IAST: vaneṣu vy antarikṣaṁ tatāna vājam arvatsu paya usriyāsu
Griffith: In the tree-tops the air he hath extended, put milk in kine and vigorous speed in horses,
Devanāgarī: वनेषु व्यन्तरिक्षं ततान वाजमर्वत्सु पय उस्रियासु
pada pāṭha: vaneṣu | vi | antarikṣam | tatāna | vājam | arvat-su | payaḥ | usriyāsu || hr̥t-su | kratum | varuṇaḥ | ap-su | agnim | divi | sūryam | adadhāt | somam | adrau ||5.85.2||

IAST: hṛtsu kratuṁ varuṇo apsv agniṁ divi sūryam adadhāt somam adrau
Griffith: Set intellect in hearts, fire in the waters, Siurya in heaven and Soma on the mountain.
Devanāgarī: हृत्सु क्रतुं वरुणो अप्स्वग्निं दिवि सूर्यमदधात्सोममद्रौ
pada pāṭha: vaneṣu | vi | antarikṣam | tatāna | vājam | arvat-su | payaḥ | usriyāsu || hr̥t-su | kratum | varuṇaḥ | ap-su | agnim | divi | sūryam | adadhāt | somam | adrau ||5.85.2||

IAST: nīcīnabāraṁ varuṇaḥ kavandham pra sasarja rodasī antarikṣam
Griffith: Varuna lets the big cask, opening downward, flow through the heaven and earth and air's mid-region.
Devanāgarī: नीचीनबारं वरुणः कवन्धं प्र ससर्ज रोदसी अन्तरिक्षम्
pada pāṭha: nīcīna-bāram | varuṇaḥ | kavandham | pra | sasarja | rodasī iti | antarikṣam || tena | viśvasya | bhuvanasya | rājā | yavam | na | vr̥ṣṭiḥ | vi | unatti | bhūma ||5.85.3||

IAST: tena viśvasya bhuvanasya rājā yavaṁ na vṛṣṭir vy unatti bhūma
Griffith: Therewith the universe's Sovran waters earth as the shower of rain bedews the barley.
Devanāgarī: तेन विश्वस्य भुवनस्य राजा यवं न वृष्टिर्व्युनत्ति भूम
pada pāṭha: nīcīna-bāram | varuṇaḥ | kavandham | pra | sasarja | rodasī iti | antarikṣam || tena | viśvasya | bhuvanasya | rājā | yavam | na | vr̥ṣṭiḥ | vi | unatti | bhūma ||5.85.3||

IAST: unatti bhūmim pṛthivīm uta dyāṁ yadā dugdhaṁ varuṇo vaṣṭy ād it
Griffith: When Varuna is fain for milk he moistens the sky, the land, and earth to her foundation.
Devanāgarī: उनत्ति भूमिं पृथिवीमुत द्यां यदा दुग्धं वरुणो वष्ट्यादित्
pada pāṭha: unatti | bhūmim | pr̥thivīm | uta | dyām | yadā | dugdham | varuṇaḥ | vaṣṭi | āt | it || sam | abhreṇa | vasata | parvatāsaḥ | taviṣī-yantaḥ | śrathayanta | vīrāḥ ||5.85.4||

IAST: sam abhreṇa vasata parvatāsas taviṣīyantaḥ śrathayanta vīrāḥ
Griffith: Then straight the mountains clothe them in the rain-cloud: the Heroes, putting forth their vigour, loose
Devanāgarī: समभ्रेण वसत पर्वतासस्तविषीयन्तः श्रथयन्त वीराः
pada pāṭha: unatti | bhūmim | pr̥thivīm | uta | dyām | yadā | dugdham | varuṇaḥ | vaṣṭi | āt | it || sam | abhreṇa | vasata | parvatāsaḥ | taviṣī-yantaḥ | śrathayanta | vīrāḥ ||5.85.4||

IAST: imām ū ṣv āsurasya śrutasya mahīm māyāṁ varuṇasya pra vocam
Griffith: I will declare this mighty deed of magic, of glorious Varuna the Lord Immortal,
Devanāgarī: इमामू ष्वासुरस्य श्रुतस्य महीं मायां वरुणस्य प्र वोचम्
pada pāṭha: imām | ūm̐ iti | su | āsurasya | śrutasya | mahīm | māyām | varuṇasya | pra | vocam || mānena-iva | tasthi-vān | antarikṣe | vi | yaḥ | mame | pr̥thivīm | sūryeṇa ||5.85.5||

IAST: māneneva tasthivām̐ antarikṣe vi yo mame pṛthivīṁ sūryeṇa
Griffith: Who standing in the firmament hath meted the earth out with the Sun as with a measure.
Devanāgarī: मानेनेव तस्थिवाँ अन्तरिक्षे वि यो ममे पृथिवीं सूर्येण
pada pāṭha: imām | ūm̐ iti | su | āsurasya | śrutasya | mahīm | māyām | varuṇasya | pra | vocam || mānena-iva | tasthi-vān | antarikṣe | vi | yaḥ | mame | pr̥thivīm | sūryeṇa ||5.85.5||

IAST: imām ū nu kavitamasya māyām mahīṁ devasya nakir ā dadharṣa
Griffith: None, verily, hath ever let or hindered this the most wise God's mighty deed of magic,
Devanāgarī: इमामू नु कवितमस्य मायां महीं देवस्य नकिरा दधर्ष
pada pāṭha: imām | ūm̐ iti | nu | kavi-tamasya | māyām | mahīm | devasya | nakiḥ | ā | dadharṣa || ekam | yat | udnā | na | pr̥ṇanti | enīḥ | ā-siñcantīḥ | avanayaḥ | samudram ||5.85.6||

IAST: ekaṁ yad udnā na pṛṇanty enīr āsiñcantīr avanayaḥ samudram
Griffith: Whereby with all their flood, the lucid rivers fill not one sea wherein they pour their waters.
Devanāgarī: एकं यदुद्ना न पृणन्त्येनीरासिञ्चन्तीरवनयः समुद्रम्
pada pāṭha: imām | ūm̐ iti | nu | kavi-tamasya | māyām | mahīm | devasya | nakiḥ | ā | dadharṣa || ekam | yat | udnā | na | pr̥ṇanti | enīḥ | ā-siñcantīḥ | avanayaḥ | samudram ||5.85.6||

IAST: aryamyaṁ varuṇa mitryaṁ vā sakhāyaṁ vā sadam id bhrātaraṁ vā
Griffith: If we have sinned against the man who loves us, have ever wronged a brother, friend, or comrade,
Devanāgarī: अर्यम्यं वरुण मित्र्यं वा सखायं वा सदमिद्भ्रातरं वा
pada pāṭha: aryamyam | varuṇa | mitryam | vā | sakhāyam | vā | sadam | it | bhrātaram | vā || veśam | vā | nityam | varuṇa | araṇam | vā | yat | sīm | āgaḥ | cakr̥ma | śiśrathaḥ | tat ||5.85.7||

IAST: veśaṁ vā nityaṁ varuṇāraṇaṁ vā yat sīm āgaś cakṛmā śiśrathas tat
Griffith: The neighbour ever with us, or a stranger, O Varuna, remove from us the trespass.
Devanāgarī: वेशं वा नित्यं वरुणारणं वा यत्सीमागश्चकृमा शिश्रथस्तत्
pada pāṭha: aryamyam | varuṇa | mitryam | vā | sakhāyam | vā | sadam | it | bhrātaram | vā || veśam | vā | nityam | varuṇa | araṇam | vā | yat | sīm | āgaḥ | cakr̥ma | śiśrathaḥ | tat ||5.85.7||

IAST: kitavāso yad riripur na dīvi yad vā ghā satyam uta yan na vidma
Griffith: If we, as gamesters cheat at play, have cheated, done wrong unwittingly or sinned of purpose,
Devanāgarī: कितवासो यद्रिरिपुर्न दीवि यद्वा घा सत्यमुत यन्न विद्म
pada pāṭha: kitavāsaḥ | yat | riripuḥ | na | dīvi | yat | vā | gha | satyam | uta | yat | na | vidma || sarvā | tā | vi | sya | śithirā-iva | deva | adha | te | syāma | varuṇa | priyāsaḥ ||5.85.8||

IAST: sarvā tā vi ṣya śithireva devādhā te syāma varuṇa priyāsaḥ
Griffith: Cast all these sins away like loosened fetters, and, Varuna let us be thine own beloved.
Devanāgarī: सर्वा ता वि ष्य शिथिरेव देवाधा ते स्याम वरुण प्रियासः
pada pāṭha: kitavāsaḥ | yat | riripuḥ | na | dīvi | yat | vā | gha | satyam | uta | yat | na | vidma || sarvā | tā | vi | sya | śithirā-iva | deva | adha | te | syāma | varuṇa | priyāsaḥ ||5.85.8||

IAST: indrāgnī yam avatha ubhā vājeṣu martyam
Griffith: THE mortal man whom ye, the Twain, Indra and Agni, help in fight,
Devanāgarī: इन्द्राग्नी यमवथ उभा वाजेषु मर्त्यम्
pada pāṭha: indrāgnī iti | yam | avathaḥ | ubhā | vājeṣu | martyam || dr̥ḷhā | cit | saḥ | pra | bhedati | dyumnā | vāṇīḥ-iva | tritaḥ ||5.86.1||

IAST: dṛḻhā cit sa pra bhedati dyumnā vāṇīr iva tritaḥ
Griffith: Breaks through e'en strongly-guarded wealth as Trta burst his way through reeds.
Devanāgarī: दृळ्हा चित्स प्र भेदति द्युम्ना वाणीरिव त्रितः
pada pāṭha: indrāgnī iti | yam | avathaḥ | ubhā | vājeṣu | martyam || dr̥ḷhā | cit | saḥ | pra | bhedati | dyumnā | vāṇīḥ-iva | tritaḥ ||5.86.1||

IAST: yā pṛtanāsu duṣṭarā yā vājeṣu śravāyyā
Griffith: The Twain invincible in war, worthy to be renowned in frays,
Devanāgarī: या पृतनासु दुष्टरा या वाजेषु श्रवाय्या
pada pāṭha: yā | pr̥tanāsu | dustarā | yā | vājeṣu | śravāyyā || yā | pañca | carṣaṇīḥ | abhi | indrāgnī iti | tā | havāmahe ||5.86.2||

IAST: yā pañca carṣaṇīr abhīndrāgnī tā havāmahe
Griffith: Lords of the Fivefold. People, these, Indra and Agni, we invoke.
Devanāgarī: या पञ्च चर्षणीरभीन्द्राग्नी ता हवामहे
pada pāṭha: yā | pr̥tanāsu | dustarā | yā | vājeṣu | śravāyyā || yā | pañca | carṣaṇīḥ | abhi | indrāgnī iti | tā | havāmahe ||5.86.2||

IAST: tayor id amavac chavas tigmā didyun maghonoḥ
Griffith: Impetuous is their strength, and keen the lightning of the mighty Pair,
Devanāgarī: तयोरिदमवच्छवस्तिग्मा दिद्युन्मघोनोः
pada pāṭha: tayoḥ | it | ama-vat | śavaḥ | tigmā | didyut | maghonoḥ || prati | druṇā | gabhastyoḥ | gavām | vr̥tra-ghne | ā | īṣate ||5.86.3||

IAST: prati druṇā gabhastyor gavāṁ vṛtraghna eṣate
Griffith: Which from their arms speeds with the car to Vrtra's slayer for the kine.
Devanāgarī: प्रति द्रुणा गभस्त्योर्गवां वृत्रघ्न एषते
pada pāṭha: tayoḥ | it | ama-vat | śavaḥ | tigmā | didyut | maghonoḥ || prati | druṇā | gabhastyoḥ | gavām | vr̥tra-ghne | ā | īṣate ||5.86.3||

IAST: tā vām eṣe rathānām indrāgnī havāmahe
Griffith: Indra and Agni, we invoke you both, as such, to send your cars:
Devanāgarī: ता वामेषे रथानामिन्द्राग्नी हवामहे
pada pāṭha: tā | vām | eṣe | rathānām | indrāgnī iti | havāmahe || patī iti | turasya | rādhasaḥ | vidvāṁsā | girvaṇaḥ-tamā ||5.86.4||

IAST: patī turasya rādhaso vidvāṁsā girvaṇastamā
Griffith: Lords of quick-coming bounty, ye who know, chief lovers of the song.
Devanāgarī: पती तुरस्य राधसो विद्वांसा गिर्वणस्तमा
pada pāṭha: tā | vām | eṣe | rathānām | indrāgnī iti | havāmahe || patī iti | turasya | rādhasaḥ | vidvāṁsā | girvaṇaḥ-tamā ||5.86.4||

IAST: tā vṛdhantāv anu dyūn martāya devāv adabhā
Griffith: These who give increase day by day, Gods without guile for mortal man,
Devanāgarī: ता वृधन्तावनु द्यून्मर्ताय देवावदभा
pada pāṭha: tā | vr̥dhantau | anu | dyūn | martāya | devau | adabhā || arhantā | cit | puraḥ | dadhe | aṁśā-iva | devau | arvate ||5.86.5||

IAST: arhantā cit puro dadhe 'ṁśeva devāv arvate
Griffith: Worthy themselves, I honour most, Two Gods as partners, for my horse.
Devanāgarī: अर्हन्ता चित्पुरो दधेंऽशेव देवावर्वते
pada pāṭha: tā | vr̥dhantau | anu | dyūn | martāya | devau | adabhā || arhantā | cit | puraḥ | dadhe | aṁśā-iva | devau | arvate ||5.86.5||

IAST: evendrāgnibhyām ahāvi havyaṁ śūṣyaṁ ghṛtaṁ na pūtam adribhiḥ
Griffith: The strength-bestowing offering thus to Indra-Agni hath been paid, as butter, purified by stones.
Devanāgarī: एवेन्द्राग्निभ्यामहावि हव्यं शूष्यं घृतं न पूतमद्रिभिः
pada pāṭha: eva | indrāgni-bhyām | ahāvi | havyam | śūṣyam | ghr̥tam | na | pūtam | adri-bhiḥ || tā | sūriṣu | śravaḥ | br̥hat | rayim | gr̥ṇat-su | didhr̥tam | iṣam | gr̥ṇat-su | didhr̥tam ||5.86.6||

IAST: tā sūriṣu śravo bṛhad rayiṁ gṛṇatsu didhṛtam iṣaṁ gṛṇatsu didhṛtam
Griffith: Deal to our princes high renown, deal wealth to those who sing your praise, deal food to those who sing
Devanāgarī: ता सूरिषु श्रवो बृहद्रयिं गृणत्सु दिधृतमिषं गृणत्सु दिधृतम्
pada pāṭha: eva | indrāgni-bhyām | ahāvi | havyam | śūṣyam | ghr̥tam | na | pūtam | adri-bhiḥ || tā | sūriṣu | śravaḥ | br̥hat | rayim | gr̥ṇat-su | didhr̥tam | iṣam | gr̥ṇat-su | didhr̥tam ||5.86.6||

IAST: pra vo mahe matayo yantu viṣṇave marutvate girijā evayāmarut
Griffith: To Visnu, to the Mighty whom the Maruts follow let your hymns born in song go forth, Evayamarut;
Devanāgarī: प्र वो महे मतयो यन्तु विष्णवे मरुत्वते गिरिजा एवयामरुत्
pada pāṭha: pra | vaḥ | mahe | matayaḥ | yantu | viṣṇave | marutvate | giri-jāḥ | evayāmarut || pra | śardhāya | pra-yajyave | su-khādaye | tavase | bhandat-iṣṭaye | dhuni-vratāya | śavase ||5.87.1||

IAST: pra śardhāya prayajyave sukhādaye tavase bhandadiṣṭaye dhunivratāya śavase
Griffith: To the impetuous, strong band, adorned with bracelets, that rushes on in joy and ever roars for vigour.
Devanāgarī: प्र शर्धाय प्रयज्यवे सुखादये तवसे भन्ददिष्टये धुनिव्रताय शवसे
pada pāṭha: pra | vaḥ | mahe | matayaḥ | yantu | viṣṇave | marutvate | giri-jāḥ | evayāmarut || pra | śardhāya | pra-yajyave | su-khādaye | tavase | bhandat-iṣṭaye | dhuni-vratāya | śavase ||5.87.1||

IAST: pra ye jātā mahinā ye ca nu svayam pra vidmanā bruvata evayāmarut
Griffith: They who with might were manifest, and who willingly by their own knowledge told it forth, Evayamarut.
Devanāgarī: प्र ये जाता महिना ये च नु स्वयं प्र विद्मना ब्रुवत एवयामरुत्
pada pāṭha: pra | ye | jātāḥ | mahinā | ye | ca | nu | svayam | pra | vidmanā | bruvate | evayāmarut || kratvā | tat | vaḥ | marutaḥ | na | ā-dhr̥ṣe | śavaḥ | dānā | mahnā | tat | eṣām | adhr̥ṣṭāsaḥ | na | adrayaḥ ||5.87.2||

IAST: kratvā tad vo maruto nādhṛṣe śavo dānā mahnā tad eṣām adhṛṣṭāso nādrayaḥ
Griffith: Maruts, this strength of yours no wisdom comprehendeth: through their gifts' greatness they are moveless
Devanāgarī: क्रत्वा तद्वो मरुतो नाधृषे शवो दाना मह्ना तदेषामधृष्टासो नाद्रयः
pada pāṭha: pra | ye | jātāḥ | mahinā | ye | ca | nu | svayam | pra | vidmanā | bruvate | evayāmarut || kratvā | tat | vaḥ | marutaḥ | na | ā-dhr̥ṣe | śavaḥ | dānā | mahnā | tat | eṣām | adhr̥ṣṭāsaḥ | na | adrayaḥ ||5.87.2||

IAST: pra ye divo bṛhataḥ śṛṇvire girā suśukvānaḥ subhva evayāmarut
Griffith: Who by the psalm they sing are heard, from lofty heaven, the strong, the brightly shining Ones, Evayamaru
Devanāgarī: प्र ये दिवो बृहतः शृण्विरे गिरा सुशुक्वानः सुभ्व एवयामरुत्
pada pāṭha: pra | ye | divaḥ | br̥hataḥ | śr̥ṇvire | girā | su-śukvānaḥ | su-bhvaḥ | evayāmarut || na | yeṣām | irī | sadha-sthe | īṣṭe | ā | agnayaḥ | na | sva-vidyutaḥ | pra | spandrāsaḥ | dhunīnām ||5.87.3||

IAST: na yeṣām irī sadhastha īṣṭa ām̐ agnayo na svavidyutaḥ pra syandrāso dhunīnām
Griffith: In whose abode there is no mightier one to move them, whose lightnings are as fires, who urge the roari
Devanāgarī: न येषामिरी सधस्थ ईष्ट आँ अग्नयो न स्वविद्युतः प्र स्यन्द्रासो धुनीनाम्
pada pāṭha: pra | ye | divaḥ | br̥hataḥ | śr̥ṇvire | girā | su-śukvānaḥ | su-bhvaḥ | evayāmarut || na | yeṣām | irī | sadha-sthe | īṣṭe | ā | agnayaḥ | na | sva-vidyutaḥ | pra | spandrāsaḥ | dhunīnām ||5.87.3||

IAST: sa cakrame mahato nir urukramaḥ samānasmāt sadasa evayāmarut
Griffith: He of the Mighty Stride forth strode, Evayamarut, out of the spacious dwelling-place, their home in commo
Devanāgarī: स चक्रमे महतो निरुरुक्रमः समानस्मात्सदस एवयामरुत्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | cakrame | mahataḥ | niḥ | uru-kramaḥ | samānasmāt | sadasaḥ | evayāmarut || yadā | ayukta | tmanā | svāt | adhi | snu-bhiḥ | vi-spardhasaḥ | vi-mahasaḥ | jigāti | śe-vr̥dhaḥ | nr̥-bhiḥ ||5.87.4||

IAST: yadāyukta tmanā svād adhi ṣṇubhir viṣpardhaso vimahaso jigāti śevṛdho nṛbhiḥ
Griffith: When he, himself, hath yoked his emulous strong horses on heights, he cometh forth, joy-giving, with the
Devanāgarī: यदायुक्त त्मना स्वादधि ष्णुभिर्विष्पर्धसो विमहसो जिगाति शेवृधो नृभिः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | cakrame | mahataḥ | niḥ | uru-kramaḥ | samānasmāt | sadasaḥ | evayāmarut || yadā | ayukta | tmanā | svāt | adhi | snu-bhiḥ | vi-spardhasaḥ | vi-mahasaḥ | jigāti | śe-vr̥dhaḥ | nr̥-bhiḥ ||5.87.4||

IAST: svano na vo 'mavān rejayad vṛṣā tveṣo yayis taviṣa evayāmarut
Griffith: Like your tremendous roar, the rainer with light flashing, strong, speeding, hath made all tremble, Evayam
Devanāgarī: स्वनो न वोऽमवान्रेजयद्वृषा त्वेषो ययिस्तविष एवयामरुत्
pada pāṭha: svanaḥ | na | vaḥ | ama-vān | rejayat | vr̥ṣā | tveṣaḥ | yayiḥ | taviṣaḥ | evayāmarut || yena | sahantaḥ | r̥ñjata | sva-rociṣaḥ | sthāḥ-raśmānaḥ | hiraṇyayāḥ | su-āyudhāsaḥ | iṣmiṇaḥ ||5.87.5||

IAST: yenā sahanta ṛñjata svarociṣaḥ sthāraśmāno hiraṇyayāḥ svāyudhāsa iṣmiṇaḥ
Griffith: Wherewith victorious ye, self-luminous, press onward, with strong reins, decked with gold, impetuous and
Devanāgarī: येना सहन्त ऋञ्जत स्वरोचिषः स्थारश्मानो हिरण्ययाः स्वायुधास इष्मिणः
pada pāṭha: svanaḥ | na | vaḥ | ama-vān | rejayat | vr̥ṣā | tveṣaḥ | yayiḥ | taviṣaḥ | evayāmarut || yena | sahantaḥ | r̥ñjata | sva-rociṣaḥ | sthāḥ-raśmānaḥ | hiraṇyayāḥ | su-āyudhāsaḥ | iṣmiṇaḥ ||5.87.5||

IAST: apāro vo mahimā vṛddhaśavasas tveṣaṁ śavo 'vatv evayāmarut
Griffith: Unbounded is your greatness, ye of mighty power: may your bright vigour be our aid, Evayamarut;
Devanāgarī: अपारो वो महिमा वृद्धशवसस्त्वेषं शवोऽवत्वेवयामरुत्
pada pāṭha: apāraḥ | vaḥ | mahimā | vr̥ddha-śavasaḥ | tveṣam | śavaḥ | avatu | evayāmarut || sthātāraḥ | hi | pra-sitau | sam-dr̥śi | sthana | te | naḥ | uruṣyata | nidaḥ | śuśukvāṁsaḥ | na | agnayaḥ ||5.87.6||

IAST: sthātāro hi prasitau saṁdṛśi sthana te na uruṣyatā nidaḥ śuśukvāṁso nāgnayaḥ
Griffith: For ye are visible helpers in the time of trouble: like fires, aglow with light, save us from shame and
Devanāgarī: स्थातारो हि प्रसितौ संदृशि स्थन ते न उरुष्यता निदः शुशुक्वांसो नाग्नयः
pada pāṭha: apāraḥ | vaḥ | mahimā | vr̥ddha-śavasaḥ | tveṣam | śavaḥ | avatu | evayāmarut || sthātāraḥ | hi | pra-sitau | sam-dr̥śi | sthana | te | naḥ | uruṣyata | nidaḥ | śuśukvāṁsaḥ | na | agnayaḥ ||5.87.6||

IAST: te rudrāsaḥ sumakhā agnayo yathā tuvidyumnā avantv evayāmarut
Griffith: So may the Rudras, mighty warriors, Evayamarut, with splendid brilliancy, like fires, be our protectors;
Devanāgarī: ते रुद्रासः सुमखा अग्नयो यथा तुविद्युम्ना अवन्त्वेवयामरुत्
pada pāṭha: te | rudrāsaḥ | su-makhāḥ | agnayaḥ | yathā | tuvi-dyumnāḥ | avantu | evayāmarut || dīrgham | pr̥thu | paprathe | sadma | pārthivam | yeṣām | ajmeṣu | ā | mahaḥ | śardhāṁsi | adbhuta-enasām ||5.87.7||

IAST: dīrgham pṛthu paprathe sadma pārthivaṁ yeṣām ajmeṣv ā mahaḥ śardhāṁsy adbhutainasām
Griffith: They whose terrestrial dwelling-place is wide-extended, whom none suspect of sin, whose bands have lofty
Devanāgarī: दीर्घं पृथु पप्रथे सद्म पार्थिवं येषामज्मेष्वा महः शर्धांस्यद्भुतैनसाम्
pada pāṭha: te | rudrāsaḥ | su-makhāḥ | agnayaḥ | yathā | tuvi-dyumnāḥ | avantu | evayāmarut || dīrgham | pr̥thu | paprathe | sadma | pārthivam | yeṣām | ajmeṣu | ā | mahaḥ | śardhāṁsi | adbhuta-enasām ||5.87.7||

IAST: adveṣo no maruto gātum etana śrotā havaṁ jaritur evayāmarut
Griffith: Come in a friendly spirit, come to us, O Maruts, and hear his call who praises you, Evayamarut.
Devanāgarī: अद्वेषो नो मरुतो गातुमेतन श्रोता हवं जरितुरेवयामरुत्
pada pāṭha: adveṣaḥ | naḥ | marutaḥ | gātum | ā | itana | śrota | havam | jarituḥ | evayāmarut || viṣṇoḥ | mahaḥ | sa-manyavaḥ | yuyotana | smat | rathyaḥ | na | daṁsanā | apa | dveṣāṁsi | sanutariti ||5.87.8||

IAST: viṣṇor mahaḥ samanyavo yuyotana smad rathyo na daṁsanāpa dveṣāṁsi sanutaḥ
Griffith: Like car-borne men, one-minded with the mighty Visnu, keep enmity far from us with your deeds of wonder
Devanāgarī: विष्णोर्महः समन्यवो युयोतन स्मद्रथ्यो न दंसनाप द्वेषांसि सनुतः
pada pāṭha: adveṣaḥ | naḥ | marutaḥ | gātum | ā | itana | śrota | havam | jarituḥ | evayāmarut || viṣṇoḥ | mahaḥ | sa-manyavaḥ | yuyotana | smat | rathyaḥ | na | daṁsanā | apa | dveṣāṁsi | sanutariti ||5.87.8||

IAST: gantā no yajñaṁ yajñiyāḥ suśami śrotā havam arakṣa evayāmarut
Griffith: Come to our sacrifice, ye Hnly Ones, to bless it,
Devanāgarī: गन्ता नो यज्ञं यज्ञियाः सुशमि श्रोता हवमरक्ष एवयामरुत्
pada pāṭha: ganta | naḥ | yajñam | yajñiyāḥ | su-śami | śrota | havam | arakṣaḥ | evayāmarut || jyeṣṭhāsaḥ | na | parvatāsaḥ | vi-omani | yūyam | tasya | pra-cetasaḥ | syāta | duḥ-dhartavaḥ | nidaḥ ||5.87.9||

IAST: jyeṣṭhāso na parvatāso vyomani yūyaṁ tasya pracetasaḥ syāta durdhartavo nidaḥ
Griffith: and, free from demons, hear our call, Evayamarut.
Devanāgarī: ज्येष्ठासो न पर्वतासो व्योमनि यूयं तस्य प्रचेतसः स्यात दुर्धर्तवो निदः
pada pāṭha: ganta | naḥ | yajñam | yajñiyāḥ | su-śami | śrota | havam | arakṣaḥ | evayāmarut || jyeṣṭhāsaḥ | na | parvatāsaḥ | vi-omani | yūyam | tasya | pra-cetasaḥ | syāta | duḥ-dhartavaḥ | nidaḥ ||5.87.9||
